qxohCJt7UwW2gTUOoU4XHg.text: Rex believes in loyalty, Rex believes in honor. Rex believes in good service, and servicing good when his neck isn't cramped. Rex has been in Vegas a bunch recently (it's dumpster diving season and Sexy Rexy has a new wet suit. well, not wet suit but a suit that was found wet behind Mike Tyson's house.)  Anyway, to be loyal Rex went to Carson's. First time it was very crowded. The greeter wasn't nice, but Rex understands. Trying times can make the weak go dumb. The second time 4 of us were seated. Slightly crowded but not too bad. They had seated two people in a bad location so it forced us to sit all on one side of a table. If they had sat the 2 people correctly or asked them to slide down we could have sat on the L and been able to talk. Less than ideal but we could handle it. Instead she made NO attempt to help us, and the 4 of us were like bums on a stoop. We couldn't talk to each other. It was embarrassing. They were more worried about the "owner's table".  Well, hey owner...we are paying customers, returning customers, and we go there regularly. About 24-30 times a year between both couples. That's pretty good if you ask Rex. Instead you were treated like a human being and you weren't even there. We were just shoved into a table and had menus thrown at us while they ran around waiting for you. How about teaching your staff to take care of the regulars? How about making some sort of effort?    The real problem is that this isn't the upstart spot that needed locals to come down, they are always busy and now they don't care. It was very clear. Rex is never going back. Rex's friends aren't going back. Rex is going to stop telling people he knows about the place. Rex is going to go somewhere 150 bucks for dinner and drinks for 2 people multiple times a month gets you treated with a little respect.

aPhFzaQLQLHDJ4KyBfkjZA.text: Tucked away in a little corner downtown on 6th and Carson (hence the name), chef Simon Kerry and his team offer unique twists on American classics.   There's only a few tables and bar-top seating. It was only my wife and I, so they sat us at the bar...right in front of the kitchen. Very cool. We chatted it up with the chef and enjoyed the casual, friendly atmosphere.  Now onto the food:  Bacon Jam with Brie: I liked this dish, but didn't love it. It had a "baked beans" flavor to it and it was just hard to get over how cloyingly sweet it was. But as sweet as it was, it wasn't very...well...jammy. I expected to be able to spread it on the toast points it came with, but it wasn't really like that. It also had one tiny strip of Brie down the middle. It could've used a little more.  Veal meatballs: decadent, rich and spicy. This is stick-to-your-ribs food done well. The foie gras sauce was velvety and luxurious and the dish was seasoned perfectly. It just wasn't very balanced. Rich on top of rich on top of rich. It came garnished with English peas, so it'd been nice if they'd topped it off with a pea shoot salad with a sharp vinaigrette for some freshness.   Gyro tacos: exactly like it sounds. But instead of slices of an emulsified slow roasted meat loaf, they used ground lamb. All the flavors were there. This was a solid dish and easily the lightest of the offerings we were served.  Crispy chicken skins with smoked honey: it may sound heavy and greasy, but if you come to this place, you can't leave without trying them. They are light and crisp, succulent and savory. Like the best part about fried chicken without the grease and the stomach ache. Easily the best thing we ordered.  Deviled eggs: you put caviar and pancetta on anything and I'll eat it. These were no exception. Simple. Elegant. Phenomenal.  Wild mushroom pizza: nothing out of the ordinary. The crust was nice and crispy and the mushrooms themselves had a hint if thyme which works so well. The bleu cheese felt a little overpowering.  Bread pudding: made from day old donuts from the shop next door, you'd think this would have been over the top sweet and rich. But it wasn't. Very light and airy. It had an almost savory quality to it probably due to the yeastyness of the donuts. Enjoyable.  I'd like to come back here during the cold months. The food was great overall, but a bit rich and slightly unbalanced. A solid effort.

vMAjC__6FonOH4XNygCVUg.text: I was in down town so I decided to try Carson kitchen, the new place in the area and based on the great reviews from yelp I decided to try the chicken fried skins but they were out at that time so I eded up getting the Wellington empanadas, the gyro tacos, and the veal meat balls.  It was about 110 degrees that day so the first thing I ordered as soon as I walked in was a diet coke, when I got a 8oz bottle for 4.00 I knew that wasn't going to work for me so I ordered beer instead. The bartender recommended me 1664 blanc a wheat beer with a hint of citrus and fruit which was very tasty and refreshing. The beef Wellington empanadas were my favorite of the items I tried, but at 10 dollars per order it seemed a little to much for them two tiny little pockets until I took a bite and realized that they're worth every penny. The gyro tacos were also good and the name says it all, tacos that taste like gyros, nothing new, nothing extraordinary but good. The meat balls were the the least impressive of the items I ordered, the name itself veal meatballs with sherry foie gras was too promising but there was nothing memorable about them except that they were a little too dry for my taste, the green peas don't help either, I think their sole purpose is to make the meatballs look huge.  Ambience is great. The place is very small and you'll definitely be sharing some personal space with strangers, there's also an outdoor patio and a roof top bar that should be a great place to hang with friends when the weather cooperates but for now unless you want to match your fried chicken skins, the inside area is the only place to be.  I will definitely be back for more.

gN8_m0hHsMBpMfWxr9Wcsg.text: My new favorite restaurant. One of the more creative menus in town. We couldn't decide what we wanted to try so we ordered 5 dishes for 2 people. 3 would have been plenty but I'm glad we tried more.   I'd give a breakdown of what we ordered but I'm certain everything here is amazing. Friendly staff and great service as well.

YYfm3m9nezTAMSuPztX2dQ.text: Last time I ate here we sat at the bar.  I usually love watching the action, however, watching the staff wipe their noses, face, hair, sweat dripping out the gloves made me a bit uncomfortable.

DgorElwi5qWbK8Ac1gWkDg.text: A great restaurant for small groups. The place is small, like 1800 sq feet hey we need your menu small. We went for dinner during a friends bachelor party. Big thanks to all the Yelp reviewers who steered me right. Bacon jam and the oxtail risotto were great.   The main thing to know about this place is the food is family style. The concept is you order the sides like oxtail risotto, mac n cheese, or the sprouts and suds hash and share with the table. Then you order your protein individually, but you could really share that too.   Good food, I definitely enjoyed the experience and will go back!

C4KZVXCbKluz-vL29kO7jA.text: This place is great! Only down side was had to wait a long time but it was well worth it. They do have a great patio area with fire pit so the wait was enjoyable. My wife and I ordered the baked mac and cheese, burnt ends, and chicken sandwich. I cannot pick my favorite, they were all fantastic. Had a great atmosphere and service as well. You must eat here!

XMwT-BZJtplx_2bHaypvYw.text: This place was great! My wife and I sat at the upstairs bar and loved the atmosphere. It was lively but not crazy and the decor was a nice modern casual. Tara, our bartender, was incredibly friendly and made awesome drinks.   My wife had a drink called the green tea and it was great. They had a nice selection of craft beer and I had a bottle of little sumpin sumpin.   I had the short rib sliders with root beer glaze. I thought they were great. The meat was juicy and flavorful. The tater tots that they came with were good.   My wife had the broccoli dish. It was fresh and very balanced combination of sweet and flavorful. It tasted healthy and totally hit the spot.   Overall, nice atmosphere, great service, and great food. Would definitely come back.

r0uVXB1o3fW4HWz9sqgLZw.text: I stopped in last Monday evening after deciding to find something aside of the Strip places and hotel restaurants. To be fair, they're fine, but I wanted something a little different and more personal for the chef creating the food.   So to Carson Kitchen I went, and I wasn't disappointed. Parallel parking out front and immediately seated at about 6p at the bar. Because it was only me, I ordered gyro tacos and seared scallops with mango habanero salsa. These two were powerful and delicate, respectfully. Fresh taco shells/pita and amazing flavor combinations in the tacos. Careful selections of flavors with the scallops as to compliment and not overpower. (Pair the scallops with a Kronenbourg Blonde-they're a perfect marriage.) For dessert I had the glazed doughnut bread pudding. I couldn't fit anything else.   Best was that everything is made from fresh and service was fast and courteous, to say the least. I had plate envy from those around me that I couldn't indulge for lack of stomach space.   I'll definitely be back next time in Vegas.

a9I6sKYPRuyIJBdTuI8EoQ.text: This is our first time here, first timers from Honolulu, holy shit this is some damn good food.  Small and home place with good people great staff and most importantly cooks that can cook.  Tara our waitress funny and professional.   We will be back

46AkNi2ITU5XHu2gr_FdGQ.text: Went back for dinner with a larger group so got to try a lot of different dishes. I now think this is a True gem. No, it's not fine dining but for a slightly upscale, but casual meal you really can't go wrong. Had the fried chicken skins, turkey burger, mac and cheese, NY strip, carbonara, and meatballs and they were all great. We sat at the bar and the bartender was super attentive and kept the drinks flowing, which I'm sure helped us enjoy the meal that much more!

k9KCE7qyhjw0C38Gox7mGg.text: I came to LV on a work trip & demanded to be taken to a nice dinner. To my surprise my boss took us to Carsons. The food, service, and atmosphere were all fantastic. We were greeted by Felicia who was bubbly, well informed and passionate about the restaurant and menu. Hands down, my favorite item was the deviled eggs. They were so good that we ordered a second round. Next time I'm in town, I will be back.

PzBdWsPHd9kLOpijH35XXw.text: We took a risk leaving the tourist area but hit the jackpot with Carson Kitchen (cha-ching). Roughly a 10 minute walk from Fremont street, staff were super friendly and although there was a short wait, we enjoyed really good drinks in a comfortable outdoor waiting area. We scored seats on the upstairs outdoor balcony and proceeded to completely overeat. The deviled eggs w/caviar: INCREDIBLE, get them. Bacon jam with Brie: DELICIOUS, get it. Barbecue burnt ends: OMG how could it keep getting better?! Our mistake: the mac and cheese. If you've never had good mac and cheese, go for it. If you have, skip it. It's very rich and frankly doesn't live up to the tremendous hype (but considering all we ordered, we should have opted for something lighter like the cous cous or cauliflower). That said, between the staff, charming location and amazing spread, we couldn't have been happier. Plan on sharing whatever is ordered and go!

mWnrRjYHstAbhs2kBkpQKQ.text: Ordered 4 dishes. Devil's eggs and killer shrimp were amazing! Gyro tacos were good. Not something that would bring me back, but good. Fried green tomato and lump crab sliders had so much potential but we're very disappointing. Mostly sauce, very little crab meat. Service was excellent. Fun ambiance. Will probably give  it a second go around.

ga185RfngQv4MyAXZrrFFA.text: Went for lunch, Uber'd there from our hotel near the strip.  A bit hard to find, but it's on the corner in the old Carter Motel, you will see that sign at least.  Carter Kitchen signage is on their windows only.  Excellent service at the bar, fun to watch all the cocktails being made.  Fried chicken skins were good but tasted like fried pork rinds to us.  Awesome gyro tacos!  Last we split the crispy chicken sandwich which was an homage to Chick Fil A  but much better!  Nice little gem near the Fremont street experience.  Friendly, prompt service to boot.

TZG670t8hTli8At0dXsf6w.text: This place is fabulous! My boyfriend and I found out about this place through a friend and decided to try it. We got the deviled eggs which I thought was strange at first to have as an appetizer, but they were excellent. We also got the bacon jam (which is heavenly), the turkey jerk burger and the regular burger. Everything was so tasty, and I could really tell that it was quality made food. I will definitely come back for some more of Carson kitchen's unique creations.

EUObG093EOX-m92Y7DAZIg.text: I'll give it 3 stars at best. Stopped in for dinner this evening with a group of three other people. They were fairly busy I do have to say the service was fairly good. Order the mushroom flatbread that is 12 dollars. It was just ok. It did have a lot of ingredients on it. So at least they weren't skipping out. I felt the crust was too soggy in the middle and when you tried pick it up & eat it it would fall apart. And the crust around the outside was super chewy and just did not taste good. One of my other diners got the scallops and it was three tiny scallops for $17. She was a little bit irritated. If it's only going to be 3 scallops then it should at least be the large sea scallops. There are plenty of other places to eat downtown if that's what the price of the scallops are. Overall I would go back once more since there were a couple of other items on the menu I would like to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Flatbread

_JrpUbElqpjWcDaQvS70YA.text: So I have been here three times and I am counting down the days till I can find an excuse to come back again!    Each time I have gone it gets better!  My first experience was by chance as I showing some out of town friends around downtown.   Glad we decided to stop in.    The first thing we ordered was the bacon jam and it was amazing! Really smokey and good bacon flavor.  The whole thing reminded me of eating smoked ribs at a good barbecue place.   We then had the Mac and cheese and all the reviews where right. This is a must try.  When then finished up sharing the meatloaf sliders which were great.   The service was also fast and friendly. One of the mangers came over to chat with us and talked about his favorite item.  Next thing we know he stopped by with a plate of the rainbow cauliflower for us to try.   It was really good. Had a good garlic flavor to them and was dressed very simply with oil and I think a bit of lemon.   On my most recent visit they were pretty busy so we grabbed some cocktails and waited in the area outback. The area was very cool with a unique fire pit.  The drinks we ordered we also fantastic.  The I had the brewers fest and really enjoyed it.  It reminded me of a citrus type beer even though there was no beer in it.  I would definitely order it again.  Not to mention the bartender was great in answering all my questions and talking with us.   The only thing I didn't care for in my times there was the deviled eggs.  They were pretty basic in nature and not on par with the other items I had tried.   Next time you are downtown check this place out but expect a wait.  A wait worth it though.

WCaxCRkp5Ym40azNxfnauA.text: I've been to Carson Kitchen a handful of times for lunch. The location is an easy walk down Carson ace and they are located next to the best donut shop in Vegas (more on that in next review). Their menu is enticing and allows a non-foodie to experience some savory gastronomy.  On this occasion I went with the veal meatballs (in a foie gras sauce) and the gyro tacos.  The meatball was nice and crispy on the outside and tender inside. The sauce should be made into toothpaste so you can savor the flavor!  The gyro tacos had the right amount of sauce and good portion of meat (3 bites) however the flour tortilla shell was grossly empty and too large. (Ingredients in middle - nothing on outside). If I take a bite of just flour tortilla, someone messed up.  Overall good meal and lots of items to try and the service was incredibly friendly however the kitchen is always backed up and lunch should not take an hour to get tacos. The pass seemed to be just waiting on the food at all times.  Regardless I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very True.

k3I2viKH8w4aRkvFS61vEg.text: We had the watermelon feta salad and the wild mushrooms flat bread. It was simply a taste of heaven!!! We loved it

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SimonSaid Sangria

lnfaGA3yrAU_EdZ8nTbkmA.text: This is a nice little gem downtown. It does not have a flashy sign or anything so it's kind of hard to notice.  The food here is great. I highly recommend the bacon jam and also the turkey burger.  Even the beer selection is great.  As for decor, it reminds me of a place you would find in the East Village in Manhattan and has kind of an industrial feel. Very cool.  I think this would be a great spot for a group or a date.

nKBj018GlityPnCq66QZRg.text: Went for dinner and was seated quickly.  Service was attentive and friendly.  Varied menu with meat and vegetarian (a few) options.  Two dishes on the menu were unavailable.  We had the tahini carrots which were flavorful and delicious, not over cooked.  The tempura green beans were crunchy and hot, a heaping portion.  The desserts looked amazing and popular at other tables but we skipped dessert.  The outside fire pit and upstairs patio were nice but we were seated inside.  Have to mention the chairs were mostly stools and quite uncomfortable.

P4BmplHzwEjFjRYHvGfxTw.text: I'd slappa da bass to that sweet bacon jam. Shrimp changed my life. If i could give six stars i would. Over the moon for our free dessert in the desert.

h__BZuGWE0G9qHP9a37IOw.text: Great menu served family style. Sat outdoors upstairs and absolutely loved the ambiance. Service was excellent and very friendly. Really enjoy this part of town compared to the modern Vegas strip.

PS1_oN1qPBa4Wxs3fuW7hQ.text: Love the service.  Our server was very attentive and had recommendations when needed.    Must haves:  the crispy chicken skin and the bacon jam.  I didn't know bacon tasted that good when mixed with jam, just the perfect mix of sweet and salty.  The crispy chicken skin was just heavenly when dipped in honey.  We also ordered pig and fig flatbread which was not quite as life altering as the other two.  It wasn't bad, but after the tasting the appetizers, I was expecting more and this was a tad disappointing.  I can't wait to come back and try the other items on the menu.

rhXuDqBYIs06CXrNjS6QIg.text: A little gastropub in downtown Fremont with a nice ambiance. The prices here are a little on the higher end but the experience here is worth a try. This restaurant/bar has good drinks and small plates for sharing. I have been here about 2-3 times and each time we waited around one hour to be seated (each time was either a Friday or Saturday night). They do not take reservations. They have a nice campfire with lawn seating outside and a bar inside (I don't know if it's open seating) and a bar outside (there are seats but it is not open seating) to grab a drink while you wait. This is a pretty trendy restaurant. Environment is very intimate with very dim lightening. Service is excellent. So I tried the crispy chicken skins my favorite), BBQ burnt ends, bacon jam, baked mac and cheese, and the cocoa espresso NY strip. My whole party enjoyed the food here. Overall, it's a nice restaurant to try, especially for a small party (3-4 people), it's a trendy spot and the food is good, just expect to wait to be seated.

gkWPaTOCbTO1wHB5iSZOuw.text: My favorite place to eat downtown! Totally worth the prices! Sit on the roof/patio when weather is nice! Everything is extremely fresh and the menu changes every few months!

zFpq5q8K0bY6ezG-N24XmQ.text: Got the lamb tacos and risotto! All I can say is, our food was were well crafted.   Service was unremarkable, ambience was like an extension of downtown LV:)

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MliRpE01QUUldWaKpLnL2A.text: If you don't have a reservation, get one. Seating is very limited/shared and that's what makes it so special. Food comes out fresh and fast. If you do have to wait, their outdoor seating is really cozy and comfortable. Once we were seated, we order my go to, the bacon jam and the mushroom flatbread. The bacon jam is one of my favorite things on the planet and is covered with one of my other favorite things on the planet, Brie. The mushroom flatbread was just as good with a nice balance of mild and vinegary mushrooms. Definitely a good choice if you're a foodie or open to interesting menu items.

EzZs6qVmvogGaG3LL0CCvg.text: Everything we ordered - from the tempura green beans to the deviled eggs - was amazing. I had he burger for lunch and it was excellent - as were the tater tots that came alongside of it. The artichoke was ok, not super easy to eat and a little greasy, and my cocktail was just ok. I would definitely come back here though as the successes outnumbered the misses!

dvXzWKRC7FC98rmxsA6SUQ.text: Love the design concept.   Stopped into this little joint for an afternoon brunch with some friends Sunday 3/20... I loved the vibe & it was pretty quiet compared to majority reviews. The food was pretty decent and the Simon Says Sangria was amazing!!!  I'd definitely return to experience the roof top ambiance with dessert and cocktails.   What I ordered:  Devils Eggs Bacon Jam Veil Meatballs Mac & Cheese FGT Sliders***** Must Order  Crisp Chicken Skins***** Delish!  Dessert: Bourbon Fudge Brownie Banofee Pie***********Beyond Delicious

IQjRtwJvf6JXkLQLQcDNYw.text: Ok. I've been coming here since it opened and the only bad thing I can say about CK is it's always so busy and so hard to get in now!!!! It was the locals secret and now it's amazingness is NO secret! I  so happy for them but man..... haha! Last nite I took a new transplant to Vegas here and he was blown away. Out wait was less than 30 minutes and got seated at the bar, which is my fave! For a Sunday it was buuuuuuusy! My date is kinda small town and found it so funny to see deviled eggs on the menu! Of course we ordered them and he was just laughing! He loved them! Also had the bacon Brie app and the watermelon salad. All were enjoyed by us both!  All in all this place Never disappoints. It is great food and a fun vibe. I'm so happy that CK has shown us their here to stay!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;like my grandmas?&#34;  &#34;Yes, BUT NO&#34; I know your grandma didn&#39;t top them with crispy pancetta or caviar!

UQvaitdAX1OBuaCwyzd9Rw.text: We decided to give Old Town Vegas a shot and check out all the renovations. I found Carson Kitchen on Yelp for dinner. The food sounded promising and it wasn't a too fancy restaurant.  There was plenty of street parking around. The restaurant was a bit hard to find in the dark. A homeless man actually helped us find the door. Not to worry too much, I think the area is relatively safe, just kind of unpopular. The inside of Carson Kitchen would tell you otherwise. It is packed in there and if you arrive during peak times you could be faced with a wait.  We agreed to sit in the bar area which turned out to be a bad idea. Minutes after, another couple arrived and they were seated immediately at a table that just became available. We hadn't even been seated yet. The bar table we were given was extremely uncomfortable and was under a light fixture that had a dead lightbulb. It was so dark that we couldn't read the menu without shining our cell phone lights on it. This shaky beginning was enough to make it just a three star experience but our waiter was so cool and the food turned out pretty good, I'm giving it a four. There is great potential at Carson Kitchen. BTW, we ended up moving over to under a light fixture that was working. Hooray we would be able to see our food and each other's faces. The couple next to us? Not so much.  Depending on how hungry you are, it can work out in your favor. The dishes are meant to be shared and there are entrees that are a bit more substantial. For dinner we ordered the staples and a sandwich.  Crispy Chicken Skins with smoked honey Bacon Jam with baked brie and baguette Veal Meatballs with sherry foie gras cream Wild Boar Sloppy Joe  The crispy chicken skins and bacon jam are what dreams are made of. Forget the fat and cholesterol content. These appetizers were amazing. The veal meatballs and sloppy joe just added bulk. Honestly, I could actually do without those and just pick more snack type foods but it was dinner and we tried to make it a well rounded meal. I'd come back again if I were in the area. I'd just be sure to request a proper table next time.

zaBxy7Mn_apiArWgXq7gGA.text: This place is excellent for small groups, say 3-6 people, who can gather around these excellent shareable plates and chat about their flavors.  Our server recommended mixing the bacon jam and mac & cheese -- he did not steer us wrong!

Cq0c02R5Asfd9icyepoyqQ.text: Keep doing it right!  Love the drinks, balance and diversity of food.  You can't go wrong, love the flavors, keep it coming and look forward to new items added to the menu, a go to spot!

0pMPzK1-dzwU4DJ2SCySMA.text: Oh my God!  What can you possibly say about a place that has had so many five star reviews, to make yours stand out?  I suspect every possible nice thing that could've ever been said about this place has already been said. But I'll give it a shot anyway.  For starters the staff is incredibly friendly. You have to remember that Las Vegas churns a place like this.  People come in with very high expectations, and if the place doesn't deliver they get torn to shreds in the press and on Yelp and are shut down in a matter of months.  Carson kitchen has stood up to this kind of expectation for a while, and they've kept on delivering.  As for my meal, I went with the veal meatballs, Gyro tacos, and the beat salad.  All were every bit as magnificent as others have said they would be.  Keep up the good work Carson kitchen, I sure hope I get to visit you again someday.

A5GC3was1Nal4yWRg9lY6A.text: Quite a new find in Las Vegas with Carson Kitchen.  It's hidden on Carson Street and the taxi drove right by it as minimal signage.  You will like this place if you enjoy ordering many appetizers as all are made for sharing.  We hit on many of the favorites, gyro tacos, deviled eggs with caviar, fried chicken skins and Mac and cheese with a ting of truffle.  We filled up or the next would have been the bacon jam as everyone said it was the top seller.    Let me start by saying the food can come quite quickly so you should do "serial ordering" and order one plate at a time.  We started with the deviled eggs and they just melted in my mouth.  You only get 4 of them and let me say I'm not sure you should share these as I wanted to eat them all.  The next course was the gyro tacos and they were tasty but a bit greasy and heavy following the deviled eggs.  We should have got the bacon jam as the second course.  Next we had to try the fried chicken skins and they were great, almost like eating pork rinds.  Lastly the mac and cheese was some of the best I've ever eaten... now I was full.  We followed with a margarita straight up in a martini glass and it was one of the best I've ever had, and I've had quite a few of them.  The mixologist was great guy and we enjoyed the atmosphere and ambiance of sitting at the bar.  You can easily sit here and eat and drink for a couple of hours; as we did.  This is quite small place and coming in from the bright sun and heat this is a relaxing place to hang out before sundown before going over to Fremont Experience a block away.  This place is now on my must go list when coming to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H-Ek_SustCGFLXMlFmilaw.text: Of all the places to eat in Las Vegas, all the endless buffets, all the fine dining options, this little eatery in Downtown served us the best, most delicious meal we had the pleasure of eating on our trip. It was well worth the walk in the heat of June. The classic, relaxed atmosphere is just as appealing to the eyes as each dish they serve. There are two areas of tables and two wooden angled bars with seating, one fitted along the bar, and one that wraps around the open kitchen. The staff made us feel right at home too, which made this an easy 5 star dining experience. I honestly wish I could give them more than 5 stars.  We ordered the Mini Lamb Tacos, Macaroni & Cheese, Wild Mushroom Flatbread and the Short Rib Grilled Cheese Sandwich, each of which were devoured with pleasure. The menu is served Tapas Style and each dish is meant to be shared. Wether you're dining with friends/family or alone, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our friendly staff mixing things up behind the bar. Carson Kitchen, Downtown Vegas.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar around the open kitchen at Carson Kitchen in Downtown Vegas.

lbkMcDQfBXOwKT-qIBa7CQ.text: Carson Kitchen is one of my top 3 favorite dinner spots in Las Vegas. I've been here three times since I first visited in December! I tell everyone how much I love it.   Bacon Jam Fried Chicken Skin w/ honey  Deviled eggs Ny strip Beers Desserts  It's just my type of food! The flavors on each dish never disappoint. I'm sure the flat breads and sandwich options are wonderful- I just can't omit the bacon or chicken skin lol. You lol try other parts of the menu eventually!  Service is attentive in the cozy taverny spot. I don't think the portions are small, regardless of what reviews say. I always leave fat and happy.

DVam2kEft8GCfMO8FimNew.text: This place was hyped as super food. Hip, fun, chic: NO.  Between the loud music they had going the tourist helicopters and road noise we couldn't have a conversation or think. The atmosphere was annoying to say the least. The food was not as described. On every level this place was not worth going to.  The owner contacted me several times trying to bully me into changing my review. He finally contacted yelp whom removed my review.  My fish was burned. My mother's dish was completely flavorless. The hoops to jump through just to get a table made us all feel unsafe.  Carson Kitchen didn't come anywhere close to a worth it experience

agMf_ANHmRNXFgUrB6Z2jg.text: Yelped this place while on a weekend trip to Vegas and I am so glad we did! We started with the crispy chicken skins my first time ever having these and in my opinion every restaurant should offer these they were so yummy and seasoned so well! Next up where the caviar deviled eggs and they were amazing I should have gotten two orders! Lastly was the chicken sandwich and it did not disappoint the only disappointing thing was I shared it with my boyfriend! Never again I need a whole one! It was so good couldn't get a pic before we scarfed it down!!!! We will be going back on the next trip

_3VAUZCRLt7Q77u-_m8KoA.text: I loved everything about this place.  They have amazing food, great ambience, and awesome service.  The kitchen is open so you can see them cook your food and the backyard has a garden.  I had a tasty drink that was downright dangerous because it didn't feel like there was alcohol, but trust me, you'll feel it after a couple.  The food is tapas style so we shared everything.  The flank steak was my all time favorite of everything.   Best part is the dessert!!!  MAN!  The bread pudding was a party in my mouth.  You will not be disappointed if you visit Carson Kitchen!

p_Ct19bzXZ7JQI8z-H44Lg.text: Delicious, everything was full of flavor. Great service and a fun social atmosphere. Baked Mac and cheese and the bacon Brie jam were amazing.

jkI5GKtfJ22RcS6UmRZUuA.text: The first time I had food from here, I didn't even have to go here. Food just fell on my lap and it was forkin glorious. The first time I actually went here, I was a bit lost since I'm kind of blind even with my hipster glasses on. It's right next door to O Face Doughnuts. I've also been here for my post-workout birthday lunch and a few other times...all because of a bowl of vegetables!  Chicken: Chicken thigh that's simple but tasty. The skin is crisp but not overcooked. It's quite juicy. I paired this with their broccoli which was a bit spicy 4.5/5  Rainbow Cauliflower: This is my favorite item on the menu. I never thought I'd say that the best dish I've had was a bowl of veggies let alone cauliflower! What crazy friggin ish is that? As a matter of fact, I crave a bowl all the time now. Garlicky, a bit of spice and a bit citrusy. I could eat this all day. A glowing 5/5  Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip Steak: Tender slices of beef with pink on the middle. Earthy and nutty because of the cocoa espresso but without being bitter. 4/5  Swordfish:  Flaky white fish with lemon, mint and basil. Refreshing, light and delicious 5/5  Young Beets: I don't normally get too crazy over beets. The texture is mushy and tastes like dirt - CK was able to make me like beets. 4/5  Gyro Tacos: Greek tacos with tender meat, feta and onions. Nothing complicated here. 4/5  Chicken Skin: Comes with honey to dip the crunchy salty goodness that is chicken skin. Forget your healthy eating habits for a moment and indulge in this basket of magnificence. *crunch crunch crunch crack crack crack* was all I heard when this was brought to our table. 5/5  Tomato Stack: Caprese salad, basically. 4/5  Mac n Cheese: I don't know how they made such a simple comfort food to be better than most places. The crispy top, the creamy cheese sauce...yuuuummm!!! 5/5  Devil's Eggs: Deviled eggs with caviar and pancetta. Absolutely delicious. With the caviar and pancetta, I thought this would be salty but I was wrong. Different textures in my mouth. 4.5/5  They have a few tables by the window, a few stools by the kitchen and by the bar, and a community table. They also have outdoor seating. This is one of my favorite spots in Downtown Las Vegas.

1K1056HH9o8cS9vv2RVVHA.text: Before I start, I'd like to saying that I truly have 2 ratings for this place- a 3 for someone just wanting dinner and a 5 for those hanging out with time to kill.  My husband and I came here for dinner while on a business trip. We called ahead to see if we needed reservations and we were told to just walk-in. So we walk-in and put our names on the waiting list. After 25 mins we were called and told our table was ready. Totally normal wait until we had to wait 40 more minutes as our table was "being prepped". We were really excited to try this place and by the time we were seated we were over it. We just wanted a good meal.   Once we were seated our experience was wonderful! The servers were so friendly and my husband LOVED his NY Strip. I got the fish filet sandwich with tots and it had a lot of flavor (and salt).  If you just want dinner, this place is a 3. Great food but poor wait. If you're coming with friends, having some drinks, the wait is no big deal and this place is a total 5.  **UPDATED. Owner genuinely cares about his restaurant and his customers' experiences. He took time to respond to my review and I believe that truly shows the quality of a True establishment.**

tkZkqhD-0n1-lzGg-ohQ2A.text: This place is so hard to find, had maybe two other groups lost, walking around Carson St, trying to find the place.. It's located downtown so parking, of course, sucks!   The place itself reminds of the other restaurant downtown, EAT. only because of the small space and the cool decors.  Came here for quick Thursday lunch with the coworkers and this place was pretty loud, busy and packed!  Item chosed was the Black Rice with Oxtail Risotto - very rich, heavy, and tasty! Don't let the small looks fool you.. I was very full half-way through. I also liked how every bite had a good chunk of oxtail meat.  I really dig this place and can't wait to come back to hopefully try more items on the menu!

cAZUaaIThn7g_LW4Xc2KGg.text: This place was delicious, have a couple of complaints though ..first off when I had checked on their yelp page I didn't see that (not good for kids) was highlighted so I figured that it was going to be ok (boy was I wrong). I have a 1 year old son and I had to hold him the whole time while being there and did I mention I'm 7 months pregnant, thank God I had help. The second complaint I have ..I had made a reservation due to having a party of 7 and then needed to add one more to my party. I don't recall the name of the man who answered the phone but I was nice and just asked to add one more to my party. Well he made a smart remark over the phone saying, "well as long as it's not more than 10 .." after I had just said to him, "I have a reservation for 7 and I just need to add one more." Otherwise, the food was delicious, I enjoyed that it was a la cart style so all of us felt like we got to try a little of everything that was ordered, not a lot of food went to waste either. Definitely worth trying but if you have kids, unless they're old enough to sit on tall stools or capable of feeding themselves and I'm talking like 8 and older then it should be fine.

HiAQ70AXj5fXJ2dVAf64mA.text: Perfect spot for a group dinner.  We came here for dinner on Saturday and it was packed. We made a reservation in advance something I strongly urge for weekends since it is a small place and the wait for walk ins was over an hour. I ordered the steak, and the macaroni. Both were really great. The mac n cheese was super rich and definitely a shareable size for 2-3 people. The steak had a unique seasoning that made it delicious. The prices were great for the quality of food.

2KWw8UiABdtYr606LYvbTA.text: It's a long story on how we ended up in old town but we did and we were on the hunt for some good eats and drinks. Well let me tell you the surprise when we stumbled int Carson Kitchen. Upon entering the restaurant we were greeted by Michael Martinez and that is the moment our afternoon took a turn for the best.  We were promptly seated upstairs and given an amazing background on the restaurant and all of the must order items. I could tell he was a guy who knew what he was talking about so we handed back the menus and had him bring whatever he recommended we try. It made for an awesome late lunch and is the reason why they deserve a five star.   Best service we received while in town. We'll be back in a couple of months and will definitely be back to see Michael.

d2URApL1Gv9D1om8O6jzEg.text: That's the dinner that we tried before we heading back to LA.  -parking: it's out of the strip, that area has parking with parking fee. It's not that easy to look for a parking.  -location: it's just right next to Donut bar, which is a very famous donut shop in Vegas.  -environment: it's an open kitchen one with some high chairs tables which you might have to share with others. The only thing was not that pleasant was the temperature of the night. It's was freezing cold when outside temperature was so nice. We couldn't enjoy much due to that.  -service: our server was very nice and easy to talk with. She gave us some suggestions on the menu and came to update with us on the food serving.  -meat balls: their meat balls were awesome, the meat was so tender and it's juicy with the top gravy. It's a good amount of portion too. -fried chicken skin dipped with honey. Pretty creative. It's so crunchy that you cannot stop eating.  -black rice risotto with short ribs was so good. The truffle oil enhances they whole dish. We enjoyed it a lot. -taco: it was the pita bread style taco. I like this style more that the other. It's just perfectly made the taco easy to eat. The meat had a lot of flavors.  -wile mushroom pita pizza: I like this a lot. It's the the topping, a lot of different ingredients, they were generous on the cheese and the wild mushroom, the crispy pita bread were matched them perfectly.  -bread pudding was a must: it's so good. Hmmm, we enjoyed it. Bread and pudding were equally put together.  Good food with good service. Hope the AC won't be that strong next time.

-sPGtkvviwTFgtYVhqedyg.text: Hard to find on the first trip here! Food is outta sight. We had the gyro tacos, fried chicken skins,  and bacon jam to start out. All was perfect but the chicken skins was by far my favorite. We also got the grilled cheese with tots and the 3 of us was stuffed from those picks.  It is pretty loud in here on the weekend due to the size of the resturant. Come check it out!

4eo8DZmsVdpeYqXXjIBoRA.text: I haven't really explored Downtown Las Vegas, but this place seemed like a rock star with the current 4.5 Yelp average and the recent glowing review by the New York Times critic. Even though I don't typically go out for American cuisine, and I haven't actually tried any of Kerry Simon's establishments, I resolved to take advantage of Michael U.'s invitation (and the pleasant company of Clint B.) to give Carson Kitchen a try.  The entrance is actually on Carson, not 6th. It's in the southwest corner of the former Carson Hotel. Parking was readily available, and it's currently $1/hr (max 2 hrs) on the street.  Carson Kitchen itself is one of those places with intentionally exposed pipes and lumber in the ceiling, wooden tables, dark but not muted colors, simple music like Sting or Aerosmith, and a not too loud volume of chatter, at least not during our lunch. Casual attire seemed to be the norm. I liked it since nothing in the atmosphere or decor really distracts you from whatever food (or liquor) you're partaking in.  As is the case whenever you're attacking a menu with Michael, our order was enormous. We were able to split things from the Social Plates section of the menu easily, but we did need a serving spoon or fork for a couple of other items. And now, the blow-by-blow commentary:  Devil's Eggs ($8): surprisingly light take on a classic. Pancetta stood out the most, couldn't taste the caviar too much, and it probably could've benefited from a little salt (to be fair, hard to judge when you only grab one of four bite-size pieces).  Crispy Chicken Skins ($6): couldn't stop eating this. Savory, chip-like crunchy skin with more than enough (smoked, apparently) honey to dip it in. I could have ordered another had our meal not run so deep.  Bacon Jam ($12): almost couldn't stop eating this one either. It's a sweet but still savory concoction with a classic complement in the form of melted brie. Michael is going to ream them for the extra bread that they gave us without asking and without mentioning that it would be any sort of extra charge. In the grand scheme, the $1.50 isn't too bad, but it makes you wonder what other stuff they might try to pull.  Gyro Tacos ($10): the ground marinated lamb is actually a little bit higher quality than what I typically get at a gyro shop, but otherwise it just feels like a tapas-ized take on the classic gyro, with tzatziki, feta, cucumber, and tomato. It's worth a try if you're a lamb and/or gyro fan, but I personally would shy away next time.  Rabbit Ragu ($12); I think this is actually my first time eating rabbit, and Elmer Fudd does now have more of my sympathy. Tasty meat, not gamy. Came with a fairly crunchy (fruit-crunchy, not chips-crunchy) spaghetti squash and grated parmesan. Was a little spicy, but even my wimpy palate tolerated it.  Wellington Empanada ($10): ground beef tenderloin, with something that I had to Google called duxelles (buttery minced mushrooms, onions, herbs). Great crunchy empanada shell, really flavorful filling, good complement of a vinegar sauce of some sort on the plate.  Sprouts & Spuds Hash ($10): probably the 3rd or 4th item I would re-order if I were to come back here. Properly cooked potatoes that have that bit of a crust but are so soft inside, with no trace of that raw potato flavor. Did not mind what I assume are baby brussels sprouts.  Wild Mushroom Flatbread ($10): mushroom was good, caramelized onions were good, mozzarella was good. The cabrales bleu cheese was nice and creamy, and not quite as sharp as other bleu varieties. Unfortunately, I couldn't really taste the cabrales in a whole bite of flatbread and had to rely on eating it separately to enjoy it.  [DESSERTS]  Not Your Father's Twinkies ($8): flavor-wise, this somehow reminds me of the sweet dumpling dessert that I had last week at an Indian place. It does not resemble Twinkies at all, by the way. The mandarin orange coulis brightens the dessert.  I was the only one at the table who liked it though.  Bourbon Fudge Brownie ($8): so heavy, so chocolatey, so yummy. The bourbon isn't too pronounced, and the bacon is something I always welcome in dessert. Eat the brown butter ice cream fast or it will melt on you. The kind of utter indulgence you expect from something called Bourbon Fudge Brownie.  Glazed Donut Bread Pudding ($8): soft bread pudding with very restrained sweetness, lovely caramel and creme anglaise. I like all the desserts, but this one might be the one with the widest appeal since it's relatively safe.  Overall, Carson Kitchen is a somewhat upscale take on American food, with commensurate increase in both quality and price. I wasn't too concerned with the bill since I figured it would be up there with how much we ordered, but a ~$45 w/ tip split was a little surprising. Then again, it's solid value for the sheer volume of menu items that we experienced. Given my usual budget, I'll have to hide for the rest of the week to absorb the hit, but it was worth it.

B0ssXbBBzxVvsNaEAwRC4Q.text: Expect a long wait on a weekend night. Unfortunately, you gotta stay in the nearby area because they won't call/text you if your table is ready. For an upscale restaurant that's sort-of hipster, I was impressed they didn't have a call system. We tried to make a reservation a week before, but was told a party of 4 didn't qualify. Bummer.  Atmosphere? Some folks are dressed super fancy while others are not. It's definitely a mix.  After waiting an hour and longer, we finally got seated upstairs in the patio. It was a nice area! I loved the decor and the chill atmosphere.   A lot of the entrees and dishes are meant to be shared like tapas, so we ordered a crap load to share. For appetizers, we got the: - Gyro Tacos (YUM!) - Deviled Eggs (Can't ever go wrong with these!) - Fried Chicken Skins (DELICIOUS! It tastes like chicharrones) - Bacon Jam (Skippable, but that's just me! The rest of my table liked it, but I wasn't a fan of it. We ran out of bread and they charged us another $1 for an additional plate of 4 tiny pieces)  As for entrees, we got the the steak and the lamp chops. The steak was delicious and I'd definitely recommend getting it! It was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The lamp chops were good too.  Overall, this place was delicious! I'd recommend this place to anyone looking to find a nice upscale restaurant to dine in at Downtown Las Vegas.

Vp7bgPfw5rcUtG_91Oj_Zw.text: Carson Kitchen has been on my radar from the moment they opened and I was excited to give them a try for my good friend's birthday dinner. We arrived around 5:30, and they were just on the cusp of getting busy, so it was great timing.   The entrance is a little obscure and there are two doors right next to each other, so it's a little difficult to figure out which one is the one you can enter through. We approached and tried the door and when it didn't open we walked around to the other side of the building and then had to walk back and realized there was another door right next to the one I had just tried. When we walked in, the hostess mentioned seeing us miss the door and walk around and I kind of wondered why didn't she didn't come out to let us know instead of just watching us wander around the building. I saw this same thing happen to a number of other customers as well, so they might need a sign or something.   Once seated, our server was very attentive and friendly. We quickly ordered some cocktails and sodas and he let us peruse the menu for a while. There aren't a huge number of menu items to choose from, but almost all of them caught my eye, so we decided to share a number of items amongst the group.   Items selected:  -Cocoa espresso NY strip steak  -Devil's eggs with caviar and crispy pancetta -Crispy chicken skins with a smoked honey dipping sauce -Beef Wellington empanadas -Butter burger spicy tater tots   Everything we tried was great. The strip steak was perfectly cooked and had a nice rich flavor. The deviled eggs were a highlight of the meal. They were rich and a great twist on the typical deviled egg. The chicken skins were very rich and I'd recommend sharing these with a larger group to save you a stomachache. The Beef Wellington empanadas were very tasty, although I did feel a little more sauce would have enhanced the dish quite a bit. The butter burger was very basic, so I probably wouldn't order this dish again.   Service was attentive and their cocktails were solid. I look forward to trying out the rest of their menu soon.

8-EyDxtIZWUYtEWFEY8OWg.text: I. Love. This. Place.   It's like a hidden gem. Let me tell you. My friend and I were looking for Carson's Kitchen. Siri was telling us we were there, but we weren't. Just as we were about to turn around, a kind lady pointed us in the right direction. Luckily for her or we would have missed out! We get there and their not open yet! It was past the time plastered online. We waited a little and someone came to open the door.   We walk in and the place isn't that big. Nice, trendy atmosphere. Love the tables as they look like they were recycled and reused. Not sire from what. I guess I could have asked. We sat at the middle section, right next to the lemons and such. Haha! They even have hooks for your bag, so it doesn't have to go on the floor. Which is bad luck! All your money will fly out! Anywho, I ordered the baked mac and cheese and my friend ordered a butter burger that came with tots. They do inform you when you sit down that food comes out as it's done. So one may get theirs before the other. Which happened to us. I got my mac and cheese first. I like to wait to eat until everyone gets their food. I only took one bite. I couldn't resist. It looked so good. The melted cheese, and those toasted breadcrumbs were just screaming my name! Not too long after her food comes out and we dig in. Omg! That mac and cheese is up there with some of the best. Then I had a glob of cheese and I was singing! My friend took a bite of hers and she loved it! I had a tot and they were made to perfection! The right amount of crunch! Not soggy or falling apart.   The ladies working there were awesome! Shout out to Tara and Felicia! They were hilarious and down to earth. Real people. When you get your bill, it's in a book, which you can write a little note in. Of course I wrote something in Lucky number, or chapter, 7.   I asked how long they had been there and I believe she said around 2 years. And I had no idea! I'll be back though!

veHov_wj63FXeGG_mGYgHA.text: Wow. Period! This place may not need more accolades, but we have plenty. Everything we had was top notch. Service impeccable. Staff so friendly and warm. Love the open kitchen and bar seating. Matthew the mngr (?) was great and recommended the best dishes. Seriously so good. Can't wait to return.

ZhRm8esNLDWunbFeQ9PJCA.text: So glad we found this gem! Thank you Yelpers. Everything at Carson Kitchen is delicious and the building is neat. We got a seat at the bar on the roof top. It was an amazing evening with great service. We shared a few plates and they were all fantastic.

oQqemaZbVMp350XzGlqSSA.text: By far this place is such a gem. I tried 4 times to get in for dinner and was always too busy and I see why. So I came in for lunch and got right in. Ha657xiZNvWC7HXJ3IBwJA.text: Some friends and I came to Vegas for a girls get away. We ate dinner on Saturday night. We were a party of six women enjoying a girls night out. We started with the Bacon Jam and Tempura Green Beans both were absolutely delicious. Then we each ordered a variety of sandwiches and entrees that we're equally as good. I had the sea bass which was prepared perfectly with a side of cauliflower. I was in food heaven. We were enjoying cocktails and our dinner then we decided to share a dessert. Our waiter, Manny, had made wonderful suggestions all night long so we took his suggestion once more and ordered the Glazed Donut Bread pudding. We all shared one because we were pretty full but ended up wanting to lick the bowl....as an added treat the manager brought over a seasonal dessert. A Bartlett Pear tart, sweet and refreshing, s perfect ending! Our entire experience was amazing, our waiter was excellent, the service was great and the food was sublime! I can't wait to visit Las Vegas again and come back to Carson's. We loved it!! Thank you for a great evening and a memorable dinner,  Torii Beatty

-bWvp_5R9kJGP-P2VPD-MQ.text: What a great Valentine's Day dinner. We had the 4 course prix fixe menu with an additional entree. All 8 dishes were amazing, service was great and the wine/cocktail pairing was well matched. Thank you Nichole, Matt, John and to all the staff at Carson. Keep up the great work. KS is very proud!!

nOctOrnN0iGqtq4ijdZZaQ.text: If you love to social eat with friends or family this is a great little spot in downtown.  The food is so tasty so wonderfully zesty and just with such an abundance of flavors.  I love the vibe, I love the service, I felt welcomed and cozy and warm and sat right by the kitchen every single waiter and waitress was wonderfully nice to us and it was just delicious will definitely come again and bring friends.

WadX9Rtu0B0JKr0B_QyfNg.text: Pleasantly surprised to find this cute place only a few blocks from Fremont Street, definitely would go again.  Service: lovely and fun Food: delicious, their mac and cheese was to die for Ambiance: dark, casual, industrial, crowds of people in their twenties  Only qualms:  * price for quantity, but makes up for it in quality. * not much space, but it can't be helped, it's still cute  Overall a fantastic experience!

zHPk-U5GkS1s7nHykQsLkQ.text: This is my favorite place to eat downtown, hands down. The menu is quaint, easy to read and full of great options for all! I absolutely love that the change out items on the menu, pending what is in season, making it forever changing and fresh!  Though the space is small the tables are laid out well providing great seating for a date night, a group hang out or even a special event. Reservations recommend especially on the weekends!

z_vf14VpUY12BfcHhSqAKA.text: Best restaurant in Vegas.  Modern and inventive menu.  Try the Gyros Tacos!  Fun "rock n roll" atmosphere.  And the service is friendly and engaging.  Forget all the chains and the expensive in hotel restaurants and go here.

N-zRR2YFJZogS6fE_oJ0uA.text: I checked this place out on a Sunday afternoon before heading back to Cali last weekend with a couple of heads. I saw previous reviews and pics on this place and wanted to give it a try. I would recommend coming here if you're with a group of friends and are ready to have some food and drinks and shoot the shit.    So, we ordered the chicken skins, deviled eggs, and bacon jam to start off with and all were destroyed in seconds. After that they ordered burgers and I ordered the wild boar Sloppy Joe, which I thought was decent even after having those small plates which were full of flavor.  If we weren't leaving that day we would have ordered more and would be drinking, but since we weren't I felt like we didn't get the full experience of this place.  I'll make sure to comeback and not be as hungover and tired. Based on the food I give it 4 stars.

Eg9IDAPNWlSkMG44CXl6CA.text: Foods pretty good. Lamb gyros are great sliders are as well. Service here is terrible. Every time I've been its been an extended wait for no reason! If the tables are open let us sit there so we don't have to awkwardly stand at the door.   In order to get a drink it takes a good half hour.   Been there many times because the foods good but we just had to walk out because waiting a half hour when half the restaurant is empty is just rude. Never mind the fact we have to pay for parking to wait in your empty restaurant.

sdrMEK2JZCfLucmns9xoEA.text: The place is small and there is still a bit of miscommunication but I'm sure they will work it out.  The food is outstanding.  First time, I had the Turkey burger and it was spicy but delicious.  The tatter tots were great.   Came back and sat outside.  A bit hot even at night but enjoyable.  Will be nicer as it cools a bit.  Order gyro taco and chicken skins.  Both were excellent.  Friend ordered sliders which were "not bad."

2WpMDJ9KQoayhtdF7gjbaw.text: Seriously, SO GOOD. I have never written a yelp review because I have yet to eat anywhere that made me want to praise the restaurant online. But there is a reason this place has 4.5 stars. We had the baked macaroni and cheese, burnt BBQ tips, veal meatballs, short rib grilled cheese, ox tail risotto, butter burger, and porkchop all to share. EVERY single thing was so flavorful and good that we were literally fighting each other for the last bites. The service was really great too and the place was packed all night! I 100% recommend this place. Don't be fooled by the appearance of the neighborhood and buildings around here; this place is a diamond in the rough!

fOa-ATmm4Sr1S6gyOWPvCQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great waiter. Thank you Roman, from the girls of Plexus(Team West)

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G6QYdyIsSGUy7m8Q_uhqjg.text: Great atmosphere and prices. Not a lot of gluten free options. The beet salad was one of the best I've had. I was less impressed with the burger. It had a good flavor, but it was slightly over cooked and the cheese was placed on after and not melted. I would come back and I would recommend it!

lrHQsDtlsO0ib3HpXLoDzg.text: One of the restaurants that is part of the new downtown. I only had a drink there so I can't really tell you about the food, other than it looked great. The drink was very good. This joint is a tad off the beaten path and can be a little difficult to locate via GPS, but hey isn't that half the fun? Not really. If you do happen to find it, it's worth a stop in. Please tell me how the rather delicious looking food is. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

16JTLgPIqRpQUpAWA6tVPg.text: I LOVED this place.  So eclectic...by decor, menu and drinks.   I had the Chardonnay (only 1) and it was yummy.  My husband And I shared Mac and Cheese, green beans and fried chicken skins (interesting).  I didn't like the chicken skins much...but my husband did.  Loved the tempura green beans and Mac and Cheese.  We got great service...even though we didn't have a reservation.  I would recommend one...as it appears hugely popular there.  Just a block or two from Fremont Experience...and well worth hunting down.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love it!  Great food &amp; service in this uniquely different space.

WVSvJeIR_y2_4SnXosZ-9w.text: I have been to better and classy restaurants in Vegas. The food was good but service is baddddddd. Stick to wine or beer because cocktails are not worth $$.

22_Ljzbpr57C-OOYkKRE5A.text: I loved this place! The food was amazing and I really jived with the low key atmosphere and staff. The caviar deviled eggs and glazed doughnut bread pudding were killer.

pqpzNdcrn6ES2mIhSh3ffQ.text: This place is hard to spot if you don't know what you're looking for. It's just off the corner, next to the doughnut shop. All of the food is great. Service is awesome, atmosphere is poppin, inclusive, young, fun and inviting.  I highly recommend the fried chicken sandwich. You can also get the turkey burger without the bun (on a crisp bed of lettuce). The cook was very personable and recommended other places to go later. Check it out!

xWMKRPdYlYq6HyZFWAE8wg.text: You know all those young, heavily-tattooed, hipster Food Network chefs you see on every edition of Chopped? Apparently, they all end up here. And that's not necessarily a bad thing, particularly if you like your deviled eggs topped with caviar, and your pressure treated ceiling joists left unpainted. It's a pretty damned cool spot with design influences galore.  The food is what you would expect from young, heavily-tattooed, hipster Food Network chefs: Tater Tots with spice, meat with coffee stuff rubbed all over it, shitloads of bacon. But hey, it tastes good, it's nicely presented, the prices are reasonable, and the environment--in the right company--feels artsy and hip and cool. So put on your Joy Division t-shirt, drop your parents off at the Wynn, pick up your weird cousin and enjoy. The burger alone is worth a visit.  Drinks alert!!! Mixed drinks are strong and interesting. Wine list is uninspired, overpriced, served in water glasses, and meager.

FLw1ERYwmqLPY8UkGlF5LA.text: Awesome service, unbelievable food. It is a must if you are in the Fremont area.   We had the bacon jam spread -share it (they will suggest sharing)  Shared a burger. Grass fed. Special sauce and cheese. Unreal taste and flavor. Put the left over jam on it.   Very nice people and fast.

_bhOa8hqPrIm4TBtGMA2hg.text: Love love love this place! Great innovative dishes and delicious libations... so impressed.

_vv4zABWuJBrD2jwzkw2yQ.text: Fantastic deviled eggs. Fantastic fried green beans! And an awesome burger! Come here, eat, drink, and be happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried green beans.

Ddu9ZBGpUOHpPhcQg3PqSQ.text: We are locals here in Las Vegas and have decided to try a new local restaurant each opportunity we have to go out.  This was our first pick. Great atmosphere, great food  & super friendly staff.... ask for Jason. We will definitely be back!

Z7TBIadPTtVHAOtmnnst9g.text: Was looking for a different place to eat with convention/business contacts before heading over to Fremont Street.  This place was awesome from start to finish.  Great cocktails and service in the bar, and the food was amazing! We ordered the deviled eggs, crispy chicken skin, beet salad, and pork belly to share.  Everything was delicious! We all ordered individual entrees also, and every single person raved about their meal.  I had the meatloaf patty melt and it was great - homemade tots were fantastic too.  Unfortunately when we left last night, my fiancee grabbed both credit card slips and so we inadvertently cheated our server out of a tip! We called the restaurant and there was nothing we could do, so we promise to come back next year and make it up to him!! All in all - Fabulous meal and a really cool place that doesn't feel "Vegassy"!

M767e2pZuInfBXH4pCFk_A.text: Very much enjoyed this place.  Food was excellent, and we tried a lot of the appetizers.   My only issue was were were suggested 30 min for wait and yet it took more like 90 min to get a seat.  We were suggested that they were going to take care of us, but the bill was really not adjusted much, if at all, so that was a little disappointing.   I just felt that when you say that, you kinda need to do something nice and intentional.

ogPb22BZt4pQkDuML58Q7A.text: Incredible food and fast, friendly service. Oxtail risotto, carrots, buffalo pork belly were all highlights! "Just the Tip" whiskey cocktail was dangerously good and likely to lead to more things...

-q2FCXmbJ7QZt3eCA1sllQ.text: Great everything. Menu, food, people, atmosphere, value, experience, etc. it's. Hidden gem in Vegas, I hope you find it.

l3xgpt7IHZHB_FQbmFTcjQ.text: Atmosphere was super casual and the staff was friendly.  The place has a great vibe.  Now the food!  I cannot think of any negatives, not unless I consider the fact that I over ate.  :-)  The bacon jam with Brie was fabulous!  The deviled eggs reminded me of my mom's.  The killer shrimp was to die for.  The watermelon and feta salad was perfect!    Thank you for providing us and our Uber driver directions.

O-Ph8LZOtma4o28lv8jGJQ.text: Carson Kitchen was simply amazing. I went with a group with three other people and it was really convenient that all of their dishes come out family style, meaning that it came in smaller portions and very easy to share. We ordered a lot of food which included Gyro Tacos, Spring Asparagus, Rainbow Cauliflower, Baked Mac & Cheese, Pork Chops, NY Strip, and the Salmon and everything tasted amazing! My personal favorites were the tacos, cauliflower, mac & cheese, and pork chop. For dessert, we had the Bourbon Fudge Brownie and Glazed Donut Bread Pudding and both were some of the best desserts I've had in Vegas. The food is a little pricey but well worth it.  Our server was also very friendly and recommended many of the dishes that we ordered. She came by often to check up on us and refill our drinks.   The atmosphere was very modern and since we came at night, very intimate. A great place to catch up and talk to the people you're with.   I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant for the great food, atmosphere, and service!!

fxlAp-uWTkplW0Mkq-XViQ.text: Went with two others downtown for a Saturday night dinner, They do not take reservations so called ahead and put our name in as the place is popular with locals and tourists, Loved the reviews and loved the food here. Our great waiter Anjelica took care of the three of us. Loved the Tempura Green Beans, Gyro tacos, and delicious Cocoa Espresso NY strip. Mac & Cheese was delicious and so was Brussels sprout Caesar. Go and make sure you share but it can get busy here. I would go again when back in downtown area.

tZJx8LdBOPaADhECHHI7Gw.text: I yelp this place and the reviews were great. When we first got there the hostess was not very friendly.She told us and another couple 30 minutes but sat two couple after us before. I didn't want to be "that person" so I let it slide since we got a drink from the bar. When we finally got sat down the waiter and food was amazing especially the bacon jam. Only thing the chairs are not made for the curvy girl...lo I updated my review because the owner heard my concerns and addressed them. Like I said before the food and waiters were awesome and it is a nice place to grab a bite with friends.  Also the grilled cheese was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YX3Bs0OMFvbwzQsVFjW_MQ.text: Great vibe and the staff was super friendly and accommodating. We loved the chill atmosphere, 90s tunes, open kitchen and amazing dishes. We loved the pork belly, crab fondue, and the veal meatballs the most. Definitely coming again next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JmRZI7wMTCqQ5Wm69Hd7pw.text: Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere, and great service make for a great night out.   We arrived and were told it would be a short wait. No worries, we were able to grab drinks at the bar and wait out back in the courtyard. The hostess said she would find us when our table was ready and that she did.   The drinks to start were very good and the drink menu had some unique options. The food menu offers small plates as well as entrees. We opted to order a variety of food items and share. The waiter let us know that food comes out as it is prepared so sharing is really the best way to go.  The Gyro Tacos were very good. We almost asked for a second order of these. The meat was well seasoned and the pita was both soft and crispy perfection. The Devil's Eggs were delicious. The Baked Mac & Cheese was cheesy and had a nice truffle flavor without being overwhelming to the dish. The serving looked like it was on the smaller side, but was oddly filling. The Jerk Turkey Burger was another great item. The jerk flavor was nice and the mango slaw paired nicely with the spice in the seasoning. I enjoyed the tots on the side, but they weren't spicy as described on the menu.  Service was on point. We were greeted as soon as we sat down, waters were refilled, and the waiter took care to explain menu items so there weren't any surprises. The employees worked as a team to get food to the table and empty plates cleared.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mac &amp; Cheese

XQL71K0yzW3lt9UivRMI4w.text: This place is incredible, take the $11 ride and avoid the strip. Food and service is incredible. Crispy chicken skins, gyro tacos, bacon jam, and broccoli were 10's!

ZxwyY69NC1OWaP5wqSWBlQ.text: We came in April 2018 and absolutely LOVED our selections: Gyro tacos, tempura green beans, secret Sunday chicken and spicy tater tots.  Fast forward to August and we can't leave without stopping and trying new items on this yummy menu. Today's selections: chicken thighs with Alabama white barbecue, tater tots, wild mushroom flat bread and Killer Shrimp. Mmm mmm good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Different points of view...bar seating is beast!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eat at the bar and watch he magic happen!

6xaMeNbNZ4GdP-xtwS6scw.text: Excellent spot in downtown Vegas located parallel and south of Fremont. I recommend getting there early and would not plan to have a large dinner party on a weekend. We arrived about 9pm on a Friday night and it was a 20-minute wait. We headed over to the small bar area. They have a great variety of beers foreign, domestic, craft, as well as a cocktail list. Cocktails range in the $11-$15 range. Bar area is quite small. Cool looking but not a place to meet up with a group of friends. Good place to meet up with a friend for a drink. If you are looking for more than that you would need a table.   Luckily, when it was time for us to be seated we were given a front row seat to all of the entertainment. We were seated at the bar. We went from sitting at the bar to dining at a bar next to the kitchen. At first, I thought it was lame but then got a feel for what was going on. If you are foodie (of course you are because you Yelp) then this is the place to dine. It was like a bonus or getting upgraded concert tickets. It was a different experience to watch all the chefs/cooks/scientists in action.   The food was amazing. There are not too many things on the menu and tapas style or sharing is encouraged. Our server recommended 4 dishes is usually good for 2 people, but I pushed it to 5. I like to push boundaries. I appreciated the menu because you can get a little bit of everything at a reasonable price. The plates started at about $8 and slowly crawled their way up.   We had the gyro tacos which were an excellent choice. Paired that with some rainbow cauliflower (had a little bit of a spicy kick to it), grilled and flavored with garlic and lemon juice. The beet and goat cheese salad was a good selection as well. I tasted the shrimp and antebellum grits that my wife ordered. The shrimp had a really good flavor and was a little spicy.   If you are a huge fan of their food, there is a large swear jar at the bar for you to tip. Just yell out any expletive to share your joy in the excitement of the food. The money is then split between all the cooks and they have a large party to celebrate their success.   Overall, great place to do something different in Vegas if you are a visitor like me. I try to stay away from buffets and commercialized spots on the strip. Come out and support this great small business. I forgot to mention the playlist inside was great. Friendly people and excellent customer service.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good

fNOxjt2PbQmQTAxDYXrORg.text: I'm from Los Angeles and coming here is something I do every time I go to Vegas. I tell all my friends to go and as someone who worked at one of Kerry Simon's old restaurants, I tell people who ask about him when they come in now to check this place out. Food and cocktails are always amazing. I've never had anything bad. The chicken skins are something I order every time. The chicken thighs are also a great entree. The price point is very good for eating and drinking and the service is phenomenal.

NKDqNW6y-UBXryQR9lwuKA.text: Such an amazing "non strip" restaurant!  Fun rooftop patio! Macaroni and cheese was so good!

IQvdrwRqSWeXnI3xSlLCVw.text: Everything here is exceptional,  butter burger, deviled eggs, bacon jam... fun place you won't be disappointed in any part of the experience.

1KbFpNqYn85d7eb86tz0PQ.text: Delicious food at not crazy prices. Shared the Sunday chicken sandwich and the short rib grilled cheese with a side of cauliflower. I think the winner overall was the chicken sandwich - fresh and moist white meat fried chicken in a pretty amazing bun with something akin to a secret sauce that was a perfect match. The spicy tots that came with it were also great, maybe the best tots I have had in a LOOOOOONG time. The cauliflower was good, but some pieces were cold in the middle, not really a game changer because at least they weren't mushy but a little, I don't know, weird? Super garlicky for sure, so prepare yourself for that. The short rib grilled cheese was good but I almost feel like I would have rather just hunkered down with the chicken sandwich. I am probably going to have dreams about that sandwich now... mmm... chicken....  Nice spot, my only compliant really is that all the seats at the regular tables are stools without seat backs. We sat at a counter height communal table so we could get seats with backs, which, I guess, for us old fogeys is the way we have to do it. Lumbar support people!!

-_O22B2ay2tvJnmvImFatA.text: All the yelp reviews about how good this place  is are spot on. All the food was great! Fun, lively atmosphere. The presentation of all the dishes are meticulous. The menu is a sharing menu so portions are more than adequate. The place can be a little tricky to find as there is no large, obvious signage outside. They just added a nice patio area outside and on the second floor that can be rented out or used as over flow for busy nights. I can't say enough good things about this place! A must go to...The business will be changing out portions of their menu at the end of month and rolling out new offerings next month.

x295ZmtTf2yE27GWMfc_fQ.text: Saw this place atop many hot spot lists and since we stayed downtown figured we would give it a shot. Our minds were blown. The food was incredible, the service was great! We started off with a few social plates the crab cheddar fondue and bacon jam. talk about taste explosions they were decadent and just exquisite. We also tried the mac n cheese which was also very delicious. The last thing I ordered was the chicken thighs. Let's just say I never knew how good thighs could be until this experience. I can't wait to go back and try other items and one thing that was great was our server and possibly the floor manager or owner were there to give us some pointers on what was what and even mixing some of the items we ordered for even more tasteful experiences. Def my new favorite spot downtown!

3AzNC4hhmtnTlHf7GHEiAg.text: We lucked into Carson Kitchen. We set out for an evening walking around Fremont Street area, planning to grab a quick snack along the way. On the way from the Strip, our taxi driver started talking about food and couldn't say enough good things about Carson Kitchen. So glad we took him up on his advice!  We were able to sit at the counter overlooking the kitchen right where the food comes out. Every single dish that came out of the kitchen was beautifully presented. Watching the kitchen and dining room staff at work was like watching a fabulous performance--who needs to go to a Vegas show when you've got this!  All the dishes are made for sharing. We shared Black Rice Risotto and Veal Meatballs. Our server very correctly recommended that since those dishes were both rich that we include something with a little acidity. So they brought us the Pear and Blue cheese Salad which was the perfect addition.  Foodies seek out this restaurant as a destination. We were fortunate enough to be guided there by a last minute suggestion by a well-informed cab driver.

VKrJaCRJU8_i8dxK7Fg6bA.text: Salmon had the crispiest skin and cooked perfect. Brussels sprout Ceaser and tempura green beans. Perfect combo!  Perfect meal for 2!!

oYAnxZsS2pDvgNH3g3tqHQ.text: Broccoli crunch YUM! Trout EXQUISITE! Wild mushroom flat bread AMAZING! Please visit this trendy and uniquely delicious restaurant in downtown LAS VEGAS

4hDwmLayUYeWMHlSo3jNIA.text: This is our best food experience on our vacation in the US so far. We can recommend pretty much everything on the menu!

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best food so far on our vacation in the US. We recommend pretty much everything on the menu!

VcGhC-LI6mL25tffriQ8Dg.text: Everything here is on point! Crafted cocktails that are balanced and tasty! The knowledge of the staff is solid also. Enjoyed the Devils Eggs, the Gyro tacos, Charred Octopus and the Wild Mushroom Flatbread...perfect for the 2 of us to share and thoroughly enjoy each bite! Didn't feel rushed and enjoyed hearing from the owner as well when he brought over a dish! Great service and omg the food!!! Highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

isveWhhWF2LmH_65SNucQg.text: A nice spot to have dinner downtown.  Environment: The restaurant itself is in downtown Las Vegas and is small inside. However, it looks as if they have done some renovations in recent months as they now have a separate bar area which is great if you do not want to have to wait for a table (which they usually have a wait). Additionally, they do have an outdoor patio area in the back which tends to fill up fast as well.  Food: The food here is southern inspired and so far, everything that I have had here has been good. On my most recent visit, I tried the pork chop as well as the gyro tacos. The pork chop was cooked very well, and it was paired with a very nice sauce. Additionally, the fried chicken skins are a great appetizer. The only thing I will say is that the cocktails are below average. They taste too weak and even when I ordered a long island just tasted like lemonade. I typically stick to old-fashioned when ordering drinks here.  Service: Service has always been adequate and I have never felt like I was left waiting for someone to check up on me, and sitting at the bar, the bartender was sure to check up on us and refill our waters when necessary.  Overall, Carson's Kitchen is a nice, fun spot to grab dinner downtown, and while I wouldn't say it's my favorite spot it is somewhere I could see myself coming every couple month.
