Vgd-pYOZZGp_wirpxedyzw.text: Outstanding!   One of the best meals I have had in a long time and that's quite a statement considering the amount of very fine establishments I've had the pleasure of dining at.   We had the crispy fried chicken skins....yummy.   The veal meatball were delish.   My only complaint is I wish I could taste the Foi Gras, but I still would order them again.   The gyro tacos were tasty but the oxtail risotto stole the show.  Just delicious.   My date ordered a cocktail that was so tasty.    It had tequila and cayenne pepper in it...not sure what else was in it, but who cares.  You had me at tequila and cayenne pepper.  The service was wonderful to spite the fact that they were packed to the gills. Everything arrived promptly, hot and perfectly seasoned.   I'm already looking forward to going back!

qvw7wv74QR8N0wjWFRh_rQ.text: Great joint in east Fremont without catching the tourist traps on the strip. You get that local neighborhood feel and the food is damn good. The gyro tacos were my ultimate fav. The shrimp were also damn tasty. I think they lost a point on the shepherds 3.14 dish. The gnocchi were soft pillows that melted in your mouth among the shredded pieces of lamb but the sausage had a distinct taste that I didn't care for and the au jus lacked flavor. The edamame was a nice twist of the original but didn't increase the flavor of the dish. Everything else was 5 star worthy!

107QYMpobIBnBGeR_xVESw.text: Carson is ALWAYS consistent in all the food, no matter when you go. Definitely is a great legacy for Chef Kerry Simon and highly deserving of 5 stars on Yelp (if anyone still takes Yelp seriously)

PusUFwT8xI-JvjaTKlZ0Aw.text: Went during lunch hour with a friend, I love Simon at the Palms Place. I was hoping for a similar experience. When we walked in it wasn't too busy. I had read the menu online before coming in but unfortunately not only was 50% of the menu different or it had been changed, but they had already ran out of two items an hour into opening. We interacted with 3 out of the staff of probably 12. The hostess looked like she didn't want to be there and that she was annoyed by seating us. The server seemed pissed off when I was asking questions about the menu (about what was pregnancy safe... Which turns out a lot wasn't!) and he also forgot my friend's drink. The man bringing out our food which we assumed was a manager of sorts at first came off like there was a chip on his shoulder as well but then later on he seemed to warm up to us. We ordered the bacon jam, chicken skins, edamame, and the butter burger. The party on the burger was a little small and the edamame was not worth the $8 but everything was pretty good and came out nice and hot. Would definitely want to try it again maybe if the menu changes up again. But not if the staff is still so miserable, unwelcoming and awkward..

5NZj7HpYthuunaziWstR3w.text: We arrived without a reservation.  Two dining and were led to open bar seats next to the prep area of an open kitchen.  We loved the Decore, and the service.  They were instantly pouring water and asking for drink orders while suggesting options.  They explained the breakdown of the menu which was easy to understand.  We had a few choices that were all delicious.  We can highly recommend the food and service, but would ask for a different seat next time to see if that wasn't more comfortable.  We will go back on our next visit.

OmCWvhobH8VDsnOj1baUrg.text: This place is a hidden gem in downtown Vegas. The atmosphere was laid back, modern, and full of personality. I love that we got to see the chefs creating the food, it was so interesting! I had gyro tacos and although they were smaller than I thought they'd be, they were delicious. My husband got the beef sliders and they came with tater tots which were also delicious. The waitstaff was cordial and helpful. I love how when they brought the check we got to write a message in a book! The whole place was interesting and full of personality! Can't wait to go back!

5TDB0et9ZE-Flu-05Ni_MA.text: I always go here when I'm close to downtown. This is also a must for when visitors are in town. The bacon jam, chicken sandwich, and burger are my favorites!

80KpsJyE4RmYjcxtMZ1E3A.text: Great restaurant, seated next to the kitchen at a bar, spoke with one of the chefs during the meal.  Meant to be a sharing menu with somewhat smaller size portions, but the large meat entrees certainly enough to share.  Sea bass was deliciously grilled, tender, presented with tarragon, Italian parsley, a mint leaf, and a roasted slice of lemon.  A ribeye steak medium well was a bit salty but otherwise tasty and tender.  Side of spaghetti squash with rabbit (yes, hop hop) was tasty, as were colorful golden and red beets.  The margarita with cayenne salt was punchy and delicious.  Fantastic cozy atmosphere with varied seating arrangements, great for a date.  At about 6p on a Sunday didn't have a wait.

MI5BvpHvwX1DsZ_fKeQ9Sw.text: My hopes were really high based on Yelp reviews.  We had about a 30 minute wait so got a cocktail upstairs at the bar and took it downstairs to the courtyard.  Very relaxing and comfortable wait.  We (4of us)were seated at the eating bar downstairs.  Good seating since it was facing the kitchen so was fun watching the chefs at work.  The staff was great and our server was attentive.  He recommended eating  tapas style; the four of us sharing plates.  Sitting at the bar made that pretty difficult.  We first ordered burnt ends, fried chicken skin and tempura green beans. Unfortunately none lived up to expectation.  The burnt ends were 90% fried fat.  None of us got much meat to speak of.  I'm from barbecue country and know what burnt ends are.  These weren't it.  The chicken  skin was cooked exactly as I expected but way too salty.   The tempura green beans had no tempura batter on them. Some of the beans had a thin layer of batter on them.  They were also a bit greasy.  It was as if the grease was not hot enough when they were cooked.  That being said, the overall texture of the beans was quite good.  Not too under done, not too over done.  To end the meal, we got watermelon salad, mac and cheese, asparagus salad and cauliflower.  All were good.  The two salads were fantastic.  Be prepared to say "what did you say" a lot.  Very noisy.   I think sitting on the deck upstairs to eat would probably have made the dinner more enjoyable.  All in all, it was a fair experience and wouldn't go back, which pains me to say.

_CpwOu_WYy-SFwmMS2NvnA.text: Be sure to try out Carson kitchen next time you visit Las Vegas.  I heard many great things and decided to go on Friday night.  Great atmosphere, staff were very friendly and food was amazing.   Tempura green beans were awesome!  Jerk turkey burger was the juiciest turkey burger ever.  Cauliflower and butter burger also were delicious.  Both burgers come with spicy tots that are to die for.  Our server Stacie was super attentive and very nice.  Definitely recommend as a must try!

REB83Jf77vG7CsMQWxZNdA.text: Incredible food! Great atmosphere, doesn't look like a restaurant from the outside. They have a nice outside patio. People are awesome and food is some of the best in downtown!

BHvHJmd1joxCx5IrGyAodQ.text: Food: Definitely a must try, the prices in ratio to their portions was just right. My wife had the osso Bucco I had the black Rice Risotto and both tasted excellent the osso Bucco was soft and was still on the bone. It was cooked perfectly. Black Risotto with oxtail tasted amazing, me and my wife shared both our entree's protein via the osso Bucco and Black Risotto a great combo. My daughter had the taters, hey its taters screwing the taters would definitely be bad for ANY restaurants.   Ambiance: Good vibe, not great for family dining though, it was small, it would be noisy if we didnt go there on Saturday at 2:00 PM. A great place to hang out and dine.  A meeting place for Yuppies of some sort kind of Vibe.  Restroom: Very small, should have been maintained better though.   Location: This place is the definition for Hole in the Wall dining, the location is in downtown las vegas, Downtown las vegas has been revitalized to a degree, but still has some bad neighborhood vibe to it but changed a bit a result from Downtown project by tony Hsieh Zappos Founder. Hopefully with more time and effort downtown las vegas can be compared to DownTown Chicago, or Downtown Frisco as of now I dont see it yet.

VUuw8QlWGygzzuHBevBOgQ.text: Cozy, family style seating.  Also has an area to watch the creations take shape.  Wife got an order of brussel sprouts which I thought was overwhelmed by vinegar and salmon.  I'm not typically a fish guy, but the protein glistened and the top was seated well. I got a burger that was executed well with an unusual treat - cheese that wan't cooked with the burger.  This's one change affected both the taste and the texture of the burger.  Good stuff. We would go again, if we found ourselves in the Fremont area.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tsG6LebnPmIR6ssyZI42VQ.text: Oh man... Where do I start, the food, the people, the booz???  Ive been here several times and each time the food and service keeps getting better and better. The food has been outstanding. My personal favorite is the bacon jam.... OH MYYYYY (George Takei voice).  Sweet, salty, cheesy, crispy loving good. Deviled eggs, better than your grandmas ancient recipe.  Tacos, hell yeah I'll have another... Flat breads are really good, good enough that I high jacked my friends left overs. If you like spicy, the boneless chicken oysters are the bomb. Anyhow, whatever you get, you won't be disappoint. I suggest getting everything family style... More choices to pass around.   Service, bar none!  Enough said.... Just be careful that the bartenders don't see you chair dancing as they will call your ass out for a dance off. I didn't have the heart to show my sweet moves and one up the bartender, but if I had guzzled another Jack and Coke, she would have been in trouble, haha!  But seriously the team there is awesome, customer service is legit and they take great care if you.   The booze - you call it, they'll pour it... Just make sure you uber it!!!!  Love this joint... From the food to the booze and more importantly, the staff!

FI3BTtuVZOWS5eEYxmfC8A.text: I had a watermelon feta salad and the mushroom flatbread pizza. Both were very unusual and delicious. They were so good that I wished I was there with another person so I could try more things. The waitstaff was very friendly. I will definitely be going back.

XHAExomTU9Xrupw-vLpJsQ.text: Really liked our visit. Went with a party of six and were seated within 20 minutes of arriving (after calling ahead) on a Friday night. Great food. Some dishes were very rich but delicious all around. Our table ordered: Chicken skins Bacon jam  Mac & cheese Burger Crab fondue  Scallops Shrimp Stroganoff Risotto  Thai chicken flatbread  Gyro tacos   My favorites were the gyro tacos & mac& cheese   Would recommend and will return!

lNlQkk7JJNBtTgsKZcX2NQ.text: Woop! Woop! New fan of this place!  Stopped in here for food and drinks before heading out on Freemont with a friend visiting from out of town. Be warned that you are not allowed to park in the street directly across from the entrance!  The interior is set up for table sharing type eating.  The three of us ate on one of the big butcher blocks next to the bar on the left upon entering and shared the table with about 5 others. It looks like they don't offer your own table unless you eat on the deck upstairs or have a big enough group to take up one of the big tables downstairs.   The decor inside is awesome, they did a great job.  It offers that hipster/raw/industrial feel but still feels classy.  The bartender at the upstairs bar was very chill and quick.  He whipped up three of their signature cocktails very quickly.  The server downstairs was very friendly and knowledgable of the food on the menu.  My only con about this place was that the food took FOREVER to come out, roughly 25-30 min, and we didn't order anything fancy.  The food was very good though!  I'll let them make up for it there.  Overall though this place is awesome, the ambiance is there, the service was great, drinks were tasty, and the food was delicious.  Will definitely be back!

nLp0MH9O8ngtzSUytEp4gA.text: This is a great funky place with clever small plates and creative adaptations of familiar foods.  We went on date night before a show downtown and this was a highlight.  Unique foods based on classics served as sharable portions.  Loved the bacon jam and bacon ice cream.  Sliders were the best.  Unique cocktails to match.  Communal-style seating without being overbearing.  The area is growing with these types of unique places and Carsons leads the way.

qhFLzCpN9c091wlMpYYKew.text: Second day of being open and it was amazing. The atmosphere was cool and felt like I was in San Francisco or something. The Mac and cheese blew my mind. I also would recommend the bourbon fudge brownie (it's got bacon). Tip: taste the ice cream and the brownie separately then together! Sooo yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is  side order of spicy tater tots. And the bacon jam!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mac and cheese. As you can see it was half gone before I could even get my phone out to take a picture!

litEAHNSFnhvWFd3Jtm1fg.text: This place gets busy and is a small cozy place downtown. If you are looking for something cozy and different this place would be it. I enjoyed the jerk turkey burger, but the slaw became a bit much for me after awhile. This restaurant is easy to miss, it is in a all white building.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skins
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro taco
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk turkey burger

91X-hCFYg6yDGKS4VbqKgg.text: Absolutely the best find in Vegas! Carson's kitchen is just south of Fremont on the East end and it's a little hard to find with no distinctive sign out front...  It's a small charming place where everything is ala carte and comes out in multiple stages. Which I was sure of at first, but it works and well!  From the unique drinks at the bar to the excellent food; Carson's is a can't miss in your Vegas trip!  The flat breads, vegetable dish, steaks and the worlds best butter burger will have your taste buds not knowing what just hit them... EXCELLENT!!!  From the ambiance inside, charming patio hidden out back, the delicious food and the great friendly attitudes from everyone... it's a nice break from the Vegas hustle and well worth the drive to the old strip!  I'll definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fOIlLN50TBozfKfWE14mPg.text: The guest relations guy was not pleasant At times he would deliver the food to the table and instead of going around us he would go right in the middle of us and interrupt our conversation I do Not appreciate some guys arm rushing in between me and my date. His whole demeanor was stand offish he should not be the one who greets and and seats guest  The food was ok but nothing worth coming back for the atmosphere and ambiance was nice

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WtF? Aliens use the bathroom laying down⁉

-45pGWhbnM_SySapfjy1lg.text: Very interesting menu. Creative menu choices. We ordered the pork and wild mushroom tikka flat bread which was phenomenal! Definite must eat for any foodie

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tikka flat bread

BzOaep0ww8Qk0B_Xhofzcg.text: Carson Kitchen is indeed,  as good as it gets!  My husband and I were in town for a conference from Chicago (home to some of the best restaurants in the country) and were actually planning to eat at a buffet on the strip the night we ended up at Carson Kitchen.  We were too late to get a table at the buffet (thank goodness) and ended up snagging a couple seats at the kitchen bar of Carson Kitchen - the best place to eat.  We loved watching Chef Harwell and his staff prepare all the tasty dishes and send them out to the dining room.    We ordered the bacon jam, the baked mac and cheese, the wild mushroom flatbread, the rainbow cauliflower and the glazed donut bread pudding.  Oh my word!  My mouth is starting to water just thinking about how good every single thing was, especially that mac and cheese.    We had a lovely chat with Ethan, the director of operations, about Chicago and the restaurant industry and even discovered a shared acquaintance!   He recommended we try the bacon jam on a piece of baguette with the mac and cheese on top...  Absolute HEAVEN!!!  That was the best decision I made the entire time we were in Vegas, hands down!    The food was to die for, Stacey, our server was such a doll and Ethan was a joy to talk with.  Excellent food and even better service (if that's even possible)!    Please do yourself a favor and leave the strip if you are in town visiting - there is so much more to Las Vegas.  Carson Kitchen is proof of this fact!  P.S. The next night, we went back to the buffet (because my husband really likes to eat large quantities of food) and all I could think about was how sad I was we weren't eating at Carson Kitchen again!  : )

hFhPVv-7ehkHQX4j4U8glg.text: I visited with my 2 friends this last weekend while we were on vacation together.  It was extremely loud where we couldn't even talk to each other, the service was ok with long waits in between and to top it all off they added at 1 next to our tip making the tip 62%.  This is theft and very bad business. -----Update the owner contacted me the same day and resolved my issue.  As it turns out it was a mix up with checks and we have all been issued a refund.  Changing my rating to 5 stars due to this quick resolution.  Also as I understand part of the restaurant was closed which explains the increased noise level.  I will definitely visit again as the food was amazing my issue was only around the incorrect charge.  Thanks Cory for resolving our issue.

bAbE6zK9QFjh_tS3nmXp5Q.text: I love me some chicharrones. Fried pork skin rules! So I was always intrigued by the crispy chicken skin offered at Carson Kitchen and wanted to try it for myself. Turns out there's a reason why fried chicken skin isn't as popular as fried pork skin: It's just not very good.  Sadly, I also was not impressed by the other items I tried. The deviled eggs were pretty plain (nowhere near as good as those at Yardbird), and the bacon jam was more sweet than savory (nowhere near as good as that at The Bronze Cafe).   Maybe I shouldn't be comparing Carson Kitchen to other restaurants. But that's what people do--especially in a city with scores of great dining options.  I will say that my drink (The Magarian) was pretty tasty. And my husband loved the pork belly (aka "pork wings"), although I wasn't a fan. But we both wish the restaurant took reservations for small parties, because we had to wait 40 minutes for a table. Luckily, we scored a two-top, because most of the other seats were at "community tables" and I wasn't in the mood for small talk with a stranger.  I guess I don't get the concept, and maybe I ordered the wrong items, but Carson Kitchen just isn't the place for me.

5U9W-gYGjd-Wk-o3t4vHHg.text: Wow!!Wow!!Wow!! Started with deviled eggs and chicken shins. Both where awesome great flavors.  Then we received the oxtail risotto with the tempura green beam. Every thing was full of flavor. And now the

i5nczoBz0kGqbcnNaxhQNQ.text: I came here as part of a walking food tour, and had a wondergul time. The next time I come to Vegas, this restaurant is definitely on my list of places to come back to. Located on the eastern side of Fremont Street, this restaurant, this area, is a welcome respite from the very loud Vegas so many of us are used to. Great food selections. As part of the tour we had fried chicken skin w/honey - sounds bizarre, but this was a welcome "street food" selection. Think gourmet pork rinds, with chicken. We sampled a savory veal meatball course that was simply delicious - an "elevated" meatball. Finally, a beet salad with pistachio crusted goat cheese. For the record, I do not like beets. This course? DELICIOUS. Very kind and attentive wait staff. Just an unexpectedly wonderful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A stop on the Lip Smacking Foodie Tour...

EAOMP3l1cEVkIqiy9YfUEA.text: Been here multiple times! Probably one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas. I have never had a bad dish from the menu so of course 5 stars from me. It is wise to make a reservation but if you don't mind waiting order a refreshing cocktail.   Let's see so I been with a couple groups that didn't mind sharing everything (recommended) and one group where we ordered separately.  I love, love the Brussels sprouts Caesar -recommend to start.  Also the crispy chicken skins - so good and hot and salty and chewy. The bacon jam is also very flavorful and delicious.   I've had the NY strip with cocoa-espresso sauce - sounds interesting but it really does taste amazing. Also thought the meat was cooked perfectly medium rare.   The black rice and oxtail risotto is very good, love the chunks of oxtail. It is pretty salty but highly recommended to share with group. The Baked Mac and cheese is probably one of my favorites at a place, they do it right with the crunchy top but gooey cheese sauce, not chunky/clumpy at all. I don't recall which flatbread we ordered but I remember my friend obsessing over it.   Desserts....all amazing but that glazed donut bread pudding, in my mind, is worth eating here.   Service and ambiance- all great the times I've been.

gFTb8JZNakvf6gcV9oUUNA.text: I like this place for a cute date night spot! The portions are shareable and its fun to sample everything together. The cocktail menu is interesting and has something for everyone. I like ordering drinks that I can't make myself because there are so many ingredients or ingredients I don't recognize - I feel like I'm getting my money's worth! Sitting at the bar is cool too because you can watch the kitchen and staff prepare everything. It made me really want to order a flatbread.   We tried the smoked trout appetizer which is good if you like mustard seeds. Young beets was refreshing. We ordered the NY strip but the server forgot to put it in and we had to run before she could correct it. The server was super apologetic and it wasn't a big deal because we were pretty full anyway. The service has always been great and super friendly every time I'm here. I'm def coming back for some flatbread!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked trout

7i4PZMgSPSPKBSO571U2tg.text: Love this place! Quick Uber drive away from the Strip. Such good food & yummy cocktails!

CGUXGf98i_eAD5869AAQvA.text: Absolutely phenomenal food and best service! Thank you so much for an awesome experience

4ZPOQlt92dO6ids38zQPeA.text: So I was looking up restaurants near my hotel and found a whole block of restaurants I wanted to try out. One being Carson Kitchen. I read their chicken thighs ate very popular so I went with that and the mushroom flat bread. Both were absolutely delicious. My son, a picky 5 year old who only eats chicken nuggets and fries, ate both and enjoyed it. I love the atmosphere and the decorate of the restaurant. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom flatbread
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken thighs

EMf6G3ur5fuWvjDOjfcbuQ.text: We came in a group of 20 or so with a prix fixe menu already sorted out beforehand. Our reservation was early on a Saturday evening (4:30 pm) Whomever greeted us and seated us was so overly trying to be charming that the sarcasm sounded insulting.   Our server was annoyed with us from the beginning, and did not hide it at all. We asked the best and most convenient way to order bar drinks since our meal did not include beverages - he wasn't happy about accommodating - I mean the higher the tab the bigger the tip...right?  I didn't understand the annoyance.   So about the food. AMAZING... Desserts...Ohhh holy hell yum! The treatment by staff....just a little too unprofessional I feel.  The food came out timed by them, not us in several courses.  It was imed well for the most part... but we were informed at 5:30 ish that our time was almost up (we were waiting for desserts)  and there was another party at 6.  #1... $1700 + drink tab for dinner we spent...#2 YOU timed the food... #3 NEVER say that to a customer.   It worked out for the most part,  and it makes it hard to review because the food was outstanding. It was just an odd experience.

GPHdkWUVf102vcVyPyXnMQ.text: Really glad to have found this place. Everyone in our group thought it was fantastic and I did too. Next time in Vegas I will definitely eat there  I had the meatloaf sammich and tots and was yummy

Q3NdYT7hnJVQN_87zGG5dg.text: Based on the positive Yelp reviews, we went in around 7 on a Tues eve. got seated at a kind of long high table for 16 or so- The is sort of a hipsterish small plates place , with upstairs space for large receptions and events as well as a nice outdoor patio in the back. They do serve mains, but I think the plates are the stars standout for us were the Tempura green Beans, I think these were lifted from Marlowe in San Fran, they've been a staple there for over 10 years. Only problem was this sweet cream cheese dip along with them . Did not work for me.    Veal meatballs good, with  distinct  veal taste. Tahini carrots and mac and cheese. We are not really Mac & C types , theirs  was very cheddary and really filling. Tahini carrots had a fair amount of charring, but were still very much crunchy ( I think they should have been tender)  and could have used more of the tahini. Decent beer  and wine selection along with many more plates  burgers  and flat breads. Trying to steer clear of massive carb intakes is tough at a small place like this. Our server  was really super nice and helpful , but the bar was rather slow. We liked everything but overall, given what is going on in the food world, I felt this place sounded and looked better than it tasted. Just not really satisfying. I think with a group , when you are not focused on the food, it would be a better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner for two w/ a couple drinks
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fire pit patio out back  - very  chill

QyMioVjKy71TDH_wVOGcBA.text: This place was an absolute gem. Located more in the old downtown area. Environment was very laid back and chill. Food was spectacular - some of the best I had in Vegas! The bacon jam was sooo good.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IxVBk7e0uXMeqloy18HJgw.text: One of the best meals downtown. Friendly atmosphere. Hip vibes. And fabulous food. Tapas are my favorite and so easy to share. The sandwich menu is equally nice and perfectly delicious. The presentation is lovely too but the food stands out.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken skin with smoked honey.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devil&#39;s Eggs.

LWkuZBHmXCLO3KlmzmkXaQ.text: Off the Las Vegas strip but if you are willing to go to downtown area, you'll find this hidden gem. Lovely rooftop restaurant but more importantly the chef is amazing! All the food had so many details and tastes, it was an amazing experience!   We had a variety between the meatballs to the steak to bacon and fig mixture with Brie on top. So many good things! Definitely not a swanky place but if you're looking for good bites and nice service come here

xzxHLNbjmCMuau2H-JJcOA.text: Dang, what a great dinner. Came on a Friday night around 8:30, there was a small wait and we had just enough time to order drinks before we got seated at the kitchen counter. In a blink of an eye, food was already in front of us. Everything came out as the kitchen was ready, and man the kitchen works fast! Here's the dish:  -Gyro tacos: If you love gyros, you'll love this. It looks like a taco, tastes like a gyro. What's not to love. -Mac & cheese: I'm normally very picky about my mac and cheese because a lot of places bake it and then it dries out. This is dreamy, creamy, cheesy, deliciousness. -Sugar snap peas: With a harrisa cream and paprika butter, this was a little too greasy for me...like swimming in pools of grease. I liked the crunch of the snap peas, but probably my least favorite dish of the night. -Cocoa espresso strip steak: I almost never order steak unless it's a bone-in rib eye steak at a steakhouse...but we went for it and didn't regret it at all. The rub was really good and the meat was cooked to perfection. -Crispy chicken skins: So sinful, so addictingly good. The guy expediting food was really awesome and gave us a small sample of this on the side. It's very similar to chicharrones (pork rinds), with a side of honey to dip it in. It was the perfect combo of fatty + crunchy + salty + sweet.  Our cocktails were nice, I enjoyed the The Magarian. After we finished eating, we went out to the patio and enjoyed food coma-ing by the fire while finishing our last drink. Perfect on a cold desert night.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skins. Doooo ittttt!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocoa espresso NY strip steak, cooked to perfection
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dreamy creamy mac and cheese

5m-iBQefcxN4fETQp2OwSA.text: Came here twice while in Vegas! Definitely a different concept which throws you off at first, but the food is great and service is even better. Everyone that works here is friendly and has no problem answering any questions you may have about the plates! My recommendations are: the baked mac & cheese, the green beans, the mushroom flatbread is great (although a little spicy), those were my faves!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2wUbEsMJw-exqxRgkcC0EA.text: Try to come at an off time of day so you don't have to wait, even though the wait would be worth it.  Love that the menu slightly changes three times a year, you'll want to come back over and over again.  Mac and cheese is ridiculous as is the donut bread pudding.  Prices are decent, you can't expect not to pay a little more for food this good.  I'd like to see just a vegetarian sandwich but there are options for about every diet.

lhzYK44N2l3rjS9BTgrjSg.text: We headed over to this cute place on a Wednesday night. It was very busy so we had to wait with many others before us in the outside backyard. That area is very nicely set up with lots of seating. Bummer the upstairs bar was closed so we were waiting without any drinks. We decided to explore the menu (too bad lots of things I saw in Yelp were no longer available - they change their menu a lot which is great for returning customers of course!). After about 30min we were seated by the bar. The one bartender was overwhelmed with work. She apologized and we were totally understanding, she was very friendly when she served us. We ordered drinks and 4 plates. I had the pink smoking jacket with a real smokey flavor to it. Good! And my partner had the Daaammmmn Daniel but on the rocks, which was fresh and tasted like a lemonade!  Tempura green beans: Delicious but totally different when combined with the sweet pepper cream cheese. I prefer without but both work. Serious portion!   Filet ohhh fish: Very good! Comes with hush puppies and ketchup, yummie!  Rainbow cauliflower: Good but after a while you are over it. Has a spicy aftertaste and I don't like spicy food but this didn't bother me. It was good but would be great with less salt.  Wild mushroom flatbread: Yasssss  so good!!!!!! My favorite yummy    We ordered several dishes because were thinking it's tapas style but nope these are large portions and we had to take home half of it. We were full with 2 for the 2 of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pink smoking jacket : not too sweet and a real smokey flavor if you like that!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow cauliflower good but not my favorite of our dishes
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried greens very good

jyCpAXclGayw08BQPv8xiw.text: All I can say is WOW! All original dishes, very flavorful! I shared the Killer Shrimp, Gyro Tacos and Veal Meatballs. Desert was the Fudge brownie with bacon ice cream. I really enjoyed the mix of flavors. Highly recommend and look forward to sharing with out of town visitors.

IcCRT7gYT_JqpX2KFwI6Ig.text: Great spot. Excellent service from our server Manny. We tried the pickle brined fried chicken sandwiches, pork belly cubes, and bread salad. All were very good, but it was the tremendous service that particularly stood out.   Low profile spot, but great food and happened to get lucky with a great server!

YoAIOxiYVU_zGRFf-Ar5Mg.text: We hosted my birthday dinner here for a group of 20. Finding a restaurant on the strip for 20, for under $200pp was near impossible so we took our search downtown and ended up at Carson Kitchen and it was honestly one of the best meals I've had in Las Vegas, ever.  Our menu included several dishes, each one better than the last. The shrimp and flatbread were both outstanding. The oxtail risotto and salmon were fantastic. The crispy skin on the salmon makes me salivate just thinking about it. Dessert was donut bread pudding and bacon bourbon ice cream with a brownie. Both were delicious! The service was excellent and we happened to get a cooler summer night with made sitting on the private upstairs patio very pleasant. All in all a great meal with great people!

urpvSe-oRk6Fgi6QYmyfEw.text: Rare find in old downtown. How could I pass by this place so many times and not even notice it along my way to the donut shop. The food was awesome and the service was great. I need to go back to try some more dishes. Order the string beans and chicken skins. They were so good!

z6gvKIdyJVe9m8Bf61lxsQ.text: Leave your diet at the door!  Very unique, very tasty, fun food!  Here is a great place for binge night.    We started with the bacon jelly with brie.  Very tasty, rich and I could have stopped here.  BUT no, we then continued with some burnt ends, which were very tasty, great sauce, not quite smokey like I prefer,  but very good.  We got the cod, which is well caramelized with a sweet citrus flavor and a bit of heat.  Sauce was a but thicker and sweeter than I typically prefer, but as I said binge night and it was great.    I would definitely come back for the jerk, Turkey burger with tater tots. Big, juicy burger (made with applesauce) with some powerful, complex,  tasty spices.    Oh, yes, very nice salad, BLTA.  Pretty savory here with big thick chunks of bacon, avocado and romaine.    Great smaller place.  Great service.  Small plates fun for sharing.    In Old Town if you feel the need for a fun place, great atmosphere, fun and decadent food.  Get off the strip and explore Vegas.  I did roll out of there, a bit overstuffed but very happy.  I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jelly, but ends...nice light way to start off a decadent, fun,  casual dinner

6U4oopgPF-JlhG5IMTIktg.text: If you enjoy looking out large windows and observing the plight of some of Las Vegas's poorest while dining on 2 ounces of pork belly which you just paid $14 for, then this place is for you.  This place tries so hard to defy stereotypes and be completely different that it has legitimately become a stereotype.  From its "come as you are" dressed wait staff to the Edison bulbs and non-gender conforming bathroom sign, this place is as typical a hipster-foodie joint that you will ever find. I was surprised there wasn't live music performed by a local kazoo orchestra.  From, the moment we were seated our experience was on a downhill trajectory.  You see, everyone here must sit on stools and not the comfortable bar stools you might expect with a cushion, backrest or other body-conforming surface, oh no, these are small, hard, flat stools, typical of what you might find in a prison only not bolted to the floor.  The place is small, so I guess I can understand that these are space saving but I think the real purpose is to make people uncomfortable enough that they do not stay long and clear out to make room for the next party.  Larger customers, and folks with back problems beware.  Our plain-clothes waiter told us the menu items were designed for sharing so we ordered accordingly, my selection was two orders of the gyro tacos (so all six of us could try one) and an order of the pork belly.  The rest of the party ordered the mac & cheese, pork tenderloin, spicy shrimp, crab fondue, goat goulash and the Thai eggplant.  It seems like a lot of plates on the table, but the food comes out as its prepared which is great so its always piping hot and doesn't clutter the table and the staff was great about clearing empty plates.  Once the food arrived it became clear that I would be leaving hungry.  The tapas style works best when everyone at the table has similar food tastes but that wasn't really the case with our group.  Personally, I do not like seafood, so I avoided the crab and shrimp.  Another is not big on Thai or Asian flavors in general so no eggplant.  Still others were not keen on eating goat meat, and so you can kind of see how this might work better for the more open minded and non-picky eaters.  Not the fault of the restaurant but something to be aware of when coming here, but I digress.  I am just going to say it: the portions here are tiny.  Some might call this "shareable" portions or "light eating" but these are just euphemisms for tiny.  The gyro tacos I ordered were each about two bites worth of food.  I would consider a "street taco" size small for a taco and these were maybe half the size of one of those.  The mini flat-bread contained only a small amount of ground lamb so the mound of feta cheese was pretty much the dominant taste.  After finishing my two bites I decided I would have rather had either an actual gyro or taco.  When my wife and I arrived, we parked in a pay-to-park lot.  As far as I know there is no parking around that you do not have to pay for, so we paid $4 for two hours in a spot and walked half a block to the restaurant.  Despite the many improvements made to downtown it was impossible not to pass some of the homeless trying to sleep on the streets on this cold night.  Once in the restaurant we were seated by the front wall of window which meant we could see these folks occasionally shuffling by as we dined.  I am explaining this, so you understand how I felt when the pork belly arrived at the table containing four squares of meat, each about the size of a postage stamp.  The guilt of eating this expensive and pretentious meal was beginning to weigh heavier in my stomach than the food.  I understand spending extra money for a special occasion and high-quality food, but just because the food is high quality doesn't mean it's delicious and just because a restaurant can provide a dining experience doesn't mean that it's a good one.  The food at Carson Kitchen is high quality and a few things were delicious but ultimately, we left a lot of food on the plates (which is saying a lot considering the portions size). The bottom line is this, there are lots of places here in town where you can try interesting and delicious food that doesn't come with the guilt of paying a $200 bill and still leaving hungry.  Carson Kitchen tries hard to do what it does, but it just feels so ridiculous that I cannot take it seriously. When the bill arrived, it did not come in a typical bill holder but was instead bookmarked into an old library book with handwritten notes of past customers all over the pages.  I imagined the walls of the bathroom stalls probably looked something similar.  Hipster level 9 for sure. Two stars because the pork tenderloin was fantastic.

8kajUUcN00C-QazGdl3ZPQ.text: Carson Kitchen was great and I can't wait to come back and order more off of this menu. We had the Gyro Tacos, Butter Burger and the bread pudding. I really liked the tacos but the Butter Burger stole the show. The meat was so tender and juicy but still tasted very lean and so fresh. The menu is really random but I dig it. I feel like they don't want to describe anything in detail and I couldn't even tell if there was a salad on the menu. Overall, the food and service was great and it's an awesome spot for hangover food. I especially like the open kitchen concept and even though it wasn't my first choice of seating it was refreshing to sit at the counter. The ambiance is dim and chill and it was pretty slow for a Sunday lunch. We are a couple of locals who had heard about this place since it had opened and we are so grateful we thought about going here for lunch. That's a lie, we wanted to go to Donut Bar but it was closed and I think everything happens for a reason so we stumbled in here and it was delightful and delicious.

AABhH5YhNYYKoonNGKOWAw.text: Ok I totally swore on my bite of the secret Sunday Chicken Sand. DAMN this is so good. The best chicken I've ever had. And the spicy tots- whoa!  Almost walked past as the place is incognito.   Definitely coming back. Have to eat more of their food!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jdk1awD7pcz1MJu1IodnYQ.text: Had high expectations given the 4.5 star yelp rating @1200+ reviews.  Gastropubbish hipster place with a menu to match (oxtail risotto, chicken skins, etc).   Coolest thing about the restaurant is the resto itself and the location its in. Great bar!  The neighborhood is in a revamped area of old town Vegas and the building itself is a renovated hotel where other businesses share office space. They string up lights outside in the patio with a nice little fire pit.   BUTTER BURGER - $14 (2.4/5) - The handful of tater tots were good. Ordered the burger medium rare and it came out tough, chewy, more like a well kneaded meatloaf burger. Not really buttery or juicy, on the smaller side. Should rename it the MEH-tloaf burger. Didn't think there was alot of value or anything special about it. (https:)//www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=L5NCn3p4iXUse1eg9NHkHA&userid=pDfL8xt8F8ls0-kQIG_ADg  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing?

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Next door to the donut spot
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dope patio

KEKpbm5j0gk_VPrY4XWJ4g.text: Holy crap. This is so tasty. Amazing food. Great portions and super flavorful. We're visiting from CA and had to stop here for some good quality grub. +1 for the meatloaf

ImzJteU5ptDpR7_Inw0nag.text: Carson kitchen is an amazing little spot downtown. It is difficult to find and seemed a little bit off path, but DEFINITELY worth it. The food was AMAZING the service was AMAZING. It was probably the best meal and the best service we received all weekend. The fried chicken sandwich made all my fried chicken dreams come True. My brother had the burger and he said it was one of the best burgers he's ever had.  The vibe of this place is really cool and fun. We were a little worried that walking in without a reservation with a party of 9 that there was no way we'd be seated, but they had a table for us and we were able to be sat right away.   We will definitely be back!

P38ROHomiC8UInYsIhSZxg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.   Great food and yeah unpretentious, perhaps it's the only one of its kind in all of Vegas?     The devilled eggs with caviar and bacon were wonderful, the black rice and oxtail risotto was full of flavor and pefectly cooked, and the jerk turkey burger with mango slaw also excellent.    The artichoke appetizer was a disappointment.  It was grilled, and yet oily, with very little meat in the leaves and a tiny heart.    Finally, step up your beer game and add a Belgian ale or two for a 5 star win.   The prices are actually amazingly low considering its in Vegas although on an outing the way street near Fremont st.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu tonight.

osbUM45NpLBq0MWvr1c1kQ.text: Just so you know, the dishes are a la cart and not huge portions (except the sandwiches) because you're meant to order different dishes so everyone can share. With that said...the food is excellent. Tastes very fresh and it's different. We had the Mmm Ribs (which is a sandwich), jerk turkey, NY strip, & Black Rice Oxtail Risotto. My kids loves the rib sandwich and my husband and I loved the turkey burger and risotto.   But that's not the highlight. The dessert is with making the trip!!! The bourbon brownie is AMAZING. I can eat the ice cream all by itself. I do NOT like bread pudding but I tasted my husband's donut bread pudding and I can say that is the ONLY bread pudding I'd willingly eat.   The service is excellent from the hostess to the server. Roman, our server, was excellent. He explained everything without prompting and constantly made sure we were taken care of. We'd definitely come back we're in the area again.

hZMzd2PXhVL2vpV2MeaRWQ.text: The food overall  was very good. The gyro tacos and the risotto was fantastic. The plum salad and grilled radish was great. The butter burger was dry disappointing, cheese was not melted and boursion was just a dab. They over cooked the strip steak. But the get shorty cocktail was good overall a good experience. Will go back again

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snap peas very tasty
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rossetto was excellent
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Radish dish really good

57-m6DhmHMgi-mXarK9ksA.text: Great food service was fast for my lunch I ate at the bar the server was very friendly and recommended a great beer . I got the fry chicken skin with honey and the pork belly bite .

41I9f2BFaOlYASrflkWjiw.text: Hopefully this restaurant never changes, because we love it just the way it is!  The deviled eggs have been on point every time we've ordered them (6-7 times now). That's perfect repetitive culinary execution.  The beet salad is simple yet awesome. A little beets, a little mandarin, a little pistachio goat cheese, some honey, makes me think dirty thoughts with my woman. Yes the food is that good that I get in a zone of food turns sex.  The salmon is surprisingly delicious as well. The spinach pesto spread is on point served with the salmon. The charred lemon squeezed over the salmon takes it over the top, and the spices on the salmon skin is on point yet again. Terrific. Good tasting seafood in Vegas is hard to come by but not at Carson.  I've had a few other items on the menu. But it's so hard to deviate away from the Deviled Eggs, Beet Salad, and Salmon every time I go to Carson Kitchen.  The only suggestion I'd like to make, is perhaps adding signature/special/seasonal/secret menu items each month/few weeks for your repeat customers who may want to trust your culinary imagination and ideas and have something new to look forward to or be surprised with. And that's just a suggestion. You are all awesome. Love the open kitchen.  Keep it up Carson Kitchen! It's not easy getting a 5 star review from me. But you deserve 5 stars so far! Just Don't get lazy, don't let it go to your head, and we will keep coming in every 2-3 weeks like clockwork!   Stay different stay delicious!

r8EYwB-O7PKAUv9L6pki2w.text: Carson Kitchen is one of the most important things to happen in downtown Las Vegas in years.  The chef and menu are incredible, giving you the opportunity to have a True culinary experience based on fresh ingredients and bold flavors in a comfortable atmosphere away from the over-stimulation of The Strip.  Stop in any night and you will find a great mix of locals, foodies, hipsters, and adventurous tourists that know this place is worth the Uber!  A definite don't miss!

cgs5E25zctNtKTHE1sBojw.text: A dozen of us were in town for meetings and one of the women arranged dinner here for us. We had a set menu and everything was wonderful. Killer shrimp, beets (I despise beets, but they were yummy), rainbow cauliflower, oxtail risotto. It was all fabulous including the bread pudding dessert. We'll be in town in a year, and I'm looking forward to returning!

C4uGCABrtmFrvRAtaHtgoA.text: Small, but quaint and hip.  Definitely has a downtown NYC vibe.  Great sharing dishes.  The crispy chicken skin and deviled eggs were amazing.  Mac and cheese had chunks of cheese and the short rib grilled cheeses was delish. definitively try this place for good food and atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious honey  dipping sauce
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs with caviar, bacon and chervil. Amazing!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken skins! Yummy!

x5nheMR918BKHg8URL3c9w.text: Imagine it this way if you would. You just arrived home from a vacation to Las Vegas.  People and friends will ask how were the shows, how was the hotel you stayed at. Your asked if you did any sight seeing? What do you tell people about the food you had.  It's not everyday you can say you had Turducken Pot Pie, or a Wild Boar Sloppy Joe.  Carson Kitchen, a place I have seen many times on lists that name the best places to eat in Las Vegas. Therefore it was on my person top ten lists of places to try here in Las Vegas.  Service was awesome. We arrived 5-10 prior to opening at 11:30 on a Thursday morning. We were invited to sit in the patio area on the other side of the restaraunt. The atmosphere there was delightful!  Once seated, we were handed menus, and out waitress was awesome about going over the menu.I must say, of all places in Vegas that I have eaten, this one has the most intriguing menu.   My wife opted for the Wild Boar Sloppy Joe served with tator tots. That was my original choice, but since the wife picked it I went with the Turducken Pot Pie. We also decided to share an order of the Bacon Jam.  We took bites from each others meals, which is something we never do. But then again when is the last time we had either Wild Boar Sloppy Joes or Turducken Pot Pies? N-E-V-E-R!   Bottom line everything was delicious. As we left, I asked my wife how she liked everything? She replied "It was great, but how do you find these places??"  My reply was simply... "Yelp."

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most intriguing menu ever.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio seating while waiting for a table.

RNc7emjpqqqAiFO2UTXzKg.text: Everything here is great... From the super hip interior design to the very attentive servers.   We came with a larger group & ordered all of the great things which were recommended in various Yelp reviews.   The bottom line.... Great taste in every dish. Our whole group was amazed & delighted by the interesting menu, tastes & the whole experience.   Loved it!

lTQNK9CsNEegQAoi0o56CA.text: I LOVE CARSON KITCHEN! I feel anyone who enjoys delicious comfort food will enjoy coming here. However, the place is usually always packed. I recommend trying to make reservations, but they often don't take them. They will take your name down, but there are no guarantees over the phone. The place is also not the big so there is limited seating. You may have to sit at the bar if there are not any tables open. During the summers, you can enjoy the food and a drinks outside.   Service: Although the restaurant is busy, the service is still great. They try their hardest to be attentive to everyone.   Ambiance: Great place for you to hangout with friends and family! Come in to grab a quick bite to eat and then walk out to explore Downtown. You are pretty close to the nightclubs and bars. It is a bit loud, so be prepared to yell a bit as you talk to your peers.   Food: We can here mainly to grab a drink, but we did get two appetizers: The Crispy Chicken Skins w/ Smoked Honey and the "Devil's Eggs". Both were great. The Chicken skins is probably the best I have ever had and goes well with the honey. It is agreat sweet/salty combination. The Devil's eggs were also delicious as well.   Drinks: I got the moscow mule. It was made perfectly and served in the ideal copper cups. It was mixed well so it was very tasty. I would recommend getting the mule here.   Price: I would say it is decently priced with many of the menu items are tapas size. I would bring at least $40 bucks to cover food/drinks.   Have fun and enjoy yourself at Carson Kitchen's this weekend. :-D

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devils Egg
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken skins with smoke Honey

iozlhxx-CZsIZgW2X9SXGQ.text: The food was very interesting. Never would have found out about this place without my cousin.  Pros- *Interesting foods and drinks *Good customer service  *Food was out fast  Cons- *Almost got the wrong order *Very loud   Other than almost getting the wrong dish, the food was good. I appreciate the good customer service. You can have the best food, but if you have bad customer service your done for. In addition to customer service, servers will address that the dishes are small and are best eaten family style. Beware, the restaurant is packed sometimes. The food is definitely worth the wait. Though the food portion looks small, it will appease your stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VsCpcVH16zM4WRVm6-Ib9g.text: always great food.  Had the bacon jam, pork chop,  risotto, mushroom flatbread and of course the donut bread pudding.  Everything was excellent.   The place never disappoints.  Highly recommended.

u00UDBtLpF9pw6TFd_-_kQ.text: I've been coming to Las Vegas for years but I've always just stayed on the strip. I wanted a reason to go outside of the strip and experience something a little different. I found Carson Kitchen on yelp and decided this is where is that adventure should start. I wasn't disappointed! It was a really awesome vibe with awesome people and totally different then the big overproduced restaurants on the Las Vegas strip. If you're looking for good food, unique atmosphere and otherwise fun experience Carson Kitchen is a great place to try!

b3FtupHIMpgDqy39WpiP5g.text: Delicious food. Fast service!  A friend and I went on a Saturday night around 5. I was surprised that there was no wait - but it was Halloween, so who knows?   We told the server that we were in a bit of a hurry, as he had to be back at work at 7. I was amazed by how quickly our food came out - and it was all delicious.   There was nothing particularly novel on the menu, but it was all reasonably priced and well done.   I will definitely be back.

pBWDCi-Vibih8INX-UIr_Q.text: I've been to Carson Kitchen three times now, and despite the fact that my first visit would have been five-star worthy, it's been even better each return visit.   I know it's on practically every review here, but if you stop reading this review after this paragraph... get the bacon jam. Seriously. Bacon jam. Bacon jam. Bacon jam. I was hoping it'd appear in front of me.  On our last visit, we had the opportunity to sit at the seats right in front of the kitchen. I was initially a bit apprehensive about being next to the hustle and bustle, but wow. It was a totally unique experience, chatting with the staff about the dishes and watching the synchronicity of a well-managed kitchen. On top of the bacon jam, we had the cauliflower appetizer as well, both of which were delicious (but if you have to choose between these two, get the bacon jam, seriously). For my main course I got the fried chicken sandwich, which was prepared just right. Plus, the tots - delicious!   We'll definitely be back for a fourth visit.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining next to the kitchen, thought it might be loud/busy but turned out to be a great experience
