3b5Exa7W_QH_5k5boC1Pdg.text: Delicious food at a reasonable price. The spicy Tator tots are amazing! The dining area is small, but not stuffy or crowded. The kitchen is open so we also got to enjoy watching the food as it was prepared. Only disappointing thing was that their patio was not open when we visited, despite the beautiful weather.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Turkey

F1AohBFh5ULVCwte2a2oBw.text: The food was good. The chicken skins were crazy overpriced for literal trash food. The bartender was kind of a tool. The prices are pretty high and everyone seems like they're trying a bit too hard for what they serve.  I will say it was one of the best turkey burgers I've ever had.

HxmJhR0HGvyr0uPNwIyV8g.text: As other Yelpers have said the place isntbthat east to find. Once inside you will find a pretty small restaurant  (seating 40-50) with bar seating where you can watch the chefs and cooks do their thing.  We ordered a salad at $13 And a flatbread at  $13. Both were excellent. For the salad however there were no exotic ingredients (pear, goat cheese) but at several bites each I have to question the value. The flatbread on the other hand was a good value.

KVRVLeAGqSdqLEnEXozcWQ.text: So not Las Vegas, but in a good way ! Delicious sophisticated sharing plates, tapas style, so many rich flavors very hard to find in the US kitchen , it felt like our small miracle! We had the beet salad ( small and gentle), colorful cauliflower (strong and biting), grilled artichokes (best we ever had! Excellent marinade !), portobello flat bread (fabulous) and Ox tail risotto (sooo rich), brownie fudge butter bacon ice cream. If only they've had an espresso... Fun music and atmosphere, very friendly service, highly recommended, we'll surely come back !

010zkYI1tauI1mcXRzpbag.text: Tara did an awesome job behind the bar! Met cool people, ate great food, perfect night!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!!! Tara did an awesome job behind the bar!

azmAQiev2vH-2OHcL_u_EQ.text: Got takeout from here yesterday and it was ok. The host was great - she was very nice and helpful when I came in and asked to place a to go order and helped me make a decision. She recommended that I get an appetizer and an entree and that it would be enough for me. I didn't realize it was because the entree was a super small portion.  I got the gyro tacos and the black rice & oxtail risotto. The gyro tacos were delicious and I'd definitely get again. The oxtail risotto I was really excited for, but was a little disappointed with it because it was a little bland for me.  The restaurant looks really nice inside and the employees all seem friendly and nice. I'd definitely go again and dine in. I was just disappointed by the small portion and the oxtail risotto ):

HfDk2MZNco160vrcMyKzwg.text: Cute little place.  I'd heard a lot about the bacon jam with Brie.  It was great but very rich.  2 of us could only eat half of it.  Good for 4 people to share, unless you just really love bacon!  Deviled eggs with pancetta and caviar were a perfect little bite.  Recommend the Gyro tacos which had a little spicy kick.  Glazed donut bread pudding with vanilla & rum sauce was excellent.  Most portions were meant to be shared which made it fun to try several items.  Very reasonably priced as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect deviled eggs
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos had a little spicy kick
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b4-Xj0-rta3sdMnwOu8sQQ.text: Bacon jam is on point! perfect blend of salty and sweet. Could use a few more toasted bread pieces. The bake brea on the bacon jam makes the dish quiet heavy.   The burnt tips were really good the first time I went. But can't say the same the 2nd time. The 2nd time was actually burnt burnt. Way too hard.   The steak was good - couldn't taste any espresso flavor. But it was definitely too salty.   The beet and goat cheese dish was subpar. Not enough balsamic.  The turkey burger was huge! but the chutney was pretty tasty. Didn't taste any jerk flavor though.   The tacos were so good the first time! gyro meat cooked perfectly. The shell was warm and soft. 2nd time around - the shell was STALE AND NASTY and not enough sauce.   The risotto was good but WAY TOOOOOO SALTY.    Overall, based on my 1st experience I rate it a 5 star. And based on my 2nd experience - I give it 2 star. So about aver is 3.5 stars.

RjH6Pmp4f7CcMOeNe1NLZA.text: Great food! The starters are amazing and fantastic drinks. Must eat place in Vegas if you want to get away from the strip.

QGIwPtSzexgkH5ppR9Lr1w.text: Wow where do I begin!? Decided to visit this place before hitting up Fremont street. First of all the service is top notch. The food was outstanding. We got the Mac and cheese; green beans, chicken skins, and the gyro tacos. Every single item was cooked perfectly and was very tasty! Would definitely return the next time I am in Vegas!

FIBOdTSXT6Fk7GCwQSwoXA.text: We stopped by on an early Sunday evening for dinner. It was busy, but they were able to seat us right away at one of the community counters/tables. Space is at a premium in their close-packed space, so expect communal seating to be a more likely fate than a private table.  The dish portions and pricing seem to indicate they're more the "we're not here to engorge you, we're here to delight you with good tasting food" kind of place.   We ordered the "Devil's" Eggs, Roasted Young Beets, Rabbit Ragu and Duck Confit Flatbread. The "Devil's" Eggs were ridiculously delicious. The Roasted Young Beets with goat cheese and orange slices was interesting and good. The Rabbit Ragu wasn't so great. Although alright, I couldn't taste any rabbit flavor over the spiciness of the sauce. And the duck in the Duck Confit Flatbread was tasty.  The service is top-notch, but also a bit pandering with their, "You've made some excellent choices." I'd like to think that if I ordered ANYTHING from their menu it would be an excellent choice. But I really appreciated the effort.  If you're looking for a bit of a culinary adventure in a very social eating space, then you'll likely enjoy an experience at Carson Kitchen.

ZbzXIi-k06T5oqucNkkGFg.text: Hands down THE BEST Gastropub we have ever been to. And we have been to tons. My husband got the steak and Mac n Cheese and we were so so impressed! Both are just mouth watering. We also got the gyro tacos and the glazed donut bread pudding and both were insanely good. We have zero complaints and just couldn't stop talking about how delicious everything was. Winner after winner! We will absolutely be coming back. Such a hidden gem! But seriously, it's right next to Donut Bar. You'll think you missed it or something but it's right there!!

wktfoCqlsCwzEUMpj5Nu9w.text: This place has such a great vibe and  decorated beautifully. There's communal style dining and separate tables with and open kitchen. I love the touch of a "Swear Jar" on the kitchen counter. I've also heard that the rooftop patio is open but didn't go up there because it was 100 degrees outside.   Tara was our server and she was attentive and funny. She even made the cocktails we ordered behind the bar, talk about a girl that can multitask!   Crispy Chicken skins - this dish is amazing for people that love fried food. It's not greasy or oily and is seasoned perfectly. It comes with a side of honey to dip it in.  Perfect mix of salty and sweet.   Black rice and Oxtail risotto - my favorite risotto I've eaten. The first bite made my jaw drop because I enjoyed it so much, especially the parmesan cream it was in. I can't explain all the flavors in it but it's a dish I would get every visit here.   Veal Meatballs - sherry Foie Gras cream and peas. The sauce was very light and added the perfect touch to the meatballs.   Chicken thighs - the citrus chimichurri sauce made so savory with the juicy chicken.   As for cocktails, we tried Drink With The Ms. (pig's nose whiskey, amaro del sole, grapefruit juice, fresh lime, maple syrup, crabbie's ginger beer) and The Margarian (aviation gin, thyme & honey syrup, fresh lemon, mr. q cumber soda). Both were extremely refreshing on a scorching summer day in Vegas.   I'm already looking at the menu to decide what to eat in my next visit. Can't wait! And yes, this place is that good!!!  FYI: the restaurant is located in the newly refurbished John E. Carson Hotel. We had a tough time finding it at first because we entered through the Bikram Yoga door. It fastest to just walk around the building on the outside and stay on Carson.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken skins
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal meatballs
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black rice and oxtail risotto

Ggsse3HIVobpwkRX7DlDlw.text: Amazing food and overall ambience! The staff was delightful and really went above and beyond. Watched the kitchen staff deliver amazing dishes throughout the night perfectly, the aroma from the kitchen is a meal in itself!!!  And outside there is seating around a fire pit along with an upstairs outdoor bar with seating. Love this place! A must try!

e8kQOtG-aZYDkdAIaPUuNg.text: I've probably been to Carson Kitchen a dozen times in the past couple years and I have to say it's one of my favorite restaurants nationwide.  I always take coworkers here when in Vegas and it's one of those rare places that Everyone loves.  Menu changes from time to time, but everything is wonderful.  I usually go for the beet salad and then any meet entree.  Gyro pitas are always great, and they make an exceptionally good chicken sandwich.  Drinks are good too.  Cucumber gin n tonic is a good hot weather choice.  If you're staying at the other end of the strip, it's about a $12 Uber ride.  Well worth it.

fIgXISfhJmLgWFUsccPCEg.text: Saw the recent reviews for this place, and we just had to check this place out. Located right in heart of the revamped DTLV, behind the eclectic famous "Fremont street", Carson Kitchen is hidden with no large sign, the food speaks for itself.    As we walked in we were greeted quickly by the hostess. Very nice, sleek, tiny restaurant with a cute small bar, open concept with views to the kitchen.  The food: small menu, small portions tapa style maybe?  We got the... Tempura Green Beans: good flavor not overly battered comes with a pepper cream cheese dip. This was good.   Beef Wellington Empanadas: 2 in a order, not bad flaky crust comes with a sherry sauce? Idk but this was nice.   Crispy Chicken Skins: comes with honey dipping sauce. Think of fried pork skins.. Super crispy, this would go excellent with a nice cold beer. Good flavor, a bit on the salty side. I feel like this didn't need the seasoning really.   Caribbean Jerk Turkey Burger: eh I didn't like this. Maybe the fact that I don't really care for cole slaw, which by the way was the only thing in it. Burger became soggy. It had a pumpkin spice kinda flavor and it was kinda sweet ehh..    I liked when each item came to our table the server described what it came with. The food came out in good timing. We were there for probably just 45 mins.  The service was good she checked on us a few times. This place would be great after a night of drinking and you want something good, and savory! But they close early in Vegas standards at 11pm.   I will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of The kitchen
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool bathroom! Looks like you&#39;re in a fridge
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caribbean jerk turkey burger; no wonder I didn&#39;t really see this on yelp.. Not the best but the taters were good.

DUOTCNeTOB_TPYkNWxSx_w.text: I was hesitant to try Carson Kitchen after I had tasted the less than impressive desserts from Simon Kitchen and Bar at the Epicurean Affair.   I arrived at 5:45 and there was a 30 min wait for a table so we decided to have dinner at the bar. We were greeted by an Irish bartender with a large personality. I ordered the Mac & cheese, jerk turkey burger, and glazed donut bread pudding. The Mac & cheese was the best macaroni I have had in a very long time. The noodles were still al dente even though they were sitting in a creamy sauce and baked in the oven. Flavor was bold and I enjoyed the bread crumbs on the top, however they were only on half of the dish. When I tasted the burger all I could taste was the potent star anise spice. Burger had potential but the spice ratios need to be toned down. I barely touched the side of tater tots because they were too greasy. I thought the dessert was decadent and very moist for a bread pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked mac &amp; cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glazed donut bread pudding
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk turkey burger

DVn2mSaCDN3hH6o7C-eNug.text: Food is excellent, service is excellent, ambience is nice, only thing holding back to 4 star is space. I thought it was a little cramped inside. I personally do not like to share tables with ppl I don't know. Idk, maybe I'm mean and don't know it. The Butter Burger was so good, along w the Mac n Cheese, which was more creamy than gooey cheese. I personally like more gooey/melty cheese. And the Fried Chicken Skins were awesome. I know it may sound like a turn off to most but they are crunchy and flavorful. Give them a try you won't be disappointed. The outside of the restaurant has windows that are grayed out so we almost thought it was closed down for a second. Our Uber driver drove right past it, so you have to look right next to the donut shop.

6neH2WkPswto5reQRbCNKg.text: Happy to say the food here (at least what we had) was fantastic. We ordered the jerk turkey burger and wild mushroom flatbread. We were pleasantly surprised with the flavoring in both options. The jerk turkey burger was slightly sweet and spicy, simply bursting with flavor. It was also a big enough burger to split between two people. The flat bread while looking kind of skimpy on the toppings was also full of flavor. It was cheesy, gooey, and had a slight crunch. Since we were seated at the bar, the bartender explained the menu to us and told us most of their menu items are smaller sizes but I truly felt like the portions were standard.   The minute one star comes from the fact that this place is SUPER loud.

CggvLGuPnoGzEa_zzkkrBw.text: Let Yelpers be my guide....knowing nothing about Carson Kitchen I though I would give it a try.  Yelpers recommend the Crispy Chicken Skins, the Bacon Jam Baked Brie Baguette and the Wild Mushroom Flatbread .....what should I order...... not able to decide made me order them ALL.... I was not disappointed.  They were delicious with amazing taste.  A great little place you have to visit while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild Mushroom Flatbread
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam Baked Brie Baguette
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Skins

Nw9G6OdaZwppGoEPVZ1hLg.text: I have to commend the chef, one of the rare places where I did not need to season my food. The Bacon jam was just perfect to start, fried green beans and crispy chicken skins were another great choice for the group to share. I ordered the fried green tomato burger, enjoyed it not too sure about the tartar sauce, however, I enjoyed it.  The desert, bread pudding and icream (with bacon) was heavenly. Am really impressed with this place.  Loving how downtown Las Vegas is getting great eatery places. Look forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Green Beans and Crispy Chicken skins! Delicious!

_pq_pcaf14O0DyzkLiGaEQ.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. The food was ridiculously great, good variety, flavor, taste, presentation, also the drinks are solid as well.  Definitely wasn't expecting this to be as great as it was. I would suggest this to anyone who is looking for a great meal and good vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside dining.

IiFTRYq7L9vKfRNp6AS9vw.text: Visited on 7/22/2014  Food: Ordered the Bacon Jam, Tempura Green Beans, Veal Meatballs, and the Bourbon Fudge Brownie. My son loved the tempura green beans. They were pretty delicious, especially the cream cheese it comes with. The veal meatballs were also very good. The bacon jam...unbelievable. I'll just leave it at that. Bourbon fudge brownie was a nice finish to a wonderful meal.  Service: Our waitress was very very attentive. Almost to the point were she seemed like she was rushing us...She still did an excellent job, however. My only problem with the service was actually at the very beginning of the meal. The hostess seemed visibly annoyed when I asked simply if they had a high chair for my son. which they did not.  Decor: The place is very stylish, with twisted metal and views of the street. The place was clean and orderly, although a bit small.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Meatballs
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bourbon Fudge Brownie

NvezBAsOCOjj8W-cVBfGWw.text: So glad I did my homework and knew to look for this small place.  It reminds me of a hipster joint in Logan Square (Chicago) but do NOT let that deter you! I was pleasantly surprised in the yummy and healthy options. (I ordered falafel sliders). When we got home from our vacation, my husband kept talking about the chicken skins he ordered and how much he wanted them.  I had tasted one.  Even the BREADING was damn good.

AsCNZr3WGBeODGR4PaGv3A.text: An exceptional meal....  We took in a late lunch/early dinner or as Janeane Garofalo said it best, "Lupper or Linner"  At 3pm the restaurant was completely vacant on a Thursday  We had the opportunity to meet the staff and crew on a more intimate level.  They had just come off of introducing new items to their menu and Brandon and Lina were very gracious   Our picks to share for two included: the deviled eggs, veal meatballs, BLTA salad, black rice risotto with oxtail, wild mushroom flatbread, tomato bisque and the donut bread pudding for dessert  Great attention to details in each dish for flavors and presentation  It was a joy to have the staff's attention as we can imagine the chaos the line endures at peak times  Highly recommend Carson to everyone who wants honest food lacking any pretense

l7QrPCverSpcKrdADezV5w.text: Get the: Bacon jam baked brie baguette Spicy tater tots Truffle mac n cheese Steelhead trout

YaRd6_PaMz88ZdYbjZ_JXg.text: We tried this while on vacation and really enjoyed it. We were gluttons and ordered way too much food (4 dishes for 2 people) and didn't finish everything, but the prices were reasonable and we couldn't narrow it down! We had seats at a bar overlooking the kitchen and really enjoyed watching all the food being made.   The awesome - bacon jam and veal meatballs. OMG. Get them both, please! The meatballs weren't attractive, but they tasted really great and were in the  most delicious foie gras sherry sauce.. I really wanted to lick the plate!   Eh - Chicken skins were too spicy for us to really enjoy and honestly ate like pork rinds. I was expecting more and wasn't overly impressed. Basically think pork rinds in a basic spicy salt blend. Meh. The chili cheese dog flat bread was just OK as well. Not enough sour cream, chili was overly spicy and hot dogs weren't special. I like the idea of a chili cheese dog pizza but it wasn't as yummy as I was hoping.   WTF - $3.50 coke served in an 8 ounce glass bottle. The same ones used at the high end restaurants on the strip. Who the hell wants 8 ounces of soda? I'm not surprised high end restaurants on the strip pull this but I was annoyed by this crap at an off the strip joint. I expected at least a 12 ounce glass bottle for that price.   Overall really great and worth checking out! This is the best Kerry Simon restaurant I've tried!

HkQr_et7cbUIR2kymrzYtg.text: This review is for the Black Rice Oxtail Risotto. Gremolata was served on top of the risotto. This was not mentioned on the menu description, and it should be as it was fantastic. On my initial bite, I honestly didn't know what to make of it. However, the more I ate and (as a fellow patron encouraged) mixed the gremolata with the rice I really enjoyed it! It's not quite as creamy as a typical risotto as black rice does not cook as glutinous as other rice varieties. It is very flavorful and rich and the gremolata really cuts into the dish and adds another dimension in flavor. The reason I'm docking a star is because my plate did not have very much oxtail. This is a pet peeve of mine and it's happened twice with oxtail being mentioned as a main ingredient to a dish. If it's part of the description, it should be showcased generously. I would definitely come again for this dish and it's one that I will be thinking about for awhile.  Service was friendly and large communal seating around the bar was interesting. Decor was very tasteful and thoughtful considering the tight space.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Rice Oxtail Risotto - Delicious! Very interesting and thoughtful dish.

PL0MiZR6gziZFepmfXf7Ig.text: This place was a pleasant surprise for me in contrast to most restaurants I have encountered downtown.  I came here last night to meet up with my cousin, his son, and his girlfriend.  The food is tapas style and the decor is kitch contemporary.  It reminded me of a little place in Ballard Seattle called Bastille. I give one star for service, which was very friendly and expedient. One star for food and presentation.  The dishes were very unique in style and great for sharing. One star for pricing, as the food was adequate in amount for the quality you are receiving. I give the last star for atmosphere. I would have loved to try the outdoor seating but you have to be 21 for that. It was still lovely indoors as well. It was just chilly and a little loud inside for conversation. All in all, I would come back here again. It's a memorable place.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My cousin and me enjoying the food and company.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine berry shortcake with lavender whipped cream; very light in sweetness and dense in the crumbs. My favorite!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam. My cousin&#39;s girlfriends favorite.  It has hints of a light barbecue flavor to me.

UfXGYmSfkybUDLZ1elqkLA.text: Started with the deviled eggs which were perfect!  And served on a melted wine bottle platter you can get in container park. I had spaghetti squash with duck it was perfect just enough spice! My friend had the grilled cheese and spicy totes mmmmmm those tots !   LETS TALK DESSERT! I had the bread pudding and was in heaven :)) the chef told us it was made with doughnuts from next door at O Face doughnuts love that!  Loved the downtown vibe here cant wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding!  Made with doughnuts from next door at O Face doughnuts!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs!! Apparently you can get these cool melted wine bottle platter in container park :)
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese and tots!

G5Aymkil6ao6B2dxyUZfmQ.text: We happened upon this local restaurant and we were so thankful we did. We were seated at the Chef's table and watched preparation of many beautiful and interesting dishes. Our server was fantastic as we asked for recommendations. We were not disappointed. After a week long trip to Arizona and Nevada we had tried several highly rated establishments. This one gets top billing! Try the Bacon Jam! Try it all! Wishing now we'd have Uber'd back for dinner!

VRiOAxYoJVCSOYq1cfGrNA.text: Food was very tasty and for the most part seasoned well. The devil eggs were very interesting topped with caviar however salt and pepper was needed because it tasted  bland. The jerk turkey burger was very well seasoned coupled with the tater tots I would give that meal an A+!

MKDRlI4L0Ll0I0eGZYdSLQ.text: Deep fried chicken skin and bacon jam was our favorite. Services was excellent. I was pleased with all the desserts. The bread pudding was like a perfect donut on the top dipped in Carmel delight. I didn't care about the calories of the meal, worth the sacrifice!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs with bacon, chives and truffle

auIZ-f7xj391rslRcvBs7w.text: Loved this little gem of a spot!!   We stopped by to grab a bite after the Sunday matinee showing of Book of Mormon at the Smith Center.  Bacon jam...amazing!! Crispy Chicken Skins...salty slices of heaven which are served with a smoked honey for dipping. (These are MUST try items!!!!)  We also had the short rib sliders, the beet salad and the Devil's Eggs (4 deviled egg halves with crispy pancetta and caviar on top....OMG!!)  Plus I tried two delicious cocktails   Brewer's Fix: Hop head vodka, apricot preserves, fresh lemon, simple syrup, prosecco   The Magarian: Aviation gin, thyme & honey syrup, fresh lemon, mr. q cumber soda  Not easy to find....the door is actually ON Carson Street not on 6th.   This place is tiny, so I'm quite sure that if you go on a busy weekend during prime noshing hours, you'll have to wait. I will tell you, it is WORTH the wait!!  Next time I'm trying the Butter Burger and the Mac & Cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Kerry Simon has created a new gem!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devil&#39;s Eggs (crispy pancetta and caviar on top)

0U6HC9WGXXDzS8Caqy1buA.text: Love this place!! Casual dining with a twist.....try the bacon jam, crispy chicken skins, turkey burger....everything is amazing!!!

umQvV0pGwq2cz4TzqKIkHw.text: Turkey burger ok. Salmon was really bad.  Canned beer.  $50.  Please.  Not a great place for dinner.  Not very healthy food.

tIrY1QbwzuFXkjVsYgQXRg.text: Very small space with an Interesting menu.  I'm guessing but seemed like there are about 10 tables max, with a fairly good size bar, where you can dine as well.  We ate at the bar and were served by Tara who was awesome.  They have lot's of "small dishes" for sharing.  Tried the cauliflower, Brussels Sprouts, and Trout.  All were solid options.  I especially liked the cauliflower.  Carson Kitchen is a solid addition to the downtown dining scene.  I hope they expand their space into what was formerly Big O Donuts.  Place seems packed all the time.

AhBH45zBEXAXxI7YqFGFpQ.text: First time ever coming here and definitely won't be the last! The bartenders craft up spectacular cocktails and Chef kills it in the kitchen. Ever had Bacon Jam and Brie? YOU SHOULD. Everything was cooked to perfection!!! Finish your meal with the Brownie, BOURBON/CHOCOLATE&BACON  i mean really what more could you want? Will def come back again. And again. AND again.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vBssw97GU0GX05UA9p20fA.text: Great local restaurant while in Vegas.  It's located off the strip in downtown LV but worth the $15 Uber. Plan on arriving early (5:45/6) to be able to quickly grab a table, or wait 30-45 minutes depending on the night.    If you can, try and grab a seat at the bar overlooking their kitchen. Also try the fried chicken skin with smoked honey, the veal meatballs, or their chicken sandwich.  A good selection of small bites and appetizers allows you to really experience what Carson Kitchen has to offer.

smStd0MDq8lDIkPnJuk22w.text: Service was excellent and I loved the unique menu.choices but all items were very hot/spicy. The appetizers like the bacon jam with Brie should state spicy. Nothing in the menu shows jalapeno etc. Same thing with Hawaiian flat bread and veal meatballs were fiery hot. The Devils eggs were great and cooled things down a bit.  Just be clear in the menu when things are spicy.

X0bNFsgnOyeFmrvE5amjEQ.text: I am SOOO thankful Dyanna L. insisted we come here for brunch a few weeks back... And after going back for a second visit for dinner after an Elite event downtown, Carson Kitchen has skyrocketed to the top of my list spots to dine downtown.   I have been lucky on each of my visits to be seated at the chef's 'table' (really more of a counter), where I have had a full view of the kitchen and been able to interact with the fun and entertaining staff.   Service here has always been on point for me... I can't recall the name of the adorable, rockabilly-ish blonde that has been my waitress on every visit, but I adore her. She fits right in with the "rock and roll hipster" vibe Carson Kitchen has going on.  Literally EVERY item I have had here I would order again... but I do have some favorites:  Bacon Jam: Everything I could have wanted and then some. Salty, sweet, creamy AND crunchy... A culinary grand slam. Tempura Green Beans: I have been craving the pepper jelly cream cheese served with the tempura green beans for weeks now. It is the perfect compliment to the addictive green beans. The Secret Sunday Chicken Sandwich: Simple yet perfectly done... Juicy chicken, aioli with just a slight kick, delicious bun.  Prices are very fair for the caliber of the food being served up. Carson Kitchen is a must when dining downtown in my opinion.

Fk6V6HfLMlIANdCgYtpRsQ.text: Loved this place, even though it took forever to get a table. Sat on their patio which was nice for a sunset and ordered many, many plates with friends. The food, the service, the atmosphere...everything was amazing. So cool to find spots like this, definitely worth the wait.

rSpzpOv9qqyp7R8vuifLrg.text: Honestly I don't understand what all the hype on yelp is about. Being from San Francisco I can see how this type of restaurant is fresh to folks in Las Vegas but to be honestly we were not too impressed by the offering. Cocktails are really light and we asked to make it heavier our server didn't gives us heads up that they will charge extra ( for the record, we saw the bartender, Chris, pour extra and he did few drops while giving us this look. ) amd we ended up being charged extra 7$ for the extra drops. The server even told my friend that " you know good drink doesn't mean it has to have a lot of alcohol" she even asked me how much tip I want to leave after I complained about the situation. I would really skip this place, you can do a lot better in Vegas.

lqRpuyNoiFpXizxiym04Og.text: This is easily the best meal I've ever had in Las Vegas. Forget the snooty famous places. Find the best places. Hip vibe. Great staff and food. We had drinks, Fried Chicken Skins, Bacon Jam, Cocoa Espresso NY and Baked Mac n Cheese. Excellent. Total bill under $80. Excellent value. Great place. This place would thrive in Portland Oregon - food Mecca.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mac n Cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken Skins with Smoked Honey dip

ohTbSwLYpG9YGekx2WPHlA.text: Our Lyft driver suggested this place for a bite to eat and to make sure to get the bacon jam! He claimed it to be the best food in Downtown Las Vegas. We had our doubts by what the outside looked like. But decided to take chance, and the ambiance on the inside was very intimate and cool. We had a great experience and meal. Shared the bacon jam, BBQ Burt ends, and veal meatballs (our favorite). I would highly recommend this place too!

1Oe2CFupFfqtdzltv-i3YA.text: This place was amazing! We got the chicken skins, bacon jam, Cuban sandwich and turkey burger. Everything tasted really fresh and delicious!   It's kind of difficult to find. The place is small and in an odd area. The only sign is located on the front window.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam! Amazing!!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skins so good! The dip was a little too sweet for me.

ngiwcVf2oNCgppREMxVHFA.text: This is definitely a hidden gem off the strip in old vegas.   We started with the tempura green beans which were great then had the steak and gorgozola flatbread.   The flatbread had a pumpkin puree on it which was a little funky but still delicious.  If you venture north off the strip definitely check this place out.  Make sure to ask to sit on the rooftop deck.

fIQPHhavufu0D3zjoSIG5A.text: Excellent food great atmosphere. Staff knowledgeable about menu. Fried chicken skins were phenomenal! Only negative was poor signage-hard to find.

r9DSJBGlnPY6-WIZ-0h4ww.text: For the record I never got to actually eat a meal, and here's why: we sat at the bar and were perusing the menu when one of the chefs dropped a tub of lettuce and the lid. Thankfully none of the lettuce spilled out but the lid landed on the floor with the inside flooring facing. He picked it up off the floor and placed the lid on the full tub of lettuce. Not thank you, I refuse to pay $10 for a salad that has sat all day rubbing up against something that fell on the dirty ass floor. I will never return here and need to tell everyone I know to do the same.  UPDATE: they've made certain to threaten me through personal message. I'm supposed to let you all know after he put it back in the fridge, some time later the lettuce was taken to the back and water was run over it. So no worries. It was only exposed to the floor for a bit and I don't know what I'm talking about. There, is that right? Did I say what I was supposed to, will you not threaten me again? Thanks.  gotta LOVE this customer service (below)

vDut1f0M56aJef37qXD7vQ.text: Eclectic, unique, delicious and gastronomically innovative... that is how I would describe this place. Located near downtown, this restaurant offers scrumptious dishes and an upbeat/modern atmosphere with a super friendly staff.  We visited this restaurant for date night, and wished we had discovered it sooner! We brought our own bottle of wine ($20 corkage fee), and enjoyed some of their signature dishes:  * Fried chicken skins- A MUST try. Seasoned and fried to golden perfection, these are the perfect opener for any meal.  * Bacon and brie jam- Sweet, tangy and a bit spicy. The mixture of flavors in this dish are just awesome and will surely have you coming for more.  * Turkey burger- Yes, I know it sounds plain. The truth is, this sandwich is anything BUT plain. With tropical and jerk seasoning flavors, this is the BEST burger I have had. In fact, you will leave that place in love with the explosion of flavors in the dish.  * Last but not least, we had the doughnut bread pudding which was the perfect desert for the night. Fluffy, sweet and heavenly, this is the best bread pudding in town!  I thank you for reading my review now, as I know you will thank me for writing it once you experience this place.

orAZsAJdjaHfktvHuZAWbg.text: Best tempura green beans.... Ever!   If you can, sit at the bar where you can watch them cook and watch the dishes come out.  They have small plates best for sharing... so this seating option gives you a chance to see it all before you get too far into ordering.   I would never order fried chicken skins from reading it off a menu ... but they sure looked good coming out of the kitchen.  I would have definitely ordered it if they hadn't ran out that day... just based on the looks of its crunchy deliciousness.

CZmPDDOIKhu5z_ipBYlfGA.text: Fun place, funky atmosphere, very good food and spectacular service. Off the beaten path.

Ooxq7UZMCR8FMV0bR1dVZg.text: The gyro tacos were out of this world, phenomenally great. The veal meatballs were delish in a modestly spicy sauce. The chicken sandwich was excellent as well. Service was fast and excellent, thank you Manny. This is 5 star at its best.

G2CbM4lhZwRSCUe4eDU39w.text: By far the best place I have had lunch in Vegas, well worth the short walk from Freemont to escape overpriced lower quality food.

WCzHSf0c61V4DHtwEJWFVw.text: Super disappointing. Hard to give a rating since I didn't get to eat anything. 6 person table, 5 got dinners, 1 never came. I understand mistakes happen, but the restaurant handled it very poorly. Even after the first manager, the only offer was to comp the meal never received and then for a free dessert. Thanks for not making me pay for food I never got! And not really interested in dessert when I never got dinner. For what seems like a cool restaurant, I would have expected a mistake like this to be handled better. Was really looking forward to this dinner but now wouldn't recommend the restaurant.  Update: I appreciated a quick response by restaurant owner to learn more about the situation and try to make it right. Still frustrated over my experience since it seemed like there was little priority that night to fix a problem. A meal was missed and the rest of my party was long done with their plates cleared and still no missing meal. However, I realize mistakes do happen and I appreciate the owners follow up. Everyone else's food looked great - hopefully processes change.

GjOuZ-n5pZMycH7IQRCCLA.text: This is the first time I've ever reviewed anything,  but I've been here twice now and believe this to be the best spot to be period in Nevada. Everything was perfect from the atmosphere to The Taste and timing of every entree.

SBH7NYjewXU_Ad9TH3SzZw.text: Great find in Vegas, cool, hip and fun. Tapas style with contemporary feel, fish to Mac n cheese, cauliflower to flatbread.  If your not cool or into new things, don't come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

epuSOBxli4RVutukduQTIg.text: Best restaurant in Vegas!!  Frequent here every time we come to town, and they never cease to amaze us!  Veal meatballs, Mac and cheese, strip steak, and of course the doughnut bread pudding are some of our favorites.  But there's not a bad thing we've experienced here!

EkteMu5U6ygJ2ArSGisnyQ.text: We found this place on yelp and want to give it a try. We drove by this location previously but did not dine here because there's no signage and we were not sure if the place was open or wait time. Today we had more time so decided to give it a try. Our sever as Manny, he was knowledgeable and gave us some great recommendations. We had bacon jam appetizer (it was soooo good), I had the fried chicken sandwich (another yummy dish) and my husband ordered turkey burger. We both agreed my fried chicken sandwich was a better choice. We will definitely come back next time and try other dishes.

cpPerEuDSYpLApL0YIuRFg.text: Pretty cool place and friendly staff. The only bad thing is...too much garlic in everything:( Really bad for date night if you're planning on talking or kissing lol.  Other than that, its pretty yummy

iHsDleqhRvN6EIOJkCyKrA.text: The food here is amazing! The food is meant to be shared but the portions are still generous. Had the Oxtail Ristotto which was smokey, the Bacon Jam was flavorful and the Cocoa-expresso NY strip was juicy. Great people, good music and friendly staff.

S1Twas5NV2WNw83q7wwEEA.text: This was my second time here in three years and it was five stars back then and only better this time.  Matthew is simply the best and he flexed when our reservation for 8 turned into 4 with a surprise 5th showing up at the last minute.  The veal meatballs were perfect if you like the Swedish style meatball vibe.  The fried chicken skin served with honey is excellent but the star of the show is always the baked bacon jam with brie.  Extra points to anyone who uses the chicken skin as a bacon jam delivery vehicle.  The devils' eggs are just a perfect balance of a little sweet, a little salty and a whole lot of great egg flavor.  The pork belly was a table favorite and, after a few minutes to cool down to a mouth friendly temperature, was a salty, sweet little bit of crunch and happy pork fat bite of ridiculous flavor.  The macaroni and cheese is just a wonderful blend of cheeses and elbow macaroni.  The bar made every cocktail to perfection.  The deserts we had (bread pudding and the chocolate cake with ice cream) shut down the table as we were just in a food happiness coma.  Seriously, if you haven't been here yet I'd give it a try and you will not be disappointed.  Carson Kitchen keeps bringing it strong and is a reliable five star all star.  Thank you again to the staff for another wonderful experience!

2iQ424O8oC3AZaYRNyzTWg.text: Was excited to go here only to find out that the manager was giving us a hard time on finding a spot. He seems to only be interested in regulars.   In fact, he seemed to care about us as we were exiting the restaurant after waiting for 15 minutes. If you're a hipster, you might have better luck than us.

KFhPyqseUZ0CyF1dCWT1jQ.text: Carson Kitchen is one of those places where you can keep going back, knowing you'll get a quality meal each and every time.  It's one of those locally known, must-hit spots in downtown Las Vegas.  Just know that you might miss it when walking by.  There's not much advertising and it's down a pretty empty road off to the side of Fremont.  But you walk in and they have an upstairs, outdoor area for eating, a downstairs patio, lounge area, and then your typical restaurant, inside, as well.  The ambiance is great for a nice evening out.  The menu is a little limited but all very unique and delicious.  Sizes vary, but 3 orders for a group of 2 people is probably fine for most of the dishes.  The prices are very fair and coming to Carson Kitchen won't put you back too much like other finer dining venues in town.  The quality of the food is right on par with those higher end venues, but this place is cheaper and gives you that local feel.  The staff is great, the food is great, and the venue is great.  Have a nice night out and go to Carson Kitchen.  You won't regret it.

-wyKf2LCWCXj6N45Ok39cQ.text: Great atmosphere ! Good food we order the black risotto look a little weird but so good !!

werTkU4Nbq8FKJOud_Fc9w.text: I really wanted to love this place. I was so very intrigued by the menu and the reviews. Maybe I just ordered the wrong things? The restaurant itself is beautiful. I love the rustic industrial style they have going on. Definitely feels like a hipster spot, but I brought my husband and kids and didn't feel too terribly out of place. Service was very friendly. I ordered the chicken skins. This item is what brought me here in the first place. The spicy honey sauce was great, I just felt like the skins were a little overcooked. 3 stars. I also ordered the *Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto* which was fabulous. 5 stars. The black rice had an interesting texture and the oxtail was tender and rich. I would return for this dish, for sure. I'd also return for the dessert. The *Glazed Donut Bread Pudding* was SO good. 5 stars, again. My husband's chicken sandwich was ok. Not bad but not great. 3 stars. Not quite worth the price of admission. The BBQ Burnt Ends were just that. Burnt and dry. I thought it was a clever idea, but it just didn't hit the mark for me. 2 stars. Considering the price of the bill and how satisfied I was with everything, I would probably lean toward 3 stars but I'm hoping that I maybe I caught them on an off day or maybe there are other items on the menu that are fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skins w/smoked honey. Good sauce, skins were too well done for my taste.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Rice &amp; Oxtail Risotto. Delicious!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glazed Doughnut Bread Pudding. Oh so good.

SHmMAZdzgLDU-50e9SesaQ.text: I don't mind to spend $$$ if the food worth it,however,I was not satisfied with food we got here. Since the disappointing dining experience,I gave this place two stars. To my surprise, the business owner left me a message the next day and his tone was full of sarcasm. I drop the rating to one star because of his attitude.

We waited a bit for fish sandwich and were brought a free appetizer. We will be back! (Desserts were amazing!!)

98u6vzuAx8Q2EvhW1qeaYQ.text: Yum and yum! Great cocktail menu and small plates for sharing. We had crispy chicken skins with smoked honey, meatballs, Mac and cheese, fried green beans, burnt ends and gyro tacos....everyone was happy! Super cute rooftop deck and even the waiting area is quaint. Go here you won't be disappointed!! And next door is the donut place. Go there too!

a24XbunM2wCVf25xCcp38g.text: The wait is always super long, the stools are uncomfortable to sit on and there is little seating inside. The vegetarian options are extremely limited, only 3 options I believe. The portions are super super small too and they're kind of pricey.  If you are going to go, get the mac n cheese, it is amazing.

fmI-y-uKk8wMDsBF9vIToQ.text: ENTRANCE is on Carson between 5 & 6 th. If you go by the address you'll get lost. Tapas style servings to share. Everything was excellent - bacon jam, tempura green beans, flatbread (pizza), meatballs, chicken breasts, deviled eggs...  A recent Wine Spectator recommendation... great flavors

9hYenlocNSwsI5fQDEZZ9A.text: I've had one of my best meals her.  The server went over the tip, Maria just did a fabulous job.  The meatloaf tasted great and I will be going back

2piXdNKyAoMJthzjjKyg9g.text: Love this place ingenious  menu good service good quality food definitely a place to patronize I like the fact that it's more of a local place not a touristy place

iS9HyFgYvKN0VUruwNm20w.text: What a treat to get off the Strip and find someplace where a local would go. Great vibe - and great food and drink; they have a great outdoor dining an bar area up on the roof also - which is nice for evening dinner. Service was top rate - loved the staff - especially Felicia who was super friendly and helpful in making food choices. The bacon jam was an amazing treat to start the meal - and their turkey burger may be one of the best I've ever had - but menu changes a few times a year - so hurry before they're gone!

UhxEuknR818p7ja3qR3wbg.text: We decided to do dinner off of the strip and a quick Google search led me here. We had just left a pool party, so I called and asked what the attire was and they responded "clothes." I knew this place was gonna be alright with me!  We were seated right away (and totally comfy in our pool party attire) at the counter next to the kitchen. We shared the strawberry & cucumber salad, charred octupus, mac & cheese, and pork chop. Everything was cooked to perfection! We were stuffed and the server asked if wanted dessert and of course we said "naaaah..." but the chef said we should really try the brownie. My goodness!! Brown butter ice cream with bacon served over a brownie! I'm SO glad we tried it.   It was such a nice experience from beginning to end. If you live in Vegas or visiting, make it a point to stop in!

NCAAoNeKGNw9VVJV5SSOTg.text: If you're visiting town and tire quickly of the Strip, the downtown area is a short Deuce or taxi/Lyft ride away. It's increasingly buzzing with foodie-friendly places like Carson Kitchen, which serves scrumptious fare that's reasonably priced given the quality and portions that you get.  I tried a fried chicken sandwich which turned out to be positively gigantic. It came with a yummy "secret" aioli and also came served with a nice helping of tater tots. It all washed down well with a couple of glasses of beer and cider - here, it's worth noting that they have quite the good boozy selection. There were many other tasty-looking items on the menu like jerk turkey burgers, beet salads, strip steaks, and flatbreads that I didn't get to try, but if you're stopping by, it'll be worth coming with a small group, getting a bunch of different things, and having everyone share or at least mooch a bite off each other's plates.   The space itself feels a bit compact in the way people are spaced from each other, with the advantage to this being that things feel a bit more open and social than it would, say, at a Strip resort bar or restaurant where you'd have lots of space for your party to lounge and stretch out. Service was fast and professional, and the venue is just a short walk away from the nearest Deuce stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. secret sunday chicken sandwich with spicy pickle aioli

HaJLi_CiSjco4_wcatOZ5g.text: Why, why, WHY have I not been here before???  I can't believe my hotel concierge took this long (I'm talking years) to recommend Carson Kitchen. I had some friends from Boston visiting for our annual New Year's celebration, and the day after the nutso celebrations, we were looking for what breakfast/brunch places were open. The only qualification? It had to be amazeballs.  Carson Kitchen is located next to the Donut Bar, and has one of the most nondescript front entrances I have ever (or never) seen. Our limos had driven by at least twice, looking for something resembling a eatery or gastro pub of some sort. It wasn't until I pulled up WAZE and stepped out onto the curb that I realized I was standing right in front of it. It was hidden right in plain site, and I LOVED it.  One of the first things you'll immediately notice is the amazing service. It honestly had a small town friendly vibe to it, which I never expected to find in downtown Vegas..... or Vegas in general, where everything is so commercially corporate, and friendly but superficial. Carson Kitchen was warm, like Biddeford, Maine, or Snyder, Texas.  We were table of 9, including five kids and teens, so probably the most fickle bunch of eaters this side of the Mississippi. But we had this amazing communal table, and just went to town. I ordered every one of the share dishes, and the kids had their mac n cheese and grilled cheese with short rib sandwiches. Here are my thoughts:  1) Grillled cheese with short ribs: GREAT! Wow. It tasted like something I'd expect after a night of debauchery in N'awlins. Perfect morning-after food.  2) bacon jam. This is a twist from what I'm used to, and the Bostonians weren't crazy about it, but I'm a bacon jam connoisseur, and this stuff was artisanal. It comes out sizzling with a strip of baked brie right down the middle. Truly next-level stuff!  3) Veal meatballs in sherry foie gras cream sauce. So I have to be honest. The meatballs were bit overcooked when we got them, so probably not as great as they should have been. But the combo with that sauce is simply amazing. My suggestion is request that the meatballs not be overcooked when you order them. But I'll say this much. These were REAL meatballs. Not the sausage-like chewy crap you'll find in frozenfood meatballs.  4) Fried chicken skins. Okay.... this one is for a chosen few. I spent some time growing up in Indonesia, so this is normal fare for me. I also have friends from Wisconsin and N'awlins, where this kind of stuff is normal. if you're turned off by the idea of chicken skins (lots of people are), then skip it. But if you like it, order it. I LOVED it, especially with their smoked honey dipping sauce. It tastes like pork rinds, but are an amazing comfort food for those that know what it is- crunchy comfort.  5) BBQ ends. I can't remember if I'm calling this right, but it's the end pieces of what I think are beef ribs, grilled to crunchy perfection. These cubes of succulence were exactly the kind of thing I wanted to round off the savory part of breakfast. I elect these the ultimate Superbowl snack of choice that goes perfectly with your coldest of brews.  6) The OMG. The Finale. The coup-de-gras..... is the glazed donut bread pudding. In all honesty, if we simply ordered 9 of these, we all would have been more than satisfied. This was the most amazing thing I've had in a long time. It was everything you think sex should be if it was a dessert. Soft, bouncy, moist, creamy, and just the right about of sweet. Truly impressive.  Obviously, I love this place. Highly recommend it, and will definitely be coming back on a regular basis.

z228uEb75hzi40mNYStMPA.text: Really like this place and would go back in a heartbeat. Reasonable prices for some eclectic cuisine. I got the lamb spiedee which was very tasty (although easier to eat with a knife and fork as opposed to a sandwich)  The waitstaff was very friendly and the drinks are delicious, well worth it.

mqXAFlM8BPcspcMGDGUelA.text: Could have been a 5-star if only. I ordered the Mac & Cheese and Killer Shrimp, had planned to finish up with young beets. But, my taste buds had enough salt after the Killer Shrimp and half of the M & C.   Had alot of great flavors, but just over did the salt!

AtFz3-ni_VsZUAq-w6faIw.text: A small unique gem of a restaurant in downtown.  Its an intimate restaurant with a funky and contemporary vibe, and an open kitchen for watching your meal being made.  Everything we ate was thoughtfully curated and prepared for a group setting. The apps and entrees were fabulous as were the drinks and the service. This is a restaurant should be a stop on your list, its wonderful!!  If you get the green beans ask for twice the sauce, its worth it! The sauce was amazing and ran out too quickly.

VvkDTYDJrnlty8KoU6mMhA.text: Great concept! This place is perfect for small social gatherings. Never had bacon jam before and its so worth it! Gotta try it.

-bGPHWQ-IYdjTt3WKsV_AQ.text: Among the best meals I have had in Vegas! Darn good food, friendly staff, reasonable prices, and the cool vibe equals a better experience than restaurants from many 'Michelin' and 'James Beard' chefs of the Strip. Keep it up guys, I will make it a point to visit again soon and pester all my friends and family to do the same.

714ebBYm-egxQsWCGO_gsA.text: I love all of the food here! And their drinks are amazing too. I have never had a bad meal at Carson's. I try and come once a month i am a local and i love to bring new friends to try the food.  I had my birthday party on the roof top and they were very accommodating and it was a great time.

yMWL1qtMcp-omEcmmpJbog.text: Went to Carson kitchen when we visited Vegas with our parents. Nice layout and friendly employees.  They inform you that the plates are small and that they have burgers/sandwiches (if you really want to get your money's worth.)  Go to Carson kitchen if you want to try different plates and have a casual hangout with drinks. I would recommend looking into other options if you want to get a big meal

H0-TuzfnzrH9wTjBtKvXUQ.text: We tried to go to Gastropig around the corner - but they had closed early for some reason. Since this was nearby and I had it bookmarked we headed on over at about 9:30 on a Saturday night. They were packed. It is a little awkward to wait and have a cocktail b/c there is ZERO place to stand.  I had a blueberry something drink that was good - but small.  The bartender said there were going to expand in the coming months to take over the tattoo shop next door, where they will have a proper bar.  All the waitresses wear old rock and roll t-shirts, I asked about it and the gals said the owner used to cater for bands.  We ordered a bunch of things to split (apparently the menu changes quarterly):  -Gyro tacos -Crispy chicken skin - Never seen this on a menu, served with honey, we asked for hot sauce too, which they should just serve with it -Black risotto with oxtail - Loved it, want to try and find black rice to re-create it -Veal Meatballs with a sherry fois gras cream sauce - these were my favorite! -Bread doughnut pudding - the Yelp reviews said this were great, but I found it unremarkable  I kinda wish we had ordered the bacon jam with brie, everyone around us who ordered it loved it.

9zUZ8KjMxYg6J5zUqz4BfA.text: This cool chic boutique simple restaurant serves big flavors for a decent price.  Was sad that the upstairs patio was t open because temperatures were a bit above 50 degrees, which for people not from Vegas is comfortable.  Bar was overwhelmed but the manager Matt jumped in to help.  Would suggest Chef Counter reservations. There is no soundproofing so it does get very loud and hard to hold a conversation but it was a great experience.  Will return.

VkyEDGk0g_l0_edjSd7HvA.text: This was by far the best meal I ate while in Vegas. Everything is family style and you truly can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The Bacon Jam was life changing! I didn't leave there overly stuffed which was perfect and the service was incredible. Our party of five ordered five plates and we could've probably done a couple more because it's THAT good. Go during the week (specifically the afternoon) to avoid a wait, but any wait would be worth it!

1zbk6fCEjyVl0lkq25i5mQ.text: The food was so good!!   The meat came not so warm, but still tasty. The place it's nice on the inside, and I love open kitchen

HBig4-aAJYvQYoscTfGMDA.text: A real bright spot in the area. Small plates, shared stuff. I had a goat goulash, which was perfect. Also had a cranberry turnover. Could have been a little sweeter but that's just me. Skip the casinos. Eat here.

ehvJT31etvCxmAQ3mM8u-Q.text: Such an awesome place! Great upstairs patio dining and food is just the right amount! Love this place!

8f7HqyGweD0CSHx04-t5Kg.text: Many savory options on the menu that's great for a light bite!  --- Rum/Coke - 3/5 Stars - this was okay. It seemed like the bartender slipped in a little too much rum and ice in my glass. Baked Mac and cheese - 3.5/5 Stars - their Mac and cheese was incredibly creamy and savory and I loved it! But why the 3.5 you're asking? It's way too small to be paying $13 for it. The size is almost the same size as a side at a local fried chicken shop.  --- Service - 5/5 Stars - My friends and I came here at around 6-7PM and it wasn't incredibly busy! Our waitress Eugenia was incredibly kind to my group of 8 and was very patient with us. The lighting is a little bit dark but your eyes will adjust. So for those who have a hard time seeing in dim lighting ask to be seated at the bar or directly under a lightbulb. Overall - 4/5 Stars - You're kind of forced to buy yourself an appetizer to get you fully satisfied at the end of your meal. But on the plus side, their food is amazing! If they could match the serving size with their price I would definitely be giving 5/5 stars. I'll definitely be back to try more of what's on their menu but I'll come back with a heavier wallet or a half full stomach haha.

dKM0O0I3XTlpsw4kx1bMNA.text: So i heard about this place from my friend and we decided to hit it up before my drive back to home and reality. I wanted some good substantial food before the Vegas to Bakersfield drive.    We had ordered the pork belly, caviar devil eggs, and the crab cheese fondue. We shared between three people and it was perfect. Pork belly had a buffalo sauce on top, tricked you into thinking chicken wings. Deviled eggs were tasty and had a very nice presentation. The cheese!!! was so good. It was served hot on a cast iron dish with sliced bread. Everything was spot on, no complaints.  Dessert we all shared the glazed donut bread pudding. YUM  If you are in the area and like to try something new, I would recommend.

KvF8aFdvCzPxxoNHU8RYbw.text: Overrated and uninspiring. I was really excited to eat here, as I had only read rave reviews and heard great things but my experience was excessively average, which is disappointing for a restaurant so hyped. I ordered the broccoli, which came raw with seeds and cranberries and in a green goddess sauce. The sauce was good but it didn't pack a ton of flavor. Plus, the broccoli was raw! It would have been better grilled, broiled, anything. I then had the Sunday chicken burger. The chicken was perfectly crispy but again it didn't have an innovative or inventive flavor. The side of tater tots was good. However, for raw broccoli and fried chicken I want to be wowed and impressed, which did not happen today.

fwNyB8_sfDOK5Nor1hNI-Q.text: Loved it. Was attending a concert on Fremont St and this was the perfect dinner before. I was expecting a long wait, but the 2 of us were seated promptly on a Saturday at 730pm at the kitchen bar. We had the Brussels sprouts and kale Caesar, the killer shrimp, and the jerk turkey burger. All were delicious. The tater tots that came with the burger are some of the best I've ever tasted. If you're in Vegas and can make your way off the strip I highly recommend this place.

n7vwO57nEicyxLpKlAiwLQ.text: OMG!!!!!!!! Stopped for lunch with a client, Sunday Chicken, beet salad, BLT flatbread, and the meatloaf.   Run don't walk, get here quick.

iVa-cbXBDPX7PBKB1EjytQ.text: I absolutely loved this little gem right off Fremont Street. We came here on a recommendation from a Vegas local and I am 100% coming back. The prices were incredibly low and the food was excellent.   My girlfriend and I shared the Gyro tacos, tempura green beans, killer shrimp and the Secret Sunday chicken. The Gyro tacos were fantastic, the green beans were out of this world and a must get, BUT, the Secret Sunday chicken was hands-down the best chicken sandwich I ever had! Oh and the tater tots were fantastic too.

ttTLTNVp7n420my4PRM7cQ.text: Carson Kitchen primarily serves modern American tapas style bar food. My favorite dish on a recent visit was the Crispy Chicken Skins. They were similar to pork rinds, addictive, and paired nicely with the side of smoked honey. I also had the Baked Mac & Cheese which was nicely cheesy with savory noodles. The Bacon Jam was unique: meaty and sweet with a little pepperiness. The Goulash was disappointing and had a relatively unpleasant aftertaste.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat Goulash

wT0Rg4v4Sta9pzJtAu-Pcw.text: First time here. Had an event downtown so we figured we'd five it a try. Was very impressed with everything we had. We were greeted quickly and sat at the counter looking into the kitchen. Since it was our first time I wanted to try a little of everything so we ordered the crispy chicken skin($9) and the devils eggs($8). The skins were out of this world. It's a basket full of deep fried chicken skin with a spicy smoked honey sauce that was out of this world. The eggs were piled high and had a dollop of caviar on top. Pancetta was sprinkled on top as well. Very well done and super tasty. we ordered the Gyro tacos (3 for $12) and they were yummy. It was like an open face gyro with lamb and tzatziki in a street taco size. For our next course we had the black rice oxtail risotto ($14) and the sea bass ($22). The risotto was cooked perfectly and super tasty. The sea bass was grilled and came with crispy skin (I guess I like skin) and a cauliflower tabbouleh over the top. A squiggly chili oil sauce was on the plate for dragging the fish through and it was so yummy together. We ate everything we were given and enjoyed each course. My wife liked the fish best, I picked the risotto as my favorite. We could see what was going out of the kitchen and the beet salad, Brussels sprouts Caesar salad and Mac and cheese seemed to be very popular so we'll try those next time for sure. Service was excellent and efficient. Great time, can't wait to go back

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyros tacos with lamb and tzatziki
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass with cauliflower tabbouleh and chili oil

QDB7bcvXurt5kEeRysFfmw.text: I have had this place bookmarked forever! And for one reason or another I was never able to go. Finally this weekend I was able to check this off of my list. It was so worth it!  I heard from friends it's much better to go at lunch because there isn't such a long wait to sit down. They were right, we walked in and we're seated right away. The staff were all super friendly and attentive. The decor inside is very cool and modern, great for taking lots of pictures.  We ordered the Bacon and Brie jam, cocoa espresso rubbed NY strip and the salmon. Each dish's flavor was off the charts. Now I just have the challenge of going back to try everything else on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and Brie Jam!

bj1UJsMyrF-l6pjtLf8x1g.text: Carson Kitchen is my favorite DTLV restaurant. It is one of the few restaurants that never, ever disappoints whether I'm having my usual go-tos such as The Devils Eggs, or the Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip. The consistency is always on point.   Not only are the "resident" dishes all amazing, but their seasonal features are always memorable and leaves me wanting to come back as much as I can, knowing that these particular dishes may not be around forever. One example was a watermelon salad from last year, it was hands-down the best I've ever had and I was so bummed I never made it back there in time to have it once more before it was gone for the season.   Another great dish that rolled out with the new winter menu is the phenomenal Chicken Thighs served with mushroom marsuvio. I am not one to ever order chicken at restaurants but I've had this dish twice in one week because I couldn't stop thinking about it the first time. I really hope this one stays around for good.  Service is always warm, friendly and personable. I love sitting at the chef's counter when it's just me or another person. Drinks are great, my particular favorite is a paloma type drink called the Get Shorty which comes with a Tajin rim. To round out my delicious meal, I always go with the Donut Bread Pudding which is made with the neighboring Donut Bar's famous donuts.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devil&#39;s eggs and Get Shorty
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yy5I-n-DlRdCESQWFlvkig.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas! A friend recommended this place and I'm so glad because I probably wouldn't have thought to come here. The must gets are the bacon jam, Brussels sprouts kale salad, and pork tenderloin. I love that the plates are meant to be family style so that everyone can try all of the dishes. The risotto, mushroom flatbread, and killer shrimp dishes were pretty good but definitely would come back just for the bacon jam!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QL7ZD1l-XFWXVzGerFv1Gw.text: Another off the strip hidden venue!  Get the Mac and cheese (ask for it if not on the menu). Also the gyro tacos and killer shrimp are bomb. Can't go wrong with anything but those were our favorites.

-ywJQeCgCn-qZlUWudK_Vw.text: While Las Vegas is definitely a food destination- don't spend all your time at buffets and miss this gem. It is located downtown off of Fremont. I am still dreaming of the deviled eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried green tomatoes with crab atop
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos... great choice!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs... still dreaming about these

7BlF1YXJ9Lm5zAhViuKt4g.text: Great spot in the heart of downtown with rooftop bar and dining area. Craft cocktails and delicious upscale Gastro grub. The open kitchen creates an interactive theatre experience if sitting at the bar top.   Get: Bacon jam  Chicken skins  Tempura green beans   Main course: The steak   Service is great. Will dine again.... and again.. and again.

hNCAvn5DHbyuI6OGILcEtw.text: Found this gem on the way back to LA from Utah. We were so glad we stopped here instead of other options closer to the strip.  Service was good, food was delicious and generous portions for tapas style dishes and we walked out with a food coma for the ride home.   We ordered (in order of deliciousness): Tempura string beans- super crunchy with a surprisingly good cream cheese dip Sunday fried chicken sandwich- perfectly salt-brined fried white meat Gyro tacos- tender and balanced with cool yogurt cucumber sauce  Oxtail risotto- great texture of purple rice and flavor  Brussels sprouts Caesar- great tangy dressing  Mushroom flatbread- familiar with a twist of Indian spices  Cocoa espresso strip steak- different.. wasn't a huge fan of the bitterness of the rub and the fennel seed used   The dessert to end the meal: GLAZED DONUT BREAD PUDDING!! my fiance is a huge fan of bread puddings and I got to say, this one was the best we've ever had. I just wish it came with a scoop of ice cream :)   Definitely a refreshing take of farm to table, American (new) category in the Las Vegas food scene!

_dKXcYI5w1-D84xc97EBdQ.text: My boyfriend came here with some friends without me and he couldn't stop raving about it being his favorite place he's eaten so far in Vegas. On this trip, he brought me and two friends back to try it out. The menu is great for sharing (all portions, including the main courses, are tiny portions) and the prices are really reasonable - almost everything is under $20.   We got the cocoa-espresso steak (my personal fav, cooked perfectly), the tempura green beans (the cream cheese was amazing), the mac and cheese, the pork belly, the gyro tacos, the killer shrimp, and the oxtail risotto (the dish I couldn't wait to try, but was my least favorite - it was a bit too al dente and had such a unique taste to all of us that I just couldn't make myself love it - I even got the rest to go and, despite being hungover and starving the next day, I still couldn't force myself to eat it).   I have to say, I was so beyond full before we even got here that I could barely have more than a bite or two of each dish, so I feel like my review is more focused on the group's thoughts, but everyone loved the dishes so much and were so glad we came here that I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

AIgEuEf8IKx7XwDbv8lH-A.text: This is a great lunch/dinner spot downtown!!  The food is amazing!!  Our server was so nice!!  Definitely coming back again, and also telling my friends to come check it out.   We had the edamame, the watermelon feta salad, the wild mushroom flatbread, and the jerk turkey burger to share.  Everything was delicious!!!

9b2gNoiuvBVweJuvtrFSBQ.text: Had seen the awesome reviews so I knew I wanted to try out this place while we were in town visiting freemont street and so glad we did!   My husband and I tired the following:  Gyro tacos The fried chicken skins with honey  Mushroom flatbread Plum salad   All were so yummy and I wish I had saved room for dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms flatbread
