FsvgG_LxVdO97_T8U7wwSw.text: Menu has nice variety, although their best dish (firecracker shrimp) is no longer on it. Waiter was friendly and knew the menu well. Food is tasty. Most chairs don't have backs and got uncomfortable really quickly! 7 of us went yesterday afternoon and were sat at a table that was barely large enough for 6. We got there about 4pm (between lunch and dinner) so it was pretty empty.  We asked to combine a 2 person table with ours and hostess said no. We said we may consider eating elsewhere if we couldn't and she said, "ok, let me know if you decide to stay". A friend really wanted to eat there, so we stayed. Waiter actually told us we look like we 'got in trouble and all had to sit at this tiny table' and moved us to a much larger high top (where we shared with another group... but that was ok with us). Hostess was rude and didn't care about our comfort-or whether we stayed or not. Horrific greeting and start.

CWyGG66wp83upp3vtYrNyg.text: Had dinner there last night. Very busy. Over an hour for the wait. Snagged a seat at the bar. Well worth the the wait if you have the time. Very small place, they are going to have to expand. Best dinner so far on this trip. Glazed Donut bread pudding was even better than it sounds.

OwgXIR5v1DELaCx_zLzA7Q.text: I was meeting my friend Angela H for a late lunch and this was her suggestion.  And an excellent suggestion it turned out to be!  We chose to share small plates and our eyes wanted more than our stomachs had room for.  We had bacon jam, mac and cheese, gyro tacos and cheese fondue. It was all great! Early afternoon on a weekday it was busy but not packed.  Service was really good. We were catching up on stuff since we had last seen each other but we were never rushed to finish. I would definitely go here again.

KmXTbr7mkbTf50R_Uvw5jg.text: Interesting menu items. The bacon jam was as good as everyone raves. Very interesting.  It's worth the visit just for this menu item.   The espresso steak tasted nothing like espresso or chocolate. And was served undercooked.   Veal meatballs were pretty good with the foie gras gravy.   Beet salad...meh.   The doughnut bread pudding was dense and not appealing.   We won't be back. BUT the bacon jam was worth the visit. Damn amazing.

2C0I8uopbEHWtLzXy_bzAw.text: This was amazing. The tapas were perfect sizes for sharing! The chicken was fantastic and loved the watermelon feta salad.

A5U_ajl5XmT47BH58TtF7w.text: Great vibe, delicious food, warm and welcoming staff. Perfect dining experience every time. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take a seat at the bar if you can. Geronimo is awesome. Thanks Geronimo for the delicious, refreshing cider recommendation!

g0YqougNiav8KlNShdajTg.text: Fantastic food and cool little location!  I suggest going with a couple of people and ordering a little of everything off the menu...family style. The food is too good not to get to try a little of everything. My favorite was the Mac n cheese and the rustic coliflower!

r4i8-sSjMa4kERDrVNZslw.text: Located about a block off LVBD across from the post office. It doesn't stand out but it's worth going in. Ordered food to go: killer shrimp, Mac & cheese, & butter burger with tots. While waiting for the order we had 1 Miller Lite & 1 vodka soda. Food came to $36 dollars & was worth every penny. However our total bill was $55 so I'm guessing our drinks were pretty expensive. Staff was friendly & order was fast & correct. Wish the drinks were a little cheaper but I would eat there again.

2qGHq8f4sPJ0jqYPsjkeuw.text: Everyone seems to love this spot, there's honestly nothing special about it. We were here for dinner and it was super busy, we sat at like a big kitchen table with strangers and yelled for the whole night in an attempt to have a conversation. The drinks were whack. The food was OK. We ordered a bunch of tappas but nothing really stood out. I wanted to really like this place but... no.

TbIS3bn5UF2N2GJq6vfWLg.text: Good, but not great.  People always get caught up in the hype, afraid to say it wasn't that great just because everyone else said it was.  Very small portions, very basic seasonings and some of the items seem like you can just make it at home.  Ordered bacon jam, deviled eggs, cocoa steak, Mac n cheese, chicken skins, peach & heirloom tomato.  Sad that it wasn't 4 1/2 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HD15xGDgPHaT-by_ZcSFEw.text: Oof, loved this place. The space was super cool, mostly high top, social seating and perfectly lit. I had the steak, which was amazing and only $19, and I split the cauliflower with my friend. I've been trying to recreate it at home, so good. My cocktail was amazing. I usually never mention service in reviews because I don't actually care as long as the food is good, but the service was great. The bartender was hilarious and attentive.

hYKyddGC6IMOjfW7U_owGw.text: I found this place while bored one evening in Las Vegas.  It was kind of hard to find this spot as there are no Neon or Big Signs, to show that you have arrived.   The Parking was nice.. Plenty of room along the curbside.   The Bar was also nice.  The feeling in there was a little lonely.. The lights were dim, and the bar was rather quiet.   I ordered the Chicken Skins and a Cuban Sandwich. Initially I wanted to order a Burger, and the Famous Chicken Skins.  When my food came I was disappointed with the Cuban Sandwich. But the Chicken Skins and Drinks made up for it all.     Great Customer Service.. And if I was Hungry I wouldn't mind going again.. Only this time I'd order a Burger AND my Chicken Skins.

2WEJ_maN2fyu_Hm4mDkwow.text: Delicious!  Love the back patio and the selection was very unique.  Dessert was totally worth it (Glazed Donut Bread Pudding).  Baked Mac n Cheese was fantastic too!  Friendly staff!

vrxwz8MdbPTg64LY7bRhrA.text: Top 5 burger I've ever had....and it was a Turkey Burger!!! Wasn't expecting it, but the sandwich was fantastic.   Restaurant is small and quaint. Loved the simple decor. Bianca our server was fantastic and very enthusiastic. She will take great care of you.   Highly recommend. Heard dinner is very busy so be prepared. We went for lunch and it was less busy.

gNPEvhgSA0zW0vwRU7snag.text: The cocktails are excellent and he tapas are fantastic! Great place downtown in Las Vegas. I am in Vegas every two weeks for work and this is a great place to grab a bite.

EdRJAwtmH7CacnaCM-CUXQ.text: Great food, cool atmosphere and excellent service.

MG4q315bwJZBE2NWPzTD9Q.text: Not a good food experience. We had the chicken skins which tasted more like bacon, tacos not bad, burnt ends definitely not KC, artichoke hearts which really had nothing on them, red snapper again ok nothing great, pork belly flat bread which was inedible. The pork belly was so chewy you couldn't chew it enough to swallow it.  Was really disappointed and I had such high hopes for a good meal in Vegas.  Waitress very nice service was good but the food was just not good.

5o4ANXRyQ8_FPscaGoiTSQ.text: So delicious, all of it! Best baked Mac and cheese around. Also had the burnt tips, rainbow cauliflower, cod, gyro tacos, and bourbon chocolate desert with bacon ice cream; definitely a foodgasmic experience. The staff are also very welcoming and conversant.

VTSqGagTJHx3U8WfivDUHA.text: So overdue to write this. Great place. Great food. Their crispy fried chicken skin is amazing. Their gyro tacos are my fav. I would recommend sitting at the bar. I love seeing my food being prepared.

myXIOWiCyEg58Fn2LTAQBQ.text: This was our second trip to Carson Kitchen in the desert.  We enjoyed it so much the first time, we came back with friends.   Located in an odd location in the Fremont area, don't blink, you will probably drive right passed.  Street parking near by is metered, so be sure to pay enough time so you're not interrupted meter feeding half way thru your meal.    Restaurant was remodeled and expanded since our last visit.  Looks like they blew out the wall to extend the bar.  Funky modern vibe, lots of plaid and "a lot more ink, a little less sleeve" atmosphere.   The kitchen is open so you can see the chefs working their magic first hand.  As in any good chef's kitchen, noise was minimal.  No pots and pans banging about.  We felt the best way to experience Carson was to order a lot of appetizer bites for the entire table to share.   We ordered the bacon jam that's absolutely to die for yummy!  The Devil's eggs were good, but honesty....every picnic I've ever been to has their own rendition.  Theirs happened to be topped with caviar.   The veal meatballs with peas were outstanding!  Hard to have just one!  Melt in your mouth delicious.   Portions were good sized and enough for a table of 4 to share.    One of us ordered the Secret Sunday Chicken sandwich.  Tender juicy chicken on an aioli smeared brioche bun.  Another at the table - dear Lord was on a diet in Vegas - ordered a Green Goddess Caesar salad.    We all waited and salivated for dessert.   The Glazed Donut Bread pudding sounds heavy....but it's really a light treat. Caramel and rum covers a light fluffy donut.  Just enough to share with the table and get a few bites to satisfy you.  We liked it so much we nearly licked the bowl clean!  The Bourbon Fudge Brownie was outstanding!  Super rich dense chocolate flavor topped with ice cream and bacon bits.  Out of this world.   The desserts were by far the stars of our dining experience.    The check arrived along with an "autograph book" of reviews.  Sign your name and share your comments of your favorite meal.  A nice inclusive touch to an exceptional and well presented meal.  Service was good and staff friendly.  We enjoyed Carson Kitchen once again, as did our friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Sunday Chicken

11j6EyMIruvEV0a2OldJhg.text: This is an amazing place. It's right downtown Vegas near the Fremont casinos. I went here because I wanted a local experience complete with fancy cocktails and this was it. Every cocktail is super balanced and because I went at lunch, the bartender could talk to me and gave me several recommendations to go to during my stay.   The food is also great. I just got a flatbread with lox and onions and flavored cream cheese. They change their menu four times a year, probably because they offer a lot of farm to table options. Definitely come for the cocktails and come at lunch to sit at the bar so you get attention! It's crowded in the dining space because it's so good.

xzU_fIh9NzhV6hsR2UPpZg.text: Bravo, Vegas!!  You NAILED IT.  This is the mix of good food, fun atmosphere, interesting/upscale but accessible menu items at reasonable price points.  Cocktails that slip down your throat like lies slip out.   BAM! Go there, fool, don't hit the buffet again, take yourself to somewhere worth the time and effort to put on that nice shirt, and look at your date, her dress says she's ready for this, not the 1.99 shrimp cocktail at the casino.  Sit at the bar if it's full, the staff is always fun and you're closer to the booze!

EeZSskHZyESVwxeVLMI7xQ.text: Small place but arrived before the dinner crowd. Bacon jam was amazing. Gyro tacos were solid. Definitely will come back.

t0imruW4WpSwftvAAX6aNg.text: We came back after our first meal here was so good.  Great drinks, great flavor.  I loved the gyros tacos and the shrimp.  The Mac and cheese was pretty good too.  Drinks are well crafted.  It was not too busy for lunch and they were able to get us out in a hurry in our evening visit.  I definitely thought the food was superior on this end of Vegas!

3uZ5aTkt9drv-p6H_OncCA.text: Fantastic experience.   We walk in and there's a 10 to 15 minute wait so we go to the bar and get a couple of drinks.  The drink menu is eclectic and cute.  A good variety to suit any mood but not large so you're not standing there and reading a menu for 10 minutes debating the merits between drinks that all sound more or less the same anyway.  We were seated right in the ballpark estimated time at the counter in front of the kitchen.  Now, being a chef myself, I love this location but I will say that the seats were ever so slightly uncomfortable.  I don't think there was enough leg clearance for those of us with longer legs and I found myself with my feet all over my friends purse.    The food.  Yes, it's good.  Like, really really good.  They pace the items so that whatever is ready first will come first.  I like this but I was also kind of disappointed.  We ordered the chicken thighs which take 20-30 min.  This made us think that we'd get this dish last but we got some other things afterwards.  It made us think that maybe they forgot or maybe it wasn't put through.  The food is absolutely delicious though.  Everything we got was very tasty and full of flavor.  The black rice risotto with oxtail is my dream dish.  AMAZING!  This is definitely going to become a "GO-TO" place for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Donut bread pudding
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel corn pudding
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib grilled cheese

agvkzlqFcqDDl6_cHztX9Q.text: Came for dinner with friends based on great online reviews and the recommendation from a friend. Group dining is the way to go here, since the plates are perfect for sharing. Our server was amazing- made helpful recommendations about dishes to try, how much to order, cleared plates in a way that was efficient, but didn't make us feel like we were being rushed out the door. Definitely 5 star staff. The food was OK, but the menu didn't offer many vegetarian options, so probably not a place I would come back to, but everyone else seemed to like it.  We ordered a ton, probably a bit too much for a group of 7... - Deviled eggs- Four halves = $11. These were nice a creamy with a bit of space and some type of meat on top - Roasted beets- ($11) YUM! - Caesar salad- ($12) fine with a good dressing, but on the small side - Lamb tacos 3 small street-style size = $12, add one more for $4- I thought just OK, but you shouldn't take my word for it since I'm not a big lamb eater and definitely don't prefer ground meat - Baked mac and cheese ($12)- didn't really love this. It was nice and creamy, but wasn't very hot and had truffle oil that seemed too strong - Rainbow cauliflower- ($9)- I love cauliflower and am sad to say this is the first cauliflower dish I think I've ever ordered out and not enjoyed. I didn't care for the strong vinegar flavor - Wild mushroom flatbread ($14)- meh. The pickled onions were nice, but I didn't care for the tuffle oil  Other things that we ordered, I didn't try, but they seemed to be crowd pleasers with my dinner companions: - Bacon jam with brie ($13). Pro tip, save some to eat with the mac and cheese - Veal meatballs- ($14) - Pig & Fig flatbread- ($13) - Black Mussels- ($14) - Short rib grilled cheese with tater tots ($14) - NY strip($20)  Overall, would say service is great. Menu just not my style of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet salad (yum!) and deviled eggs
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam w/ brie

U9D9kxY1eT9xRyuk6W8rCg.text: Another great trip to Carson Kitchen. The beet plate, oxtail risotto, and donut bread pudding continue to be the amazing classics that they have been since opening. Today I tried for the first time their Mac, shrimp app, and pecorino plum salad. The Mac is amazing, worth it (kind of wish I ordered the bbq thighs to pair it with). The shrimp app will be my new go-to here, it's a cross between Chinese take out honey walnut shrimp and nachos in the best way possible, amazing. The salad, though something that did not expect - I was hoping for something presented like the beet plate - was very fresh and flavorful (amazing date vin) but in my opinion portioned poorly for the 13 dollar price.    Past experiences: I've been coming here on and off for over two years and I've tried a lot of dishes some of which have stuck to the menu. Most importantly of which is the coffee rubbed strip, which is one of best pieces of steak in town, especially considering the price. If you're really hungry and don't mind something super rich I also recommend the bacon jam, it's unusual compared to other iterations I've had - note that it's huge, too much for two people in my opinion.   Also something that I've tried a lot of are all of the cocktails here, all of which are great. This is one of the best cocktail programs in town for sure.   I wholeheartedly suggest visiting here. Good food and great vibes, it's made to become your regular place for get togethers or just grabbing a drink and a bite.

PW4TqwhhRl_PKvLxYwwfqg.text: Food and ambience are on point here.  When I arrived on a weeknight for dinner with three other people there was a thirty minute wait.  They told us we can grab a drink at the bar or can go wait in their backdoor patio.  We decided to grab a drink at the bar to go to their patio area.  The girl behind the bar originally ignored us for the longest time.  She was just wiping down glasses while we wait for her to acknowledge us.  Finally when I made it obvious she finally took our drink orders.  It was annoying.  Annoying to the point where I almost ask everything to leave.  Once we got our drinks, we chilled at their spectacular patio with a bon fire going.  It was nice.  Once we were called and seated, we asked for their short rib grilled cheese and bacon jam but both were sold out.  Boooooooo.  We wish the waitress told us prior to us ordering what they were out of.  So we went with the following and its description:  Veal Meatballs ($12)- These tender and flavorful small meatballs were divine.  They came out in a bowl with some sauce and peas all over them.  They were really good and perfect if you love veal.    Secret Sunday Chicken Burger ($13)- We got this as a replacement to the short rib grilled cheese sandwich which was out.  It was good but nothing crazy.  It was served with some fries.    Baked Mac & Cheese ($12)- This was the best thing we had there.  It was so good that we got two orders between the four of us.  It had a truffle taste and was super cheesy.  We all loved it and recommend it.   Braised Short Rib ($14)- This was suggested by our waitress since the bacon jam starter was out.  The short ribs were pretty magically, tender, and had lots of flavors.  It was a good starting dish.  It was served with two crust-less piece of white bread.   Rainbow Cauliflower ($9)- This was our least favorite here but still a goodie.  The cauliflower had lots of lemon but I enjoyed it.  They were cooked perfectly.    Galzed Donut Bread Pudding ($8)- OMG!  Now I know why the hype.  I don't know another place that has bread pudding as amazing as this place.  It was one bread pudding served in a bowl with the best sauce poured on top.  It was the perfect ending to our dinner.   All dishes are about $10-$20.  It's kinda tapas style and everything is shareable.  The service in the dining area was excellent.  The service at the bar sucked.  The inside is smaller so there is normally a wait.  I love the romantic ambience.  It is perfect for a date night or to hang with a small group of friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the bread pudding!!!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Meatballs
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger

eWfAz-y8yaCH1IJlQCVc9A.text: Always good! This is our go to for visiting family and friends.... fried chicken skin, mac n cheese, tacos, and my personal fav...  the rainbow cauliflower...

vlJ37lB9LfcU5CNvKesNTw.text: I have two words: BACON. JAM.  If you get nothing else on the menu, get the BACON JAM. Baked Brie, a toasted Baguette...truly, what more could you ask for? More Brie, actually, definitely more warm brie. They will gladly give you more toast slices, but they will charge you for them (they don't tell you this up front, but it's so good it's hard to care!)   I ordered the Coco-Espresso NY Strip as my main course. It was perfectly cooked and beautifully plated, but it doesn't come with anything else, and I did find that the price point was a little steep for a meat-only dish. However, after the Bacon Jam and Brie appetizer, I certainly didn't leave the restaurant "hungry."  The atmosphere inside is really, pretty cool. Lower ceilings with a more "Industrial" feel. We ate dinner here before seeing the tour of "Hamilton" and it was the perfect combination of trendy and casual!   If you just want to try one of their awesome crafted cocktails, there's a little bar to the right of the entrance and even a patio outside and upstairs!   I definitely recommend getting a reservation (especially if you're aiming to be seated between 7pm-8pm) as the place is not that big and does fill up. There is also no real "signage" outside and even I struggled to find it! The restaurant faces Carson St (go figure) but is right next to the Donut Bar. I also love how, although this spot is just one block away from the Fremont craziness, sitting inside, you'd never know it!

YOPiaIIG8MyexbTS8fu1jQ.text: First review...5th visit. They just keep us coming back.  About 8 months ago me and my fiance decided to go here on a date and that night started our love affair with Carson Kitchen.  We have been back many times since and it never disappoints. My goal has been to try everything on the menu, little did I know the menu changes from time to time and I'm left in an endless quest to try everything this awesome little restaurant can make.  Staff is very friendly and attentive, food is always on point, can get pricey but totally worth it. Expect wait times, but also worth it.  Here's a list of things you must try:  1. Baked Mac & Cheese - it's ridiculous how good it is, not enough to share so order two 2. Watermelon Feta salad 3. Chicken Skins - best shared with the table 4. Secret Sunday Chicken - one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had 5. Butter Burger 6. Tempura Green Bean - also a must every visit 7. Cocoa Espresso steak  8. Glazed Donut bread pudding  The Get Shorty is also a good drink to wash all this down with if you like tequila and your drinks to have a bit of spice.  There's so much more. Don't be afraid to get out of your comfort zone and Carson Kitchen will reward you.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Green Beans
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Sunday Chicken
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mac &amp; Cheese

PYg_cBRkJEvp2gbtQvV1ug.text: Heads from locals this was the place to eat. After yelp and google maps got us lost, we finally found a hole in the wall hipster kitchen. Waiter was good but did not explain how tiny these portions are!  I assumed "family style" meant it was to be shared, noooooo. We got the pork plate and it was 4 tiny pieces and the deviled eggs were outrageous. I'm not much into hipster food so maybe my fault. Three stars for ambiance I guess but the food was nothing to write home about or go back to

bt23rfv_e35o1FjEEYjVbg.text: A must. Located close to Fremont Street but with only good weirdness. Every dish, aside from the beets were phenomenal (also note we tried every entree, half of the appetizers and salads and all Desserts). The spot is what makes it. Small, loud, close, unfinished and awesome. This is a super cool find and a lot with the food to make you come back tell others about it!

xPQ_2hzRZ4EX0KNjKl-7Sw.text: I've reviewed this place several times because the menu changes several times a year, and I'm always surprised to find something totally unexpected. Today, it's the new Chicken Liver Mousse with cherry fernet compote. This was really the standout of several dishes my son and I had today.  All of the dishes were very good, which is why we keep coming back for our favorites, like the Chicken Skins and the Devils Eggs (with lardons and caviar!). But I always check out the newest menu and find a few new favorites.  I was happy to see that the Brussel Sprouts Caesar Salad is still on the menu - I love this crunchy version of a Caesar. I also tried the new "Pasta" Puttanesca made with calamari "noodles," a great dish for those avoiding pasta.

gU49DKpciKsvIebCMu65lA.text: Awesome place to eat! Small portions that are shared by each one is the way to go. My personal favorite was the fondue w/ small pieces of garlic toast. The Shrimp was excellent as well. It had quite the flavor and was spicy. The tempura green beans w/ dipping sauce was amazing. Our waiter Manny kept the food coming at the right times. He was great at explaining all of the choices, a very friendly guy. The food, waiter and our group made for a great evening at Carson Kitchen. We will definitely be back.

VhQ5WfsEUJ4o8q0w2s8qFQ.text: Carson Kitchen is a beautiful spot in downtown Vegas! On a Saturday afternoon for lunch, we had zero wait, which was awesome! Plenty of different seating options between bar seating, communal, high top tables and small family tables. Definitely great for groups of all different make-ups!  The way they aim to serve food is sharing style, with plates coming out as they are ready since the whole table will be nibbling on everything ordered.   We shared the "Devil's" Eggs (topped with pancetta and caviar!) Pig & Fig flatbread (I only wish there was more goat cheese on top!), and Sunday Chicken Sandwich (biggest, juiciest chunk of chicken breast I ever did eat!). Beware that the sandwich will be the last thing served because it takes forever to cook!  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here and would not hesitate to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Sandwich and spicy tots
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pig &amp; Fig flatbread
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Devil&#39;s&#34; Eggs topped with caviar and pancetta

2dmMPJwU2fEaFb6A0_Y-Uw.text: Great restaurant, special dishes.  The shrimp is amazing.  For main try to risotto The dishes are a bit small but really good

Aj6uFOhRrKcujiGdV2G-Jg.text: Highly recommend this off strip gem located near the Fremont street experience.  We were there around 1pm on a Sunday and there were only a few other tables seated.  There were so many options on the menu, but being that we were only 2 people had to settle to sample only 4.    They will bring them out as they are ready and we started with the fried chicken skin, which lets's be honest, the reason why we eat fried chicken!  Next up the "devil's" eggs which were the creamiest mixed with pancetta and topped with caviar.  Next up the gyro tacos - which is served as three, but they asked if we'd like an extra so we got 2 each. Ground lamb is so delicious and this really is an great spin on a gyro and a taco.  Last, we ended with the bacon jam with a melted brie and a pile of bread.     Restaurant was not busy and service was good.  The hostess was very friendly and was helping get the food to the table and chatting with the customers.   Very happy with everything we ordered and will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu on the next vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bacon jam
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. gyro tacos
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. deviled eggs

z8wz3xqI4djQnta6iLGnNA.text: Very pleasant surprise. Well priced and well made. I order some of the same menu items at my local steakhouse and they're $6 more per item.   They change menu items..but most everything I tried was great.

m99NXbVl3j9cRH_WnccdVg.text: So I had to try this place out for myself since I had read many of the Yelp reviews. I decided to go for lunch and was pleasantly pleased that the location was right next to the Donut Bar, so I could try out both places. Score!  We were lucky to land a parking spot right in front of the these businesses. Parking is sparse in this area and if you aren't paying attention, you can drive right by.  We walked in and were promptly seated at the bar. I also noticed that there is bar that you can sit at and watch the chefs making your food. For lunch time the place was not busy at all. There were just a few folks gathered around the chefs bar and a few tables were filled. The space is pretty small and intimate. There is also a second level, so perhaps more people were seated upstairs. Our bartender Chris was really helpful and basically explained that their menu changes with each season. The current menu is for spring. He told us that it is better to choose a couple of different items on the menu since the idea is to share the food. We viewed the menu and started with chicken skins, bacon jam and shrimp dunderi. We anxiously awaited the arrival of our food. Well, let me say I made I huge mistake in ordering the chicken skins (I thought I read chicken wings). They were accompanied with a honey sauce which was tasty but the whole skin thing (Yikes) I was not into. Thank goodness the bacon jam made up for it. This dish had carmelized bacon with melted brie and most Yelpers had raved about it.  We spread this delicious combination on the small baguette's they provided and experienced melt in your mouth goodness!  Next came the shrimp dunderi which came with only with two prawns and a ricotta style pasta. This was flavored with limoncello and was delicious. I think they could have spared at least six prawns since the dish ran $14!! This brings my review down to three stars.  Since we were at work we could not imbibe any alcohol although Manny the other bartender did try to tempt us. We received great, personal service which was appreciated by two first time customers.  Unfortunately, time was ticking and we had to get back to work so we were not able to try anything else although there were some other items that looked interesting. I would like to go back and sit at the chef bar as I think it might make the experience more enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Dunderi
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undone look

x31mXeFYjCzVXdcMdPDSOQ.text: Our uber driver recommended This place. When we drove up I was a little worried.  It looked a little sketchy from the outside.  Inside I was delightfully surprised.  Lunch was perfection.  Devils eggs had caviar, Mac and cheese truffles and white cheddar, Himalayan sea salt and the tater tots!!!! Everything was great!  Service was perfection.  Thank you Uber driver for this little Gem!

5svJapKVWNzfWuq4Dbbahw.text: Great food! Going again before we leave Vegas! The bacon Jam was delicious! Everything was wonderful and staff was very friendly.

fSV0BhAoU5X_0G-fvEbxmQ.text: Excellent staff, great terrace and patio. We had drinks and appetizers, which were outstanding. The staff is helpful and friendly. A little out of the way, but worth the trip.

6el9naLZUdaYw0saLILIoQ.text: You might have to look for this place a little bit but once you find it you will be Happy! Great Food, Drinks & Staff, we had a Great Experience here and can't wait to get back! I really recommend a rooftop seat if it's not too Hot Out, I cannot Wait to get back!

LFV9oMXwzNPnyYDqkB6GLA.text: I've always wanted to try this place downtown, and I was not disappointed. Fantastic food with a very hipster atmosphere. The dining is different than other restaurants because the menu is not large, and everything is a la cart, so it is meant for sharing among the people you eat with.  We ordered the rainbow cauliflower, and it was simple, yet really good. I specifically came for their mac and cheese, I saw on other yelp reviews on how good it is, and YES, this is by far the best mac and cheese I have ever tasted. I still dream about it everyday. But if you do not like truffle oil, then it's not for you. It's rich and flavorful, and it's one of their dishes that they are known for.   10/10 - will definitely be back and will try other items. If you are fond of different flavors together you will love this restaurant. Also, they put a twist on a lot of classic dishes.

IXyvUB0xnAjj-b51BTI38w.text: You should come here if you have 2 of 2 things while you're in Vegas (you will need both):  1) Mobility- take a car and drive yourself here. My friend and I spent $30 on cab fare trying to get to downtown Las Vegas with the possibility of not catching a cab ride back because cabs are not plentiful in downtown.  2) Intestinal fortitude- downtown Las Vegas is not for the faint of heart. The crowd is...eclectic which is a rather nice adjective to use. There are a lot of drunk, aggressive people in the downtown area if you happen to take a peep into the downtown strip after dining at Carson Kitchen, beware. I'm usually alright, but I was slightly uncomfortable because it was out of my element.   With that said, Carson Kitchen was great. I had a great meal here. I hope it garners more press and popularity because what the staff is putting out is nothing short but amazing.  My friend and I ordered the following:  -crispy chicken skin with smoked honey: deep fried pieces of chicken skin, lightly sprinkled with a powdery chili and dipped into a smoked honey. This was a winning combination. The texture of the chicken skin was spot on- not too hard with the right amount of crisp. I really enjoyed this dish. I do wish that the skin pieces were slightly smaller, but overall, this was excellent.  -"devil's eggs": deviled eggs topped with pancetta and caviar. The addition of fried bits of pancetta was excellent. It really balanced the soft texture of the deviled egg by giving it an extra crunch. There were also generous heaps of caviar on each egg. Wonderful.  -cocoa expresso New York strip steak: medium rare steak topped with a red wine demi. The steak was flavorful, had the right amount of chew, and perfect to the palette. This was surprisingly so good. I do wish that they were more sparing with the red wine demi because the sauce really added another dimension to the steak. Great overall main dish.  We also ordered a side of the fingerling potatoes to pair with our steak. This was a great addition because the potatoes came generously heaped with garlic. It was a winning steak and potato combination.  It's only been recent that I have ventured outside of the strip in search of food, and if you have the willingness to do so, you can find find gems like Carson Kitchen hidden in Vegas. Do yourself a favor- if you are searching for one really great meal in Vegas, make your way off the strip and into Carson Kitchen. It's a good bang for your buck ($27 per person including all of the dishes), and it helps keep the food scene in Vegas alive.

dWBS3q9Y7-HrmMveOShp_Q.text: Carson Kitchen was quite the experience. 4 of us were in town for March Madness and we went to Yelp of course to help us find a place to eat. Carson Kitchen looked like it would hit the spot. Even with a picky eater on our hands. I was a bit curious about this place as we rounded a rural street corner. Nothing very cute about this street. But to our surprise there it was. A Cute little restaurant window with the glowing ambiance inside, welcoming us to come in. As we walked through the door it was very small. I was worried. They said "A 40 minute wait." As I thought to myself "Where would we wait, and where are the other people waiting....?" The hostess that seemed to read my mind said "There is a Patio right outside this door and a roof top bar above us, you are more than welcome to grab a drink and a seat there if you would like." Did she say "roof-top bar?" That alone made this place even more exciting. We walked upstairs where we found lots of seating (unfortunately all full,) a long bar and bar top, and a list of craft cocktails, wines, and beers. The Bartender was very helpful. 2 of our friends got some very interesting cocktails, one which included egg-whites. I stuck to a trusty Pinot Grigio that the bartender recommended. We went down to the seating area, founds a couple of cute chairs, sat, drank, and chit chatted. And before we knew it our names were being called.   We sat at a cute little table next to the window looking out to the street. Our waitress explained that this was a family affair. Items are meant to be shared. So we did just that. We started off with the Bacon Jam with Toasted Baguettes (PRO TIP: Get the extra Baguettes for a dollar a head of time. You will need them) The Jam came out sizzling, sweet and tangy, gooey and so good. The Baguettes were not too crunchy, as to tear your mouth apart, and were warm. We also started with the Crispy Chicken Skin with a Smoked Honey dipping sauce. Skins were large, crispy, and also don't tear up your mouth. But the Smoked Honey.... I could put that sh*t on anything. I even kept the left over sauce, just in case.   For the Entree's we got the Co-co Espresso New York Strip, cooked perfectly and well seasoned.  The Beef Belly Sliders, Juicy and tender. I had never had Beef Belly, only Pork, but this was just as delicious. It came with 3 sliders. It was plenty to share. Along with Spicy Sweet Potato Tatar Totes. Not really very spicy but very yummy. Our picky eater got the Gyro Tacos. She had them to herself but said she loved every bit.   We then finished our meal with 2 desserts. The Bourbon Fudge Brownies with Brown Butter Bacon Ice Cream. I didn't eat too much of this, as it was very rich for my taste. The rest of the group found this to be very tasty but we all agreed we could not taste much bacon. And Lastly the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding with 3 Rum Carmel, Vanilla Ice Cream. This had the consistency of bread pudding with the exact taste of a glazed donut. It was so interesting. Not one bit of it was left. We almost licked the bowl.   This restaurants was one of the highlights of our 3 day trip. We really enjoyed our experience. The staff was really great. You could see them all working their tail off. The interior was rustic, yet modern. Very small, but we all enjoyed that fact. You get more attention from the staff and the kitchen has time to get every detail right. We look forward to our next trip to Vegas and coming back for more delicious creations by Carson Kitchen.

yVHhcTaLPgEkV6pfX6g6mQ.text: Outstanding spot!  These guys took such good care of us :)  The food is excellent, sooooo gooood!  The drinks or stiff and well crafted.   The bar is NICE.  And the staff is awesome, they were top notch and all class.   We will be back. A little gem in downtown fer sure ;)  The chicken sandwich is just bomb.

35WRnXeT7JlQj3aIZTHMVA.text: Sitting outside on the top deck on a beautiful Saturday afternoon eating delicious food and enjoying everything possible. Tempura green beans, veal meatballs and crispy chicken skins. Let's just say we are not watching our diet today.Eating at this place surely can make your day better.

uI9TU9-3F2HoOE4pZJoNFw.text: This restaurant is literally a hidden gem in old Vegas. The food was incredible, their attention to detail is unmatched! If you are looking for good, authentic food, leave the strip and come here! So so glad we took a chance!

drZ6gCRA9qw9O7RPegGwgg.text: If you are in Vegas just GO HERE. I wish I could give this place more stars!   Everything about this place was wonderful. The atmosphere is fantastic, the seats are comfortable, the customer service is top notch... and the food literally brought tears to my eyes. We ate until we could eat no more, and both of us had multiple drinks. We walked out for about $65-80 with tip. I fully expected the check to be over $100 and wouldn't have complained it is was.   My husband and I travel a lot and we don't tend to go to the same place more than once on a trip... but after our first experience here we just had to come back! The 2nd night was just as good as the first. The waitress remembered us and made us feel like regulars - which is rare when you are from out of town. The food and drinks were just as good as the night before, and the owner even came and chatted it up with us for about 10 minutes just because he liked us.   I have never felt so sad to leave a restaurant. It felt like we were leaving an old friend. I wish I could pick this place up and move it to Seattle.   Probably the best all around restaurant experience we have ever had.

1Grylu4IIHw8StHn_hofpw.text: One of my favorite places downtown.  Simple, yet complex and quite the experience.  Superior management takes this place to the next level.  A symphony of perfection!

nG_0bA0SUM11VTcbHBkTew.text: We ordered the Turkey burger and is the best tasting burger I've ever ate .... just perfect ratio of meatiness and slaw!!!

-31AnlJkoAVWG_BYe1f5KQ.text: Let me first start off saying this place was AH-MAZING!!!!!! Came here two weeks ago for vacation!  The vibe in this place I would say is pretty hipster. Before I get into the nitty gritty of this place I would like to say that the hostess was rude. My boyfriend and I only thought she was rude to us but finding out later that she was pretty much rude to everyone that had entered the restaurant. Just for future reference don't just toss menus on the table and walk away if customers don't know where their going and you continue to ignore and talk to your co-workers.  Alright now down to the menu! Let me just say that you HAVE to get the fried chicken crisps! They're so crunchy and especially dipped in honey!!!  Next on the menu we got the bacon jam this was something that I thought was good but not amazing because the bacon jam has some spice to it and as you keep eating it feels as if the spice builds up!  Gyro Tacos were so good this helped even out the two heavy appetizers that we first got so it's a good touch to your meal!  Last but not least the Ox tail Risotto, the ox tail was tender and went so well with the risotto. But this was a bit too salty. If it was less salty this dish would've been perfect!   As for our attentive and sweet waiter Dakota, you were the biggest sweetheart to us and literally made sure we were doing great during our meal here. Literally please ask for him if you do come here to be your server! He's awesome!

EdeaCNxhckXwQf6bW-3AsA.text: I called because I wasn't sure if they did happy hour , they don't. I then asked to make a reservation, mainly because I knew first Friday evenings pack everything in down town. They don't take reservations for a party of 4 , apparently that's too small for them.  Perhaps if it was delivered differently I would have a different opinion.  Regardless, I still went because we planned to try with friends who have also never been. I also live in downtown so I am always curious of the culinary scene.   They take your name down, how many in your party, tell you the wait time, and then to come back. They don't take your number they don't call or they don't text. I found this frustrating. Something needs to be done about this.  After having to wander around down town and make many laps in this blazing heat, we finally were seated. I have to say 5 stars for the service from our waitress. Wish I could remember her name she was so nice and pleasant and very suggestive. We ordered many things as our appetites grew.  The deviled eggs with caviar is great, the gyro tacos ok. The fried chicken skin good , didn't care for the jam butter with bread. The turkey mango burger was sweet. The tarter tots were delicious. I would come back again when it's slow or if I have a large party enough for this restaurant to take my reservation.   Again, my only complaint I have is my experience about the whole reservation thing and no text or call back not even a buzzer.

I also had some of the chicken skins and a bite of the Mac & cheese. The 5 cheeses in the Mac & cheese... divine! The chicken skins were like an even better pork rind. Delicious! I can't wait to eat here again!!!

0K-KkzxTRRxgAxrLtfvwkA.text: I've been there a few times and the consensus is... it's absolutely amazing!! This local spot in Downtown LV is a must for everyone! There is usually a wait, but it's worth it!! The staff is so friendly and the food is so yummy! I ordered the bacon jam, chicken skins, devil's eggs, short rib grilled cheese, and the glazed donut bread pudding! Everything was flavorful! And I'll be back to try everything soon!

A6qXcRnf2J6-1YT1Bntb-A.text: This place has the most amazing food! I highly recommend the burnt brisket ends, bacon jam Brie & the donut bread pudding.  The flavors in all of the dishes we had were fantastic! Service is great too! Local or visitor...  DEFINITELY check this place out. Such a nice chance of pace from the strip.

tOEkxBbqf8SsqECkRxyiDg.text: This place is fantastic!! A hidden gem!! The staff make you feel right at home. Every dish is prepared with love and executed to sheer perfection. The menu options work harmoniously with one another. My favorite was the black rice oxtail risotto. It was everything a risotto should be-creamy and full of cheese-only "grand-er"-being intertwined with the tender, flavorful, beefy shreds of ox tail..topped with a delicious gremolata...It's heaven in a bowl! Be sure to save a little room for dessert. I can't wait to visit Las Vegas and dine here again and again. You have stolen this foodies heart..lol...

RksTM4nD3vj07qnK2fqLSg.text: First off - my boyfriend was absolutely thrilled with his dishes. He ordered the deviled eggs, mac n cheese, & the chicken thighs. He had absolutely zero complaints & that is UNHEARD of coming from him (he's a chef) LOL Any way - he wanted to leave because I didn't see too many vegan options for myself, but I insisted we stayed cause I thought this would be perfect for him, & I was certainly right! As for me, I got the rainbow cauliflower & tater tots cause I was really worried about disliking the other options (not that they have very many cause most of their dishes have dairy.) So this place is GREAT for vegetarians & carnivores but not so exciting for vegans. I'm just glad my bf finally left a restaurant happy for once!

rl8VfotakJYQIY4U_NM2Vw.text: This place is on point! Food was absolutely delicious! Prices are a little high but totally worth it.. hidden gem in downtown Vegas. Parking lot right across as well as street parking in front. Looks vague outside but inside is immaculate! Will be back again. Butter Burger and Bacon Jelly

q6mA8zSaLacQKtxKoml-kw.text: We reserved a table for 2 for dinner in anticipation of our trip, having seen the amazing reviews.  Our table was actually two seats at the expo line.  OMG we could not have had better seats.  It was amazing to watch the kitchen line work and see all the plates coming out.  The girl working the expo line was super friendly and told us about all the dishes.  The manager was very enthusiastic and asked us how everything was several times.  Our server was awesome.  The food was delicious.  The deviled eggs are a necessary order item.  We also had the meatballs, fried green beans, bacon jam, and it was all fantastic.  We ended with the bread pudding.  I am not a dessert person and I inhaled it.  Just an exceptional experience all around.  BTW the ambiance is so wonderful because you can tell it is a locals place.  Not touristy at all, which was refreshing.  150% recommend.

_j58iX36MsfUuxfwK7DdBQ.text: What an absolute DELIGHT to dine at Carson Kitchen!!! Everything we had was delicious and we practically had all of the appetizers, the Red Snapper, as well as the donut glazed bread pudding. I am NOT a fan of green beans OR bread pudding but they have converted me!! I'm a new woman lol. I'm not sure who our server was supposed to be but we ended up with Roman and he gave great drunk recommendations. We were three happy women at the end of our meal and dessert. You HAVE to go to this place.

a4Wiqqm0KCGq59Et0hGe1A.text: I've had Carson Kitchen on my bookmark page for the last couple years and I'm so so so happy I finally was able to experience it.  Located right next to Downtown Fremont, this is a must stop from now on if I'm coming downtown.    1.  Everything on the menu is under $20, including the NY Strip which was cooked perfectly.  2.  Ambience level 1000.  The dining area is small, but with chairs lined around the kitchen and bar it works really well.   Small open room where you can see everything going on.  Very hipster atmosphere, I loved sipping on my Towns End near fire pit out back while we waited for our table.  3.  All of the food we sampled was amazing.  The restaurant encourages family style dining, so we ordered several things off the menu and let the entire table sample a little of everything.  Definitely the way to go here.    4.  Extremely well mixed and delicious cocktail creations.  The cocktails are a bit pricey at $10-$13 but worth it.  Everything I tried was really refreshing and tasted amazing, really can't wait to come back and try everything I didn't have on my first visit.   A couple of the highlights for me were the Fried Chicken Skins and Honey, the perfect balance of sweet and salty.  I was really impressed by the Fish Fillet sandwich also, so goooood!!   If you're looking for something delicious with a really cool atmosphere that will not break the bank, you should definitely come check out Carson Kitchen I can't wait to come back.

TPpaBaY86LnwC7bmuP8mdg.text: Without a doubt, one of the best restaurants in Vegas, and that is saying a lot.  Tapas style comfort food, amazing drinks, excellent staff.  Also, it is fun to get off the strip and close to downtown.  Kendall behind me he bar was fantastic, fun, and professional.  My second time here, and it has never failed to satisfy my foodie sensibilities.  Lol... foodie sensibilities.

rKivcB3elwuCkM0XqLVirg.text: I went last Saturday and it was amazing. I forgot to tell the host I wanted to sit on the roof patio. He was so nice! He made it happen in just a matter of minutes. So may people from the chefs to the bartender upstairs to my server who she was amazing, all of them made me and my guest feel so welcome. And as always the food was soooo good!!! We got the deviled eggs of course, the asparagus and my steak was as always sooo good! Shrimp dish was off the hook as always, and I know I'm leaving a few things out. Sorry it's been almost a week, but save room for the bread pudding! Perrrfect crisp and soft balance, with the sweet sauce. Wow! As always thank you CK for an amazing meal, service and ambiance!!!!

MNLCunvoF9LdiVSrZBltRA.text: Great creative food. Been here 4 times and is delicious every time  Only reason for three stars instead of five:  Last visit, I cracked a tooth on a piece of bone.  I didn't want anything because of it, but mentioned it to the manager AND the waiter, as they both were at the table asking about our experience when it happened.  Neither responded, except for asking if I was done with the plate.  Plus, we waited 45 minutes for a table , while there was two 'reserved' tables. Neither was occupied when we left 1 1/2 hours later. It is a small, cozy place, but they kept saying we couldn't sit at the tables for 4 when we only had three people in our party. The ironic thing was we were seated eventually seated on a table for 6.   I'll probably return, but I'll not go on weekends or holidays. Maybe it's the extra pressure, or something, but I might go back again weekdays.

Qin4cJR7D4p9_or6WLpGDw.text: I felt like we lucked into the most amazing seats in the house--at the bar right in front of one of the chefs who was responsible for the cold dishes and flatbreads. He even took some time to chat with us. Watching the three chefs work together was enough to keep me in my seat all night. Talk about a well-oiled machine!   Our food was pretty good, but the theme was that it was all a little spicy (which is usually not an issue for me). Since we got to watch them make things up close and personal, we noticed either paprika or cayenne as a frequent addition, and we tasted it, too. The best thing we ate was the short rib grilled cheese, which was absolutely delicious and buttery. We also split the bacon jam (the spicy element here was in the liquid base), which came with lots of bread for dipping, but probably less brie than I was expecting. We also got the rainbow cauliflower.  They have a lovely back patio that was nice to relax on while we were waiting for a table. The staff was super pleasant, and the prices were perfectly reasonable. The food came out tapas style (and quickly). I'm glad we came here if for no other reason than our awesome view!

wLz55JX2mL1KJNRxulaI8Q.text: Everything is amazing. Here's what you have to order:  - Bacon jam with baked brie on a toasted baguette - Crispy chicken skins with smoked honey - Tempura green beans with pepper jelly cream cheese - Black rice + oxtail risotto - Gyro tacos with lamb, tzatziki, feta, and tomato - Short rib grilled cheese on sourdough with gouda - Glazed donut bread pudding  The black rice and oxtail risotto is an absolute must and so is the bread pudding. I'd highly recommend try the bacon jam, crispy chicken, and tempura green beans if you're ordering apps.

iItq7k8tjKmXWiZ-3svqeg.text: Just had the most amazing dinner. The staff is absolutely amazing, the food is epic, and I still can't believe the reasonable price. Honestly the staff made us feel like we were the most important people in the restaurant. The kitchen staff has a wonderful energy and work relationship...they just flow. Each dish, especially the salads, were like little pieces of art. I can't say enough wonderful things about this place. I have spent $1000 on dinner before and this was still better. Thank you all for a wonderful night and an amazing meal!

RsvtRYpPmh0lui2YjyL7Hw.text: Great place to get out of the heat and enjoy some unique food and cocktails made with care and knowledge by a friendly staff.

ONFA_YyNm5MnWTQ_Bmo5Jw.text: Reviewed this restaurant before we came to Vegas and put it on our list to try.  We were not let down. My husband and I shared a pizza, risotto, bacon jam bruschetta and a steak! It was way to much food for the two of us but I was eating the leftovers later that night!! The staff was very attentive and friendly! The prices are fare for the quality. Overall a must if you are by Fremont street!

_eM188SNoPPpVu61HcLpvA.text: A good place to come eat and chat with friends. We came with empty stomachs on a Monday afternoon around 4-5 on Labor Day to try the place we have seen so many reviews about. We were seated right away and were attended to promptly. Service was good but the portions were very small compared to the price we paid and some of the stuff was a bit salty but the flavor was good.   We ordered:  Tempura Green Beans: This was the absolute surprise of the day. Tempura green beans are exactly how they sound but the pepper jelly cream cheese they served it with was so good!. The creaminess of the cheese with the sweetness of the pepper jelly complimented the mild flavor of the green beans. Although a bit oily for me, it was nevertheless, my favorite dish. Good portion  Cocoa- Expresso crusted Steak- It was very salty in my opinion. The crust itself was very salty on the end pieces but for the middle slices, it worked well. The meat was good. I would have preferred it a bit more rare but it was good the way they served it.   Rabbit Ragu- This was very good. The rabbit was cooked well with crunchy pieces of pancetta? or was it rabbit? Either way, the sauce worked well with the meat and complimented the spaghetti squash. Portion was super small in my opinion for the $12? $14 dollars I paid. If i really crave it, i would order it again but I think I'll opt for something else next time.   Hawaiian Flat Bread- Flatbread served with spiced rum pineapple and ham, sprinkled with chives. It was alright. The pineapple was delicious. It was a very bold and sweet flavor. The ham however, was salty and overpowered the pineapple which was a shame. Also a bit pricey but it's Vegas so I can't say anything there.   Overall it was a good experience. Good food although a bit salty and great customer service. Will be back to try other food on the menu!

dkSjwWMq2-ddWlBVJUfzfA.text: This place was amazing! I came with four people right after my wedding and everyone there was extremely friendly. They took care of us, and the food was to die for! Such interesting combinations and options you wouldn't expect them to compliment each other but BAM just flavors never combined before. I highly recommend this place to anyone!

hfk-vk9mjJNICbm_mEPkZQ.text: This place is one of my favorites! So much good food it's easy to go overboard. If you can try to sit at Bridgets table. Her light heart and amazing customer service will guide you through the amazing menu.

gVjr5WIDiTt5jAEsjhhNGA.text: GOOD Staff is really friendly and it reflects in the service. No complaints about our servers.  My girl dragged me here after work, since we were on he same side of town.  Last time were here meeting friends a month ago it was like a 45 minute wait time.  So wasn't too happy and expecting the same...We were having a way early dinner so no long wait time (530pm)...yeeessss! 10minutes tops wait in back patio. Upstairs wasn't open yet.   The steak was pretty bomb.  I thought it was gonna be a little thin cheap cut of meat.  It was rather delicious, medium rare to perfection and comes precut for sharing ( as all the dishes do )  The green bean dish was also pretty tasty and a different spin than the norm with light thin breading that flakes off.  Comes with a side of bell pepperish cheese thing for dipping.  The mushroom and spinach pizza was awesome...even threw a few pieces of the steak on top...yummmm...carnivore style! If my girl who is usually a 2 bites and box it for home girl...actually finished it and no leftovers...well then it's pretty darn good.   THE BAD. Wait times can be ridiculous... seriously finding parking then having to do alternative plans when you get their with friends is a downer.   The beet salad was tasty but it was wee size.  I think maybe the portion size should be rethought by the kitchen.  Loved that delicious little nugget of cheese deliciousness that it comes with.    P.s.  All in all a great early dinner and ambiance..  I think their was about 36 people in the 40 room dining space.  So pretty packed for that time but no serious wait times from the kitchen bringing food out.  Great job to the Carson Cocina! =)
