saqoBSmRvGysNZhRLcUsbg.text: We went to Carson Kitchen tonight to celebrate our friends birthday. We were a group of 12 and I was so impressed with everything from start to finish. We were seated immediately and our server came over right away. Our server Manny made suggestions on the menu - all of them were excellent. The manager also came over and was so sweet and gracious. If you are Vegas, this place is a great place to go. We absolutely loved it!

NNgx3RPw07KFXSQjZZlOGA.text: This is the spot in old town, about as real as it gets away from the strip ie real people, real food. The vouvrey fine is a fantastic selection when it comes to white wine; the Barbera was  tough as a red. The meats were done just right, so was the seafood - the beets were great too! Overall, a great spot !

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent seafood choice: sea bass. Although it tastes like a branzino.

065PBPCm5GaFuBNzFOebHQ.text: This is a hidden gem! The food is AMAZING!!! Beet salad, bacon jam, tempura green beans, cocoa espresso NY strip and baked mac & cheese. Everything was delicious !! Do not miss this spot! The food is to die for!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daaaammmnn Daniel! Vodka sage lemon and simple syrup! Legit!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura green beans!

A7zpPF1BfmfPG2ulYBSKPQ.text: My wife and I just tried this spot on a rare rainy Friday night here in Vegas. Because of the rain we had to sit inside, which is fairly small but well laid out. It's also mostly communal seating, which I'm not a fan of, but the tables are wide enough that you aren't shoved up in someone else's face. Unfortunately, the tables only have about 6" of overhang and are completely solid underneath, which is a bit uncomfortable when you're over 6' tall.  The food is great and the prices are reasonable for what you get. We started with the crispy chicken skins, which were expectedly amazing. I mean, come on! All our lives we're told not to eat the skin (which we all know is the best part) because it's "not healthy".  Well here, they give you a whole bowl of just that with a side of smoked honey. It's fantastic.   Then we got the Bacon Jam, which is arguably what made us want to eat here in the first place. My wife absolutely loved it, but shockingly, I wasn't overwhelmed by it for some reason. It's a sizzling cast iron plate of bacon and brie cheese, how could I not love that?!? Oh well, that's a mystery for another time.  Next we shared the Jerk Turkey Burger, which was back to amazing, for both of us this time. It's flavorful, juicy, tender and just spicy enough. The burger came with a side of spicy tater tots which were delicious also.   Finally we shared the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding. This was decidedly mediocre for both of us. Just a big, doughy, plop of undercooked cake soaked in butter and caramel. Sounds like it would be great but it had next to no flavor.   For drinks we both had "Drinks With the Mrs" which were excellent. Refreshing but just strong enough.   Overall, it's a solid 4 stars and we'd definitely come again to try some more of the menu.

jcQzaGaVtgyoWtmBi0XwPQ.text: I have mixed feelings about this place, but the good outweigh the bad, so I definitely recommend anyone to try it.  The first time I went here was for dinner.  I got the rabbit ragu and my husband got the oxtail risotto.  Both were absolutely delicious, but very small portions.  Now, the prices were $12 and $14, respectively, which I thought were a little steep for the amount of food that came with it.  A friend of ours got the beet salad ($8) and I was again shocked at the small portion size.  We also had a few cocktails ($12 each) which were good, but again a small pour for the price.  I also remember it being extremely LOUD in there because of the design/layout/building materials.  Our waiter had to lean in and ask us multiple times what we had said and I felt like I was shouting at him.  So my first impression was: very good food, but kinda expensive for what you get.  Second time we came for lunch.  I got the fried green tomato sandwich which comes with tater tots.  My husband got the gyro tacos.  Then we shared the bread pudding for dessert.  The sandwiches and sharing plate prices are much more on point with serving size.  The fried green tomato sandwich was really quite scrumptious and had this nice crab ravigote on it.  The sandwich plus tots was $10.  Cheaper than the entrees, with more substance!  The gyro tacos came with three to the order,  and were also $10.  The tacos were mucho spicy, beware!  Also, my husband got a craft beer in a bottle for only like $5.  In conclusion, I like this place for lunch type food and beer.  Dinner food and the cocktails are just a little too expensive for me.  Whatever you get will be delicious.  AND I also just found out they have a rooftop patio which will be delightful!

Jnp82Mx7kfApfieqREtoWQ.text: I came here on a monday afternoon, pretty slow, only 2 other people in there at the time.  The set up is cool... small 2 and 4 tops around the perimeter and larger snaking tables that move into the bar hat are more "family style" which was cool, all 4 of us (me and the hubs + the two other people) were at the family style table and struck up some convo.   on to the food We had the crispy chicken skin, the italian sausage flatbread and the risotto.   Now the hubs mistakenly ordered the skins thinking it would be a chicken finger-esque type thing.  They were spiced, not too salty and served with a dish of honey.  After eating the first i wasn't too sure, but they grew on me... sweet and savory, I would get it again.   I had the flatbread, yummy, decent size... I recall it being called "spicy Italian sausage flatbread" without mention of the broccoli that was on it.  Very... Different... I tied it.. and ended up picking any of the larger pieces off.   Hubbs had the risotto... Ox tail risotto.  Now being italian to me risotto is strictly made with arborio rice.  The end.  This was made with like a black wild rice... It had a bit more of  a bite than I would like, and that wild rice flavor... but was decent.  I would not get that again, but I know I'm very  picky when it comes to italian foods.    Being monday afternoon I wasn't trying to get hammered, but did have the only apple hard cider they had, Ace i believe? It was the best cider I've ever had.    and whatever you do, don't park in the lot across the street! insta-tow will get your car before you've crossed the street

b-TZ5DnDWvO5OumzaI4XdQ.text: Very flavorful food.  Cool ambiance.  Service had a little room for improvement - 20 minutes to bring me the wine I ordered; hostess was a little short with me when I asked if I could sit at the bar (four open seats) and snottingly told me that all seats had at least a 20 minute wait.  Vegas restaurants  seem to have an attitude that you're lucky to be there these days.  That's True to a lesser degree in Chicago, but Vegas is more extreme in this way.  But, as my skin gets a bit thicker, it's not worth docking a star for.  Just be aware that they have a bit of a smug arrogance to their approach to dealing with customers.  Overall, it was a pleasant-ish experience and I would give it one more try.

yqHqUGOV2zQ8l71u8nnSxA.text: We tried CK a few months ago and liked the food but not the overall ambiance or vibe.  It is a small place so doesn't take much for it to be crowded.  We wound up eating at the bar and the deviled eggs, tater tots and Secret Sunday Chicken Sandwich and drinks were all good.  The service was fair but since place is so small you just can observe and feel like they are constantly in the weeds.

k6SqkeIXKbjjZ65YadBeJA.text: I didn't find the food to be mind blowing, but it was good, flavorful, and I think I would eat here again.  I just don't think I will be a frequent diner.   I got the fried green tomato (crab) sandwich.  It was pretty good, 3.5/5.  The crab was seasoned with an odd herb combo which I thought may have been rosemary?  It was still good, just different to my pallet.  The others in my party ordered the bacon jam, the sliders, and gyro tacos, and they even comped us a free Mac n Cheese because they brought a plate out late.  Everything was pretty enjoyable overall.  My one complaint would be the tater tots.  They are seasoned very heavily, almost overkill.  The beer menu was a little different as well, probably could be expanded upon to better match and compliment the food flavors.  Venue has a industrial loft inspiration with interesting lighting and exposed brick, and the upstairs patio was raved about.  Very downtown Vegas vibe for sure.  The staff was great and super welcoming, friendly and willing to accommodate.

vTMvEaLiDokah9d5diOutg.text: Don't waste your time and money eating here. I had visited the restaurant previously and the food was good, mostly have the appetizers. Decided to go for dinner and  it was not very good. Some of the main plates could not be ordered since they didn't have the product. I ordered the oxtail risotto which was terrible tasting. Another person across ordered the same dish and she also was disappointment. The risotto was not cooked properly.

5_gHTGZox2iI9pmb1xjoPw.text: Carson's Kitchen is my wife and my go-to on a Friday night. The vibes are great - we always end up sitting at the bar and get great service. When it first opened, service was super slow, but we've gone a few times since and it's definitely gotten better.   Used to not be a fan of "small/social" plates but I think Carson's is what made me turn the corner. Perhaps the best thing on the menu/best thing I've probably eaten in a verrry long time is the Bacon Jam. Sorry arteries. Served with some toasted brioche toast, it is just amazing. And it's just as good as leftovers. Burgers and the mac and cheese are great too.  So much flavor in such a small restaurant. Will be back. Again and again.

1nYt2uPP8XZfWJSP-CPPPg.text: Came in with coworkers after work. Great spot recommended by the roomie. Great tempura green beans, crispy chicken skin, and beef wellington empanada. I gotta try the sliders next. The Irish bartender made a great beer recommendation too. Bomb.  Edit: Sliders, tempura green beans, veal meatballs. All bomb.

hOWwS6f0Ha8yu7AiaVEZ2w.text: Not only some of the best service in Las Vegas, also the BEST food I've had here in years!!! Get the bacon jam, Brie and baguette- it will change your life it's so good!!!! Also, if you can, sit at 1 of the 4 seats at the kitchen - best seat in the house!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BACON JAM and Brie with baguette---- BEST THING EVERY!!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato pie with beer stout marshmallow
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unreal broccoli salad

CtKdjvH7a-rjrfP8gMiTlQ.text: One of the BEST dining experiences ever!!!!! Came around 6 on a Friday night eeeekkk..  for a very over due date night with hubby. Was lucky enough to get the corner seats at the kitchen counter (guess we had locals luck for a hot minute). Wasn't too crowded just yet.  DAKOTA was the bomb diggity. Not sure who speaks like that, but...well he was just awesome and so was Michelle and the line cook who makes the cold dishes and desserts.  Everything was perfect!! And I definitely dont say that about a lot. I don't usually like beets and their best salad was to die for. So much so I actually had to order another. A stinking beet salad!!!  I was also obsessed with the red snapper and that sauce. Oh my gosh that freaking sauce!!! And to top it off the donut for dessert was superb. The atmosphere was quaint but super hipster almost felt like I didn't belong, big everyone was sooooo cool and kind! We had a great time and will definitely be back. Can't wait to share some more delish eats!

l_uqq1RtO-KjrZuEHOR27A.text: The food was fantastic and the people and my server were all good vibes. My only complaint is the hostess, actually!! I got the impression that she wanted us to leave based on the wait but when I told her we preferred the rooftop, she attempted to seat us in a cramped corner on the bottom floor at the bar. When reiterating that rooftop was preferred, again I felt like she wanted to dissuade us by saying it would be an additional 20 mins to the 30 we already waited. We were willing to wait, then miraculously there was seating available right at that moment... Seating at 4 tables actually. Then when we left, she didn't make eye contact, but the hostess next to her spoke and gave a happy smile. So I acknowledged how I appreciated her for actually speaking. All in all, great food and service. Only The hostess had an off vibe.

VP-l9ft_CvgDsWtHk-c8Kw.text: My go to downtown spot. Everything on the menu is good but they have the best Mac & Cheese in LV! You have to try this!   The sign they have in their window calling out the people behind them towing cars is also very Las Vegas! LOVE IT!

tUD8gzvHiZgURG8gN424-Q.text: I've tried just about everything on the menu!!! Nothing will disappoint you. I wish I had taken pictures. The food is not only beautiful and creative, but everything is perfectly seasoned and bursts with flavor. One of my favorites, for sure! Suggestion- don't just order one thing. Order many and share!!

afhO_QIaIGqGf5qTVOM2eg.text: A great spot in Downtown Las Vegas. I love the atmosphere. Service has been great the three times I went. Loved the Mac and Cheese. Had the Fried Green Tomato sandwich every time because... I might be addicted.   I tried a few cocktails as well and each was great.   Great for date night, friend dinners, or dining alone at the bar. I want to go back on a weekend to enjoy the upstairs patio when it's open.

cNxFo4U6H7-1ymP2Gpb8Mg.text: Foodies beware - you will LOVE this place. We had to wait a bit to get seats (a good sign). Unfortunately, the bar upstairs was cold - the weather AND the service (we waited ten minutes at the bar to place our order, then another five for the lady to turn 180 degrees, fetch 2 beers from the fridge, then turn back around). Fortunately, things got better very quickly after. Roman (our waiter) was really outstanding. He was fast, courteous, and extremely helpful. We ordered 6 plates for two people to eat (this was way too much for, and Roman did warn us it was a lot). But the tastes were great. The steak was absolutely the best!!! At first, we thought the seating was odd, but we struck up conversations with other folks there, and it was quickly very comfortable and even fun. The journal books at the end are a nice touch too. Overall very pleased, and will be back next time I'm in town!

Kxo6_KqOQEv_cgEHCewnlw.text: Went in for the soft opening today, excellent menu, friendly staff, beautiful decor. The empanadas were my fav, everything else we had on the menu had excellent flavors and presentation too.  Will be back!

5qspq0z7ybnyep8HM78rhA.text: Our server Geronimo rocks! Most hospitable and attentive service everrrrr! My two girlfriends and I came here for a late lunch and sat on the upper deck patio on a cool sunny day. We tried as much as we could -- the watermelon salad, the rainbow cauliflower, baked mac & cheese, turkey burger, stroganoff, and the short rib sliders. I washed it down with a nice cold, floral wheat lager (which I'm so bummed I forgot the name Geronimo set me up with ). Let me tell you-- you are missing out if you don't go HAM and try a little of everything. All of the above were great. Watermelon salad -- light, fresh, zesty and with the perfect amount of feta cheese. Rainbow cauliflower -- buttery, crunchy, zesty and visually appealing. Baked mac and cheese -- creamy, tasted like white cheddar Mac and cheese baked with crunchies on it. Stroganoff -- beefy, melt-in-your-mouth type of sensation *just get it*. Short rib sliders -- bite size, meaty, sweet caramelized oniony goodness. I would like to emphasize on the amaaaazing tater tots they serve with the sliders! Have you had hot fries when you were a kid? NOSTALGIA once you pop one of these in your mouth (yeah that's what she said). But no really the seasoning is on point. I have to admit these are THE BEST tater tots I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l4wf_U1kU8yCY3Tnuf53uw.text: Went there last sunday 11/2/14 around lunch time. Husband had fried green tomato burger and I had the oxtail risotto. We split the bacon jam...which was so good. Imagine tiny bits of carmelized bacon with barbecue sauce topped with melted cheese. Yum! Minus one star cuz I found three pieces of ox bones in the risotto....ouch :(

AdVQWfilr0M7amBpnb2Mjw.text: Firstly, hats off to chef Charlene for making a kick-ass mushroom flatbread. That thing was amazing.   What really left me drooling and wanting to return was the bacon jelly. I doubt humans have before or will ever again invent a better reason for existing on this earth.  The atmosphere near sundown on the rooftop is definitely something to appreciate. It left an intimate setting for my group and I and made the whole experience something to look forward to repeating on our next trip to Vegas.  P.S. Thanks to Matt the manager for coming to our table and making sure all was well. Great staff.

MOEkYDsGB6GIp3XOnSNS4g.text: This is the second time I've been here. We were in the area and I remember it being tasty so thought I'd try it a second time. It didn't disappoint. Last time I had a cocktail that was Delish, it was called drinks with the ms.  I just had a glass of Sauvignon blanc this visit. We ordered the chicken skins (omg), killer shrimp and short rib stroganoff. All were delish. Our server was pleasant and attentive. We'll return for sure.

KzIxFmle2dTabO9PefHD1g.text: My fav local spot when I visit vegas. Fun, chill vibes, great staff, amazing drinks and even better food. this place is a hidden gem. Its small, so a reservation is probably a good idea! Really enjoyed the bacon jam, the rainbow cauliflower, the mushroom flatbread, mac n cheese, and trout.  everything i've had here has been delicious!

VYb2THZHMQiXbsE12IcXmQ.text: Such a small and cozy restaurant, but still an amazing hidden treasure! It seems pricey but the work that goes into each dish is well worth it! I ordered the gyro tacos, bacon jam, watermelon salad, and the crab cake sliders. Each dish was wonderful (my favorite was between the tacos and the sliders!) I highly recommend Carson's Kitchen! Also, the check "book" is so unique! A must have in the Vegas area!

VBbvIEmo_2WlkY9OQXJujw.text: Thank you Yelp for helping us find the best downtowns restaurant! The food is unique and delicious; love the social plate concept. Manager Michael Martinez and server Roman made certain our experience would be a highlight of our time in Las Vegas. Don't miss the opportunity to try this gem, and say hello to Michael from the Carters! #michaelmartinez #bourbonfudgebrowniebrownbuttericecream

dKas0SYeODZbrxwnaLKDCA.text: Really good food! Very unique menu items but all the things I have tried are good. The gyro tacos are delicious. The rainbow cauliflower is really tasty and fun - since it's actually rainbow. The crispy chicken skins with honey are very strange but still good too. Staff is always friendly too. Cool atmosphere. Definitely a cool place to check out if you're in the area and want something fun to eat!!

q4nCs9JnAPlrL2Hr-CI6tg.text: This is a cool little place in downtown but, for me, didn't live up to the hype. I had the killer shrimp and the cauliflower, which were ok, but drenched in sauce and seasoning. Like most places in Vegas, way overpriced for what you get and decent at best service.

OXbADVleLpF4MrMYTBSUJA.text: I have had the pleasure of eating here 6 times now, and I felt as though a review was in order. I have been here for two of my birthdays, couple of business meetings, and a couple dinners outside when the weather was nice. The food, the atmosphere, the service, all have been great. No matter what you decide on for your entree, you must always get the Crispy Chicken Skins, and the Veal Meatballs. You'll be happy you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Okay. I may be a little partial to the name.

bS2I41acbg1Fsx_X4Cn4mg.text: It is great to know that our reviews are being seen by management and the owners. I was so pleased with the passion of the owner to reach out and have a discussion about our visit. I am happy to update my review knowing my voice did not go unherd. As we were not a fan of a couple items on the menu I know you cannot please everyone. I am blown away by the customer service of the staff and owner. A lot of businesses could learn a thing or two. #supportlocal

MsHFGnSEREl72gkds1FCfA.text: My wife and I shared a truly wonderful meal!  From the Brie w/ bacon jam to the Veal meatballs, every plate was exceptional in taste and execution. The service was fast and friendly and we were lucky to be seated at the counter were we could watch the chefs work their magic. Chef John was also super cool and fun to talk to.  Carson Kitchen is also a terrific value, we had 4 plates and a bottle of Malbec all for under $100- we will definitely be back!

xRhC11_2scXpGA7jfl5CXw.text: I had been to Carson Kitchen quite some time ago so I felt it was time to revisit.  Still the same cool, hip vibe.  Same amazing service that I remember from last time.  This time I noticed quite a few menu changes.  Very welcome menu changes!!  We ordered the deviled eggs, veal meatballs, gyro tacos, pesto margherita flatbread, young beets and baked mac and cheese.  All extremely good and very filling.  Delicious!  It's not an inexpensive place to eat, but a very good one.  If you're looking for something a bit different and fun, give Carson Kitchen a try!  You won't be disappointed!

e8_ae6_8i4jG48n-4smLWQ.text: Used to spend about $1500.00 a month here when it first opened but like all businesses downtown they tried something new, and changed the menu. They quality is steadily declining. Seems that people who are friends of employees get their food faster, the person who got special treatment and I know each other. The shrimp dish they added to the menu tastes like crap. Last time I'll be here. Bye Felicia

IuW1uWydFhX8uwJ3X-J_OQ.text: Holy moly! Where do I start?! The food here- divine! The service- amazing. We rocked up without booking and were told 45min wait, we decided to wait and they say us out the back next to a fire. After 1 drink our table was ready. We sat at the bar where the bar man is also your waiter. He was very personable and helpful- we took his recommendation and ordered the macaroni cheese and bacon spread. Both were incredible. Very well done

FZTk9JBpJDGTaIIZQbYA9w.text: Mind blowing. Bacon jam with truffle Mac and cheese was beyond amazing. They actually go well together when you mix the two, as per the server's recommendation. Alligator flatbread, however, is an acquired taste - a little divisive among us who dined in.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam, Mac and cheese (truffle), alligator flatbread

4zlI63biRnRS0UIZwyfsMA.text: Amazing service and food. Nicole was our server, by far the best waitress ever! The Donut Glazed Bread Pudding is a must try.

TKdmMod5VURMPACYPehSiw.text: I'd give it less for service. We walked there after checking website stating open until 11. It's 8:30, lets go. Oh wait! They're closed, doors locked. Maybe update your website so I don't wonder down a dark street looking for you.

5z2ytz3QL21TXuyNoYfZyg.text: I ate here at a visit to Las Vegas 6 months ago.  I was so impressed that I ate there again a few days ago.  The food is truly wonderful and fresh.  I especially like eating at the chef's table and watching them cook.  I loved the flat bread pizza's, cauliflower, and a brussel sprout/potato hash.  My only criticism was that they were in the process of changing over menus and so a number of food and alcohol items that I wanted from the menu were actually not available.  This was a real problem when it came to the shortage of a number of beers.  Overall loved the place and will return next time.

0QIr-Qlhiyuy3_7DQ2JxuA.text: Off the beaten path, this was a fun unique place to eat. Not much seating. The staff was great. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. I had the fish sandwich which was hot and delicious. Not a huge menu, nut good quality food.

jCkcux8fsiBz7w1YzJu4lw.text: I wasn't sure about the crispy chicken skins and our lovely server, Bianca, brought a couple pieces to try. Very tasty with the honey drizzle. My husband had the Sunday Chicken Sandwich with spicy tater tots. The chicken was to die for! Tender, juicy, and seasoned perfectly. I also ordered the mac and cheese...very creamy and filling. If you don't like communal seating, be sure to ask for a separate table. There's a fire pit on the outside patio where you can take your drink should you have to wait--which, you'll want to. Both Bianca and the GM were very attentive and pleasant!

u2vmeOjRNKxRiGnfjK06oQ.text: Amazing food, music and service! Carson's is a smaller place off the busier streets which is a nice break if you need one. The restaurant is small but we were able to get seated right away. The food comes as small plates to share. The Mac and Cheese is amazing! My significant other insisted on 2 deserts. The brownie with brown butter bacon was delicious. The donut bread pudding was out of this world. Highly recommend!

M8HmL8SQQleFwWQI7KfG1Q.text: Not bad. Could be better in my opinion, but I really liked their fried chicken skins. I've never seen anything like that before.

nwaT3TANd98fK-ZBSf7jow.text: Excellent little place with authentic selections. Tempura beans are to die for! Bacon jam is very good.   Chicken Skins were very well done, and good idea to serve it with honey. You may or may not like it as it's crispy fried chicken skins literally. :)  Excellent service and friendly staff. Nice to see the kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5qGXgfeUm_jDZHFgKtvk0w.text: Nice local place that attracts out of town folks too. Solid offerings that are well priced and mostly delicious. Ask your waitress for a recommendation and she'll tell you cauliflower is, deviled eggs and shrimp are the way to go. We had some chicken for dinner but it was undercooked and not that interesting. Sit at the counter and watch the staff do their thing.

L0b_gaugn9DlebHt_7X3Mw.text: I wasn't a total fan of Carson Kitchen the first time I came here, but I've somehow returned numerous times and now consider myself a regular. I'm actually quite a fan now!   Carson Kitchen has a really sweet and genuine staff with great knowledge of the menu (how its prepared, the ingredients that go into it, etc.) The food is strangely unique and everything is super tasty. I feel like the menu changes semi frequently, so I'll refrain from commenting on each individual dish.  My complaints:   1. The setup - Come in the winter on a windy day and when the door opens, all your stuff gets blown over and you turn into a popcicle. Come in on a summer day and when the door opens, your stuff gets blown over and you melt into a pile of sweat. 2. Their prices - Carson Kitchen costs more than some places on the Strip! For me, that's what's holding them back from giving them five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos are AMAZING!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam, bison sliders with tater tots
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TYd0B9-lw5bcvirU6VqCKg.text: Contemporary Hipster place, I was nicely surprised of the look of this place located in a neighborhood not that far from the downtown Casinos. The interior was decorated modestly, with items that really make you feel like you're in a Chef's man cave. Really dug the Chopping block tables that we ate on. We ordered so items to share among the 4 of us, Wild Mushroom Flatbread, yelp.com/biz_photos/cars... Tempura Green beans, Strawberry Salad, yelp.com/biz_photos/cars... Short Rib Stroganoff, yelp.com/biz_photos/cars... Butter Burger, yelp.com/biz_photos/cars... Everything was delicious, especially the addicting Tempura Green Beans and the Butter Burger. You know that I just had to drink a Voodoo stout to complement the wonderful dishes, I highly recommend sharing dishes and tasting as much as possible. Love their menu and atmosphere,nice kick back feeling.The service was friendly,really good to see a staff that enjoys their job.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Craft Beers
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5eN3Lc6U2hKxLHHKfRtrZA.text: Excellent place to eat. Choose the bar against the kitchen to watch the chefs prepare the food. One thing that caught my eye was the fun they had doing their jobs. They clearly enjoy preparing food and they get along with each other. It was a bit relieving to see that the folks making my food didn't have a bad attitude about it.   This shows clearly in the preparation as well, our plates looked great. I watched as the waiters and other staff helped to make each order look it's best before it was taken out to a customer.   The portions are perfect. Not too much. Just enough to enjoy the flavors and fill you up, but not so much that you don't want to do anything after you're done.    Don't hesitate to give this place your business.

coxpYF1C_a3OrB3iCcnKTQ.text: First of all, compliments to the great staff of Carson Kitchen. From the wait staff, management, kitchen staff and, of course, Chef Brandon.  From the start, we are greeted cheerfully by the hostess, and quickly sat at the bar with a kitchen view. I don't know about you, but I love to cook and watching them prep is relaxing to me. Our wait staff took our drink orders promptly, and served our drinks quickly as well.   Our first item was called Crispy Chicken skins with smoked honey. One word for this dish: phenomenal. My friend and I were gobbling up this dish when our second food arrived. It's called Barbecue Burnt End Tri tips. I was still on the skins when my best friend Will told me I have to try the second dish. So I did. I thought the skins were great, but compared to the tri tips, it paled in comparison. The tri tips were just excellent. The second dish were getting murdered like there was no tomorrow. That's when our third dish came, and it was called Bacon Jam with Brie. Now, I've tried other bacon jams, and the mix was either too much bacon (even though there's no such thing as too much bacon), or too much jam. The Bacon Jam at Carson Kitchen are in perfect harmony. The split between the two are perfect. Matched with baked brie elevates the flavor even more.  Now, the food were excellent but it wasn't just about the food. The staff were on top of their game as well. The wait staff and management were checking in on us, but not in an annoying kinda way. They checked on us in opportune time, not when we are midbite on our food. Hahaha!   The greatest kudos goes to the Wait staff especially Chef Brandon. Here's the thing, most kitchen staff are busy with prep work and cooking. Even though the kitchen was busy, they still took time out to interact with us, and that really made the experience great.  Chef Brandon, you can tell he's busy but he still takes time to talk to us. Now, even though he's busy and talking to us, his priority was still cooking the entrees so all the other customers weren't waiting long times for their orders. Now, that's service.   The only regret that I have is that we were only there for a small amount of time and only got to experience the appetizers. If the appetizers were that great, I can NOT wait to try the entrees.   I would DEFINITELY come back for the appetizers, and would DEFINITELY take my time and experience their entrees. I definitely recommend Carson Kitchen to everyone. That includes family, friends, and people I don't know. It is THAT great.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam with Brie
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Brandon personally serving us the BBQ Burnt Ends.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Skins with Smoked Honey

ypDMv9NRxAQGSSXfo9eYmQ.text: Fun, friendly restaurant that has unique eats and a pleasant staff. Dishes are meant to be shared and there is a good selection of beers to accompany everything. Definitely returning thi this spot again.

EurvYXFxQJElm73sPkW9Yg.text: Loved the food and atmosphere!! The tapas were excellent size, each choice was big enough for our party if three!!   Service was ok, the atmosphere was fun, great date place.  I understand the menu does change, so I will be back again.

54qHZHq-QZE7OhJAcK7D-w.text: Carson Kitchen has become a go-to favorite of mine in Downtown Las Vegas.  My most recent visit was truly exceptional.  The restaurant recently upgraded and expanded their dining area and the whole vibe has really improved.  The new tables and seating allow for more space between parties and really give a good amount of space to fill with the delicious shareable plates Carson has become known for.  My favorite items on the menu are the Burnt Ends (the pickles are INCREDIBLE!) and the Jerk Turkey Burger with mango chutney.  The flavoring is out of this world good.  I could easily eat either one on a VERY regular basis!  The bar, too, has improved and although I'm not one to drink a great deal with my meal, I know I can always find a delicious cocktail, beer or wine to pair with whatever I choose.    The constant through all of the changes?  The service.  Dakota is definitely a fan-favorite of this reviewer and if you get a chance to stop by CK, ask for him and you'll see why.  Just the right amount of attention, great suggestions for both food AND drinks and a warm personality make for a fantastic service experience.  I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit to Carson Kitchen...there's always something new to try!

fkKi_tbzguqaoF5fPjrL7A.text: Carson Kitchen is a Hipsters dream in downtown Las Vegas. The directions from YELP put us in the wrong place on 6th street but after a quick phone call to the establishment they got us headed in the right direction. Find the white building with blue trim on Carson!  Thank you to Philip T for the awesome list of local favorites. We're so glad you told us about this place!  There are different seating areas, one is a community table near the bar, one is a bar near the kitchen with the remaining seating being tables for 2-4 persons.  Because I was in a hipster locale I had to get a hipster drink so I got my new favorite beverage, the Moscow Mule. It was delicious!  We started with the Devils Eggs and they were so tasty!  Next we enjoyed the Gyro Tacos, and the Black Bean Oxtail Risotto. I have a total sweet tooth and the Donut bread pudding did not disappoint!  The service was outstanding and the food came out from the kitchen quickly so that it was perfectly hot when it was served.  This place is a foodies dream and we'll definitely be back again!  In the meantime, Carson Kitchen, how about opening up a location in Orange County, CA?  Please?

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devils Eggs and Gyro Tacos, delicious!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding made with donuts? Have I died and gone to heaven?  Oh Lordy this was delicious!

KFdQ9EF_CefIACEYEofM-Q.text: So this review was actually super difficult for me to write. I loved the food but was less than satisfied with the service.   As other Yelpers have mentioned, it is extremely difficult to find. It is a great place to visit off strip but just know it will be a bit of a hike if you don't have a car. In addition, be ready to pay for parking. Meters and street parking can be extremely hard to come by so you may need to pay for a spot in a lot. Good news about this though, if you choose to walk around Fremont after dinner you won't have to feed the meter.  The food - so delish! Be ready to split a lot of things with your family and/or friends. Sharing is definitely the best way to go when eating at Carson Kitchen. As unhealthy as they probably are, the crispy chicken skins are to die for - so delish! I also am a sucker for good green beans - they were definitely fabulous! In addition, I loved the scallops. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu - the only item we tried that we weren't huge fans of was the crab fondue - it just wasn't really our style.   The bar service was what killed my group. The running joke was we had to order our next drink when our drink arrived as it took that long for us to get fresh ones. This could have just been a busy night or something; however it was disappointing to my group that they would have to wait a while for their next drink.   Definitely would come back to this place - it seems like their menu changes up quite a bit so I would be extremely interested to see what they come up with next!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun interior

RpieFdlxIPJyER9bFvkGog.text: I really like the ambiance and atmosphere of this hipster place! This has been on my "to try" list ever since I moved here two months ago.   Friends were in town on the strip so I finally had an excuse to come here and so glad we did. We spent at least 2 hours here and started out with 3 of their best apps:  Fried Chicken Skins (something my mom makes all the time) - they serve this with honey but I prefer hot sauce so asked for sriracha sauce  Tempura Green Beans  BBQ Burnt Ends   I ended up ordering the Fried Chicken Sandwich (Secret Sunday Chicken) and immediately regretted it since the apps were so good and filling already.   They have a really good drink menu, try the Towns End, if you're into whiskey . This a great spot when you are really hungry.

tI0GgIxdjYUAhvy9MApJbA.text: Excellent little kitchen. Has a very hidden hipster feel with outstanding food. The experience is very modern where you can order as you eat and share with everyone at the table. The shrimp and the bacon jam were the favorites amongst the table and I highly recommend them to get started.

D-jrKe1tY01HMsrouxcwQw.text: I finally was able to try this place. It's in downtown Las Vegas and I had been wanting to go here forever.  It took a while to find because it is inside an old motel that I thought was still abandoned. I feel like this is part of specialness of this place. You feel accomplished once you find it and feel like you are in on the secret of where it is located.  Their menu is a bunch of small plates that are meant to share with a large party. They also have a few items, such as their burger, that weren't mean to for sharing.  You have to have an open mind and not be a picky eater to eat here. They have a lot of different yet delicious pairings.  It is a bit on the pricy side but if you go with a large group of people I feel like the cost will even itself out. Since it was only my uncle and I it felt a bit pricy and I felt a bit cheated with going with only two people because I couldn't try as much. Next time I come I would like to come with a larger party.  I would have to say the best item I tried was the bacon jam. I'm not even a big bacon fan (yes, I know, I'm weird) but I really loved this dish. It had brie cheese on top and you were able to spread the jam on bread that accompanied the dish. It kind of tasted like smoked meat and was delicious. I would definitely get this again.  I also ordered the mac and cheese. It was good but very heavy. I feel like I would have been fine with just a scoop because of how heavy it was. I feel like this would be a good dish to get with a larger group of people.  We also ordered the devil eggs which were just meh. I have had better and would recommend trying something else.  Overall I had a great experience. A tad on the pricy side but then again it is downtown. I would try this place again once I've gone to a few other DT restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottled beer only
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese! Great for sharing

eKDmxiS8RRiMi-Xc1lxbsQ.text: Places like Carson Kitchen are what gives downtown a real personality that's refreshing when compared to the Strip. Authentic food, good service and not a rip off. We came here during Life if Beautful weekend for lunch. We sat on the upstairs open air patio which is nice to do in Vegas when weather permits.  We had the truffled deviled eggs (delish and good portion) to share. My wife got the beet salad which was well made and just enough to hold her over for dinner. I got the lamb tacos, which were also delicious, however the amount of meat was not nearly enough to satiate me.... I was a little hungry when we walked away. That is my only complaint.  They had some create cocktails and a decent beer/wine list. I had the malbec ($9) and it was decent. If you are looking for something unique and tasty, I recommend giving this place a shot.

N9keatfHYxmEZ7QSy-frWQ.text: Stumbled across this place on Yelp as we explored Fremont Street.  Communal seating in a cool industrial space.  Service was warm and friendly.  We shared the Sunday Chicken sandwich (moist and all breast), watermelon salad with cucumber, feta and tajin.  Tater tots served on the side were crisp and dusted in herbs.  Cocktails looked awesome, but we weren't quite ready to start drinking for the day.

--stv8AY9Z7T15rU0JOhAw.text: Great staff, food and atmosphere. Loved the open seating shared table.   PS... the brisket is amazing!

VrJeRWRPBjATXxhDhn7pqg.text: Let me start by saying that this review is overdue by about 17 months.  We visited Carson Kitchen in Vegas early last year.  So, I believe that some of the menu items that we tried at the time are no longer available now.  I don't believe that we made reservations,  but we got there right when they were opening for dinner.  Got a parking spot right in front of the restaurant,  and we were seated right away.  Location is in downtown close to Fremont St.  Charming restaurant with good food and service.  Here is a rundown of the above average fare we shared that evening.  Crispy Chicken Skins were delicious!  I'd order that item of crispy goodness again!  (4.5 stars)  Tempura Green Beans were good.  I don't think you would be disappointed with this either.  (3.5 stars)  Rainbow Cauliflower was something that I enjoyed more than the Tempura Green Beans.  (4 stars)  Pork Belly Carbonara was okay, but not as good as I thought it would taste.  (3 stars)  Butter Burger with Tater Tots was delicious!  Try it for yourself!  (4.5 stars)  Pork Osso Buco was okay.  Again, I was expecting more out of this choice.  Was good though.  (3.5 stars)  Carson Kitchen in Las Vegas is a fine dining option.  I recommend you check them out too.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter Burger with Tater Tots was excellent.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Osso Buco was ok.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow Cauliflower was delicious.

ipVUHLSeMpSW6mLjX3RpJQ.text: Fantastic food! Great for sharing... just all around great flavor in the variety of dishes we ordered- gyro tacos, black rice and oxtail, mushroom flatbread, bacon dip, and pear salad.

kQ1LjLuWkxPGHaVmHtAOhg.text: Really disappointed that I couldn't get a table for dinner tonight after I made a reservation for said table yesterday. I had friends in town and wanted to show this place off after having a great experience last time. For some reason my reservation was "not on the list" so the host informed me it would be an hour and 45 minute wait. Again, after I had made a reservation. We could not wait as we have a show at 9 pm. No help whatsoever, leaving me embarrassed and finding another restaurant at 7pm on a Sunday. Not how you treat your locals, guys.  UPDATE: I was contacted by the owner immediately after posting the review above. He invited me back in to try it again and I must tell you that everything was amazing from food to service. Evidently my original res slipped through the cracks; mistakes will happen but what's most important is what happens next and Cory and his staff more than exceeded my expectations.  Tonight we had the tempura green beans, new beets and goat cheese, baked mac & cheese and the espresso rubbed NY-each dish stood on its own individually and all were outstanding. Our server Roman and the MOD were pleasant and attentive. We sat next to a couple from North Carolina whose Uber driver had recommended the restaurant and for good reason. An enthusiastic two thumbs up this time, we will be back!

NKuLOD-A4V0UcZ3RrOMkGQ.text: So tonight was my first time here. All I can say is the food is super on point. There was an hour wait but so worth it. I have to highly recommend the bacon jam - just wow! The veal meatballs, the Mac and cheese, all amazing! I will for sure come back and bring people here. The beet and goat cheese were amazing! Must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We ate it all so fast that there was nothing left lol

I7du_1dGoKZ2mW5DHHZ7xQ.text: If you are visiting Las Vegas and looking to get away from the Strip, Carson's Kitchen has to be on your list. The Owner and GM are usually on site ensuring a great customer experience. The vibe and feel of the place is terrific and the food is to die for!!! This place truly embodies all the great characteristics of the "New Downtown Experience." My Food recommendations are as follows:  Appetizers  Chicken Skins - a little spice with honey to offset Bacon Jam - self explanatory   Food Secret Sunday Chicken or Butter Burger Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto Seared Scallops  Drinks Ask your waitress. They have a large selection of wines, beers, ciders, and specialty drinks

z-QYEKpvmoRJEKYMstWFKg.text: I ate here last year with a friend when I was checking on our rental property. Its in downtown, a previously super shady area which is now slowly improving. The location is still shady. I had a homeless dude sleeping across the glass window from me. The spot is hip and dark. The waiters were super friendly. The food was good. Nice tastes and bold flavors. A bit hipster. I hope all of these downtown businesses thrive and do well.

3dp7xyIX7aFox3dr5ImyOg.text: Dining at Carson's was unique for two reasons: one, dishes were featured in small platters so that we could get a taste of each without it ever growing old on us; two, our family got to share dishes, rather than eating a plate each, making it a delightful "family night" experience. Although a bit on the pricey side, it was well worth the 30 minute walk.

FIH2yBvHHBi9glhtC1FOBw.text: Funky little joint with a great vibe and even better food. My wife and I ordered six different items and all were great and each dish had a special unique touch. Will be back soon. Tara was awesome and engaging.   Tim & Tahmy

PdLVxQElXZJprNPI_Ht9rg.text: Excellent service and great food.  Very casual small place where you eat at the bar or large counter where the chef's are.  Deviled eggs are the best.  Most items on the menu are very good.  Will go back.

6tpPrm6VZHDeqq_JlySAzg.text: Beyond best service. I wish I remembered our waitress's name. She was awesome. The food was amazing. We got the burnt ends, the pig and fig flatbread and the burger. Everything was delicious. I had to toss two piece of the flatbread because we didn't have a fridge. I almost cried.

1n-ilCXqfc0q1piO1X79RQ.text: Simply fantastic. The staff was top notch. The ambiance super cool. The food, incredible. Find this place and enjoy!!!!

qoH6IX8fK9ENzZGMP7Z8Mw.text: First time I visited Carson Kitchen it was the new guy on the Downtown block. The restaurant, since its incarnation has seen great praise, on Yelp, in local Las Vegas scenes, and has even gone national.  There is no doubt the food here is good, inspired, and not your typical grub. Carson Kitchen is for a day when you feel like splurging on veal meatballs topped with foie gras cream, which I did and they were absolutely delightful. This dish is pleasant and warming, like Swedish meatballs, a dish you might imagine your Grammy serving you on a cold winter night. But the foie cream is what gives it that Carson Kitchen difference.  Crispy chicken skins and honey dipping sauce. Pretty much one of the last meals you need to eat before you die and leave this Earth. Good eats and simple eats. The portion is also good for the price.  Bison sliders offer up a meaty variation on your old beef burger sliders. These should not be missed as they have a tangy BBQ sauce that melds oh so happily with the lean bison burger. Paired up with some crispy tater tots, and you have yourself a winner.  Service was decent, some hit or miss spots here and there. But at least they were willing to split the bill between myself and my friend this time.   Lunch time is best in my opinion, but get there early or you'll be waiting, or you may not even get to eat, depending on how long your lunch break is.  Solid Downtown eatery. I will be back.

M0WBEbyzZxZ1K-PpCMsPEQ.text: Great food that is off the strip and the staff are a fun bunch. Highly recommend if your tired of casino food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail risotto. Not what I expected but very good flavor with nice chunks of ox tail.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild boar sloppy joe.  Much better than the stuff from my elementary lunchroom.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken skin is highly addictive.

UW2tppitPnRnBvKPzAMAXQ.text: Carson Kitchen hands down was amazing ! The story behind this restaurant was very heart warming . The ambiance was welcoming .  Geronimo the bartender was also our server and he made sure we had a great time . For a first time Vegas goer my boyfriend and I felt like we were at home ! The jerk turkey sandwich was the bomb . I suggest the Baked Mac & Cheese. It was mouth watering . Good food and amazing vibes !

m2BiNzIDv90F_eA7enRYeA.text: Arriving at the restaurant was a lady who acted as the hostess but she didn t even greet us because she was busy on the phone. After having to finish her phone call she asked us to follow us to the corner of the bar where she sat us. We asked for a table and she denied one stating that tables were for parties of 6 even though the tables were empty. We asked her to move us to another section in the bar, and she said it was too difficult, after me getting serious and asking why, she moved us with the worst attitude ever, and the came and literally threw the ice water not even placing it properly.  Then we were waited by a nice waiter and had a just OK dinner. The BBQ tips were too sweet and did not taste like nice home-made bbq sauce, bread was not fresh. Veal Meatballs were just OK, nothing special. Macn Cheese was quite nice. And the grilled cheese sandwich was just OK.  Tables remained empty during the whole stay of our dinner, almost two hours.  Sorry to know that a place that has a nice decor and could offer a nice hipster ambiance experience is ruined by the hostess who works there.

QcPu78qWswyPdmVeOywMxw.text: Food was great! It was a family of 6 and we waited about 20 minutes for a table during lunch time. We all shared grilled cheese, pork chops, macaroni & cheese, and burgers. Very good food! Definitely would recommend to anyone wanting to try a local place here in Las Vegas :)

03H91mqCj_7L6UJB5ZYwXw.text: Where do I start?  Ok, the good first.  Very cool atmosphere.  That got the one star.  The bad...  they offer three entree's.  Tonight they were out of two of them. Ok, that happens, but they made us wait 40 minutes before telling us this.  Not right.  And they don't put it in writing, but this is a tapas restaurant.  I could go on about the less than tasty food but I won't.

4g2E0mNcTl8IIXdmGv7s1g.text: Located a short walk from Fremont St Experience I did a few small plates and a few craft cocktails. Friendly service and high quality made this a thumbs up experience. Would go again!

MTIjWfuL9ZcKDkCQju7anA.text: There is absolutely nothing but great things to say about this place. Our server Manny was amazing. The food tasted amazing I recommend the place as a must go!!!!

eLzntg7T0myfsGFvji9GwA.text: Stopped here for Kung after a long day of driving to Vegas through Arizona. Let me just preface this by saying I love Boursin cheese, all my friends make fun of me for how much I love it, and I've never seen it on a menu before.  First, the ambiance was pretty good. They had an open kitchen and we sat at the bar, so we could actually watch the chefs as they cooked the food. The chefs were also friendly, so all around a cool experience  Next, the food was pretty good! I wished it was better given that it had Boursin, but it didn't blow my mind. The crispy chicken skins were good, but be warned they felt like a heart attack waiting to happen. The butter burger was the one with Boursin in it. It came with tater tots which were just normal, and the burger was alright. The best thing we got was probably the Mac and cheese! That too had Boursin in it (told you I'm obsessed), and that was truly delicious.

FY8nwNcPMDfVJoIBlCUt1A.text: This place does not have a celebrity Chefs name on it but this is one of the best restaurants in Vegas.  I loved everything about this place.  The ambiance, the decor, the staff and most importantly... the food.  We were in the downtown area on Friday night and wanted give this a try.  We sat on the rooftop deck and although it was cold outside the heat lamps kept us warm.  We got our drinks right away and the waitress told us about how the food is group food and meant to be shared.  We loved this.  We got the Jalapeno poppers, potatoes and the steak.  Every Bit was incredible, and the portions were perfect for the price and for sharing.  I've been into Ciders a lot this year and tried the berry Cider they had which was very good but I think she liked it a lot more.  I know parking in downtown can be a big hassle, but I know if I'm ever downtown I will be making a stop to the Carson Kitchen.

ZKcrWc_keJJ_qrpuKfqu2Q.text: This is a nice small spot in Downtown. It's pretty easy to miss but we put our names down and our table was ready in ten minutes. Our server was super sweet and explained all of our questions. We tried a bunch of appetizers and I would go with their 1.5 per person recommendation.  What we got:  Chicken skins- I wish this was a way smaller portion because the first couple pieces were good then it was just oily and not that great. If you have a huge group I'd get one order so you can try it because it's so different. Asparagus- SO YUM! Butter Burger- I personally didn't love but others did Jamaican Turkey Burger- I LOVED! The slaw was sweet and the burger had a nice kick. Deviled eggs- These were good but I didn't love it Mac and cheese- So cheesy and delicious

5T6HD1azHXXdtD0iQqaTEw.text: Location: on Carson - not 6th across from an empty parking lot. Kiddy corner from Post Office. Bison meatloaf sliders - pleasantly filling for a quick lunch. Smothered in BBQ sauce and topped with small fried onion and bun hat.  Who would of thought tater tots were going to be this delicious at lunch. Spicy and soft. Great job!

JrgezrVlMYJCEuxaIpZbew.text: This place is exceptional! Beyond the extraordinary food (creative recipes, fresh dishes, beautiful presentation, exciting flavors, new twists on standards) the service is warm, friendly, professional, and all of the people I met there were really cool and nice. Green beans are generally my least favorite vegetable (on account of them being boring and flavorless) but somehow they made green beans that made me actually gasp with pleasure! They were extremely accommodating of my vegetarianism (made me special flat-breads without meat). When I ate the Brussels sprouts I may have shed a few tears when it occurred to me that I couldn't continue to eat them for the remaining moments of my lifetime.   Summary: Go to here. Eat many food.

a09Y7T5JejHp0wTkjwk0Sg.text: I'm giving this review 4 stars only because the food wasn't really my cup of tea. The atmosphere is great, the servers are even better! We had a little wait the night I went, which was on the weekend so I kinda expected a wait, but I loved the courtyard they have in the back that you can get drinks and wait for your table at. The place isn't very big either but it's not too crowded.

HU4tuSqr3cGcm-hI7DfHew.text: I post this review with mix emotions, I love eating here ever since I found it on a weekend getaway. We have come back many times with fam/friends. I also refer others (blogging, IG, FB), (Love Bacon Jam). With that said I feel a little gouged. Let me explain; I thought it would be a perfect place to host a bachelor party dinner (patio). So I went ahead to set up for a dinner at 8 pm. But as u know it's hard to wrangle up 12 guys from drinking, napping, and gambling. So I called to say I was running late, they said that was fine. So we had a good dinner. Then we got the catering bill, and then I noticed an additional charge of $300. I was like shocked. The manager said your party was charged $150 for "every 30 mins" past the reservation which was noted in the catering contract. Totally my fault for not getting the group there on time (and for not reading the details of the contract). But then I reviewed the bill, and I noticed the bill had a time stamp of 10:39 pm, Our reservation was to be from 8-10pm. So I was puzzled when I was charged 2 increments. Come Monday when I had a chance to recover from Vegas (getting too old for this stuff), looking back on the event, I was left to wonder if those additional 9 mins were totally attributed to us and only us? I recalled several possible factors that could have contributed to those extra 9 mins. Here are some that stuck out in my mind. 1) Even thou the waiter was nice, he did go on some long stories about his life in Las Vegas, fine...nice guy but let's get the food out. 2) Waiter decides to hold some food from the table until we finish other appetizers, which we had plenty of room for the food for the table plus with that many guys we would go through everything quickly, no need to wait, but to go back and forth from the stairs takes time. 3) The waiter was nice of enough to bring us extra desserts for us to consume even thou we were already done with dessert,(added time to our event). 4) When fixing the bill, he rang up the alcohol on the catering bill we had said to leave it on a separate check, so the waiter had to go back and adjust the bill. then I get the bill at 10:39. So what I am trying to say is those extra 9 mins could have been caused by many factors that we were not in our control/fault. I called the Carson kitchen later that week. Again everyone was courteous and professional. The GM heard me out, and I explained to him the situation like I stated above. He said he would take this back to the owner (Cory H) because he would ultimately have the final word. I mention again that I'm not looking for a full refund just a partial refund or maybe even a credit for next time. But from the some of the conversation with the managers at the restaurant and over the phone it seemed that the reason they were charging me was because they have been "burn" before. It seemed to me, Carson Kitchen wanted to punish us for being "late" and for staying over our time. So which is it then, are you charging us for being late or having the party go past the time or both? Because the contract makes it seem, I should have only been charged for each 30 minutes past my time and not for showing up late (which you guys made it seem, for both). It almost seems that it was out of anger or resentment for past situations with other customers, and I was told any chance of a refund would mean that they would be taking a loss. Which I totally understand why I was charged for the 1st 30 mins (would I have been charged at 10:01pm if I came at 8pm?)...and far as a "lost"...I mean it's not like I consumed $150 worth of food and then I asking for a refund for that...this is 9 mins we are talking about that could have been caused by Carson kitchen staff or us. In the end, $150 would not have bankrupted Carson kitchen or myself or created anarchy among other patrons. I think the compromise or gesture from Carson Kitchen would have been nice, it would have garnered so much more effort from me to post on yelp about the situation in a more positive manner than I am now. This situation has left a bad taste in my mouth, and I found myself hard to recommend this place without letting them know about this incident (I really did like this place). I truly believe in the power of 5, 1 person will tell 5 other people and those other 5 people will tell 5 other people, but in today's age with media, it's more like 1 person tells thousand other people and so on. I appreciate Matt's effort to speak to the owner and even offer me a drink to bury the hatchet the next time I'm in town. But what I really want to ask Cory H was that $150 charge for 9min worth alienating a frequent customer? Again thank you, Matt and Julie, for being understanding and handling our business. I give the food 4 stars, standard service 3 stars but catering operation 1 stars. Total 8 stars divided by 3 categories = 2.6 avg stars (just in case you wondered how I came up with that rating. Sincerely, Heartbroken bacon jam lover :(

RcgJ4j8Gm-9dFIw26CQT_g.text: Food was great but the communication was a struggle. I would go back simply because the owner cares for his customers and business.

sf1I-KKqN-B03nOsLHfs_Q.text: Get there early for a great seat and less crowd. We sat at the "kitchen bar" overlooking the kitchen which us totally our style. We had the bacon jam (outta this world) chicken skins (dynamite) and a mushroom flatbread that, oops, was our only veggie of the meal. We left stuffed and satisfied and wishing we had room for more food! Great ambiance, service, cocktails and food! We will go again!

yB2wnk9POSX_K1wE-SxfqQ.text: Holy cow!  Real food from real ingredients just off of Fremont?  This place isn't just great, it's essential.

kG-LUw7-y_rEqevr1F26ig.text: Amazing lunch today July 4 at Carson Kitchen. We ordered the lamb pita taco, margarita flatbread, veal meatballs and the philly cheese steak Perogi. All were so good and so fresh  Service awesome and by far one of the best Bloody Mary I have ever had.   We will be back and they change their menu a few times a year

qLZajsHQK1QPsgkH9R2iXA.text: Amazing food....fun atmosphere and updated decor. A great find in DLV! The small plate process is easy to get used to.

JRcRiAcKrSG-rNrHNcQwAQ.text: Disappointed from the minute we walked in. Space was available at both bars and there were three empty tables inside. We were told there was a 30 minute wait and we could go to the bar upstairs. Went upstairs, sat at a table and we were told we could not sit there because the tables were "for reservations." The tables had seating for four, not six. Why they were for reservations were did not undersstand because the hostest said, "reservations were for parties of 6 or more." The whole expierence was confusing, made no sense and we left. On our way out we asked about all the empty tables and the hostest said, "they were for reservations."

rLRmw0c71YmhxF7G22k4Qg.text: OMG I love this place!! I had the jerk turkey burger it had all kinds of flavors inside.  They also have a lot of specialty drinks that are not on the menu you have ask the bartender. They're opening up a patio area on the top of the venue July 4th weekend looking forward to it!

sxuvwq-4P9oWDJLeu-e_lA.text: Was amazingly surprised. The seating was tight but for our party of 6 including CrossFit Athlete Cheryl Brost and her Husband Troy this was a great Dinner. Two words: Bacon Jam. WOW WOW  WOW - The Deviled Eggs were excellent as well The Beer selection was too different for my standard, Pyrate or Duval but they were fun to explore new labels I never heard of. The Design of the place is amazing and we all polished our plates with 100% satisfaction - Leave room for dessert cause Kerry Simons Carson Kitchen will leave an impression on your appetite and Heart. Bravo!!

WV18JhnNMuup14Vexcd38g.text: A great place to hang with friends. Great food for all tastes. Will be coming back here, someday. The staff are super friendly & know the menu. Thanks for the recommendations! We had: Crispy chicken skins (yum!), killer shrimp, Pork Belly Carbonara, NY Strip and Gyro taco with lamb (OMG). Great selection of drinks too. Go here!! You won't regret it.

BIVkl8YxeGZSAHvm_W7ACg.text: Loved this place. Great food - veal meatballs are amazing. Cauliflower wonderful too. Everything at the surrounding tables looked fabulous- especially the tempura green beans. Fair prices too.

y6qsDJjrf6uCASjTb6AG2Q.text: Delicious tapas style plates! Got the spicy tomato bisque and the baked mac n cheese - both were delicious and had great flavor. The service was very good too. Highly recommended!

DA1WwvwcKNcyoPau0u8SGg.text: Visiting from out of town and stopped by this restaurant through recommendation of a friend. The food did not dissapoint at all. My wife loved her pesto flatbread, my 4yo loved his Mac and cheese, and I just about fell apart with how juicy and perfectly cooked my medium rare "butter burger" was. However the absolute best part of our visit here was our server, Bianca. This says nothing about the quality of our food (DELICIOUS) but everything about how well we were taken care of. She was very attuned to our unspoken needs and comfort. Ultimately, she made us feel special even on a very busy night. Thanks, Bianca!

hTLd2PSThdZDH_csAzi96A.text: Real simple...if you're in Vegas, you've got to eat here.  Very cool atmosphere...obscure from the outside but once you open the door, it's full of character.  It's tapas style so sharing is encouraged.  Exceptional

wvGBG_M1SYhpkXfnsWJlbA.text: Great food in a fun downtown Las Vegas location with very friendly and helpful staff.

_GyewTX0HqRPaSvI98pg4w.text: I am usually quite picky on my reviews for restaurants and one of those people who rarely go back to the same spot. However, Carson Kitchen is my "must-do" in Vegas. I heard they are looking into a second location in the GV/Anthem area (my old neighborhood) which would be even better for the locals there. For all of my trips back to Vegas, I make sure Carson Kitchen is on my list of places to eat! You can't believe how good a crispy chicken skin dipped into a bacon jam really is!!

5w9rq0m3bLdLNzcdKgjQLg.text: My family and I had a wonderful experience at Carson Kitchen last weekend. Service and food were all excellent and top-notch. Our favorite food items were the mac and cheese, the meatballs and the risotto, even though it was hard to choose a favorite because everything was phenomenal. My mouth is still watering from that meal... each item that came out was better than the last! Service was efficient and knowledgeable as well. Great time, will go back next time we are in Vegas!

Ir58Qfeead8gBUFsY4ksmA.text: I can see why this place is packed every night.  The decor is great.  The service is nice.  The food that we had was very tasty.  It is a little above my everyday price point, but I appreciate how ground breaking it was for a place of this caliber to come downtown.  Kudos to the chef team and Kerry Simon.

UNQXutbbkpt-SnDUAWu32Q.text: Delightful little place and great friendly service. We found this place after walking around a few blocks and loved the food. We ordered the watermelon and feta salad, young beet salad, Mac and cheese and chicken thighs. The watermelon salad was very refreshing and the beet salad was perfection. I didn't care of the Mac and cheese because it has some sort of chemically taste that I didn't like. The chicken was cooked to perfection and was delicious!

ZXSjNWk7n6CA12wyV5Wsjw.text: The food, with the exception of the Fried green tomatoes, was excellent! ( the fried green tomatoes were a tad toasty. We can Fr the fried chicken skins, but they said the batch that came in did not live up to their standards, so they didn't serve them that day. I can def appreciate that! They made the best deviled eggs I've ever had... with bits of crispy guanciale and caviar; crispy pork belly atop a heavenly sauce; spicy to die Fr shrimp  ; and watermelon/feta/ basil/ balsamic salad    Why 4 not 5 stars? Our server was very quirky to say the least. We were waiting to ask Fr our check for over 20 minutes. When she did appear, she informed us that "a female situation and she was only one person!" Ahhh... TMI We will return; hopefully she will not have another female situation ... lol

QoOoXrsa0ccUmhX85MQV7Q.text: We went for lunch today (Tuesday), and it was great.  The food was very fresh and tasty and the waitress was outstanding.  We started with the Bacon Jam (great), Devil's Eggs (fantastic) and the Chicken Skins (good, but really, really salty).  I had the Meatloaf Patty Melt, which I liked, but it has a unique sweet/salty thing going on that keeps your taste buds confused.  My daughter had the Butter Burger, which was nice and my wife had the NY Strip.  The NY Strip was the highlight of the meal, it was soooo good.  I'd sell my first born for another order of that entree.  The Mac & Cheese complimented the steak well.  Don't miss this place if you visit downtown!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Skins
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf Patty Melt

-xlLxiKwhUZXAFVjL3aDqw.text: Tucked away on 6th St in downtown Las Vegas is a hidden little gem.  There is both a full dining area and a bar area.  The dining room was a hour wait on a Thursday evening so my coworker and I ended up going to the bar which was free.  Note that the bar has about 8 - 10 seats in a line and no TV so you better like who your dinner company is that evening because there won't be anything else to entertain you other then the bartender!  Speaking of which, the bartender was nice friendly and funny.  The FOOD...well what can I say, the butter burger I had was exceptional.  The meat was juicy and flavorful and you could taste the strong butter flavor in the bun.  You can tell the ingredients are exceptionally high quality, particularly at the price point.  My coworker had the mac and cheese as well as the gyro tacos.  Both items looked delicious but maybe it was just me but they seemed on the smaller side?  He mentioned how two of the dishes were needed before he was full.  The decor is very contemporary and the restaurant itself was very clean. It was very busy when we went but only had to wait a couple of minutes for a table to be cleared.   I love the little quirks of getting your check in an old hardback book.  Carson Kitchen is well worth another visit, but I'd like to try the dining room next time.

PvCvCY5pVyJrzf2CqUbT4g.text: Great restaurant near Fremont. Our favorite dishes were the crispy chicken skins, gyro tacos, broccoli with green goddess dressing, and mac & cheese. The buffalo sloppy joe and tater tots were good but definitely have a kick. We were a little disappointed with the bacon jam dish - it would have been better with more brie and less jam (there really is just a whiff of brie). Our server was great along with all the staff, and we enjoyed 80s rock while we were there.

gky_X4MIBorVnkK7aVBVdQ.text: Carson Kitchen is the restaurant I frequent when I want really really really amazing food. After dining here at least ten times, I can say I've never had a negative experience. The servers are always so friendly and knowledgeable, they are definitely up-to-date on how dishes are prepared and will build a menu around your taste preferences.   On my last visit, I sent my drink back because I simply didn't like it, and feeling awful I apologized over and over. The sever told me it wasn't a problem at all, and got me a negroni instead. The Caesar with bacon is to die for, and the deviled eggs are the app I always order. I'd probably have a mini heart attack if they took those eggs off the menu.   The star of the show however is their secret Sunday chicken sandwich. Served with tots, I usually feel full for anywhere upwards of 8 hours after eating there, but Carson Kitchen is definitely worth spending your calories for the day here.

WYPXGeDKjF8PBh-nVnocjw.text: Located off the strip in Downtown Las Vegas, the crowd and vibes are way more relaxed.  This spot was a little tricky to find but when we finally did, we were so glad we didn't give up!  One of the employees met us outside and recognized our look of confusion and showed us the way.  We were seated indoors right away at a communal high top table because we desperately needed AC. But if you love the sun, you can eat on the outdoor rooftop patio and bar.   The first thing I noticed were the actual menus which were so unique. I immediately knew that the food would be amazing because if someone puts that much thought into a menu, then they've definitely put a lot of thought and care into crafting delicious cocktails and dishes.  We ordered the Machu Peach-U cocktail. It was a peachy take on a Peruvian Pisco sour, with Smith & Cross Jamaica rum, Giffard creme de peche, Barso pisco, fresh lemon & lime, bar keep saffron bitters, and finished with a fluffy egg white on top. I loved it!  Our first appetizer was the KILLER SHRIMP with rocoto & aji amarillo pepper cream. It looked and tasted similarly to Walnut Shrimp from a Chinese restaurant, minus the walnuts, and had a spicy kick at the end.    Our second app were the PORK WINGS with buffalo bleu beurre blanc. They were the most succulent juicy pork belly bites dipped in a little buffalo sauce. They were finger licking good!!  Next we ordered the baked mac n cheese. I'm not sure what cheeses were used but it was creamy, dreamy, delicious.   Our entree was the COCOA-ESPRESSO NY STRIP with red wine demi. It was perfection! I couldn't distinguish the cocoa or espresso flavors, but they must've worked well together because I took pleasure in each juicy bite.   Dessert... Oh, my... I love donuts. I love bread pudding. And yes,  they actually made a GLAZED DONUT BREAD PUDDING!!!! It was almost shaped like a mushroom- the top was donut and it became softer at the base, almost like flan. I had the biggest smile of sheer bliss on my face and I closed my eyes to make the flavors and that feeling last as long as possible.   three rum caramel, vanilla creme anglaise

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q14OcwLNsQksln4kcpcl8Q.text: If you're looking for a fun, interactive bunching experience for a larger group of 10 or more then Carson Kitchen is definitely the place for you! (be sure to make a reservation since this place fills up quickly and it's not that big inside with maybe less than 10 tables.   Roman was our server and he recommended that we do family style dining, where you order numerous dishes and basically everyone in the table gets a little bit of everything. This concept is financially feasible especially when you have a larger group, plus everyone gets to experience the same dining experience!   We basically ordered one of everything on the appetizers page. To make it even, Roman just added extra here and their so everyone got one of everything.   My favorite items from the appetizers list are:  *Fried Chicken Skins with honey dipping sauce  *Rocket Fire Shrimp: These are crunchy pieces of shrimp tossed in a creamy kick sauce!  *Bacon Jam (yep, bacon Jam!) *Mac n' Cheese: you just taste the truffle, which I'm totally okay with! *Veal meat balls  My favorite alchie bevie is called "Get Shorty."
