K4QMoCocVYHEq6C2cpS85Q.text: Great hang! Serious old fashion and the pork belly was Perfect after work combination.

vK4Y6zuSxebc-rdIj8-3yw.text: Exceptional dining experience, everything tastes great. Standout dishes include the deviled eggs with black caviar, gyro tacos and glazed donut bread pudding (one of the best desserts that I've ever tasted). Restaurants manager comped our steak because he said the chicken thighs were not up to the Carson kitchen standard. This is a must for anyone visiting Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs

LcF4Kl_YWykImlGLB2owxw.text: Swanky Gastropub in downtown LV right by Fremont.    BF and I had heard so many great things about this place so we ventured over in hopes of one of the greatest meals of all time.  It certainly was good but not the best meal I have ever had.  To be fair, there's a lot of competition in LV and we are well traveled so the bar is high.  All that stated, the crispy chicken skins with smoked honey are worth returning for and definitely a dish we will rave about to others when making recommendations of where to grab a bite in LV.  Food was served quickly and service was on point.   The pork belly buffalo bites were ok. I think I got two dry bites cuz they were hard...my bf's pieces looked juicy.    Veal meatballs were full of flavor but needed more texture.   We want to return and try the steak and chicken thighs...and have more of those f'ing amazing chicken skins.

LjXPqkwIyV35dMq8iWWigQ.text: One of the best restaurants we ate at in Vegas. We opted for Tapas-style ordering, since it looks like shared plates are their speciality. We ordered:  + Tahini Carrots + Kale and Beet Caesar Salad + Oxtail and black rice risotto + Pork Belly  All of these were awesome, especially the Tahini carrots. However, I probably would not order the risotto again---I couldn't really taste the oxtail, and I thought that the parmesan cream overpowered the rest of the dish. Instead, I wish I had tried their chicken skins dish.  Drinks: + Town's End: This was good, but the drink itself is a standard citrus + whisky preparation, which a lot of craft cocktail places have some version of. + Margarian: This has very strong cucumber taste, and I thought it was a more unique drink than Town's End  My biggest complaint is that the decor and general menu are a bit too generic to "hipster" restaurants. The decor and menu are a standard, "New American" style, with metal stools, dark lighting, and pork belly. I felt like this restaurant could just as easily be located in Austin or Berkeley or Boulder. I think a little more local flair could make this place a real destination in Vegas.

qIPXyh_FYdQVYWnt7jxHfA.text: Great atmosphere and food. The deviled eggs and fried chicken skin are to die for. We loved the vibe and the culinary surprises it offers!

jTfD_iNn0qPRVCz-haXh0A.text: We have eaten here several times.  The food is very good but each time the attitudes of the staff because far too condescending for our taste.  They make you feel that you should feel privileged to be allowed to eat there and that you are there for their benefit rather than yours.  The experience is just as important as the food.  And this place has become a poor experience.  Oh well......

OJNbKaonHEbkLGQ8rv8Z4g.text: Wow this is what I call fine dinning. The flavors and ingredients are definitely quality . This is a social place, meant to snack size not a full course dinner . One less star because of the portion size. That bread pudding won me over tho!

chydxS6jb-PhijJalxjmSg.text: Unanimously voted our best meal in Vegas from start to finish.  Each of the five items ordered was excellent.    Do not mistake the fried chicken skins for pork rinds.  These are just as you would expect.... the best part of fried chicken.  The accompanying sauce is delish.   The Mac'n'cheese and glazed donut bread pudding are musts.

7hIMII3C5S6bcPiyT7BLsQ.text: Found this place to have lunch while we were in Vegas for Life is Beautiful. We came in right when they opened, and they quickly sat all 15 of us.   After we sat down, the waiter immediately gave his spiel about the dining style of the restaurant. He was a little impatient when getting our attention, and there were 15 of us sitting at an L shaped table.. also, when we walked in and mentioned table for 15, the host and another waiter made a face, like "oh no, seriously?" I get it were a big party but no need for the attitude :(  The waiter took all of our drink orders, and when they came out, it was perfect! No one got their drinks mixed up or anything.   Their menu selection is pretty wide. They're all meant to be shared, that means you can order a few plates and eat it family style. Perfect if you wanna try many things on the menu. My boyfriend and I shared the steak, oxtail risotto and veal meatballs. The meatballs were 11/10 while the other two dishes were just okay. Some of my friends got the butter burger, it was pretty good. The tater tots that came with them complemented the dish really well.   My drink was pretty good but a little light on the alcohol (tbh almost non-existent), but it tastes refreshing. I got the Magarian.   Overall the service was good (except the part where the waiter got impatient), food is great and if I'm ever in the area again I'd definitely come back.

ST3H_D4YGCsE9z8nnV80qA.text: The food here is amazing and the drinks are delicious :) I was beyond tired but I remember their sangria was divine. The Mac and cheese, a happy memory of goodness that melted in my mouth, and the flatbread, delightful! And the gyro tacos were a different, but very good!The place was pretty packed, but service was still great!

w5OD0CN8wkMhu5aHYlArZg.text: Okay, I came back.  I wanted to update my review with one more recent.  It had been a while since I had visited when I wrote my last review, as pointed out to me by the manager, and I thought it would be only right to come back.  So I did. This time I brought a colleague in tow (it was my treat).  We ordered the lamb tacos, and some spicy shrimp diablo, that was really delicious.  The lamb was flavorful, but just a tiny bit stringy.  The fried chicken skins were a little gummy, but the sauce was excellent.  The beet salad was absolutely 100% perfect. I liked the chocolate dessert, but it was bit too dense and cloying.  The other one (which I'm not remembering right now), was a bit better.  The seating is mostly at high tops, which I'm not a fan of, and music was way too loud to enjoy a proper "power" lunch with business chums.  Service was a bit affected.  It was fine.  It was fun.  I think the food more properly is 4 stars, on more reflection.  But I still give the overall experience a 3.  It's not an "average" experience to be sure, but for me, personally, I am not a super fan.  I do appreciate the concept, and I have more respect for the serious investment of commitment and artistry in making food like this, and in operating a restaurant like this.  But I am probably not the target audience. You might be, and you should check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I spy Carson Kitchen!

7lsGVA-_Gmr-cxAMbm48LQ.text: This is my second time here. The first time was when they first opened. No one acknowledged us for at least 10 min so we left.  It was full but not crazy busy.  This time it was kind of the same, the host was busy at the host desk and did not acknowledge me, but he bartender Felicia redeemed them by her awesome customer service! The food is wonderful and is seasonal. I can't wait to come back and taste more great food.

NMbB348AXFgXR8mENkp8CQ.text: I'm updating my review because it's been over a year now since I've last been to Carson Kitchen. Since we have friends in town from Hawaii, my boyfriend and I decided to take them here for brunch yesterday. I definitely have to say that no matter how many times we come here, this place still impresses us with their excellent service and food.   The second we walked through the door, we were immediately greeted by the nice hostess who seated us. The menu has changed quite a bit since the last time we were here; so our server, Manny, was very nice to answer any questions we had and gave us his suggestions. Although the menu is made for sharing, there are a few dishes you can order if you don't want to share. For a group of 5, we ordered the bacon jam with brie, chicken skins with honey, and mac and cheese (which have always been our favorite items on the menu). In addition, we ordered the deviled eggs, pork wings, cocoa espresso rubbed steak, and the oxtail risotto with black rice. Everything came out hot and delicious! Our friends particularly enjoyed the chicken skins and bacon jam.   Overall, the service and food here was fantastic. Manny was super friendly and attentive in refilling our drinks and making sure everything was made to our liking. We will continue to keep coming back again and again. I highly recommend this place!

MIDgQA1v-OEKOCp8Nl5vCg.text: I'm going 4 star based on the fantastic service and creativity of this fun little spot. The food did not blow us away. It seemed to JUST miss in many places.   First, the crispy chicken skins. Think pork rinds. That's basically what you are eating but doused in a season salt that is so heavy and salty you can't even taste the chicken. We sat at the bar where you can see everything being made and the chef shakes on about half a pound of salt.   The bacon jam had great flavor but was super sweet with just a tiny slice of cheese. You could have tippled the cheese and there still would have been way more of the sweet jam.   Roasted cauliflower smelled delicious when it was brought over but it had such a heavy lemon flavor it was almost not edible.   We really enjoyed the kale Cesar and loved watching the flat breads being made but didn't try those.   Prices were very fair and like I said earlier, service was great. We both left with dry mouth from all the salt. That was our biggest takeaway.

lsWsyaFin9vAUuGf2wik7w.text: With one day in downtown LV, my friend and I decided to seek out a yummy brunch spot and came across Carson's Kitchen. With all the overwhelming positive reviews, we were excited to try it!  Our server Felicia was amazing! We asked for recommendations and she gave us quite a few. We decided to go with the bacon jam, devil's eggs, and jerk turkey burger. The bacon jam is perfect blend of sweet and savory, and is served with toastinis. The devil's eggs was creamy and delicious. The turkey burger had nicely toasted buns, topped with cole slaw. It also comes with a side of spicy tater tots.  Unfortunately I have little to no tolerance for spicy items (my friend loves spicy though!) and I found the bacon jam and jerk turkey burger to be very spicy. Luckily, Felicia kept refilling my water as I was chugging the cup after every bite of the food. Everything was very delicious! Despite the spiciness, my favorite dish from that day is actually the bacon jam!

4M_pku-dLL5ucqa1cTCBVg.text: My boyfriend and I tried Carson Kitchen for the first time last night (10/13/18) and it was a great dining experience. When we first entered a man held open the door for us and was super friendly. We sat at the top level at the bar and all the staff were very nice.  The food was delicious. I didn't realize it was tapas style so my boyfriend and I got a few dishes to share. We ordered the killer shrimp which had a spicy kick, the chicken sandwich with spicy tots which was really juicy, the gyro tacos which were hearty and amazing, and the Mac n cheese which was rich, cheesy, and everything you'd want in a Mac and cheese.  Definitely a little pricey but it was worth it.

o8ZedpP4WpwNsoouB6WyTQ.text: The food is not good enough to make up for the experience. They tell you the wait is 40-50 minutes. Checked in at 5:52 on a Saturday and finally seated at 7:15. In all fairness the staff tried to make amends but then came the meal.  We were told dishes come when they are ready but three of us were finished with our meal when the flatbread came out for one in our party. We were told the chicken would come the latest but after a long wait anyway the flatbread arrived 15 minutes after the first dish of mains is served after stating clearly we were not sharing. That's simply not acceptable.  I will not return to this restaurant despite having friends in the area.

O-HOJOalhQxstDA8T7tLdQ.text: I love,love ,love this place if your in Vegas make the trip downtown.  I'm a native I drive there for great food as much as possible

adKAXUfa_DiB7yj3oI0UHw.text: PROS: -This is a great social-restaurant to catch up with a friend/family -Unique interior -Great service + they're fast when it comes to ordering food -There's an upstairs where you can grab a drink.  FOOD 5/5: -Tempura Green Beans ($8): This was enjoyable. My friends and I ate this so fast, so addicting! -Baked Mac & Cheese ($12): WOW, i love this. The mac & cheese is gooey & rich. We ordered 2 servings because 1 is not enough. -Wild Mushroom Flatbread ($12): Delicious! I like the gorgonzula sauce they use  CONS: -Usually, always a wait. The restaurant is very small. Don't get discouraged, worth it at the end

dZ9i680h4oo6nSMZRswYCA.text: This place is awesome! It was a little hard to find being that there was no huge signage and the streets are dim downtown but it was packed nonetheless for a Wednesday night. Parking is convenient just across the street (paid parking $1.00 every half hour). We arrived an hour and a half before closing and we had to wait for 15 minutes so we grabbed a drink at the bar Molbec red wine for me and the bartender recommended  Bad Beat Hoppy Times IPA for my sister -- which she loved. Prices are reasonable for the drinks. (Total was $16 and change)  There are comfortable bench seats arranged around a fire pit in the back patio which my sister and I occupied as we waited, and we loved and took a lot of pics around :) haha  Our server was friendly enough. He explained the servings a bit and wasn't too pushy when urging us to order a bit more than we did and giving us the option to order more as we go. Sis and I weren't too hungry so we decided to split the Mac n Cheese and the Butter burger.  The Mac n Cheese was so tasty! I told my sis I shoulda ordered another one to go haha it was the perfect amount of cheesy and the bread crumbs on top gave it a light crunch/more flavor! The butter burger was alright, we both agreed, nothing too special. Spicy tater tots were good though! Really wanted to try the bread pudding but we were both stuffed, as we werent too hungry to begin with. The bill came out to be $26.  I really liked the ambiance, and it was intimate. It seemed like the clientele enjoyed the setting as well. I would definitely come back again!

P6RxdcAQHQYsB_WJoSn48Q.text: Super recommend crispy chicken skin, especially the smoked honey. Cauliflower is ok. Egg is amazing.

h53E6PfPV7ggtnv5dDfkJA.text: We were complete aholes and came hungry 30 min before closing time. Despite that, EVERYONE was super super nice, professional and accommodating. They took to time to explain what was on our plates, and at the end we were asked if we wanted dessert well after closing time. Whatttt...   The food was fun and tasty.  Ordered bacon jam, chicken skin, beet salad*, burnt tips, grilled artichokes*, short rib grilled cheese sandwich*.   Drinks:  Dog fish head flesh and blood ipa*, Magaraian*, pink smoking jacket and wine.   *our favorites

RUKHVhiP9V1rJY86aEFRWw.text: Food? Amazing! Service? Spectacular!   I'm trying to figure out how I could have worked downtown for a few years and never knew this place existed! Clearly my bad! Everything we ordered was simply delicious! I can't say a bad thing about my experience except for the fact I had no idea I've been missing out on all of this good food! Can't wait to go back!

0Lo5N0WXy-LfkU2QkV8sGw.text: Wow! This place is GOOD!!!!! Omg, it's so GOOD! The service was excellent. I love that the food comes out as soon as it's ready and your not just sitting around especially if you are with more that 1 person. We ordered the wild mushroom flatbread.....AMAZINGLY BREATHTAKING! Also ordered the chicken skins, although very unhealthy.....AMAZING salty crunchy. The honey was good but I like it fine all by itself. The hubz got the grilled octopus and agreed that is was also AMAZING!  Lastly we finished it off with the glazed donut and that was exactly what I needed to end my night. I am so glad I found this place. Very cool ambiance, corner spot with outdoor seating. Very pleased and plan to return anytime in Vegas!

KnjDT6SAS_oy4b1rxxb0SA.text: Excellent!  Good drinks but not a lot of options on cool cocktails. I almost expected this place to have a large menu of unique cocktails but they didn't.  What they had was still pretty good.  Went with a bottle of average Pinot Noir with dinner.    We had 4 of us in our party and we ordered from a fairly large tapas type menu. We probably ordered 10 items and they were all great.  The loaded deviled eggs were excellent. The order comes with 4 with a topping of caviar on each. Pretty damn good!  Pretty reasonably priced and definitely a place I'd go to again when I go to Vegas.

UOUy4WxBFtTn6d6xF2xI_Q.text: My husband and I came up from LA and stopped by Carson Kitchen for an anniversary dinner and we're glad we did! We were seated right away which was a nice surprise, given that it was Memorial Day weekend. We sat at the bar and had the pleasure of having Felicia as our bartender. She served us some fantastic cocktails and recommend a few dishes for our meal:   * Bacon Jam: tons of bacon, reduced in jam, and topped with Brie, served with toasted buttered baguettes. 4/5 *  Young Beets: a tasty beet salad with red/green grapes & goat cheese. Loved this 5/5 * Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip: reduced in a red wine sauce. We ordered medium rare but it was a little over cooked; the flavor was really good though. 3/5  * Turkey Jerk Burger: A very unique burger... we were pleasantly surprised. It had a mango chutney slaw that took it to another level. 4/5 * Glazed Donut Bread Pudding: I'm usually not a fan of bread pudding but man, this was SO good. A must try. 5/5  We also ordered the Crispy Chicken Skins with the smoked honey sauce but weren't really a big fan of it. We found that the batter overwhelmed the chicken skin. But Felecia graciously took it back for us and we appreciated that very much; we opted for the Turkey Jerk Burger instead.  Honestly speaking, the food was good but the drinks were even better. We got two rounds of the Mezcal Negroni, a Towns End, and an herbaceous gin cocktail with lime that our bartender made, and it was on point. Just what I wanted.   So if you want a break from The Strip, you're definitely going to want to check out Carson Kitchen. It's cool spot with outstanding service.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Burger, Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip, Young Beets, Bacon Jam, &amp; Bread Pudding

nA-2UK7mJyUEhjeEww_2oQ.text: Such a cool vibe and interesting food! This place gets packed pretty quick so it's best to arrive early. My favorite was definitely the Secret Sunday Chicken sandwich. The skin was cooked to perfection and the side of has brown was amazingly crisp! We also ordered the mac n cheese and gyro tacos which were also really good. The only thing that I didn't care for was the oxtail risotto.

PWJ4T-me_EKPqlXccXYRKA.text: This is a Tapas style restaurant with a fantastic rooftop patio and bar. A nice relaxing spot to eat lunch on a sunny day. The "killer shrimp" is tasty for people who like a little spice. The "Secret Sunday Chicken" is made with crisp white meat chicken.

OqPfg5lYcn9dUvntxbM61w.text: Wow. Just. Wow. What a fun, unique, and amazing menu. We had the Devils eggs and veal meatballs for starters, and the veal meatballs were out of this world!  We followed it with the ox tail risotto and snap peas, and they were equally amazing. We were stuffed, but went ahead and ordered the upside down peach cake and it was spectacular too. Drinks were creative and a great value. We'll be back for sure to try other options that sounded amazing as well!!!

W7SvMkU8HkztXe4K7NwV_w.text: This evening we decided to try out Carson's Kitchen. We weren't sure what to expect since we aren't from LV we are from London. I just want to acknowledge the service we received at this restaurant. Top notch and top speed. Preston our busses was a nice young lad with a great sense of humor. After a 14 hour flight that was much welcome and his outstanding service provided a great evening of fun for my and my partner. Thanks again.

9k8hrtFj3KoTd3o12qSguQ.text: After my first stellar visit, I've been back two more times and I'm still impressed. Love how they clearly take feedback into consideration. A few menu changes have been made, but they all seem to be for the better.   WATERMELON AND FETA SALAD: A classic summer salad, with cucumber and white balsamic. Great fruit dish that shines alongside Kerry Simon's excellent veggie dishes. TEMPURA GREEN BEANS: This dish is addictive! Every table around us had an order, and after ours arrived we understood why. It's crunchy, it's savory, it's sweet with a bit of spice. The red pepper cream cheese is sinful. Just get it. BLACK RICE & OXTAIL RISOTTO: Didn't quite have the usual risotto texture or consistency, but the dish itself was so savory and indulgent. Rich and flavorful, meatier than expected.  GYRO TACOS: This was a bit of a letdown. Cool concept but poor execution. The pita taco shells are super dry and floury, and the taco filling was overly seasoned to the point that it didn't even resemble lamb. BISON MEATLOAF SLIDERS: Awesome upgrade from the original Dr. Pepper sliders. The bison was moist and flavorful, complemented nicely by the crispy onions. Side of spicy tots was nicely seasoned and crunchy. If you aren't sharing as a group, this would be an adequate lunch portion. THAI CHICKEN FLATBREAD: This was a fail for us. The cheese just didn't work with the other ingredients. The curry sauce was lackluster. The crisp veggies and crisp flatbread did not harmonize at all.   As long as they keep turning out great dishes, I'll keep coming. But my original claim that their vegetable dishes are where they truly shine still stands. Service remains great, try the rooftop patio if you come by in the evening.

q6VkZsCg-iqmDH-tjfJ7Kg.text: Tasty. great service. Decent prices.  What more could you ask for? veal meatballs and bacon jam were a fave.

NIr_9dX18CO68TE5KL2Yog.text: great food and staff. open kitchen so you can see the whole show. great find near fremont st  food was excellent really was impressed

gNT5GvYkMgXRBDyC5qMxKQ.text: If you are in Vegas. You must come to this place. It has a great vibe and amazing food.  The service was excellent.

VnDdl07XKiKNNTZTeCEo9g.text: Such a hip, trendy gem right off Las Vegas blvd in the (somewhat seedy) Fremont st area. We sat right at the counter and got to watch the kitchen team cook and create each delicious meal! Our faves were definitely the burnt ends, sunday chicken sandwich, mac and cheese, and black mussels -- all yum! Drinks were also very, very good and the female blond bartender at the roof bar upstairs was very friendly and down to earth. Also loved the firepit and outside "chill area." Worth the uber ride if you're out of town like us and staying on strip!

qcIshZRAR4DuJ_r9tj2Brw.text: Great food. Great service. Love the feel of the place. Of course bacon jam is the best. We had Mac and cheese which was amazing. Burgers are to die for. Gyro tacos and mushroom flat bread pizza was also just as good. Very friendly place and servers who know what good foods to pick. Drinks were par as well. Visit this place you won't regret it.....

WCF1yIsNKq0i6Sfdr2Dldg.text: My partner and her 11yo daughter went Friday night for a cool outing after a challenging workweek.   Daughter was told this was an adultish environment - and that intrigued her all the more.  No need to expand on everyone else's rave reviews of the food -- over-the-top good; but the prices reflected that MUCH more than the "$$" suggests: be prepared.  With that aside, the rest of your experience is OTT as well.  Staff is young, professional, and fun; the music played is fun as well; there are countless enclaves to personalize your experience; and the decor is totally unique - from the pseudo refrigerator door leading to the facilities and cooking area (which is totally open air if you want to sit and watch) to the floor and ceiling work.  In summary, fun to look at, fun to hang out at, fun to eat at.  Oh, fund to pay for too.  But what are Fridays for if not to spend what you earned in a memorable way.

Rw6FJnEx9dvG1DJ16SeMfA.text: This place has the best food. Everything is brought as it's made and ready so food is deliciously fresh. Their devil eggs is a must to try. Love love love their jerk turkey burger with tater tots. And please leave room for dessert, their bread pudding is amazing!!! Plus you will love the atmosphere and they just expanded and added a bar area. Recommend the sangria.

MGtBNrhFxuDT2b-iEOx6cg.text: Wow what a busy lunch spot...even tho the bartendar was really busy, the servers, kitchen staff all smiles and laughter. I enjoy a place that is happy under pressure...but can someone tell the hostess/manager, to smile once in a while, she seemed very grumpy and unhappy.

nmgVAmGyo0ifqLwD39PNYg.text: in town for work... glad i found this place. Awesome fresh delicious food.  Tried the watermelon salad and fillet o fish sandwich. The fish sandwich came with seasoned tater tots which were a great touch. Btw the green goddess tartare sauce was BOMB.  Cool open kitchen and friendly service vibe.  Look forward to coming here again on my next visit to try the other items.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet o fish sandwich with tots

flIp2VGC4VB_1dsDwjq1Xg.text: My boyfriend and I had super quick lunch here before we hit the road back to San Diego.   Hands down, best food all weekend. We got the bacon jam, and the Green, Eggs, and Ham flatbread. The bacon jam - delicious and I'm now ruined for life because this place is so far away and I can't have this every time I'm craving it. There is A LOT of bacon jam, so you will probably (definitely) need to ask for a little more bread, which they told us to just let them know if we needed more.   The pizza - oh my goodness the pizza - it was amazing. It was crispy and flavorful and perfect and I was craving more, but was too stuffed from a weekend of over-indulgence to get seconds.   Carson Kitchen will be a regular stop on any trip that I make to Vegas and will recommend it to any friends that I know heading that way.

UHlzSkXaJq2ll7ARx9QRYA.text: Wonderful experience! So glad we returned and tried it again!  After my first review, the manager messaged me wanting to know more details about my visit and invited me to return and try it again. So right away, great customer service. And I really appreciate that.  We returned on a Saturday night and got to sit in front of the open kitchen. Dinner with a show! As food lovers, it was a real treat to watch the workings of the kitchen.  Our server, Dakota, was wonderful! He was very friendly and attentive. I asked him for recommendations and we ordered those. He was definitely not wrong!  We started off with the crispy chicken skins and tempura green beans. The chicken skins were definitely not something I would normally ever order. But they were seriously delicious! The seasoning and flavor was so tasty. And the smoked honey to dip them in went perfectly. And the portion was pretty big too. The green beans weren't exactly flavorful (but hey, they're green beans). But they were nice and long and perfectly coated and fried. And the pepper jelly cream cheese dipping stuff was seriously delicious and added a really nice flavor with subtle spiciness. And again, a pretty large portion.  For the next course, we went with the cocoa espresso NY strip and mac 'n' cheese. Yum, yum, yum! We were seriously impressed. We weren't sure between medium rare and medium, so our server put it in as medium rare plus.  Who knew that was even possible? It came out perfectly cooked - absolutely perfect. Fantastic crust on the outside and just right on the inside. The flavor was phenomenal! The red wine sauce on top went fabulously with it. It was seriously one of the better steaks we've had in town - and that's saying a lot. We're literally still talking about it. Get the NY strip! The mac 'n' cheese was also a real treat. It reminded me a bit of the mac 'n' cheese at Simon (also a Kerry Simon establishment), which I also loved. It was an excellent mix of cheeses, blended and melted very nicely. It had a good sharpness and tanginess. And just the right amount of crustiness. Loved it! And it was the perfect accompaniment to the steak. And both were pretty sizable portions too.  At this point, we were totally stuffed. So much food goodness! But how can you skip dessert? We got the special for the night - banoffee and the donut bread pudding. Both were quite tasty. James O. absolutely loved the banoffee. I particularly liked the biscotti and whipped cream. Very flavorful. The donut bread pudding was a great twist. The rum caramel sauce was a particular favorite aspect of mine.  Oh, and there were cocktails. Tasty and well-made cocktails. Again, going with server recommendations was definitely the way to go. I ordered some I normally probably wouldn't and was pleasantly surprised and pleased.  It was definitely really busy (duh, Saturday night) and the staff seemed to never stop for a second. But despite being so busy, we had wonderful service. And sitting in front of the kitchen made it all the better. We left completely stuffed and very pleased with our dining experience. Do we possibly have a new favorite downtown restaurant? Yes, we do. No doubt we will be back again (and again and again).

ical4omPj_wb_zsrg_XwDw.text: I was a little nervous bringing my 8, 9, and 12 year old but were pleasantly surprised. They all loved it and wanted to order more-  mac n cheese, meatballs, hamburger, jerk turkey burger.

WovUS4eHL3Lf-Hn5anSOaw.text: Carson Kitchen is a rare combination of a warm, inviting atmosphere, a welcoming staff and food with flavors that will blow your socks off. I couldn't recommend it more strongly. The Mac n cheese rivals the time tested recipe of my southern roots and he turkey burger snuck up on me like a ninja and smacked me across the face with its sweet and savory one-two punch. Do yourself a favor and high tail it to Carson Kitchen. I might just be sitting there when you arrive.

hwaDDLT4-dBM--F03UEajQ.text: I think we passed it... No that's not it... Wait, there? ...  The place is pretty hard to spot, but don't let that turn you away. It's worth the search!  Lots of street metered parking available- you don't need to go back to your original meter to add time to it. Any of the meters downtown let you add to your specific spot-just don't forget to keep the receipt with lot/space number on it!   The restaurant is small and cozy with a full view of the kitchen. It was pretty packed on a Saturday morning- it's not a place you can go to sit and read for hours.  We ordered the thai chicken flat bread. Not spicy, perfect size for two, not heavy on the cheese. 4/5 The spicy shrimp was a 5/5 for me. Perfect combo of sweet and spicy.   I don't have an issue with this but.... A couple came in with two screaming kids and were given cold looks from other customers throughout their meal. "Why would you bring your kids here," was said by the couple across from them multiple times and loud enough for them to hear. Carson Kitchen might not be the place to bring them.

Cqz5q8SUEXnifszXtgeWTw.text: The food of of the chart great and the service just  as good.   Loved it so much for lunch that we came back for dinner.   :)

-FVuX2a066sJBTbmfvaP4g.text: If I could give a negative star I would...... After posting this review I was immediately called out by the owner for trying hurt his business.  After two more even stronger emails from the owner I was informed I will not be welcome there in the future!  We have eaten here in the past and the food is outstanding!  Unfortunatley this trip we weren't able to get in.  We called in the mid-day and said we had 5.... they said they cant reserve with less than 6, but if you arrive before 6:30 you should  be fine.  We arrive a bit early with an important client and the hostess was very rude and said no way you will get in here until 9 pm.  We were like we were told there would be no problem she said nope!  I then spoke to the manager who was a bit more understanding but still said no chance.  We left walked around the corner and had an amazing Mexican dinner (we were seated immediately)  and my customer was pleased!

J8u5iPnFKSeYRmmVJeJCkQ.text: The staff is perfectly friendly but quick, namely Bianca, hit her up when you come in to try this place.  The atmosphere is very well done and doesn't come with an outrageously priced menu like other similar styled eateries.  Try the turkey burger, it's very original- and delicious. The portions vary from petite to filling, they have something for everyone.

BzBIEIpgVd3_wAWvsEcPRA.text: There was some anticipation after all that I have heard from this place.  had a chance to to try this place out with a good friend. There was a 15-20 minute wait. Nonetheless, we got the best seat in the house. Right in front of the cooks as this was an open kitchen style setting.   We tried the following  Tempura green beans Deviled eggs with pancetta and caviar Bison Meatloaf sliders (my choice) wild mushroom flatbread (Aiza's choice)  The tempura green beans and deviled eggs were delicious. couldn't have done it any better. As for the wild mushroom flat bread, we both agreed that there was something missing. The bison meat was fantastic, only gripe was the sauce, a little overpowering. Another highlight was the cucumber soda, I ordered which i have never had before. All in all it was a great experience. well done!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wd8HsaBiVLy_NugGojMVnQ.text: This was the best meal I've ever had. Be sure to try something new and ask the staff for recommendations. We had the cheeseburger, tri-colored cauliflower and brownie with ice cream and bacon. Delish!

hxjOooRrSbTACZI0hHWEXg.text: I held a party on the rooftop of Carson Kitchen last week and had a great experience!  They were super easy to work with, provided seriously amazing service (anticipated needs and listened to our guests by delivering on things they weren't even asking for...simply amazing).  We offered passed appetizers and an open bar for 65 people and the team handled it with ease.  The appetizers were delicious - mac 'n cheese bites, lamb meatballs, gyro tacos, bacon jam on toasted baguette and devil's eggs.  Definitely want to stop in for a full meal next time!

2DqaQUSPqMl-m8wXuVwPVw.text: Wow  was totally surprised at this place . seriously the only place we found in Vegas that's not some corporate multi chained /Star chef that has a location here in Vegas kinda place. I know it sort of is I mean Kerry Simon was a celebrity chef but sadly since passed away but his food still is alive and well here. Reasonable prices which is refreshing from the $125 wagu steaks on the strip ugh. Cauliflower, Risotto Asparagus salad Blackend catfish all standouts decent cocktails too great beer list. This is a must stop if you remotely like food!

70Nvn-7WCSInAGSJ23L0IQ.text: Super food!!! Had a great meal here last weekend- literally everything we ordered was awesome. Highly recommend the lamb tacos. Shout out to the manager who helped us with our "ItsOnMe" issue - great guy- Thanks!

VQpP-egloPPBM3P8GX-glA.text: I love when I can write a rave review about a place.  It's not often I give 5 stars, but when I do I mean it!  I'll start off by saying this, it's a small place so having a group of 17 people for a sit down dinner can be a little stressful up in here, but it can happen and it can be amazingly good!  And it's just so beautiful and welcoming in there.  Certainly a place to sit and stay awhile while you sip cocktails, have great conversations and enjoy amazing food.   We made reservations for my man's birthday dinner @ Carson's on a Sunday night around 8:30.  The staff was very obliging with the fact that I didn't want to do a special prefix menu and drinks which was great since I didn't want to make people eat food or drink things they didn't want.    When we arrived (a bit early) the place was full and they weren't quite ready for our group yet.  They let us know there was an outdoor patio area where we could wait with our drinks until our table was ready.  The bartender was a good sport when he got pounded with drink orders - but he handled it professionally and whipped them out for us.  He was shaking and stirring so hard, he had to take off his over shirt to cool down, but he didn't miss a step and made each one deliberately delicious.  He even whipped out some off the menu orders for us.   I stuck with the classic 'Towns End' and it remained my sipping pleasure for the evening.  The outdoor space was really great too.  A little fire pit glowing to keep us warm while we sipped our cocktails and beer.  It's a great area to relax and mingle while you wait for a table.   Once we were finally seated we realized we had a few more people than seats, but the waitress and hostess (though a little frazzled) handled it well and we worked it all out.  Our waitress was the bomb and took control of the orders with gusto and charm!  I loved how organized and knowledgeable she was.  She helped my sister in law figure out what her allergic self could consume and didn't miss a beat when food started arriving about who it went to.   She was energetic and witty from start to finish!  Great job lady!!  I hate that in the chaos I didn't remember this feisty, petite, curly sand blonde headed gal's name.  But I'm sure the owners know they have a catch with her there!  The food - every bit was delish and we tried so many things!!  As a vegetarian, I can attest that there is PLENTY for you to eat here.   Just for starters the Tempura Green Beans, Young Beets and Rainbow Cauliflower were all scrumptious.  Many of my meat eaters loved all their dishes too.   But what topped my evening off was the Bonofee Pie.  Oh my my - this is like your grandmas banana pudding massively upgraded.  As full as I was I licked every last morsel of that off the bowl.  SO GOOD.  I would not hesitate a moment to go back here or recommend it to anyone!  So do yourself a treat and book a table... now!

-274_8nopHrkDUvzmScr1A.text: My boyfriend and I were here in January and I'm just getting around to the review. First, the location was surprising, on a side street near Fremont. We had a number of dishes: the bacon jam, the beet salad, and the devils eggs were absolutely delicious.  The timing of the dishes was off for me... they brought them as they were prepared, which was one at a time. When we finished one, they would shortly bring another.  I guess that wasn't bad for the shared plates but we each ordered a main plate and they arrived 20 minutes apart.  My boyfriend was already done by the time I got mine and I didn't even have anything to pick at.  Also, the two dinners lacked flavor and originality.  They made what would have been an otherwise 5 star, only 4.  I want to give them another shot for my son's bday dinner, but I can't take the chance. Overall though, the small plates were the best part of the night and we still talk about them.

UOz_ApDewZue9cxflv522Q.text: Best Deviled Eggs Ever!!! And Chicken Skins!! Don't forget the SKINS!!!!!! Great atmosphere and service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty chicken skins basket

OTU1npKDSJj9-_BzyFZ46Q.text: Well worth the drive from the hotel on the other side of town. Came because of reviews and I agree with everyone. Skins and the eggs for starters were perfect. Chicken skins were done just perfect nit at all greasy. My guest ordered watermelon salad and I got a bite which was remarkable. The blending of flavors was perfect. I ordered the jerk turkey burger and my husband I ordered the butter burger.  Both were very thick. Some might like that but I thought just too thick to be enjoyable one reason only 4 stars. Flavors were good presentation excellent however if you are not a fan of spicy watch the menu for less spicy dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert outstanding!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great starters

1btKahsKI-GAQut7FKhCMA.text: I highly recommend this place! I loved the set up and the ambiance of the restaurant! The service was fabulous and very friendly and interactive. We had such a great experience- cannot wait to go back! It was my boyfriend and we decided to try a variety of items- Killer Shrimp, Gyro Tacos, Seared Scallops, and then Strawberry Salad.... All of these items were very delicious- but I think that I would have to choose the Gyro Tacos as my overall favorite!

c-N6L_CHPYai1c5mZOk3-Q.text: I love this place, the chef is very creative. Was very crowded the last time we dined here however I understand that they expanded into the space next door recently.

mOoLDd15ep2F_Lat7jBWsg.text: Came here per recommendation of my supervisor. She raved about the fried chicken skins, so I made the trip out. Carson Kitchen offers a unique dining experience. Most of their dishes are appetizer style and are made to share. Our host was very nice and went through the entire menu with me as I have dietary restrictions being lactose intolerant. We ended up choosing bacon jam and of course, the fried chicken skins. I won't bore you with details and get straight to the point. The food was different, unique, but damn, it was delicious. If you're looking for that special different kind of something, this is it. Just go check it out.

UwdUS6Nl555TXl3cNJ2YIg.text: I'm so surprised that everyone loved this place. :/ like. I was crazy disappointed. The food was so incredibly unbalanced, and truly almost jarring.   I honestly felt that the only reason this place is getting such high reviews is because of the hipster vibe and rock and roll t shirts.   So odd.

QiNpsdPqPThkXuTzH2KR8w.text: We came here for lunch after a recent hip Fremont district stay-cation.  Pretty much to kill 2 birds by trying it out and nursing a hangover.  It was pretty busy in there.  We got seated at the bar.  The bartender was a great server and had many good suggestions for our "situation".  The decor is completely minimal.  Bare structure is exposed, but in a good way.  Sometimes up dressing and decorating is not needed.  It is quite a tight spot but I believe they have an upper level now, which probably has a spectacular view.  I ordered the Tempura Green Beans.  The Pepper Jelly cream cheese was a nice whipped addition to the lightly crispy large green beans.  4/5 for green beans  I ordered the Wellington Empanadas for my girl.  She said the meat tasted somewhat like a stroganoff.  The sauce was very slight flavored.  I discontinued eating land meats so I cannot give you a rating on this, but, she said it was good.  I had the Broccoli Crunch for myself.  A very fresh and hearty salad.  It had sunflower and pumpkin seeds, grape tomatoes and preserved cranberries.  The green goddess sauce was underscored just enough to grease things up a bit.  The whole salad was executed greatly.  4/5  We shared the Roasted Young Beets.  This came out as the most impressive plate design.  It reminded me of a vegetarian "Uni to Ukura" (from Yonaka Modern Japanese)  The roasted beets were soft and mild.  Pair each mouthful with the crushed pistacios, orange slices, goat cheese and micro-greens in each bite.  The mixture is refined.  Nothing out shines the rest of the ingredients.  As a whole the flavors are a symphony that doesn't quite match the beauty of the plate itself.  Still a very notable flavor.  4/5  All of the entrees had a thoughtful execution and I would say the entire menu is meant for the discerning taste bud.  More for those who would prefer a Waldorf salad over Spicy-Nacho Doritos.  With that being said I would highly recommend Carson Kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Green Beans w/whipped raspberry &amp; peppers (?) Aioli.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted young beets.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wellington Empinadas &amp; Broccoli Crunch.

ZnOPny-FiUdi3_rU3BQqEQ.text: Ten of us came for dinner.  This place is awesome. The chefs put their heart into the food there. Everything was delicious. Burnt ends, Mac and cheese, sea bass.  Wish I lived closer or could take Carson Kitchen home with me back to Detroit.  Highly recommend to any foodie!

yQuWkevMHXMMTVkOjfUXVg.text: So much yaaasss. The Oxtail Risotto (if there's risotto on the menu, I know what I'm getting, and THIS is the best risotto I've had thus far...so that says a lot), the Deep Fried Chicken Skin, and the Bacon Jam. *cue in tears of joy*  The service, the ambiance...ah, yes. I've taken a couple of my friends here as an introduction to the DTLV scene, and so far so great with their reaction. I've had one friend order the Beef Stroganoff, another the Rabbit Ragu. Both enjoyed their dishes quite a lot.  Bottomline, love this place. 5 stars for sure.

R5ALGjQGv2hNIInaryJAwA.text: (Janet) Jason and I travel quite a bit and visit many different restaurants and hotels, but we haven't felt inspired enough to create our yelp account until now. Neither one of us are Vegas fans, the strip gets old real fast and we're not big gamblers. So we decided to go to Freemont Street and walk around - the "old" vegas if you will - neither one of us had been downtown before.   We yelped restaurants in the area and found Carson Kitchen. It's two blocks away from the Freemont Street Experience.   (Jason) The manager of the restaurant, Matt, sets the tone that the rest of the team follows. Friendly, inviting, and dedicated to making our dining experience completely different from the depersonalized norm on the strip. The food was outstanding. All the staff was friendly. Great atmosphere - we really enjoyed sitting at the chef's bar overlooking the kitchen.  Do not miss the Bacon Jam!  The downtown revitalization makes us actually look forward to our next stay in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View at the chef&#39;s table. The drinks were fantastic!

venmtl3sh9aQCqWmn453SA.text: So happy to find this little slice of "local" atmosphere.. outside the Vegas strip. Food was delicious- especially the bacon jam. Super bartender-Chris-took great care of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EpJRaO6zw5O2emZKSp9ijQ.text: This would easily be five stars if the prices were a little lower or the servings were a little larger. The food and service were faultless. Decor is modern industrial stark yet appealing.   Note, the Carson Kitchen is on the Carson Street side of the building on the corner of 6th and Carson. The restaurant is not well marked, so it helps to know this.   We went here on the strength of Yelp reviews and did love the food. My son now says forbidden black rice is THE thing for risotto. I had the Wellington empanadas. We shared bites and were impressed with both dishes. We wisely saved room to share the bourbon brownie with brown butter bacon ice cream; the flavors blended exquisitely.   A bit expensive for lunch, but well worth it.

wq7OIGkxtiMHtiXTyGgI8g.text: Most important part of this review is the passion and professionalism of the entire staff, seriously impressive! Wife and I stopped and tried 6 different options (4 from the "Social Plates" n 2 from "Farm n Garden", here goes.  Positives: Gyro Tacos are great, could spend all night eating them. Mac n Cheese well worth it. Beets - a very tasty unexpected surprise. Did I mention the staff was great? Negatives: Veal meatballs were on the bland side. Expected more from the crispy chicken skins. Thoughts the prices were a little high for amount of food received.  Will I return, definitely. I saw some items that left the kitchen that make me wish I had tried them vs going the small plate route. Overall, a solid 4, but look forward to returning and seeing if the rating will be improved.

RYpP4FM9MqjNW9jS_4rcnQ.text: The whole experience was so lovely!!  We started with the bacon, strawberry jam and fresh French bread and wow!!!! So glad we did. It was almost sweet like a Smoky BBQ sauce, I enjoyed each and every bite. We then had the broccoli crunch which gave me a whole new outlook on broccoli! The salad was delicious. Lastly, we shred the mushroom flatbread, it was good, but I would try some big different next time.  I love the low ceilings and how you can see through to the kitchen. It's very clean and I loved the ambiance. You betcha I'll be back!

W042Lgke8xbsxD_gmDLiMQ.text: Bacon. Jam. Chicken. Skins. Holy god was this place good. Maybe a little hard to find, but it was totally worth it. It's also close to a lot of great stuff in the area. Great service too. This was the best meal I've had in Vegas!

1CUH6JSdy8L6ts67smbZTw.text: I've been here a few times now and it's been fantastic each and every time. My starters usually include some variation of calamari, tempura green beans and the deviled eggs (and I don't even like deviled eggs like that, but they're so good here). The beet and goat cheese salad is great. And for my main, the swordfish or trout is phenomenal paired with the Mac n' cheese if I'm feeling up to it, which I usually am.  Now the gem of the meal is the glazed donut bread pudding. It was a gift from the manager on our very first trip there and I will never not order it now. It's super rich so it's a great dessert to share!

wTml6Lgr8uTDjhmmszfGYg.text: This is the best food I've eaten in awhile. great quality and perfect flavor. the staff is so kind and outgoing, the place just feels fun to be in. perfect for a night out. i absolutely recommend this restaurant, 10 out of 10!

AEjDxbAOCRYifBEjseNIRw.text: First woman told us there were no tables or bar space whatsoever............we were leaving and the manager grabbed us and told us we could have bar seats upstairs and maybe a table. No AC, but we didn't want to have to try and find somewhere else to eat . Very good manager. Got some crispy chicken skins which I thought were really good. Shrimp......ok. Mac & cheese ........bomb! Nice mixed drinks as well!

Cs5jcp-p6Z4WxTK0UBE01Q.text: We ate a late birthday dinner here with a small group and let me start by saying that the food was FANTASTIC! We shared the deviled eggs, chicken skins, veal meatballs, cauliflower and beet salad- the perfect portions for a group of 5 and a not so heavy dinner before a night of b-day celebrations. The staff was friendly, the swear jar near the kitchen was a hoot- glad to see people still have a sense of humor. I loved everything about this place, its an off the beaten path gem for sure! eat here and enjoy!

txcqmfjSwuvJyB57GsR1ng.text: Love this trendy downtown spot, everything from the food, to the decor, it a great downtown Las Vegas eatery.  I would like to see more vegetarian options offered on the menu, and 2 of the 3 times I've visited the were out of the swordfish I really wanted to try.  My menu favorites are the Broccoli crunch and mushroom flatbread! My boyfriends favorites are the oxtail risotto and crispy chicken skins.   Everything we've tried we've definitely loved. The only thing that I really wasn't in love with was the rabbit ragu because mine was a little overbearing with oil. (Cooked to order, maybe the chef had a heavy hand is all).

tH-81HgyIVAbPZecEb5KtA.text: This place is amazing!  You cannot miss the Bacon jam!  It just makes everything better!!  Everyone is so welcoming just a great place.  It is not the easiest to find but It is well worth It!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam

PR5g_Lks4q-TU4a7qiHl8Q.text: So good they have a "Swear Jar" because when you get your food you will SY holly sh** that's good!

VX5FGGICaR1Sakg4iFDOvA.text: Whomever came up with the bacon jam is an evil genius! The next two plates haven't even come out yet but I already feel the need to post.   I would definitely come back to vegas just to eat this again!  *****  The next two plates came out and although the jalapeno poppers were good, major kudos to the rainbow cauliflower. A great mix of vinegar and spice; makes me think of pickled cauliflower with a kick, but grilled with a light char at the same time.  One of the best eating experiences I have had in the last year! Try this place!

W55hTBGk_GvlD6CB4TKKSQ.text: The food was very tasty and the service was excellent.   We had devil eggs, bacon jam, the pork chops, and the fried donut for dessert.  Nothing disappointed us, except the portions were a little on the "skimpy" side.  Would've been glad to pay more for larger portions, but maybe because the place felt more like a hipster hang out is why the menu was done this way.  Still a solid location and would recommend.

CUsyz5W3juUy6rRyfnXmLQ.text: I was determined to try this place after looking at their menu - I mean, how could a place that serves Fried Chicken Skin be bad, right?  They totally lived up to my expectations!  The chicken skins are served with a honey to dip them in, and the salty sweet combo is just what I wanted. We also tried the bacon jam, which was a little to sweet for me (I was picturing more smoky/salty), but it was thoroughly enjoyed by everyone at our table. Our meal was DELISH, and the service was perfect. Make sure to try the Rainbow Cauliflower, and the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding.  I had the Bourbon Brownie and Browned Butter Bacon ice cream.  The brownie had the texture of a chocolate bar, rather than a brownie, and the bourbon was truly present - almost overwhelming, but the ice cream was great.   All of the drinks on their menu use really obscure liquors, which I guess makes them a little more pricey. They do have a full bar, though.   I would definitely recommend this place, and can't wait to go back.

Bo-um5naZg_V7eCKT_SjfA.text: The visit here was a bit of a let down, partly because of the hype and partly because it was so hot and the only seating was outdoors which diminished the experience. The food is not traditional. There are many innovative dishes here to share tapas style with your dining companions. One of my favorites was deep fries chicken skins. While the creativity and innovation gets high marks, not all variations hit the spot. The staff is very attentive and helpful and the service was fast. I will certainly return but not go out of my way to get there.

KpL5lvycLdaChT6FI9moNw.text: Gave me a good first impression, but after entering I wasn't a fan of the heat inside the restaurant, it was an uncomfortable atmosphere. On a Sunday night all of the menu items I was interested in were out. The Sea Bass, NY strip Steak, and Pork Chop. That is the entire Meat and Sea food section. I asked if I could get the pork belly flat bread without the Pickled Figs and the chef refused to do so. Not much of a problem if i was explained as to the reason. Instead the waiter told me that he begged the chefs to remove the pickled figs, but they were insulted and couldn't do it. Very disappointed. Also be aware of small portions and a hefty price tag for what they are delivering. The rest of my party enjoyed their meal, maybe i caught them on a bad night.  Either way, i will not return or suggest this restaurant. Thank you to our waiter who did try his best for us.

ShdujkoojbQrMgRGeRjzJA.text: UPDATE TO PREVIOUS REVIEW:  First off, I went to this establishment but was unable to eat here.  I've spoken with the owner since my original review and there was a misunderstanding over the phone. We were expecting a table when we got there. Had we understood that that it would be such a long wait (45 min), we would have opted for a different restaurant.  I'm changing my review from 1 star to 2 because I did not have a good experience here as I was disappointed by the service / communication here as we waited in the restaurant. I've been to other restaurant that do those things better. Their phone service is very good.  As per my previous review, I probably caught them on an off night. If I dine here again when I return to Vegas, I'll update my review.    OLD REVIEW: I was really excited to try this place out last Tuesday. I called them up to see if a table was available for a party of 3. I spoke with Matt who said one would be available in around 20 minutes. He put our name on the list and he advised us not to park in the lot across the street so we parked in the Container Park lot and paid $10 to do so.   We made it to the restaurant 20 minutes later hungry and expecting a table. The girl at the front counter greeted us and informed us a table wasn't ready yet but would be soon as we were one of the next 2 in line. We understood and waited our turn.    We kept checking back in but she kept giving us the same story. It was very cramped inside as we waited so we spent a little time outside waiting where there were wind gusts up to 50mph.   After waiting 45 minutes, they gave our table to a larger party and she told us to continue to wait. I'm sure we caught them on an off night but the experience at the restaurant sucked and I cannot recommend them and don't think I'd ever come back, which is too bad because the food and atmosphere looked promising.

todEpcRvYXB4Ic5dBwMAWA.text: My wife & I came here today 7/10/16 for lunch. Seeing all the pictures on Yelp & reading the reviews definitely made me want to eat here. Once we arrived. We noticed how beautiful the restaurant was, friendly staff, and just a feel good ambience about the whole place. Today we ordered the Fried chicken skins (a little overcooked) but still was a good appetizer, the macaroni and cheese (definitely in my top five when it comes to mac & cheese) & we had the steak $19. Steak was great you could cut it with a butter knife, and I did. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the pictures are deceitful! The portions looked huge in the pictures, but are not. I seen someone eating a burger & that was huge. I wished I've gotten that instead, because everything I ordered I was still hungry when I left. Carson's is the kind of place you come to on a 1st date, and when you're not trying to have a heavy belly. Would I come again... Hell yea! I just know now that the things I ordered are not for sharing. Order your on damn Mac & cheese.

T2IoS1leir7tff6s_cecmw.text: Carson Kitchen is all things wonderful (except the long waits to be sat from being so darn good and busy, but there's a bar and a courtyard while you wait so horray!)  We sat on the roof deck which is great during summer nights. (I know it's winter while I post this review so sorry) the view of Downtown was really nice. We tried the bacon jam (Yum!) and Gyro Tacos (also yum!) to start. The table next to us ordered the crispy chicken skins which looked amazing, so we have to try that. We also tried the Baked Mac & Cheese which was rich and super de-lish. For dessert, we ordered the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding, which was okay. I mean the flavor was there, but I am not too much of a fan of O-Face donuts. They are a little too dense for my liking. We also tried the Bourbon Fudge Brownie that was served along Brown Butter Bacon ice cream. That was delightful! So good.  Can't wait to try more next time.

UQclBAQg-zRRL7xsCymPBw.text: Bacon jam,crispy chicken skins,Tacos,Mac&cheese,butter burger and donut pudding are my favorite things to get love the food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet salad

EPgMEo3sSmqeQLI3mm23bg.text: My husband and I had the bacon jam and turkey burger. Both were great. The bacon jam was super rich. We could not finish it despite its amazingness! I recommend the bacon jam if you have a larger group of people than two or can take it to go. Since we were staying at a hotel room with no fridge, we sadly had to kiss our bacon jam goodbye. The turkey burger was great! I eat a lot of turkey burgers, and rarely are they that juicy and flavorful. My husband thought it was too fennel tasting, but I had absolutely no issue. It came with some crunchy tarot tots that were nice and dry, not oily at all.   Wait staff was good. decorations are fun. Communal tables are a bit different, but we made friends! I would definitely try this place again. If you are staying near Fremont street experience, do yourself a favor and venture a few blocks off the path. Good stuff!

vWb0HiDfP-Kld5--IaHQdw.text: Highest of my reviews. That atmosphere and wait staff were fantastic. I wish I could remember the name of the drink that I had. A whiskey drink with the word town in the name. I loved all of the above prior to the food. The food was better!  Highly recommend the mac and cheese for a side, devils egg with caviar for an app and save room for the bread pudding. Fantastic!!!!

IYo8qsbwYHFc0n6yUUbBgQ.text: This place is really great. Our server Eugenia was outstanding and the food was amazing. I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu. It's about 15 min away from the Aria with no traffic and totally worth the drive. We will for sure be back

0GCzH-NK8hBNd_H8o2pXtQ.text: Great menu with a variety of options for sharing!  We started with the fried chicken skins and charred octopus.  The fried chicken skins were good but not the best I've had, the skins were just a little denser than the ones they served at 595 craft.  The honey with the chicken skins definitely worked though.  The charred octopus was very tender, I just wish there was more octopus and less potatoes.  The aioli that paired with the octopus was a little too lemony for my taste.  We also got the new york strip which was impressive, the coffee flavors and the red wine made a great pairing.  We went to Gordon Ramsay steak the night before....and the NY strip was possibly better than the Wellington there in terms of tenderness of the meat and flavor.  We also got the mushroom flat bread which was executed well but maybe a touch under seasoned for me.  The black rice oxtail risotto and the mac and cheese were also excellent for carb options.  We tried two desserts the bourbon brownie and the bread pudding donut.  The bread pudding donut we couldn't stop eating.  We left behind half of the bourbon brownie, it was more like fudge, so super dense and heavy with bourbon flavor.  Overall, solid meal and I would definitely come back. FYI don't bring kids here that need a high chair, they don't have one.

CI6gUnJWu1AhxI3_-6Xycg.text: Such a great find for Vegas!  Service is always on point!  Love the seasonal menus changes, and the fact that there is always still your favorite on the menu.  Will go back every time in in town!

N5Z2kdGs1rQUI2zmP3x0XQ.text: Was convinced by the owner to re-evaluate my experience. I admit 2 stars may be somewhat harsh just because I didn't "get" the vibe of the restaurant. I added another star for the obvious (and it is obvious) effort the owner is putting into customer satisfaction.  Local old fart here - I found this place to be more "hip-to-the-skip" than a restaurant with substance. The food is overpriced for the uniqueness it's trying hard to achieve. Granted, I only ate here once during lunch...ordered the Pig & Fig, but I found the entire experience to be "meh". The balance of flavors was off in a potentially delicious fare - the sweetness of the fig overpowered the pork and goat cheese. Staff was friendly enough yet it felt superficial. Sorry, just not a fan.

QLZT-7OoEKg-7jumgnOrCw.text: Had an amazing evening here. Food was great as usual, but the service was exceptional. Roman, our waiter, was kind and attentive. The whole staff was also friendly and accommodating. This last piece was especially important since our reservation at another restaurant was cancelled, which made us very late to Carson.   Will definitely come back soon!

Mj5cqJGccZzKzRPRO1Jo4A.text: I am giving them two stars because the food smelled delicious.    However, I never got to try it.  I was part of a party of five.  We called to make reservations but were told it would be no problem to seat us.  I arrived early and realized that at least half of their seating was metal stools.  My party was going to be comprised of people who would find the stools very challenging and/or uncomfortable due to health reasons and having different physical needs.  I discussed this with the hostess and she was very clearly annoyed with me that I was being so specific in the type of seating we would need.  Once my party had arrived we tried to look at some other seating options but they would still be very challenging.  I was very frustrated because the seating at this restaurant felt discriminatory and the hostess was unwelcoming.  So unwelcoming I would describe the her as cold and hostile.  I finally asked for other restaurant recommendations and her boss gave us a suggestion - Eureka where the food was not nearly as good (I am guessing) but to be treated as if they actually wanted us in their restaurant or respected us as people was a huge relief after our terrible experience with Carson Kitchen.

tQCAzmtO6aRWok6iO-Eovw.text: Before heading to the Smith Center to watch Beauty and the Beast we stopped at Carson Kitchen for an early dinner. We were seated in about 20 minuets, the wait was worth it! We had the deviled eggs, bacon jam, burn ends and Mac & cheese. They were all great, you mush mix the bacon jam with the Mac & cheese they make a great combination. We will be back to spend more time to enjoy this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zEvw2v99Bh_cZ5oLeaofoA.text: 1st time here.  We came down on Friday night with some friends and really enjoyed it.  Devils Eggs, Cawliflower, Burgers and Sea Bass.  Our service Eugenia was great.  She got us taken care of very quickly and attentive.  We really enjoyed our time here and we will definitely be back for more.

7lUZydxOaSvheH-EuYJFQw.text: Great neighborhood spot, killer flatbreads and creative takes on American comfort food. Plenty of vegetarian dishes to balance out the porktastic options. Make sure to engage the bartenders for some cocktails and leave room for desserts.

JpIUCqg20_-f9Lno4DQUsw.text: My favorite local joint.  I highly recommend the chicken skin.  If you're going on a busier night be sure to make a reservation there are not too many seats in the place so you may have to wait for a while. This Kerry Simon restaurant is not one to miss there are so many things on the menu to try. I have never been disappointed and have been back several times

U3sLFPSq4KwTWq9OjpK3hA.text: Small place but great food. A little hard to find but worth the search. Make sure you hit the donut store next door!

F9oHNcZNUdgHS_ppQzbQrA.text: Came with a group, which was ideal for the tapas-style. We all were really happy with the food, and the atmosphere was good. Great for date night or parties of four, not as much space to accommodate larger groups, but the food, drinks, and service are worth a visit.

PE89QnHB73Pk50sDFC9z5g.text: I literally ate the best meal of my life. Thank you Chef John and to your amazing staff

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZErg11PUDud1j_LhHqhyYg.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said?   Carson Kitchen should be on your Downtown dining stamp card, if it's not, pencil it in. I wandered in here for a few bites before meeting up with some friends for a birthday party, sadly this was third time in Carson Kitchen, but my first time actually the eating food.   I went with the Gyro Tacos, the Wild Mushroom Flatbread and, "A Drink With The Ms." to wash it all down. Carson Kitchen killed it on all fronts; the tacos were surprisingly light and very fresh, with the Mediterranean flavors really shining through and the Wild Mushroom Flatbread was a flavor bomb accented with a flaky crust that was to die for. These are both great options if you just plan on snacking at the bar before heading into Downtown Las Vegas.   "A Drink With The Ms.", isn't a quote from a "Mad Men" episode, but a solid Whiskey cocktail with a very sweet finish. The sweetness comes from the maple syrup and ginger beer that's mixed with a hefty pour of whiskey. This cocktail was on the verge of being too sweet, but the salty food I was eating kept everything at the perfect balance.   Carson Kitchen left my palate wanting more and like most people, nowadays my hunger controls my schedule. Carson Kitchen - 1, Nate - 0.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos.

Z6skOg7iVaGxNdBwgH4taQ.text: We're going with 4 stars for beer selections, ambiance and some really really good food and I might be talking about the jerk turkey burger with mango chutney slaw!  First of all they serve Brooklyn Lager and Maui Bikini Blonde that's a point or two right there but if you think I came all the way from Brooklyn to have a Brooklyn Lager you might be.....wrong!  I was in town for business and had the monkeys with me they always find me when I'm on the West Coast dad had the short rib grilled cheese with gouda and mom monkey had the flatbread...me and mom share our food dad always seems to get the ribs he's figured out it's hard as hell to share that plate so he won't have our fingers all over his dinner!  We started with the tempura green bean's it comes served with a pepper jelly cream cheese you want to start with that dish! I ordered the jerk turkey with mango chutney slaw and it was delicious probably one of the best turkey burgers I've had!  Carson Kitchen is one of a few really good dining experiences populating the downtown freemont experience area they've got about four or five craft breweries and gastropubs there to slowly make it the place to dine and drink, grab your monkeys and go!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Green Beans
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tXtnF-2eAXIUT4jPvwuJFg.text: Been here several times and have brought friends. The truffle mac and cheese is really good and the bacon jam is fun to try.

K9-mmz2rB2hEr-qQgkS-Ug.text: This review is closer to 3.5 stars. After reading Yelp reviews, this is one of the restaurants I added to my list to visit while in Vegas. The unique menu items made this one of the first stops on our list. We went on a Monday afternoon so we parked right in front of the restaurant, and we didn't have to wait for a table. We started out with crispy chicken skins and hot oysters. Both were great. They were actually the stars for me. For my entree, I had the butter burger and tater tots. Just average. I actually sent it back for them to melt the cheese. The cheese was very cold and hard and was not warming up even though it was on top of the meat. My friend had the black rice and oxtail risotto as an entree, and it was phenomenal. Definitely try this dish.
