HkSMbiPHo6jAS7Ozhtydaw.text: Came here for my birthday for dinner with my wife.  Waited for a table for about 30 minutes. We get seated and place out orders.  My beer and the appetizers came out quick, but the waitress forgot my wife's drink.  However, they balanced it out by serving my wife's entree without my burger.  Wife ate, waitress claimed mine was coming in a few minutes.  After 20 minutes, I had counted 7 burgers had been served, but not mine.  Flagged the waitress, told her to cancel it and left hungry.   $50 and a wasted chunk of my evening with barely 2 schitz given by the staff.  It's also really loud and the chairs are all backless stools at normal height tables making sitting there waiting for nothing a ridiculously uncomfortable experience.

Lv0n2wb2YvYtUn3VcYHzeg.text: I love Las Vegas and I love Carson Kitchen.  So much so my husband and I have been back 3 times in the last 3 weeks.  Each time we've brought new friends to experience this new way to dine ... family style or traditional.  The service was prompt, professional, and the servers very friendly.  The food is phenomenal.  Try the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding.  It is my favorite and I bet it will be yours too.

BRf0atXbX_XVX_sQqTzXFg.text: I absolutely love this place. Great atmosphere and drinks. Not to mention the food is

BuXsc4pMegHnyAZhxGbZKQ.text: Good service, great, imaginative casual food! If we were local, we'd be regulars. Bacon jam on crostinis, gyro tacos, spicy cheese on pretzel bread rounds, and breaded fried green beans were the stars. Go hungry. Order sharing plates, to nuts. You won't be sorry

tCBAatbHjbamc4q38-408Q.text: Sooo good! Had the gyro tacos, burger and bacon Brie! Fantastic flavor. Mr. Big drink was super flavorful. Can't go wrong! Sat by the kitchen and watched the prep. Super friendly staff too.

10TwHTBKwhbwCEg61nNgVg.text: I truly adore Carson Kitchen, but the last time we visited, was completely awful. I know plenty of restaurant managers on and off the strip but never have I been so offended by the manager that worked that evening.  It was slow evening when we arrived and were offered a table for 3 but our 3rd flaked out. Either way we're we're served well, except for the fact my lady noticed the manager continuously stare at us from afar. He finally came up to us and asked if our guest was going to arrive. As soon as we said no, he grabbed the napkins and place settings with such a bad attitude and walked away without a word.   We had our meals but we're still annoyed and Mike kept leering at us. Finally, we got our check and we're about to pay when he, grabbed the check out of our servers hands. He came back and stated, "I took care of the appetizer, thanks for understanding and we needed you to get up quickly!"   Wtf? Like really? You could of kindly asked us to sit at the bar or another small table, and we would have been good but the way the manager Mike, handled himself was completely unprofessional, offensive, and rude as fuck.   I will return, as long as he's not managing others with a bad attitude, giving patron rude leers and pushing them out the door.

45ddGdmnvomdCDZkWs4iEQ.text: Wow, are you kidding me? I had high expectations for this place due to the popularity but unfortunately, it was nothing to rave about. Went out for lunch with my co-workers and got the Short Rib Grilled Cheese served with Spicy Tater Tots and the Green Beans for an appetizer. Keep in mind that your food does not come out at the same time, it comes as it is prepared or at least that's what they told us. In our case, our Green Beans "appetizer" didn't come out until we were almost done with our entree. The Short Rib Grilled Cheese was probably one of the worst I had, the bread was burnt and over toasted and the short rib itself was dry and lacked flavor. The Tater Tots again were overdone, I mean it was more than extra crispy. Then comes the late "appetizer". It was nothing appetizing, came out full of grease and extra salty. I don't know if they were having an off day but for the price and quality of the food, I will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greasy and Salty Green Beans
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Grilled Cheese, do not get!

ZriNrHXaBM9pri5cs6Ih1g.text: Loves the ambience, food and service. We had the meatballs and the mushroom flatbread. They were both so good!

2dmmwo0PNwRTrHY4sK-BNw.text: Love love love this restaurant!!! My husband and I have gone here to celebrate our birthdays and anniversaries, and I always look forward to it.

lHxMoCnfVZfY5oQKMRXM2g.text: Wow just WOW.  Great and I mean great food had the salmon steak and chicken.  All amazing and flawlessly prepared. The staff are incredibly nice and on it glass never empty. High recommend . Our server was Yachelle and she was phenomenal

DyP9nekokhQzCAR_Hon9Cw.text: First of all, YUMM! We came in lastnight (06/21) before our comcert downtown. Always a great choice. The staff is always super nice and know their sh*t! Seriously even the chefs are YUMM!The blonde guy chef who makes the pizzas and that girl chef in the hat, um yes pls!! Ill take 2 TOGO! Lol love the upstairs patio too, wish it was open.

RaJIqXoSoXNvwXLstvjfjA.text: I was super excited to try this place out but I had such a bad experience. I am rating them based on customer service, not the food. A big group of us were exploring Fremont Street so we decided to stop by here based on Yelp reviews. I didn't realize it was such a small and intimate restaurant. We were escorted on their outside lawn which is filled with lawn chairs and some tables while the waiter asked the owner if there would be seating available for us. We were wondering if we could sit outside and eat but someone from Carson Kitchen came out and told us that he could split our party up and accommodate our large party as long as we finish by a certain time due to a reservation. We all agreed but then he said that they couldn't split checks. The could only split in groups of 3's. My friend asked why and the he simply stated "because it's our policy." My friend was curious and asked again why is this the policy since they could obviously split checks but it could only be done in 3's, he replied again in a rude tone "because it's our policy." I think we all would have agreed even with this interesting 'policy' but we were just wondering why. We were here for a conference so we needed our receipts to be itemized and separate. We did not need someone from the staff to be rude to prospective customers. I'm sure the food is great, but this man needed an attitude check if he thinks he's the reason for the success of this restaurant. We ended up leaving through the back, we didn't need someone to be so condescending to us. Sad I missed out on what seems to be an amazing food experience but we as a group felt like we were disrespected.  The owner contacted me after my review and was extremely apologetic about this situation. I hope this issue will be resolved so that others won't have the same experience we did. The owner also invited us back to actually enjoy the food. I'll be sure to come back with a smaller party the next time I'm in Vegas.

9QnvjuB8Q7unSDOgFw5gJg.text: The best food in Vegas. Share everything. We ate there twice in 4 days. I recommend them to everyone.

sw856HI71AIGM54DYkBkkg.text: I came tonight for my birthday with my family and had a really excellent experience.   We tried lots of different plates this evening, including the Jerk Turkey Burger, Grilled Artichoke, Shrimp and Andouille Risotto, Chicken Skins, Sea Bass, and Devils Eggs...WOW! Delicious and I can truly recommend everything listed above. Also, I recommend ordering several plates and sharing with the table, as the plates are brought out as the kitchen sends them out.   Our server was so sweet and attentive.   They do not take reservations but make sure you call about 20 minutes ahead and they can set a table for you in advance.   Highly recommended!

iNO6ylNgbGTIg77nxHsoQA.text: Finally got to come here after bookmarking at least a year or so ago...we just happened upon it and I'm so stoked we did! Great way to end an amazing weekend with a very tasty meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small plate consisting of a sliced toasted baguette topped with bacon jam &amp; brie &amp; a deviled egg
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious deviled eggs loaded with a creamy rich filling graciously topped with caviar &amp; bacon garnished with parsley
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Refreshing and a unique option cucumber soda

ODCaE5E3tUxnv254iM8pZQ.text: I wasn't feeling to spiffy and wanted to treat myself to lunch. I love their Devil's Eggs but wanted to try something new for a chilly day. The Black Mussels broth has to be one of the best things I've had in liquid form! The hostess and server were super friendly and sweet and I thank them for the pick me up, it was genuinely appreciated. Thanks for turning my day around with perfect food and perfect service.

7dSuNEWPYlC-fM9_6scUag.text: Simply the best meal we have had in Las Vegas.  Our hostess (I think her name was Danielle?) gave us the best seats in the house right in front of the grill so we could see all the food come out.  We ordered four plates and they were all amazing.  Dakota and Bridget were excellent and attentive servers, just the right amount of checking in without being overbearing.  Gyro tacos- perfectly cooked and the meat was delicious  Macaroni and cheese- you must order this.  Just trust me.  Burnt ends- we are from an area where BBQ is taken very seriously.  These were on par with a good BBQ restaurant back home.  Deviled eggs- reminds you of childhood.  Yum!  To make a long story short, this place is worth every penny and the wait!

8nf8jjL3j_hJjkCXJ-lE6Q.text: Good better bomb!  The burnt ends and the deviled eggs were the wonder.  Beet salad good but nothing amazing.  The risotto pass. Mistake was made by using Korean purple rice. It's too hard to be used in this way and the oxtail is nonexistent.  The chicken skin was good but not amazing.  Hipsters

IJTQ58M7v5_arAUZEbTDRA.text: This place is really good. The best thing they had were their chicken skins and veal meatballs. We got there fairly early, so it wasn't too crowded. Later on (about 7-8) is when the crowd came. The restaurant is clean, had a good vibe, awesome waiters and amazing food. Everything was so good! Definitely recommend and coming back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUMMY CHICKEN SKINS.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST VEAL MEATBALLS!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forgot the name, but it was some kind of rice/pasta.

E-d_9P8dKkJVQGY4XaPr0Q.text: Was really excited to come here, but pretty disappointed.  My husband ordered a medium burger, which came out super fast. Sadly the other sandwiches came out 15 minutes later... And because we all wanted to eat together, by the time my husband discovered his burger was rare and had to send it back it was cold anyway. Which, we had to flag a server down, no one came to check on us.  It took another 15 for that to come out...they did comp our burger. However, the mediocre food didn't make up for the service.

FZFZm3hCMVeutB5T7cGiIA.text: Great food and amazing service! I'm so glad we decided to take our group here for dinner. Everyone loved it and it was priced so reasonable. Thank you for the great dinner

oRglg0jky9kgnWXN7vgb3A.text: Love the location, food and atmosphere!!!!Great Job crafting an experience which brings myself and others back Downtown! I have been here multiple times and brought dozens of others to experience the Delicious Food which is cooked to perfection! Management, Servers and Bartenders take that extra step in all of my visits which add that 5th star!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good Times

HJDdpbGR7gbfMa3wTnP4Eg.text: Love this place.  It's got a great urban vibe and the food is on point.  We brought some friends from out of town and they were impressed with the flat bread, devil's eggs, and black mussels.  It was quiet during brunch, with minimal waiting.  Will come back again to try their drinks.

2EXrW39f2_AtfeLU2_eUYQ.text: This place has a cute vibe to it.  Although, not a fan of only stools for chairs.  Unless you sit at the bar or the group bar table in the back corner.  I felt like I was eating at the kids table.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  Nicole, our server was awesome.  Always made sure we had full drinks, coursed out our food timely, and made great recommendations on what to order.  We had a variety of items.  Fried green beans were delicious.  Young beet salad, not my fancy, but tasty. I'm not a fan of beets, personal preference, but I still enjoyed it.  Oxtail risotto, something new for me, but delicious.  Bacon jam was a bit sweeter than I had expected, but good.  It could use a bit more baked brie in it than they currently use to prepare the dish.  All dishes are made to share, so if you aren't keen on that, might not be a good place to go for just the two of you.  Group dining is the best way to go.

8DRTaQJ7WthH0_a2miomSg.text: Meh. Overrated. Started out at the bar, waiting for some friends for dinner. Ordered some drinks, but they refused to serve us food there with some excuse that they had to hold the counter space. Food was great. Service was fair.

8xb3iBwoI1v5B3ierYnNGw.text: Fantastic!  Bianca is amazing so cool. We had the meatballs, cauliflower, wild boar sloppy joe & my personal favorite the fried green beans!  Great local spot with fantastic food and even better service!  Thanks Bianca don't forget about #41 DMB!

e3nY19DWcAuh0U0DOGVBwg.text: So good!  If you're going to be bad, and splurge on something that's not good for you, definitely try out Carson kitchen!!  Very friendly service, cool atmosphere, not a very big menu, but definitely enough variety!   Everything we ordered was awesome, but the Killer Shrimp was definitely my favorite!

aEzUsi2zQ_HhBGFL0fCfZw.text: I went there for the first time a few days ago. Their mac and cheese is great. One thing I always like to get at places is mac and cheese so if they make a good one you definitely will have a returning customer. They also had orange cream soda which is not as common as soon as I saw it in the menu I knew no matter what else I got I would have to have that as well. That definitely hit the spot being so hot outside having some cold orange cream soda. I will be back there again. Maybe expand my horizons a bit on the menu.

W6BNNPOgTOpy13P67yVi5Q.text: Great ambiance, super friendly staff, quirky little touches that keep you going, "oh, cool!" Phenomenal Shrimp dish, fun desserts, and great beer selection. Sit at the "kitchen" bar and watch the fellas cook and laugh and master their craft. Thanks for a fun evening, everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watching Jake (not from State Farm).

y3RBiotJk1oJr1TmpvnQnA.text: Experience:  I have been waiting and waiting to try this place. I kept missing the nights out when my friends were going. So, here I am with about a group of 7.   Facility:  the inside is very small, but it was a beautiful Vegas night, so we sat on the balcony.  Was quite a walk around for the elevator, but stairs are easy access. The balcony seems to have more room, but it might be because it's open air. Upstairs has some bench seating and chairs.   Service: when I first walked in, I asked how to get to the balcony and a very nice lady (Suzanne) walked me all the way around to the elevator and up to the top. Our waiter (Roman) was friendly, attentive and accommodating.   Food:  wow!  So, we ordered a bunch of dishes to share.  Seems like most portions are on the small side.  Here's what we had: Gyro tacos - 4/5 - very good. Crispy "shell" made from pita, very good tzatziki and good lamb. Crispy chicken skins - 5/5 - crispy, slightly spiced skins almost cooked like pork skins, and served with honey for dipping.  The perfect blend of salty/savory and sweet.  Bacon Jam - 5/5 - the bread was perfectly toasted and the jam was sweet and delicious with a hint of bacon. Brie was kinda unnecessary, because the jam overpowers it.  Devils eggs - 4/5 - good flavors of egg, caviar and pancetta.  Cheddar crab fondue - 3/5 - good flavor, but almost tasted like canned crab. But I still liked it.  Mac and cheese - 4/5 - good, cheesey, but a tad runny.  Glazed Donut bread pudding - 3/5 - if you like sweet donut flavor - yum! Good flavors, but waaaayyyy too sweet for me.  Bacon Ice Cream - 5/5 - the yummiest!  Ice cream with bits of bacon.   Overall - this is now my favorite restaurant downtown.  I loved it!  The atmosphere, the service, and, of course, the food. I'll be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alligator Gumbo flatbread - tasty! 4/5
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach and tomato salad - yum!! 5/5
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upstairs on the balcony - great atmosphere and perfect night!!!!

pdWQWiNK2oRAO6kyg6qiaA.text: YUM! From the cocktails, to the food, to the service and atmosphere. Tried some new things tonight. Definitely sit upstairs outside, cool breeze and music makes for a great time.

IoMe5HRgJT-sZeqSVnOyyw.text: Ordered: Crispy chicken skin - delicious..something diff Bacon jam - interesting...and yummy Rabbit and spaghetti squash -  had it without the rabbit..this one was ok.... Baked mac n cheese - omg soo GOOD... best I ever had (I'm not a mac n cheese fan either) Burbon fudge brownie w/ brown butter bacon ice cream -  ice cream was bombass....brownie was too fudgie for me...  All the food has a ton of bold flavors....so ending with the fudge brownie was a lot.  But still good.  Drinks - the magarian & brewers fix..both refreshing and delicious  Love this place, definable will be back ....cute place and roof top seating is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MBAYRu8RaQir5p6qtgrFJw.text: Absolutely loved this place! There wasn't anything that we ordered that we didn't like. Will definitely come back next time we are in town. Thank you Roman for such a great experience!

Vxnxh1Qj5Bq6d4b8WA9_bQ.text: I wish I could take this place home with me! Delicious and creative use of ingredients. Truly a culinary delight. I read online about the restaurant so called ahead for a reservation for six people. Our impression was perhaps more locals than tourists in this downtown spot away from the strip. Trendy ambiance with open kitchen and fantastic service. We ordered so many dishes to share that It is difficult if not impossible to pick a fav. Gyro tacos, flatbread, snapper, bacon jam, green beans... really could list more. Delicious. Cocktails and dessert yummy and different as well. Outstanding! Wish you guys were in Austin!

7nAKC-r38CSn-y0vo5eO0A.text: I've eaten here a few times. I appreciate the attention to detail the chef gives to creating an innovative menu. Always get the cauliflower and the caviar eggs. If can, request Dakota. He's a great server with a positive attitude who's easy to love. Everyone here is awesome. I loved the Annabella cabernet.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caviar deviled egg

xC9huEBtDe4AOSEzQ1Ramg.text: Decor 3.5/5 -There is limited seating so recommend your party is limited to four -Update: There is an upper level that can accommodate 50-60 people!  Service 2.5/5 -Service was friendly but my water was empty for a while  Food 1.5/5 -Crispy Chicken Skin was tasty and seasoned at first. Eat a few more and it becomes very salty quickly. I couldn't eat more than three without my tongue feeling burnt -Bison Sliders had a mild game flavor and cooked around medium.  -Gyro Taco was over-seasoned and very salty. I couldn't even finish one. The cheese overpowered the lamb, all I could taste was cheese.   My whole party of four agrees that the dishes were salty and felt we weren't wow's by Carson's Kitchen. Definitely overhyped.
