_suvhx9_xx1S08e1TCY3Vg.text: It's about time that I finally sat down and wrote a review for the Carson Kitchen... My girlfriend and I have been to this place approximately 8 times since moving to Las Vegas last year. There's a reason that we keep coming back, it's friggin fantastic!  Heres the skinny: Carson Kitchen is a small, hip, yet unassuming, spot in Downtown Las Vegas that caters to nouveau foodie crowd. The space is tight, the ambiance is lively, and the food is killer.  We've experienced three different menu changes since we've been coming here (CK alters their menu seasonally in order to incorporate new recipes which reflect the time of year) and we have yet to be disappointed. Most items on the menu are designed to be shared and the best strategy for a meal here is to come with people who are comfortable sharing and order a bunch of different dishes to taste.  Some of the dishes that we keep coming back to are: Bacon Jam ('nuff said, just get it), Tempura Green Beans (delicious pepper-cream cheese dipping sauce), The espresso-cocoa rubbed Strip Steak (better than steaks that i've had at 5-star dedicated steak restaurants), Crispy Chicken Skins (YOLO), the shockingly good Mac & Cheese (great as a side with entrees), and the Black Rice Oxtail Risotto (a rich and creamy, albeit slightly al dente version that always impresses).   Oh god I almost forgot the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding dessert... That is the goods right there. The things I would do for that Bread Pudding might get me blocked from Yelp if I were to go into detail...  The servers are all welcoming, friendly, informative, and above all on top of their game. Any issues are remedied before they can become a real problem, drinks are always filled, and they are more than happy to give recommendations and answer questions.   I've taken every Vegas visitor that we've had in town to the Carson Kitchen and each and every time it is a highlight of their trip and we hear about it their love for this place for weeks afterwards. My only fear is that this place will become too popular and the quality will slip; but so far CK has held up strongly over almost a year of repeat visits. Love this place, keep it up!

YC8o_6Bf2C_tzgO6hyqgzg.text: So so so good.  Highly recommended.  Great prices and not your average applebees menu.  Never had oxtail risotto?  I can tell you it's amazing and there are other great options for non-adventurous eaters like my husband.   Fun location, close to the container park, easy to enjoy a date-night.  Seriously, so good.

106IvwQKTipt9-KvqTlQ_A.text: Fantastic food, a great, cozy atmosphere, and super friendly and good service. Would definitely come again if I'm ever back in Las Vegas!

pUPlNs5MI3uN416X9p2m0A.text: If you didn't know where this treasure is, you may not spot it.  But you should check out out. The interior is rustic yet hip, with a low ceiling and inviting atmosphere. We sat at the bar and, since my brother knows the chef, John Courteney, we were given a basket off fried chicken skin with honey, delicious.  I ordered a margarita, which was not overly sweet and the "Secret Sunday Chicken" sandwich.  The sandwich was packed with flavor and I would highly recommend it. The staff was friendly and unpretentious. You should check out this gem.

ZRNZ6qNPJINjPOnekP2F0g.text: The food was incredible. Highly recommend for foodies. Wait staff so pleasant. So happy I went

A_r7EGAEIvoNpGF_2x2qlQ.text: Really fantastic food, excellent service, and priced really well on top of it all.   The gyro tacos were amazing! Bacon jam was really good as well. Really all of the Social Plates were excellent. The deserts were good too. Unique and tasty.  The service was great. We were seated promptly, our order was taken right away, waters were refilled regularly, empty plates were taken away, etc. They were really nice and were on top of it.   One of the best meals I had on my last trip to Vegas! I would definitely recommend and would come back again.

f5RcrOU3lad6K6QfHIoJFA.text: Easily the best reasonably priced meal I have ever had in Vegas. The only place I like better costs five times as much and isn't nearly as cool or friendly as the Carson Kitchen is. Words cannot describe how incredible the food is here. We shared the fried Chicken skins, truffled Mac n Cheese, Stupid Good Shrimp, BACON JAM!!!!, spam sliders, butter burger and a bourbon brownie between three guys. We were absolutely stuffed and beyond satisfied for under a hundred dollars. It is hidden gems like this that you only find off strip and I can assure you that the three of us will be repeat customers at this fine little hole in the wall.

oqPrWZSXQOflimgzCC82lw.text: Carson Kitchen was fantastic. The food was phenomenal and the staff just as good. Ask for Dakota. He recommended the best choices from the menu for us like the Crispy Chicken Skins, Bacon Jam, Killer Shrimp, and the Bison Meatloaf Sliders. All fantastic but make sure you leave room the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding. Holy cow!  A fun touch was at the end when the check was delivered in a book that we and others could write in. Very humorous...  All in all, a great time and highly recommended.

-qx69Eq7oSDbxmB3Ubz6VA.text: This place is just top-notch every time.  There are some staples on the menu, but it is constantly changing, depending on customer demand and ever-changing palettes.  The chef here is very smart, and is always whipping up some new recipes in the open-kitchen atmosphere, and sharing them with his employees to see what they can tweak. Stellar. If I had to describe the food, i'd say american twisted, with a southern/cajun tinge. Great drinks to boot.

rImVg3cl5eSGdyi0tvfClg.text: The first time we tried to "walk in" the place was packed with an hour and a half wait. We persisted and came back for a late lunch several days later. It was worth it. Fun, creative menu and great cocktails. Order and eat family style. Everything we had was terrific.

z-KA-6QJJnnpa1SHMwIqRA.text: Last night my friends and I had dinner at Carson Kitchen, when we got there the hostess Emily was on the phone on what it look a personal call and we had to wait like 5 minutes standing for her to pay attention to us, after she finished the call, she took the menus, did not even greet any of us and sat us in the bar. I asked for a table and she said they can only have party of 6 or more in tables even though the place was empty. The waiter was really nice and the food is amazing they just need to reconsider that girl in their Staff. Emily you are by far the worst hostess ever! If you don't like your work please do us a favor and quit. That ruined our experience at Carson kitchen.

LMli91fCHpwtYRZc1AQX-w.text: Wow! Right from the get go. We sat at the back bar and Felicia was our wonderful tender. She made us delicious cocktails and had only us sitting for most of the meal so we got to talk to her a lot. Beautiful soul. She made some recommendations that we took. Starting with the devil's eggs. Wow! I licked the plate clean lol. Then the gyro tacos which were excellent, and being from Austin I like to see different twists on tacos. The piece de resistance was the jerky Turkey burger. It was something very heavenly with a crunchy jerky crust on the outside. Wow! Highly recommended and can't wait to go back to try other menu offerings next time im in Vegas. Bye Felicia!

k5--dWG7T-qY2acfhLdvQQ.text: The wife and I were heading to our annual Fremont street vacation. Always stay at the golden nugget, but that's another review. We travel to find new places based on good food, good service, with a great vibe. I stumbled on a review of this trendy hipster movement that seems to be happening in towns from coast to coast. We have found many. We now have another one to add to our favorites list. One block from Fremont street you will find carson kitchen. From the outside, you would never guess what they are doing indoors. We went there for lunch on a Thursday. It was busy, with about a 10 minute wait. The whole time we talked to the hostess who was so excited to be leaving NV and putting her food biology degree to use. We wish her well ! We were seated at a big table with 3 other customers. Some people might not like this, we love it. We're people - people. Never met a stranger ! We were greeted by " Felicia " our waitress. She went over the menu, got our drinks going, came back to figure out what we were going to try. This place has a great " share " options. A great way to try many items. We started with the fried chicken skins, ( don't judge us ) delicious!!! Had to order the lamb tacos, started talking with the other friends" we were seated with, and before long we were sharing food. We ordered the bacon jam with brie, grilled artichoke! Our neighbors ordered green beans and mac and cheese, oh my !! I've had a lot of artichokes and this one was the best. Everything we had was amazing !! Our kids were flying into town in a few days. We were thinking where we were going to take them for dinner. With so many options in Vegas we have never gone back to the same place, yet alone the same place in the same trip. But that's what we did. We came back on Saturday night. Had a bit of a wait, even after we called. No reservations, but they will add your name 20-30 min out. If took a bit longer because we requested " Felicia " again. Our dinner order: chicken skins( don't judge us again ) lamb taco ( lettuce wrapped because of the GF daughter) still tasty, black rice risotto, devil eggs, two orders of artichokes, and ended with whiskey desert drinks and the best bread pudding ever tasted. I can't say enough about this place. Do a few things really really well and you will be successful on many levels. Add amazing wait staff, which they have and it gets even better. We can't wait to come back. I can't give more than 5 stars but I would.

Xg3YpFo0MWToRz5ZlmypvQ.text: Lets keep this simple and to the point...  Bacon Jam, Chicken skins, and Scallops... I was hella satisfied after those three items! This place is great! The menu is short and sweet, the service was interactive and fun, and the atmosphere is small but great for meeting new people.   Get out and goto Carson Kitchen today!

WChnIrCK00fpzsCemvgCeg.text: I love Carson Kitchen. Everything about it. Well there is one thing that I wish was a little bit better and that would be the space. Because of the very small and limited space to sit there is always a bit of a wait. But the wait is worth it!  The staff are super friendly. Every time I've been there the staff have gone above and beyond to make sure my experience is great.   The drinks and food are exceptional. There are very few restaurants that I would say everything is good. Everything is good here!   A few of my favorites would be the Bacon Jam, the shrimp, their Mac and Cheese is dang good. All their burgers are great and steak.   I can't wait for this place to extend in the Vegas area. They need more locations for sure.

wQ7L79IVimkZrnVn4JNB8Q.text: Holy mouth watering Batman. Everything we ate was amazing. I'm not exaggerating. The beet salad, the jerk turkey burger with mango chutney slaw (who knew turkey burgers could actually have flavor?!), and even the bread with the bacon jam (!!!!!) were all fantastic. Then came the donut bread pudding and I never want to eat anywhere else ever again.

8Nxj-PSX7wJWxSFHcrUfoQ.text: We tried this on a recommendation.  It's not quite in the heart of the bustling Fremont crowd, which surprised me, but later, I was quite thankful for that.  You're close enough to walk to the Fremont craziness but about 1-2 blocks away, enough to make an easier arrival/escape.  We were escorted to a cute little courtyard waiting area, which was cool.  It looked like there were tables downstairs and upstairs (outdoor area upstairs?) although I never saw stairs inside.  The downstairs is all I saw.  It was small but had an energy about it.  1) Bacon Jam (baked brie w/ toasted baguette) = 5/5 (sweet and salty and spicy and sour all at the same time, very complex flavors made this very unique 2) Tempura Green Beans (pepper jelly cream cheese) = 5/5 (so glad my co-diner ordered this, the red pepper cream cheese was so tasty) 3) Baked Mac & Cheese = 4.5/5 (pretty darn good, solid mac n cheese) 4) Butter Burger = 5/5 (such a good burger, moist, unique flavors, seasoned well, melty cheese, yummy sauce)  I will say we each ordered a burger (which he told us was a full meal w/ spicy tots - also very good) and shared the bacon jam, tempura beans, and mac n cheese.  This was WAY too much food for four people!!  We loved our three shared items so much and think we should order 1 cheeseburger as a shared item as well instead of a whole burger for each of us.  Very high recommendation for this place.

ywxXIdauL-7DZRPZ6O617g.text: Great food, try it all! Everything was delicious, personal fav was the chicken skins with honey! Fundelicious do one of each arrive early.

xRkXIjaL3I9uE88Rqz2qKw.text: Genuinely tasty. Small but articulate menu, with everything done with love and satisfaction. The ambiance was a fabulous break from the strip and the staff was amicable and pleasant. I will be back when traveling. It's well worth it. Mac and cheese was delicious, shrimp and grits was spicy and flavorful. I highly recommend

NaPZ8MVyoY1ALfHBFlheuw.text: Don't go if hungry unless you you want to spend at least $50 a person.  Place wants to be gourmet but falls short for many reasons.  The portions are very small and lack flavor.  It's sad that there is not much competition.  The reviews make no sense as they flagged my first one.  It is as if they are in bed with Yelp.

lmh4KY5a1QkQbaimQ9E-Tg.text: This place is a great find. The restaurant is very upscale, but this is not reflected in the prices. The menu is great, with a modern take on the comfort foods we have grown to love. I also enjoyed seeing banoffee pie on the menu. This is a classic British dessert and was outstanding - my favorite part being the baileys whipped cream. I will be back the next time I'm in the area!

X4PjxRXWuY1Qzptga94vvw.text: This was the first time I've been to Carson Kitchen. I found it on the AAA travel guide and thought I'd give it a try since it had three diamonds. I was not disappointed. All the plates we had here were so delicious. We had the Salmon, Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip, Rainbow Cauliflower, Spring Asparagus, and the Bourbon Fudge Brownie with brown butter bacon ice cream. The nice crispy seared salmon was my favorite because it was seriously cooked to perfection. I highly recommend giving it a go.

zUzCpUb8UVx1BqpvnnFqDg.text: We came for an early dinner before heading over to the Neon Museum. I'd been before & my partner had not. Tempura green beans, killer shrimp, Sunday chicken sandwich, and flatbread. (Half the flatbread was taken home.) Sangria for drinks. All excellent! Absolutely zero room for dessert :( Looking around at other tables, the deviled eggs and mac and cheese appeared to be popular. Our waitress was great too, though we can't remember her name now.

T6jtyrhDWacexDs5qzjGdw.text: We've been here quite a few times and each time is as good as the last. It's a short walk off Freemont Street and very much worth it! The lamb tacos are simply amazing!

wlo1LWy-e_5Tcp5qUjEvfw.text: One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas with an extremely unique menu. Service was also excellent. I always get the Gyro Tacos and alternate a second dish. If you are ever downtown or looking for a great place to eat downtown, I highly recommend Carson Kitchen.

dGr0m26dRU_6TIzUQLgLRQ.text: Enjoyed everything about this restaurant... including decor and food. Service was a bit slow but everyone was doing their part. Everything was cooked fresh and arrived separately. But dynamite.

b8n-7y2X-HLyx7XCLWj5Ow.text: Very good service.   I love this place.  Great serving and atmosphere. So a Google search and Yelp search brought us here.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sx8VephBDItOio4R01wyJQ.text: Oh god, the food is so good. Although I've only eaten here twice, I've sampled enough of the menu to rate this place a 5.   What I enjoy about Carson Kitchen is how many of the items on the menu are sharable, making this the perfect location to dine at with a small group. Emphasis on SMALL because this place does get packed around peak hours.   On to the food!  Crispy Chicken Skins: Eating these gave me a warm, comforting feeling..or were my arteries clogging up? Whatever. Fried chicken skins served without the chicken is a daydream come True. The smoked honey sauce goes great with skins, though the deep fried flavor is fine by itself.   Bison Meatloaf Sliders: I stalked Carson Kitchen's Instagram and spotted these sliders and had to have them. The petite patties are flavorful and moist and come with a side of tater tots.  Veal Meatballs: Essentially, fancy Swedish meatballs, but, you know, way better because of the sherry foie gras cream. *salivating*  Compared to my previous visit, the service was warmer, and I attribute this to having eaten at the bar. It just felt like we received more attention there as opposed to eating at a table. Before I forget, there are purse hooks beneath the bar counter, because who wants to cradle their baggage while eating?  I can't stress enough how dining here is a MUST if you're in the downtown area. The menu may sound unusual, but keep an open mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Skins
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bison Meatloaf Sliders

ZXziJvjuXlzMQACHfAt-Tg.text: Tasty, unique plates. But be prepared to spend a pretty penny. Maybe people in Vegas are just used to being this spendy at a super casual restaurant?  The burrata and asparagus salad (which also had summer peas and something else...fennel?) was fresh and perfect for the heat. The oxtail and black rice risotto was tangy and sweet, fun texture. The gyro tacos were a fun "appetizer" of sorts. We would have ordered a few more dishes if we hadn't have dinner plans already. Come by if you're feeling off-strip for a casual, chill atmosphere and some fun dishes.  The 3 small plates plus a drink was something like $70, I think, but both tummies definitely had space on our way out. (Space for... giant donuts next door, actually.)

kLSNn9a9SZ_Rg2bcQMPHeg.text: Wow. This place was amazeballs. I loved everything about it. From the friendly staff, to the cozy dimly lit atmosphere, to the open kitchen, to the yummy food, oh the food. My friend and I shared 4 social plates and they were all delicious.   Crispy chicken skins served with smoked honey sauce- Seriously, who doesn't love chicken skin?? These babies are deep fried and fattening as hell, but oh so yummy. I didnt particularly care for the side-o-honey it came with though. The portion was definitely enough for 2 or more people to share.   Tempura green beans with pepper jelly cream cheese- These were super yummy. I thought the beans could have taken a little longer of a tempura bath cause they weren't that crispy, but this is not a deal breaker. I really liked these and would order again.  Bacon jam- Hellloooo gorgeous. Bacon, brie, and served to your table bubbling what's not to love? To be honest I found the jam to be a little too sweet, and only had a little bit of this but I can see how this is a popular dish.   "Devil's" Eggs- Deviled eggs with panchetta and caviar- So good. There were 4 to each order and I wish we had ordered at least 10 because they were so yummy.   My dining companion ordered the secret Sunday chicken sandwich for her hubs to go, and she said it was really good. I decided to get one to go for my man. Luckily for me, he didnt end up eating it so I had it for dinner. The sandwich was pretty good. The chicken was tender and juicy even after I had reheated it in the microwave and the bun was soft. It comes with sauce on the sammy, but since I was getting it togo  I got a side of it which was spicy pickle aioli. It tasted just like a spicy pickle!! The sandwich also came with spicy tots which were yummy and even better dipped in the aioli.  I am already planning my next meal here. They are open late, and at nights you can sit upstairs on the patio which is awesome for prime people watching. I totally recommend this place and I can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura green beans
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devil&#39;s eggs

yU0gRoEJzW6s63Vuz-fKZA.text: Date dined: 01/15/15  After actually finding Kerry Simon's downtown restaurant we had a great lunch.  Even though Carson Kitchen has a 6th street address, the door is actually located on Carson Street two doors down from O Face Donuts, in the Carson Building.  The smallish space has a lot of charm and warmth and seems to encourage a social dining experience.  There are only a few 4-top tables, but there's a huge butcher block topped bar with seating on both sides, as well as another that overlooks the open kitchen.  The brick walls and wood beams add to the sense of warmth in the space.  Today we tried the Tempura Green Beans with pepper jelly cream cheese and the Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip with a red wine demi glace.  The Tempura batter was fantastic.  Light and crispy, not greasy at all, and the seasoning was perfect.  The word "jelly" does not sound appealing to me when thinking about a Tempura Dip, but it was Awesome! and the consistency was more of a cream than a jelly.  The NY Strip was slices of Heaven!  Since we did family style I would definitely order a double batch of this next time.  The crust on the steak with the warm red center was perfect and the rich flavor was fantastic.  But the wine demi was a star.  I kept dipping my pieces in the ever dwindling pool until it was gone.  Seating was quick and the Service was good.  We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bathroom mirrors...just cause they are fun!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Green Beans with a pepper jelly cream sauce  (sorry it was really sunny)
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip Steak

edDCp0VrEReKL5ofn4J6Ow.text: I visited Carson Kitchen on my trip to Vegas for a bachelorette party. First, the restaurant is downtown and away from the chaos of the strip and it's tucked in a little store front. It was pretty easy for the Uber to find and not a hassle to get picked up or dropped off.   The venue is small, very intimate, and there is lots of table sharing. When I arrived there was a 20 minute wait but I was able to find 2 chairs at the bar for my friend and I. If you must wait for a table, there is a waiting area outside the restaurant in the back. The restaurant was really clean and quiet. The patrons were mostly dressed for dates.   I had the deviled eggs, chicken skins, tacos and a sangria. Each item was made to order and arrived at different times. They were all seasoned and prepared extremely well. The bartender was really really polite and offered great suggestions on both food and beverage items.   I loved this place and I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Vegas.

oC2a5DXYwib6oC0En_hPuQ.text: Wow, this place was incredible! From the outside it's unassuming; you might miss it if you're not looking. Once you walk in, the decor is modern and rustic. We were blown away at the stellar service... From the person who greeted us to our amazing waiter Manny; they were fabulous! Now for the food. It was DELICIOUS! We got the baked Mac & Cheese and fried check sandwich... Both were fantastic. Definitely pay this place a visit when in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H3WEs8H6C1SqHrIbS5pGKQ.text: Stopped by here last night since my first choice was booked up but I'm glad I decided to try Carson Kitchen.  It was pretty full since their upper patio area had some kind of business thing going on so I had to wait about 5 minutes for a seat at the bar.  The wait wasn't bad since there is a little courtyard right out the back door that has some nice seats to wait.  When I was sat at the bar the bartender asked if I was having any food tonight.  When I said yes she gave me a menu and a napkin with silverware.  I got a Margarian to drink and ordered the pork belly Cuban sandwich.  While I was waiting for my food the guy next to me got an order of the mac and cheese and it smelled awesome.  I almost want to change my order because of that.  The drink was light and refreshing and the sandwich was really good.  I really enjoyed the spicy tots that came with sandwich as well.  As much as I would have liked to have ordered dessert, my meter time was almost up on my car.  The bartender quickly got me my bill and I was back out in time to feed the meter.  Based on the service and deliciousness of the food I will definitely be back the next time I'm downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly Cuban with spicy tots.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Magarian, yum.

nrbG7I2F5lmht0JVfKD8fg.text: First let me say Manny our waiter was AMAZING!  He was more like your cousin who invites you into his home  and makes you feel comfortable and welcome!    The food was great as well!  We had the watermelon and feta salad, the butter burger, and the short rib grilled cheese. Everything was cooked fresh and tasted like they took their time making it.   I'm from Cali so I like to try different local spots. This spot has a chill vibe!  The only con, the music was a little too loud for a Tuesday afternoon, but I loved the eclectic selection.   A definite recommend!

mYXpAPsxypRkM7oYBmELSg.text: One of my favorite places to eat in downtown Las Vegas! The food is great, it's not overpriced, and has a fun vibe. The only thing is that I wish they had the rooftop open more! Especially with the great weather we have in Las Vegas.

tbh6Ih-6VXIxP5j2wXLpmw.text: Did I say deep fried chicken skin?  Well hell yes I did!  I always wondered why someone never put that on a menu because people eat pork rinds so why not give our poultry friends some love?  We went in here for a quick snack and were drawn here by the chicken skin appetizer.  It was a Saturday at 2pm and the place was packed so I can only imagine the crowds at dinner.  The fried chicken skins ($8) did not disappoint; however, it might have been too much of a good thing because it was too rich to finish them all.  I recommend going with a big group and sharing this appetizer with a few friends.   The menu was very impressive and the bacon jam looked like a winner. I watched other people get their burgers and they looked amazing as they came out....great presentation as well.   When I am back in Vegas I will definitely come back to try their other dishes.   Carson Kitchen reminds me of the Milwaukee restaurant the Social when it was still open.  It is an open kitchen with a very innovative menu at affordable prices.  If you are staying downtown, take a few block walk to this great restaurant.  Also, I would check if they take reservations because this place will probably be packed at dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken skin appetizer.

08xfSKN98IlJOqbusFyYHw.text: This place was AMAZING!!! There was not an item on the menu that we didn't wanna try!!  We ended up getting the crispy chicken skins, bacon jam, deviled eggs, turkey burger, and bread pudding. ALL amazing!! ONLY thing I'd say is that the bacon jam could be a bit... baconier? And it could use more Brie! But still. DELICIOUS!! And Felicia the bartender MADE our experience! She's a foodie to the CORE just like me so I trusted all her suggestions!! She was spot on with everything. And the cocktail she made (margadian?) was perfectly balanced and delish. Anytime we come back to Vegas, we will come here!! I can't say enough good about it!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glazed donut bread pudding with vanilla creme anglaise. Oh. Em. Gee. Delish.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger again. SO thick!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We don&#39;t like turkey burgers. This... changed our minds! SO moist!! Jerk turkey burger with mango chutney slaw. Whoa.

LWV6kwCOZGhXEm0p4PHOOQ.text: The veal meatballs were life changing....I am a hard core Italian and if u don't get ur meatballs right, they will never see me again in that place. Light crunch on the outside and super tender in the inside....the sauce is something your palette has ever tasted. Foi gras sauce with cherry vinegar, peas....just lovely!   I will be dreaming of them until next time!   The gyro tacos was brilliant! I don't like lamb , but the way they made is like ground beef and the small pita bread taco was genus. Tender and full of flavor  We also ordered the mushroom flatbread and all it needed was a little truffle oil and a touch of sea salt.  Definitely coming back - I have my eye on a couple more items....I'll be back!   I love the BAllS!!!!

EAD2_avZNiZLRFkXpW1Jog.text: Yummy food, great service, and good vibes! Stopped by here on a Friday to eat lunch before Life is Beautiful festival. Other places were really crowded, but we only had to wait about 10 minutes here to get seated. We got to sit on their upstairs patio which was lovely. It was a great day to sit outside. We ordered the Secret Sunday Chicken sandwich, Bacon Jam with Baked Brie, and Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto.  My favorite was definitely the chicken sandwich!! The chicken was perfectly fried and tender, and the sauce/aioli they put was so good. Everything went so well together. I also really loved the tater tots they came with. The bacon jam was really good! It was my first time trying anything like that before and it did not disappoint. It really reminded me of cha siu bao (bbq pork buns at dimsum) because of the sweetness combined with the pork! I really liked the flavor of the risotto, but I felt that the texture was a bit hard for a risotto. I expected it to be more creamy and the rice to be softer. It's probably because they didn't use arborio which is the typical rice that is used in risotto, so I should've expected it. I did think that the water tasted kinda weird (maybe it's just LV water?) but it wasn't a huge deal. Our waitress was super sweet and overall a great server. Would definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Rice &amp; Oxtail Risotto
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Sunday Chicken
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam Baked Brie

nRHazRJ4GLPobR2O9W-Fwg.text: Rooftop deck with a kind, friendly waiter, affordable prices, laid back atmosphere, and great food... all near the container park and downtown vegas.  This was the perfect spot to get away from the craziness of the strip and to sit back and relax and enjoy some good food and company.    We ordered the gyro tacos, which were so savory and tasty.. These were probably my favorite items we ate. Get these if you come here! :)  Tempura green beans were a hearty portion and came with a great dipping sauce, but our favorite veggie dish was the rainbow cauliflower.  So good!   Catfish sandwich was filling without feeling heavy, which I liked... The bread was crispy and the fish was flaky, light and well seasoned and the spicy tater tots were delicious!!!  My least favorite dish was the pesto flatbread which was a little on the heavier/salty side for my taste, but all around, this was a great dining experience here and I would definitely recommend giving it a try!

Rs-Owf_JsMqD1buyZS-X-A.text: As is customary I am upgrading their review one star because I was contacted by the owner to address my concerns. Not only was I contacted, I was contacted within 15 minutes of actually posting them which is really impressive... Cory I wish I had a better time at your Restaurant but well done in your response   Not impressed Don't believe the hype I had pineapple vodka which was barely any vodka whatsoever and that's OK if the food is good the mac & cheese is decent but nothing we ate was really worth raving about. The chicken skins were very tasty and it's a novel concept I've seen nowhere else, literally just chicken skins deep fried. We had the grilled cheese with short rib it was unremarkable .. the tots were good. The tacos were boring and the devil eggs were about on par with something you'd expect a friend to bring to a Christmas party when they're making them for the first time. I had huge hopes for this place and that could be tainting my review But their yelp rating was through the roof and I definitely did not enjoy it. The bill with tip came to about a buck 128 for four people and if I had any inkling that this was going to be the case there's no way in hell I would've gone. It was overpriced and we left unsatisfied and slightly hungry.  They do give a military discount

OcmnMZqCo2gZMEwiYk6xWQ.text: Loved everything we had.   We stumbled upon this cozy little place after visiting the Downtown Container Park. Although there was a 10-ish minute wait at 1pm on a Saturday, we're so glad we stayed.   The host was courteous and caring. Our server was super helpful and cool. The restaurant is trendy and the menu is full of great choices.   Can't forget the back of the house team...simply dope!!! They push out so much, great quality, consistency, and they have fun!!!  Do yourself a solid and stop by Carson Kitchen while in Vegas. If you're a local, run there now!   We had the BBQ Burnt Ends (can be a bit fatty), Pig & Fig, Jerk Turkey Burger, Butter Burger, Purple Haze, and Bad Beat IPA. The tots are salty crunchy heaven.   If there was more time and space in our bellys, the Wild Mushroom flatbread  and Glazed Donut Bread Pudding looked amazing!!!

boYWXOA-ZVCTai8UWNJWDg.text: Vegas restaurants can be hit or miss. My girlfriend and I stumbled on this little gem while visiting. It was so wonderful we ate there two nights in a row.  Go early or late to avoid the rush. But it's worth the wait. Can't wait to go back.

6yIm9tXd_wbwrwYAxay42A.text: Went here for a second time after the first time was ok, got in the host was busy chatting stood there for a few minutes until she finally got to us she sat us in the most uncomfortable tiny cheap chairs ok some angry guy came and threw us menus fine whatever we order the drinks were ok not great wouldn't order another one, got the deviled eggs very bland but filling I guess. Next up tempura green beans they were ok but the cream cheese was a weird combo maybe they would taste better with something else. Mac and cheese is ok but the truffle oil is a bit too much, last the butter burger lol avoid not worth it AT ALL. Overall this place feels like it's trying so hard to be hipster and cool it just falls flat the food isn't good enough to make me want to deal with pretentious staff. Never going back.

7ydbkP4ucTOmutOa5AlNXg.text: A hidden jewel downtown LV.   Seriously hidden.    Everything was perfection.   The service amazing.    They really care about serving amazing food and making sure you are just as enthusiastic about it.   Salmon and shrimp  are cooked to Perfection.   Amazing innovative bar.   My only advice in this forward thinking restaurant is to join the ban on straws as a small step in decreasing plastic waste.

kwI18J3D3e5AlCCm49wgLQ.text: In Vegas for four days and had lunch here twice! Awesome TASTY food! LOVED the Killer Shrimp & the Baked Mac & Cheese! Probably the BEST mac & cheese EVER! Would recommend Carson Kitchen highly!

ST3dZWyDhO3WzuL7yDPW4w.text: Be careful you don't miss it when you walk through old town Vegas but it's worth the trip  the food is simply amazing the menu fresh unique different on a daily basis.  It's worth the trip don't be put off from the exterior and make sure you get here early.  Get a seat to watch the chefs and be prepared to be amazed from the eyes to the taste buds

nOQf1Zdqg8jGNgnIJ2xEmA.text: If you're looking to try something flavorful and different go here. I'm all about service and every worker there was so attentive and helpful and so friendly so 5 stars forsure there. The food omg the food was so freaking amazing!!!!!! I can't wait to go back, I plan on trying everything on the menu. Bacon jam make sure you get that I repeat make sure you get it.

VwrOou8lf2ZOmdMzI0Vqsw.text: Hard to find you'll walk right past it. But great food. The fried chicken skins uhmmm.

QLIVHvc03eqNZlC0dYO58w.text: Food is good, service is ok.  Came here for lunch on a weekday for a small work meeting. It was super busy already and so we got to sit at the counter looking into the open kitchen. The host was very energetic and greeted us right away and seated us and gave us he menu to look at.  We ordered a few appetizers to share and they all tasted pretty good. They did run out of one item and the nice host did apologize for it. No issues. After we finished the appetizer, we ordered entrees and everything was nicely presented and pretty yummy. Our waitress seemed very absent and I had to ask a couple of times to refill our drinks. It was hard to flag her down, and the host was the one who brought us our food.   Presentation is nice, portion sizes are very small, and prices are high.  Bathrooms were clean, parking was pretty easy on the street: all metered.

hpKzO0d1v0hAAwxXBkimJw.text: This was a nice little spot. The food and service were great. Roman was an amazing waiter. The only thing I didn't like was the seating. The high tables and chairs are annoying. I hate sitting super close to other people while I am trying to talk to my date and eat. It's really awkward in my opinion.

E52-i0npMZCg6Zih-f5fmQ.text: What a great funky place! We had a friend recommended it and hoy were they right! Fun sharing plates kind of place- worth the drive!

8F8gr7FR1-E7S7Ltgj7z-A.text: Carson kitchen hits my tastebuds just right every time! With shareable tapas style dishes this place is killer for a social dining experience. The creativity and uniqueness are a few things that I feel separate Carson kitchen for a few other spots in town with similar concepts. From fried chicken skins to gyro tacos everything is full of flavor and plated to perfection! Carson kitchen does offer reservations and does tend to be busy most of the time. Highly recommend this spot for lunch or dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken skins

WWBgl180UU2hLsjMBDLTzg.text: The downtown revitalization of Las Vegas has dramatically changed the dining options available today compared to 15 years ago when I was visiting more regularly. Certainly if you are looking for a bottomless plate of Ribeye for $8.99, you can shuffle along for about a block and get just that. However if you want a modern, hipster foodie spot, with taste that backs up the attitude, then this is a must. They don't seem to care about making you wait, and even seem to like throwing out attitude if you expect something faster. The kitchen is small but quick. Due to limited tables reservations are not taken. If you have a large party or are impatient, get there early. The staff is "cool" with uniformly dissimilar artsy hair styles and no name tags, but look for Nirvana and Bowie tees to designate staff.   Now the most important part: The food is delicious! I especially enjoyed the gyro tacos, bacon jam, turkey burger, all way above expectations. If you like tapas style eating this place leans that way, with the waiters even encouraging sharing multiple plate. I was sceptical at first, and showed up borderline hangry, but left completely satisfied. The price was extremely reasonable, costing about the same as breakfast on the strip for two, as dinner did for 4 of us.  Walk it off with a stroll around container park or play frogger along the Fremont. Parking is super easy, with lots open around the block

1UelVeodCEuyzsYAr68cNA.text: The only reason I give it 4 stars is because my husband wasn't as impressed as I was. We both LOVED the hand crafted cocktails, but we were on opposite side with the food. We ordered the fig and Brie, which I loved, he did not. I ordered the shrimp and grits which were amazing, I'm craving it now, and he had one of their pizzas, he wasn't impressed. Overall, the service was great, and we are planning to go back during another season when the menu changes. Hoping a different menu will change his mind about this place, because I will absolutely return!

D7QxW16IJjpgAJxvZ5EeQw.text: Jesus Christ this place is delicious! I thought it went beyond just "good, well executed dishes". They really did a great job using a lot of cool flavors.  Mac n' Cheese: $12 - I loved it! They had little bits of garlic sprinkled on top which I've never seen before, but really livened it up. The pasta was cooked perfectly; a little al dente. The cheese was creamy and delicious. And they also had bits of shredded cheese sprinkled in that you'd get a taste of to provide some more variety.  Butter Burger: $14 - My girlfriend got this; really, we shared both. She ordered it medium well and it came out moderately pink on the inside. Reading some other reviews, it seems that this is a consistent pattern. She liked it though, and so did I, so it's all good. The burger was juicy and delicious. It was served hot off the grill. I loved the cheese too; not overwhelming; just the right amount to balance the meat. My girlfriend loved the spicy tater tots. To me, they were the one thing there that was average.  Bourbon Fudge Brownie: $8 - This desert was awesome. It had "brown butter bacon ice cream" and a really really rich brownie. I really liked the ice cream a lot. The brownie was good, but it was a bit too rich for me. I also like this sort of dish when the brownie is warm. I would have preferred if they have more ice cream and less brownie; I think what makes the dish is when you eat them together, and in this case the proportions were off. But that's nitpicking. It was great. Also, they weren't shy in about adding bacon! It was good, but it was also a little overwhelming to me. My girlfriend thought the bacon was just too much and picked it out.  Other than the dishes, I thought the atmosphere was pretty cool. It was extremely extremely hipster. We sat at the bar and they have an open kitchen. I really liked that. I enjoy watching them cook.  The service was good.  Overall, I was really happy and am excited to go back to try new dishes. I thought the flavors were awesome. Most dishes were in the $10-20 price range - I would pay $30+ to eat here.

eH60aACCTNBG1Pn5z3gVZA.text: This was soooo good! We got the bacon jam, chicken skins, mushroom flatbread, and oxtail risotto. The bacon jam is a must, especially if you're into brie. One of the best things I've eaten.  I've never had oxtail before. It looked kind of goopy and weird. Surprisingly amazing though. My only complaint would be the music.  It was really outdated and out of place in a trendy spot.

9Vx1xg1-ztHRuKvZl8QSug.text: My favorite spot in Vegas for not only dinner but for cocktails and dessert. Hands-down the best dessert I've ever had in Vegas definitely one of the best spots for locals. The bourbon fudge brownie and the bread pudding were enough to make me go back a on another occasion just for dessert and drinks. Definitely a decadent a way to treat your self after a long day or long week of work and great to share with friends and family. The cocktails have been top notch from the times I've gone. Not only is the Simon Says Sangria refreshing but definitely one of my favorites on the menu that would complement any meal with citrus notes that mixes perfectly with the white wine. The communication breakdown cocktail was a lavender infused cocktail with italian liqueur and tequila that had a smoky yet fragrant quality. They have a wide assortment of cocktails that are handcrafted and unique only exclusive carsons kitchen. I I can't wait to go back and try another cocktail. Hands-down the best place in Vegas for a late night meal with friends or family or even if you're looking to just have a nice dinner by yourself with good drinks good food. Overall my favorite spot in Vegas.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i5kGZo_X5rDiMD8OcLCu1Q.text: Love this little place ever since the first time. Me and my girlfriend love sitting at the high top counter to watch the cooks do their magic in the kitchen. Staff are kind to us always and the food is just as amazing, except for one dish "lamb spiedies." My only constructive criticism for the restaurant is that dish; it's a little too sour and the bread gets soggy once it's get too the table and the lamb is a little tough, but the everything else makes up for it. I still plan on going back because it's that good and also because the Donut Bread Pudding is the best thing ever invented in the world!

oxNcXhCHXdtdsarZlF9s1A.text: Probably my favorite spot in town. Funky downtown vibe, great food, great service. Public parking is across the street. It can get kinda busy in there so call ahead if you have a large party. It's tapas/family sharing style and the portions aren't very big so be prepared to order quite a bit. Can be pricey but well worth he money. Don't l ave without trying the chicken skins.

X-WqMAkXh9badjZRGrveGA.text: Started my weekend off right with my favorite couple, Christina W. and Arvin C. and my fiance' and I having a double date night!   We've been curious of the buzz and were heading to DCR so we looked through bookmarks for something nearby. It was busy, but we were able to have a table upstairs on the cute rooftop patio.  We just ate family style and shared all our items.   Wellington Empanada- the empanada serving comes with 2. This was crispy but the flavors were just A-OK for me.   Roasted young beets - I'm a sucker for the trifecta of beets, with a soft cheese (goat cheese in this case) and pistachios. The orange slices and microgreens were nice in this. Solid salad.   Rainbow Cauliflower - it's really simple, but it's done right. Nice roast and seasoning on it.   Chicken Skin - these were delish and naughty! The smoked honey reminds me of being a kid and dipping KFC chicken in those janky honey sauce packets that come with the biscuit.   The following is more meal portioned than appetizers as they are sandwiches plus spicy tater tots.   Fried Green Tomato Sandwich - this was lovely as it had a lump crab ravigote salad and greens that went perfectly with the crispy fried tomato and I enjoyed the bread quite a bit.   Short Rib Sliders- came with 3. The root beer glaze was sweet, but it worked for me. It reminds me of this braised pork dish that's cooked in root beer and spices.   The tater tots were standard, but good. Real crispy and dusted with seasoning spices.   Then for dessert we tried the glazed donut bread pudding. They use day old donuts from O Face next door. It was soft and moist and the sauce reminds me of a bananas foster. Real good.   Service was pretty good. They were doing training so we had the attention of a server and their trainee. Drinks were refilled in a timely manner and they were friendly and paced out our food pretty well too.  Overall, I enjoyed the food and didn't think it was outrageously priced, but can be the type of place to add up quick when you go small plates. Out of all the items we got, the Fried Green Tomato sandwich was the best deal, but it also was my favorite dish.With that said, I think $75 for four is not a bad price for what we received in flavor and quality. I will be back soon as I need more fried green tomato sandwiches in my life.

auCw_AXFj3S6wj3r68JhtQ.text: Wow!  Super place and great prices.  It made the trip downtown worth it.  So many interesting choices.  Loved the deviled eggs.  The bacon jam is to die for.  Will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas.

YNJIqlcvFftGj2FdPxHZXg.text: Another SCORE thanks to YELP ! Awesome food and Awesome service. OMG do yourself a favor and get the Bacon Jam. So delicious.

x1KYYJ3zmf0Bwho40S26AA.text: Great atmosphere located in the heart of downtown Las Vegas. We tried so many items on the menu. The sliders were a little too salty, as were the tater tots, but the tempura green beans were amazing and the shrimp were damn delicious. You gotta do the shrimp!!  Geronimo was a great bartender and we enjoyed our time here. I hope to see the rooftop deck next time we visit.

hXugeuNEPhVPzSGYG0g6Pg.text: Great space. Good music. Staff was all wearing rock n roll band t shirts. Upstairs patio and bar is excellent.  But the food is the reason.  Excellent.  The meatballs were out of this world. And the tots!!!!   OMG.  The seasoning makes those the best tots I've ever had.  Don't miss out on the bacon jam either.  Excellent all around.

iVjPVUOqC6l9rihV5frbvw.text: Carson's kitchen was a great surprise,  I heard great things about it so we had to come and try it out!!!  Everything we tasted was great,  the Wellington empenadas,  the deviled eggs,  the fried chicken skins,  the short rib sliders,  oxtail risotto,  and the donut bread pudding,  we were bad bad girls today but it was mother in laws birthday so we had a reason !! The vibe here was great,  the decor industrial,  and the service was great.  I'm excited to try this place at night!! Definitely coming back....
