__9gFD5i3PlsyQ2JOFUGhA.text: What a find! Great atmostphere, killer drinks, awesome bartender, and the food!  We started with the meat balls w/ foie gras sauce. The seared the meat ball for a firm crust, and that sauce, utterly insane! And bacon jam?! Tried it based on our rockin bartender's suggestion, no dissappointment there! Scallops were killer! And the price? Way more reasonable than many other places with lesser caliber food offerings!   I also love the fact that it's walking distance from Old Vegas.

MdmcBxLWfb6K8b6dW8hEYQ.text: On a road trip, Vegas was a good stopping off point and we didn't want to deal with the Strip, so we stopped here. Lots of great stuff on the menu, we opted for the butter burger and the turkey burger with jerk seasoning. Turkey burger was delicious, great flavor, loved the cole slaw on top. I was afraid it might be a bit dry, but it was just right. Bun was a little  sweet, which was odd, but still decent. My husband wanted his burger done medium and it was pretty rare-lots of blood on the plate. I guess he could've sent it back but we didn't want to deal, and it was still good. He thought the tater tots were not as good as fries would've been.  Great place to stop at, I love the restaurants in downtown Vegas, definitely more real, with real food.

hGZZnPtxdFO-jaAXkPIYeQ.text: The food is "sexy"! We went there for our Pre-Prom dinner. For a Saturday night, we were seated promptly (just 2). We followed the posted recommendations and ordered the Bacon Jam and the Fried Chicken Skin! We usually order healthful food but we decided to splurge on some good old fashion fatty food! I was not disappointed. Dakota our server rocked our world by giving us some awesome pointers, for example; have a bite of the bacon jam with the Mac & cheese  and/or dip the fried chicken skin in the bacon jam!  We went back there for our Post-Prom dessert (we had to!!) The Bonaffee and the Donut bread pudding were seriously delicious. Trust them, if you are indecisive and you don't know what to order!  They got an AWESOME team working there! LOVED the food AND the Carson Kitchen Crew! Perfect combo!  I will go back for sure! Gotta try their sliders and taco...

WBhVRhT_dIvivW8xUbj3Dw.text: This place is small but probably the perfect size.  I got there a little early for dinner so there was no wait, but by the time we left it was packed. The drink menu is well rounded and enjoyed a lot of the beers and cocktails.  All of the food was awesome. We ordered almost every single one of the dishes under the social plates and the were all delicious in there own way. The only one that I didn't think was out of this world but still delicious was the shrimp which was just fried sauced rock shrimp. Our server was nice and on point. All in all well worth the small price point for the quality of food recieved

UthZH_FJgZj8Iq85znF4lA.text: I had heard such great things about this yummy place and now I can agree. Wow! The bread pudding is absolute heaven. For appetizers we got the gyro tacos, green beans, the deviled eggs and the veal meatballs. Every single item was delicious. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green beans. Amazing
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread putting. Total heaven.

tIcQaS9r_Bmbv7Nzt_Y6Ug.text: This was a find for us thanks to Yelp. Great neighborhood find....food was delish! Catfish sandwich and Flatbread....tempura green beans and gyro tacos....really great!

aIg43sXHZSB1zJXvYfizyQ.text: Delightful little spot! Staff was very friendly and welcoming. I loved the design of the restaurant. It's very open, and very clean.   The food was great. Roasted beets very good. Broccoli crunch was ok, could have used a little more dressing. Mac and cheese, yummy. Devil's eggs, a must try! Fried green tomato sandwich good. We had the twinkies dessert....it was light and flavorful.   I would definitely recommend checking this place out. It's tricky to find, but worth it when you do.

G5yrrhF0nOKggOLTW_UCJQ.text: We had the tempura green beans, bacon jam, sea bass, chicken, burger, beet salad, flat bread and pear tartlet and donut bread pudding-group of 6 and everything was delicious!  Loved our server, Manny and the General Manager stopped by as well.  They gave great detail about food so you could make an informed decision.  Sampled 6 different entrees since we all ordered different entrees and ALL were terrific!  If you want to go I would advise reservations because it is small so it's busy.  Love this restaurant and will definitely go back every chance I get.

MHHTxPOO37MWq6rEoJGUKA.text: Incredible food in a fantastic location. Its located in an old motel and has an indoor area, an outdoor patio, and an upstairs patio. Its a Kerry Simon restaurant so you know the food is going to be good, and not outrageously priced. During the summer its really nice to sit upstairs and enjoy the music and the shade, but the vibe inside is just as good.

jeYFaeEOxvbWKDTZMhKIFw.text: I've been dying to come here since the minute it opened. I literally want everything on the menu. I've never been to a place where there isn't a thing I wouldn't eat. My waitress was awesome and super friendly, and there was the most handsome boy I have ever seen was expediting, so until my friend showed up, I stared directly at his butt. So far, this is a terribly written review. Anyhoo- My friend was late, so I ordered the beet salad. So delicious and perfectly balanced with the addition of goat cheese and orange. All I could think of was the hot guys butt, NO I MEAN TEMPURA GREEN BEANS WITH PEPPER JELLY CREAM CHEESE DIPPING SAUCE.  I would dip anything into that, it's so good. Then I had the butter burger. I've been wanting to try one since I saw it on a tv food show about Wisconsin and I thought, I may be fat but I'm not flying to Wisconsin for a cheeseburger, even if coated with butter. (I realize that I COULD have made one at home, but space travel has also been invented and I'm not doing that either.). How was it you ask? Do you have to ask?  It was DELICIOUS. DUH. It comes with tater tots. I almost bypassed them because I did fill up on vegetables, but they were the best tater tots I've ever had. Soooooo crispy on the outside and fluffy potato-y goodness on the inside.  I WILL BE BACK.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beets, oranges and goat cheese, nom nom nom.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A butter burger- omfg. AND the best tater tots I&#39;ve ever had.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I would dip ANYTHING in that pepper jelly cream cheese.

OOXaXqE2sd2QdAy1RwVCoA.text: I was in Vegas for the first time. I couldn't WAIT to get off the strip. I found this little gem by chance and decided to give it a try. We couldn't make a reservation but called on the way over to put our names on. We ordered drinks at the bar, and suddenly our table was ready. I loved my "Get Shorty" -- sort of a spicy margarita. We sat outside on the patio upstairs. It was warm, welcoming and wonderful.   All of our food was delicious. Most memorable were the bacon jam (what?) and the veal meatballs. I'm Swedish, and I know a thing or two about meatballs. It was something in between Swedish meatballs and another Swedish dish called Wallenbergare. Pure delight.   I loved the cool atmosphere, and such a diverse crowd.  Thanks so much. If I get to Vegas again I will be back!

YhS0cyEdCqvO1yD5wCsiHA.text: Carson kitchen is one of our favorite spots in DTLV. I have been a fan of Kerry Simon since he opened Simons at Hard Rock Hotel.  He truly puts a new spin on classic comfort food. I mean, Fried Chicken Skin?!?! So delicious.  My husband is a big fan of the burger. I had the veggie flatbread. And both were fresh and tasty.  Service is amazing. We sat at the bar to eat. I don't know his name but he is a True mixologist. Every drink is hand crafted to perfection.  The only bad thing is that is is small. And when it gets busy it feels kind of cramped. We didn't have to wait but I imagine the wait time on a busy night could be long.  Love DTLV and love Carson Kitchen!

DkvGccYQX0UwSifqAR-zoA.text: Was our first time eating there.  I think our server's name was Audrey(? - blonde with glasses).  She was super cool to my wife and I.  Food was great.  The chicken skins were amazing and the butter burger was awesome.  Just a cool vibe inside the place.  No doubt we will stop by next time we are there.

o0liOmekDbBDbkP8lRw_yw.text: The Bacon Jam is a must have! All of their food is good but the "go to" dishes are definitely the gyro tacos, mac & cheese and the peach/ tomato salad. That bacon jam tho.....

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Get Shorty&#34; drink. Tequila, grapefruit, and cayenne syrup. Yum!

m6I1UWABnMF5NiEiZiPSsA.text: This place has amazing food. Veal meat balls were out of this world. Gyro tacos s must. Mac & cheese we all loved.  Get the idea. Food is so flavorful

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos and the Mac and cheese

5CihVKFuHPyXaluTiVdvmA.text: I went here for lunch today based on the yelp reviews. It's a small sophisticated atmosphere with a casual attire ordeal. Typical art district spot. Which I like over the turn and burn feel of Fremont.  The food was awesome. Great flavors and perfect portions. I ordered the killer shrimp and gyro tacos. Plus a drink called Ms that I could of done without.  The  killer shrimp had a light almost like tempura batter with lime infused jalapenos. Mmm. The sauce on.them wasn't over powering and tasteful. The gyro tacos were lamb and goat cheese with an awesome sauce. Need I say more.  I should of gone for the good Rodney Strong chardonnay they had. The drink was ok but far to plain to be amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch.. Gyro tacos, killer shrimp, and drink call the Ms
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yawHP0g42hTfaCMFChqFaA.text: Carson Kitchen.. You Complete Me I .. love.. you.  Shut Up, Just Shut Up... You Had Me At Hello...   I'm gonna be a regular at this place. Beautifully rich flavors, nice presentation, delicious prices! I've already had 1/6 of the menu, and I've been here exactly once! Get here... Now. You'll be thankful you did! Happy Eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington Empanada
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam and Crostini
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato Stack

VMkYRX3AdKP_PYQ5WqIAZA.text: This is seriously one of my favorite restaurants anywhere.  We were in Vegas for four nights, staying on the strip at Aria...yet we spent two of our four nights at Carson Kitchen.  I love everything about this restaurant.  The food is delicious, the atmosphere is great and the servers couldn't be any nicer.  Nicole was our server both nights and she has to be one of the nicest people I have ever met.    I have been to Vegas four times in the past year and I always like trying new places, but I can tell you from now on I will be having at least one dinner at Carson Kitchen every trip.

BizH_uZC69D-39xJjkwtXQ.text: Please note that we didn't eat here. The review is for the customer service I experienced when planning my visit.   I use a mobility scooter and always want to make before I visit a restaurant or store that this won't be a problem. So I sent them a message via their website asking about accessibility. 2 weeks, no response. So I send another message. Still no response. No point in calling long distance to a place that clearly doesn't want my business.

bS00dERolm6rSNGfVqcikw.text: I rearly to never write reviews. I had to write one for this place though.   I was treated to a Chef's tasting (My buddy knows the owner) and I have to tell you something. Everything I had was amazing. From the NY steak to the Mac N Cheese, and even the Rainbow Cauliflower was amazing. The service was great too. The ambiance was nice and welcoming. I plan on coming here every time I come to Vegas.  I couldn't help to be amazed by how tasty everything was. Visiting this place was one of the best experiences I've had in Vegas. I totally got my money's worth here.

N96J23GwryFReeRjZRFbhw.text: Definitely a great spot outside of the strip.  The inside is a bit hipsterish, but service was very very great!  The set up is nice as you can see people cook.  And food wise, it was great.  Bacon jam is the jam, and I don't even like bacon that much.  Also, the gyro street tacos were excellent.  Rainbow cauliflower was also great.

NEKKNe38QZqMLTMQzppvKQ.text: Bottom line: Excellent gastropub fare and great service!  We walked in for lunch and had:  1) Bacon jam (Such a simple but decadent dish. I mean, how can anything with spreadable bacon and melted brie be bad?) 2) Killer shrimp (hot, crispy juicy deep fried shrimp...again, how could you go wrong?) 3) Oxtail and black rice risotto (unbelievably rich and amazing. The raw garlic in the gremolata they top it with takes it over the top in the best possible way) 4) Sunday fried chicken sandwich (pretty great as far as fried chicken breast sandwiches go... The spicy tots they serve on the side are the real star) 5) Rainbow cauliflower. (GET IT. Especially since the main entrees don't come with sides) 6) Chicken thighs (Well-cooked, but literally it's just two chicken thighs on a plate with some chimichurri. Also WAY oversalted.) 7) Short rib stroganoff (This was the only misfire of our meal. Whatever spirit they used in the sauce completely overpowered the dish and gave it a horrible aftertaste. The meat was perfectly done though)  Service was awesome! Tiny space, so make reservations. We came in during the lunch hour and got a table, but it was packed by the time we left.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib stroganoff. Weird flavor. Skip it.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail &amp; black rice risotto. A bit salty, but BOMB

wqjt_rwY2D1ZPVYmC2IFMQ.text: If you're anywhere in the Vegas area do yourself a favor and hit up downtown. Carson kitchen is a diamond in the rough down there. Get the bacon jam, chicken skins, mac, green beans, and risotto. And when you're too full from all of that get the glazed donut bread pudding. Can't go wrong with any of the cocktails either. It's literally the totally package. The GM is the shit and the servers are bomb. You won't regret your experience. "Kerry on"!

zKfsTonxby1A-rfaAYx2MQ.text: I'm going to say this. I will come back in a couple of weeks to see how things are going. But first, let me praise the staff to the high heavens. Unlike a lot of new places downtown they don't assume you're going to just drink the koolaid. They were ernest in their desire to make sure we were comfortable and happy with our food. They seemed to have actually tasted most of the food and had good recommendations for us. Much like La Comida, I'd eat here again regardless of what I thought of the food because the staff made the experience worthwhile. Fyi, I don't care for the food at La Comida.   The food. Well. We split oxtail risotto which, honestly, was so rich as to be offputting. I ate maybe four spoonfuls as did my lunch date. There was plenty left to take home but we passed. We also had the bacon jam with brie. It was actually delish, but again, a little went a long way. A very long way. Again, we passed on taking the extra home. The empanadas were filled with nice chunky meat that was tender though it could've been a tad juicier. The mushroom flatbread was a great appetizer and the pizza cook was lots of fun without being overly familiar.  Here's my issue and it's something you can actually see in the accompanying picture. The risotto and jam seemed to be swimming in something. It wasn't grease. Maybe some oil like truffle? The lake of whatever it was did not inspire one to want to deal with that in a to go box or when it inevitably congealed. Again, offputting is the only word I can find to describe my feelings about it. It really wasn't greasy or slimy, but it looks that way. Combined with the fact that everything (except the empanadas) was just way too rich means I won't be pushing this as a place to go. Not yet.   I'm sure that Carson Kitchen will find it's feet very soon, and hope so. I like the vibe even if the decor looks like someone went to EAT and decided that's the new downtown Vegas hip eatery look. Seriously, it almost looks like a blatant rip off. They seemed to be working on an outside patio which in and of itself will get me back this summer. And, not to be petty, I give it points for being filled with adults, not a bunch of bearded wannabes.   The pricing seemed a tad ambitious. For small plates you can go from a quick bite to a $50 lunch in no time. Not outrageous but probably not in my, "let's run by for a nosh", price range.  I look forward to sampling more of Carson Kitchen soon but I'm hoping they bring the ooze down a notch. Go check it out for yourself, it's worth a try. Good luck Carson Kitchen, welcome downtown!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flatbread #carsonkitchen
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam #carsonkitchen
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail risotto #carsonkitchen

kO9LKCFe48HSDXqHwrcNVg.text: My boyfriend and I had a great time here at Carson Kitchen. We had a few beers, Devil's eggs and crispy chicken skins while we waited for our check-in time. Our server was nice and informative. The Devil's eggs were just ok. Now the crispy chicken skins were freaken delicious! It was crispy on the outside without being too burnt. And chewy in the inside without being under done. Such a great appetizer to go with your beer. Definitely will be back to try other selections on their menu. Only down side is that we got sat a communal table. You can hear everyone's conversation in front of you and next to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Devil&#39;s&#34; Eggs topped with crispy pancetta and caviar
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute restroom decor
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Skin and Smoked Honey

_0cnhqjoxvv6lzMMrT8gkQ.text: So I tried this restaurant for the first time last Thursday . So let's start with the basics. I like the decor, and our server was Bianca. She was real nice and have great service in spite of being real busy or short staffed. The hostess though had the fuck off face. Maybe she was having a bad day.  Now about the food. I tired the bacon jam. That shit is bomb! Only one problem. They barely give any bread with it. My table had to ask like 2 extra servings of bread.   The deviled eggs was good. But I think they can add a dollar more and give one more egg.   The pierogi tasted very bland. Thank goodness for the Cheese wiz with it.  My main issue was their risotto. The rice was so undercooked. The rice was hard. I wanted to send it back but I'm seen the movie "waiting" and I didn't want to be bothersome since my friends and I were having a good time. But really they got to work on the timing of cooking the risotto.   So my suggestion is don't order it unless you wanting the risotto coming out the way it came in. Hard. That's what she said! Lol

W_5PxbFuG32EFI85LbP_wQ.text: I liked it.  First off, I love the gentrification of downtown, especially what's going on in the old Carson hotel. Super cool. The inside of the Carson kitchen matches that hip, semi-industrial vibe. Surprisingly, the clientele seems to trend away from hip and so-industrial! No big deal, but on a Friday evening, the average age was definitely over 40! I'm not one of these bacon-crazed people, but I saw that the bacon jam was the hot item, so we had to order it. Your reviews did not steer us wrong! It was awesome! Overall, we enjoyed all the food and the server delivered with excellent cocktail recommendations.  Service was friendly if a little slow.  Overall, Carson kitchen may be my top choice for downtown dinner right now!

ReEKD0HEA3lVE-K70pG-8A.text: The atmosphere of this place was more of a small dark bar or pub environment and we felt it was more suited for nightlife, and not so much for a family dinner with kids.  The menu had a limited selection, and 4 of the already limited items were unavailable the night we ate there.  My daughter enjoyed the butter burger.  We had no qualm with the quality of food or service, however we felt it was too expensive for the amount served, and we could not find free parking nearby.

QmZXLP4TYAIGu4n-UCo_SA.text: Decent restaurant with okay food but not high brow enough to be called a good tapas place.   short rib sliders: WAY TOO SWEET. tasted like pure sugar and the meat was dry.  Would not get again.   Mac and Cheese: decent, enjoyed the crust, nothing exceptional.   rainbow cauliflower: very garlicky (in a good way) and spicy.  I'd say prob a 8/10. Good but again, not exceptional.   I was disappointed that the cocktails were not strong at all. If i'm paying 13$ for a cocktail I expect it to pack a punch, unfortunately they just tasted like juice.   I was also really annoyed that the waiter kept pushing me to either 1. buy a drink or 2. buy a more expensive drink. Nothing bugs me more than pushy service.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow cauliflower, spicy and garlicky, 8/10

p6Y6sfwMwwXuHvuf4YKEoA.text: Yelp and numerous people led me astray on this one.   I have the upmost respect for Kerry Simon. He has created some beautiful and well-respected restaurants. I was expecting some really fantastic food, and this was, unfortunately, not it.   We sat at the bar, and the bartender was friendly, but service was incredibly slow. Our food took an extraordinary amount of time. We ordered the oxtail risotto and the burger. The burger was very poorly cooked and had to be sent back. Apparently, their method for cooking does not align with how we feel meat should be cooked. The oxtail risotto had a strange flavor to it that I would not like to really eat again.   Overall, I wanted to like it, but I just couldn't.

TpKbg7UJyGctzCyrVqVmbA.text: Was pleasantly surprised to find this gem of a restaurant during a business trip. The food was amazing & the service was excellent.   The kitchen staff & waitstaff have a tightly run ship that runs smoothly. My partner & I were lucky to be seated by the kitchen & witness the beautifully efficient system they have in place, getting food to patrons in a timely manner. We were very impressed. Despite the place being packed & busy, the kitchen manager stayed on top of orders and made sure that everyone had food at their table within a reasonable amount of time and even managed to make friendly conversation with us in between orders. Our waitress was super friendly & helpful as well. She informed us ahead of time that food comes out as it's ready (not all at once) & dishes are intended to be shared. My kind of dining! Our food came to us at a steady pace.   We also asked our waitress for recommendations & she did not steer us wrong!   She suggested the Baked Mac & Cheese. Sounds like a pretty basic dish & I was reluctant but I'm sure glad we got it! It was soooo good. Not sure what kind of magical cheese they use, but it was delicious & it had truffle oil, which makes any simple food decadent. Great spin on a classic. And the baked bread crumbs sprinkled on top added a nice balance of crunch to the creamy gooey goodness.   The Roasted Young Beets with pistachios, orange, & goat cheese was an amazing combination of flavors. Very light & refreshing.   The Steelhead Trout with almond relish & creamed kale was also fantastic. The skin was crisp to perfection & the flesh was moist. No clue how they do that. I can't recall eating a more perfectly cooked fish.   Great to have had a positive experience during our stay in Vegas.

w3FgfAlgEWLkT6_ImSqqHw.text: My son took us to old downtown Vegas...mwah! But this place is so cool and fun! Service 11 out of 10! Tried their fried chicken skin with honey...may gosh! First time and many to come...the best, their NY wasn't that great, a bit dry and tough....however their pork chops are the bessssssst!   Roof top is where you should go....I'll be back for sure!!

jALL43cor2W636tSzF8c_A.text: I've had the pleasure of having both lunch and dinner at Carson Kitchen. It's a rustic new addition to the downtown scene.   Both times I dined we started with the Crispy Chicken Skins and the Bacon Jam. I am not into the chicken skins, but almost everyone I went with both times loved them. They are salty and the honey is smokey and sweet. I get the allure, but I am not into the chicken flavor. The bacon jam however, is definitely my jam! You MUST start with this and then slather it onto whatever you order. It's packed full of flavor and unbelievably delicious. It comes out piping hot, so try not to dive right in.  On to the entrees! The Secret Sunday Chicken sandwich is an upscale take on a Chick-Fil-A favorite. The chicken is moist and fried to perfection with a delicate and light batter. The spicy pickle aioli is perfection, I would be in trouble if they bottled this and the jam. Speaking of the jam, don't be afraid to add it to your sandwich! I wasn't a fan of the spice used on the tater tots, so those fell short for me. I've also had the short rib stroganoff and it was just OK. The flavors weren't as rich and creamy as I had hoped and something tasted a little off. I did however spice it up with some bacon jam, I may have a problem. I would skip the stroganoff and try a burger next time.  Overall, there were some hits and misses, but the hits overshadowed the misses for me. I find the service to be a bit spotty, but the food is worth a try if you're downtown.

fOHUsgCPvXQB4bEZptKvZA.text: Probably the best flatbread I have ever had. Great staff. Everyone friendly. Decor is typical hipster industrial which is the norm downtown. Good beer list as well. Look forward to coming back!

1o8DaXNr4LUTVOqdZD9s2A.text: Honestly, I memorized the menu before I got here because I yelped it.   Our waitress Bianca was super duper nice! We ordered SO much food but it was so worth it! :)  The gyro tacos were so good! It was so light and refreshing! I could eat 3 or 4 of them! We also ordered the tempura green beans and black rice oxtail risotto. If you're a fan of black rice, this is amazing!!!   Last but not least, the donut bread pudding. MUST. GET!! Save room for that ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black rice oxtail risotto, tempura green beans, gyro tacos and don&#39;t bread pudding.

OPfDqUrSig11qnpIQvhnQQ.text: How could anyone give this place less than 5 stars? I have had numerous experiences here and from food to service to ambiance and price, this place has stole a little piece of my foodie heart. Not that it surprises me that a Kerry Simon place would win me over. I mean, the staff has to wear rock & roll t-shirts. Would you expect anything less? My first experience was on a busy Friday night, and we sat upstairs at the patio bar. My second trip, I came right at the start of business, and was lucky enough to get a seat at the open kitchen aka Chef's table. If you know me, you know that is my favorite place to sit. I love watching the kitchen staff interact. I love watching the food be made right before your eyes. Also, in this particular kitchen, I really love the passion of the staff. It was clear they wanted everything perfect before leaving that kitchen.  So far I have indulged in: devil's eggs, corn succotash, baked mac and cheese, gyro tacos, watermelon salad, a butter burger, a sloppy joe, and some bread pudding. I would order every one of those items again. And let me point out, I never ordered the tacos to begin with. My daughter and I were dinging together one day, and they were sent out compliments of the Chef. Total score. We devoured them, and still ordered our entrees and appetizer. I plan on trying the chicken skins, bacon jam, and killer shrimp on my next visit.  I don't know why it took me so long to get to this place, but I am glad I finally checked it out. Perfect addition to downtown Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday chicken
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Green beans with red pepper jelly
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skins

o8TBLRCkDb_2SzYMRoyyaw.text: Although I am not thrilled with the interior (yes there is such thing as too modern), I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of food and service. Their chairs have no backs and are all "bar stool" style. My husband has back issues and for him when a place does not have booths or seating with some type of back support it can be a deal breaker. We were seated promptly and presented with a modest but quality cocktail list. We opted for beverages of the non adult kind, but they did seem to have some creative cocktails on the menu.  I chose their scallops with rainbow cauliflowers which were phenomenal. The scallop was cooked to perfection in their mango habanero sauce. I don't know what they do to the cauliflower, but it was delicious, crunchy and slightly charred for the added flavor. My husband had their Cuban sandwich with the fingerling potatoes. That was one of the better spins on a Cuban sandwich I have experienced in a very long time. The bread was fresh and crispy and the inside was an explosion of flavor. The fingerling potatoes were garnished with parmesan cheese and truly were nothing to write home about.  The server was accommodating and friendly. Our check arrived in a book which serves as some type of a guest book where you can write in feedback or random comments. The prices are not cheap, but the food is worth it. The scallops were $17 and the cauliflower side order $8. Keep in mind it comes with three small scallops that are bursting with flavor. Make sure to fill the meters for parking because you will get towed. Also, if you hate hipsters stay away.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow cauliflower

PVhO7sMUP0UwsjPnTzbMNg.text: I ate here for lunch this afternoon. And then again for Dinner. Enough said.  Amazing staff. Amazing food. Amazing service. Top 5 most memorable places I've been to. Keep it up guys.

ZOtcLeRltzo4lJ1_Y5gt0Q.text: Holy s^*t. This place is absolutely wonderful. Went for lunch, and had to go back for dinner. We arrived at almost closing time for dinner and we weren't rushed, and the staff at both of our visits were fun, helpful, and laid back. We've spent tons of times in Las Vegas in the last few years, and I think this place is our favorite by far.

VAD-2aBYAe0TkYEOzfSTvg.text: Surprise restaurant on the outskirts of the downtown area of Las Vegas. My husband and I came for brunch and sat at the bar overlooking the kitchen. Most of the food on the menu is served tapas style, but we were dead set on a couple of their sandwiches which is the only section of the menu that isn't a shared plate.   We did share an order of tempura green beans, my husband had the jerk turkey burger and I had the short rib grilled cheese. Everything was amazing. We couldn't finish our food because the portions were substantial and filling, but we were happy to take the leftovers for later.   The vibe of the restaurant is cool and funky, our server was knowledgeable and friendly, and the overall experience was great!

k5du0GR3FLCJUg1TSoU6vg.text: It was a long wait, but the food is well worth it! We had the wild mushroom pizza, the gyros tacos, and mac & cheese. If youre near fremont street at all good here!

7WcRvBbqREYUeO0R7PPSPQ.text: First timer, visiting Las Vegas and Carson Kitchen. Found this place on Yelp and I couldn't be happier. I love the hipster atmosphere and the food is awesome! I recommend the sea bass, baked macaroni and cheese and to die for doughnut bread pudding...

0Bc6SuTZ1wX0LnHjFWGPCQ.text: This place is great! The staff is friendly and the food is great!!! Come and try the muscles, they are amazing!

qwjEUNIMuIDbjyjDCB_E6Q.text: I've lived in Vegas for almost a year now and visitors always ask me what my favorite place is. I think I've found it. The food at Carson Kitchen is amazing. The menu is simplistic, but creatively hatched. There wasn't anything that we ordered that I didn't like. Many plates are perfect for sharing, which is encouraged.  Of the social plates, there is a trio of must-tries. If you like chicharrones, the crispy chicken skins are highly recommended. Dipped in smoked honey, these tasty snacks were wildly addictive. The gyro tacos (3) were well-balanced and liked by all. My personal favorite was the bacon jam. The jam was topped with baked brie and spread on a toasted baguette. The flavors were a punch in the mouth: sweet, salty, smoky, and creamy.   For mains, we shared the cocoa-espresso NY strip steak and the two flatbreads with a side of fingerling potatoes. The steak was cooked perfectly medium-rare with a tasty red wine demi glaze. It was better than a lot of the steakhouses in Vegas.   We were already satisfied, but got a dessert to share anyway. The glazed donut bread pudding is one of the best and most unique bread puddings I've tried in a while. Served with three rum caramel and vanilla creme anglaise, it was the perfect ending to a damn good meal. It was light on top and the bottom had a toasted crust that's reminiscent of a glazed donut. The service was awesome, and the ambiance was hip, something that you don't find very much of in this city.

kzaeov7AfXzsWUmCAKdxtA.text: I recently stayed downtown for Las Vegas for my 50th birthday celebration.  I did my research in order to find the best restaurants in the area.  Carson's Kitchen continued to pop up as one of the best.  So I put in on the itinerary for the trip.  I was not disappointed in anyway with this restaurant.  First service:  the guys and gals working the front of the restaurant were cheerful and seemed to be happy working at this establishment.  The food was the best I had during my celebration this includes eating at Hugo's Cellar (very good), Three Gorges Grill (good), Park on the Fremont (mediocre).  The Veal meatballs were the best meatballs I've ever had.  The Killer Shimp was the best shrimp dish I have ever had.  I will never miss the opportunity to visit Carson's Kitchen when I visit Las Vegas.  IF you are staying at the strip, I would highly recommend grabbing a rideshare and visiting the restaurant.

z4JKyFHyRcZbcnhH0Im_7Q.text: I just have to say everything was great from back Jan to steak to donut bread pudding I absolutely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam and what

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He best mac n cheese ever

5boErcdPP3jQTs9-LOM37w.text: Phenomenal...everything about our experiences tonight was fantastic. We sat at the bar, which I would definitely recommend Geronimo the bartender was funny and fairly attentive especially considering how busy the place was. We had the Devil's eggs which was hands down the highlight of our meal. Do not leave without trying them... seriously they're that good. Would definitely recommend.

KRCrV7TJihhQM222om08KA.text: The food was incredible.  the service was wonderful. I just love everything about this place.

pWVBcywJ4WesVteRJDmr7A.text: Excellent for the food network watching foodie in you. Erotic..I mean exotic menu selections to arouse your palate...

qvYk3Tiqx7HrweyU4F5-bA.text: I decided to try this place over a meeting to finalize some plans for work and my god was I impressed! I had the coco espresso strip cooked rare. It was fantastic and amazing. Truly wish I could order an endless amount. I had it with a side of Rainbow Cauliflower which was a mistake on my end. That is the only thing wrong with this place. I enjoyed a drink of a special of theirs called Towns End. It's a twist on an old fashioned. It was good but nothing to brag about. But when it comes to bragging. They have something I feel they don't brag enough about. This one dessert called the Bourbon brownie. Simply just wow. That's all you can say. The brownie is just so rich and the hints of bourbon are balanced just well enough where they don't overpower the ice cream or the chocolate. It is a must get!

-SRnapR_roZbwPcplNRzEA.text: Looking for a new spot to grab a bite/drink and yelp led me to Carson Kitchen. Came here with my wife and bro and we had a great experience.  Attempted to make a reservation but they only take reservations for large parties. No big deal.  So we walked in and was told there would be a 45 minute wait.  Place looked full and it's not particularly big.  There's a bar inside and one on the roof. Waiting area was outside in a courtyard/lounge type area.  So we headed to the roof, grabbed a drink, and proceeded to chill in the courtyard. A couple drinks later we were seated inside.  Placed our food order and another round of drinks. Started off with the chicken skins which were a crunchy delight of fried goodness. Wife ordered the green beans which were as tasty as a green bean could be. I ordered the Secret Sunday chicken sandwich, which was one darn good tasting sandwich. The accompanying tater tots were consumed by the wife so I'm assuming that they were just as delicious. My bro ordered the blackened Chilean sea bass and that thing was damn tasty. Perfectly cooked which the right amount of crispness on the blackened side.  We finished the night with the bread pudding which was on point as any dessert should be. The waitress was cool,  friendly, and attentive. Don't particularly remember her name but she was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Sunday chicken sandwich with a side of tots

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura green beans

IJj_zZvTo9fEhmaZCIwNtg.text: Needed to try something outside of the casino buffet and found this place. The BbQ burnt ends appetizers was delicious flavorful!  Goes well along with there selected beers. The place gets busy but luckily we made it before it gets packed but our server was nice and always checks up on you.

8DWfhhM-Yb9BjnoxqY6fRw.text: Really neat little out of the way restaurant. Food was excellent, the dishes are shared so my wife and I split the burnt ends, baked mac & cheese, and cocoa rubbed new york strip. All were fantastic. Our waiter, Roman (?), was very helpful and service was prompt. Only drawback was no signage on the outside to direct you to the correct door. Glad we searched as it was worth it.

8CUd3jDehTPqZhb5AP20pw.text: Nestled in the heart of downtown, behind the hubbub of Freemont Street, Carson's kitchen was a quaint little eatery with a friendly staff and delicious eats.  Not a full 5 stars for me because I thought their drink menu was more extensive than their food menu.  The menu is designed for sharing and that we did.. I'm not a fan of chicken skin, or animal skin of any kind but I took a little nibble just to say I tried it; flavors were great, almost bacon-like.  Mac and cheese was my absolute favorite, rich and delicious.  With a dual outdoor patios, one upstairs and down, it really rounds out the extension of the restaurant.   All in all, Carson's kitchen is worth a try and I definitely will be a repeat offender.

bwTr_AHUbg058JfgIQ-19g.text: Trendy looking restaurant. The food came out quickly and the server was friendly. However, the food was unoriginal and really not anything special. We ordered the rainbow cauliflower, the Sunday chicken sandwich, and the tikka masala flat bread. The server warned us that our entrees would be spicy and we do not typically eat very spicy food. However all the entrees were really not spicy at all.

wlFK8R8p2x5xnkR3uT4gjQ.text: Best fried chicken sandwich I've had by a long shot. I mean it was so favorable and crunchy. The buns were buttery, toasted by soft. The service was also amazing and this place is a must visit fried chicken lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9nzrUte9HeX0lD0xcVxZ0A.text: Came in for the chicken skins!  Our server Kendall was so sweet and explained how the menu and things worked- meaning the food comes out when it's ready and mostly just a-la-carte. The skins had a nice spice to them that wasn't hot, but very flavorful. Our server honestly made the experience great and I'm glad we came in here

uK4aLQBhpHd5bzZ0iCFP8A.text: I told a few friends where i was going for lunch and everyone had a favorite dish there so it was a tough choice but i went with the chicken sandwich and it did not disappoint.  This was my second visit. The first time, a large group of us went with pretty short notice but they accommodated us and it was fantastic.

AdNpoDfF4nQZzt7w8sFeVA.text: One of the best meal we had in Vegas, including some celebrity chef places on the strip. The cozy environment with a fire pit in the courtyard is the perfect setting. Food presentation was great and everything was very tasty, fresh and substantive. We really enjoyed the streak and the mushroom flatbread. Tapas style dishes allowed us to try many things on the menu. The only thing we didn't love was the bacon jam, which is an acquired taste.  I would highly recommend this place for any occasion. It gets really busy so be prepared to wait. They will text you when the table is ready.

Pz7xpxjqjuUuuW9g03PZrQ.text: We love this place! They don't take reservations unless you have a large party, so be prepared to wait a bit, but it's worth it.  You must order the bacon jam brie.  We have a few other favorites too, but that is a must order for us every time. Friendly service staff and cool atmosphere, and easy parking on the street close by the restaurant.

KOnIJD-W59KHOLgBgX6-Ow.text: This place is amazing! We went in around 6 and there wasnt anyone in yet but quickly became packed, we started with the bacon brie jam which was delicious,  the baguette it came with was super good, after I had the strip steak which was pretty good, I dont have steak too often but I thought it had good flavor with a nice char on the outside. Now to the best part was the dessert, the glazed donut bread pudding, might be the greatest bread pudding ive ever had.  I really enjoyed the ambience, food and presentation at Carson Kitchen, I plan to come back and try other dishes

EBMqQ2xJm5C43b9Phudq6Q.text: I really liked this restaurant, the hipster, urban vibe is another welcome addition to the slowly evolving area of Downtown LV. I'm excited to see more unique and alluring  restaurants popping up.  Food was very good, ordered a bunch of everything as our table of ten just kind of shared. The menu is varied and unique, lots of interesting food combinations, but executed well.  Cocktails were stiff and did the trick.  Staff was friendly, accommodating and helpful in going over the menu.  A tad on the pricey side for meal size, as pointed out by a couple friends, although the ambiance and meal quality is quite good. Would defiantly return.

opd20xa9fDggmB0msmOv_A.text: Amazing food.  Amazing service. Must go if you like food and are in Las Vegas. GET THE CHICKEN SKINS.

egVzU1G_NL0ejA3fTlRSzQ.text: This place is crazy good! Unconventional menu of unique and incredibly delicious items and creative cocktails.  Fun, casual environment and great service. One of the highlights of our trip to Vegas. Will definitely return.

4JZdGE1GUrGWzPI3TeViMA.text: NOT MY KINDA PLACE Small, noisy and horrible chairs (mettle stools). And I'm just not a Toppas fan. Food is creative and ok. Service staff looked overwhelmed. Had to pay to park. Not my kind of place.

dz6ELbEzQdvSGzzl5tuuwg.text: I really loved the vibe of this place.  Really hard to find, but once you do, you forget where this place is located.  The waiting patio was awesome...not packed in like sardines...it turned a wait into a nice visit.  I had already pre-gamed this place before we ever got to Vegas, so I knew we were going to have the bacon jam, the chicken skins, and the glazed donut bread pudding.  All of those were great, but I think my mac & cheese and my hubby's butter burger with tots were headliners as well.  I will say I thought the chicken skins would have had more flavor...probably wouldn't get those again but I did enjoy them, and my hubby loved them.  You have got to go here, whether you're a local or a visitor like us.  Will have to try to fit it in on our next visit in March.

_fR0Z-urBy8Mowi6NE8nXg.text: Busy place, trendy, hip, phenomenal food, small plates, order two or three per person, share. Or they offer burger and fries for complete meal.  We practically tried everything thing, and it all was delish. Seriously, you can not go wrong!  Our favorite was the "pork wings" and the Mac n cheese!  The service was impeccable, but not sure if it just is, or because they gave us a table if we promised not to linger. We received attentive service with food, removing plates, refilling drinks. It was reserved for someone arriving in an hour. Either way we ate, and didn't linger, since they didn't make us wait an hour for a table.  Would eat here again!

cSkqRj8gCKWnmbAlNE_dIA.text: Did not disappoint!  Enjoyed everything we ordered and am already looking to go back to try new things.  Good menu with a decent variety of options.  I like the area, although parking can be tough, great spot for lunch or brunch if you want to avoid the crowds.  We were seated at a table with another couple, so if you don't want to eat with strangers maybe ask for a smaller table or go with a group!

tJcTUZRnu7rlFfLDoeaGZA.text: We ate at the bar, which meant we had a vantage point for watching the kitchen. We ordered after scoping out some of the food, which included the Devil's Eggs, flatbread and NY strip.  Everything was well cooked and played with finese. and the place was packed. We were just popping in for a quick dinner and it was a good choice. We were seated immediately, food came out in a timely manner, and while we enjoyed our time there we were on our way a lot quicker than I could have imagined.

-84l_GX-t6GD79BRYIMvmg.text: The food is really good here, a bit on the pricier side, but really good. Keep one thing in mind before going in though, the portions are really really small. They do warn you when they come to take your order though.

K6BSZcdwRYOSt2Fyyk-7lg.text: This is a cute little brunch spot. The wait wasn't too long on a busy Saturday morning. About 15 minuets. They had a very tasty cherry sangria cocktail. Their bacon jam starter was a sweet, salty, creamy concoction perfect for sharing and spreading on bread. The Greek tacos were delicious. The mushroom flatbread was earthy and had a creamy bechamel sauce. Another little gem was their black rice oxtail risotto. It had the perfect bite and ended with a Parmesan taste. Lastly their glazed donut bread pudding melts in your mouth and is the perfect ending to the meal.

LtZFmmBh8PwGq8V57MJFvw.text: Okay. Some of the things we ordered were awesome and some were mediocre at best. My favorite was the bacon jam with Brie. They brought us out 4 small slices of banquette twice and charged us $2 each time. The restaurant has a cool vibe. We threw down $70 at lunch for 4 of us and left still hungry. Probably won't be coming back.

FyObzrkQ7P5uA1jSEwg4xA.text: THe burger might seem small, but it's really filling esp. with the tater tots. It kept its juiciness. The staff is wonderful and the place is wonderful esp. the rooftop.

Tq64yj4Am0svtXi9VqzPaA.text: Absolutely delicious food and cool atmosphere! We shared the tempura green beans, Mac n cheese, and butter burger ; the 3 were perfect to split between 2 people and a great hangover killer. The purple haze whiskey drink was magnificent- perfect for a whiskey lover, not too sweet or strong; perfectly balanced. I am adding this place to my regular spots to hit up every time we are here!!

ME3GIdzMS5aq2oIuvdBv7A.text: The Bacon Jam is sooo good. They have a delicious fried chicken sandwich and there is a hard cider with vodka drink that I wish I could remember - I have to go back just for that drink!  The wait staff is friendly and although it took us a few minutes to find the place it was well worth the time to get a great bite :)

d58aKCTCbrEa0HjcHqVF0Q.text: Wow the food is fantastic.  Some of the portions are small, but perfect if you are going to share several dishes with your wife who can't make up her mind LoL.    The dessert was great. The bacon ice cream was " to die for" according to my wife.  The bread pudding was great as well.    The green eggs and ham was good, however a touch spicy

Y40byhdDn2HmAnVmfBdgSg.text: Although they were out of alot of items that we wanted to try. The courses we did get were amazing. My favorite was the Tuscany Chicken. This is an excellent place to go if you're wanting to get a variety of different things to try as the plates are sharable. Our server Amanda was awesome. We gave her crap about being out of most things we wanted to try but she rolled with it. Excellent service and will be back the next time we are over this way.

CiiVQd3D2IHYk8x6M7Hr6g.text: Great restaurant! Food was tasty with a lot of spices. Staff was friendly and informative. Would totally recommend this place. It's a block off of the Fremont experience and worth the walk.

Mr1Lrux-NcCLFuJPCQ7UoA.text: I have been to this restaurant for business Meetup, social gathering and romantic date night. And I gotta say its one of my favourite spot downtown.   The rooftop patio is cool.   I also recommend this place frequently to visitors who wants to get away from the strip, but looking for a casual yet trendy place to eat at.

pXqwLnrRCB5ey9nd0CEvkA.text: This place is amazing! Bacon jam so delicious and there Mac and cheese so good. It never disappoints me each time I go. Butter burger yum!! Now anytime I'm in Fremont street my go to is always Carsons kitchen!

Px5179cxDKcplRcv4yPKsg.text: So i DIG Caron Kitchen !   Whats not to like really? besides the wait to get in which is understandable if the food is above par which it is. The menu is diverse with a little bit of everything but my favs are easily the gyro tacos, mushroom flat break, and the butter burger. Each time ive come here the service has been spot on, as well as the quality of food. Sitting at the bar area in front of the kitchen is quite a spectacle if you are not in the food service industry. I am not, and it amazes me how well they coordinate getting everything out so well and in such a timely manner with little to no mistakes. Do visit Carson and appreciate the good food they are bring to us in the downtown area.... thanks guy ill be back.

fkA4pe9u2JI_I8ZpsUa5Gg.text: This is my favorite spot every time I visit Vegas!  It is so good. The food is excellent, the staff very attentive and friendly!  I love the burnt ends and the beets are to die for!  The deviled eggs yummy.  We've tried several desserts and they were all good.

K_Egq7OwwNZI-RigEPJsVw.text: I went to Carson Kitchen for dinner fairly soon after they first opened and I have to say their food was really good.  I kept it simple with a flat bread and the deconstructed donut dessert and they were both really good.   Recently I had occasion to join a friend there for lunch and was treated to food that was even better than in their early days. Sure, different menu items, but it felt like they had dialed things in a bit and the sliders and the deviled eggs that we had were really really good.   To top if off, the people working there are extremely friendly and on top of their game, overall I would say this is a really great addition to downtown fare and you should definitely check it out, especially if you're looking for a new lunch spot.

Ujf4C363TwxrbqUJu0LLaQ.text: Paid twice as much the night before at a steakhouse at Ceasar's for a meal that didn't measure up to what this place served up. The people working here truly care about what they are doing. Great menu, great food, great service.

uuM_ixA4rnkEVT3N_Y3b4A.text: Salty and below average. I had the oxtail risotto and it was salty and horrible. Chef's taste your damn food before you actually serve it to the customer.

imPTmYm0QDqSKPDA-qsWHQ.text: We read about this place in desert companion, having won the neighborhood restaurant of the year. It has definitely lived up to the hype. We've gone on less busy days like sunday and monday, and we've been able to sit right away. The food is amazing. My current favorites are the devils eggs and jalepeno poppers, and of course, the bacon jam!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upstairs balcony, warm desert night:)
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stanley effect and white belnd, highly recommended!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devil&#39;s eggs with caviar, amazing!

nieZCd8yam9FLDRjlYzs4g.text: If I could raise it to 6 plus I would. Definitely worth the drive off into the downtown area, this unassuming stop charms you the minute you enter. Wonderful welcomes await you with friendly servers and front of the house staff. But first, this place is small, and I'm sure gets busy. It's worth every minute you would have to wait! So be patient and await with a drink! We ordered small plates and the Butter Burger. The Burnt Ends come with an out of this world ranch, homemade pickles and leaves you wanting three more orders, even though the portion is generous! So amazing! We enjoyed the Devil Eggs and a Beet Salad that came with delicious morsels of goat cheese....I cannot explain the perfection and explosion of flavors in every bite! My husbands Butter Burger was extraordinary, juicy perfection with homemade cheese.   I'm gushing, however this rad place deserves so much more! We will be stopping again on our way home! Bravo!!!

dra_A6nrEk92A5VF_jd1sQ.text: I dream about this place. Particularly the chicken skins; or the deviled eggs; or the bacon jam. Oh my gosh, I dream about it all.   I have literally (yes, literally) tried everything on the menu and it is superb. EXCEPT, the desserts... I don't really enjoy any of them - that doesn't mean they're bad, but could use some work.  The staff is exceptional, the location is easy accessible, and the drinks are on-point.   The only cons are the seating can be awkward for large groups, and the noise level hinders conversations with large groups as well.  Highly recommended.

ajNRtKX3YhikOhHnLet7eQ.text: Let me start with the food is awesome.  Bacon jam lived up to its reputation.  We had a party of 8 with reservations made two weeks in advance. We showed up on time and were seated about 20 minutes later. Not a big deal since they had a great outdoor fire lounging area for us.  Once we were seated, our server, I can't remember her name, but she could be Gwen Stefani's sister, seemed on her game and said she won't forget anything because we'll order then she'll repeat it back to us...which she did.  We were warned that food came out randomly about every 6 minutes and they encourage sharing plates. Fine. However, first, not all plates are shareable with 8 people. Sandwiches and burgers and certain salads are not shareable. That being expected is simply ridiculous. Second, Food came out 20,30 and 60 minutes apart. That's insane. The server suggested if we wanted protein in the much talked about Mac n cheese, to add the meatballs. Perfect. So meatballs came out promptly, then the Mac followed about 35-45 minutes later.  YEP. Great recommendation server! To top off the already late dishes, everyone ate except our friend with a chicken salad. First being told "the chicken takes a long time to marinate" This is almost an hour after originally ordering.  Finally The server said "someone forgot" and she would comp the salad because she "didn't even care"  Still, 30 plus minutes goes by without it and I can't help but wonder if it was because the cook was playing "finger drums" in the back. The salad arrived, we cheered and the hostess seemed annoyed and said "frankly, it was because your server forgot to order it". Nice team work! No one takes ownership, just blames or throws you under and made us feel like the jerks because WE should have expected that due to their expediting technique. The infamous salad was wonderful, so our friend said. We left with pleased palates but service was considerably less than our expectations.  If you want good food, go. Just leave all other expectations at the door.

I0XsOfsdjjrSr_SHWkfWAg.text: Great Food and service.  You may have wait a bit, but it is worth it.  You can sit outside in the summer.

V3pRZcIq7k-SwZpNPM0DQQ.text: Don't pay so much attention to all the reviews. Ultimately every flavor was masterful.   Just get as many different things as you can and share them with your friends.

AqS6ntwGN9kjl_Qbhdx3bQ.text: Carson kitchen definitely put a lots of effort and attention into their food.   We shared the bacon jam and brie to start and it was delicious and different! The shrimps had a nice crisp and flavor also.  I ordered the chicken thighs with apricot and it was beautifully made and flavored. All my friends also had great food which were all beautifully decorated. The only dish I didn't like was the tahini carrots, the carrots weren't cooked all the way through I believe to keep some crunchiness and generally tasted like vinegar to me, but that might be just a personal preference.  The service was friendly and attentive, shame that they didn't let us split the bill. One of my friend ended paying the bill for all until we sort it out. Not the kind of headache you want to have when you enjoy lunch with some friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tahini carrots
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken thighs

LWhQ1MJnBQU8m8DGcW_IZw.text: Finally got around to eat here. It was a great foodie experience sitting in front ot the cooks. We ordered chicken skins, beet salad, sloppy Joe and devil eggs. I loved all of it. I mean,  everything was utterly delicious and I was sad there was absolutely no room for that brie or even dessert. Will surely come by another time for more food orgasms.

XPmENOZlfo-3ycOllpNJgw.text: I walked here, taking a lunch break from the Mob Museum. Although it's a bit quaint inside, everyone's friendly, and I love the ambiance. I sat at the bar with the open kitchen. I loved being able to see how everyone from the chef to the servers worked together to bring everyone their meal.   I didn't want anything heavy, so I settled on a yummy sounding bourbon fudge brownie. The saltiness of the bacon contrasts well with the chocolatey brownie and sweet ice cream. I practically inhaled this it was so good.

c9GDC_InPYUg2eRZ5tfNhw.text: So... We had 2 awesome Purple Haze, a red wine, Bacon Jam (though I would prefer a slightly bigger piece of brie), Killer Shrimp and Young Beets... Everything is delicious. Friendly service.

xZTztyZJ1HdA6gryb6ltug.text: Nicest staff, alongside food that is just a bit above what you expect and it makes one want another bite and another....plus Chelsea at the bar served me peach cobbler as a birthday treat because she heard I was Southern!  That is hospitality

KOX-jh4CyzFLhXOT9_EiGQ.text: I was so excited to try this place and had the perfect opportunity last night while hosting a dinner for all the speakers we are having present at a conference tomorrow night.  I would definitely give this place five stars for the ambiance, the cool vibe and super friendly staff. Matt the co-owner greeted us personally and showed us the rooftop we reserved for the evening. There are five heaters up there and a private bar. The drinks were awesome.  In order to accomodate a large group we were asked to choose a pre-set menu and it would be served family style. My one and only complaint is the portion size. The plates are very small. The beet salad had half of one beet cut up with four tiny balls of cheese. We got one plate to share for every five to six people.... everything came out at a different time so you were perpetually hungry and your plate was always empty. The ox tail rissoto which is fantastic has enough in the plate for one tablespoon per person, you can get two small pieces of cauliflower and a tiny sliver of chicken.... The only course where the portion size was appropriate for the guest count was dessert.   Every single person commented that the food was delicious but they were still hungry. Many ended up going out to eat after dinner.  That's not what you want when you pay aprox $128 per person. There was one exception, the girl that is vegan. I think because they had to alter several dishes  she ended up with a satisfying amount of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C9_WVRO4q78tPlxQmXojZg.text: This place is FABULOUS!!! Wish I would have remembered to take photos. We began with deliciously wonderful cocktails then went for the kill with deviled eggs with pancetta and caviar, fried green tomatoes topped with crab,, then fried chicken skins with honey dipping sauce. The staff and service is exceptional. Will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emmet is preparing deviled eggs topped with pancetta and caviar.  YUM!!!

_j-YiXq1-3DaunLkJWfYbQ.text: I used to have a client downtown and I would purposefully make meetings with them around lunchtime so I could dine here after. I love this place!  Dakota, though I'm not sure if he still works there, always took great care of me and my coworkers when we could come here. The wait was never too long and it is always packed around lunch because it's such a great place to dine for a quick bite between meetings. Lots of smaller plates to share as well, which is always my favorite thing to do. The bacon jam brie is OUT OF THIS WORLD good! The flavors are absolutely incredible.  Great, friendly and kind staff that are always the cherry on top to any restaurant. Such a great restaurant that carries on Kerry Simon's legacy extremely well with quality food and service.

v0rIiySOkyDfPGY3aW0ToA.text: This restaurant has a great vibe. Liked the decor. Service was great. Restaurant was clean. Loved the bar seating that faces the chefs. Thought that was cool.   We ordered Rainbow Cauliflower, Mac & Cheese and the Hot Italian Sandwich. While, I didn't fall in love with any of the flavors, the ingredients were fresh & of quality.  Some may be confused with my 4 Star rating but, I don't believe a restaurant should be penalized for ones personal taste preference.   They deserve 4 Stars because everything else was on point.

tk2uwvfmY1jvkb8fh_f-kw.text: Lovely dinner away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Made a reservation for a group of 10 and we were all able to fit comfortably. The waitresses were super friendly and the space was beautiful.  We ordered several small plates to share and a few large plates. It was so much food.   After all the small plates, we probably could have gone with one large plate for every two people. Everything was delicious and reasonably priced. Drinks were unique and tasty.

YWR9b6lchp7nug4y_OJONw.text: Bacon Jam holy heaven in my mouth!! Plates are shareable. We ordered the bacon jam, mac and cheese which was rich and creamy and delish and the Secret Sunday Chicken which had a spicy (not too spicy) pickle aioli. I love aioli!! The chicken was super moist and the breading was perfect, not cakey not thick, literally perfect   Everything is made to order so it took a little bit to come out but the wait was worth it. The server was really attentive and nice. Very knowledgeable about the menu.  I had the Get Shorty! Drink and it was really good as well.  This place is a MUST visit for sure!! I will be back!!!

G_pteCL8voejvdOEJ1fVew.text: Six dishes, three friends, 1 amazing restaurant!  I have been trying to get into this place for years but every time I'm downtown, it is super busy and now I know why; this place is fantastic!  Be warned though that they do not take reservations so you either have to come on a slow day or during a slow time.    Here's a review of the items we got:  Killer Shrimp:  Delicious.  Imagine bang bang shrimp from Bonefish Grill but add a few pickled peppers.  The creaminess and the slight spiciness makes the bowl totally lickable. Crispy Chicken Skins:  Addictive!  The skins are fried really crispy and dusted with a special seasoning blend so good you could sell it on the corner downtown.  Dip these bad boys in honey and you've got yourself a real treat! Black Rice and Oxtail Risotto:  Not bad.  This was our least favorite dish.  The texture and the taste seemed just a bit off.  The dish almost didn't get finished, almost. Meatloaf patty melt and tater tots:  This was delectable/  So juicy, so crispy, so savory!  I needed this to be bigger but luckily it also came with the best tater tots I've ever had!  They too wee dusted with the same seasoning blend that was on the chicken skins. Jerky Turkey Burger and Secret Sunday Chicken sandwich:  I unfortunately did not get to try these but my buddies told me they were fantastic.  The turkey burger came with a sweet and spicy chutney and the chicken sandwich came was dusted with that amazing seasoning blend.  Both of course came with those heavenly tater tots.    I will definitely be going back and hopefully soon because I want to try literally everything else on their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut butter banana cheesecake.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black rice and oxtail risotto.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Sunday chicken.

PUzUXG3pD8fm_vDPcG6ipA.text: The last time I was here, I gave this restaurant an enthusiastic five stars. I can only say that I am now significantly disappointed and don't know if I would want to coming back here. The service is fine. Everyone is very nice. It is downtown with a convenient location with parking available. The problem for me is that it seems like the menus change depending on either the season or what is available. The last time that I was here, they had an amazing array of small plates/salads, including the most amazing watermelon feta salad. I specifically came here today hoping to get that salad again, as well as other small plates they had the last time. Sadly, it was not on the menu. I did order the beet salad with mandarin oranges and it was quite yummy although small. Due to not really liking what was available on the menu otherwise, I also ordered the sea bass ( I prefer vegetarian/vegan yet will also eat fish). It was a disappointment for me. It was very plain and I could make a way better one in my kitchen, at home, esp at $22.00 for the small plate. My friend ordered the flat bread with mushrooms and Tikka Masala. It was a little bit on the spicy side but I just wasn't blown away. I would never order this flat bread again. She also ordered the tater tot's and they were not only on the spicy side but way over seasoned. The bill came out to about $64 with tax, and that included one beer.  I am not sure I want to take another chance unless I preview the menu before going there to make sure that the items on the menu are those that I would like to eat. Otherwise, today was more of a thumbs down for me which is a real bummer, as I really liked this restaurant the first time I went there. This place went from being amazing to very average and easy to forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

Z0qN4g8TMqQhW-PSyJ7tvA.text: Hubby and I wanted to get a bite to eat to tide us over until our dinner reservation. We knew nothing of the area so we looked to Yelp and our fellow Yelpers did not disappoint us! We were led to this gem of a place just a short walk of where we were already so it was perfect. We ordered the Deviled Eggs, Young Beets, and the Gyro Tacos. My favorite was definitely the beets. We so wanted to return during our stay so we could try out the dinner options but unfortunately we couldn't find the time. It is definitely on our list for the next time we are in Vegas however!
