-eH_jAHjpwNuqTXGzH0E7g.text: Carson Kitchen has been on my list for a very long time. It pains me to miss it for the past 3 times I've been in town due to conflicting schedules...ok....so it's really because my friends and I are always so hungover and lazy to make the drive from Henderson to downtown. Don't judge, it's Vegas folks. Fast forward to 2018 and my crying about losing too much money at the Golden Nugget. Wanting to drown my sorrows in good food and libations, I dragged my poor friend in 100+ degrees scorching weather to go on a walking mission to find Carson Kitchen. After about 30mins getting lost, endlessly dropping f-bombs and getting sunburned, we managed to find this kickass air-conditioned oasis in Downtown. THE MAGARIAN ($13): Refreshing blend of Aviation Gin, fresh lemon juice, thyme and cucumber soda. There was a subtle sweetness to it, possibly honey. I likey. bit.ly/2Deerg3 SIMON SAYS SANGRIA ($10): White wine, pureed peach and sparkling wine. - Our server suggested this popular cocktail for me because I told her I wanted to try something different than my usual Vodka-Soda. - It was way too sweet for me, not my cup of tea. I stuck with countless chilled vodka shots and vodka-soda for the rest of our meal, lol. CRISPY CHICKEN SKIN w/smoked honey dip ($9): bit.ly/2EQ9pIk bit.ly/2PEb1sV THIS was the sole reason why I bookmarked Carson Kitchen and it definitely did not disappoint! We loved it so much that we ordered 2! - Addictingly fried chicken skin chips that you just can't put down until the basket is completely empty. Oh yes, you bet yer ass I licked those crumbs. - The smoked honey laced with cayenne pairs so well with the saltiness of these fried delights. - Did I mention that they were GLUTEN-FREE? You're welcome. DEVIL'S EGGS ($8 for 2 eggs): bit.ly/2OeEzIE The best deviled eggs I've had yet. So velvety-whipped and melts in your mouth. The garnishing of crispy pancetta and black tobiko (flying fish roe dyed w/squid ink) takes it to a whole 'nother tasty level, in terms of savoriness and texture. KILLER SHRIMP ($13): bit.ly/2CSgKUU Menu listed it as being fried shrimp coated in a rocoto and aji amarillo cream sauce (orange and red chilies that resembles bell peppers). All I tasted was a sweet mayo-like sauce, reminds me a lot like the "dynamite"/kewpie mayo you'd find on your sauced up sushi rolls. Too rich and not a big hit for us. LAMB SPIEDIES w/tater tots ($15): bit.ly/2JwqNk4 Ground lamb sausage on a french roll. Overall, it was just ok. - The giardiniera (melange of pickled veggies) was crisp and tangy but it was a bit messy to eat. The garlic aioli could use more garlic. RAINBOW CAULIFLOWER ($10): bit.ly/2PwgQIC Very pleasantly surprised by this simple yet delicious plate of veggieterribles. Cooked to perfection with just simple seasoning of garlic and lemon juice. I'd definitely order it again. COCOA-ESPRESSO NY STEAK ($20): bit.ly/2yFp5sg Bras off to the chef because this was a pretty well-executed hunk of delectable beef! So tender and juicy, I couldn't stop eating it. Served on its own without any sides, but so worth the money! - The cocoa-espresso crust on the steak was deliciously genius and not at all overwhelming. The rich buttery red wine demi-glace added a nice savory-sweetness to the overall dish. Carson Kitchen, I lub you long time. Hours: Mon-Wed & Sun 11:30am-10pm; Thur-Sat 11:30am- 11pm Parking: - Street parking, if you're lucky. - There's a paid lot for $2/hr (free on holidays) across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. COCOA-ESPRESSO NY STEAK w/red wine demi-glace ($20): So good!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LAMB SPIEDIES w/tater tots ($15): Ground lamb sausage on a french roll topped with garlic aioli and giardiniera/pickled veggies.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE MAGARIAN ($13): Refreshing blend of Aviation Gin, fresh lemon juice, thyme and cucumber soda and SIMON SAYS SANGRIA ($10).

h17n70fIcdtyq8ZPc6vIFQ.text: This hidden gem is the type of restaurant I find so exciting to find.  From the unassuming exterior (to say the least), the millennial charm of the front staff to the passion with which I got to see the team in the kitchen prepare our meals, I knew I struck gold in downtown Vegas!   And my lunch that Thursday afternoon made my trip.  What I had wasn't important, I watched them prepare everything as though they were preparing for someone they loved.  What more can be asked of a restaurant.   All I can say is go!  If you have to wait, then wait and enjoy.  You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My steak and cauliflower prepared to perfection!

I0zFzeS36gZm-jMJeyKyEA.text: Always fresh & delicious.  Unique selection of food prepared to perfection.  A real gem in the downtown area.  Service is as good as it gets.  This place is an oasis in Downtown sector.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carson Kitchen, Las Vegas, Nevada

vAvBWh7hkr2E7zaV2N1aHQ.text: This is my new favorite place in Las Vegas. It is located right off of Fremont Street and if you did not know it was there, you could not find it. There's not a sign outside and the street on which this sits is not busy. I almost missed it during my first trip there. Yet, the restaurant stays really busy. It's a great local favorite.   The menu is nice and has dishes intended to be shared in an American version of tapas. I always get the Espresso Crusted New York strip and the Oxtail Risotto. I have also tried several drinks and desserts and have never been disappointed. I think I would come back again and again just for the Oxtail Risotto. I don't share it anymore. If you want some, you have to get your own bowl, even though the serving is large.   The open kitchen is a nice touch. It allows guests to watch as the food is being prepared and let's you have some slight interaction with the chefs. Service is good and food delivery is prompt. My only recommendation is that you should not miss this place, so do yourself a favor and make a reservation ahead of time. Especially if you are only in town for a little while.

Qet0JUAfEtRkdVMZKl09HQ.text: BAM! In a city of sin, there's a beaming light from heaven and I just found it. Aside from the fact that Gordon Ramsey just rolled through here 5 minutes ago (not kidding) and claimed the chicken as the best he's ever tasted... I am able to verify that this place is killing it. There isn't a dish on this menu that you are able to order that won't have you looking around wondering how the angels above were able to manifest themselves as a taste in your mouth.   Ethan, Yes. Thank you.

6Q_nb5b8B8epqekbfYP3jw.text: Long, some might venture to say too long, on my list of restaurants to visit, we finally arrived at its doorsteps on a recent Thursday night finding it quite busy and, might I say, noisy.  No reservations are accepted though our hostess found us an unoccupied table in a shade under 2 minutes.    We decided to get our motors runnin' while looking for adventure by starting the meal with an appetizer of bacon jam and brie accompanied by toasted baguette rounds.  The only problem was the wait, and wait you  must, for the bacon jam to cool so you will not ignite your palate.  Tic, toc, tic, toc, toc, tic. It is time to scoop out a sizeable portion, smear heavily on the baguette and savor.  Repeat again and again until every delicious morsel has been consumed.   Our Brussels sprouts Caesar salad was likely healthier though registering far lower on the flavor scale so it won't be receiving an invite to join us on next visit.  Lastly, both my wife and I each ordered the sea bass entree with chili oil and topped by an interesting cauliflower tabbouleh that proved to be quite enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sea bass
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bacon jam and brie
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts Caesar

OccTM7iVeHs69-II-uoxxg.text: Absolutely excellently executed meal. From beverage to dessert we had a really lovely meal. Great vibe, loved the communal tables and service was sweet and on point. Only qualm was that all of our food came out at once. We weren't asked if we'd like it coursed out. No big deal, would have just liked to sit there and savor each dish on it's own. We'll absolutely be back

K6Rmd5nIBXMNDQqg8b5tlw.text: Go here!  Superbly friendly staff. Cool, hip exterior. Very walkable from Fremont street (one block off). Fresh, flavorful and well prepared food. This is a don't miss.

VkrriFTdVfIVytQ3cymTrQ.text: Great food at reasonable prices.  I liked the communal atmosphere and the butcher block tables.  I'm not normally a mac and cheese fan, but I'm a fan of the dish here.  I had the oxtail risotto which was just ok, chicken skins were good and the bacon jam was very good.

enEI0dqlYq1CFXpGZbGY4A.text: Loved the venue. I had my wedding reception here. They were very accommodating on short notice and the food was amazing. Average food price would be $15-20/person not including any alcohol. Try it out in the heart of the arts district and right off Fremont street.

e1zVUIT_fTnUkxtm_xVR1A.text: Almost couldn't find the restaurant, it's not easy to spot on an almost empty street. We arrived at around 8:30 pm on a Sunday night and it was very busy. The restaurant has an intimate feel, they were out of a lot of items on the menu but we ordered the steak, the cauliflower, Devils eggs, and catfish sandwich. It was all amazing!! Great flavor, fresh ingredients. Would definitely visit again on our next Vegas trip. It was the perfect date night restaurant.

on0D6bZYr5MRKSMgLzK7kA.text: Words can not express how much I love this place or how much I look forward to going back. The food is so good! The atmosphere is awesome.  We ordered the deviled eggs- you have to try then The bacon jam w Brie- soo much jam too little bread but so good! The cocktails are awesome!!!

cFc2rZ2HJF1guUgYQ2DvXw.text: The macaroni and cheese is life changing. I love everything about this place. Fried green beans, the butter burger, chicken skins. Yum.

nzdMRDH915SAAO6R3gDtZg.text: Great service, great drinks but the food is the star. Try the burnt ends and bacon jam. The watermelon salad was an awesome share plate to finish off our great experience.

K81tBG5IHAanpqHMsAbBFQ.text: We have been here 4 times now and it never disappoints. The food is just unbelievable. The gyro tacos and ox tail risotto are crazy good. The waiters are so cool. Our waiter even remembered what shirt I wore the last time. The deviled eggs are quite wonderful. We are going to try a new item each time we go, so far we have not been disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l0MD_P06y71ot7MCFqEe0Q.text: It's a small place but the food and presentation was excellent. The lamb chops and the Blackened catfish was delish!

QmlGz8jgLyHfXA6IyrOBsA.text: This is one restaurant that I would like to take to the Bay Area with me.  Everything that we ordered was wonderful and they're all gluten-free starting with crispy chicken skins (I'm seriously thinking of going there for dinner tonight to get more of these), mushroom ceviche, pork belly, spaghetti squash and gyro tacos (replaced with lettuce to make it gluten-free).  Our server GianCarlo moved pretty fast so we were in and out of there pretty quickly (had to take my friend to the airport).  I'm seriously having withdrawal symptoms from this place.  We also love Bridgett who greeted us at the door.  No complaints about this place at all.  Forget the strip, come to Carson Kitchen!

L5y8WtVrfABBf9Hi-CAZRg.text: We had a delicious dinner last night at a very reasonable price, including wine and dessert.  Everything was fresh and beautifully served.  Nice ambiance and great service.  We loved the veal meatball and bacon Brie appetizers, then some ribeye steaks.

Uv66NHxm8LZtneaOSGClpg.text: Oh how I wish there were more stars to give! The executive chef personally saw to my dietary restrictions, and accommodated them with a smile, understanding, and speed. Even "off menu" they did an amazing job with the food and service. Hands down, my new favorite local spot!

wdj8i7QBmBe9AYFpliXIdQ.text: This was my first time eating at Carsons Kitchen and the food and service was excellent.  We will definitely be back.

98XYMr5iVOXg0kt049gorQ.text: Great recommendation by doorman of Banger Brewery. Took some finding but well worth the effort.Few individual tables with most sitting on high stools,bar style. Frequented by local sthe limited menu of excellent sharing plates, totally different from the usual Las Vegas fare was thoroughly enjoyed by our party of 3. Friendly and efficient service, excellent, tasty food, we can't wait to return. If you go, you must try the bacon jam dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EAnDEmIdKU0yJpQlPWE16g.text: Read good reviews so decided to try it out.  The fried chicken skins sounds a lot better than it tasted.  It tastes like a bag of pork skins, wasnt impressed.  The gyro tacos were very good and the mac n chz was also very good, i would recommend those 2 items

cUGpMk207SxUwoCiEEy8hQ.text: Not only one of my favorite downtown spots, but one of my favorite spots in all of Las Vegas.  The menu is so creative and unique.  The Chef is out of this world.  All of that with incredible customer service.  I promise you won't be disappointed.

YesDQ-0TtDB_w0wxYIxtcQ.text: Disgusting, overrated and overpriced.  I was horribly shocked at how small, dark, and seemingly dirty this place is.  The service was slow and the food was flavorless and overpriced and way overpriced for the quality snd quantity received.  Apparently they are trying to profit from the reputation of the now deceased Chef Kerry Simon, but I doubt he'd be pleased with this place either.  Save some money and go to Eat, just down the block, or any of a myriad of better, less expensive restaurants on Fremont Street instead.

hNRKJzMdxDLaaKiEjmsoHg.text: It was good, but not as great as I expected it to be. The deviled eggs were the highlight of the meal and I don't even like eggs, but everything else we got was either alright, or worse.   Short rib sliders- overly sweet and dry  Bacon jam - good, but only comes with enough bread to eat a third of it, either lower the portion and price, or more bread  Empanadas - something about the sauce I didn't agree with, also on the sweet side  I would also recommend going with 4 or more people, seems like that would work out better with the small plate aspect of the menu

OF3vq4P4Au7tP0IwRyMNHQ.text: The food is good, BUT the server warned us that food would come out randomly from the kitchen. WHY? Some main courses came with apps and a salad literally came out one hour after everything else. All servers said the same thing " well we encourage sharing everything" FIX THE EXPEDITING!

d7_ba5_S5pBSy5Qs5YhmAQ.text: We tried this on a recommendation.  It's not quite in the heart of the bustling Fremont crowd, which surprised me, but later, I was quite thankful for that.  You're close enough to walk to the Fremont craziness but about 1-2 blocks away, enough to make an easier arrival/escape.  We were escorted to a cute little courtyard waiting area, which was cool.  It looked like there were tables downstairs and upstairs (outdoor area upstairs?) although I never saw stairs inside.  The downstairs is all I saw.  It was small but had an energy about it.  1) Bacon Jam (baked brie w/ toasted baguette) = 5/5 (sweet and salty and spicy and sour all at the same time, very complex flavors made this very unique 2) Tempura Green Beans (pepper jelly cream cheese) = 5/5 (so glad my co-diner ordered this, the red pepper cream cheese was so tasty) 3) Baked Mac & Cheese = 4.5/5 (pretty darn good, solid mac n cheese) 4) Butter Burger = 5/5 (such a good burger, moist, unique flavors, seasoned well, melty cheese, yummy sauce)  I will say we each ordered a burger (which he told us was a full meal w/ spicy tots - also very good) and shared the bacon jam, tempura beans, and mac n cheese.  This was WAY too much food for four people!!  We loved our three shared items so much and think we should order 1 cheeseburger as a shared item as well instead of a whole burger for each of us.  Very high recommendation for this place.

0aUicLsa8twv1dHqRls7AQ.text: I really wanted to like this place.  It's got such great Yelp reviews. Well unfortunately this Yelp lead me wrong and we are not impressed.    Walking in, the decor was nice. I liked the communal tables.  The host was a good looking guy but seems grumpy.  Didn't smile once while we were looking over the menu.    We usually like the bar so decided to sit there.  It was about 430 and relatively quiet.  You would they would have even more time to be attentive.  Wrong.  The guy behind the bar was busy the whole time stacking glasses and stocking beer.  Felt like we walked in too early and before they opened or something.  He was rushing to get everything done.  He did take our order and our food came out in reasonable time but serving us was more of an afterthought.   This would have been ok if the food lived up to 4 stars and it did not.  Everything was over salted.  We ordered the tempura green beans and oxtail risotto based on good review.  Green beans was ok, crispy but some were salty.  Felt like someone put salt at the end but didn't spread it even. First bite or the oxtail risotto was good.  A burst of flavor and richness.  Unfortunately more bites made us realized it was also over seasoned.   I asked for a slice of bread to eat with it. and he said he had to charge me.  That's okay.  Bread came with butter toasted and also some salt.  Why would you put salt on bread?  Needless to say, we were not impressed and walked away with a salty after taste.  It was a far cry from the Therapy dinner we had last night.  We will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of oxtail but need less salt and butter
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was so so only. Tell them less salt

PY58cbiZUE8c8qm4mXACLA.text: Where to begin... My girlfriend and I walked through the door and immediately was looked up and down by the hostess and she simply said "you guys can sit at the community table or, the bar" we didn't get asked or given the option of a table. We chose the bar because sitting at a random table with other people was not too romantic, nor did I want to meet anyone new that day. At the bar we were never greeted or asked what we would like to drink. The bartender finally walked over 8 steps to us and handed us a menu and walked off, I had to ask someone else that worked there if we could at least get a water.   We were told by the female bartender that everything that is cooked/made to order and meant to share. She also said the food is brought out as it is ready and would not come out at the same time... NOT A PROBLEM! We ordered the Ox tail risotto and a burger. The risotto came out within 10 minutes of us ordering it. Not impressed with the taste and it seemed like it was cooked in a crock pot earlier that morning and NOT MADE TO ORDER. My burger however, is a whole other story. We were done with the risotto within 20+ minutes and still no burger! I asked the bartender if the burger was coming out soon and she said she would go check. She came back and said nothing to us about the burger eta. Then the cook came out and from 15 feet away and within earshot of the whole bar and said "10 minutes on the burger" and the bartender turned to us and said "it will be right out". Now I've cooked burgers over 1000+ times in my life and if I cooked a burger for 30+ minutes it would come out a hockey puck.   I had enough and stood up and walked out. My girlfriend and I never got an apology or asked if there was something they could do. Horrible service, food sucked (I unfortunately never got to take a bite outta the burger), we will NEVER recommend that horrible place!

YUaeek5llHrEFXZcLuEfWQ.text: We stopped in for a quick bite before heading home after hitting the outlets, and were pleasantly surprised. We ordered the burnt ends, bacon jam, and fried chicken skin - and that hit the spot for us two. Manny was our server, was super nice and had great recommendations regarding the menu items. First, the burnt ends were a perfect balance of crispy charred fat and meat, and the sauce wasn't too sweet. Perfect. Second, the bacon jam was a balanced blend of seasoned sweet and savory without a sugary overkill. And third, the fried chicken skin is probably the best you'll find in Las Vegas. We order this everywhere, and Carson Kitchen has everyone beat. This is a must-visit.

G8HX-rlQn31Go0aT6AIE2Q.text: Friendly staff, great food, great beer selection, cozy atmosphere. The bacon jam is everything you could ever hope for. You will not be disappointed!

-gnJFMTgdaXWgP3g4sgLyw.text: The menu is always changing and the staff is always amazing! I love that they keep staple items on the menu, yet change items for the season. You will always find the meals that brought you back, and new tasty delights to keep you coming! I love the open kitchen and sit at the counter all of the time. The names of the menu items are hilarious to hear being called in.   It's a tapas style of americana dinning, but if you over eat like me...you can go at it alone. The desserts are to die for...especially the Donut Pudding!   And don't forget to say 'HULLO" to my fiance, Chef Maria Plaza!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy! I love falafel! Thanks Chef María Plaza

ZjF026LEqusXc2g7WCsdvg.text: Omggggg this place is delicious! Came if for dinner after we watched the Elvis show.. we ordered the bbq burnt tips, wild mushroom flatbread, bacon jam and the secret Sunday chicken sandwich... my god EVERYTHING was to die for!!!! For dessert we ordered the glazed donut bread pudding it was amazing. Will definitely be coming back when visiting Las Vegas

vj07pf-y4iYBZNRJqM4g0A.text: Awesome food. Tried the mushroom flatbread, turkey burger and pear and bleu salad. We sat at the high top and watched the chefs prepare the food which was cool. Definitely a hidden gem in Vegas. We were so full after our entrees but the donut bread pudding souffle like dessert looked delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5GlXisjKmCB6wSJWkHTUrg.text: By far the BEST meal we had all week in Vegas! The only disappointment is that we didn't go earlier in the week so we could've went back a 2nd time. First off, the customer service was phenomenal. My friend and I were wow'd by how all of the staff asked us if we needed help, offered suggestions, and overall super friendly. There was a 15 minute wait so they offered to show us to the patio in the back where we found a little oasis in the Fremont area of LV. A great fire bowl and chairs, not to mention a rooftop bar. We didn't mind the wait at all!   After were we called to our seats were were happy to see that we could see into the open kitchen and watch the busy staff prepare beautiful plates. The manager checked on us throughout the evening knowing it was our first time to dine with them. I was very impressed when he noticed a family trying to take a photo on the patio. He ran out to the patio and took the family photo for them then back inside to greet guest. Top notch.   The food did not disappoint at all. We decided to share a few plates so we could try out a few options. Our server suggested the chicken skins, devil's eggs, and baked brie with bacon jam. All three were spectacular.   If you want something local, yummy, and off the beaten path take a short walk to Carson Kitchen. You will not be disappointed.

Yazln12QH2TZahB4vnb2tA.text: Ate there 1/31 based on reviews. There were 4 of us so we ordered 8 different things. Each one was better than the last!! This place is a hidden gem! Service was fantastic. Cocktails were delicious!! Cool and comfy vibe. Cant say enough good things about it. GO THERE!!

iskfADBV6a5sQRpzHze3gA.text: A hip joint to dine in. Portions are small comparatively to American standards. The food is not bad just not crazy about it. Others in the group find the food to be great. I generally don't like hip joints with elevated prices but that seems to be a trend with the affluent or wanna be affluent. Price is often not proportional to taste, just very proportional to bragging rights and how much you are able to afford at these places.   If you looking for a little twist in how food is prepared, this is the place for you. I am not saying it is tasty, just a little different.

6h9_Ego0IbHcSer6eJbxfA.text: Great creative (and most importantly) delicious food. You can tell that the whole team cares about the food and drinks that they put out. We sat at the counter watching the kitchen which was really fun! Order the tempura green beans!

BtBOf2lMfug_51qAfwJPHg.text: Loved this new gem! Absolutely a great find for fine dining in Vegas DT area:) Really friendly staff, prompt service and that big smile win me over at first minute! Pig in a duvet was my favorite. Love that cute name! Steak was good, can't remember the full name anymore but it was just on point! Will def go back again. Oh! And their check, in a BOOK, was awesome! Don't want to spoil it, go check it out yourself!

hjxd8pnsltT4_GHlGHckew.text: Outstanding. I highly recommend making the trek. Their "secret sunday chicken" sandwich is absolutely amazing and I don't care for chicken sandwiches! The killer shrimp is one of the best shrimp appetizers I've ever eaten. SUPER all the way around! Loved it.

NLYvoN05p_sVAU7HsV8tTQ.text: The Macaroni and Cheese side is to die for. I paired it with the filet & Brussels/kale salad. All exceptional!

wCney-k1KGbhGEoSpHl5AQ.text: What is there not to like about this place, except that they could use more space to accommodate more people!   I've been here twice, and sadly, the first time was a definite 5 stars, but my second visit has brought it down to 4 stars. Hence, I'm having a hard time how to write this review.   Bacon jam with baguette- 5 stars on first try, but went down to a 3 for me. Second visit, the bacon jam was waaaaay sweeter, and it almost ruined it for me since I had been obsessing over it for months.   Crispy chicken skins- 3 stars. This stuff is good, but I've definitely had better.   Tempura green beans- 5 stars on first visit, but went down to 4 stars on second.   Rainbow Caultiflower- 5 stars all the way. This stuff is sooooo good, I wish I could eat it everyday. Unfortunately, they were out on my second visit.   Glazed donut bread pudding- 3 stars. I wasn't too fond of the flavors or the texture. It was good, but nothing special.   Wine berry shortcake- 4 stars. Loved the hint of lavender in the whip cream.   I love the style of this place. It's definitely "hip." And the open kitchen layout on the first floor is really cool.  The chef was very friendly, and all waitstaff are always on top of their game.   I'll definitely be back for the rainbow cauliflower and I'll give the bacon jam one more shot.

jQ48iMOnL0DzbnFE63RiDw.text: Although I felt like the old man in the room, my one foray here was a pleasant experience.  Devil's Egg with Pancetta and Caviar was a very nice and smooth starter.  Veal Meatballs in Cream Sauce were savory and tasty.  But I wasn't that fond of Crispy Chicken Skins, which were like Pork Rind.  But they tasted better dipped in very silky Smoked Honey.  Baked Mac & Cheese with Parmesan splinters were good, and Fingerling Potatoes excellent.  Grilled Rainbow Cauliflower was colorful but tasted no different than regular white cauliflower.  Bacon Jam Brie was rich and unique.  Short Rib Stroganoff with Cognac, Button and Portabello Mushrooms, and spinach was very good.  And homemade Tater Tots were great.  The contemporary decor and tableware here are quite inventive.  Our server did not check on my party of four much, so we had to ultimately forego dessert and ask the manager for the checks to avoid missing a play at the Smith Center.    This place has fine food!  XXXX-1/2 stars overall!

uRINuOB3Wc1efYrzaTQ83w.text: Great friendly service with knowledgable waiter.   5=gin and whiskey drinks 5=tempura green beans 5=sea bass (we love fennel but that can be off putting for some 5= mac n cheese 3= fried chicken skin a bit under done and burnt tasting at same time maybe need new oil 2=cauliflower  Will definitely come back next time we are in Houston. lNN9zsLP3JcdMQJQLSepAA.text: My buddy and I came here after searching Yelp while hanging out on Freemont St. Kerry Simon is a celebrity chef that has passed since I dined here, but his influence was definetly felt on the menu.   We sat at the chefs table and ordered beverages and had to order the bacon jam with brie upon the suggestion of other Yelpers and our server. The bacon jam was amazing and has my vote for best appetizer, the brie baked right in really makes the dish.   I chose the butter burger and it was very good, the only thing is the tomato didn't have salt or pepper so the tomato flavor really wasn't coming out, but that's a minor complaint.   Dessert was really good and one must check out the mirrors in the restrooms as they are so cute.   GO to Carson Kitchen!

oYogy73i2KNxnHQ_ibGefg.text: Sat at the bar outside, bartender was extremely helpful with the menu and explained everything thoroughly. Ordered the bacon jam, trout, cauliflower and meatballs and we were the perfect amount of full (for two people). Meatballs were definitely my favorite of the bunch! Wish we could have stayed for dessert, but needed to save room for more drinks! Highly recommended if you're looking for a place to eat off the strip.

XTMxmUyJqSLp4cxwEdxg2Q.text: I love this place because the food is yummy, gyro tacos and sangria. Amazing tator tots. The atmosphere is hip and the staff friendly. The bartender was hilarious. They have a nice upper deck too.

Xpg92Q-kKqJZguECVaQlyQ.text: Amazing!! Seated us in about 10 minutes although it was obvious they were fully booked. Excellent service and food! Will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas... may even be worth planning another trip to Vegas around!

YpU5XItbEH5ijc1xlwY0dg.text: High marks for flavor of the food however the staff needs to get an understanding of good hygiene while in the food service industry.   This was my second time having a late lunch here. This time around the bartender seemed to be the waiter at all the tables so he was needless to say "very busy" we were created and seated promptly by the hostess. As we sat the bartender is passing behind us and mudders to hisself f@$k, I'm guessing because he was so busy. The hostess got us some waters and said that the waiter would be with us. About 5 minutes pass and he comes by says hello and asked if we were ready.   I ordered an iced tea and the other person with me asked for raspberry iced tea he responded in an almost annoyed fashion I don't have raspberry iced tea, so we order lemonade. We order a starter and two other main dishes.   The shrimp platter came out first which was a main dish followed about 3 minutes later with the gyro tacos which was the starter and then about 5 minutes later the turkey burger which was the other main dish. Seems the waiter should ask and deliver instructions to the kitchen so guests get the food as they are expecting.   My main concern was the hygiene the hostess was trying to help out the waiter by delivering some food and helping with drinks however the almost to the crotch shorts seemed to be causing her a problem so she had to keep reaching to her inner thigh and pulling them down. The other was which seemed to be a manager figure wearing a button down shirt and sweatpants, he would play with his mustache and sole patch rub his eyes and face then grab a plate from the kitchen and deliver it to a table. The other lady at the kitchen counter did a good job as well as the kitchen staff. The other manager figure there delivered one of our plates to us and was very professional.   The food is a little over priced however great marks on flavor so great job to the kitchen staff.   The employees and managers should be a little more mindful of cleanliness.   Would like to come back but would need a very good reason as there are other establishments to spend my money.

i10tQ1nqbrzIftFzVoa9yw.text: Excellent service.  I won't be back for the food though.  Ordered the following:  Devil's Eggs: basically 6 deviled eggs with a sprinkling of black caviar and crunchy pancetta bits replacing the paprika.  I love deviled eggs and this version tasted okay, but I couldn't help thinking that real deviled eggs have more flavor, because of the spice from the paprika.  This version was just salty, and the egg filling was a little on the dry side as well.  The pancetta was the best part.  The caviar didn't have much of a flavor impact.  I think I would have been more impressed with the dish if they had replaced the black caviar with Japanese flying fish roe or salmon roe and added a drop of spicy sauce as well, because Japanese roe has that poppy texture that was missing with the black caviar.  Plus it's orange, so the presentation would be more exciting, more of a play on the traditional deviled eggs.   Roasted beet salad: the description sounded good but the flavors did not meld well for me.  Besides the beets, it had mandarin oranges, goat cheese, pistachios.  I think it would have tasted better if the beets were sliced thinner instead of in big chunks, and maybe if the pistachios were replaced with candied walnuts or pecans.    Rainbow Cauliflower: I prefer roasted cauliflower to whatever they did to this cauliflower.  Roasted cauliflower is more tender and the olive oil carmelizes, bringing out the natural sweetness of the cauliflower.  This version had no sweetness, only salt.  I didn't taste much or any garlic and lemon, which is what other reviewers have raved about.  And the cauliflower was still very crunchy.  It was another miss for me.  Hmm...looking at the photos other people have posted on Yelp, I see that I didn't get nearly as much caviar on my eggs as others did.  It really was just a sprinkling, whereas I saw in one photo that it was piled on.  I wonder if I caught the kitchen on an off night.

6f8H6MouKEtZtLGB5GdNnw.text: Carson Kitchen is located Downtown Las Vegas on 6th street right next O Face donuts and two blocks away from the El Cortez. When we arrived at the restaurant I was not sure I was at the right place at first. The front of the restaurant blends in with the block . As we walked in we noticed that the restaurant was full and busy at 7pm on a Friday night. I was with a group of 12 people. We had water at our table served to us right away and we were given wonderful, attentive service by the staff. Water is so important because it was about 114 degrees last night.The menu was explained as well as the "cook to order style" Our food was served quick and with a smile. Whatever you ordered you get as soon as its ready. The food is hot, fresh and seasonal. Each entree is made to share or not share if you choose. I ordered the rainbow cauliflower, it was excellent! I cant wait to try to duplicate this dish at home. I also ordered the Veal meatballs, excellent as well. I thought the cream sauce and the peas were a nice touch. I sampled other dishes like the fried chicken skins,very good for those that like chicken skin. I had a great dinning experience and I am looking forward to going back. A special shout out to our server who went above and beyond for our group last night, thanks again for your great service.

m-7gwbj1O4j2dSAccZlvbA.text: Crispy Chicken, Bacon Jam, Pot Pie...bucket list items. Best drinks...bartender is on his game.

ZZD2LgqWjGGSXrXkSwauLA.text: Love the tempura green beans, and the stupid good shrimp. Dakota was a great server. I wish the space was a little bigger.

QIbRfZL6Bf2Pf_lXlZD2Jw.text: Thanks to John and the Team at Carson Kitchen.  Our Team had a fabulous evening enjoying the pork sliders, the chicken skewers, and various wonderfully topped flatbread.  Sweet, savory and spicy - positively delicious!  Combined with a terrific Bar staff brought all the tasty treats together.  This was our 2nd visit and will most certainly make it a regular stop when we're in town.  If you're headed to Fremont Street, it's conveniently nearby.  If not, it is worth the effort to get there.  Otherwise, you'll have to console yourself for missing an opportunity, in my humble opinion, anyway!  Thanks John!

P-ttgQ5NTKqIwB2or5S15A.text: This amazing restaurant is not to be missed. The service is right-on with our server explaining the menu as there were 4 of us and we wanted to try many items. The burnt ends, watermelon salad, beet salad, macaroni & cheese, flatbreads, fried green beans and so many other dishes were awesome. Also, the desserts are not to be missed! What a find! Looking forward to my next visit!

uBRWEopGhl6ffX1W9fWlcw.text: Came here with a group of friends, seven of us total, and had we not made a reservation, it might have been tough to fit, so if you've got a group, think ahead. Disclaimer: I'm vegetarian with an egg allergy, so my access to the menu was pretty limited, and that's all I've got to go on for the review.  The food was decent, but struck me as a bit vinegar-heavy. The dishes were ordered to be shared, and of what was ordered at the table I had the Mushroom Ceviche, the Roasted Young Beets salad, and the Rainbow Cauliflower. I would probably have loved the flatbread and the tempura green beans, but both have egg in them, alas. (And then had to deal with delicious-looking green beans being dangled in front of me because the table ordered not one, but TWO orders of it. It's apparently quite good.) Of what I ordered, the Roasted Young Beets was my favorite, but was similar to roasted beet salads I've had elsewhere. The mushroom ceviche was nice, but a smidge more vinegar-laden than I would have liked, but then again, maybe that's a ceviche thing--I haven't had any previous experience with ceviche, so I had no idea what to expect going into that dish. The Rainbow Cauliflower was oddly and inexplicably vinegar-y tasting when it should have been more lemony, so I'm wondering if maybe having the ceviche where I could smell it was affecting my ability to truly taste it. The cauliflower was ultimately abandoned by the rest of the table in lieu of other things, so it kind of fell flat for us (I finished it anyway, though; I usually love cauliflower).  From what I remember of what the non-vegetarians ordered, they had the Cocoa Espresso NY Strip, the Bone-In Pork Belly, the Tempura Green Beans, the Baked Mac & Cheese, the Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto, and I believe an order of The Devil's Eggs. Of these, a second green beans was ordered and the mac & cheese and the risotto disappeared fairly quickly. I seem to recall a lot of anticipation for the pork belly that didn't quite appear to deliver, but I do believe the ones that had the deviled egg liked it. Again, I am not sure. They also got a Bourbon Fudge Brownie to share for dessert, which didn't go over well with the ones that don't appreciate salt in their sweets and weirded out Mr. Piano a little with the bacon ice cream. I'm mostly just mentioning this in case it's helpful; it doesn't make sense to work any of the stuff I couldn't try into my rating.  The service, however, is top notch! Our waitress Felicia was really friendly, great with making recommendations (including recommendations for my dietary restrictions & allergy), and seemed to really enjoy working there, which can be a real breath of fresh air :) She also had some fun recommendations for things to do or see around town, which was nice of her. The setting of the restaurant itself is pretty tastefully done and I like the decor--it's a cute place.  Overall, really awesome service, but they need more (and perhaps better) options for vegetarians/vegans, or they need to make the options that sound like they'd be vegetarian/vegan actually be so. I had previewed the menu before we came, and thought there was more I could eat, like the flatbread. Also, a good traditional tempura batter can easily be vegan, so there's really no reason to have people making sad eyes at crispy, delicious green beans that they can't eat, guys :( I'd probably be okay eating here again if I found myself in Vegas again with friends who wanted to go, but I'd have to have a snack first. Or hit up O-Face Donuts next door immediately afterwards (vegan donuts).

Q8VaKCFOwFACZlBXngHWzw.text: Carson Kitchen is one of the best tapas restaurants in Vegas. Always amazing. Try the mac n cheese and NY Steak. Won't regret it

OdvRQI_0gBy1C8LNW-qfWw.text: Great places for a group and drinks. Almost everything is made to share. Make a reservation if you can and trust the opinions of your waitresses!

ynhOLmX3SApAU_WbwZsO0A.text: I have had the pleasure of dining at Carson Kitchen on several occasions when visiting Las Vegas.  The atmosphere is very trendy and cool and the service has been great every visit.  The food is what sets this restaurant apart.  I absolutely love the creative ways they approach their menu.  The gyro tacos, veal meatballs and the FGT sliders are a personal favorite! Their cocktails and beer list are great and I absolutely love their roof top space for hanging out.  Anytime I get to Vegas, I always try to stop in at Carson Kitchen for its fabulous food, great location and yummy cocktails!

mFnY23CWjWbpFcGVrH8NgQ.text: Great find during our stay downtown Vegas we were referred to this place and thought we'd give it a try checked out on Yelp and everyone had positive things to say. Wife had turkey burger which was a bit spicy but very good, I had the chicken sandwich and both came with excellent tater tots. We sat at bar looking into kitchen and was amazed how well the staff works together and quite efficient. Their personalities and communication was great. Great staff. And with the kitchen view we got to see many great dishes go out. So we went back following day for lunch we had the lamb tacos, mushroom flatbread pizza, and the tempura green beans with an awesome sauce, and again very satisfied with everything and awesome staff next day to. Great to find a place like this, and everything that leaves the kitchen looks very appetizing.

MKpsEvi7yxzeBu2urSKDog.text: Went for dinner on the 31st, honestly the food is amazing, great steak, good Mac & cheese, the butter burger was amazing! The cocktails were so good too! The atmosphere and service...just everything was really good! The only complaint I have is most of the food is sold separately, which you can share the sides, but because of that the bill was pretty hefty...I'd say it's a bit overpriced. But if you have the money to spare it's a must try!

mGfyApJ7pynoupr982KMZw.text: UGH! We go here at 5- right when they open- the place is completely empty except for the excessive amount of staff all standing around having in appropriate conversations- we go to take our seat once the hostess finally greeted us and walked the three feet to the table and guess what? -- NO HIGH CHAIRS?!??! I asked the waitress to repeat it and she laughed. Like its  a joke that you expect my 16 month old to stay seated at a booth. I was shocked at her overall lack of care about the situation- she walked back to the hostess stand to begin laughing with her coworkers again- we left- and they didnt mind- don't worry owners- you can have your empty restaurant and rude staff- I took my $250 dinner tab elsewhere

P2DdEuWVAagAyjbh5Yd-3A.text: Really good. The burger and the spicy sloppy Joe were both excellent. The place has a nice vibe. It had a deck that wasn't open but looks like fun. Good value for the money.

dLScNIv0a3RS_qpc1bWgMA.text: This is the first restaurant I've reviewed in so long, but I had to because it was AMAZING. The service is perfect, they have a great selection of craft beers, and their food is perfect. We had the bacon jam with baguette slices, the gyro tacos, the turkey burger with mango chutney slaw, and the oxtail risotto. For dessert, we had the donut bread pudding. Seriously, the best of everything ever. If you're within 100 miles of this place you have to go. I split the bacon jam and gyro tacos with my fiance, and then had the turkey burger. I would say, if the staff is reading this, the only thing I would change is a different side dish on the turkey burger. The tater tots are "okay", but with everything else tasting so amazing there has to be something better. My suggestion would be sweet potato fries with honey to dip them in. Just my $.02 but otherwise sooo good!

LAAZ_LZOTofkkI9LrrnTAQ.text: Carson Kitchen is a gem! My favorite spot in DTLV - great atmosphere, creative menu and fabulous service! It is a must-do in Las Vegas!

9RNVrja9EktsqV2OyFmA5A.text: Firstly, food was amazing. We shared tempura green beans (which was the delicious vehicle to get the pepper jelly cream cheese in my mouth), bacon jam (I repeat: Bacon. Jam.), and the glazed donut bread pudding.  Secondly, the staff was great. Very friendly, and Chelsea knocked it out of the park with service.  Lastly, the restaurant is clean, beautiful, and you can tell it's ran well.  I'll definitely be back.

PzUG9eox4_0KjGEOr7Rovg.text: We enjoyed this place. Great food! We ordered 8 items and each one was very delicious. We loved the burnt ends, mac and cheese and steak. Cons no draft beers and small space so it's a little bit loud.

tztvUKkxNdpLfSl5a2ky6g.text: What a cute little place! Me and my husband were in town just for the day and wanted something different then the everyday overpriced restaurants on the strip. I'm so glad we found this place it was AMAZING! I'm a vegetarian and my husband is not and they had several items on the menu for both of us to enjoy. Will be back again!

1H5iaNgpa_o6e8ckwssn2Q.text: i never, ever, ever make reviews, but.... this S*** was good!!!!                                                              Bacon Jam, Gyro Taco, Jerk Turkey Burger

ICtvLMCBJmLg4fjZlxXH6Q.text: Really yummy- I have only gone once but really enjoyed it. The only thing is that it is on the pricer side but hey, you get what you pay for. Super cozy on the inside and the waiter got super personal with us and made us feel welcome and not just like a table he was serving. The food was amazing too.  A quick walk from Fremont Street but seriously so yummy, def stop by when you have the chance, and wear socks because they will be knocked off.

jBD4cYSTQDDKpM7kKK9a5w.text: Such a fantastic experience!! Very hip spot on Carson and LV Blvd. I came for my parents anniversary dinner. The place was packed! There were 7 of us and we were seated quickly upstairs on there rooftop patio. We ordered tons of things. Oxtail Risotto which was superb, blackened sea bass had lots of flavor and cooked perfect. Veal meatballs were delicious. They had a nice sauce and were served with peas. The tempura green beans were fabulous. The ribeye was interesting it was served with a cocoa sauce which went great with it. The falafel sliders was amazing! My favorite was the gyro tacos. They had so much flavor. Too bad you only get three of them. The service was great and prompt. The bring your check out in a book, which I thought was so cool. All in all wonderful experience! Highly recommend!

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon salad and oxtail risotto!

sSWEg9oIIiuRhmN7JlFYAQ.text: Definitely worth the trip off the beaten path. Sat on the rooftop patio, very romantic and relaxed but friendly service!  Shared a few appetizers and the New York Strip was fabulous. My only grievance is that it is a bit pricey but that absolutely won't stop me from visiting next time I'm in town!

ON5LwpXUynA4n0EfSIdPww.text: So. Good. We ordered the NY strip, tempura green beans, and oxtail risotto and it was all amazing and cooked perfectly. The hosts were super accommodating and made great recommendations. Would definitely recommend sitting at the bar for dinner to watch the chefs while you eat. Also, doughnut bread pudding.

-Tg2o5iumcsECjPNB2o8Lw.text: I hate to tell you how much I LOVE this little place. It is already too busy! But the truth is, this is one of our favorite places in Downtown, and maybe even LV! Shhhhh...Don't tell anybody! Just our little secret.  The food here is best shared, lots of delicious little plates of incredible tasty food. I have never ordered and not loved it. The menu changes frequently, but the gems seems to stay...like crispy chicken skins and local honey! Sliders of one meat or another, NY Strip. Really you cannot go wrong!!  The entire staff is amazing! You really feel their pride for the restaurant. We especially heart Dakota! He is a rock star to put up with the drunken lot I frequently bring in.  I could go on and on, but then you might actually want to go, and I will have to wait even longer for a table. So, just know that it is incredible, but don't feel you need to actually go try it yourself. Just kidding...kinda.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anticipation....

NMBi0fVwIP452J0mAryhTw.text: I really liked the feel of this place. It had that industrial feel yet it was 'warm'. I felt the 90's alternative rock playing fit really well into the ambiance. The server greeted us and explained how everything works.   Although this was more of a tapas, or small plate, type of place, we opted to go with a couple appetizers followed by entrees. We ordered the chicken skins, which was an interesting choice but highly recommended. I don't know what it was but I sneezed each time I took a bite. Nonetheless, I really enjoyed them! We also had the tempura green beans, which were really good with the jelly.  I opted for the osso buco, which was nothing special and it was really small. Everyone else had the filet and I think they won out.   I found the menu a bit limited but that isn't a bad thing as they do fewer thing better (in theory). The prices were pretty good considering where you are. It's a good place to socialize and recommended.

Xz7_zLZJsc62smV4qdyE7A.text: If I could give this place 6 stars I would!! Some of the most amazing flavors I've ever tasted.   You MUST, I say MUST, order the bacon jam with baked Brie served with toasted baguette slices. It's sweet and zesty, and most of all bacon-y!!! It was close to the best thing I've ever eaten.  This place is small and hip. Has great service and a great atmosphere. If you sit at the bar you can watch the chefs cook.  Our waiter mentioned to us that they will be changing their menu every 8 weeks; that statement will bring me back here next time I am in Vegas. I can't wait to try their new menu items.  Mmmmmm! GO HERE!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam and Baked Brie! Must order this!

5Zs-uDBuqQGajgBcB2hbqA.text: Fun trendy place with a variety of food for everyone. Service was great, prices were reasonable and our food was really good. I thought the burnt ends were too fatty, but the deviled eggs, sea bass and beet salad were outstanding. It was a nice change of pace to get out of the hotel and find a little hole in the wall off the beaten path. I highly recommend it and look forward to trying more of their menu items in the future.

LiNRFgB6nuwmWLx3gBjfuw.text: Everything was delicious! Great service, very cool place. The beet salad was light and fresh, exactly what we were craving. The caviar and pancetta was the perfect touch on the devil eggs, and the cauliflower dish was seasoned and cooked to perfection! We stopped on our drive to California, and didn't eat a whole meal. We will make it a point to have a full meal on our way back. I highly recommend the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caviar &#34;devil&#34; eggs with pancetta

_nsbIqbWvBwbERapjcoKUg.text: Stopped by Carson Kitchen on Thanksgiving Eve and was so glad that I did. We were a very hungry group of six, who did a quick Yelp search and ended up here. So glad we did. Located in Downtown Las Vegas, Carson Kitchen is a classy tapas style restaurant. It is very small and can get pretty loud.  Roman was our server and he was great! Whatever questions we asked about the menu or any unusual requests we made (truffle ketchup), he delivered. In fact, everyone working here was great. I saw a lot of customers waving goodbye as they left, which tells me that a lot of locals frequent this place.  Their mac n cheese is my absolute favorite!!!!! Burger was also very good.

SOk8N9pG8JK-4f9_AluWbg.text: Wonderful restaurant, love the decoration food is delicious and staff very friendly and good service.  Prices is a little bit expensive but it doesn't matter when you are having great food. Highly recommend

8R_Z8-3aNrr0NnHxRP3GaQ.text: For me and in all of my restaurant experiences, Carson Kitchen is perfect.  The atmosphere is spot-on; fun, interesting, engaging, and unique; the service was great and enjoyable; the opportunity to watch the kitchen adds some entertainment; and the food was nothing but outstanding.  When you add in the price being better than you'd expect for this experience, let alone for a high-end place, this is perfection.  When you experience yourself, check in with Matt. He makes the experience enjoyable and will be sure you are well taking care of.  Thank you for making your Buffalo Burger's lettuce wraps for us, Matt!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view of the kitchen while you eat.

9w3viujJmgBc6TIvONEfnA.text: The most unadorned business in Las Vegas. My hubby had the gyro tacos and I had the pig and fig.  Brilliant.

9yiwwDibpjBe8uEbC7K0KQ.text: A local friend recommended Carson Kitchen, and we're so glad we left The Strip to find this gem. It's just off Fremont Street and easy to find.   The food is delicious - they've got just the right mix of familiar comforts like Mac & cheese and deviled eggs, plus food with a twist like crispy chicken skins, black mussels and banoffee pie. We got there early on a Friday night to beat the crowd. Even when it got busy, our server, the staff and manager were great!

IVYCodbRLf-0JWgb1LJtew.text: I don't make it out to Downtown LV often, but that might have to change because of this place. I left here super full and satisfied. From the chicken skin dipped in honey to the tater tots that came with the short rib sliders, I can't really say anything disappointed me. We sat at the bar and our bartender was attentive the whole time and gave us amazing recommendations. It was a hot day and I wanted something refreshing and The Margarian hit the spot (Gin-based with cucumber soda). I'm glad she convinced us to get the donut bread pudding, too. Loved the music they were playing in here and the overall vibe of the place. Reminds me of San Francisco... without the long wait and paying $4/hour for parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib sliders with spicy tater tots

VoNwAp9_-Dx5vrs1rHICyA.text: I've been to Carson around 5 times now over the past 2 years and I'm still very much a fan.  It's one of my favorite spots in Vegas and where I take friends from out of town to get a taste of LV off the strip. I've sampled almost all of the small plates and a number of mains and sandwiches and I'm always pleased.  My favorites include the gyro tacos, chicken skins, veal meatballs, chicken sandwich, lamb chops and mac and cheese.   The drinks are on the pricey side and if we go alcohol free, we walk out feeling like it was a great deal. Otherwise, it does get more expensive, but still a good deal.  A group of six with drinks and it was in the mid $300s. Not bad for a great dining and sure to impress experience!

aliJklBclQ8Ce25XMEmxvQ.text: the food is good; however it is a limited menu with acquired tastes and rare substitutions. also it's a bit pricey for such a casual place

mJ0huIBV3EPuJg4WXpjnSA.text: Food was great. Had bacon jam (awesome, I highly recommend), short rib grilled cheese (very good), and BBQ burnt ends (also very good). It's a small setting with a "hipster" feel in a rough feeling area. While the food was great, the staff was, well.... we sat at a large counter near the kitchen. While it was interesting to see how the kitchen operated, the spiky-haired manager (I'm assuming, he seemed to think he ran things) kept getting into arguments with the female cook (who kept smiling and not telling him to go f himself). He dropped the f-bomb three times that I could hear. And being that we were sitting on the corner near their prep area, it was like he was standing at the counter with us the entire time we were there. Even apologized once and thanked for us putting up with him. That, coupled with the fact that one of the waitresses came over and reached for something in a storage compartment above my head, totally putting both her armpits in my face from six inches away, and the location make me give it 3 stars. Food is 5 star quality though.

3m9K0NNuFY6cYzNIpNjt2g.text: Amazing food and service! Went last Thursday and brought in our own bottle of wine. Told it was going to be hour wait but ended up being only 20 min. Sat at the community table and had a cute blonde with a great personality wait on us. I wish I could remember her name but you know who you are! Thanks for a great 1st time experience.

TfRG0M8k4K30SoAkOrYuHg.text: Carson Kitchen is AMAZING!!!!  Cool new spot downtown, great outdoor seating, awesome staff and the food is soooo good!!!!!  New fave!!!

ENk1O_8jhNIh5vbmwhz8Ag.text: My new favorite Vegas restaurant! Very original dishes. Get the bacon jam (I know, just trust me), Mac and cheese, and steaks d turkey burger. All fantastic. Will be back! The wait can be lengthy but it's well worth it.. Put your name down and walk the streets of old Vegas.

G_kIyDtKMzXjy74uAa4rgQ.text: Carson didn't disappoint nor excite us. First-off, all beers here are bottled (if this matters to you read-on; if not, what is wrong with you? :) Coming from San Diego, gastro pubs serving locally-sourced brews on-tap alongside locally sourced eats are everywhere. Carson's menu is begging for locally-sourced brews to accompany the menu's eclectic fare. As for the menu, the Jam/Brie is spot-on; the Fried Chicken Skins satisfied at '2-bites and done' (it's deep fried chicken skin and nothing else!) and the Butter Burger was above average. Blown away post-eats? Hardly. Would I return? Absolutely, to further sample the menu. Plus, LV is seriously lacking at eateries on this level of hip, urbane, fun fare. Felicia behind the bar took good care of us, too. She's personable, professional and exudes good energy. One or two other staffers (dudes in dated 70's and 80's rock tees) not so much ;) Hip is one thing; douche another. Lighten-up, guys, and engage your guests. 4-stars.

qt96nvzeVN7xGaZ5Dti-Fw.text: You know what I mean when you taste the first mouthful of food and you immediately know this place will be on your "come back" list?  This is one of those places.   I'm docking a star for service.  The food was awesome.  Tried the broccoli salad, bacon jam, butter burger, steak, and the bread pudding.    Broccoli salad - wonderful mix of sweet, sour, crunchy, and creamy.  Refreshing.  Burger and steak were cooked perfectly - medium rare, just the way we like.  (Medium rare meaning red in the middle, you have no idea how hard it is for people to get medium rare right).  Bacon jam was so smokey and slightly sweet - just wish they weren't so chintzy about the brie and bread.  I mean, 5 pieces of bread for all the jam??  Come on, now.   The interior is very industrial-y, raw material-y feeling.  Very unique.  We were catching Book of Mormon after dinner and let our bartender know.  We sat at the bar as there was no other seating when we arrived.  We let her know when we first sat down and she promised she would get us out of there in time.  We ordered everything up front (including dessert) but ended up waiting and waiting for the bread pudding after the meal.  We told her to cancel it and it ended up showing up right as we were leaving.  At this point we were already late so we each scarfed down a bite and ran out the door.  It also seemed more important to her to flirt with her fellow bartender than see if we needed anything.  We all wanted another round of drinks but could not get her attention.  By the time she noticed, we were done with our meal and it was a little late for another round.  Is it customary for bartenders to take away your glass when you still have at least two drinks left?  I felt like I still had a good amount of beverage left when the bartender tried to take away my glass.  Maybe it was our fault for catching a show after dinner but we thought an hour and a half would be sufficient.  Guess not.

idjRUQAPneSR-Rh8O-_xrQ.text: Super good!!!  The lamb gyro-tacos are amazing!  The service was wonderful and fun!  Nice atmosphere!

H_6HX4bDM2AXN5ARDu5z3w.text: Wow, such an amazing experience! The Bacon Jam with Brie was INCREDIBLE! Crunchy/crispy bacon and the melted brie in the cast iron dish served sizzling with the toast was just heavenly. My hubby loved his Boar Sloppy Joe with crispy shaved fennel and homemade tater tots. Our server Felicia was really sweet, attentive, and friendly. Can't wait to go back next time we're in Vegas.

c_6IBvGZZL5A-gs_LMJvWg.text: Carson Kitchen graciously donated a gift certificate as a silent auction item for a local non-profit, Safe Nest, that provides shelter and services to survivors of domestic abuse. I am so grateful for their generosity. And as for the food, this place is amazing! I went there with 3 girlfriends and we enjoyed ourselves so much. We started with the tempura green beans and the bacon jam. Both were divine. For our entrees, 2 had the NY strip which was cooked perfectly, 1 had the turkey burger, and another had the seared scallops. We also shared the baked mac and cheese, which was sinfully delicious. Then we indulged in sharing the glazed donut bread pudding, which was out of this world! And the service was swift and courteous. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed the meal and the overall experience! Can't wait to bring my husband here soon!

ibpKUHw_guyuF2YR9sUUew.text: Gyro taco, Mac and cheese, chicken skins and flat breads were on point! The food was amazing and service was great! Only problem was that the kitchen was outrageously long for food to come out, however Bianca our server was great and handled everything above and beyond! If you head out to Carson Kitchen, get Bianca she makes the experience!

5sq6z2ACv4y6F5jieEk_2g.text: I ordered the chicken skins, succotash, cauliflower, and beet/goat cheese salad. The star were the chicken skins. The succotash veggies were too undercooked for my taste. The cauliflower was seasoned perfectly and the fresh lemon accompanied the brightness of the cauliflower.  This cafe is on my list for my future Vegas trips.

-YBYt9oVuoPsaFCPGfNhAA.text: MUST MUST MUST EAT HERE!!!! Sooooooo freakin' good!! I just tried the chicken skin, meatballs, devil'd eggs and the BACON JAM baguette. I'm eating here every time in in Vegas now. I just asked the chef if there's anything close to the bacon jam over in LA. So good!

3ccaGLrTYUS9IdWrl6uJww.text: Went there tonight and I must say I have not had food this good in a very long time. Everything was full of flavor and different - not just the same old as usual restaurant. Not only that- but the service was incredible. Was a bit disappointed that they ran out of the shrimp, but what we did have was amazing. I'm pescatarian  and had the trout, beet salad, green beans and blue cheese and pear flatbread and it was all amazing. The skin on the trout was so crispy and the center cooked perfectly. I am super picky about fish as well. My husband loved his mooing burger and the chicken skins. People with us ordered medium burgers and the first time they came out extremely rare. We sent them back and had 3 different staff members come up and apologize. When the burgers came out again - in my opinion they were cooked perfectly medium but they still thought they were rare and 1 went back. Again the staff came and apologized and took both burgers off the check and gave us 3 free desserts. The banoffee pie was delicious! They went above and beyond despite me thinking the girl with us should have ordered her burger med-well. It was not the restaurants fault. By far the best meal I have had in Vegas. The service was great without being over the top. Will definitely go back next time I am in town.

DWz8faR5N-IGra82UemRNQ.text: I love Downtown Las Vegas, I live Downtown. I have heard good and bad about Carson Kitchen. I waited almost a year before i ate here...and I was incredibly disappointed. Waited forever to get a table, and then was disrespected by staff...  Honestly, the menu is so limited, as a lactose intolerant diner, i could barely find anything on the menu. When i did, it was so awful it was hard to swallow. Seriously i cannot recommend this place to annyone...which sucks because I love downtown, I have been here for 3 years, push downtown to naysayers...and this place just made me embarrassed. Im sorry. I love downtown, but i cannot put my money into this place.

Ej-w4biT0GIAK83qgxcLvw.text: Attempted to go to Carson Kitchen tonight and sit on the patio when I was told by the hostess it would be open at 730pm. Due to no patio seating we went elsewhere. As we walked by at 630pm the patio was open and full. Absolutely disappointing.

dXiCPdrHmb_imf8L89qGHw.text: As a "foodie," I'd say the food here is good.  The staff was friendly but the seating was odd.  The only reason Carson's doesn't get 5 stars from me is because ALL of our food came out at different times, including my friend's a la carte veggies she ordered with her fish.  The server told us that everything comes comes out when ready and we should plan to share as it does.  I thought this odd but by then we were committed. It was her cauliflower, her fish, her husband's sandwich and some time later my turkey burger. I watched them eat most of their food and then they got to watch me eat mine (we did share some, but we wanted what we wanted).  So, I don't know if this is the general practice there or we just look like a bunch of schmucks but Carson's, your kitchen really ought to figure out how to time it so food is ready together.  Every other restaurant and home kitchens can do it, so can you.  Seriously.

k8QTVkizxaOSkTzFQAiENA.text: Wonderful place, wonderful food. Go a bit earlier than later as popular items go quickly. Delish desserts.

buM_F76xc_x-H7nxOn--Dw.text: Fantastic! Tried the Mac & Cheese, Bacon Jam (needed a little more brie), & Sloppy Joe...all delicious!!

euPEOMRs-SyojnUu4QHpaA.text: I was excited to try a new spot downtown.  I love being downtown.  I went there with 2 girlfriends to catch up.  We had a couple of drinks and appetizers.  We were approached by the manager - telling us that we basically had to leave because he needed our seats for a party.  First - how rude!!!  He had the nerve to be mad us when he is trying to make us leave.  To comp drinks to soothe things over was a slap in the face as we still had no where to sit to enjoy them.  The unfortunate thing is - the food was great, the setting was very nice.  I will never be back - I will let all my friends know the experience I had there.  I have never in my life been asked to leave.    What a buzz kill!!!!!

yrEcfhk-qyfMTlqA7Kv6Hw.text: Amazing find! This is a must try when you are in Vegas. 1 street off of Fremont ave in a cool old hotel. We were able to sit outside on the deck and enjoyed lovely service and fantastic food. Our server was knowledgeable and engaged. We had great cocktails. The dishes are designed to share and all of it was delicious.  I can't wait to go back. The prices are great value for the quality.

LUKW4vzYqS9CVN_76Gj-jQ.text: Talk about the thriving downtown culinary scene. It rare that go downtown mostly cause going anywhere near casino on my days off flat out avoid. I work in the casino industry. I must applaud the effort cause downtown its come long long way!!! Especially Fremont street with the experience but more with all bars at one end and then all these small restaurant. To be clear Carson Kitchen not located on Fremont but Carson Street is literally minutes off it. Like anything downtown parking not the most ideal situation but have all the hotels that can park at or street parking. Carson Kitchen the best idea is the Fremont Experience parking garage literally right there or Downtown Grand just accross the street.   I was pretty psyched about checking out Carson Kitchen for the first time. The best part was my cousin visiting with her family from the 808. She an avid yelper so I knew it was ONNN came first timers. It was for all of us. Talk about the BENEFITS of party of six or more. The only time take reservation if you have party of six or more. I went with my brother family my two nieces, my cousin her family niece and nephew, and then there me. So talk about spread of food. We pretty much ordered every appetizer on the menu. Literally had the Bacon Jam, Devils Eggs, Crispy Chicken Skins, Gyro Tacos, Meatballs, Scallops, some kind of popcorn shrimp, and Thai BBQ Pizza.    Bacon Jam was my favorite appetizer! The bacon jam talk about divine spread that was not only fabulous on the grilled believe baguette sliced bread. The charcoal mark the crispy bread then nice spread of not only bacon (the nice part you could see pieces of bacon rather then I all grounded or cooked out puree), caramelized onions, and nice sweetness like any jam. Devine. Definitely you can taste the hint of bacon grease in the jam also! It perfect for the kids. Or on this night my nieces and nephews was enjoying the bread by itself.   The Crispy Chicken Skin was the second winnah for me. It tastes like fried pork grinds chips you see in bags. I know not PORK but the texture similar and something that think of if never had crispy chicken skin. I loved it by itself. They have almost like sweet and sour dipping sauce that comes with it. I like the whole tiny fry basket for presentation. Truthfully came to presentation you can clearly see the Kerry Simon style. High end food. They incorporate unique severing dishes. The devil eggs presented on wine bottle cut in half.   The other appetizers it had no WoW factor in any of them. The Devils Eggs like any other Devils Egg. It looks great but only thing that makes it stand out is the caviar on top. It such small amount nothing rave about. The Gyro that was pretty solid. I think you get only two per order but since we had big party ordered two orders. So had four on one plate. The grilled dough they use as shells are nice crispy and hot. The filling very generous, the lamb real tasty cooking spot on, the tzatziki, cucumber, and tomato. All together makes for hearty taco! Just warning so much stuff that it drips with every bite!!! The Meatball by itself was ordinary but the sherry foie gras cream sauce now that was amazing. I could see that sauce on pasta dish would die for. The two together for me just never worked. The Scallops was seared to perfection just between the sauce and the starch nothing exciting. So much going on forgot the components where just blah. The pizza was ok but so many other good things pizza last thing need to try at Carson. My opinion.   I ordered the Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto. I really enjoyed. It not very often you see Black Rice on any menu. The combination of Oxtail Risotto sounded too good not to pass up. It had interest contrast with different texture rices. Oxtail made it nice and hearty. I think my brother had perfect analogy almost like hearty jook. The rice is not going be al dente since two different types. No doubt perfect dish on cold Vegas day and pretty filling dish. My cousins dishes looked pretty good. I had no room after all the apps tried more food.   The service was spot on fabulous. The whole staff on on it from the minute we sat down. I found great is when you get the bill they give you book. I know right like "What the Hell??". Guess you can sign it if you want. All the kids signed it. I thought that was cool.   The interior is very modern with community tables and upstairs outdoor patio area.   No doubt Carson Kitchen place highly recommend if looking for place eat downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Rice and Oxtail Rissoto
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro Tacos
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Skin

QP-zPHhHgAKFs4kUXzK5CA.text: This is the type of restaurant I live for. Local business and unique twists on classic food. You can taste the thought and love that is put into their original cocktails. I recommend going with a small group and ordering family style. That way everyone can try a bit of everything. Since the restaurant is small, you may have to wait a little for a table, however, there is a nice patio out back. I recommend grabbing a cocktail from the bar and relaxing back there until your table is ready. If you are lucky and it's chilly outside you can sit by the fire pit and get toasty.

hxv2QgY6aGdszC1hAOs2fg.text: I will definitely return here. The location was clean, our waitress was sweet & attentive, and the food was delicious! We ordered the bbq burnt ends, chicken sandwich, and the grilled cheese.

D8eTK-Nvzjad3kezNQFdzw.text: Cool spot with great food!  We came around 4pm on a Sunday for a very late lunch and were sat immediately but the place was almost full. It's tiny and very cozy. We were sat overlooking the kitchen in hightop's that were very comfy and I immediately loved everything because watching the magic happen is always a good thing in my book. The chefs were hot so that helps too. Nothing like tatted men who know how to cook!   The food was really good. Started with the devil eggs that were creamy and salty from the caviar & pancetta. Next came the sizzling bacon jam with Brie which was so sweet that I had to keep drinking my water. The finale was the butter burger and anything with the word "butter" in it can't go wrong. This burger is very simple with traditional toppings but tasted amazing. On the side came spicy tots that were the perfect amount of hot. All in all the food was great and we wanted to try everything on the menu so with that said we can't wait to go back.   The atmosphere is very casual with a very cool vibe. The staff is very friendly and we loved all the interesting people around us who made the experience.   If you're not a downtown person you are missing out big time! You can't get moments like this on the strip. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dr.Better &amp; Hefeweizen
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter burger
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little sumpin ale

6z8mQDSgP751nuiNDfrGdw.text: Just visited Carson Kitchen couple weeks ago.  Service and food were both excellent.  Bacon jam - jam is too strong, can't really taste the bacon.  I wish that there is more cheese and more bread. Crispy chicken skin - excellent.  Great with the honey dipping.   Devil's egg - average.  We order it because a lot of yelper recommended it but it's just like other devil's egg.  Maybe I was expecting too much. NY Strip - excellent.  Meat is soft.  Very juicy.  Very tasty. Ancient grain greek (salad) - Good. Black rice & ox tail Risotto - Good.  But the taste is very subtle.  I wish for a stronger taste. Mac-Cheese - Good, but it's too expensive for what it is. Pear & Bleu flatbread - love it.    If I visit Carson Kitchen again, I will get chicken skin, NY strip, flatbread and a different salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pear &amp; Bleu Flat Bread
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac-Cheese

p8uJKXRpnNzndkqZQ46qrQ.text: Super delicious!!! Not great if you're in a hurry but the food is absolutely amazing.

p-bvsu8IcYlqvLEaViMiXQ.text: Friends recommended this place and honestly it was a hidden gem! Can't wait to take other friends here

hSCscEMib0BL3I-Y4dlyaw.text: So glad we found this restaurant tucked away a few blocks from Freemont! If you're downtown, don't miss Carson Kitchen! Even if you're not downtown, make a trip over here. It's small and casual - the type of place locals might want to keep to themselves and get away from the hustle and bustle of the touristy places. The staff was very knowledgeable and provided great service. The food was delicious - meant for sharing amongst the table. My teens said the mac n cheese was life changing...the best they ever had!

4IUV5a0yWU-PkjFhN5YWFw.text: Carson Kitchen is the BOMBdotCom (for the most part - a few dishes fell flat and the service was alright, not bad, not amazing). After being bookmarked and finding myself downtown with my family, I suggested this place.  We arrived on a Friday at 5 PM and the place was relatively empty. The joint is small. Maybe 30-40 people can dine here at most. Several 4 tops and two large bar-ish tables. They're neat the bar, high top, and large parties or 3 pairs of dining couples are seated here.  On to the important stuff. The food!  Bacon Jam is the jam! A sweet, tangy, and mildly spicy BBQ bacon jam is delivered to your table, bubbling, and topped with Brie. It's served with crunchy garlicky grilled bread. If you order one thing here... MAKE IT THIS!  Jalapeno Poppers were meh. It is what it is. Not bad, not memorable.   Pork Osso Buco. Succulent, flavor-able, fall of the bone tender. We ate this dish is two seconds. It was mouth sex.  MUST ORDER!  Broccoli Crunch: a light, fresh, crunchy, slightly sweet dish. The craisins and sunflower seeds kick this up a notch. A great side dish.  Pork Belly Carbonara was pretty bland as well. My mother thought the fried egg on top was cheese and got yolk everywhere.  That's what is memorable about this dish.  Gyro Tacos were flavorful and complex. They were just a bit dry. Tasty, but needing wetness.  Donought Bread Pudding was amazing. The donuts come from their neighbor O Face Donuts! Love learning about these little slices of community happening in Vegas (cause it's RARE - like Violet Eyes).  Carson Kitchen delivers. It's hit or miss and the offerings seem to change. It's hard to find as there isn't a street sign so GPS!!! Parking is on the street or in one of the nearby garages. I can't wait to go back!
