D8ftKIMK_tSA7LMZV3gKUQ.text: If you come to Ls Vegas and you don't eat here then you are missing out.   We sat by the kitchen. The staff are incredibly friendly - and most importantly, HAPPY! They're making good, honest food with great quality ingredients.   My dad and I shared chicken skins, gyro tacos, a watermelon feta salad and a donut bread pudding. If we had more stomachs, we would have eaten the whole menu.   The vibe is super laid-back, and the entire experience made us feel right at home miles away from where we live.   10/10, 5 stars, 100%, A+... would live here if possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon salad, gyro taco, kitchen side view

vl4C7_F_bx9xTfykbGErUg.text: Heard many great things about Carson Kitchen and decided to try it out.  The food is alright, but most of it is fatty/savory.  There needs to be a better balance as far as flavors. Street parking is metered and isn't too far and shouldn't be hard to find (depending on the day and time).  No issues with service, but the food isn't really memorable.

P-wsF8AJaDTg4SntWF5iMg.text: Came here again earlier this week because my boyfriend has never been.   We ordered the jalapeno poppers first which were unbelievably aaammazing. Best jalapeno poppers I have ever ate. They outside was soo crispy fill with cheese and meat. Not too spicy but just the right amount of spice. We then ordered the buffalo chicken flat bread which we watched them make right in front of us since we sat at the bar. The chicken was soo good the flat bread was nice and crispy with a good crunch. My boyfriend ordered the Sunday Secret Chicken I think. It was a burger with a good hunk of crispy chicken. The spicy tater tots they serve with it was like amazing.  I was craving for some desert and ordered the Donut Bread Pudding, and my goodness was that heaven in your mouth. They get the donut from the donut place next door. PLEASE PLEASE get the donut bread pudding its soo good.   Only my 2nd visit to Carson Kitchen, I will always come back. They have really good food and the location is just in Downtown. Cant go wrong with that.

chKGHHVqg1eGxzWBpOI7hw.text: This is an amazing restaurant. The steak was so delicious, literally melts in your mouth. The corn omg what can I say was amazing and the Mac n cheese as well. Apparently our eyes were bigger than our tummys we should have just gotten one of each lol believe it or not one corn and one mac n cheese would be good for three people

_Ktc4sUngy-_NBwDj1DFEg.text: Carson Kitchen has TAKE OUT. Great news for my family and our stomachs.  My phone call was well received and the order was taken promptly. Seared Scallops (mango habanero buerre blanc), Cocoa Espresso NY Strip Steak (medium rare), Chicken Thighs (with citrus chimichurri tastes great on the Tempura Green Beans), tator tots, Tempura Green Beans and Short Rib Stroganoff.  The portions are a la carte leaving you space to sample many flavors. These item fed four people are we were all fully satisfied.  The service was cheerful and helpful Matt, the General Manager, ensured our order was well packed and we were completely taken care of from entrance to exit.  I look forward to outdoor seating on top of the roof and savoring more flavors like the Rainbow Cauliflower and "Devils" Eggs.  Thank you for treating us to tonight with dinner to go and friendly, kind service.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sodas with no HFCS and GMO free. Plus, caffeine free. Natural ingredients. Delicious.

Cw4Jnl7xuBcwbuATICNY6w.text: Delicious!  This place was recommended by a local chef and didn't disappoint, loved the short rib grilled cheese and grilled artichoke!  Wish this place was in San Diego.

K9Q_Jrrn8GlmgfE1j57ACg.text: Came in on 4th of July to have some pre bbq lunch. Sat near the kitchen so I could interact with the staff since I was dining solo. Not only was the food beautiful but the guys(Taylor and  Brandon) weren't bad to look at either! Like cool glasses of water on a hot day, very refreshing!. Nicole and Eugenia brought me some amazing fried chicken skins, devil's eggs, and rainbow cauliflower. Love the laid back feel and attentiveness here, downtown gem!

Pi9g8RlhEaCmlRbMp1Y4fg.text: This is a farm to table hipster place.  It's good but different.  The tomato bisque is really spicy.   The New York Strip is good but It had poor quality marveling and I had to cut around the fatty structures.  You would only know what I'm talking about if you are serious about steak.  But it is only $19 and not $50 so I can't be too picky.  It was great for the price.

4m-0j3paVxoRJF6MfRBgPQ.text: So good we came back! Out of 3800 restaurants in Vegas, of which I'm sure I've sampled a hundred, this is hands down a great culinary experience!  Everything we had was unbelievable  Deviled Eggs sprinkled w/caviar; Burnt Ends w homemade Tumeric Pickles, Mac & Cheese; gyros tacos; Butter Burger (med rare); cocoa-espresso NY Strip--mmmmm all small plates so you can share. Decent Beer & Wine list, a dozen fun cocktails compliment the meal

8EwnGFO57i9CSXhEnWmBsQ.text: I wanted to like this place based off of their menu but their seating arrangements and lack of hospitality was thoroughly disappointing.  Tonight a friend of mine suggested we eat here, I've never been.  We arrive and spoke with the hostess.  She tells us for a table of 3 it'll be a 30 minute wait so we went and grabbed a drink at the bar.  As we drank we reviewed the menu.  I hadn't eaten all day and was starving so I've already pre selected several dishes I wanted to try myself.  I had about two appetizers 2 entries and few sides that I wanted to try, plus wine (which I was already having a glass of)  just on my own accord not counting my friend and the rest of our party.  After about 30 minutes or so, the hostess comes back and asks us when the rest of our party would arrive, we said in a few minutes they're running late.  She says "if your party isn't here we cannot seat you, because we have a full house."  Even though 1. That disclaimer was not mentioned during the initial waiting period, and 2. Our party was legitimately running late.  Mind you I suggested that since our party is running late.  I will order for 4 so we'd make it worth their time.  When clearly myself alone was already tentatively at over $150 dollar bill.  I understand turning tables quickly, I also understand milking a cash cow as is.  If Ive already suggested ordering for four which means we would've cleared a 200 dollar bill, and had my friend and I only had two in our party but ordered for 4 it's a win win.  They've gotten their money and we would've gotten our food, and as soon as the rest of my party arrived the bill would've doubled, because like myself my friends and I are food fanatics.  The hostess was completely unapologetic for her lack of the disclaimer which still annoys me.  Had she mentioned the fact that our entire party needed to be present obviously we would've coordinated better and had everybody present and not have wasted an entire 30-40 MINUTES, waiting for a BS excuse at the END of our wait time!  It was a bullshit move and I took my money somewhere else.  Despite what looked like an appetizing menu, I won't come back to a place that refuses to serve people because they can't get their seating figured out.

98ct_Sic7KAo0aq3c3-BpQ.text: The place is small seating is a hard stool lol...the gyro tacos was ok at best ...small portions and over priced. The burger was pretty good and the tater tots was the best thing with a little bit of spice on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OmBs2DB0EuzxJWeFDHaCJw.text: The food was so good. I don't think you can go wrong ordering anything on the menu. Note: They serve "family style" so all the dishes are served as they are finished and designed to share. We started with the deviled eggs, which came topped with bacon and eggs (caviar). Super tasty. We also go the pear salad, it was fresh and well proportioned. The pork chop was the star. It had this amazing apple puree and plum chutney. It was cooked to perfection. Dessert was the show stopper. Like, the fat lady was singing, game over. A doughnut made into bread pudding. It was better than it sounds, and it sounds so good I'm drooling as I'm typing.  This joint is hip, trendy, and just a short walk from Fremont street. Go there.

rfEajH3867rRf-Qa_Vn5eQ.text: The Mac & Cheese literally made me want to cry. It is the ultimate comfort food. Big Love!

4Q9ppCe96Q5fzNxq--hA7A.text: OMG.....having dinner here tonight with my honey and I can't come up with adequate words to describe how amazing the food is and the best news of the night they tell us they are opening a location in Salt Lake City soon. I WILL live there.!!!!

OKV-ec-DN1qRmIl-sfVZyw.text: Tweaked  takes on American classics: fun, busy kitchen . Watch them work  from Chef's bar. Shareable small plates make for a great night out with friends.

Hg5lGgwTlS3Ba3zTRUvtgg.text: Food is delicious, location is great. Outdoor aesthetic is cute and all, the thing that really didn't leave a good taste in my mouth was the pretentious waiter we had. Now I'm not going to say who it was,  but I don't appreciate being interrupted in the middle of my order and being told "Oh WE don't serve that here". Otherwise, everything else was okay.

5GrSV26HzDTnwBhJ-Ubs7g.text: The flatbread, killer shrimp, and chicken skins are my favorites. The veal meatball with the sour cream taste wasn't what I was expecting. cCGlpuOjIRXM803kRkgSLg.text: HOLY MACARONI!  I love their mac and cheese!!!! So. Good. This place has a really cool vibe. I came here with a group of 3 for a late dinner. Interestingly they seated us at the other half of the table that another party of 3 was using. It was super chill. This place has a very laid back vibe, I'm assuming they always sit people at tables communally because there weren't a lot of tables but they are pretty long. It's kind of upscale and dress is very casual. The food is a bit pricey, but it's family style, so you can share everything. I didn't think the flatbread with bacon jam and cheese was that good. I would've preferred more cheese to be available. The beers are NOT ON TAP. You will receive a can and a glass, so expect some cool hip beers, but not poured from a tap. Still great vibe, I think they also have a patio. They had an indian fusion flatbread (looks like a pizza). The flavor was too light for my preference. The steak was GREAT! paid parking lot across the street and some limited street parking.

MaiM-_GtxuPpWTYUtWhFgA.text: This review is long overdue. This is one place that I go to every time I visit Las Vegas. I could use adjectives like 'wonderful' and 'amazing', but these do not describe how awesome the food is. I've tried several dishes that I would normally shy away from, but every single one has been fantastic.    My last visit (March 2018) we sat at the bar in front of the chefs and right next to the pickup area for the waiters. Everyone was attentive and truly concerned about the overall experience. They gave us recommendations on food and drinks, all of which were good. We spent the entire night talking with Ethan and learning the history behind the restaurant. Places like this and restauranteurs like Cory are why "eating out" is not just a meal but experiences and memories I cherish.   Can't wait for the expansion to Atlanta! A two hour flight from Miami means I can enjoy this more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The remnants . Couldn&#39;t finish everything, sadly.

UdJxeTM7aipqhLIUI9diTw.text: I've eaten here many times. Came in here for drinks and were seated upstairs. I asked our server if the artichoke was vegan, she said yes. I asked again when I ordered, she said yes. When I asked for a second helping of it (because it was so good), I confirmed that once again it was vegan.  Tipped her well, everything was fine. The next day I find out it wasn't vegan. I wrote a very normal, not even 1 star review stating that although this place is a downtown favorite, I was served non-vegan food when I asked if it was vegan.  Owner messaged me and went on a complete psychopathic tirade. All his servers did was mess up - I was a server downtown before and I understand people aren't perfect. He was fixated on that I knew one of the servers who happened to have a sister who shared the physical description of her - or something. I'm still not quite entirely sure. It sounds like his server said we all knew her and were "out to get her", to save her skin when she messed up.  He posted a comment below, saying we went on Saturday (we went on Friday), we didn't tip well (I have my receipt), and that we were being rude to the servers we don't know, and that we were lying. I told him to please feel free to look at security cameras.   He has now mentioned our names in public, threatened to sue me and reach out to my place of work, stalked my Yelp reviews for reviews I made with friends who had eaten dishes or when I was not previously vegan. In a long string of private messages, he has accused me or so many things. It's rather bizarre, and WTF-worthy. Dude, your servers just messed up. Should've apologized nicely, asked me to take it down. call it a day. Would've been very disappointing for someone with severe dairy allergies or someone who had been vegan for much longer than I have to have to go through with this.  I also know I'm not the only person who has received strange and terrible customer service here. :)

PU0Vle4wpfLvZNWnA-axYQ.text: Starting with the hostess. She's so rude. Little Asian girl. Lots of tables available but they keep the wait going. Food is average at best. Regret coming to downtown Vegas every time.

WcjOahE2DRl6cY3aiUWXNA.text: Every time I come to Vegas I make sure to try a number of new restaurants; however, I also make sure to pencil in a trip here.   Amazing cocktails, service and mind blowing food keep me coming back. I recommend ordering a number of dishes to share with the group. The deviled eggs with caviar and bacon are an absolute must. I also love the bacon/Brie jam and veal meatballs.   Depending on when you go there may be a wait but you can leave your phone number and they'll call or text if you want to kill time at a nearby casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L3T6Bq5jt9D-9DYbcHBOQw.text: We were looking for someplace to eat while visiting Freemont Street, and found Carson Kitchen by chance after searching google.   A short walk from the Main Street has us slightly worried we were lost. But once we found the restaurant we were relieved to see it looked like a great find.   We were seated at the bar in front of the appetizer prep station. Staff were all really friendly and attentive to our needs. The style of serving is more of a social, sharing type experience, which we loved but may not be for everyone.   Bacon Jam = life changer. Get it. You won't regret it. Steak was amazing as well. I honestly don't think I saw a single item that left the kitchen that looked anything short of amazing. We'll be back for sure.

mdfG6ssJnSxjMXnUOkBRfg.text: A friend and colleague brought me here for dinner when we were in Vegas fro NAB.  He preps me by telling me this is one of his favorite, chill places in the Fremont District...the food and drinks are great, but that we can expect to wait for a while.  As promised, we walk in and the super-friendly hostess tells us there's about an hour wait, and then invites us to grab a drink from the bar and chill in their outdoor patio.  We opt to walk down the street and grab a drink at another hip spot, so we put our name on the list.  When we get back, there's some lady going absolutely nuclear on the staff at the front door.  She's screaming so loud, she's just about frothing at the mouth and no one can really tell what she's pissed off about.  What was remarkable was that the manager and the hostess were so kind and patient with her...and even though they were trying to settle her down, she still stormed out yelling about how she'll never set foot in there again (Thank God! lol!).  The manager seats us at the counter in front of their huge, beautiful open kitchen (at our request), and apologize profusely for the scene.  He then calls out to the chef to serve us some tasters and small plates from the kitchen, on the house, by way of apology.  We explain that's not necessary...but he insists (super classy!!).    We then order a couple of first-rate drinks from the bar and spend the next two and a half hours on a delicious journey of culinary greatness!!  Seriously, one of the best, most fun meals I've had in a long time.  Once she realized how into the experience we are, the chef keeps dropping us tasty morsels to try...deep friend chicken skins that were perfectly crispy, salty, oily yumminess...cauliflower bites that were at the same time light and healthy & rich and sinful (how do you do that?!?  Seriously).  Plate after plate of mind blown, tongue tickling satisfaction!!  So yeah...Carson Kitchen gets one of my highest recommendations!!  When you come, expect three things...food that will amaze and surprise, perfect drinks, and a staff that will treat you like instant friends!!  Just know that there's going to be a wait.  And treat the staff kindly.  Don't be that lady...ever.  Just don't!!

VA_9gQ-lBaX394YSPG_aQA.text: Party of 2 adults and 1 child, came on a Friday afternoon. We were seated promptly. Only about half crowded downstairs and upstairs patio was closed.   If I could give 2.5 stars overall I would. Service was ok. Food was ok. Nothing new or interesting.   Server asked if we wanted all the food items to come out as they are ready or altogether. We requested the deviled eggs as an appetizer first and everything else to come together afterwards. We got the deviled eggs first and quickly, but then my husband got his sandwich and probably 12-15 min later I got my burger (was sharing with my toddler since there's no kids menu). He really had to dawdle to keep from eating his whole sandwich while me and my son waited for our burger.   Deviled eggs were good and I would order again.  Then burger came and cheese wasn't melted, not even a tiny bit. If I had known that cold cheese was going to come on it I wouldn't have ordered it. Burger was just ok. Nothing great, In-N-Out makes a more flavorful burger.  My husband liked his chicken sandwich. He just wishes he didn't have to dawdle while eating it. Since two hungry people sat staring across from him. Tater tots were good but nothing special. Mac n cheese was very good, smooth, perfect amount of bite. Portions were good.   I really don't get the "mind blowing" reviews. Maybe it's because we live in San Diego and this menu has been done long ago. The atmosphere is decent, nothing outstanding. Very clean. The bill coming in a book is nothing special it was a trend years ago in California. If you're hungry and in the area go ahead and eat here. But don't go out of your way to come here on a weekday. Save your time and dine elsewhere IMO.

IoWSTgwQLa5srJyOU8K4eQ.text: Was in Vegas for a visit and I ended up finding this place. I would go back to Vegas just to eat here. Very delicious.

z8ujBpBXNNZZKIKb_vaPgA.text: We tried all the starters from the menu. Couldn't resist! All of them were at the least good, some were out of this world. Don't miss out on the Bacon jam /Deviled eggs /Pork belly. For mains, flatbread mushroom was highly recommended but it was ok compared to the butter burger or the pork sirloins. But these, inspite of being so good, fell flat infront of the Blackened catfish. The service was super quick as well. One of the best places I've been to!!!!

wuhZMB_D1BPixwaCg11UFA.text: The menu sounded amazing. Lots of interesting American food that is trendy and very friendly service.  Lots of things are spicy on the menu and not all are labelled as such. I really like spicy but my mom is a wimp so that put a hitch in the bacon jam. It was yummy for sure and very rich with all that bacon but spicy so she couldn't eat it. The description had nothing about that.  The beet salad was really yummy! Goat cheese, pistachios, golden wand red beets. Yum!  We also got the friend green tomatoes with lump crab. It just didn't have a lot of flavour and had a ton of breading.  Our server, although very efficient and sweet wasn't the most helpful with the cocktail menu. I wanted something strong and not too sweet and Towns End with whiskey and a sweet liquor was really not what I was looking for. The honey bee one sounded amazing. I should have stuck with my first thought.  It's nice that it's away from all the traffic and healthy option exist but I wouldn't rush back

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktails

nO0vffOyog-RwAeJ3kvzKQ.text: Just off Fremont St (on Carson, near 6th) in downtown Vegas.    Suzanne, the manager, seated us quickly and with a smile.  (We loved the larger tables allowing conversation with people we didn't know; great vibe.)  Stacie waited on us and was AWESOME.  I requested an old fashioned with Bullit, which was FABULOUS; bartender NAILED it.    On to the food.  Deviled eggs with pancetta and caviar?  EXCELLENT.  Killer Shrimp?  SUPERB way to describe the sauce and crunch!  Veal meatballs with a sherry fois gras cream?  AMAZING!  suzanne asked us to try the bacon jam, and we regretted not ordering one!  This place ROCKS tapas!  We finished with a TOGO order of the glazed donut bread pudding, which was DECADENT and still warm when we got back to the Bellagio.  Overall bill?  Less than $100!!  In any other restaurant on the strip, this would have been 3 times that!!  We WILL plan to try one of the other restaurants they are opening.  Clearly the management and staff are part of a new "food revolution".  We're with you!  THANK YOU!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer shrimp!  Yes!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish deviled eggs.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A sampling of the bacon jam with Brie (heated and served with toasted baguette).

CXbp2LQ4UniZFjl6gxN-2Q.text: The Strip has its big name restaurants, but I feel the REAL culinary talent and passion is on Downtown Las Vegas.  We dined at Carson Kitchen for lunch this past Saturday. It is in a great spot because it is about 3 blocks from the Golden Nugget where we were staying. Although, in 104 degree heat, 3 blocks feel like three miles. Also, there is a ridiculous amount of construction going on in the neighbored so it makes the hike to Carson Kitchen a little more interesting.   Carson Kitchen sits on a rather obscure corner on roughly 6th and Carson. Next door to Donut Bar. There is no sign on the side of the building. No flashing lights or showgirl pointing the way. Just large windows with smoked glass etched with Carson Kitchen on them. When you walk in, you first notice how small the place actually is. The dining room is attached to the open kitchen and the bar area sits off by itself on the other end of the dining room. The decor is very industrial with some communal tables and counter seating.  The menu at Carson Kitchen is very simple in my view. Jason, our server, helped us make some choices. We chose items from the Social Plates and Farm & Garden parts of the menu. We started out with the Devil's Eggs. They were deviled eggs topped with crispy pancetta and caviar. When you bite into them, you get the salty burst of flavor from the caviar and the crispy texture from the pancetta. Next we had the pork belly with buffalo bleu beurre blanc. The pork belly was perfectly cooked and the beurre blanc gave it a little kick. We then had the Fried Green Tomatoes topped with lump crab ravigote(almost like a Cole slaw, but with finely shredded crab meat.) We ended our meal with the veal meatballs topped with a sherry foie gras cream. Talk about rich! However, the best dish was the Fried Green Tomatoes.   Carson Kitchen also has a good craft cocktail menu. I opted to try the Pretty Rye for the Chi Guy. It is made up of George Dickel Rye, orgeat syrup, velvet falernum, fresh lime, mint. It was refreshing and very smooth drink. You could easily drink several of them and not feel anything until you tried to walk away.  Next time you are in Las Vegas, get off the strip and head downtown to where the real culinary passion is in Vegas. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal meatballs with sherry foie gras cream.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes with lump crab ravigote.

Rfz7cnEUm8iHlggdZY6IAw.text: This is mine & my husbands third time here and let me tell you... it never disappoints.  We are a creature of habit & have always ordered the same thing. But... when you find perfection, it's hard to switch it up.  MUST HAVE- Fried chicken skin. Oh my goodness these are heavenly. They come with a honey dipping sauce. The dish is frustrating, but keeps you from over saucing, if that's even a thing.  Deviled eggs... again, PERFECTION!!! Bacon jam is delicious with the brie cheese. Mmmm   And we get the Butter burger... oh my. Juicy, and PACKED with flavor with a side of tots. I recommend asking for the spicy pickle sauce to dip the tots.   The ONLY thing I dont like about this place is sitting at the bar, both my knees have bruises. There isnt any leg room and you're forced to smash your knees, which also sucked for my husband because he is an amputee.   Definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled egga

O3owop9hFqdwPoRfxpwFkQ.text: I have been to Carson Kitchen several times. Five of us gathered to share plates and taste the items on the new summer menu--a menu composed of the most ordered items at Carson Kitchen during its five years.  The restaurant recently marked its 5th year in business.  Items shared:  Crispy chicken skins and smoked honey Wok charred edamame with ginger salt, togarashi Fried green tomatoes with lump crab ravigote Watermelon and feta with cucumber, white balsamic Blackened catfish with spring pea slaw Green, eggs, & ham flatbread with pistou, smoked mozz, tasso Broccoli crunch with green goddess, sunflower & pumpkin seeds Young beets with pistachio, red & green grape, goat cheese Wild mushroom flatbread with caramelized onion, bleu cheese Wild boar sloppy Joe with crispy fennel, orange aioli Chicken thighs with Alabama white barbecue Pork tenderloin with jalapeno pesto Glazed doughnut bread pudding with three rum caramel, vanilla creme anglaise Bourbon fudge brownie with brown butter bacon ice cream and candied bacon Peach upside down cake with crafthaus zitrone, whipped mascarpone  There was not one item I would hesitate to get again.  Outstanding items for me were the catfish, beets, wild mushroom flatbread, chicken thighs, and the pork tenderloin.  Consider all the desserts to be your friend.  They are very, very good!  The fried catfish has a bit of zing on the breading.  The pork tenderloin with jalapeno pesto surprised some of our group--the pesto is hot and it is fantastic alone or with the pork loin.  If you're a fan of bleu cheese, get the wild mushroom flatbread.  The cheese is bleu cheese and it's rich and very tasteful!  While these dishes are not new to Carson Kitchen, several of them were new to me but I intend to go back and have some more pork loin with the jalapeno pesto.    Chef Harwell and his staff continue to do excellent dishes.  Thanks to him and Matt for explaining the dishes.  I'll be back and back.

s6Ww4CkoU6pDYHNgOkk6uQ.text: I came here by chance. The sushi joint was closed.  I was pleasantly surprised.  I'm not a fan of communal dining but it wasn't crowded.  Great vibe. The service was on point.  We had the Gyros Tacos, was really good and tasted as good as nothing I've had in Lebanon and Greece.  The watermelon / feta was really good.  I love that it came w purple onions. We also had the Mac n cheese and the cocoa strip.  It was cooked perfectly and it was all just great food. Reasonably priced.  I'm a fan!!!

I have gone through most of the menu and recommend you do the same.  The vibe is energetic but comfortably pleasant.   If you are in the Fremont street area this is a MUST try place!

VR0N_lwFFVSLRDHK8qcz9A.text: There is no denying Downtown Las Vegas has developed tremendously over the past five years, from East Fremont to The Arts District, and although competition is now tougher than ever Carson Kitchen continues to pack the house from open to close as a result of good Food, delicious Drinks, great service and fair prices. Nothing less than iconic entering its sixth year, a milestone reached by less than a quarter of Restaurants nationwide (and likely far less in Sin City,) it was impromptu that four guests stopped in at 7:30pm, greetings at the hostess podium yielding unclaimed seats near the window where a young man named Roman offered excellent recommendations as well as descriptions for guests who jokingly claimed to be first-timers. Obviously far from the truth in terms of patronage, this visit actually number seventeen including every menu since Summer of 2015, it was after listening to stories of "founders" Cory Harwell and Kerry Simon that four Cocktails arrived, Matthew Harwell's creativity continuing to impress from Sangria to Tricky Vic and Get Shorty!, though much like day one The Magarian remains unsurpassed thanks to an herbaceous top-note lifted by restrained sweetness and effervescence. Ordering a la carte from Carson Kitchen's current "Greatest Hits" menu, a celebration of the Restaurant's past as well as the upcoming expansion, it was opting for dishes not tasted in some time that "Devil's Eggs" arrived quickly, the request from a woman who "never thought I'd like Caviar" attesting to Cory's longtime goal of making esoteric Ingredients accessible to those who may not have previously known any better. Next up, Fried Green Tomatoes, a dish concocted by Georgia-born Harwell and carefully prepared by Chef Scott Simon, it was beneath tangy Crab Meat that all three rounds delighted guests before transitioning to "Gyro Tacos" and charred Edamame that both also shine thanks to complex spices and a touch of acid. Continuing with Tempura-battered Green Beans, the more-sweet-than-spicy Cream Cheese another southern staple, it was after hearing a story about a former Chef nixing "Killer Shrimp" that the dish was revisited after sixteen months, its textural comparison to Chinese Walnut Prawns undeniable though the use of Peruvian Peppers give each bite subtle yet sustaining fire. Revisiting Oxtail Risotto for the first time in three years, and vowing to never go so long again after one bite of creamy Rice and Cheese, it was "Between Bread" that entrees were offered, the Secret Sunday Chicken recently featured on bestofvegas.com predictably outstanding while the Butter Burger cooked medium-rare and Wild Boar Sloppy Joe are both crafted with an eye on balance in terms of taste as well as texture. A bit overwhelmed by three cones of Tots, a doggy bag trip to the oven doing little to dampen their crunchy appeal, it was with Iced Tea in hand and The National playing overhead that Dessert was ordered, Peach Cake with Mascarpone proving super for summer while Donut Bread Pudding bathed in Rum and Bourbon Brownies with housemade Brown Butter Bacon Ice Cream remain every bit the delight they were when first debuted 61 months prior.

nbpdLyQsH5F6QLZ0Ocn7JQ.text: WOWzas, the Jerk Turkey Burger was off the chaaaain! You can tell this place makes everything fresh, and the dishes are well thought out. All the flavors went amazingly well together and even tho by itself the burger woulda been a tad spicy, the mango chutney slaw balanced that perfectly. Top it off woththose crispy tater tots - YESSS!   *I came back here the other day with a friend and we ordered the bacon jam as an app - HOLYYYY SHIT!!! I don't even care that it burned the top of my mouth, it was unbelievably good! MUST TRY.

gTISB9KYFnQ2bwiZBUft0Q.text: Love the food and the staff! Such a fun place to meet friends and share dishes! Good vibes

xLP4FqLruMRwArvskcNGWQ.text: Carson kitchen was pretty good. The one time we went there for dinner, it was quiet for a Sunday evening.   We saw a family with young kids, I didn't expect that but it seemed to have perfectly fine.   Service was great, servers where all super nice, helpful, didn't get annoyed by my 200 questions and good came out fast too.   The Mac and cheese was great Flat bread was just ok  I personally loved the beet salad a lot  Only one complaint I have is that I wished there was some healthier food options for vegetarians.  Maybe less greasy food (that's just me)

CmU0_jQx_CWT2Osg2-13gA.text: The food and the atmosphere were fantastic. We sat on the roof top patio. We tried several dishes including two appetizers the "killer shrimp" and edamame. They were delicious and seasoning was Indescribable. We also had two different salads which were so good. For the main courses we had the steak, catfish, and butter burger. Everything was seasoned to perfection and the rub on the steak was to die for. Of course we split a dessert which was the glazed donut pudding, again it was scrumptious. We drank as well, one of the stand out drinks was "Get Shorty".  I would be remiss if I didn't talk about our waiter Geronimo, he was witty, extremely familiar with the menu, and overall delivered Impeccable service. I would absolutely go back to this restaurant. Probably one of the best I've went to in Vegas.

Do76JvSVimeQknTwEVltoA.text: I stopped in here for a light bite and cocktail. The macaroni and cheese was very good. The cauliflower lacked flavor and the devil eggs were okay. Our cocktails were good and service was okay. I probably won't return.

TkbgPk24B4026Owm7bftng.text: Sitting is different but overall had a great experience. Was able to interact with other guest. Our waiter was super nice and he had great recommendations. Will revisit!

mDim4l_eezC_TwuJX2Q7kQ.text: Great service and staff. Tempura green beans and the Alabama white bbq chicken are great. Beat salad was small but very tasty. Edamame is good, but it's very different flavor profile. Fairly priced drinks and beers. We were in town visiting, and trusted the reviews. Solid choice with a great vibe and music. Well done you guys.

J70JiWp2oNA_WBHcia9_sA.text: My girlfriend and I stumbled across this gem while taking in the Fremont Experience.  It's a small, quaint restaurant NOT on Fremont (thank goodness) that has a great vibe and an awesome dining experience!  The food is AMAZING, tapas style, eat as you go. The service was fantastic and Ethan was a great host and filled us in on the restaurant history and about the cuisine. The wait was somewhat long; however, WELL worth it. There is a small bar to grab a cocktail while you wait and an outdoor area.  My girlfriend and I felt this dining experience was the highlight of our Vegas weekend. Can't say enough. We will be back and highly recommend to our friends and anyone wanting fantastic food and a neat dining experience.

lEENKtF3imvXJlPDRNzroA.text: This is our second visit to this extraordinary restaurant. Just like the first time here, we were not disappointed.   I have Celiac disease and my hubby is lactose intolerant. The staff was incredibly accommodating and completely took care of us.   My personal favorite was the Cocoa-espresso NY strip while my husbands was the Young Beet Salad with the goat cheese on the side for me :-)

3fI4-dKPFL9VmEgqIo82kQ.text: I have been here twice and I LOVE it. The mac and cheese - I dont normally eat nor like mac and cheese, it always seems like a pile of goo to me - but this OMG with the truffles, I could swim in it     Ridiculously good food and both times, 2 people ate for around $50 - waaaay too much food

mw36G2ivg3fmoQdAyKHGqg.text: What a great place! Will definately be going on our regular Vegas rotation! Best beer and mac n cheese I have EVER had!!  Stopped here on a family member's recommendation after the Mob museum. We just wanted a drink and a light snack and this was the perfect place! All of their food is served in small, sharable fashion so you can try a little of everything. We got the pork belly, bourbon brownie, and mac n cheese - all of which was AMAZING. I can't remember which beer we got (came in a bottle), but it was super tasty too!  Would highly recommend as a snack spot! Not sure I could afford to eat a full meal here (prices are high $10+/plate and a plate is not a typical meal size), but a very fun snack treat!

SM86ubXMqsM8VSsMgeaxZg.text: Everything here is amazing. Super delicious food, friendly wait staff and talented chefs.  The donut pudding is the best dessert I have in a very long time.

6HEsVURv4-VhA7Trdr_ltw.text: First night in Vegas , we were spending the night at the old Downtown Las Vegas. Place is very small, and even if it was already 8 pm, it was packed . We waited outside inside their cute patio.  Food : we got the gyro tacos, very filling, lot of meat and yummi flatbread , the brussel sprouts with bacon was also very yummi, very well seasoned , I think a little bit on the expensive side for being a side ( $8), the cauliflower  was way too salty , Ithe green tomatoes for me was a bust not much flavor,  I didn't think the tater tots were spicy, the steak with the cocoa sauce was good. Overall wasn't much impressed with food , I didn't  like the fact that we didn't get our foods together, and I'm not talking about 5 minutes but like 15 minutes between  each other .

G2Nte1yrzNA8vTXXXTVyTg.text: Brought our friends from the east coast who had never been to Vegas before and they had been to every trendy restaurant on the strip before we brought them here and they LOVED it! We ordered the bacon jam, spicy shrimp, shepherds pie, turducken pot pie and shared everything. It all comes in small plates to be shared. Kinda like a tapas. The bacon jam is a MUST to order!! Everything was delicious, the wait staff fast and friendly.

iwy2QJ58mDEB0mbqnpC-TQ.text: Everything we ordered was phenomenal! Will definitely be returning next time I'm in Vegas. Staff was friendly, mac n cheese was to die for, crispy chicken skin - on my gosh, I'm about to drool! Just go there, you won't regret it.

fsGxC_zJPPkVy22o6b7uSg.text: Unique menu options and convenient downtown location. I would definitely go back for more!

IbxqFFWp8-_1nRKOyA2JYA.text: What a gem of a place! We ordered the burger (comes with a side of tater tots) and the rainbow cauliflower. The food was the bomb and so was the service!

am9TZBZJDBHkGLK6lpgZiw.text: Beautiful setting, great bartender, awesome food. Came in on a Wednesday night, it was packed but the service was great and there wasn't a long wait for food. Sangria and pineapple non margarita (it's made with him) were tasty. Tried the secret Sunday Chicken sandwich....LIFE!

4dgkMYMMSkulruOjgYatKA.text: With a menu that seems to be as dynamic as a physics engine or a periodic table, the collection of flavor is so bountiful that it will leave you wanting more.  How many restaurants can take a can of Spam and make the most tasty croquettes you ever had in your entire life?  .  .  .  Don't worry, I'll wait.  Oh but that's just the start!  The menu is as unique as they come, from crispy chicken skin appetizers to rabbit ragu spaghetti, they have strayed far from all the downtown food niche and created one of their own.  With the soon-to-be-open upstairs bar and patio, hopefully their presence will be solitified in the Downtown Vegas scene.  I have great hopes for this place.  And if you're in the area, I would definitely recommend giving this place a try.

rr_heoSA1uF-nIFn_uaVmQ.text: Detoured to this place instead of the Thai place that was recommended and boy was I glad I did. Cool atmosphere. Great place to share food and grab drinks. The balcony would have been nice but it was too hot to sit out there. The pork grilled cheese sandwich was awesome. Great customer service.

RJvsH_fyED13qR_s9zBvtw.text: I wish I could fit more than 5 stars! Unbelievable! Excellent, interesting food! Ask for Bianca when you come, coolest waitress in Vegas, she guides you through the menu and puts you with the right dishes. We're from Louisiana and are very selective on food, this place hit all the marks, sheik ambiance, great service and awesome food! Must try: crispy chicken skins (Louisiana it would be called chicken cracklin) the butter burger & OMG the Mac and cheese! Un-f#%*~g believable!!! Will go out of my way to hit this hidden gem again...

Fykq4ItzfgIJ-MIpFdz9dA.text: This food was amazing!! The Bacon Jam and Butter Burger were perfect for sharing. I can see when the Butter Burger is award winning. Super friendly staff and loved watching the chefs! This is my new favorite Vegas restaurant for sure!

vCjCXGsfqTTzHOQOABKBZg.text: Three stars for our experience, not the food.. It looked amazing, the place was packed. I would have loved to try it. Just FYI. We called ahead to put our names in. The wait was 45 minutes. We got there in time and after another 10 minutes we were seated by Im guessing the manager who sat us at the bar. I said we were waiting for a table and he looked at me like I was crazy and said, "well what do you want? If you want a table we only have two tables for two and the wait is 90 minutes." He was kind of exasperated with me even thinking we'd get a table.  He was (my perception) very abrasive. We were hungry so we sat at the bar which was so loud I couldn't hear my boyfriend unless we were shouting. Music was loud the bar was crowded. And he sat us right near the register when all bar seats were empty and people were bumping my boyfriend and the noise! But after being treated like a child the first time i asked a question we went along. After 5 minutes we gave our apologies to the very nice female bartender and left. Just be sure to ask for a TABLE, if you want a nice relaxing dinner. We headed to the aptly called restaurant Therapy which I felt I needed.

uFsjsYlqP1EPrl-O8KDE6g.text: I'm sorry that a few people had bad experiences but this was one of our best Las Vegas meals. We went at 5pm on a Monday and got right in. I'd recommend you sit at the kitchen bar watching the chefs work is great fun. We had Bacon Jam with toasted bread and 3 Lamb Gyros. I had a Glass of Malbec. It was plenty for us to eat. The food coming out of the kitchen looked great.  It's a small restaurant so I would make a reservation. There are community tables for small parties but it was fine. Ask for Nicole, great waitress. Lots of small plates to share. Steak looked good. Don't miss this fun little place.

eh7g2Lc3H0HnTNdwck--Vw.text: What a crap show. I live in downtown Las Vegas so i have eaten here a few times. The food is decent, but the service is dicey at best. But this last time will be my last time. We were a party of 4 told wait 40 minutes. An hour passes still no table. While we are waiting outside on a colder than expected Veags night. Several groups have come in after us and been seated. Finally they say we can sit at the bar in two groups of two, away from each other. If we wait another 15 minutes. Hostess says this with a straight face. Yeah no thanks.  We went to one of the many other great restaurants within walking distance (le thai, therepy, perch to name a few). The food here is not worth the attitude of the staff. Take it from a local do yourself a favor walk a few feet and go somewhere else.

NkkgMAJ2jKreRD5HEf67aQ.text: It was decent. Not like OMG I gotta tell everybody but it was good. Nice atmosphere too. Would return if I visit Vegas again. Good sized beers too.

0U6jjVekOyQEPaZ4InuudQ.text: We went for a birthday dinner, little larger group (12 people or so).  Cool atmosphere, the food was great.  A lot of flavor, loved the Gyro Tacos, could've kept eating it all night.  I had the NY Strip Steak, great sear, great flavor, good cut, Fingerling potatoes were really good too.  The only things I wasn't too fond of was the Old Fashioned they made (waaaaaay too much club soda) and felt they were understaffed. Other than that, everything was great and would really recommend it and will definitely come back.

gsMo-dRjmLxFyXrm9eev2Q.text: I went here for a team lunch and I was very disappointed. Dishes are very small, tapas style, and very overpriced. I went for the crispy chicken skins and they were sold out.  I got a $12 Mac and Cheese, which was too rich in flavor and so tiny. The dishes were pretty interesting and had unique ingredients in it which I can see WHY they may be more expensive but it was just not worth it.   The restaurant was pretty tiny, the seats were high and had no backing. The atmosphere just seemed really "cool", but the place is all hype. It's a great place to go if you want to show off a date during dinner time and be really trendy, but otherwise I wouldn't suggest it. I left hungry and poor.

OSZLjrBG6ym-S6rAMbVCCw.text: All I can say is WOW! If I could give Caron Kitchen 6 out of 5 stars I would! Five star service and food at a truly affordable ($$) establishment. My boyfriend and I found this hidden gem on yelp and they had me at brownies with bourbon bacon ice cream and fresh herbs like Rosemary and sage served as garnish in the cocktails.  We came for dinner on a Monday night and did have to wait about 30 minutes (because this is a small restaurant with limited seating) but the wait was worth it. We sat at the bar that faces all the action in the kitchen and got to see everything first hand. Not only was I impressed with the food, I was impressed with how personable the wait staff (we were served by Dakota) and GM (Matt) were. We shared the tempura green beans, bison burger sliders, and Mac n cheese, which were all mouth wasteringly amazing. We didn't have room for dessert so we came back the next night and splurged by having all three. The bacon bourbon ice cream was delicious as promised and I also LOVED the donut bread pudding with caramel sauce. I mean really!! So so so good.  My advice - go twice and try as many items as possible. The cocktails are fantastic too. Well done Caron Kitchen! We will be back!!!

7VGikuP_f_VwV7-Sj_RDBg.text: Awesome place! Off the main path but totally worth it! Service was great, food was fabulous! Would highly recommend the turkey burger:-)

Io4MwfrRNi_ZOASVcVc0vA.text: This place was great. The food was amazing! Had the sloppy joe and the edamame. Couldn't be happier with the food. The bartender that was there was super nice also. Will be going back!

56e0A7jqFLaVcuFrvbmWsg.text: Had a family member come to town so I decided to take him to Carson Kitchen.  Unfortunately, it turned out to be a mixed bag.  We ordered one of the "social plates" the chicken skins which come with honey.  It was ok but I wouldn't order it again.  Family member wanted something else to dip it in and was told no.  Ordered the Rainbow Cauliflower which is the worst dish I've had in a long time.  The flavor was so caustic, I almost couldn't breath.  Fortunately the Baked Mac and Cheese arrived and it was delicious.  Finally, I ordered the Butter Burger and tater tots which was very well cooked and was very impressive.  I was surprised how much I liked the tots.   Cooked to perfection, I highly recommend them.  ---There are so many great restaurants in town I wouldn't make a special trip to go here.  If you do, get a table, don't sit at the bar, service wasn't that great.

xF5kZHOy2lznFinlKBYecA.text: Yes to BACON JELLY, yes to FRIED CHICKEN SKINS, yes to Mac & cheese. A really good place for foodies to get a great fix!

EpyroIQASNzUq3782CIbAg.text: Please if you love yourself order the bacon jam the second you are sat. Also chicken skins and tempura green beans, then go from there. This place is AMAZING!

_xRq4VEUR3tg-2whOhcg3A.text: Carson Kitchen was recommended to me by a friend. I wasn't sure about going because I love Purple Pig in Chicago. I went in with high expectations. Well my experience was amazing. We were lucky enough to sit at the counter just across from Chef John Courtney. The food was superb. I couldn't decide what to order and walked away full. The highlight really was the chef. As if he did not have enough to do in the kitchen- He kept an eye out as to what was going on in the dining space. Then on the way out he took a few minutes to ask how we enjoyed lunch. I will definitely be back on my next trip

J8fhoB2TotMqhfUZLyYyvA.text: Absolutely outstanding! The place looks very unassuming, even divey, on the outside, but it's very nice inside with a great patio on the second floor, with an additional bar. The waiters are very "hipster", but the service was excellent and they were very accommodating to our party of 8 without a reservation. Great beer list and the food is excellent. Definitely go in with a tapas style mindset and try a bit of everything. We tried the Crispy Chicken Skins (addicting), Bacon Jam (order this. immediately.), Gyro Tacos, and the Veal Meatballs (order this as well. immediately.). I also had the Bone-in Pork Belly. It was as ridiculously awesome as it sounds. Think of it as a bacon steak. I would definitely come back here.

Fpx3JTdrA-jksW2jxdxdCA.text: Our friends and I are in town for Thanksgiving weekend and thought we would try something new.  My Boyfriend found this restaurant and we trust him on his choices usually and we were right!  This place doesn't take reservations but would put you on waiting list. We got there around 7:30 and we waited maybe 15 mins outside with fire pit to keep warm.  We took some pictures also which was nice. Let me tell you... This place is a must try if you eve go to Vegas, esp if you are with a big group of friends.... Just so you can order a plate of each and try everything! I highly recommend the crispy chicken skin served with HOT honey! It was a taste of heaven and great to share with 4 or 5 people so you won't get fat! The veal meatball with foie gras cream was delicious also.  We had try almost every dish on the menu being that we have 6 in our group! If you are looking for something healthy or healthier, the roasted beet with goat cheese is the dish to try! Anyway, everything comes in small portions and like I said, go in a group and you can try everything! The most important thing is , the bill came out surprisingly cheap... We even ordered 2 bottles of red with our delicious savory dinner. Go Go Go Go Go Go Go!!!!!!! Just Go!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep Fried Chicken Skin with Honey
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY strip steak Cooked with cocoa expresso and red wine demi
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer Shrimp with Spicy Sauce

OWKWdu8e8O-dvdkA1QRsbw.text: We met a friend at Carson Kitchen on Saturday evening. The only challenge was finding the front door. The address is 124 S 6th street but the front door is actually on Carson Street.  At any rate once we found it the reception was excellent. It was a rainy evening so the upper patio was unavailable. We were seated at the bar where we could see the kitchen and the orders coming out so we had an opportunity to see the various dishes while we had a drink or two. Our waitress was excellent and the manager who was checking out the dishes was very nice. As we asked what things were he would tell us.  We started with a couple of appetizers. The spicy shrimp was tasty and the gyro tacos were very good. We then had some Mac and cheese, Cuban pork belly sandwich, and some pan seared chicken thighs. It should be noted that the tots that came with the Cuban are extraordinary. My girlfriend is a self avowed tot expert and she gave them a thumbs up.  The best thing about our experience was that the Sou chef was willing to share the recipes and ingredients with us. The other chefs chimed in to make it an intimate experience.   I highly recommend this establishment   Thank you to the entire staff for making it a great experience.

OObXpd04kjGI-WAMD1vPtw.text: The first time I came I was not in love with the place.  It fills up pretty quickly and can be a bit crowded at the bar.  The food has always been pretty good, but it is small plates.  So best to go with a group to be able to sample a bunch of things.  Cauliflower is great, gyro tacos are good, mac n cheese is really good, chicken skins are decent, devil's eggs with caviar are yummy too.  I have never had anything bad here.    Definitely suggest going with a group of around 4 and order different things so you can try a bunch!  Have many more than that, I would imagine it would be tough to get a seat quickly because they are always packed.

xvkIkC69nxmyfdavyCzY2A.text: 5 words to describe....Bacon Jam And Pork Belly. What the fuck! By far In my opinion 2 of the best things on menu. Definitely some next level shit! The setting, the staff, all on point. Make sure you order the baked Mac n Cheese too. Then whatever bacon jam you have left over, smeer it on the baked Mac n Cheese! Major mums indeed. I'm gonna be comin back fasho!

96jycEpVTNfOTA8uf2YyWA.text: Good food. Seems to always be pack. The upstairs patio is pretty large, but they don't seem to want to use it as much because there was about a 30 mins wait for us to be seated when there was 4 empty tables available upstairs. We specifically asked for patio seating and the hostess tried sitting us at the Bar inside instead. Too small and loud to be able to enjoy a dinner night out. But she was able to get us outside eventually. I wouldn't saw that this place is good for large parties. Overall, cool place if not in a rush for dinner.

_I7NpRS-e6a4q7tvSGvTfg.text: Wish I could give them more star's. Well me and my family wanted to try this restaurant as we frequent restaurants downtown. we live downtown and thought this would be a nice change. so I called to see if they are kid friendly and they are kid friendly but they have no boosters or high chairs. which is OK cuz my kids are old enough to sit in chairs. (7 & 12 )I also asked if they are busy and she said no. I said ok will be right down. I only live about 6 blocks away. And it didn't take us long to get there. when we got there it smelt really good. we are greeted by the hostess. it wasn't that busy and no one sitting outside and we were told that it would be a 45 minute wait. well we really wanted to try this restaurant but we sure didn't want to wait 45 minutes at 5:30 in the afternoon.

SS_F7d3TrR5QQCH4QPR7uw.text: after 3 visits here, i can safely say that the consistency is spot on and i'm a stickler for consistency, especially if it's consistently delicious! my first visit here was so spectacular that i told everyone i know about it. not only was i impressed with the food but also with the service, and the ambiance of the restaurant itself. it's the type of place that absolutely belongs downtown as it makes you feel as though you're not in vegas anymore. sure, some may call it hipster, but i personally think it's one of those places that's taking vegas in the right direction.  we need better food culture here and carson kitchen is taking those strides with their amazing offerings. they take something as simple as a fried green tomato sandwich, and kick it up a notch by adding some lump crab ravigote and baby greens, all between a nicely toasted yet soft torta-style bread.   absolutely delicious. the roasted cauliflower, another simple dish with the spices and seasonings they use and the proper cooking method, was some of the best i've ever had. from the perfectly fried chicken skins served with local honey to the o-face donut bread pudding, their menu is all comfort foods with a little twist, something that has kept me coming back for more.  with a smallish menu, i thought i'd be able to sample just about everything by now but with dishes that are just too good to pass up, i end up ordering the same thing every time. it is my new goal in life to try everything on their menu at least once so, sorry fried green tomato sandwich, as much as it pains me, i'm going to have to pass on you for now.  so the next time you're in the downtown fremont area, stop by carson kitchen and give it a try. i guarantee you won't regret it.  p.s. my only complaint is that they don't stay open late enough on the weekends.  11pm is too early to close.  we usually want to stop in after a show at the smith center but there's not enough time!  midnight on the weekends would be awesome!!!  =D

cVMDkBWlsmiFz3oSyCmdBw.text: Food was great. We ate family style and had 7-8 different dishes. My favorite was the watermelon salad. Place is small but service was great.  Sangria was excellent too. Best meal I had in Vegas!

1YqFYpDzD9LRzyjEg_A-EQ.text: Mmmmmm came here with friends and we absolutely had the best time. So much to choose from we ordered way too much food but ended up eating it all loll. The crispy skins are to die for!!!

82_hMMcEJU1Z_HYjhVWUug.text: This place is a great little hole in the wall. They have delicious drinks and some amazing food. We went with a group of four and grabbed some drinks at the bar to wait on our table. The have a cool little outdoor courtyard with a fire pit that we all gathered around while our table was made available. Which made the wait go by a lot faster. We were sat up on the second level exterior patio area where you can look out over Carson and just enjoy being elevated above the chaos of downtown side streets (random bums and whatnot). We really enjoyed beginning our evening here and look forward to going back again!

AjvJJSqyHd8aTTH51gXpvQ.text: CK is a really nice find if you are ever at Freemont Street. Why eat the bleh food at the Casinos or nearby fast food when you can get good drinks and creative food so close by. The gyros tacos were great starters and the black rice risotto-very nice. The short rib grilled cheese and chicken sandwich were both excellent. The staff are really nice. Parking at neonopolis is close by and cheap.

JgVaz5WZQJ8_A035gnVlyg.text: I'm very happy to find this amazing restaurant in downtown. Food was great, service is great, vibe is great! Can't wait to go there again!

WKVZjtYg1bSy--IRjg2cjQ.text: Carson Kitchen is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. I always get the fried chicken skins and Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese is unreal! It has such an explosion of flavor in every bite. I've tried a lot of the menu and everything we've eaten here has been small in portions but rich in flavor and depth. I would also recommend the oxtail risotto! So yummy!

CU-L-QlcRhdP8zIpUNQqHQ.text: You will not be disappointed here. Throw a dart at the menu, whatever they bring will be spectacular! From the creativity,  to the exemplary service, to the affordable prices. Cory Harwell, and Chef John Courtney have refined Carson Kitchen to a great place for any meal!

0hCly3C_A7QB8CgzaDsU0A.text: Fantastic food and service.  The drinks are great too. Worth the Uber ride downtown for lunch.

UvjqDxUGJAZL7X97eryvLg.text: Pricey for small portions. Atmosphere seems nice with open concept kitchen. Had a to go order and ordered the sea bass, it was a little burnt and portion was small compared to the price.

17zk92YtPWy1jwJ1gaDauw.text: I cannot say enough about Carson Kitchen.  The food is awesome, the services is amazing, and what a fun environment!  We sat on stools facing the cooks, so we were able to watch all the prep.  The thing I was struck by the most was how well the staff gets along.  They seemed happy to be doing their jobs and the affection they had for one another was clearly evident.  The food is phenomenal.  We ordered the Chicken skins, asparagus salad, butter burger and pizza (ham and pineapple).  Everything was delicious.  The chicken skins are very popular, and although I like crispy skin, they were a bit much for me.  The idea of eating all that skin kind of got in my head a little,  but my husband loved them.  We had the bourbon brownie and bacon ice cream for dessert.  It was so rich and delicious.  I highly recommend Carson Kitchen.  We will make this a must stop during all our trips to Vegas!  (p.s. this restaurant is in the old part near Fremont Street.  It is wedged in the middle of an old building - facing the street.  There is on street parking, but be ready to put some money in the kiosk.  Nothing is free in Vegas anymore!)

RcQubgDs-4cKBPgJx112zQ.text: This place was great! Given all the wonderful reviews, we were really expecting it to be awesome! It didn't disappoint, for the most part.   The inside is small but fun, and has a good atmosphere. It's loud and lively. Seems like a fun downtown place. Had I known about the patio when I made the reservations, we would have definitely been up there! So fun!  The waiter was great - friendly and attentive, but not too much.   For food, plates are smaller- like tapas style, and they make for a great date/small party. They "suggest" that you share, but it's basically forced sharing as everyone's food comes out at different times. We had a large group and the first persons dish to the last was nearly 25 minutes. Sharing ended up being fine but if you're not a sharer or are with people you don't really want digging into your food, maybe go elsewhere that night. It's a little pricey for the small portions, but that's the "in" thing.  We ordered: Pork Osso Buco - Definitely tender... fall of the bone but it was lacking flavor. I'd skip it.  Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto - My husband ordered this and ate every last bite, so I'd say it was good.  Chicken Skins - These are spicy! Spicy enough I couldn't eat them. The sauce is interesting too. Good if you like liquid smoke.  Mac and Cheese - Was good! Gyro Tacos - I'd probably order only this if we ever go back.   The drinks were great - I got sangria and it was like juice. I think I knocked back 3 before I told the waiter no more!  It's kid friendly, but be aware that they don't have high chairs.  Definitely fun for drinks/apps. Treat it like that instead of a restaurant. and Sit outside!

yULVs9Rhyws3LiQ6NcE1qQ.text: This place had so much personality and so unique for downtown Las Vegas. The food and drinks are excellent.

DUnzbKCnYVvJWMr2i3GTAA.text: Gourmet food at a  Diner...the Butter Burger was great and also the Flatbread, but most of all the beer selection was a treat.

KjAuQ91ffNkQ7lO1LuYNmQ.text: This restaurant is going to be our favorite for a Downtown variety, we decided to do lunch and was able to get in without a wait.  Very unique food with a twist, the black rice looks strange, but the taste is very good.  The meatballs are very tasty and so was the short rib sliders.  I sure wasn't expecting that sweet taste which comes from the rootbeer sauce.  The only thing that bothers me is the parking as with any Downtown place you want to visit.  A definite must try!!!!

y7L4W5_tBfYIzatOfaujCA.text: An excellent change from the Vegas mediocrity!  Had the fried chicken skins and bacon jelly.  Very tasty!

oQJ4l8xuzqqkRLpX5yhfsA.text: Great food. Had the Butter Burger, yummy and such a huge portion and their spiced tater tots yum. Parking is a bit of a challenge,  but worth it.

0OyPuCN6yEPo1D4KAfK3pQ.text: Delicious!  We tried and shared a bunch of the appetizers.  Everything was presented beautifully and was prepared perfectly!  I would highly recommend this restaurant!

bcLHqR2QmN49f8BaeMaIlw.text: Definitely a respite from the seediness of downtown vegas. Felt like I was in a smaller city at a great local's spot. Bold flavors were on point. The prices are reasonable, but take into account the a la carte style menu before expecting it to be super cheap. Giancarlo took great care of me at the bar. Will definitely be back!

RUvVVBbPAKbr30Qp9lMCFw.text: I love this place. I didn't care for the chicken skins but everything else was great.

2tEv0wLcavxOWiW8DqaqmQ.text: Butter burger, no bun was the best burger I've had in a long time. Everything we ate was perfect. Standing ovation.

0ph_SiGasC-piI9Xf5yeEw.text: This is an update from my first review of Carson Kitchen in which I was not very pleased with the service and ended up walking out even after placing an order. Without expectation, I was contacted by the owner himself who offered my boyfriend and I to have a second chance at the restaurant. That made me feel good that he actually took the time out of his busy schedule to contact me and find out where had things gone wrong and how not only he, but also his staff could fix the issue.   My boyfriend and I had a re-do date night at Carson Kitchen last night and all was AMAZING. Our favorites dishes were: mac 'n cheese, killer shrimp, green beans with that yummy pepper jelly cream cheese, and the NY Strip which was full of flavor. It was worth the second chance and we will be back again. The dessert, Glazed Donut Bread Pudding was fabulous as well :)   Thank you staff at Carson Kitchen for everything last night. It was well worth it. :)

_7cogm6PFCa5luQ_q5zh7g.text: My wife and I checked this place out, and the reviews are high for a reason. The staff is nice, works hard. The food was amazing. I had their chicken sandwich, as i am a fan of pickles, and it had a pickle aoli. I can honestly say i have never had fried chicken cooked so perfect. The bread and lettuce, tomato were fresh. And the pickle, and sauce were a tasty compliment.

_j9euhV41b4zNx07_AYizg.text: There are no words. My taste buds are super happy right now. Had the devil's eggs, beet salad, Mac and cheese, tempura green beans and rainbow cauliflower. Only wishing my tummy could hold more!

2CBxtI06VV4T25nHla01Bg.text: Yes, it's that good. I thought the service was a little "snooty". But they deserve to have their nose in the air a bit. This is a place I would love to go back to.

C_Nlrb2_aJE_mlbE50TZfQ.text: Great American cuisine with a twist. Make sure you make reservations if not it may be a 2 hour wait. Service staff was good, tentative and a good knowledge of what's in the dishes, if anyone has any dietary restrictions. The only complaint is the main course was not delivered to the table all together but very sporadic.

qMhNTCDbdViKWTSjKljW8A.text: I seriously could have just smelled the bacon jam for the whole night and called it wonderful.  The taste completely lived up to the smell.  Chicken skins were great. I was a little reluctant to get the risotto because I make a a pretty good home risotto, bu this was above and beyond anything that I could even dream of making.  To finish it off, there was the glazed doughnut bread pudding.  It was indescribable.  You just have to get it on your own, though I would warn it is a touch sweet.  All together we had four dishes, and I truly believe that all four dishes would rate in the top ten that I have had in the last year.  Go here!!!!!!

ZNERwixstol-Cyvd76ox1Q.text: This place is so unique and amazing...off the beaten path figuratively and literally..wonderful food and service!!

hYpIelvDVaTgowv-uTZV9w.text: It's tiny, but very cool atmosphere. Service was good. The devil's eggs were overpriced deviled eggs (go figure) but the food was very good. It seemed more like tapas style, very small servings. We tried the mushroom flatbread, bacon jam and also one of the salads.Everything was delicious.

FI7hpo2U8RJajkyNQzOFPw.text: Great atmosphere, great drinks, delicious food. Can't go wrong with this place! Btw, the lamb gyro tacos are to die for!

ym_AwtUUj9JZkWyH5_Jc1Q.text: Amazing food and drinks. Andrew the bartender was fantastic. Fresh farm to table food at a great price.

n_ijWpepeGEqI8p422lfWA.text: Let me gather my thoughts... It's difficult to paraphrase an explosive experience on a full stomach. Ok I'll start from beginning to end. We got there and parking was difficult, greeter at the door was nice, super packed, 45 minute wait, ordered a beer at the bar, waited in the back courtyard. Now this seems rather unpleasant, but this is where Carson Kitchen 'stepped their game up' and delivered. At the bar they had a Brooklyn Brown Ale that my friends and I enjoy and haven't seen here in the west coast. The court yard in the back was surprisingly serene, reminiscent of times spent in a backyard BBQ with friends. The wait was actually 15 mins which translated to 'freaking awesome' (I like the under-promising and over-delivering). Now, the fifth star was credited to the food and the man behind the magic. Bacon Jam is on point and that is no understatement because I found myself spreading that goodness on everything. No joke. I put it on the Mac n cheese, I put it on the gyro tacos, I put it on the coco steak. Don't get me wrong, all of these dishes lacked nothing and were incredible by themselves, but that bacon jam was like crack for me, and given the means I would've taken it intravenously. I guess one of the chefs came out to check on us and he couldn't have been a more 'cool like dat' kind of guy. Kudos to Eugene the chef, you made that food your bitch and owned it. Not quite sure who the owner is but you get the standing 'O' for nailing the whole ambiance of this place. You seriously got that five star taste without all that pretension of those snotty, over priced, mish-mash, upscale casino restaurants. Most def coming back here and referring it to my friends and family.

y-ztqXLvyUApizCzNztGQg.text: Food was fantastic! Menu is small and everything they make is cooked to perfection. The atmosphere is super casual and comfortable. Great place for sharing plates. If I lived here I would come once a week!

Esps43Q106B-P759TnA_wA.text: Strawberry salad, crab fondue and chicken thighs....  This restaurant was a great find!  The overall meal was outstanding.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  I will be back here.

e8pbN7IavZdjvD1pnXxCaQ.text: I've been several times and all have been an enjoyable experience.  The highlights for me are the Veal Meatloaf, the Gyro Tacos, Beet Salad and Bison Sliders.  Tried the Bacon Jam, but was not a fan.  The Strawberry Salad seemed a bit flavorless.  The service has always been great.  I've only been at lunch and I always go early.  The place is small, but seems to work fine.  Sorry I've missed Simon's other restaurants in town.

YQiBu6h9T2xnB6ETM7c6Kg.text: Great place. The ambience is really unique and different from the Las Vegas strip. The staff is hospitable and friendly. The burgers are awesome and I would highly recommend them. The brownie desert with bacon was pretty interesting. Highly recommended to check it out

cfuhdSabmNBgqZi0kV6mJQ.text: Awesome place.  I didn't feel like I was downtown Las Vegas.  It's a hidden gem just a couple blocks away from the action. I would recommend this place to any one.  The food was great.  The gyro tacos were dynamite.  Fried chicken skins were also great.

X0P_MFN9Nu_5TvG1zp_yqg.text: If your friends don't like this place, you need new friends. 8 dishes in and every one of them has been awesome. Just experiment, take a risk, and you will be happy.

31sUZveCOPZztNba54IVJA.text: This is a wonderful restaurant!  My first time there and, because it was so good, I went there a second time during my 4 day stay!  The best dish was the "Killer Shrimp" and I also loved the Gyro Tacos.  The butter burger was perfect but, if you're going tapas style, plan to split it.  And the best part was a wonderful waitress, Allison.  She was a joy - friendly, attentive and fun!

zGoU5gREQivZjDsbgZCSoQ.text: We were there to start a bachelorette party on A Saturday evening. The service was attentive without being hovering.  The staff had a great understanding of the menu and more than willing to share their opinion.  The food was delicious!  We shared several items including fried chicken skins, crab cheese fondue and tempura string beans.  All excellent.  For the main meal our group ordered beef stroganoff or the butter burger.  Again flavor and presentation were fantastic.  We had a great dining experience between the food, service and the sense of humor of the staff.

QJVphU6ICqeQd0LQJIpiCw.text: Had lunch here today. Service was fantastic, food is the best I've had in Las Vegas!  Don't leave without having the Donut Bread Pudding!  Will eat here every trip to LV!!

Dx8_-5VlSiVirMiSctvu2w.text: Amazing food, highly recommend. The best food we had in Vegas. Staff is also great, we got in late and the staff made arrangements so we could still be sat even past closing.

Ppp1KvuLKNoM9xrOzRRQ-w.text: The Buffalo Sliders were tasty and filling. They had a sweet glaze.  The Tempura Green beans came with aioli sauce. Nothing too spicy. Definitely a revisit when back in Vegas.

Jbsqc1xNsgo7_vL71mhhcg.text: My wife and I ate here with some friends last Wednesday for lunch. Its located just a short distance from Container Park in Downtown Vegas. I knew who Chef Kerry Simon was seeing him on the Food Network a couple times. I like his style of fun, american style food. The restaurant is very nice with an open kitchen. I thought it was a little tight inside with little elbow space between your dining companions. However, the food here is excellent. We tried the Chicken Skins with Smoked Honey Dip ($6), Mushroom and Mozarella Flatbread ($12), and Bison Sliders with Spicy Tatertots ($12). They all tasted great. The best thing at this restaurant was definitely the Bacon Jam with Brie and Baguette ($12). It was sweet, salty, sour goodness! That dish is definitely in my Top 5 of must try Vegas eats. If you're in downtown, I say forget the oxtail soup in California Hotel and come try the Bacon Jam. Keep calm and Kerry on!

EsUZxkiRuzjObdAlkVLcDw.text: In town for work and decided to try this place based on Yelp reviews.  Amazing food, the decor is different...the only issue was the volume of the music, just a bit too loud.  I know, I'm old.  I'll definitely be back the next time we're in town!

-jA25BVQZcIl-plUFLD7bA.text: Two words: bacon jam. If you've never heard of it, your welcome! The food at this intimate eatery is innovative - not to mention delicious. In addition to the jam we had rainbow cauliflower, osso buco, mushroom flatbread, and creamy wonderful devil eggs with caviar. Yum. Bartenders were excellent, waiter knowledgable and highly competent. I could have skipped a brownie dessert, otherwise a very happy experience by our group of four.

oh7CrA4ioMtcwrE5CuAiyQ.text: I am deleting the less than ppsutive review because the owner apologized and was concerned about our experience.  For that, I am pleased and deleted the "other" review.

sESSdl8PibPt9hM63sm8xw.text: food tastes exactly how it looks! amazinggg!

ouciZUkA9l8sP3oh-Sh39A.text: Amazing food, drinks, and the best service! Besides our awesome server, two other employees came by to shoot the breeze with us. You can tell everyone is happy to be there, and it was such a fun experience to escape the Strip and eat high quality, creative food without having to pay a fortune. Their rootbeer glazed pork sliders were the best thing I've ever had. The duck confit flatbread with fig jam and Gorgonzola was fantastic. The beef Wellington empanadas were served with a red wine reduction and I absolutely loved them. We topped off the night with a bourbon brownie served with bacon butter cream Ice cream. We wanted to eat everything on the menu, and we know we will be back next time we are in town. As a tourist, it was nice to come to an actual foodie place, and then hop over to Fremont street to walk off all of the amazing comfort food. Plates are smaller- like tapas style, and they make for a great date/small party. My favorite part is that you will most likely be sitting a community table or a bar that faces the staff. This setup enhances the fun experience by forcing you to engage with everyone around you. We eat at a lot of fun places in Denver and Chicago, and I must say this has been one of the best experiences I've had in a long time. The best part- our bill was waaaaay lower than expected! They had such thoughtful touches, too- our bill was served in an old book!

DIsgoL7Y7gEikWFp6jC9jw.text: Best food in Vegas!!! Saw every big show and ate at many places but this was best part of trip!! You won't regret!

LYDhUbHEd7EM9Q5drB12xw.text: My husband and I just had dinner here on our last night in DTLV and we saved the best for last! From the fried chicken skin to the mango-habanero sea scallops to the banofie  pie...every dish was inventive and thoughtfully prepared. It was a pleasure to sit at the kitchen counter and banter with the kitchen staff, especially Angie who made our experience extra lovely. Will definitely visit again. Oh and the swear jar is totally worth it!

K2tWxZJsCmjoU7n3vQ4jaQ.text: Amazing!  Service was phenomenal thanks to Nicole our server.  The fried green tomato sandwich and the gyro tacos take the cake for the best plates that I had, but the Mac n cheese was a close second!  Be sure to check out the rooftop once the weather cools!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Wellington empanadas!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The gyro tacos!

NxjCQodwx6Tcs20Vs1JU5g.text: Came here for dinner on a Sunday night, and it was quite busy. Called ahead to be placed on the waitlist, but still waited about 20min once we got there. Luckily, there is some seating around a cozy fire pit out back where we enjoyed a Project Idaho and Simonsays Sangria. Both were excellent. We were finally seated, but I did not realize the bar area was part of dinner seating. Our bartender/waitress was awesome. Dining space a little tight at the bar, so I would probably request a table next time. We shared the bacon jam, gyro tacos, and the sea bass. The toasted baguettes were tearing up the roof of my mouth Cap'n Crunch-style, but the bacon jam was too good to stop! The tacos tasted Greek, but still felt like a taco (if that makes any sense). The sea bass was excellent--tender on the inside with a nice crust on top. My husband found a new favorite beer here: Maui Bikini Blonde. The food and drinks were excellent, and the atmosphere was great, too. Thank you for a great evening. We will definitely come back.

iwfJRFHlH9jLMKJOgmg2MQ.text: Very unique place. Very trendy with good food, service and prices. Loved the menu. Choices of different dishes.

k920kuVel0nnRkNMEH2fIg.text: Here's another fun place to lounge with friends after a long stressful day. I call it Tapas but bartender says not to use that term....lol - this place is known for their crispy chicken skin dipped in caramelized honey you have to try before judging guys. Mac - - cheese omg! Heaven! Need I say more.

IAvszCBM1ZvnJO1qPLyolQ.text: Amazing service! Love all the gluten free options! The secret Sunday chicken was la bamba!!!

3hXkAIXUFSPOpO6YzJNygg.text: Loved this place. I work at the Hard Rock Hotel and I recommend people head downtown and eat here all the time. I say " make sure to try the truffle mac and cheese)

Cb7_wHXiIekfONY7WWwY-Q.text: This is one of the BESTEST (yes I said BESTEST) restaurant's in the downtown area.  Customer service is always on point (if you sit at the bar) the food is always delicious and the drinks are excellent (the only gripe is they do not have chilled beer glasses and the Moscow Mules are served in a regular Collins glass)
