MnXIeAp8pHhAUE1n5-utqw.text: I took a group of clients out of Aria to get them off the strip here earlier this week.  Cab driver asked if we were sure we wanted to be dropped off when we arrived.  So glad we said yes.  Amazing drinks (best 4 Roses Sour ever created) - Fantastic and Fun Service only to be topped by foodie food you will never find on the strip.  We ordered a wide assortment and passed plates around.  I took another group the next night to Sage at the Aria, spent more than twice as much for fewer drinks, less food, less quality and a lot less fun.  This will be my go to spot next time in Vegas, sorry locals, much to good to not share with the out-of-towners!!

CNK0vrTnMFEnSKRpk8TNVw.text: I went with my siblings and a friend and everything rocked! Food was amazing the staff was nice and friendly the Mac and cheese was great and the orange cream soda was great. The atmosphere was great too keep up the great work and I'll be back.

IkXNePvIbaUN9W3m_0ysNg.text: A little pricey, but great food and ambiance overall. A great place to start your evening if you out for a night on Fremont St.

jqo-itFyH_2ULyI9kOpT3A.text: I have been here so many times and I am never disappointed. I've had just about everything on the menu and I love it all. My favorites though are the crispy chicken skins, Mac n cheese, and shrimp. I wish it was a bit bigger because I feel it is a better restaurant for groups, but the ambiance is still super cute.

xtFu73iwVR-oYhCd7JXgfg.text: First of all, I love the location. It reminds me of East Coast eateries, small places with great ambience. I also liked that this place wasn't trying too hard to be anything. It was just a cozy spot.  We came in rather late, a little after 10 pm not realizing they actually close at 11pm. We got seated at the bar area, which was perfectly fine with us. We like sitting at the bar - and with an open kitchen, it gives us an insight about how our food is being prepared.  We ordered the Mac n Cheese, Bacon Jam and the Beef Wellington Empanada. The Mac N Cheese was well made seasoned with truffle oil. The flavor of the truffle oil was distinctive. Also the macaroni pasta was done al dente, which is how it's supposed to be served all the time. I also liked the Beef Wellington Empanada, specially the crust - not too flaky, but also not too thick either. The beef was tender and was flavorful. I didn't care so much about the red wine sauce but there wasn't so much of it that it really didn't bother me.  I wasn't too crazy about their bacon jam either. There was too much onion in it that you could hardly taste the bacon. They also seasoned it with a lot of apple cider (?) or some kind of vinegar. I could tell bec it was too tangy. There wasn't so much of a balance of the sweet, salty and savory flavor that I associate with bacon jam. It wasn't bad though, it just wasn't to my liking.  The staff was very nice and even if it was a few minutes to closing, we didn't feel like we were being rushed. Our server was very attentive and friendly. I would definitely keep this on my list of places to revisit.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brel Wellington Empanada
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac N Cheese - nice touch seasoned with truffle oil.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not my favorite - their bacon jam.

7S9envgKf6rJwcILJWXChw.text: Great!! Definitely would go again.   Everyone from the hostess to servers were super nice.   Mac n Cheese and Turkey Jerk Burger were excellent!!

zc9xug-YyYA_Hp9rjELlhA.text: Been here half a dozen times since they opened. Menu changes periodically but the chicken skin app, burger, and mac and cheese have stayed throughout. Always top notch service and food. Highlights include their spaghetti carbonara that had pork belly and a tempura egg, beef stroganoff, turducken pot pie, bacon jam, really everything we've had there has been worth writing home about. Great hip downtown spot with an exciting vibe/energy that has a full bar and some nice beers on offer. They give you your tab in a book that you can write in to commemorate your visit. I'd say it's closer to three dollar signs because you'll want to try a variety of items when you get there. Best downtown spot for my money.

ox-quClfEIsI1LlM0fc8lQ.text: Never even got to eat. though I went in so hungry i couldn't see straight, excited by the ratings and reviews. I sat at the bar, exploring the wine list and menu. The bartender left for some time, and returned with a plate of pasta. For himself. Which he started eating in the corner of the bar. I asked him if he knew where the restaurant got its beef (Hormones? Antibiotics?), so i could have a look as to how the cows are raised. "What, you want me to go ask?" "I'd appreciate it." He rolled his eyes, set his fork down and left. He returned after a few: "Idaho," he offered and proceeded to eat. As hungry as i was, I left in search of a place that gives a hoot.

9r0v8F6HgLGdSg9Q1_SvOg.text: Exciting menu and venue. Cool vibe.  Looking forward to enjoying the outside area as the weather permits.

zgSWufaWmiDwLdCrEVCbgA.text: The place was a little small, but that is to be expected in this part of town.  I think because of the threat of rain, the upstairs patio section was closed, making the dining room really crowded.  I wasn't expecting the whole family style seating.  They don't take reservations so we called ahead to put our name on the list, as the hostess recommended.  We were seated about 10 minutes after arrival on a Saturday night, so that was pretty good.  It was really too crowded to wait inside.  While waiting outside, a dude kept walking up and down the street crazily shouting profanities at nobody, so that added some color to that part of the evening.  Again, this is sort of to be expected in this part of town.    When we were seated, it was at the bar.  I wasn't expecting this but we thought it was fun.  If you are seated at the bar, be prepared for people ordering drinks over your head and handing over payments next to your food.  The bar tender was also our server, so there wasn't much discussion of the menu, just "you guys want food?".  He was very nice and good at his job, but between the noise level and him trying to make drinks for the entire restaurant, I didn't really feel able to ask any questions about the menu. (I did have some, but oh well)  On to the food......Awesome!!  I had the killer shrimp, which were nice and spicy along with the pork belly cuban.  I thought the cuban was a little heavy on the yellow mustard, along with the pickles giving it a sort of McDonald's Cheeseburger flavor profile.  But, it would have been the best McD's burger of my life....so there you go.  Also, it came with really good house made tater tots.  I probably wouldn't order this dish again, but I don't regret getting it.  It was nice and crispy on the outside and very tender on the inside.  Hubby got the strawberry manchego salad and the garlic fingerling potatoes (he's a vegetarian).  Both were really great.  It was a really nice meal and I really enjoyed my house berry sangria.  It wasn't the same old sangria with oranges and cheap fruit.  It was nice and bright tasting with fresh berries in the glass.  Hubs got some gin concoction with cucumber and thyme.  I thought it was awfully bitter, but that's right up his alley and he really loved it.    The food is definitely 5 star quality, but I knocked off a star just for the whole over crowded feel of the place and not having a real server.  For that price, it would be nice to have had a table and someone to talk to about the food before ordering.  Also, when you're waiting to be seated, they offer you the option of getting a drink at the bar while you wait..........except, the bar is actually table seating, so if you were to lean over people eating and shout a drink order, there is no where to actually enjoy said drink.  Kind of a turn off.    This place is worth the visit, just know what you're getting into before arrival.

coUhEA93FQQ-M9qQiz__Eg.text: Love hanging out here with friends. Great music and atmosphere. The staff is very friendly, so friendly they didn't want us to leave . This place is a must, the bacon jam and macaroni dishes are to die for. You really can't go wrong here. One of my favorites for sure.

ucbY2JE7Wu4RGCQuZt8UJA.text: Really enjoyed this place!! Must get the baked mac & cheese, you won't regret it. I will be back as soon as possible!

Fu3eggwUwEOJluUXVYoTeg.text: Well-Oiled Machine!!  Chef Scott & his team are artistic genius marvels!!  Terrific menu, small plates, can try several yummy dishes in one meal.  Very fresh food; sit at counter and witness the magic!!  Nice beer & reasonable wine list!  Attentive staff, very welcoming!! We'll be back!!

kYClsCRnjQJAtJqQ1unGZA.text: First time coming here. It was a good experience, I've been wanting to come here since it recieved at 4.8. The food is ok, we ordered the Deviled Eggs, which had way too much onion, didn't say it in the menu but they were edible. We also had the killer shrimp, wasn't that spicy it was a baby kick. Tempura Green beans were a home run specially with the pepper jelly cream cheese! Another home run was the Watermelon and Feta amazing! That's an amazing combination didn't say onions in the menu but edible! Great experience, amazing service and cool music!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer Shrimp
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Green Beans w/ Pepper Jelly Cream Cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devil&#39;s Eggs

TjuF5-7d-UCOFlR1izkgQg.text: This place is a must if you're in Vegas. My husband and I sat at the kitchen bar (dangerous!) and I couldn't stop ordering food! They put so much love and effort into everything they make. At first, I was a little turned off by the seating. I felt like I was in the kitchen, but very quickly realized we had the best spot in the house.   I had 2 of their hand crafted cocktails, both we're on point! They had an excellent craft beer list (I work in the industry and that means something to me) my husband was only able to drink 1 beer, because we filled up on food.  I suggest the green beans and BBQ burned ends, those were my favorites. We ordered 5 items off the menu, nothing disappointed. I feel like you can't go wrong. Then there was dessert.... the bourbon brownie was amazing. Homemade ice cream was the best I've ever had!  At the end of our meal Micheal asked us how everything was? We told him how impressed we were and that we will make it a point to stop in every time we visit the city.

jZnni1QhX_OggVNMd1GHrw.text: It's hard to put into words how fantastic this place is. The Mac and Cheese was so good it has jeopardized my relationships with other Mac and cheeses. My life experiences with Mac and cheese will only go downhill from here.     The bison sliders were equally as life-changing. The first bite dropped a vicious Hulk Hogan leg drop on my tastebuds. And the subsequent bites were just as flavorful and wonderful. These are a must order.     The third dish we got were the gyro tacos. And again, the flavor train came rolling through once more. I don't know who the conductor was, but the entire kitchen/wait staff do an exceptional job. This may be my favorite restaurant and it kills me I won't be able to have it again until I visit Vegas next time.     If in downtown, do not even consider eating anywhere else. This is the restaurant you've been looking for.

Uyt8CDGOZcmGcwAq49ZPPw.text: Looking for unique, exceptional blends of flavors, one of a kind menu items....don't hesitate....seriously, get over here.....Love, Love, Love Carson Kitchen....1st time there, and will definitely be a have to go back place....I ordered the Young Beets, Sunday Chicken Sandwich and finished with the donut bread pudding. YuuuuuuMmmmeeeee!! The staff are very warm and friendly.....I lucked out, got there before a wait started and sat up at the cooks counter....Seriously.....why are you still reading this.....get over there and start enjoying it yourself....

NgV-AVc1kjec4yRw_HptlQ.text: Everything we had was delicious.  We had the oxtail risotto, crispy chicken skin, mac n cheese, butter burger, bone in pork belly,  veal meatballs,  bacon jam, and bacon bourbon brownie. Everything came out quickly and was properly cooked. I will back back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bourbon bacon brownie

URWgeTc9nuuYCli-SEmgmw.text: I love love love this place!   Legit food, solid drinks and chill kick back atmosphere. Tucked away  in DTLV near other new little hot spots around the Fremont area is this awesome little Resturant. Driving by you would know much of it but step inside and you will find yourself in a hip cool Resturant.   It's not that big but not that small either with a great bar and a cool little kitchen counter type thingy. Prior to coming here I've been doing my homework and had a list of items that I wanted to try but bringing that that would be almost their entire menu I had to pick and choose.   So here is what I went with  Their signature Bacon Jam- 3/5 good great concept but it wasn't my favorite or I won't rub tho back for it. You must try at least once for yourself to judge if you are crazy about it or not.  The deviled eggs-5/5 some might say it's just like any other deviled eggs and I might agree but the texture of the egg was perfect and I love the fact that they classed it up with the caviar and the pancetta added the right amount of crispy fatty goodness I loved it.  The truffles mac and cheese- freaking 10/5 no really it was so cheesy with the right amount of truffle flavor you can't go wrong. It's more like crack and cheese instead of mac and cheese!  Finally we has the Butter Burger w/spicy tots-5/5 it was so freaking good. Burger was so juicy and had amazing flavor topped with all kinds of cheese and veggies. The bun was delicious and toasty and the spicy tots were crispy and season so good that plate also was on point.  For the {Libation} "because no good love story or any story begins with someone ordering a salad" we ordered the Magarian drink which had a bunch of stuff in it but it had me at cucumber soda and gin...the most refreshing drink ever with a great flavor of lemon, honey syrup and a hint if thyme who wouldn't want to just drink that all day in the hot summer heat then we got the St. Stephane's Belgian Blonde beer. All beer are in bottles nothing on tap but who cares when they are all so good.   All in all I can't wait to come back and try everything else like their chicken skins and their beef Wellington empanadas plus sip on their other Findlay crafted drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sparkle bark haha I like it
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing juicy and flavorful butter burger and paired with yummy spicy tots. So damn good!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best freaking truffle mac and cheese EVER!

ZGSeFZ1Zx_wQu_eawrmiDw.text: I came here on a busy Saturday night on a date. They donot accept reservations. We were seated in a quaint waiting area/patio in the back. it had a fire place and nice decor. We were seated rather quickly for how busy the place was. Inside is extremely noisy. that is my only complaint. otherwise, the food is decent and all shareable. Our favorite was the green bean tempura and edamame appetizer. upstairs had an outdoor bar as well. I'm not sure that I would come back, but definitely glad that I went!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. outdoor

j0QB1D_LNThevQkT_r9ewg.text: This place is a real restaurant!  If you're like me, you get sick of the mass-produced food on the strip pretty quickly. It can be hard to find alternatives, places where the food is thoughtfully prepared and the service is personal. Carson Kitchen delivered last night. We had fried chicken skins, a butter burger, the Sunday Secret chicken sandwich, and the rainbow cauliflower. Every dish was delicious. As we were leaving I found myself wishing that we had a restaurant like this near where we live. If you're looking for a real, tasty meal, go here for sure.

NaX9shPiGOkgJ_rEbGBDEg.text: Service was great, cheery employees, very attentive. Food was supurb, deviled eggs are a must and the burger was one of the best I have had in town.

Oufa7YC6ez8PyKLWAA5T9Q.text: For some unique twists on standard food, e.g. Devil's Eggs were great adding pancetta and caviar this American picnic favorite.  Prices are reasonable and service is excellent!

0ZGAjL3_zjNHrOSuCX67Ew.text: Doesn't look like much from the outside, but this place rocks! Your staff are beyond wonderful and food is unique and well-crafted. Well done! YUM!

iPpDc1FVEMkNWxPbvyd4mg.text: This place was recommended by a local and truly lived up to the billing. Set in an old motel, Carson Kitchen serves up delightfully original Americana fare and a first-rate cocktail to boot.

q9fl39G-jiNxOw30gnxn6g.text: Such an amazing place! The food served is not your typical dishes. However each bite of every dish has a mouthful of flavor that you cannot resist. Service is outstanding, the hostess could have been more friendly but overall experience will keep me coming back. You must try the Mac & Cheese and the Gyro appetizer!!

45qkXoXwFyrlJADHJD1P0Q.text: Wow. This place is UH-mazing.  Located right by Old Town Vegas, it's definitely a hidden gem. The place is on a discrete location that really keep the "tourists" away and definitely has a more local vibe.   The ambience is a bit of a gastropub feel. High and low tables pack the cozy joint plus a full bar and stool that overlook that kitchen give it a very intimate atmosphere.  They also have a back patio where people can lounge and mingle while they wait for their table.   Did I mention that this place was created by the late Kerry Simon? This was also a major + as I have heard he was an amazing chef with unexpected creations.   We ordered several taps-style dishes that were all perfection. Note most food is made to share and come out as they are ready.   Crispy Chicken skins with smoke honey - definitely a must-try of fried goodness. Honey is a nice touch and complement to the skins.  Fried tempura with pepper jelly cream cheese - similar to the skins quite delicious. (note: I probably would only choose one or the other next time, it was a little too similar from a fried, finger-food standpoint)  New to the menu. SPAM sliders with seaweed salad, grilled pineapple and "yummy" sauce plus spicy tater tots - Probably my favorite dish.  Black Rice Oxtail Risotto with Parmesan Cheese - Oh so rich and you could just taste the flavor of the Risotto.  "Devil's" Eggs, crispy pancetta and caviar - Omg. you had me had deviled eggs. I think I could have eaten 3 orders of it easily.   We were sad to hear that we missed the pork belly but I am sure that dish would have been great.   They don't take reservations but it doesn't matter. You must try this place!!!!

3ZkFGtBnCNuPdIpgWsGTLw.text: Definitely an interesting place. The food is good and unique. It's a cool, hip, trendy type place. Worth visiting once for sure, but I wouldn't eat here more than maybe once a year. Why? Well, to be honest; there are just too many places in Vegas that have better food for the money. Carson Kitchen isn't extremely expensive, but the portions are small and if you want to try various things (you should), it adds up. We probably could have eaten at a pretty nice steakhouse for the price we paid. Service was good. We were on the roof which was cool cuz the weather was awesome, but I don't know how that will be in the summer.   Bottom line: Neat place with good food, but you could get a better "traditional" meal for the price.

6adX0wXcDXGGxVlDOXgNXw.text: We went  on a Friday so it was packed and had a 45 min wait. We waited in the bar area and when two seats opened up at the bar we went to go sit there but were told they use the bar as regular dinner service area so we went back to sitting on the window sill. We ended up being seated at the bar anyway and we ordered four items.  They bring food out when it's ready as opposed to bringing it all out together.  They forgot our salad so we cancelled it and ordered a dessert instead but that was taking a long time so we cancelled that too.  The Mac & cheese was amazing and so were the tempura green beans. Food good but service not good.

-9SHAczWGjPdkH42iv3Viw.text: Love the atmosphere as they keep it simple but industrial chic. Came alone, sat right away at bar communal area. Everything being served looked and smelt great. Rainbow cauliflower was some of the best I've had. Also loved the rib eye and cocktails. Staff was amazing, server attentive, knowledgeable and enhanced my experience. Worth the price. Definitely would come back. Place is a bit small so if you have a larger party plan ahead.

xv6AptNMzAoKDpmfXpnTpQ.text: We had the meatballs, chicken skin, oxtail risotto, and the short rib grilled cheese. All were very well prepared and extremely delicious; however the risotto was the star / winner, and is one of my favorite dishes ever. The staff is friendly and great. Can't wait to go back!

b4t5R2cHEBy_X0ZH8AWDaA.text: The cocktails were very tasty and all the food was delicious. Great service. The staff was quick and attentive.

tvBbsQWhGKZvfPL00ixUvA.text: Excellent food, great restaurant to eat outside the Vegas strip. Very friendly staff!

n_CzdER80k0qhn6kwqGtQg.text: Love everything about this place: the location in old downtown, the staff, the atmosphere but the best part is the food. Everything on the menu sounded so delicious it was pretty hard to narrow down just 2 items. We got the cauliflower as an appetizer, I chose mac n cheese and hubby got the steak.  Everything was incredible. This mac and cheese is the best and since it's a secret family recipe all I could get out of our waitress Brooke is that it has 4 types of cheese. We could of easily finished it but we wanted to enjoy it the next day. Delicious as my breakfast. Will go back to try more and go for their dessert next time.

rO5PGJwJdiTPyUW1FKnPag.text: The Jerk turkey burger was the best burger I have ever had. The staff was amazing and friendly considering how busy they were on a weekend night. I will absolutely be craving this burger now. So glad I can frequent with family and friends. Great atmosphere and very clean. Will definitely be back.

M9hOSPzslfT1-cR00P9lTQ.text: Visiting Vegas from out of town. After a long day at the Grand Canyon tour we wanted something good to eat but off the strip. So a Google search and Yelp search brought us here. I saw Yelp said it wasn't good for kids but I always caution that recommendation as I feel people lend towards a no go for kids if the place also has full bar. So I called talked to the hostess and said hey is there formal dining seating that would be appropriate for me to bring my teenage daughter and whether the place was kid friendly - hostess said yes definitely.    We took a lyft there and drove by it twice. The place is hard to find and Yelp says 124 but door says 100. Got in there and place is way smaller than I imagined. Then the seating isn't that formal. We were seated at an extension of the bar with other patrons. It was a high table top. I asked if we could change and per the hostess they had nothing else - disappointed in this aspect. In True hipster fashion form preceded function as seating layout is below average (and I'm a millennial so it's not like I'm a old head who doesn't understand).  Due to the seating layout I wouldn't recommend this place for children - which is fine but it would have been nice to been informed that on the phone when I inquired. Decor was nice.   Drinks - my aunt and I can ordered bar drinks - wine for aunt, mixed for me. Drinks were great, expensive but I think the environment/location warranted it. Nothing too crazy.   Appetizers - Burnt Ends and Deviled Eggs. Burnt ends were good, BBQ sauce a little too sweet but overall really good,I'd order again. Bread that came with it was not really edible, kind of stale. Deviled eggs had crispy pancetta and caviar on them. Pancetta was too crispy like a hard bacon bit, it would have been better if it had a little more give to it. The caviar didn't really add much of anything, the filling was good.   Entrees - we all ordered the butter burger. Burger was good and butter taste was phenomenal. The sharp cheese wasn't melted on burger and wasn't the right type of cheese for a burger, they also gave two slices of cheese which was way too much for a sharp cheese andthat was the only disappointing factor. Spicy tots weren't spicy but they were yummy.   Service - service was slow but people were personable in there.   Next time I'm in Vegas I wouldn't come back but glad I tried it. Definitely a True hipster restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter burger. All good except the cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs. Pancetta way too hard!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt ends

rPi2I3z_VXuPly5Wt_KfXg.text: Obviously Yelp helped find this restaurant otherwise it would be hard to find it, we didn't know what to expect other than the reviews, reviews are not necesarily the best, some people have rated Carl's Junior as an "amazing" experience but this place lives up to the good reviews, we had th Burnt Ends, the chicken sandwich and the Pig&Fig flatbread which the chef burnt 2 times before giving is the right one, the waitress told us that they were social portions, 1-2 per person but in reality they are medium-full portions, my wife and I were stuffed with two and I have a big appetite, flavor wise the Burnt Ends are really good, they have a nice char on the outside and soft on the inside, the Chicken sandwich was very juice and flavorful, the tater tots are super good, the best i've had, and the flatbread was flavorful but not for everyone if you like sweet and salty flavors all at once, get it, overall I give this place 4 stars it is really good but not amazing, pricing is right, not expensive at all, it is a nice stop by in Vegas to get something good and different.  Note: They claim they change their menu 4 times a year, this is a good and a bad thing, don't go there because of the pictures, they might not have what you see, go there because on the 3 dishes I tried there was consistency and a lot of flavor.  I will come back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x_EK9ITpPLDfG0fe2LNO-w.text: This is always my favorite spot downtown! Great Lunch or dinner spot. I prefer going during lunch time since it's not as packed. Very easy to park, since there is parking (pay to park) right across the street. Anyway, first thing's first.....  you must try the BACON JAM!! It's super delish! You might also want to pair it with the mac n' cheese that they have. How about this, try putting bacon jam on top of your mac n' cheese and BOOM. This equals heaven. When it comes to drinks, I like drinking light so I had their sangria. It was perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam, Crispy Chicken Skins, and Mac and Cheese.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks are yummy at this joint.

Lalv_Ktw_d6M4TsLkpIcrw.text: Amazing amazing amazing and amazing!!  Very modern cute little restaurant. The decor is very hip and classy. I love it. I think they have seats outside and upstairs but were inside in the main area. We sat at a bar table with the kitchen right in front of us. I usually HATE watching my food being made but everything looked sanitary I didn't really mind. Everyone wore gloves when they prepared the food and washed Properly.   For foods; Cocoa-espresso NY steak-- delicious! Just the way I liked my steak made. Very tender, cooked medium rare but not deadly looking. The crust on the steak had a grill taste to it and the red wine demi gave it personality! one of the best steaks I ever had. It isn't a large portion though, I wish there was more meat to it!   Baked Mac & cheese-- secret ingredient was definitely Truffle! I know that amazing taste. Very very cheesy! They did not cheap out on the cheese. I loved how it was baked so the top had a nice crust on it giving it some texture when you eat it.   gyro tacos-- made with lamb but did not have that gamey taste that usually lamb has. There was a amazing yogurt sauce that gyros usually come with. It comes with 3 tacos and you wish it was 6! It is a nice size taco and not a miniature one. It really tasted like a taco even though it was lamb.   The staff were very attentive and checked in on us frequently but not bothersome. I definitely will be returning soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked mac &amp; cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocoa espressso NU steak
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro Tacos

ixtVQwNP5nGDhWECUVErqQ.text: Outstanding food. This small place is nicely styled with great views of their (open) kitchen. We just shared 3 apps and they were all superb: the devil's eggs (good), crispy chicken skins (better), and the BBQ burnt ends (best). I'll prob come back here to try dinner soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Skins - awesome flavor
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Burnt Ends - Boom!!!

d1eD3W0B9Lft5PKGw0w16w.text: I wandered in on a Monday afternoon with my better half. After standing awkwardly out front of Carson Kitchen trying to find the restaurant hours, one of the employees opened up the entrance door and welcomed us in. The place was pretty empty, so we decided to sit at the kitchen bar on high-top stools for a cool view of the chefs in action.  BAKED MAC & CHEESE ($12): I was initially dismayed by the small-ish portion size, but my eyes were bigger than my stomach. The mac & cheese is deceiving since it's so filling. I couldn't even finish the whole thing. For shame! Great flavor and thickness level is on point.   GYRO TACOS ($10): My husband gobbled these tacos right up and was really satisfied with this dish.  Worth a return visit? Yes! Carson Kitchen is a great local restaurant in DTLV.  Service was A-okay and the restaurant looked cool and trendy. I want to head back to try out more items on the menu for sure.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #45

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nP2STzd1_Bvj395wiByvgw.text: The service was great!  We called ahead to get our name on the list because it is a very desirable restaurant.  It opened 2 years ago.  Most of the items on menu are shareable because you order a la carte.  The sea bass was succulent and the expresso seasoned sirloin was delicious.  We ordered the beet salad, it came with pistachio covered goat cheese and mandarin oranges.  We also ate the chicken skin and honey as an appetizer. My daughter had the short rib grill cheese with tater tots.  It was very flavorful with a generous portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar service

os9opeH_R9SRGD9iHCv_ew.text: Service is really good, food is just ok We went for the gyro tacos specifically and they're ok but I think the lamb is really just Greek seasoning on ground beef Deviled eggs had caviar on them which the husband really liked Veal meatballs were slightly underdone but flavor was good More of a tapas place than restaurant

wNccC43jUslBdUp0ULId7Q.text: My family enjoyed a fantastic dining experience here. We ordered pretty much everything off the small plates menu as well as the Mac n cheese. Everything was delicious- we especially loved the gyro tacos, the Mac n cheese and ok so we loved it all  it's worth the trip off the busy strip for this gem ! Great restaurant, great food and wonderful fun staff.

7W0NMKanShJXZrR5fkz6Zg.text: Best meal we had on our trip to vegas! The shrimp was amazing! And our bartender Felicia was great!

g7HB4U2O79fPwtVizq5oHw.text: Here for an early lunch, the food is pretty standard fare. Drinks are good, service good, no major complaints.

ZFntnjVFk8IKbHy4bVru-g.text: We visited early on a Tuesday, so we were seated right away. I had read that they had a terrace, but we didn't get the option to sit outside. The table was tiny and the only seats were stools, which was terribly uncomfortable, especially for someone with back issues. these were the main reasons for subtracting a star.  The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable, and prompt - so no loss of stars for the service. I wasn't sure what to order to drink and the waiter was very helpful. I ended up with the sangria, which was tasty and strong.  We ordered the crispy chicken skins and "devil's" eggs to start. The skins were warm, crunchy, and absolutely delicious. It came with a honey for dipping, which was great since there was just a touch of spicy heat to the skins. The egg were seasoned just right and the caviar gave it a little 'pop'. I preferred the skins and my husband went for the eggs, but that is just a matter of preference, since they were both wonderful.   We decided to share the short rib grilled cheese, which was okay, but a bit bland, especially after the well-seasoned apps.   For dessert we shared the glazed donut bread pudding and it was awesome! Everything about it was delicious, including the creme anglais and the caramel sauce.   I would definitely recommend Carson Kitchen, and will be going back. Just a heads up - it doesn't have any outside signage, just the name painted in the bottom corner of the window. I almost missed it and I know what I was looking for.

Z8gab8Fzti7PvEsWtmooew.text: We stopped here for a quick bite on our way to the airport.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere and food.  As an architect I really enjoyed the materials used throughout and the exposed structural elements were well detailed.  The prefab  freezer wall material for the kitchen and bathrooms was a great touch.  We had the tri color cauliflower and watermelon with feta cheese appetizers.  Each was delicious.  I had the buttered burger and the remainder of my party had the grilled cheese with beef tips and the chicken sandwich.  The service and staff were very accommodating and very friendly.  Highly recommend this restaurant.  Next time I'm in town I'll definitely go back.

m12Ko2iv7v3XPpsMM7-JIw.text: Did not live up to it's hype.   I've heard about Carson Kitchen from many friends and coworkers which made it exciting when I finally decided to go. It's literally a little hole in the wall which I love, and the inside is small with a very cozy ambiance. We were seated at the corner of a large rectangular table, seats away from a couple.   We ordered the jalapeno poppers and the deviled eggs for appetizers. The deviled eggs were great (a little on the saltier side though) with large bits of bacon on top. The jalapeno poppers were larger than I would have liked. I had to use a fork and knife but would have rather popped small bites into my mouth. It also was not as cheesy as I was hoping for.   I ordered the buffalo chicken pizza and was very disappointed. For some reason it tasted more like a taco pizza. Although there were bits of chicken, I'm almost positive there was some ground beef on there too. Strange.  My friends ordered the NY strip steak and the baked mac and cheese. They weren't impressed by the steak but enjoyed the mac and cheese.   We had a male server who was great. Nothing to complain about the service.  I honestly won't be coming back because I wasn't impressed by the food, which was what I was really looking forward to trying. I took the pizza to go to originally bring it back to my roommate but I ended up giving it to a homeless man on Fremont St.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tater Tots and Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginormous Jalapeño Poppers
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Devil&#39;s&#34; Eggs

6JQ9T0U3zU-ONaGZtVpTMw.text: Well worth the Uber trip off the strip to eat here. The food is fabulous. Hubby and I got a selection of small plates including bacon jam, devil's eggs, veal meatballs, and beet salad. First of all, the bacon jam is awesome and tastes good on everything. You will have more bacon jam than you can use up with the accompanying bread, so I highly recommend putting it on everything else you order. It makes everything taste better :) We also got a couple of desserts to try, although we couldn't finish them. The donut bread pudding is divine and so is the fudge brownie. There was not a misstep in the bunch. Definitely go out of your way to try this place. It's worth it!

bbL-66g8Nt23X3MoOHfbHA.text: You really can't go wrong with this place. The plates are on the small side so sharing is encourage, but you probably won't want to. I've only been here a few times but I've noticed the menu has changed very slightly with each visit.   Last night we ordered the crispy chicken skins, rainbow cauliflower, shrimp dunderi, and jerk turkey burger. The chicken skins are served with smoked honey and oh so addictive. They are best enjoyed fresh as they can become slightly hard and chewy if you leave them sitting towards the end of your meal. The cauliflower was crunchy, lemony, and refreshing. The shrimps were huge and the dunderi was pillowy perfection. It's basically gnocchi that is made with cheese rather than potatoes. Need I say more? The turkey burger was the real highlight of last night's meal. The patty was huge and juicy. I totally forgot that it was turkey! The sweetness from the mango chutney slaw complemented it so well, I wish it had more.   I'd love to see this place expand to a larger locations. Not a huge fan of communal seating since I'm a lefty and always end up bumping someone's elbow. It's a small price to pay for delicious food. I'll be back!

a_oP8nMkj84XmkPXe8Oh3g.text: AMAZING FOOD!!!  Great atmosphere and near the Fremont Street Experience which is so unique and different from the strip.  Make reservations as it's busy.  Specifically ask for rooftop seating.  It was so worth it!!  BBQ burnt ends:  MUST HAVE.  FANTASTIC.  The pickles were AMAZING. Bacon jam:  Delicious and adds well to other plates.   Gyro tacos:  PHENOM!! Filet-ohhh-fish:  Friend liked it but a bit salty for my taste.  Large burger. Young beets:  NEED TO GET THIS SO GOOD. Black rice and oxtail risotto:  Mild flavored but delicious nonetheless.  The bacon jam tastes so good with this. Baked mac and cheese:  SO cheesy!!!  And tastes AMAZING with the bacon jam! Wild mushroom flatbread:  Unique but tasty!  Mushroom was smokeyish tasting and the onions are a bit sour so if you like that, this is it for you!    The magarian (drink):  Very, VERY GOOD.  Very clean, fresh and such a nice summer drink!  Rainbow cauliflower was sold out but that made me want to eat it more.  Had 5 people and this filled us to the point where we were having breathing problems.  Here's where you'll ask how much it is.  About $54/person with alcohol, food, and tip included!  Service was AMAZING.  Everyone was super friendly, super helpful and super nice.  (I love the word super, apparently).  Experience was amazing!!!  Will come back!!

Goozt7NqK_erLaYa3yyRww.text: We decided to give Carson Kitchen another try for our anniversary. I am so very glad we did! Our server Bridgett was sweet, well informed, personable and gave us very good service. My husband ordered the drink "Communication Breakdown" and it was delicious with a flavor we have never tasted before. It was excellent. Unique, smoky & delicious. Bacon Jam w/ baked brie & toast for our appetizer. Rich, delicious and perfect before we had what I would call the best Salmon I have ever had  in a restaurant. The Salmon with Spinach Pistou and charred lemon. This was off the charts good and I want to commend the cook for NOT over cooking our salmon!! It was cooked perfectly. Outside had a nice crust on it and it tasted fantastic. Ending this fantastic meal with The Glazed Donut Bread Pudding was just another aha moment as to why Carson Kitchen is the place to eat downtown with their unique menu as well as skilled individuals making the food. We will be back soon! Can't wait to eat here again. Thanks for making our night great!

a6lyzhPABbeWil_8dFf8Bg.text: Last night was the second time I've been to Carson Kitchen. It was amazing, yet again! I called early in the afternoon to make a reservation for 2 at 8pm. Unfortunately they don't do small party reservations. The hostess told me to call about 10 min before arriving to ask about the wait. We arrived around 8:15pm and told the wait was 1 hour. We went to the upstairs bar and ordered "cashme ousside" (double rye whiskey, bitters, eggwhites, ancho Reyes and fresh lemon). It was refreshing, and light. We were seated around 9:30pm. Service was quick, after ordering we waited maybe 15-20 min for our food. We ordered the butter burger, gyro tacos, and the bacon jam. I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone - whether you're a Vegas local or visiting.

lkueeRMA1i0DH7U58G9yUQ.text: My 20th time here. My favorite downtown.   Watermelon salad and jerk turkey burger are my go to's but there's so many great items on the menu.   Beer menu is far above average for a downtown lunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Turkey Burger. Melts in one&#39;s mouth.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heaven.... I mean spicy tatter tots.

BQJTrIgy0CPWZvv15eKhdQ.text: Seriously. I can't stand Vegas and I haven't had a good meal since I arrived two days ago, but Carson Kitchen changed everything! The food was amazing! I was eating alone (sorry- Mom- you should have come!) and happened to be at the end of the bar, so I got to not only see everything that came out, I even got some yummy samples ;)  The beet salad was amazing, chicken skins, tater tots, gyro tacos and the cauliflower all rocked! Ethan (the director of operations) was the expo right next to where I was sitting and he was super friendly and helpful.  Seriously, this place is delicious!

hxZ_vI06nAIX6YeHk8cZuw.text: This place. YES!!!!!! Best food and experience ever!!! Eating out when you travel for work goes hand in hand. But this has been one of the best restaurants ever! Everything was absolutely amazing. GO AND ENJOY!

TZyM43wLA2PlsCerq08pFA.text: Incredible food, great atmosphere, friendly staff. The bread pudding is stupid good, best I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n5xwWz650pSfpLsH4_uVNw.text: What a treasure! So glad we found this place on yelp. We started with  cocktails, creatively crafted by Liberty on the rooftop bar. My Usual gin and tonic was supplanted by a sublime concoction of honey, gin, cucumber and thyme.  We shared the tempura green beans, which were lightly fried and salted and accompanied by a delectable dipping sauce. We then split the turkey burger that was crunchy, tangy, sweet and well seasoned and matched with spicy tater tots. Hip, fun and friendly - what more could you ask for??

cO7kW7BhqKU4yXtl08uVBw.text: I don't know...I heard good things about this place when I lived in Vegas but for the price it was extremely disappointing. I ordered the tomato soup which tasted like tomato hot sauce from a bottle. The meat/steak had a lot of fat throughout the whole thing which made it hard to eat, and they cut it slanted to make it look like you're getting more when you're not.  The staff is friendly and the environment is cool but it was expensive and not that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $8 and spicy (tomato soup)
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uhogzkvbFe2EL_hTQGTcGw.text: Fantastic food service and vibe - I love the drinks - the Brie and bacon jam. Honestly I think they have the best burger in Las Vegas! Also the Mac and cheese will leave you smiling.   It can get busy on weekend and dinner time - try and call in advance and see what the wait time is. I bring in my guests from out of town to get them off the strip and show them other parts of Vegas . Carsons kitchen is always a favorite!

boSBJhlucPMw8iqAVAIGBA.text: Fun atmosphere for a group dinner, with great service and menu showed creativity that made it an enjoyable experience.  Each item ordered, offered a flavorful surprise to its preparation which kept us wanting more.  Artichoke hearts lacked the meat to them that I'm use to, but the deviled eggs that followed were superb.

460gHWq6a-Sup0gzxAiYcg.text: LOVE this place. Food was delicious! Interesting items. High quality. Beautiful presentation. The flavors were excellent! My tongue was thoroughly tickled.   Service was great. And I like the look and ambience. Unfinished ceilings, lighting, textures, varied dimensions in tables and seating.  I haven't been this happy about a place in a while. Well deserved max stars.  Ordered: bacon jam, chicken skin, mussels, bread pudding.

PrzAOMQoRdyneZ7YlWN2Yw.text: This is a hipster place with hipster food. I liked it -- the only thing I didn't like was the cost.  Dishes were on the pricey side, but I guess still technically under the "$$" (two dollar sign) category for Yelp.  Bacon Jam -- 3 stars. It was good, and more than half of our group liked it, but I thought it was only OK. It's like bacon but sweetened into a jam. You can ask for additional bread, but they WILL charge you for the extra bread.  Tempura Green Beans -- 4 stars. Good, but probably not worth the calories.  Crispy Chicken Skins -- 4 stars. Good, but IMO not worth the calories.  Gyro Tacos -- 4 stars. Tasty, but for $11 you get only 3 small tacos.  Baked Mac & Cheese -- 4 stars. Good, super cheesy and creamy, but I would've liked some additional oomph -- would've been 5 stars with some crunchy topping and some bacon!  Donut Bread Pudding -- 5 stars. Delicious and decadent. The donut had a crispy crust that was delightful.

ud40N59qGJZq9sYWrDuQwg.text: Truly my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I go every time I am there. Incredible atmosphere and I love the shareable/community menu! Very unique menu that offers you the ability to try something new and different without being "too out there". I have tried nearly everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. The entire staff is amazing and provide great recommendations and overall wonderful service! You will not be disappointed!

PYYOwaPCrvs9v-evR86BYQ.text: Showed up during dinner rush on a Thursday, hung in the bar for a bit (drinks were on point) Then migrated back to the fire pit to wait. We were asked by several passing servers if we needed anything while we waited.  When we got to our table we ordered and food began coming out quickly, between the table we ordered half of the menu and it was all ridiculously good! We will be back for sure

OA_8O8PXoVOpjHwEDtRw1g.text: Omg... Mac and cheese, mushroom flatbread... mushroom everything. Literally everything was perfect or beyond expectations. Cannot recommend this place enough.

MiH1GJYkjxw2VDx5FQsGVQ.text: Man o man. This place is bringing some heat   Open kitchen concept which is hella dope so we can see them cooking. We had one of everything literally it was all bomb. Must come if your downtown Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar

4Qg8EMJHbsH6dZ1cKLo0QQ.text: Came to town for the weekend with a group of friends, and through a recommendation, came to Carson's Kitchen.    The food is fantastic, as is the service!  We ordered several dishes to share and but some of my personal favorite apps were the Black Rice Risotto with Oxtail, and the Burnt Ends.  For the main course, the Red Snapper and Chicken Thighs were simply amazing.  We finished off the meal with a couple deserts, and couldn't get enough Bourbon Fudge Brownie.    I couldn't recommend this place enough, great atmosphere, great drinks, and as mentioned, the food was absolutely delicious.

yYt5wrqd4kP4P49cIk-d5Q.text: Omg! Found this place randomly on our way to our Airbnb!! Great atmosphere here friendly staff and great food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Demolished!!

1jusvt8SF9-cA5ppQ6Wlsw.text: Trendy atmosphere, cool menu, definitely would recommend. The only downside is finding parking, and the wait, but other than that- try this place out.

iyXpIstb6s68ODSqsS3v2A.text: If you like bad service, pretensiousness, and overly friendly slaps on the shoulder, then this is the place for you. Try their supremely burned "bacon jam" or the overpriced cocktails that you get hassled for sending back because the bartender learned how to make drinks at margaritaville. I returned a drink because i asked for it to be "not so sweet" but this thing was drowning in sweet n sour mix. Returned it, then waited 30 minutes for THE EXACT SAME DRINK to be poured in a different glass and they thought i wouldnt notice. Yeah i noticed, but im done making a damn scene over a bad cocktail. Screw this place. Jerkoff staff, rude hostesess (made snyde remarks to both myself and my father in law), and supremely overpriced for what you get.   The only reason they arent getting a 1 star is because their steak and shrimp were okay.  Dont pay to "inconvenience" these people. They are too busy for you...

o9mzZqudbxH30ieJp1mBgQ.text: One of the best burgers and steak in town. Rabbit Ragu is good but portion is small. Crispy chicken skins is crazy good--would definitely be interested in their take on fried chicken if they made one.

WK9Dsf9cdLmfyQ5rDvrxPg.text: Food was great!  Great atmosphere. Loved the Chicken skins!!! Service excellent friendly server.  Also tried the chicken thighs and beet salad. Come with friends and share. Most dishes come as 2 or 3 pieces so if your with a party of 4 difficult to split and share. Can't say enough praise regarding food quality will definitely come back.

uuJGbdeSbJ8eJYOPt47fxQ.text: Came here with our 10 year old and we all loved it. We got burnt ends, gyro tacos, beets, chicken skins, oxtail risotto, and some tater tots. Everything was great, service is friendly and cocktails are excellent.

0iaMCuLtE3p1LfdVJp9bzQ.text: Simple dishes but creative, delicious and worthy of a return. I had the black rice and oxtail risotto and hubby had the espresso rubbed New York steak both dishes were perfectly seasoned and cook. This was my 4-5th time (surprised to see I didn't have any reviews) at this juncture and the service and quality always deliver. The chimichurri dallioped over the rich creamy risotto was the cherry on the top - awesome blend of olive oil with permeating flavors of parsley, cilantro, shallots and then some. The generous slivers of buttery oxtail was the perfect ratio to starch. His steak was also amazing - unconventionally rubbed with cocoa and espresso (?) - fired just right to his liking and was "well - rested". This place, did I mention is perfect for sharing. We wanted to get some rainbow cauliflower but our belly whiny allow it. Funny story how we ended up here, if I may. We actually left "Jerry's Nugget" - ditched our table at the cafe after sitting there for 20mins waiting for our waiter to take our order... on a very slow day no less. We intended to get the mammoth 30oz prime rib and a Greek staple called spanakopita (mine of course). I'm glad we made the switch. We would have spent the same amount of cash for a less memorable meal and ecky service. Carson Kitchen never disappoints- the late chef Kerry Simon's legacy lives on! Ohh and we also sat by the chefs prep area which was a visual treat. A dance like no other

st8u75Y6f0sp6Jqslda7rg.text: My boyfriend and I came here looking for a nice quiet meal away from the lights and buffet tables, and I sincerely wished we had saved our money.   Our experience started with a snobby host who balked at our request to sit up on the patio roof. Our waitress (who in all honesty seemed to be having a rough night) was crass, overly familiar, and inattentive. The food was almost inedibly over-seasoned, and for our $100 tab, the only saving grace was the booze.   We tried the crispy green-beans (good), the chicken skins (awful. so over-seasoned and chewy), the steak (cooked okay but drowning in what tasted like soy sauce), and the cauliflower (inedible. seriously the lemon was so strong it burned).  My boyfriend made the observation that this place really wants to do fine, innovative dining, but had absolutely no idea how to go about it. Our grumpy waitress made a few off-hand comments about "trouble in the kitchen" and how this place "sucks", so perhaps our experience was the result of a truly awful night. That doesn't change the fact that we had to have a rather awful date night with them...  The atmosphere was lovely, the cocktails were well made, but I would steer clear of the food and staff.

knR2F2ExFQehEAeBFXW7Ww.text: Hands down the best place to eat in Vegas. Small, out of the way, fresh, delicious, friendly. Everything that is so rare in Vegas in the one place!  I come to Vegas for work quite often and the discovery of Carson Kitchen makes the whole experience a little more bearable!

WH-LV_p5a25oNpFgmmZ1IQ.text: Great experience at Carson's Kitchen. We split the Turkey Burger and tri-colored cauliflower salad, both were amazing. Also try the fried chicken skins they are addicting.  Excellent lunch, highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ace Apple Cider &amp; very cool open kitchen.

Ek0HzW7VwlTuRgGXxzmnjQ.text: Getting one star due to horrible service by our server. Great beginning with a great bartender as we waited for our table. As soon as we sat down, service was awful. I ordered a gin and tonic and NEVER received it. My water glass was completely empty as he walked by with two pitchers of water. He barely said "good night" to us.  Food was okay, but not worth the horrible service. Won't be going back.

4xdqSPnF-aoXW1LJw_ZNIQ.text: Warning!! Worst review ever ahead. The food here is God damned delicious!! I'm not specific because I think I've had everything on the menu almost. Weather permitting, try to sit on the upstairs patio. That is all. Just go to Carson and enjoy the amazing culinary of Las Vegas. Great times we're living in!

GhT5oVsynryU5GbztvwGrQ.text: Good experience. The food is very good and unique. It's got a cool ambiance. It's like American tappas so plan on sharing with your party. The place is kind of small so unless you come with about 6 people you'll be eating at the bar. Hipsters will love it if it hasn't already become too main stream.

lkutfgCeSPbPyMkTxdXoPQ.text: This place works for me.  Small, casual, laid back tapas (why does saying this word make me feel like a wannabe hipster) joint with variety of options most but not all with a Southern lean.  The plates come out pretty quick so it's easy to pace yourself.  The chicken skins are like cracklin that tastes like fried chicken, i.e. dey good.  Bacon jam, burnt ends, mac&cheese = tasty.  Mini tacos, coffee crusted steak and turkey burger all good but not great.  Place works best with small group or even for two with a fat attitude because you'll want to try a chunk of the menu.

c_wz_Q0SJnBR7jnYmXpIBg.text: Perfect location on the brim of downtown and not in the middle of the cray cray bars - if you like to avoid giant groups of young drunk people. If you prefer that scene, it's only a block or two away. The service is exceptional and the menu is fantastic.   I've been here a couple of times now so I can safely say the mac n cheese, the mushroom flatbread, the gyro tacos and the Fried Green Tomato sandwich are all FABULOUS. Right - I didn't eat all of that in one visit. Stop judging me... I like food.  On a nice evening you can sit on the roof and enjoy our lovely Vegas weather with a beautiful bar and staff members that will suggest the perfect brew for your tastebuds.  Can't wait to take out of towners here.

-BRxXj_eAc212lan258NfQ.text: Great meal, loved the fresh in season ingredients!!  Manny our waiter was outstanding.  Definitely a return trip when in town.

Gy8UgRa7U5YU1CJI_ECGZg.text: What a great restaurant!  Excellent people working there. So nice and accommodating. The service was attentive with fun servers. The food was so yummy, it was amazing!  I'm so glad we found this place since we were hanging out at Fremont for the evening. The next time we get back there, it's a no brainer on where I'm going to eat!  Well done!!

-y-igAoOflCx0DRx4WCJlQ.text: Simply delicious and creative, with a great atmosphere. It is nearby Fremont St., and is a welcome reprieve from the busy atmosphere of all the casinos.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken skins, strawberry salad and

RkqJR95Mn5otMjrGAQJXEw.text: This place knows what's up. Great friendly atmosphere and great food and a hard working staff that did an amazing job, packed into a small restaurant in Downtown Las Vegas. Been wanting to try this place for awhile and glad I followed through with it.  Got there around 1:30. Place was packed. Immediately greeted by a smiling face and felt welcome from the second we walked in. She took us over to two seats at the bar. Greeted by the bartender in a timely manner, very friendly. She got our drinks and kinda read the situation, we haven't opened our menus, talking to eachother, as I hadn't seen this friend in awhile and we met out front of the restaurant so literally just catching up with her for the first time in awhile. Bartender gave us time to catch up and then we started to glance at the menus. Wanted one of everything! Haha. Ended up getting a few of the apps and a watermelon feta cheese salad. Food came out in timely manner and was explained when it was dropped off which is always a nice touch.  All in all this place has got it goin on. Great job, everyone from the food runner to the hostess. Great job.

5zG2Cn3BX_bmQKPRzcaqsA.text: A must go place! We come here in all our trips to Vegas!  The food is so good!  Atmosphere amazing roof top bar a must! Short ribs grill cheese!

Jh2jprugnH_0A06HXBXj9w.text: Ate here last night with a group of friends celebrating a birthday and this place certainly did not disappoint. Between 8 of us we shared an order of Gyro Taco's, Bacon Jam, BBQ Burnt Ends, Sea bass, NY Strip, Black Rice Oxtail Risotto, and the Crispy Chicken Skins w/ Honey. Then my best friend and I split the Butter Burger. Everything was absolutely delicious. I could have done without the Chicken Skins, but other than that, everything was incredibly flavorful, decent portion sizes to reflect the price, very friendly servers who were very knowledgeable about each item on the menu. (Bianca was our server). The atmosphere of this place is so relaxing. It's a smaller place, making it more intimate and calm. Awesome lighting and decor. Can't wait to go back!

XiEflSgpMShQ2Fc1fO7Guw.text: Let's just start with this: DTLV is really underrated - so people, get down there. There's more to LV than the Strip.   Now, let's talk Carson Kitchen. HOLY S#IT. We had heard good things, so on our recent trip, we knew we were going to carve out a day for DTLV and Carson Kitchen would be on the agenda. Can I just say that THE best way to kick off a night in DTLV is here?!  We ordered drinks first - of course. From there, we knew it was only to get better, but you MUST try the Get Shorty and the Driving with the Ms. UNBELIEVABLE...and paired so well with our social plates. It was an act of God to pull me away from the bar and not order a 3rd/4th.  Sarah, our AMAZING bartender/server, was super helpful because we were pouring over the menu and being greedy little piggies...I was hell bent on ordering 3 social plates, a side of Mac 'n Cheese, and possibly a 4th social plate. She told me to slooooow my roll...it would be way too much for us and that if we were still in the market for more, we could always order another plate or two. Thank you for saving me, Sarah.  Bacon Jam: Sugar and spice and everything nice...I love EVERYTHING about this and would spread it on the toes of a stranger, walking barefoot on the strip, and gladly eat it again.   Gyro Tacos: My husband devoured - to be truthful, I was 3 bites into one (of our 4) before he swooped in to take care of the rest. The flavor of the lamb was perfect, the shell/pita was soft and chewy - perfectly done.   Chicken Skins: I can't even deal...nor will I EVER look at chicken skin the same again. Ever. Slightly spicy (not hot), paired with the sweetness of the honey. It's like crack in chip form.   Needless to say, we waddled out - sans Mac 'n Cheese - totally in love. We've found our new FAVORITE LV restaurant - hands down.   Keep up the great work, CK. We'll see you again next year!

Edqf-1g-DAKUOWHgWKOSEg.text: This is my all time new favorite restaurant in the world! I had the cocoa-expresso NY strip and my hubby had the Butter Burger. The best part is dessert, and I have never had anything so delicious that I still dream about it to this day....the donut bread pudding! I'm sure I am 100 times more likely to die of. Heart attack in the next 3 years because of it but if I do it was well worth it! There were so many interesting things to eat, we couldn't fit them all in one trip so, of course, we had to go back to try them all!  The chicken skins were so good. If you like pork rinds, you will love the chicken skins. Not one bit of greasiness and the seasoning is so good. Not salty with a bit of spiciness. We had the bacon jam as well. It's made with jalapenos so it may be too hot for some people but it was good, I just thought it was hard to pair with the food we were trying to sample. The staff is friendly and helpful. The kitchen and restaurant is clean and has a uniqueness that make this place stand out.  It just  feels like home.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skins and the jalapeño bacon jam with Brie.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tq-xMdfECA_TDqOtnWE28A.text: The drinks, food & service were great. We visited during a menu transition so some items we wanted to try weren't available to eat and drink. What we did order was divine!!   The tempura green beans & Mac and cheese were the table favorites. Everyone also enjoyed some spicy shrimp appetizer, the mushroom flat bread and the burger w/ spicy tots (the burger was HUGE). We ordered 5 plates to share and it was too much food. We should have only ordered 3.   The cool vibe of bigger bar tables is fun but it's hard to share the table with other parties sitting elbow to elbow. I was seated next to a party of 2 who ordered multiple appetizers, which gave me very little room for my plate, let alone my drink & flatware. We could have sat on the patio but it was too hot out. Elbow to elbow is the lesser of two evils.  I'd recommend this place for sure!! It's a nice break from the typical noisy, tacky and bigger Vegas spots we've tried!! Just beware, it's kind of hard to find.

5sNE_VwjLF6vAjdS2g9ItQ.text: Had the butter burger, perfect, my squeeze had the turkey burger, excellent. We had the burnt ends and rainbow cauliflower really good, hipster vibe which I'm good with, oh this was for lunch not sure of the dinner vibe. Great spot highly recommended.

iZmQRONieoNWI355w190Hg.text: We ate here for lunch a few days ago and while everything tasted great and we enjoyed our lunch, I felt quite sick later that night and thought I may have eaten contaminated food.  I called the next morning to report that I was quite sick and wondered if they had received other complaints and the woman who answered told me the owner would call me back.  I never received a return call, however when I posted my experience about this, the owner immediately sent me an apologetic note and gave me some information about contaminated food and informed me that they have never had a complaint so I am re-writing my earlier post. The owner seemed very earnest and likely did not receive the message from his employee.

60IR-xQ2lYbpNJV_O6csuw.text: Original flavors and a fun atmosphere. I enjoyed the Mac and cheese, watermelon salad, sea bass, and spicy turkey burger. More than enough food for two to share. Will return with friends.

86-IutJROeV5fuqg-nnlVw.text: It was awesome.  We had several entrees and shared.  Lamb tacos Tempura green beans Sloppy Joe's Risotto wild rice  If we are passing through again we will make it a point to go back for more.  Nice ambiance and great presentation!

BpaU8EE-9kelyW4alq9r7w.text: Every thing from top to bottom was amazing. The food was an iron fist wrapped in a velvet glove. Casual but but flawless. Exceeding expectations. Who ever the chef is he deserves a raise!! Service was also quite pleasant. Friendly and unobtrusive, like a summer breeze. We will definitely be going back. A True gem in downtown.

Xqm2ITzsqyoQfKSGOnNnwQ.text: We need more restaurants like this: Great Service Great Food Constantly updating their menu with the season. Eat at a table, the bar or the Chefs bar and watch them cook in the kitchen.  They have a great patio upstairs as well which is great for this time of year. From Veal Meatballs with a Foie Gras Sauce to Killer Crispy Shrimp this place has plenty to choose from for anyone.

-Wrem9YhU6CsW0phPvcNsA.text: Unbelievable!!! The creepy guy behind the grill ain't so bad! By far the best meal in Vegas!!!

TrdVA8dhYeWO7gYFQ3GVEQ.text: Food is really good. Service at the bar is terrible.  Red head Bartender with cardigan has no personality.  Not once did she check and see how things were.  Acted like she didn't care about a thing.  Bacon jam is killer.  Donut bread pudding awesome.

S1pyzzlfu8KAR5rsjvirUA.text: Loved the food, we started off with the bacon jam.  The truffle (oops, that is a secret) Mac and cheese was our favorite, then the turkey burger, which was okay.  Our least favorite was the brocolli salad, just kinda bland.  The burger comes with tater tots!  The ambiance is nice. The seating is different.  We were at a table for six, there were three of us.  These tables have hard bottom short stools, no back, to sit upon.  If you are coming in alone or as a couple, they sit you at the bar table, which is in kinda a u-shape and strangers sit across from you.  Those chairs/stools have backs and are taller.  We want to go back and try other items some day.  Hiked outside of Red Rock park, calico basin road, and hiked past Ash Canyon Creek, it's called Gateway Saddle to canyon.....this morning (under gloomy foggy skies, but nonetheless incredibly beautiful.

8t9h6azecfxbzHpkXec4nQ.text: I was really excited about coming here... Unfortunately it left much to be desired. First off... The drinks weren't very good at all. I believe there was just one out of the four we tried that we liked on the cocktail menu. The wine was okay as well... The beet salad was over priced and way too small. I'm vegan and wish there was more on the menu. Everyone else seemed to like the food a lot... The bacon jam was a hit for the table and the burgers looked interesting. The service was a little slow. I waited fifteen min for a glass of wine. The location is small but I did like the seating to be totally honest, which is what everyone else seemed to complain about. I would give it another shot, maybe for lunch with a different bartender.

3oSmSBalzMv5czR2SunXqg.text: What can I say... Awesome restaurant! Food is awesome but give your self a treat have a drink or two, the bartender is the best.

KXRq_awM2dQSg6ZoRO8f4A.text: A hidden gem! This place is worth the wait. We received the best service and the food was amazing! It's worth the trek into downtown Vegas. Ordered the deviled eggs (yelp.com/biz_photos/cars...), jalapeno poppers, gyro tacos, bison meatloaf sliders. All were winners! This place is a must try and can't wait to try it again next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 come in an order
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brewers fix
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Towns End. Slow &amp; low whiskey, fernet vittone, amaro del sole, regan&#39;s bitters #6, angostura bitters.

BdlS7wwU5mbvPsggfOZrKg.text: Talk about being taken to a different place! The atmosphere the ambiance was just SUPER chill and welcoming!   We dined up on the rooftop and there were about 10 of us. Without skipping a beat, the service was OUTSTANDING!! The drink, wine, beer menu was EXCELLENT! The food, was BLATANTLY AMAZING!!!! Dakota was our Server and was a BLAST with us and took everything in stride with a smile and a laugh with an occasional hilarious commentary!   But back to the food, just WOW! Tater tots and all were GREAT!! This is a MUST place to be on your list!!!

xy2kItnRQ5EqZkt3WZswfQ.text: I wish to eat here every night. Cozy, sophisticated, delicious. Our server was funny, cool, and engaged. She was professional and personable. Sitting at the kitchen bar, had opportunity to chat with garde manger and learn about the food. Great, non-Spanish style tapas. Tapas Americana with a nod to global flavors and dishes. Try: veal meatballs and bacon spread.

K4SdNZyXlZVWRSM4-w7I0g.text: A truly unique dining experience. Both the drink menu and food menu items are extremely well thought out and creative. Whenever we go we end up spending hours there without realizing it. The food is delivered as it is ready and it is the type of place where you share plates. Every server we have had has been very warm and accommodating. I recommend the bacon jam, the green beans, the beef sliders and the mac n cheese. You can expect a wait to be seated, but the place has two bars and there are several others on the block.

ejIp4FZ8MJr6AiFhWnS8kg.text: Wow! This was the best choice of where to eat on the whole trip. I think I tried nearly everything on the menu. Nothing was disappointing. I would say the food is innovative, interesting and damn tasty!! I had a great time here and will recommend it to everyone who is headed to Vegas. The service was also very attentive, personal and friendly. Great little find, a must try.

wVfxAi9UXLqHjWOOehNqqg.text: I like their concept, good interior. But all food was too spicy (we had a BBQ jam, cauliflower and NY strip).

g6N3Q1BzTqUF717AucOcLQ.text: The wait was really long but this place was so highly recommended, we waited. I gotta say, I've never spent so much money in my life at a restaurant, and left so hungry. I don't feel like I'm a cheap person when it comes to food, I'm really willing to go all out for a special occasion, but we spent nearly $60 here and left seriously very hungry. I'd be happy with the expense if it was amazing food, but it was just.... Meh. I got the seared scallops and they were cold and sort of fishy. And it was literally 3 bites of food, so I sort of felt like a fool for working out all week and saving up my calories. Only reason I'm leaving 2 stars was the drink I ordered was just superb. I don't often order cocktails but it was worth every penny and I loved it. Food was very.... Meh.  We went to jack in the box after. The buttery jack was probably more enjoyable than my 3 scallops.

gRrEoyFrEzFGTLkKb7aHiw.text: We found them on Yelp and the staff was so welcoming to this establishment. The meal was off the hook and helped me pair a nice wine. I will come back when I go to Vegas again

UwZu7vOKZYJdWPcbNff95Q.text: Delicious and right next to Donut Bar. Bring some $$$$ because this little place is not cheap.

0pr73_P1jvz5juMnPzsLRQ.text: We hit this place every time we visit Vegas! It never disappoints. All the food is excellent. Be sure to get the chicken chicharones. It's also fun to sit at the counter if you get the chance.

eSLDwuhrWxGN295lFMDUdw.text: I'd give this place eleventy billion stars if I could. For starters, the music was AMAZING. I finally asked what station it was: The 1975 radio. We split a bunch of shared plates. The Mac and cheese was perfection, the green beans were perfectly crispy, the deviled eggs were amazing and creamy, and gyro tacos got two thumbs up. Wasn't crazy about the Brie and bacon jam, but everything else was A+. The white sangria with peach puree is haunting my dreams because it was SO DELICIOUS. My aunt said her burger was "probably the best burger I've ever had." Our server was so knowledgeable and fun. Will definitely come back and order everything on the menu.

V7X47f2luIxrunZIqeUd_w.text: OMG!!  Food is delicious! We ordered a few items to share.  My favorite was the beet salad and my husband had the jerked turkey burger.  Yummy and we practically liked the plates clean.  Highly recommend!

wTbqGMn663YqoYxAiKnxiA.text: I loved my experience here!  When I found myself in the Freemont Street area on a Friday night I turned to Yelp for restaurant suggestions.  The reviews were spot on.  Carson Kitchen is amazing.   We were happy that there was no wait to be seated.  This was because we were OK with being seated at one of the communal tables.  Even though they are shared tables, you still have your own space and a decent amount of privacy.  We were in the back corner of the restaurant which gave us a great view of the fun scene that unfolds in this restaurant. The server was friendly and informative.  She gave us plenty of information without being pushy or rude.  When we had questions, she answered them politely.  This was very helpful as we weren't sure how much and what to order.  She suggested 1-2 plates per person.   We ordered the bacon jam to share, I ordered the tempura green beans and my dining companion ordered the jerk turkey burger.   Food is brought out as it is ready (instead of in a specific order, like a salad or appetizer first).   Everything we tried was phenomenal.  The bacon jam was totally unique and totally amazing.  A great combination of sweet and savory.  It included the bacon jam and some spreadable cheese on top.  It is served with bread.  The only slight down side is that I did wish it came with more bread,  You can order extra for $1 or so.  But you can also eat the jam by the spoonful (it is that good).  It does take awhile to cool.  The green beans were served with a cream cheese/hot pepper spread.  The beans had a crispness to them and the amount of breading on them was perfect.  I came hungry and was totally satisfied with splitting the bacon jam and eating the green beans.  My dining companion had the jerk turkey burger and commented that it was one of the tastiest she's ever had. An all around wonderful experience.

U6g8aJkoSvX8hD0lwMJvDQ.text: We came to Carson Kitchen as part of the Lip Smacking Foodie Downtown tour. Honestly we probably would have never come in here if it weren't for the tour. It's a Little hidden and not very visible from the busier streets, but it's only a block away from Fremont St.  I am so happy that this place was on our tour!!! It's amazing! Service was friendly and excellent! The food? The food!!!! The food made me do a happy dance! It was delicious! A modern take on some of my personal "southern" favorites! Definitely try the Crispy Chicken Skins, Devils Eggs, and the Roasted Young Beets. Also had the veal Meatballs which we pretty tasty too! Give it a try, you will NOT be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Meatballs
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Young Beets
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Skins

vebMFxPe9gub8yn1wtvipg.text: This was my first time in Vegas and I wanted the whole experience so I researched places off the Strip and Carson's Kitchen came highly recommended - and definitely did not disappoint.   The dining space isn't really big but is comfortable. My date and I were able to dine at the bar and watch the chefs cook in their open kitchen. The food was served in small plate portion sizes which I liked so I could sample more things. The gyro tacos and mac and cheese were SO good. The staff was super nice and attentive. Pricing is definitely reasonable for the quality of food.   I can't wait to go back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Swear Jar at the Bar
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and Cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro Tacos

iV6nSWafQhynrH6Hu4tAdw.text: I absolutely loved Carson Kitchen . We came in on a Saturday date night and had a wonderful time . Our sever was amazing , our service was great and the ambiance was perfect for an adult evening . The server explained the menu to us , suggesting we order a few items and share them . Perfect idea . We were able to try several items on the menu , which was awesome . My favorite - the bacon jam , the mushroom flatbread and caviar deviled eggs . Amazing.

mXB84caQE7c39rpdWe_4IQ.text: This is a smaller, quaint restaurant so as everyone else advises, definitely make a reservation during peak times/weekends. There are a plethora of food choices and we went with the burnt ends, filet oh fish sandwich, and the butter burger with non spicy tater tots and a salad. The burnt ends were so tender and juicy and coming from KC where the BBQ is to die for, I was throughly impressed. It came with some toast and pickles that weren't as 'pickly' as we were expecting. Tasted like mildly flavored cucumber instead, but still killed it. Both entrees were good, we kept joking around saying the burger was A PERFECT burger bc it came out and you could see each ingredient between the bun, perfectly and everything was lined up, evenly. The salad was so fresh and I loved the vinaigrette it came with.    The service was on point. Our server was fun and even when he was off doing something else, someone else ran us our food and he, too was pleasant!   Our check came out in a book, with little notes and greetings written inside. Super cute.   All in all! Definitely worth checking out. I love the downtown area and this place embodies why

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Da perfect burger and non spicy tots
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet oh fish sammich with side salad

1Wpr-Gk7ed9r82kYcjJcpA.text: Im so glad we finally got away from the strip to try out Carson Kitchen.  Not only was the food great, but the prices are really reasonably. The staff does a fantastic job tying it all together with their friendliness and fun attitude.  Luckily we sat at the front bar right in front of the kitchen.  They don't take reservations so I guess we just got lucky. I cant wait to go back and try more dishes. Maybe next time even check out the roof top patio in the mean time here are some must get items...  The best of the bunch: Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip and at only $19 its a steal!
