Top apps: Veal Meatballs and "Devil's" Eggs (with caviar) yum...$8-12 what! Other tasty treats: Crispy Chicken Skins and the BLT Salad  All you visitors to LV, break away from the strip and check out Carson Kitchen downtown.  You will not be disappointed.

w8d7pozrWfyLdwxLDI51VA.text: First time here tonight and I must say its SMAZING!!  I started with the peach and heirloom salad it was ok..... Probably wouldn't get it again it's just not for me  But I got the halibut (the bartender recommended it) it was so good!! super flavor not dry and sad the Sauce they have it in is very delicious not over powering it works so great together   For dessert I got the bread pudding normally I wouldn't order it ... But it's a must get   I had two take it easy drinks    I would totally come here again pay attention u might miss it they don't have any bright signs but it's a great place don't miss out

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding

UkcyM84Br0aeP3_KQO8wRA.text: Everything we got was really sad and disappointing  PIG FIG the pig was so over cooked it ripped my upper mouth. Don't get this flat bread. Apparently the mushroom one is better.   NY STRIP. it was dry. We ordered medium rare which t came out that way but t was so chewy and just poor quality steak with a sauce not that flavorful.   TEMPURA GREEN BEANS -too fried and over cooked. The cream cheese wasn't a good mix with he fried. The whole dish was too greasy and too heavy.   BURNT ENDS- were pretty good.   DEVILED EGGS- were okay.

AdjW8Ea_BYWsbx7cQhwuuA.text: I called for a reservation around 11:30am and was told that they did not accept reservations for small groups but that getting a table at 6pm would not be a problem. We got there at 6pm and were told that it would be a 45 minute wait because a large party had reserved several tables.

9sfVcHZe8mM86UvzIeCXkg.text: Finally made our way back to Vegas, so of course we had to stop in for some yummies! Things a bit different this time, we have a 1.5 year old and I couldn't remember if it was set up to accommodate families or not, so I made a quick call and spoke with Emily. She assured me that even though they don't have high chairs or stroller storage that they would be more than ecstatic to make sure we were comfortable! We went in around 330 pm or 4 to avoid their potential dinner rush, where Emily greated is at the door. She got us all set up at or table, and was amazingly sweet! We ordered devils eggs (which were just as amazing as we remembered!), baked Mac and cheese and the butter burger. All of the food was outstanding! Just as awesome as it was 3 years ago. I'm glad with all the ups and downs in Vegas, carsons kitchen has stuck around even though they're just a small hole in the wall!   Management, if you're reading this, you've got a keeper with Emily! She made our whole experience and put my mind at ease! Keep her around, and remind her how amazing she is!

w0J7H9moUMI4N-q9QwebKg.text: Cute little place in downtown next to Donut Bar. I got the Mac N Cheese and Turkey burger with cole slaw. Amazingly good and very flavorful! Sat at the bar, great and fast service! I would totally go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger with tater tots
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac N Cheese

N4V-G2gtCpo5hmug_NewrQ.text: This place is a great spot for small sharing plates. We came here for a birthday, just 4 of us, and shared a bunch of their plates. The tacos were 5/5 delicious due to being very flavorful. The grilled cheese had a horseradish kick which was surprising but delicious, if you like horseradish. I recommend the bacon Brie as well which was good.  We were able to bring our own bottle of champagne for a $20 corking fee. Good spot for something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam Brie cheese. 4.5/5 hot and delicious

T4CTh-B_uQTc4RtMfjvfIg.text: 2nd visit to CK because the first visit was so outstanding.  CK did not disappoint.  Menu was new and fresh however, thank goodness it appears the deviled eggs appear to have landed a permanent position.  They are simply outrageously good.  I appreciate the diversity of the small plate options from rich to refreshing.  Service is on point.  Like the permanent position of the deviled eggs, CK has earned a permanent spot when I'm in Vegas !!!

ZGnMrWbjRd4ZISUZdqKgYg.text: Very tasty lunch.  Had a few menu items with our group.  Everything was tasty and unique.   Salmon. Yum.   Gyro tacos.  Yum.  Cauliflower.  Yum.   Great service.

IORmZcnpYofU0iDhDz4HdA.text: The lunch at this place was fantastic. I loved the exotic and delicious appetizers like crispy chicken skin and pork belly. Yummy! Highly recommend and you can't go wrong with them. Can't wait to back to Vegas and try their dinner menu

bCUyNx-THE87vY0REuIpng.text: My husband and I loved this spot when it first opened!! We have since moved to California and they have remodeled but we continue to make it a priority stop every time we visit! Best bacon jam on the planet! Service is always great! Drinks are always refreshing and the food is simply to die for!! You can not go wrong with any pick here!! We love you Carson Kitchen! Always have, always will!!

i722ZX41Vr_iky220dyrQg.text: Thankfully not on the strip.....this place is a  hidden gem. Great cocktails and beer selection. Chicken sandwich was one of the best I've had. Tasted like home cooking with each dish we ordered. Great flavours! Tasty food to be sure. Very cool little vibe and cool music flowing.

Fh_Xv6-HkLRMAIRRuSRJSg.text: Everything was amazing bottom line! Affordable and gourmet...  Burger was delicious, the tater tots were crisp and seasoned perfectly   The rib eye grilled cheese was off the chain!  And the tempura green beans had so much flavor it was unbelievable!   Kerry Simon should be smiling down on Carson Kitchen

x1ecupOWa9SBIverYxkx6Q.text: Made a reservation for 8 ppl to try this restaurant out. It gets busy so call ahead first. This restaurant was hard to find for me because it wasn't on 6th street. It's actually around the corner.    Water was served almost immediately and the waitress was really nice. She wasn't too pushy and was there when we needed her.   I ordered the coffee rubbed ny steak for $19. It's not pricy for red meat but it came with nothing else. Only meat. By far not the best steak I've had. I didn't taste any coffee but was happy that it came out medium rare like I asked for. I also tried my friend's beef stroganoff which I did not like. The portion size was super small and to me it tasted oddly like chocolate.   I also tried the bison sliders. They were a little dry but I enjoyed the flavor of the meat and the sweet jam it came with. All burgers and sandwiches came with a side of spicy tator tots which were delicious!  By far the best thing there. I also tried the lamb gyros. For $10 bucks you get three gyro tacos and they were pretty yummy. Best bang for your buck.   The restaurant is small and can get really loud.  But it has a very cozy hipster atmosphere. I don't think I will come back again but it's a cool hangout spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef stroganoff. Huge plate... Small portion
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tator tots

-inuA-hYKcDRuXpohHtIoA.text: Actually I would give 3.5 stars. 4 for the service and 3 for the food. 3 stars for the food, because from all the positive reviews I was actually expecting a little more. The food was good but nothing exceptional. Also I was a little disappointed by the very limited choice in non-alcoholic drinks.

YLVG7_dUHutE0-L-a0zfPQ.text: OMG! This place has some awesome hipster food! The girl who seated us was so friendly. Some times these types of places are snobby-they weren't. Then the service by the tall bearded dude was great. And the food. MY new favorite place in Vegas! (We always hit up PublicUs and Kitchen Table for breakfast when we are in town) Adding you guys to our list.  Bacon Jam--so delicious with just a hint of spicy. Green beans-amazing. And the mushroom flatbread, perfectly seasoned and crispy. Watching other tables, next time I want to try the beet salad, burnt ends and the lamb tacos. There's a cool vibe interior patio to grab drinks and wait for your table. Off the beaten path and packed on a Tuesday night-always a good sign!  oh..and the donut bread pudding!!!! perfect-just sweet enough and much lighter than i thought it would be. I won't share next time.

J2jlKPVeBN8kVBJ4yS7hRw.text: So not easy to find but very much worth the effort to look. Took the Yelp suggestion and it was as good as the reviews state.  We tried the Grilled Cheese with tots and Mushroom Flatbread. Tots were so crunchy with zesty seasoning.  Flatbread crispy and mushrooms were so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior is very cool and open kitchen
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Flaybread

75E3IWwb3mBjJf4iWj90pg.text: I absolutely love this place ! The Mac and cheese is probably my favorite , it's so creamy and has lots of flavor. The veal meatballs are also very delicious in a nice creamy tangy sauce, and the jerk turkey burger is another item to try. The only thing that is kind of awkward is the seating arrangement, wish there were more personal tables instead of sitting next to random strangers with no elbow space.

hftJHXMkijuRsQOPVlU2CA.text: First time coming here and from the outside, looks kind of like a dingy place but in the inside it's pretty modern and nice. Seating is a bit cramped though but not too bad. If you're from El Paso or have tried crave restaurant in El Paso, the seating arrangement is pretty much the same.  Waitress is very nice, food came out quickly and were hot and everyone was left feeling full. Price is about average for a burger now a days, about 14.00 for a restaurant burger. Place is nice and clean. I would come back here to eat again if I was in the area but I don't think I'd drive all the way here for food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian sliders (spam, pineapple and a fresh seaweed slaw) with spicy tots and wok seared soy beans in the back
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their menu

5q_hHqYhASZVj7JnthRXPg.text: One of my favorite places in all of Las Vegas.  Jerk Turkey Burger is a must.  Save room for dessert!

_awU-XWL8FskE5HInNMsug.text: Bacon Jam is da bomb!!! Good blend of salty and sweet. Did I mention it comes with a baked Brie and a French baguette? Bacon, cheese and carbs...what's not to love???   Shared plate style so you can have a little bit of everything. Great service and good atmosphere. Probably not a good place for a big group.   Hidden gem in DTLV!

nSOFDyuLse3kGVVzNZ2BQQ.text: We came here off a recommendation from our local friend. I saw bacon jam with baked Brie on the menu, immediately shut down my computer and hopped in a Lyft. So happy we did. This place was delicious! The red snapper with panang curry, Mac and cheese, bacon jam and devils eggs are all must gets! Also, I was so pleasantly surprised by the chicken skins. Really, everything we had was delicious.   The service was amazing. Super personable, funny and made the experience. We came deep and they found us a table very quickly. Bonus tip- they didn't take reservations, but they did allow us to call ahead to put our name in.   Also, let's be honest. Downtown is way better than the strip anyways.

RqsGiIYOQa5W26v68Z0FhQ.text: Eclectic. Awesome. Intimate. Make a stop here and make sure you get the glazed donut Bread Pudding.

0qwJrOX9l5KwBoOTJwH0Kg.text: Omg amazing. A hidden gem. Gyro tacos could be a restaurant all to themselves. Steak was PERFECTLY cooked. Incredible flavor. I am so impressed and love this hidden gem of a place. The Mac and cheese is right up there with the best ever had. Not heavy handed and over the top. Well executed, crispy top, gooey bottom and top notch flavor. I feel like the chef enjoys Mexican flavors because the undertones are there. The steak seasoning/rub would be divine on steak tacos. The portions are exquisitely portioned in that 3-4 plates to share for every 2 people and you've got a incredible meal without overeating.  This place is a hidden gem. Forget the buffet folks and come here.

nU4L74ravAWYZE8r_QYOug.text: #latereview 12/29/2015  Always forget to check in but always never fully disappointed with the food. 4.5 / 5  Started the dinner off with a drink. No matter where I go I always ask for the sweetest drink on the menu and the bartender suggested for me the Sallynoggin (Jameson whiskey, luxardo maraschino, fernet vittone, cinzano bianco, peychaud's bitters). Don't know most of the ingredients but I was satisfied with her suggestion. Nothing better than an employee who knows what they are recommending to their guests. 5/5.  My friend and I ordered the roasted rainbow cauliflower to share. I appreciated the amount of the lemon juice to the dish. It brightened up the dish definitely. Very simple but perfectly done. 5/5.  I ordered for myself the forbidden black rice risotto with oxtail and my friend ordered the shepherd's 3.14.   Risotto came out first. Rice was aldente and definitely a True risotto. Not too dry. Not too runny. Just the perfect consistency. However the oxtail meat that was pulled from the bone was missed in the dish. I only got one big chunk in the very center of the plate. The forbidden rice was just a little too al dente for my liking. I understand it has a different consistency than arborio rice but it wasn't that bad enough to put me off from clearing my plate. Just to add a touch more flavor I added the colored cauliflower with each bite and definitely the lemon brought a much needed pop to the flavor profile. 4/5.  For my friend's Shepherd's 3.14 (gnocchi, lamb, natural jus), their take on a shepherd's pie was lacking in the starch. Don't get me wrong. The presentation was appealing. The small three pieces of gnocchi, not so much. I wanted to taste it but didn't want to take it away from my friend. Our expectation was a little bit more lamb but instead we found a mixture of ground and stewed lamb meat? Seasoning was a little but lacking of salt but then again I am a salt fiend. I stopped from taking tasting bites so my friend could finish his meal. 4/5.  As small as the plates were in portion, by the end we were surprisingly full. One thing the bartender mentioned to another guest that I over heard when they were asked how big the plates were... the plates are big enough to share. Not so much haha. I would suggest you get an entree for yourself and get a side or two to share. But definitely don't share your entree with anyone else haha. Overall always great time when spent with a friend or two or three or more. Their seasonal menu is always appreciated. Definitely will always come to support whenever possible.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tmBfU2kSbFRydpHtDihfDw.text: Baked macaroni, Pig and Fig, Devil eggs with carviar, and the chicken sandwich were all delicious. The only concerns were the servers wearing civilian clothes. I just don't feel like flagging them down to take my orders. Plus, I don't even know which ones are servers or customers. It's pretty bad to mistakenly call someone and thinking they could be one of the servers. Maybe a uniform polo shirts for everyone? And also, Chefs could at least use a hair mask at least. But, overall, I liked the food and the ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Devil&#39;s egg with caviar
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos

5DF621Cv6dZ-cCmuks8Yqw.text: I'm not ashamed to admit.. I've been to Carson Kitchen more than a few times!   This place is honestly one of my favorite restaurants in town. Extremely fresh and high quality ingredients, Carson Kitchen puts a creative twist on some classic dishes.   Here's a few of my menu favorites:  Drinks:  Towns End  First Saturday In May  Food: Bacon Jam (a must) Chicken skins (an absolute must)  Truffle Mac n cheese Cocoa-espresso NY strip   Outstanding food, a cool downtown vibe and very hospitable management- give this place a shot, I guarantee you'll love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocoa-espresso rubbed New York strip
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Towns End
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steel cut salmon

CtIi6h08aZQGb1eqKC1OGw.text: Amazing little local spot!!!  The sea bass was spectacular!  Cauliflower was pretty good... The cocktail was really good! Overall, a great spot!!!

DzApD_QcXGq8VZDoUUUMGg.text: So yum!! I bookmarked this place before going to Vegas after looking at restaurants on and off the strip. Of course they had me at bacon jam!  Came at an off hour - about 2pm and no line, no wait and barely anyone in the restaurant. Wasn't too hungry so we ordered just the bacon jam and brie and the steak. It was just enough for a light mean or snack. Both were excellent! I really recommend the bacon jam and brie. It has a nice touch of sweet/salty with a hint of spice in it. The brie is actually a very small piece, majority of the dish is the bacon jam. We ran out of bread and they gave us a bit more.  Wish I could've tried more but it was enough to at least say I got to eat here!  I see a lot of people posting pictures of their swear jar here. I noticed dollars and cents in it so I asked the server if there are different amounts based on what swear word they say. He said the jar is actually for customers to tip the kitchen staff. So if your food was so awesome and you swear when you eat it, you put some money in there. Cleaver idea though as a customer, I don't think I would know that's what it's for (maybe there's a sign, but I wasn't sitting near it).  Although the address says 6th street, I believe the entrance door is actually on Carson street. It's just down and around from the Fremont Experience.  Atmosphere is cool, love the vibe in here. HIgh and low tables available but very limited seating. I would say maybe holds 40?

Q3aeTukMQx6l57srLSBqDQ.text: Ate here for Mother's Day, 1st time. Love the venue, great atmosphere, service is top notch. Menu is small and different, I like that, only downside, not enough options for someone that is a pescatarian...otherwise great spot and will probably be back!!! P.S. the tater tots are amazing!

sTjY6T6S2SCGYDK09V3xQw.text: Love this place! It's a little hole in the wall in downtown Las Vegas but nonetheless the food was great, the staff was friendly & the concept of the restaurant was even better. Went there for lunch & I enjoyed every part of it. The space is small but it's just enough to make you feel cozy. The Mac & cheese is incredible & the alligator flatbread was also delicious. Leave your mark on the checkbook; it's one of a kind, unique!! Will definitely be coming back here very soon!

mXK-MMhSj89uyBwZ-KOIvQ.text: Carson Kitchen was a real find! Just the type of restaurant that we're always on the hunt for. Cool design/ambiance, good vibe, good service and good food. Carson Kitchen was filled with a crowd ranging from 30-somethings to 60-somethings, leaning heavily in favor of youth. It was packed when we arrived, but they have a wonderful patio with a fire pit at which one can await  seating. Very nice.  Food:  4 stars Service: 4 stars Ambiance: 4 stars  We sat at the bar for dinner and enjoyed watching out incredibly energetic bartender prepare drinks, serve food, etc. She was friendly, professional and sweet.

sP3pdCpA9vIR_jYjM5vqzw.text: This place is so good that I created a yelp account just so I could review it.   We had the fried chicken skins, the bacon jam, and the espresso ribeye. All of it was to die for! The bacon jam may have been the most delicious thing I've ever tasted.   The food was perfect, the service was awesome, and the atmosphere was wonderful. I would go back there every day if I could!

VELFp7AdTDdTBwRTOCNi4Q.text: Okay so I found the food decent, keyword decent, it wasnt amazing, it wasn't wonderful, it was decent. I asked for a med rare steak, i got it medium, bacon jam was too sweet, i couldn't find the cocoa-expresso in my steak, and the mac and cheese was too garlicky, and my mom's blackened catfish sandwich was bland. My dad's trout and cauliflower on the other hand was pretty well made, and the veel meatballs were sort of springy tasting so that was nice and the bourbon brownie was good with the icecream.  But considering you pay 30 to 50 per person it was too expensive for food that i consider nice but not that nice.

jDp-DkJg_emaJ3TyFU6L6A.text: Modern gastropub experience in downtown Las Vegas.  I had the deviled eggs and the mushroom flatbread.  Both were good but not great.  Many of the bartender's recommendations were too rich for my lunch, so I may have missed their best dishes.  I'd be happy to return, but for now I'm going to keep exploring.

Uxn4_MxaesEL4QDFInZY1A.text: The service was amazing. Our server Felicia was very informative and helpful! John the chef was incredibly friendly as was Constance. The food, well it was delicious. I'm a foodie and seek out the best places. We had bacon jam, the cauliflower and the trout special. All incredible. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas! So many more things I want to try!

USnc3i3J96pkJnxPe7f18Q.text: Tried to get in on a Sunday night on a prior trip to Las Vegas and were surprised that they were  closed at 9:00 pm.  The place was full, but they weren't seating anyone else.  Went in for an early dinner on our most recent trip and really liked it.  We try many new restaurants every time we travel to Vegas and Carson Kitchen is one of our favorites.  This alone is a reason to go the the Fremont neighborhood.  It's a casual gastropub.  Very cool design with open kitchen.  We shared a lot of small plates and all were delicious.  We tried four of their house cocktails and loved them all.  This will be a regular stop for us.

y7Yt41aGg0YuNTRN_SJ6Gg.text: Sorry. I was excited to try this place after the amazing prior reviews. The food was overly garlicky and generally over seasoned. The menu was tiny. There are thousands of restaurants here in Vegas. This one was terrible.

SNOyMFIw6jYh4OUY5LulQw.text: The crispy chicken skins were good (taste like mesquite BBQ-flavored chips) but were too salty and just had too much of the spice coating on them.  The mac 'n cheese was very good too, but it would have been better to have ordered it at another time because it too was fairly salty although still very good.  The gyro tacos were excellent as was the glazed doughnut bread pudding!  The place is very hard to find (no signage and you enter from Carson St, not 6th, as the address would suggest.  Smallish place but had a good vibe. We sat at the kitchen bar and got to chat with the bread chef. Glad we got there early (6pm), otherwise there would probably have been quite a wait.

dt6xkVL_PNnm3FrEyaT--Q.text: Very, very good food. Had the bacon jam, devil eggs, chicken skins, Mac & chee, steak: all amazing. Good choice of  small beers. The donut bread pudding, fantastic. All in all, the best meal I had in Vegas during my trip. Thank you carsons kitch, appreciated.

LHLmRt4Uy8WdoAF5Lxfjew.text: I'm updating my review as I've visited a few more times. My office is very close so I was hopefully this would turn into a regular place, but alas, it's probably not to be.  The second time I went we got seated at the bar. The bar is weirdly designed so you can't scoot your barstool close and the bar doesn't overhang enough. Anyways, I felt uncomfortable and like I was hunched over to reach the bar. So we were seated and a waitress got us water. Then that was it. Staff buzzed around us but no one took our order. After 20 minutes we just left. So weird.  The third time there was an hour+ wait. We left. Get there by 11-11:30 or don't go.  The fourth time we got there at 11:30 & got seated. I asked for a table & the hostess looked uncomfortable since the only table left was a 6-top, but their bar design sucks so I wanted a table.   Anyways, the food was amazing. I had the fried green tomato crab sandwich. Soooo yummy. I scarfed it. The tomato was really great with the crab. Lots of crab and how ever it's cooked, it's great. A little messy but just delish. My friend got the butter burger. It was huge. It had two cheeses on it and looked like they did a good job of cooking it medium well per her order. The spicy tots were good...a little greesy but I ate them all.  Overall I like this place but go early and they aren't winning points for service. I'd mark them lower for the terrible service but the food is just awesome.

rxOAIU-tXu2NFkOZ6m3AMg.text: WOW!!! We tried green beans, Mac and cheese, gyro tacos and a butter burger everything was amazing. Staff was super friendly this is my new spot next time I am back in Vegas.

Fb2UofG7GzaVBC-LHHt5Tw.text: Felicia was the bomb diggity server. Jokes and impressions were abundant and funny. We sat on the rooftop which was really cozy and epic. The food was phenomenal and the staff makes the entire experience fun and light. I felt like I was in Brooklyn (Major compliment).

JkSJwOZkZWLT9HfUeUYZeg.text: This place had such Awesome food!! We had great seating at the counter where we were able to see all the food get cooked and plated. The dishes were amazing!! We had the Crispy Chicken Skin, Expresso Cocoa NY Strip, Scallops with Mango Chutney, Gyro Tacos, and Bacon Jam with Toast. Each dish was creative and flavorful. We ended our meal with the Brownie with Bacon Ice Cream, which was also different but so yummy. The cooks and servers provided such excellent service; we can't wait to visit again. Highly, recommend eating here...

OXtHdAWr1MGk4MCz4UjoDg.text: We came to Vegas to celebrate my husbands 60th Birthday. We made reservations at Carson's Kitchen  based on the reviews,  and the outdoor patio area, which they told me when I made the reservation that it would be a great spot for a larger group, and with the heaters this time of year it would be a perfect setting. When we arrived they seated us downstairs, the waitress said they "didn't have propane for the heaters".  It was so noisy that our group could not carry on a conversation, they were out of side dishes that we wanted to order,  when we received our meals, they were very small portions, even the dinner portions were pricey for what we got. The food was good,  but nothing was great. (We all ordered different things). Really disappointing since there are so many awesome places to dine in Vegas. We hoped for a special place for our celebration, and honestly this definitely was not that at all. Unfortunately, for our group, this was a big fail. I don't think anyone in our party of 12 will return to Carson's Kitchen.

4e3y3r_A47PvstF9vFg61Q.text: Very cute little spot downtown with nice variety on the menu. The portion size could be a little bigger but great food quality. Parking is difficult to find.

vGpsdSgII7b0jEQlylL1bQ.text: Awesome restaurant at the end of downtown.  Great food, wait staff is really fun and just a really cool vibe.

_qWHelPX4AYJjIXz7Fx29g.text: Took my friend here for her birthday, we had just traveled almost 5 hours from out of town and drove straight to this place. We were both really hungry and she was very excited about eating there. We didn't realize that they were closing early but the manager let us dine in and we both felt he went out of his way for us. The food was fantastic. Friend chicken skins were amazing. The service was outstanding. I only gave a 5 star rating because a 6 or 7 wasn't an option.

nzYuINeuAZEq4qrjvk-aKg.text: Genuinely disappointed.   Went solely to enjoy a signature drink, Brewer's Fix, and they ran out of the apricot preserves to make the drink.  Who runs out of ingredients for a signature drink on a Friday night?

Zje8dThPUSbLDgk1eYIUTg.text: If you came to Vegas and did not eat here you missed the best eats in the city. Great staff nices people in the city

s6rzthxyo8oUmsZ_df3hAg.text: Gastropub meets DTLV with a rooftop dining area that makes you feel like you're hundreds of miles away from Las Vegas. Fun menu with some awesome dishes and a good cocktail menu. Service has always been good, minus not utilizing the rooftop patio sometimes. Interior is industrial / rustic with fun deco. Definitely a must try!

TZy0qqpop2_0cgg7UcOzsg.text: Favorite restaurant in Vegas. We had the rabbit ragu, which was delicious, and the rainbow cauliflower which was just okay.   Back patio is a cozy place to grab a drink while you wait to be seated

NOQHjtzd8ka3PLgSyx3ZZw.text: Great place to have a bite. Solid service. Creative dishes. Craft beer. I was in foodie heaven. I truly enjoyed the bacon jam and black rice/risotto oxtail dish.

yxFlXoYMoa91TgVz6BX4QA.text: The food is amazing! Not only does it look good, but the food is unique and absolutely delicious. We had the Blood Orange salad and the brownie bacon ice cream dessert. We couldn't help but from saying, "hmmmm" every bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food is amazing. I mean look at how pretty it is! Not only does it look good, but the food is unique and absolutely delicious.

pVBSKy9AbeEjiVTPV0bVag.text: I do like the gyro tacos a lot. One of few places that serves legit cocktails in Las Vegas. Mac n cheese is pretty solid as well

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. real cocktails in Vegas!!!!!

ewkqylTY3xm_28j8gIwrIw.text: Hello and welcome to Carson Kitchen. This has been on my to go to list for a long time. Finally ventured DT to check it out. Bacon Jam, that is all I am saying. Well, not really, this is a mix of bacon and spices with a small slice of cheese on top. Served with grilled bread. We sat at the kitchen bar where we could see the Chefs at work. For our main meal I got the butter burger mid rare and Josie got the New York. We were encouraged to try the Mac n Cheese because it would be the best we ever had. (You don't know me) I thought. When you say this it better be so good I cant get enough. It was not. Honestly I make a decent home made mac which according to Josie is better. Burger was really good with an aged white cheddar on top. Had a smoked flavor and that sharp bite from the aged cheese. Steak was perfcetly cooked mid rare. I could say it could have used maybe some salt after the cook, but that is splitting hairs. Overall a great meal and great service. Our waiter was friendly and on top of the drinks. It was nice watching the pass and seeing the food being expedited.  Thank you for eating at Carson Kitchen. I really want to return here and try some different items and to see what may change seasonably. If in the DT area, give it a try.

5kusochhF-vBir3fnXlyEw.text: Great staff.  Great recommendations. Great price.  Great drinks.    If you are in Las Vegas you must come here and enjoy the people and the staff.  But most of all the food is to die for.    Thanks for the experience, it made our night

L_5phC8MBIeW-kAk8AmbFw.text: Hidden in the mean streets of DT Las Vegas. You really have to be someone with the intent to come to Carson Kitchen. It's very low key, without any vibrant neon lights or flashy sign to attract you (if you were a tourist). So to me I think this place is the very essence of what you can call local. You won't know unless you've seriously heard it from a local person, and have done your research.  Word of mouth? I think really does this place good. The great food and service really speaks for itself, and well everyone is talking about it too!  *VEAL MEATBALLS: I'm not a big Veal person, but this is a choice you just have to make. If you're the carnivore type. I would go for it. It has that wonderful rich flavor, filling taste and texture. This can possibly fill you, but if you are just all about meats. Give it a go.  *NY STRIP STEAK: Can't go wrong with steak right? Juicy tenderness (they know the difference between their medium rare and rare)! I ordered a medium rare. It had that nice well and flavorful outer layer, and that nice slightly but not too pink middle. Perfecto!  RAINBOW CAULIFLOWER: You need your daily dose of veggies. If you're not a big veggie person, or a salad person! I would suggest trying this. The flavors are rich enough, and the veggie is so subtle in taste that you can barely tell they're vegetables.  *BLACK RICE & OXTAIL RISOTTO: Forever and ever. I love this dish so much. It's very rich too and jam packed with cheese. You'll see what I mean. Every pull. Every scoop from a fork you'll see a nice lovely trail of melted cheese holding on to your fork, making it's way to your mouth. It's a party for your taste buds.   WILD MUSHROOM FLATBREAD: AMAZING! I would like to thank the Carson Kitchen gods (well, more so the manager) for hooking us up with a complimentary flatbread. Flatbread is also great! Big portion (this will take a good portion of your appetite). So, if you have the intent of trying the heavier dishes, I'd just take a pass on this. Unless you're really craving a flatbread.  BROCCOLI CRUNCH: Great salad. I'd vouch for it, it has a nice sweet taste to it, with a good crunch from the nuts. Although, amongst all the other plates, this may not have shined as much as the others.  Service: In the humblest way, I love their gesture for not wasting food, and these small acts of services they provide to just give their customers an extra kick to their evening. We all know miss orders can happen, and well the manager was kind enough to first, kindly ask if we have food allergies (way to go!), and then, proceeded to offer a complimentary dish due to a mis-order. Way-to-go Carson Kitchen on being proactive.  Waitress was super attentive with us, and very helpful as far as alternatives (chicken skins and bacon jams was sold out). She knows her dishes. She came by periodically and checked on us and of course. She too had a great sense of humor. Love this place!

dvZkmuoqO1bvfDVRyvICGw.text: This place is absolutely amazing. Couldn't believe how out of site it was when we had parked to find it. It is such a small little kitchen but the food is absolutely amazing. It is a hidden gem near downtown Las Vegas.  Be forewarned this place does get CROWDED. It is small so they can only hold so many people in there. We went on a weeknight and it was packed. They have a really cute patio that is all lit up and is fun to go out and eat on or have a drink.  The menu may or may not change seasonally. Everything we had ordered was super unique and the taste test on it won 10 out of 10. We will be coming back here for sure. One of our new favorite spots and downtown fremont is not far so you can walk around that when you are done.

5fLYK3SyXITyErJ3FJWG0A.text: Skip the over-priced over-hyped hotel restaurants and come try Carson Kitchen.  My wife and I had dinner there last Friday and it was terrific.  We sat at the bar in front of the kitchen which was entertaining and gave us the opportunity to speak briefly with a cook.    The staff were all very friendly and attentive.  The drinks from the bar were excellent.  We had their version of a margarita and a drink with sage in it.  Both were creative and tasty.    The menu was also very innovative.  Our favorite dishes were the green eggs and ham flat bread and the veal meat balls with foie gras cream sauce.  Naughty, but superb.    If I owned a restaurant this is how I would hope to do it.  Can't wait to go back.

FBn7VTIdVJhLh1dBSLK7Xw.text: We ordered the chicken skins, fried green tomatoes sliders,  veal meat balls.. All were delicious. It was easy to get a seat in the cozy restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried green tomatoes sliders

Xumrrbn2eTakCJ-2qJhWjg.text: Oh my god. The food here is phenomenal. I love sitting on the rooftop patio for a romantic meal. I absolutely adore this place. My only complaint is that the bathroom door doesn't lock correctly (you think it's locked, but nope, and then a stranger is watching you pee) and that's pretty absurd.

3pkSBlrg8UumMIejodVnlA.text: This was our second visit. The first was in the evening with a wait. This time was lunch with no wait. The food was good but not amazing. I split a jerk turkey burger which was of ample size and tasty. We also split the cauliflower side. Thought it was a bit overpriced for the size. The caesar salad was excellent but again, a bit small for the portion size. Come on, lettuce! With so much competition nearby, they need to up their game a bit. Much potential.

mrtjBQitU0Y3Ek4-nEwV5A.text: Let me start off by saying that the appetizers are Amazing! We had the killer shrimp and the crispy chicken. Definitely a must try! Had the secret special chicken for my meal. It was cooked to perfection in buttery deliciousness. Sharing is definitely a good strategy when visiting. I would definitely visit again. Great service and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Special Chicken
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pic of the high table top and kitchen area

KsY_H4Z_tF6Ky3HB6x4ZIg.text: Our experience at Carson Kitchen was nothing short of 5 stars. The steak we enjoyed was the best of three we had throughout our week there (also the least expensive). The starters and sides we enjoyed were great too! My wife and I really enjoyed the chicken skins and spicy shrimp. We had the pleasure of dining at the kitchen counter and thought it was amazing how personable engaging the kitchen staff was. We had a great time talking to them throughout our meal.  We will definitely be returning to sample the ever evolving menu.

ADK9AV89GDlZAs9jN2lohw.text: This is a beautiful restaurant with a friendly staff and a hipster vibe. The food was very good and the service was great.  I'm sorry I can only give them 3 stars.   Now that I have eaten here, I would go back for a snack before a night out or for a light lunch. Going there as starving tourists didn't work out in our favor. My partner felt mislead by our server about portion size and left still hungry. The manager gave me a hard time for ordering my burger well done. E-coli doesn't sound fun to me, and even though I am sure their kitchen is clean, sorry, not sorry I always order ground beef well done, "Bro."  Overall I would recommend this restaurant, attitude, small portions, and all.

SZ-VvB0abzaC8M8VwGkhsg.text: Oh my god! this place has delicious food and appetizers plus I love the hip interior design. Also the staff are so stylish and cool; unfortunately I don't live Las Vegas otherwise I would  always be there.  I love the wild mushroom bread and the steak was also very good. The hamburger was phenomenal and the deviled eggs were awesome. I didn't like the fried chicken skin though :(

DzfK0mr1yGEVACwbrBTKNQ.text: 3 stars is a stretch in my opinion. I just didn't "get" this place. First, the location was a bit weird at first. I wound up walking in through the back door but whatever. I found it. It was funny because once I was inside and seated, I couldn't understand why I couldn't find it. Anyway, I just wasn't impressed. We ordered a flatbread, the bacon pudding, chorizo stuffed jalapenos and dessert. The best thing was dessert. THe flatbread was OK, the bacon pudding was not. I didn't care of for it at all. Neither did my friend. It was overwhelmingly hot. And not in a good way. I don't mind some spice and flavor, but this was neither. I'm sure I'll come back since a lot of my fiends enjoy this place but I wouldn't make it a special trip to come here after this experience.

IK7b4er1p4HBU81HNxsITg.text: Nice atmosphere, even better food. Stupid Good Shrimp - similar to Chinese walnut shrimp, really good  Veal Meatballs - probably my favorite appetizer. AMAZING Mushroom Flatbread was solid and cheesy Ox-Tail Risotto - one of the better risottos I've had  Secret Sunday Chicken - probably the best chicken sandwich I've had, juicy throughout and very flavorful   Glazed Donut Bread Pudding blew my mind!!!  5/5 would totally recommend. Off the strip, and a local gem

0clHOZbISukyYbjmInniQQ.text: After my second mediocre experience here, I thought I better write up a review. This place has tons of hype which may be why I found it so disappointing.    Ambiance - There are only 4 actual tables at this restaurant all the other seating is at group dining bars where your legs dangle while you sit in their uncomfortable bar chairs. The first time I ate here we were seated at the actual bar and while it was very loud in the restaurant I was able to enjoy my friends company.   On my second trip here we were seated at the shared table across from a couple who had their tongues down each other's throat the whole time and a father who was lecturing his daughter loudly on how to make it in the business world and she "better shape up or ship out".  I understand this is not within the restaurants control however I would certainly prefer to have an option rather than shared dining but as a party of two we were not afforded that luxury.   Service - The first visit they were busy but by sitting at the bar we were able to flag down the bartender to get our orders relatively fast. The second visit I arrived first and my server asked if I would like to wait to order, I informed him I would order before my companion arrived but I needed a minute to look over the menu. After waiting for him to return for some time I turned awkwardly around from my place at the bar extension to place my order for a drink with the bartender. My drink arrived but still no server so again I ordered our appetizer from the bar. The place was busy but there was plenty of servers and I spent the rest of the dinning experience hunting down my server. When it came time to pay I ended up getting off the horrible chair to just find someone to pay so that I no longer had to sit on those horrid chairs and I could get out of there.   Food - The first trip we ordered: Jalapeno Poppers - Delicious, I recommend them highly Baked Mac & Cheese - Excellent if not a bit on the small side Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto - Such high hopes, but way over salted and the rice was not cooked it was crunchy  Second and last trip: Bacon Jam - Zero flavor, the best part was the bread Roasted young beets - meh nothing special here at all Pork Belly Carbonara- Again high hopes only to be let down, the pork was fine but nothing special the pasta was mediocre  The uncomfortable seating, small pretentious menu and awful service will keep me from coming back.

TwgJXpQsTvxGcQODWwdbrQ.text: Great restaurant!  Great food! Ambiance is fun and service is always great.  Great find downtown Las Vegas

iTAXlrjzh9Yo-Py-u2FYIw.text: My FAVORITE Las Vegas restaurant. I have tried almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Bacon Jam, Chicken Skins, Espresso-cocoa steak and brownie are just a few of my favorites. I love the casual, trendy atmosphere. Good drinks, too. It's fun to sit on the rooftop on a warm night.

xTjeIsvs80617Hv5lxRgEA.text: The best restaurant in LV!! I recommend tempura beans with pepper dip

Uh7yBA4qOmXp9HmJzzK_KA.text: A Super place. great staff, Great cook staff. Owners super personable. Go,Go,Go to this place. Great relief to Fremont Street.

MDFBP1BgZZb4cJydXYr5mg.text: After hearing my friends rave about this place forever I finally decided to check it out, it more than lived up to the hype. It was pretty busy when we got there with a bit of a wait so we decided to have a drink on the patio, Tara the bartender made me one of their specialty drinks it had bourbon and Fernet in it, sorry I don't remember the name but it was awesome! After the A plus drink recommendation we decided to just eat at the bar since we were already pretty hungry. We ordered enough food to feed a small army with everything being great with the exception of the flatbread which was a little bland. The gyro tacos, veal meatballs, turkey burger, butter burger, and Mac and cheese though absolutely killed and I'm pretty sure I'd go back just to get the spicy tater tots! Service was helpful and friendly and the food was fantastic, I'll definitely be back.

DElVEHZfzwEEoOLM4cwI4A.text: almost lives up to the hype. very friendly atmosphere and good ambiance. food was good but not worth the prices they are charging.

3MXn44GeVMQ2DgCzv7-2hg.text: The bartender said that we were probably the first non-locals that had been in there. I'm sure we won't be the last. The food was amazing. Particularly the empanadas and the mac & cheese.

u3Wh718Q6rIpW5tJJpu98Q.text: A couple of my friends have been raving about this place; so my buddy and I decided to give it a try today.   Ugh!  Never again!  The place is small and loud.  Initially, we were seated at a high top table with strangers.  I didn't want my neighbors to hear our conversation; so we asked to move.  No problem said the hostess.  We struggled to find something to order off the menu.  Tried the bacon jam since it has gotten rave reviews.  It was okay--not something to write home about.  I ordered the fried chicken sandwich.  Hated the spread on the sandwich and not impressed with the chicken.  Enjoyed the tater tots.  My friend ordered the beef stroganoff.  Neither one of us finished our meal and we both declined to have any of it boxed up.  $50.00 not well spent for today's lunch.  Carson Kitchen is busy; so I doubt they will be missing our business in the future.  It's a hip place, but I'd rather be well fed and square.

pp-MX7zVifPK5ikxhiso4Q.text: I would rather sacrafice the foo-foo presentations and get a better value for my money. Now, if the food really knocked my socks off (which it did not) I would be alright with the portions, but damn, feed me for those prices. I will not return and feel this place is a ripp-off. I can't believe all of the positive reviews on here...Well, I on second thought, Las Vegas locals voted Olive Garden the best Italian restaurant in Vega$ for almost 10 years, so you can see the mentality of this city.

lgeBtoAa4R2VzIuVBmfy5w.text: Absolutely the best grind in Las Vegas! Great food and atmosphere! Dakota our server rocks

O4dLyK0v7TDi3MOtwEcH3Q.text: We arrived at Carson's Saturday afternoon after searching for it as we drove down Carson Street. The resturant is situated in the Old John Carson Hotel.  You have to look for it. The name is located on the lower part of the window in black letters, hard to distiguish with the glare from the sun. We entered  Carson's K and there were a few people there and it was nice a quiet. The place is nicely decorated and we like the mixture of woods, metal and tile work. The kitchen is open which I liked but the tables are mostly big tables that I assume you would share with other people you do not know if your party is only two people. That would not be so bad if the stools were not so close together. I am have wide shoulders and so does my partner and to be honest, it is not comfortable if you are paying for an experience.  I like experiences but not if I am being intruded by people who are sitting right on top of me.   We sat in at a table across from the bar with a view of the old Post Office. We were immediately greeted by our server who was friendly and listed all of the foods that we had questions about. She took our drink order and after some time we ate our first choice,  the Crispy Chicken skins......Ok, we normally do not eat skin, but this was pure heaven. They were crisp and perfectly seasoned. I like the honey sauce that came along with it.   A short time later, our orders arrived:  me the Fried Green Tomato with lump crab ravigote. It was great. I wish there more tomatoes on it. The tomatoes were lightly breaded and fried.  PERFECT!!!!  Kerry, tell the cooks to put more on there. The tator tots were crispy and fresh and not as greasy as I thought they would be.   My other half had the Butter Burger with boursin and chedder. The cheese was a little too heady (spelling?) and it did not taste so hot. The burger itself was good. It was not dry and had a great flavor to it. My partner ate it all up after scraping the cheeses off.   Our services was good, not great.  Our drinks were never refilled or were we asked if we wanted more to drink....bad!!!  When I go out, I want service, not half hearted, come on strong them leave me waiting. That is not a way to win a repeat. Aside from that, everything else was good. I am not sure if we will be back. The place is small and I can not imagine how crowded it must get at night.  I wonder why they did not build a larger space.   FOOD:                A ATMOSPHERE: A SERVICE:          C PRICE:               B the portions are enough if you are starving.

I_3W8gvrFs7juOlr2KPzLw.text: Today I took my wife to lunch here and we both ordered the butter burger. The burgers were a little under cooked so we sent them back and the waitress informed us that they would make us two fresh burgers. Unfortunately my wife had to go back to work so I paid for both burgers and informed the waitress that I would return to pick them up. When I returned to pick the burgers up I didn't inspect them because I assumed they would be two fresh burgers, not the case! Come to find out the cook took the same two patties that we sent back, that was fully dressed had been cut in half and physically touched by us and placed back on the grill and served back to us. The only difference was the dressing was new. Couldn't very well give us the same dressings,  that would be un professional.  This has to be not only the tackiest but most blatant  disrespect I have experienced at a restaurant. I reached out to the restaurant before writing this review,  and basically was told this is how it's done and is the norm for most eateries. I beg to differ, I can't see Glutton, nor Eat nor any other of the fine restaurants we like to frequent would say this is common practice. The irony of it all is, my wife suggested Glutton but I choose to go to Carson and pay $28 for their butter burger. Never again! My wife also wrote a review and received basically the same response from owner Cory Harwell ( it is what it is ) note, there are over 100 other negative reviews on this restaurant. I guess the days of customer service have been lost here.

TumPAh5h81PFIIE85lB_9Q.text: Amazing food, a great atmosphere and incredible service! Went to celebrate my birthday and had the greatest time ever! Will definitely be back!! Especially for the Crispy Chicken Skins, the Tempura Green Beans and the Bacon Jam! Don't forget to get the Butter Bacon ice cream with a Brownie! Oh. Em. Gee. Five stars!!!!!

COuBdUFRd32RTxyBEoynEQ.text: first and foremost the service provided by one of the chefs was some of the best service i have ever seen by a chef. i am blanking on his name but i believe it was chef mccloud. from the moment we sat down at the counter of the kitchen he was attentive, nice, and personal. i went with my girlfriend and her daughter celebrating my bday, when he found that out he wished me happy bday, and made that night very memorable. the food was was of top notch: baked brie with onion jam...hands down the best item there. the bread is perfectly toasted, the brie is gooey, the onion jam is flavored so amazing that i am still tasting it. deviled eggs with black tobiko caviar quite tasty, fried chix skin- this one was quite tasty, my girlfriend and i were asking the chef what that dish was and he said it was fried chix skin, he told one of his cooks to give us a few pieces so we could try it, needless to say 10 secs later we ordered one of our own. the fact the chef sent us a taste was the service i was talking about before, service you don't see very much, service i still talk about today. wbtg list was nice we tried 2 different reds and liked them both, great price range, love downtown prices...girlfriends daughter had a burger with tots and that was spot on as well. we also had the beet and goat cheese salad with pistachios, just a little s&p and oil, no dressing that overpowered the items, it was a clean dish and tasty. not a big dessert guy but the chef talked us into the bread pudding that they make out of donuts, it had a smooth texture unlike most bread puddings you see, just the right amount of cinnamon and other spices, right on the $, lastly the chef sent out brown butter bacon ice cream to my girlfriends daughter, a gesture from a truly great chef. don't miss out, go eat there, enjoy life, great price range, great experience....service was spot on as well, didn't mean to leave out waitress out, blanking on her name but she was so friendly and made us feel right at home...def will go back and have told as many ppl as i can lately....

5BUaZ1AK8qm8FlQaktlHog.text: love this place! if the weather is good the rooftop bar is really cute. love the beef wellington empanadas, the espresso rubbed steak, bacon jam, green beans, mac and cheese, cant go wrong here! andrew is my favorite bartender hes a cheerful irish guy full of jokes and gives great recommendations

G3p-BRGTuLUalLoozsD26w.text: Two of us went there, as we stayed at the D and walked over. We had read really good reviews online so wanted to try it out. I got the Jerk Turkey burger with tater tots. Good, big and filling. My buddy got the osso bucco. Don't get this. It was two pieces, mostly bone and fat. a LOT of fat. One piece, was so fatty they should have been embarrassed. The bartender was very knowledgeable about the food, how it was prepared and such. That was nice. We brought to the attention of the bartender and his response was, "that's osso bucco right?". We really didn't like his response. You get nothing with it but the osso bucco and there was nothing hardly to eat AND it was $16. But the turkey burger was good although it was $14 I believe. A gal near us at the bar got some tempura green beans that looked really good. I think those are $8. We each got a dessert. I love sweets. I got the brownie with the butter bacon ice cream. The brownie was cold and rock hard. They should microwave it warm, then add the ice cream. I would NOT get that again. And it cost $8! The glazed donut bread pudding was good though. Get that. But share with someone as one is enough for two people. Besides it cost $8 as well. But get it and share it. Oh and there are only a few tables. The smallest being for 6 people. So go in a group or be put to sit in a line of people. You won't be facing your friends.

XgckHUPvmxdszeQH9uqPeQ.text: outstanding. quality.  the butter burger was so rich as well as the glazed donut bread pudding.

sycC2T4_AbDsiHyy7KM2xA.text: Came here for our friend's birthday.  We ordered five different appetizers, six different entrees, and three different desserts to share amongst our party.  Everything food wise was good, the stand outs to me were our wild mushroom flatbread, macaroni and cheese entree, and glazed donut bread pudding.  Nothing else we ate was super note worthy.   As far as atmosphere goes it is a very small restaurant, chairs are high stools with no back on them, one men's and one women's bathroom, and there is limited parking (not uncommon for downtown).    I would recommend this place to friends looking to have a small short meal or friends looking for somewhere to have drinks.  If you're looking for an intimate sit down and enjoy a big dinner setting I would go somewhere else.    Ultimately I would not mind returning again if someone wanted to go here - but I wouldn't go out of my way to choose this spot.

Jk0RcZRKnLo721HoDNKyOg.text: Been there 3 times and it does not disappoint. From the service (Bianca has served us twice and was awesome), to the food, to the atmosphere, it all works.  I look forward to eating there again and again.

ndQN5Em6uAZrZ5ZySKcceA.text: Creative ambiance, food was different in a great way! Had an awesome dinner! Try the glaze donut pudding! Twas very good!

gNR3akCgRJuoTHG7U6Z4fg.text: This place was great. Two of us split the lamb gyros, devils eggs, and bacon jam. Bacon jam was the best of the 3, but they were all good. Great service and a trendy, quaint setting.

O-SNsh637xovwnJlzgI6pw.text: Went here for my sister's belated birthday dinner, and my expectations were wildly surpassed. Everything was awesome!! We tried several different things from the menu and my favorites were the Bacon Jam, and the Glazed Donut Bread Pudding, which is made from the left over donuts from the place next door! It was so good!! I will definitely be returning. They told us that the menu changes seasonally, which is really cool because it keeps everything interesting. I can't wait to go back before I leave!!

CVpj7m7B0QOXkDSHblzHVA.text: Had lunch here a few days ago. Hopping place and a great space. Friendly, informative, and efficient staff. Split the beet salad and had the buffalo meatloaf sliders. Beautiful and tasty dishes. Decent bottle craft beer selection. The bread pudding and Mac & cheese looked great - probably next time. We will be back.
