jQ8p2HeVU6Y3jWOmLmyj6Q.text: First off, I love how it looks inside. At first glance, the outside does not look appealing but once inside its a whole different world. There seems to be a back patio & a roof patio. My boyfriend's cousin told him about this place and it was NOT a disappointment. Portions are big enough to share.   The bacon jam is as delicious as everyone says. My boyfriend said the cocoa-espresso steak was cooked PERFECTLY. I had the beef belly sliders and the combination of flavors complimented each other. We also had the deviled eggs which had bacon bits & caviar, and the fried chicken skins. If you've had Mexican style chicharrones that is how the chicken skins are. I forgot the name of the shrimp (oops).   Its a social atmosphere. Good for a first date!   Definitely give it a try!!!

GqkYc6XlH9cSo2TeAyAypg.text: I had high hopes for Carson Kitchen due to the rave reviews on Yelp. Sadly, for me, I was left disappointed but maybe because I was expecting too much. We ordered the oxtail risotto, fried chicken skins, sirloin, and of course, the hyped up bacon jam with brie. The most disappointing dish had to be the oxtail risotto. We love oxtail and were disappointed by the lack of flavor in the dish along with a small amount of oxtail. The rice was a little undercooked too. The bacon jam was good but nothing to write home about.   Looking back, it was truly a disappointing experience for us because we expected much more based on everything we read on Yelp. We probably won't be visiting again during our next Vegas trip.

_k8BXdkooYaCxF_4aTcRCA.text: Love this place!  Great food, great customer service. It's usually pretty busy, but well worth a try.  I love the atmosphere and the staff operate like a well oiled machine.

T-AhSARXHDpEomDhmKUwuw.text: Today was my first visit to Carson Kitchen. The waitstaff was excellent, but the food was just A-OK. As my rating indicates, nothing was terrible but also nothing was truly outstanding.  Two of us ordered crispy fried chicken skin, shepherd pie, roasted beets, and wild mushroom flatbread. The fried chicken skin seemed a little on the burnt side of fried. The roasted beets were well seasoned and tasty with crumbled blue cheese but were unevenly cooked with some pieces undercooked and crunchy, and some perfectly cooked. And the mushroom flatbread should be called vegetable flatbread since there were other veggies (asparagus and broccoli) in equal parts to the mushrooms; this overall was a little bland and could use some kind of seasoning, maybe some garlic or spices. I had high hopes based on others' reviews but don't share the enthusiasm after my visit.

zLWnJrIyboPLHEEbQzc21w.text: Hard to find, but well worth the effort. Barmaster Andrew made for the perfect night, with specialty cocktails created on the fly. We dove into the apps, and they inspired us to try things at home. All around great experience...

T_Dl0EFQUIOdFCjDLWZ8gQ.text: After a long wait (no reservations for parties less than 6) on the comfortable patio, we enjoyed the bacon jam and chicken skins. Great beer selection. The stroganof, tacos, and NY Strip Steak were delicious. Pretty high prices for such small portions. I would try it again, but not very often due to the cost.

l6p4E9ZgYbnmiuObpZqtKA.text: This was a big disappointment. We were seated at the bar without being asked when tables were open. The bartender who was our waiter wasn't friendly. When asked questions about the menu the bartender/waiter have smartass answers. We ordered two entrees, both of which had been 86'd because of a new menu coming out next week. That would have been good to know before looking over the menu. We ordered substitute entrees, one of which was also 86'd.  Since they have paper menus it would be very easy to cross out the items that are no longer available if the staff isn't going to tell customers. Our entrees (steak) came out cool, not warm, and the cauliflower side was no where to be seen. We asked about it and the bartender checked with a nearby server who we overheard say that it wasn't put in. The bartender then told us it would just be a minute more because he was just told it hadn't been made. We ate half of our steaks and then waiting for the cauliflower. Our steaks just got colder as we waited. At no point was there an apology or a visit from a manager. The only reason this is getting two stars instead of lower is the quality of the food. I can't recommend this place and won't be back.

Wsg5bVSnokUjpPacMDzQTw.text: Wonderful!  Eclectic American cuisine with a lot of really interesting choices on the menu.  Everything fresh and very high quality.  Everything we ordered was delicious.  I will visit any time I am anywhere nearby!  It's worth a special trip!

aTbx0-Cd8Ta1LhHy7zISgw.text: I went here on what was to be a second date so this was the date to determine whether it goes further or not.  I had called and they don't take reservations except for large parties and when I went there at 8pm they said it was about a 20 minute wait.  Actually it turned out to be not even 10 minutes and they sat me at the bar.  All I can say is my date was amazing and thanks to the impeccable service of Tara.  She made sure I was ok until my date arrived.  When he did she was attentive without being intrusive, sweet, helped make suggestions, and overall made the night such a great experience that this will be my go to spot in Las Vegas.  Could not rave more about the Bacon Jam.  SUPERB!!  A night to remember in more ways than one and thanks to the excellent service from Tara.  Cheers to Carson Kitchen.

CaudIjpfEMrhiH5Iepr5Ig.text: Food is incredible and the service is great! Everything my husband and I got was amazing ! We will definitely be back.

yIty-irLZStKQ7v1oYUHjg.text: Fantastic place, great service and most importantly consistant food. The veal meatballs and the devil eggs are a must.

mnncXkqeM1y-MdvnWbJgcg.text: Small wine pours, disappointing. Beet dish mediocre, steak flavorful choice cut. A fun place w friendly staff. Especially the bar tender!

RM21gnpBhtVT2wh-1JoKGw.text: Only if you have hours to wait.  They don't take reservations, but say they put your name on a list when you call ahead. We were told 30 minute wait, and ended up waiting for 1 1/2 hours.  When we were waiting, I asked, after an hour, if we could be given complimentary drinks as they were so negligent in their assessment of wait time, with no response.  When we finally did get to the table, we ordered drinks.  I was given about two sips of wine, and charged $8 per glass, which was a reasonable quantity if given a "glass" of wine.  The food was fine.  Deviled eggs good, and my bison sliders good as well.

q7W023ujU84FFgEiSyFQkg.text: Amazing!! Crispy Chicken skins with that smoked honey!! The drink Nilsson Shimlsson- service great just awesome!! love it!!

QrEKn_PXBiHrwysx0TbvWg.text: Love this place. We practically had every appetizer on the menu and loved every one. Will definitely be back for more.

KZDM7VR1CMWnf-DB4-3Ydw.text: Went for our anniversary last night. Wr started with the oxtail risotto and crispy chicken skins, both were amazing. Next we had the bone in pork belly, also delicious.  Finished the evening with the donut bread pudding. Again, wonderful. I have nothing bad to say about Carson Kitchen. We sat at the counter, which honestly was kinda fun. Very friendly staff, good music, good food, also, for this type of restaurant it was not very expensive. We can't wait to take our friends here.

bjO-PKJ0Bqmb10L6I6yf_A.text: This restaurant is the best ! Loved everything. Ate 6 different courses and they all were amazing !

cHlKRrKIupmqyf0yuMnEhA.text: Delicious!  Started off we sat right by the kitchen so we can see what was going on.  The staff is super friendly. Had a bloody mary which was just the right amount of spicy.  For the food we shared deviled eggs (minus the caviar), sliders, sausage flatbread and the mac n cheese.  Loved every bite of everything.  They have a rooftop bar which I would love to try sometime.

JljQtM52ppL7DHQjvCg39Q.text: This is the problem with the 'new downtown.' The attitude of these new business owners is abhorrent. They come here to Vegas, full of pompous flatulence. They believe that since they are "new and hip," that the general public should bend over and keep their mouth shut.  Yes, you did invite me to go into further detail. However, unlike you, (whom I was well aware of your presence while we dined because you sat right behind us), I have my own business to run.I also advised you that as soon as I had a chance I would be more than happy to discuss. I was there only 2 days ago.   I am a Vegas native, born and raised. In fact, my family opened one of the first ethnic restaurants here in the late 50's. I grew up working there so I know a little about the food industry.  So, here are the issues in greater detail.  We arrived at approximately 13:45. We were a party of 6. Upon stepping in, we were greeted with several looks of disdain. The "what the hell do these people want" look of disdain. However, the subsequent customers that walked in were greeted with smiles. I guess I should have come in my skinny jeans and plaid shirt.  Once we were greeted by your hostess, we had requested the table in the corner to avoid the sun. We were told that that table was unavailable. (Come to find out it was unavailable because you were going to sit there).   We sat down at the table directly behind the hostess stand. The waitress did not come greet us until approximately 5 minutes after we sat down. At which time she asked us if we were ready to order. We stated not yet as we just had  sat down. She took our  drink order ( Three waters, no ice. Three waters with ice with lemons. One cup of coffee and an iced tea.   She returned with four glasses of water, two with and two without ice. No lemons. Coffee and iced tea were delivered (without accompaniments) She asked again whether we were ready to order again. To which we stated we would like more time. Her face expression at that moment was best described as utter contempt. Then she just stood there at the table with that same look which she shared with another staff member as they walked by.  To attempt on getting her to not stand there, my colleague and sister both asked the waitress (Paige-according to my bill) for sweetener for my father's iced tea and cream for my aunt's coffee. To which she replied, "sweetener? Oh yeah, we have that." Then it took a good three seconds for her to physically react. As she reached for the sweetener caddy, she remarked, "oh, we have syrup too." She proceeded to as your bartender for the syrup where I overheard her ask for the 'simple syrup.' My sister said, "oh, that's nice but is it Agave syrup, because my dad is diabetic." Waitress handed the syrup to my sister stammering something about ," yeah it is... it's syrup... yeah it's  AH GAH BAY... uh yeah it's mixed in there. " My sister inspected it and it appeared to be simple syrup. Coupled with the waitress' response, I told my sister not to give it to my dad and to not trust her statement.  Then we indicated we were ready to order. We ordered the broccoli crunch, gyro tacos, deviled eggs and the chicken skins. She asked us if we were ready to oder our entrees to which we replied, "yes."  My dad ordered the Chicken Thighs. My sister added three more orders of the Thighs to cover my aunt, colleague, and mother. My sister proceeded to ask about the oxtail risotto about what it's like. Waitress responded, "it's good..." as though she wasn't so sure herself. At that point, supervisor,? manager? walked over to waitress and whispered something to her. She then in turn stated, almost accusatorially, "the manager just told me we are out of the chicken thighs."  oh ok.  "What else do you want to order?" To which we all said, "since there are no thighs, we would like a few more moments to look at our options." She huffed and walked away. She proceeded to step away and stand at the hostess table occasionally glaring back at the table as if we had done something wrong.   Once our food order was placed, you and your colleagues sat behind us. Your food arrived very quickly. Ours didn't. As I stated in the prior review, one bite of Chicken Skins told me that the lack of proper flavoring was compensated by immersion of MSG.   The risotto was a gloppy tasteless mess. My dad stated," they must've just waved the oxtail over this mess. I can't taste anything that resembles oxtail in it."  The deviled eggs were runny and small. The butter burger had no real flavor but for the fancy cheese that was on it. The flatbreads were average in flavor and taste.   The short rib sliders were overcooked and very small.   At no time did our waitress come to check on us after the food was delivered nor were our drinks refilled.   I wrote the prior review as I sat there and watched you and your staff react to it. Only problem was that nothing was done for your diners that were there.  'Thoughtful' enough for you?

8l2Zb9XI08OIma6sbLgerA.text: Heard great things about this place.  Would have given 5 stars except for one thing.  I thought i was going to a restaurant, but its more a bar scene.  The food was incredible, like a taste explosion in your mouth!! But the music, and i love good ole rock in roll, was so loud, we couldn't even talk.  Asked waiter if maybe they wouldn't mind turning it down a little.  Guess not. Oh well, if i was more informed that this is really just a loud bar with great food, but i was expecting a nice laid back leisurely lunch. Loved all the food we ordered, but go by yourself, cuz you won't be able to talk to anyone!!

N8dDSsE6XgUjkuDnVvoLXg.text: Super trendy type place. Creative menu combined with good execution and above-average service is a winning combination.

ksfRt01uoNijdJ_04nWFOA.text: This place was recommended and didn't disappoint great service great food fun atmosphere would come back again can't wait to try the whole menu the fried beans were great the burger looked awesome can't wait to come again

WgODVFqVarRq2MWvbxezlA.text: Excellent meal and atmosphere in Downtown Las Vegas.  Two visits to this restaurant and it was great each time.  The chicken skins, beets, tempura green beans, bacon jam, and veal meatballs are all highly recommended.  Each item was very unique and satisfying.  In fact, I have not tried anything that I would not order again.  Lots of small plate options will enable you to try a little of everything.  The wait staff is very friendly and seem to enjoy their work.  The restaurant atmosphere is very unique and has a hip vibe.  It is slightly off the beaten path, but still well worth the trip.

3p41x72t0hBlTz_JKwAvdw.text: Cool urban vibe.  Reminded me of the East Coast a little.  The food will not blow your mind and is not of the same quality that you would find in the michelin starred strip restaurants, but it is tasty enough to be a great value.  I definitely recommend checking it out with a group and sitting upstairs on the patio.  Service was excellent as well.

lwFo209Yu2abdsDbGSBtXg.text: We ended up at this restaurant after it had been recommended to us by locals. We were a party of 10 and simply loved the concept of the place. We ordered various of the different dishes (menu is tappas style), and each one was simply delicious.

_SOR5YbRVYvMxbIXB_ZRYA.text: Stop by Carson Kitchen while on business travel. What a great escape from the Vegas heat. The food was fantastic. The music was great. Just a cool little spot. If I lived in Vegas, I would be a regular. I had the turkey burger that had a wonderful Thai inspired Cold Slaw on top. So yummy. The service is excellent and very friendly. I was so tempted to get the Fried Chicken Skins. They looked delicious. Maybe next time. One recommendation for Carson Kitchen--though this didn't happen to me--I saw several people try to enter through the wrong door. Maybe a small decal on the correct door would help with this issue.

blFLiOpwGMax5AF9IeMrWw.text: Place is very cute and cozy and the food is good.  The problems I found were the portions, the prices, and the small menu.  I ordered swordfish which tasted very good but it was extremely small and it came with no sides, absolutely nothing and it was pretty expensive for the size.  With so many options in Vegas, I personally prefer to go somewhere else where I will get about the same quality, bigger portions, for the same price. Not to mention this is Downtown so prices are a little too high for that.

UW2ZtufOWbMahmTOFgD8rg.text: The nice thing about this place is that you can almost forget for a second that you're in Las Vegas, the home of the chain restaurant or the outlandishly expensive fare. I stopped in here alone and sat at the bar. I had been wanting to check out the place for awhile before bringing any guests. I had the burger. Aside from it being more on the 'well done ' side of things than 'medium', it was a tasty burger. I'll come back and it's met standard level of approval to bring visitors here as well.

be21tIN74CQgMnQmzVnr5g.text: Everything was delicious. Short rib sliders have a sweet root beer glaze that is incredible. Mac and Cheese was insane. But the real winner was the Glazed Donut bread pudding! On top of that the service was top notch. Our waiter was more like a friend serving you food at his house. Constantly checked on us, made jokes, and was always smiling. We sat next to the kitchen which got pretty live. Made for great conversation and a first look at all the good food they were serving to other customers. Everytime I'm in Vegas I will be hitting this spot

ATaXHNYZ5b9cX5-XJ1WA6w.text: Wow, second time having dinner here and I regret I didn't give them a 5 star on the first. It's super small so go early or be prepared to wait but it's worth it. I've been a senior marketing executive at the biggest casino resort on the strip. I've eaten in every celebrity chef restaurant in Vegas. This is one of my favorite restaurants, period. From the hyper creative menu, chicken skins, Devils eggs, etc. to the very good boutique service. This restaurant is legit. Actually I shouldn't write this good of a review because it will get crazy popular, as if it's not already popular. Let's make these people famous so they will open more restaurants like this one. Awesome place.

FGZFeqv7_OwpL08-neT_1Q.text: Great food, service and atmosphere.  Try the Black Rice and OX Tail Risotto.

CqW8LPFE9TAzM6W81e7hZA.text: Great food, great staff, great feel. When in vegas you should check this out and hang with the some local.

MNiinhueuHquF3q9U2GXtA.text: This place is just awesome.  Creative and super comfy.  The food was so good.  Great service, too.  I cannot wait to go back when I am in Vegas.

n8Ekg-tJ49s1xyJHveLTjg.text: Great Food, Excellent Service! Loved the Atmosphere... Had the Bacon Jam and Fried Chicken Skins! If your ever in town you have to try it.

vlWep9k0IyK78Qg0Q6nIFA.text: Definately worth the stop. It was quiet on a Monday afternoon when I stopped in for lunch. Had the pork belly sandwich. It was very good although it wasn't what I'd call a large sandwich. Fairly priced, but if you're really hungry a sandwich and the tots you get may not be enough.

AWqYFOgma_IbhIbIyBT9OQ.text: This place rocks. Period. Every single time I come to Vegas it involves a trip to this fine establishment. My friends and I share plates, which is the best way to do this place. You get to taste a little bit of everything then! This visit we had the roasted beet salad, the Thai chicken flatbread and the gyro tacos. All were just divine! The waitress warned us that the flatbread was spicy - honestly, it had the tiniest kick, definitely not on the 'they needed to be warned about the level of spicy' list. We like spicy food, and were mildly disappointed that she made it sound a little more than it was. We always finish our meal with the glazed donut bread pudding. It. Is. To. Die. For. Fat kids dream, making the 'O' face, death row last meal kind of amazing. I would swim in that bread pudding if I could. The service is always spot on, the drinks are stiff, tasty, and reasonably priced. I will continue to go back and recommend this place to all of my friends!!

vYBsEhSfMvVeTCnorfUKKQ.text: We sat at the bar that views into the kitchen. Kinda fun to watch them work. But being in the business it kinda reminded me of work :/ Probably should ask before seating people there. Started with Bacon Jam. Tasty and super sweet! Husband loved his bison meatloaf sliders. My turkey burger was good but be ready for the spicy heat! Good service. Food came up on time and hot.

9BlxxaFnzTLNrlkycet0gg.text: Tasty tasty food. Small little place with a great ambiance. Although I went thinking there was brunch (they don't serve brunch); lunch was very very good

xxWMR9pt_fLWvk87fNfTfw.text: What a pleasant surprise! Enjoyed a rooftop group dinner and cannot tell you how amazing everything was!  The food was plentiful, unique and served at the appropriate temperature.  Cocktails were bountiful and the servers and manager were happy, efficient and seemed genuinely happy to have us there!  Good luck Carson Kitchen, you are an excellent addition to Downtown Las Vegas!

InrO_BqWMzTChsTnBQJpbA.text: When in Vegas you need to stop here for dinner - the food is outstanding. To be honest I don't remember what I got since I went there in November, but what I do remember is that everything that I had I loved. I will def be coming back here next November for my annual trip to Vegas.

1UjOsa8X_UBlx47yWalOUA.text: My cousin and I are so glad we went in here. They were out of the fried chicken skin. I'll just have to come back. We had the broccoli w/green goddess dressing. Yum! The Rainbow cauliflower was delicious.  The Bacon Jam and Brie was good too. My cousin kept eating spoonfuls if it and she doesn't even care for bacon, Lol. My favorite was the Mushroom and bluecheese flatbread,  OH MY!!! Our bartender was great as well.

3idR78CYSPmBH_ZKMGcjqg.text: all the 4 and 5 star reviews had me excited to give the place a try! Walked in after getting showered and refreshed at the hotel. Glad I had read on a review that there was no sign out side, at least we knew what to look for.  Staff was friendly and I really liked the decor and vibe of the place.  He was not a fan of the communal seating, especially with the two elderly gentleman and their escorts attempting to carry on conversations. Ordered a round of drinks and ordered the short rib sliders with tater tots and the mac and cheese (which the server proclaimed was "LIFE CHANGING-you have to have it ". Place was freezing so the wait seemed to be longer than it probably was. a chef and maybe a manager were arguing with the bartender about her ringing an order up incorrectly , fine I get it but really in front of the guests?  Sliders looked good, mac and cheese looked good. He grabbed a slider and one bite he was done. The braising in rootbeer is great, but there is NOTHING on the thing to counteract the sweetness. The tater tots were way way overcooked to the point there was no white in the middle. The mac and cheese while decent, was no where near "life changing" I spent years in DC if you want life changing mac and cheese go to Cafe Delux in DC. he had been excited to try the bourbon brownie. But instead we left most of the sliders, half the mac and cheese and two half full drinks and went elsewhere for drinks and dessert.

6dTQqhJxl8UEMzoaukQZmA.text: Really really good service (bartender was awesome). The only thing disappointing was the bread with the bacon jam AND flatbread was burnt. Boo. Also, the drinks were more expensive than the food! Damn. Overall, cool place.

fvPss-9V5JnrRkAc1tkLFQ.text: If you want a low key quiet evening out, this place is not for you.  It's small, cramped, and busy.  The staff is nice enough, but they just seem to be in a hurry.  So if you have those expectations, you'll like the place.    The food is pretty good, but rich.  The restaurant kinda reminds me of a gastro pub without the beer taps.  Everything I had was flavor packed and unique.  I had the black rice and oxtail risotto, fried chicken skins, bacon jam, and the watermelon feta salad.  All good, and very rich.  I think the food was giving me gout afterwards.  BTW, I shared the plates, I didn't eat all those dishes myself.  There's a patio in the back that you can wait in while you're waiting for a table.  It's open, so it was about 150 degrees out there.  I ordered a beer and took it out there, but it went warm rather quickly.  Maybe you get use to the dry heat if you live in Vegas?  They don't take reservations, but they set the waiting time expectations really well.  People seem to be willing to wait to get a spot in this place.  Try it once.  The beer and wine selection was small but well done.  I think they should add a couple more verities of beer on the menu though.

DQk4lXLOJ0P5g2MesMBDQw.text: Funky location located off the strip with really great atmosphere when you open the door. This is totally the type of place I would expect to see in Portland, Oregon. The burgers were fantastic as were the veal meatballs. We also ordered the fried chicken skins, which were "different".   The staff was very friendly, helpful and fun.  I'll definitely be going back when I'm in Las Vegas.

4AycGUK31VBHTjIVBKm7lw.text: Our experience at this place was  excellent except for the place being too small and a  little louder than I expected but besides that food and ambiance  was was great  everything was delicious I was actually impressed on how good the food tasted.

yrNqFKKESIEqn6z6SMUl3w.text: This place had a really nice patio in the back to wait until they seat you. Really, the worst part was once we were seated the waitress told us that she would bring us bread then she never did. Then my entree was delivered 15 minutes before my dates was... which means mine was definitely cold by the time I got to eat it. The prices were pretty high for what you actually get as well. The food was okay, but everything else was below average so it didn't even really matter.

Nw0wlNZNYINoP4SfOysBbw.text: Definitely a great place with really good food, and a great atmosphere. The Butter burger was absolutely fantastic. The place was busy but it is a pretty small place. Great for a group like 3 to 6 people. The bacon jam is wonderful. Our server was absolutely fantastic. The Crispy chicken skins were a little dry/burnt . The donut bread pudding was very good for dessert. The server was great but busy so we didnt get drink refills like we wanted/needed. The parking here is not great, and you kinda wander through a little homeless area nearby if you park out that direction.

9lI_pJpow2q8RLK3jvs3gg.text: This place never disappoints. I have never had anything that was less than fantastic. Chicken skin with smoked honey and the bacon jam with Brie shouldn't be missed. The salads are always fantastic. The only thing I would say to pass on are the flatbreads. Mainly because there are more exciting options. Cocktails are always delicious. Ask for recommendations. The servers are knowledgeable and will ask you questions to make the best recommendations. Currently my favorite restaurant in the city.

20HGdgo7S2YMZ2qj8ZvR_A.text: Came here because of the Yelp reviews and now I'm writing one.   Really took care of us with great service and food.  Cauliflower was off the hook as was the chicken.  Place makes me wish I lived in Vegas.  Definitely a gem.

J4oB6Xm6b-por0_rl9J8ew.text: Burnt ends. Yum. Filet. Yum. Grown up grilled cheese. Yum. Sangria. Yum. Mac and cheese. Yum Food was a 5. Service was meh.

_FBw0aMXCeeBfPOeZ7v51g.text: Absolutely outstanding. Incredible food, great atmosphere. The BBQ burnt ends were amazing, and the crispy chicken was one of the best food items we had! Great beer selection, and a must hit if in old town near Fremont.

YrGiqzyeobmq2vqlRNUzFg.text: Very nice, quaint restaurant. This restaurant reminded me of the type of joint I would see back home in New Orleans. Wait staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was awesome for a date with my beautiful wife.

NhRFRarYQKe_trsqZrxFmQ.text: Short rib gouda grilled cheese....soooooo yummy

nW7brTgYJIwmIyTGK1WByg.text: The wife and I went downtown specifically for a dinner at Carson Kitchen.  Carson Kitchen had been on my to-do list since opening, but we finally made it for dinner less than a week after Chef Simon had, sadly, passed away.  I'd been a fan of Chef Simon's unique take on comfort food after dining at his first restaurant at the Hard Rock back in '03, so there was a somber note to an otherwise delicious dining experience.  We arrived around 5:30 on a Thursday night.  Carson Kitchen was smaller than I expected, but it possessed a dark, modern, masculine aesthetic that looked nice.  We didn't have reservations, but coming in early allowed us to snag prime seats overlooking the kitchen.  I always enjoy being able to see the action in the kitchen.  Our seats didn't disappoint.  We didn't order drinks other than water, which was unusual for us, especially since there were several cocktails on the menu that sounded appealing.  Definitely next time.  For our meal, we shared orders of the Crispy Chicken Skins ($9), Bacon Jam ($12), and Rabbit Ragu ($14).  The Crispy Chicken Skins were exactly what you'd expect, crispy chicken skins...essentially chicken chicharron, served with smoked honey for dipping.  It was simple, delicious, and effective.  The Bacon Jam was exactly what you'd expect; smoky, savory bacon made into a jam, topped with baked Brie, and served with toasted baguette slices.  It was very close to being too salty for my personal liking, but it didn't cross the line and it was still very good.  The Rabbit Ragu wasn't what you'd likely expect unless you'd read the menu, which we did.  We received a generous amount of rabbit meat in the ragu served atop a bed of spaghetti squash, a nice change of pace over regular pasta, and topped with Parmesan.  All of our dishes were generous in its portion size given the price.  Service was friendly and attentive throughout our meal.  By all measures, Carson Kitchen was everything I'd hoped it would be. 4.5 stars.

0ai1RYjiGJXTP06LHWncug.text: Wow!The bacon jam is one of my favorite things on the planet,and the chicken skins is yummy too.Everything was amazing!We'll be back to try something new soon.I just love love it!!

_GcLAB_GxHZv2qzL0AY24Q.text: I don't even know where to start.  Have you ever had waitstaff notice that your burger wasn't cooked quite right from just a glance, then immediately come over and offer to redo it? Because we did. We've NEVER had such amazing service at a restaurant.   We've also never had such amazing mac and cheese. If I wasn't half comatose from stuffing myself, I would write lengthy, borderline inappropriate poetry to honor Carson Kitchen's mac and cheese.  Bread pudding made from doughnuts. Are you freaking kidding me?  This place has officially been added to our must-visit list for future Vegas trips.

7jzs33APQBVvPqVpXp-vIQ.text: Came because of the YELP reviews for my husband's birthday. We love downtown and are always looking for new places. We were seated by the front. Immediately I was uncomfortable because of the wooden stools they used as chairs. We took two full back chairs from the next table and put the stools there. The hostess came over and told us we couldn't have those chairs because there wouldn't be enough room when they got busy. We actually sat closer to the table because they were chairs. We asked to keep the chairs and she just walked off.  Ordered some appetizers and drinks. No redbull...boo. What kind of hipster restaurant doesn't have redbull?  They did have Tito's vodka...yum.  Our server was very nice and explained how the food is served, etc. Ordered the chicken skins, not my favorite but I don't like just fried skins. Also got the green beans (YUMMY!!!!) the sauce was amazing. My husband ordered the lamb tacos and loved them. There were only 3 tacos and we were obviously sharing the dishes so the waitress asked if we would like a 4th...I thought that was nice. I did love the Mac and cheese. The rest of the food was good but not necessarily my taste. It was obvious they put great care into their menu and presentation, I appreciated that.  We had desert but only ate half of it. No one really liked the bacon ice cream except me. The bread pudding was yummy.  Overall it was a good experience. I liked the atmosphere and the whole feeling. Not sure I'd go back but only because the menu wasn't my preference.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The big round ice was fun!

Z_SOVnJ_91dlQt0CCXLqlQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant on Las Vegas. I've tried both lunch and  dinner menus and find both selections are absolutely delicious. The staff is always friendly and attentive. My favorite dish is the bread pudding!

t-phaTjd0oG2XZf2Ee3d0g.text: Saw this restaurant on yelp as a good place to eat in downtown. It took a minute to find it but once we did we were greeted  quickly. We were told about the menu. We ordered a few different things. The deviled eggs, Mac and cheese, short rib grilled cheese and burnt ends. Everything was great!

4dsxktFAhyDjLZlsR871FA.text: Are you in Las Vegas and you want to eat risotto? This is the only place to do it. No one else will sell you risotto.   This corny, well lit restaurant will serve delicious food that you will love. The atmosphere is dark and a little corny. The wait staff are friendly, professional and corny. The food is very solid. Have some.

jK_5RqDIL-82q9IyT8xTCA.text: First time here but it won't be my last.  Came here for an early lunch on a Thursday.  They open at 11:30am and the place fills up fast.  My boyfriend works downtown and suggested this place since it was close to his work.  Definitely a trendy, hipster place.  The waitresses were dressed in jeans and various music group T-shirts.  We were immediately seated by Chelsea who was rocking a Led Zeppelin T-shirt (I liked her already!).  They have various tables and seating in a big square around the bar.  We opted to sit up at the bar.  My coffee arrived quickly and Chelsea never let it get below half full (coffee drinkers always appreciate that!).  After a few minutes exploring the menu my friend and I decided to split the gyro tacos and the bacon jam.  The tacos were perfect size with spicy lamb meat inside topped with feta cheese, traditional Greek tzatziki sauce, and tomatoes.  Yummy!  The bacon jam was a piping hot mix of bacon, cheese, and a sweet flavor infused.  It was served with crispy sliced baguette bread.  Another hit.    During lunch Carson Kitchen fills up fast.  There was a mix of casually dressed 20 somethings to middle aged business men/women.  They have a rooftop bar and an impressive libations menu as well.  Prices are a little high for lunch ($40 + tip) but justified by the quality of food and service.  Carson Kitchen nails it!

ibq_AoV0mBSa0CsAMEIFoQ.text: This is a review that I admittedly feel bad writing, as it always tugs on my heartstrings a bit to see a place fall from grace. I have dined at Carson Kitchen a total of 6 times now and had I written my review after the first two times, I would have easily given them 5/5 stars, but now that I have dined there several more times since, I feel like there is a bit of complacency that has resulted in the restaurant going downhill a bit in both its food quality, variety, and service.   Starting with the menu. Chef Kerry Simon developed the original menu and when they first opened, they discussed how the menu would change over time and that things would come and go for variety. I totally respect that and think it is refreshing. We ordered the Spam Croquettes on our first visit and unfortunately it was one of the first things to be removed and never come back. Other items we have tried over the times we have been there are the Bacon Jam, the Chicken Skins, the risotto, tacos, and many others. It seems like the fryer has been in overdrive lately as the fried items are simply too over fried. The bacon jam was heavily seasoned and though some grease is expected, it was taken to the extreme.   We prefer to dine upstairs on the patio, and when it is available, we always request it. Nice view and a peaceful modern setting. The dining area downstairs is a bit cramped and a little too hipster modern for our tastes. The hostess is friendly enough but also seemed a bit agitated at times.   Refills on drinks and water tend to be pretty slow and my biggest complaint: no refills on sodas and no draft beer as they do not have a soda fountain or taps. I really do not like restaurants that only serve canned or bottled sodas but I can deal with it when the food and service make up for it. Unfortunately, Carson Kitchen has fallen short recently. I am sincerely hoping that they will get their shit together and bring back the friendly hipster service and well prepared menu items that I recall them having when they grand opened.

DounuxMNYP9J8m-DT1fq5g.text: Oh man, this place was so close to 5 stars. I'm in Las Vegas for training and I've promised myself to stay away from the tourist traps and eat with the locals. Yelp pointed me to Carson Kitchen and I had a great drink and meal there.  The falafel sliders with spicy tots were great, the deviled eggs with roe were AMAZING, the only letdown was the strawberry pie, which was basically boozy strawberries in a runny custard. I haven't had an amazing desert in Vegas so far so I won't beat them up on that.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0japN8edHsVdt2Ttm5Ipvw.text: This place was fantastic! Somehow I've never been here before, but I'm definitely coming back! The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about gluten free and celiac concerns on their menu, and they even had a gf fried chicken sandwich! The food was incredible! I had the chicken sandwich and loved it! They lettuce wrapped it with butter lettuce (my favorite) and the pickle aioli was surprisingly good (I usually hate pickles).   I definitely suggest this place for lunch or early dinner. I know it can get busy in the evenings, but it was quite relaxed when my friends and I went. My other friend had the burger and said it was incredibly delicious.   Also the tater tots were super yummy. It may not have been super healthy but it sure was incredibly delicious!   Celiac recommended and approved!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have a giant swear jar!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich lettuce gluten free!!

DP79TQkEzKoeTDW0adf53w.text: Seriously, this place is close to perfection.  I ate at Carson Kitchen tonight for the 3rd time and it never fails to deliver a great experience.  It's a small space, but always busy and active.  Lively conversation, but not too loud.  There is a great outdoor patio and an upstairs bar.  The venue is first-rate.  As far as food goes, there is nothing on the menu that isn't amazing.  I've had the Burnt Ends, Devils Eggs and Gyro Tacos.  And I've had the Strip Steak, the Pork Chop and salad.  I could elaborate on these items, but words don't do them justice.  They are phenomenal.  Mac and Cheese....heaven on earth.  Olive Oil potatoes....wow.  Cauliflower...awesome.  Yes, there is a theme here.  Nothing has disappointed.  The staff understands how to run a very busy, popular restaurant.  They are friendly, efficient and really helpful.  Having trouble with what to order?   Just ask someone to help.  I'd swear that everyone has worked here for years, because they are familiar with the menu and no one is shy about offering recommendations.  They also get along and work as a team, which says a lot about the management team.  Finally, a huge shout-out to Stacy and Michael for making tonight's visit the even better than the last two.  I am a local and this is officially my go-to place Downtown!

7bG-oH53EeCuj2AgY2ZFqA.text: Great food selection. One of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever eaten. The bacon jam was also very good. Interesting drink menu. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VM9zO0nwKAyvhtc8DUGX1A.text: So happy I came here and tried Carson Kitchen after a great recommendation from Lisa R!  I also read the many 5 star yelp reviews and knew as soon as we walked into this eclectic restaurant, it was going to be a fun experience!  They had a 30 minute wait, but we passed the time on their back outdoor patio with wine and shared the warm of the unique fireplace radiating heat, as it was a bit chilly outside.  The hostess sat us in less than 30 minutes at a bar high level communal table! It turned out to be great as we sat next to a trio of really fun ladies from California! They had already ordered and gave us tastes of several of their food selections to help us make up our minds what to order!  We started with the tempura green beans with red pepper cream cheese dip - boy was that yummy! JF had their jerk turkey burger that came with crunchy tater tots (I ate half of them)!  I ordered the red and golden beet salad with grapes & mini goat cheese balls rolled with pistachios and it was delicious too!  We also tasted the roasted cauliflower with a lemony flavor and the truffle Mac & Cheese our communal table companions readily shared with us! They were both incredible! Another couple at our communal table were raving about the Brie and bacon jam they slathered on toasts!  The bartender and our server were both very friendly and helped us with recommendations too.  I even had a second glass of Pinot Noir, which for those who know me, rarely happens!  I can't wait to go back and try more food items!  Our server told us a few items were coming off the menu and were being replaced with new menu items. I love a restaurant who freshens their menu to reflect the seasonality of fresh produce and offers what is best in meats, poultry and seafood too!  So the next time I make it to Vegas, Carson Kitchen, will be on my list of "must eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starters
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Communal table
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Green Beans with red pepper cream cheese dip

QTqFs-6oDJjMoM7rw5o01g.text: Small plates - big taste!  As I understand it, this place is fairly new.  I had it recommended to me during my last Las Vegas trip by a transplant and a native to the area, so I figured it must be good.  It did not disappoint!  The restaurant is pretty small.  Although it wasn't super busy when I visited on a Thursday night in June, it was still pretty hopping.  Be prepared to wait.  Although they don't have an indoor waiting area, there is a courtyard area just outside the back of the restaurant with plenty of seating where you can wait comfortably --- that is, if you don't mind the heat.  They offer indoor seating at tables and bar areas and they also boast a deck upstairs above the restaurant, so you have plenty of choices for seating.   The menu offers a variety of small plates.  They encourage you to order at least two per person in your party and share.  I was on my own, so there was no sharing going on.  I had a very difficult time narrowing down my choices.  Although the menu was on the smaller side - everything sounded good!  I eventually settled on the "Green Eggs & Ham" flatbread - pesto, smoked mozzarella, two sunny side up eggs and ham.  It was insanely delicious!  My waiter recommended breaking the yolks of the eggs with my fork and spreading them over the pizza, like a "carbonara".  Really, really delicious.  In an attempt to be lady-like and not come across as a total pig I ate half of my pizza at the restaurant, but wound up finishing it off back at my hotel later that evening.  My waiter was very attentive, friendly and made some great menu suggestions.  He was also knowledgeable of the beverages - explaining that the raspberry cider I chose to drink was best served over ice with some berries, if that was okay with me.  He also commented that the brand offered other amazing flavors, including a pear that was "divine" if I could find it for sale back where I was from.    When the check came, it was presented to me in a hardcover book, which based on what was on the page I opened it up to was about brewing beer.  I thought that was a funky and interesting touch.  Although I didn't leave my mark on the book, I noticed on earlier pages many others had signed their names or left little doodles.    While the restaurant itself doesn't have any parking, there is street parking nearby and the Fremont Street Experience parking garage is just a block away.  Speaking of which, the Fremont Street Experience is just around the corner from the restaurant.  This is a great restaurant to hit before or after you do the touristy thing on Fremont.    Near perfect experience --- I'd probably bump this to a five star restaurant experience if the menu had a tad more variety and if they offered an indoor waiting area and restaurant parking.    The food though?  Man... that's as good as it gets!  Check it out!

y2KjYA3raC-yWE-GMOdXvQ.text: Loved every aspect of this little gem.   1. A waiting area in the back to grab a drink till your table opens up. 2. Literally a block away from Fremont, without the loud noise of fremont.  3. A swear tip jar for the cooks, (full might I add) this place has a sense of humor! 4. The food. Oh.Em.Gee. very innovative menu; bacon jam, fried chicken skins, feta and watermelon salad and more.  5. Great price, as in both your stomach and wallet leave full.   Very impressed and this place is now on my Vegas perma list.

LbETlJq1q0tnDx5-c2QpKQ.text: Totally loved this little place. Passed on the Stratosphere and certainly glad we did! We had the mac n' cheese...phenomenal, Burnt Ends... delicious, beet salad... tasty and attractive, Oxy tail risotto (a little salty but) delicious, and the donut pudding was pretty good. Nice fire pit out back with a couple of extra tables. The upstairs wasn't open that day. We went at 8pm on a Thursday in April 2017.

UNFMT2YS9wNyRK0M86sRSA.text: Before going to the Smith Center, we usually try to dine in one of the downtown restaurants. This time we chose Carson kitchen based on the very positive yelp reviews. Ambiance: despite the fact that the address is on 6th street, the entrance to the restaurant is on Carson. There are dining three areas, indoors, the first floor patio, and an upstairs patio. It was 105 and windy the day we ate at Carson kitchen so the two outdoor eating areas were not real option. The indoor eating area is rather stark and very small. We were party of six and ended up sharing a hightop table with a party of two strangers (nice guys). The table right next to us was another party of six. Unfortunately, they were VERY loud, which doesn't do well in a very small room. They really weren't doing anything wrong. It just makes dining very unpleasant when someone is that loud in that small of a room. Service: Chelsea, our server, came to our table almost as soon as we sat down. Since we were first timers, she explained the menu and answered questions and made some suggestions. Very warm and welcoming. Overall, excellent service. Food: We started with shared tempura green beans. Yummm. We also shared the bacon jam. Very tasty. When we ran out of the bread, we ended up putting it on our other dishes (I even ate some straight up - also very good!!) I shared the Margherita Pizza/Flatbread. Excellent!! I also shared the Cocoa expresso NY Strip Steak. Prepared the way we requested but a bit tougher than I like. Just OK. Overall, the service was 5 star, the food 4 star, but the ambiance made the dining unpleasant. Perhaps I will return on a night we can sit out on the upstairs patio and really enjoy the food. But I would not go back when the only option is to dine indoors.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza/Flatbread - delish!

B27DAYZEEwyfAgjNXHqRqw.text: Delicious, unexpected, exactly what this California couple was hoping to find. Awesome charred octopus with a lovely sauce, then some deviled eggs, yum.... cauliflower with unexpected but delicious lemon.... asparagus with pickles and capers a delight. Then a shared burger and great Malbec rounded out our best meal in 5 days in Vegas. Thanks!

I5WtWlXs2K1w1NmWKNcrDw.text: This place is close to Hotel D where we stayed at so we decided to come by and check it out.   I ordered the blackened catfish burger, which came with a side of spicy tater tots. The tots aren't spicy at all and are actually fried pretty well. The fish is quite moist and well flavored and breaded.   Overall delicious meal with good service.

VCRuswWYkFgNdqQ-Oninhg.text: I couldn't have been more impressed by this restaurant. It is the one of the main reasons I'd want to come back to Las Vegas!! We had just eaten at the Nomad restaurant the night before and the service was terrible. At Carson's our waitress was extremely attentive, receptive, helpful. We ordered the salmon with spinach pesto and it was the best salmon I've ever had. Also loved the kale salad and the beets. Amazing, amazing restaurant!

L2lrmcY9cQusVzjoigdmlA.text: We hadn't planned on coming here whilst in Vegas however whilst exploring the sleezy side (Downtown) the choice of dinner options were fairly limited if you wanted a nice venue... However we found this place and it was amazing, food options were nicely paired and it's a bit like tapas where it's more about sharing than choosing your own dishes! Everything was very reasonable priced and far cheaper than any main strip restaurant and I highly recommend it!

JkRd_g-xHJrM4VbV14C5AQ.text: Wow! The bacon jam, the chicken skins, OMG the cocktails   I brought one of my best friends here and a group of friends for his birthday.  And what a great choice. We explored the menu, tried a bit of everything... and spent over $350 .... so so SO worth it!

TTDw9ZKQ8zP7pMGfF7V4oA.text: This place was absolutely delicious! We ordered the poached pear and bleu salad -yum! The poaching of the pears made them extra sweet. Then we ordered the wild mushroom flatbread. Again, outstanding. The cherry tomatoes were marinated which added another layer to a complex--flavored dish. And our most favorite was the glazed donut bread pudding. I ordered this per yelp recommendations but was skeptical because I don't particularly like bread pudding. The texture was perfect, the flavor was incredible and the sauces made it unforgettable. Carson kitchen is one of our faves now!

uYdkTbcsRgYl4oIcbwIUHw.text: Excellent service and something unexpectedly yummy! Was seated right away and despite the somewhat strange menu choices, was pleasantly surprised.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finis&#39;! Excellent

rcl6GXrjqleoPG4Q233bGA.text: Loved it here. This restaurant was amazing. The staff was super nice and cool. I loved the open kitchen. We sat at the bar seating by the kitchen so were able to see everything. It's mesmerizing. They have great drinks. I loved the octopus and the cauliflower dishes. I hope to get here when I am in Vegas next.

lt_A9evHB-0H_2MLcE9zow.text: We had jerk turkey burgers.  They were good. The people were very friendly. Turkey burger is juicy. And it comes with spicy tater tots. When downtown this is a great option. They also look to have other intriguing dishes

i9Re92A5_6cn7ajemWNKfg.text: They say what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas....they also say that sharing is caring, such a conflict of interest!  I'm going with sharing as that is the theme of this restaurant.   Only a couple of blocks from Fremont St, this minimalist delight appears between a car parking station and a clutch of cheap motels.....don't let the exterior fool you as once inside you are greeted with exposed bricks and beans and plenty of long wooden tables. So it's pretty funky in an unpretentious way....not something that can be said very often about Vegas.  Don't go for the burgers (they look fantastic) as you will miss the ethos of this place which is all about shared plates.  The Mrs and I had four. Mac n cheese which truffley and rich, deviled eggs, veal meatballs in foie gras cream and our favorite, the lamb gyro tacos.  All that for around $50.....amazing value and way better than the other chew and spew options abounding in this part of old Vegas.  The decor is minimalist, with exposed brick and beans, long wooden (shared) tables. The wine, cocktail and beer menu is short and varied.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unassuming outside facade

s5rYKaJi5RK2FssbFJVJwg.text: The only issue is they need more space.   Eats:  Every dish we had was excellent. We shared most dishes (as I recommend you do here) and it was really nice getting to try the different menu items. My fav-fried chicken skins. Trust me on his one.  Drinks:  Artisan cocktails that are on the menu are great. Not over-the-top. Straight forward ingredients that let the spirits shine through.   Ambiance:  Trendy, inquisitive, rustic. Noise level is high because of the small size and proximity to other diners. My party sat at the chefs table/bar, and it was really interesting watching them create the dishes.   Overall:  Get. Here. Today. You will not regret it. Prices are reasonable. 4 people, 4 drinks, 7 dishes. $145

cN3ZLAS5J7Ow1N5Qn45PMg.text: Love this place every time I go to eat there! Food is amazing and some of the items on the menu are very creative. The staff is always friendly and very helpful.

Ie5w1n547-aVAI67WdEXpg.text: Wow...CK is really small inside. We were on the strip and walked over to grab dinner 30-40 min, but got lucky as a couple was getting up from the bar and we ended up dining there.  The bartenders (there were two) were both super nice and responsive. Drink orders immediately.  The menu doesn't look any thing different from any other place in Vegas, but DAMN the taste was amazing. We ordered the fried chicken skins - crunchy, hot, and delicious. The bacon jam- well portion, scorching hot, and tasted like heaven.  The steak - perfectly cooked and tender. Oh boy is it a must visit every time we go to Vegas.  We'll be back in a month for sure. It's now on the regular visit place when we're in town. Great job CK- you got it right.

G4RHlJyY7GgWptKN_vGhQQ.text: I very rarely give 5 stars because those are freaking holy to me. Perhaps it was because of how skeptical I was going into this that it just... knocked me right the kisser (mouth).  The food is delicious fresh, made to order, and brought out right when it is ready. Now how about some time for hyperbole... because as a human that is all I know how to speak in.  I am going to be honest: best mac n cheese that I have ever eaten, perfect cheese melted together that had the perfect flavor bite that just melted in my mouth... well I guess technically in the pot, but lets not nit pick.  Bacon jam... yes.  Bison burgers... yes.  I saw the prices and I said I am not sure about this... i mean seriously 12$ for mac n cheese. Oh my gosh though, for the price absolutely worth it.   WAIT WAIT WAIT!!! theres more... doughnut bread pudding. That is the unofficial mic drop of this place. So oooey and gooey and puddiney.  THE VERDICT: If you are in vegas try this place out and indulge. Don't go super light, just get a little of everything, youll probably drop 70$ but I promise you... your tongue will just be so hot with delicious happiness.
