2KsvZXm2ASPFSgqoUuVMNQ.text: This place is so good.  It wasn't what I was expecting, but I'm glad we stayed.  It's a pretty small place and it's a lot of open/social seating so don't be surprised when they sit you next to other people.  Also, it's more of a small plates type place.  I recommend planning to share and spending a decent amount of cash.  I had glanced at the menu so I was expecting $15-20 a person, but realistically $30-50 a person will be a more enjoyable experience.  Everything we ordered was great.  I devoured the veal meatballs.. sooo much flavor.  I wish it would've came with more.  The secret sunday chicken sandwich was very tasty and I recommend that as well.  And you must finish with the glazed donut bread pudding.  It was so delicious!  We also ordered some german potato salad, cauliflower, and a pork chop as well.  Those were all great, but not as highly recommended as the options I mentioned previously.  Get here early if you can. I would imagine this place would be pretty hard to come to with a large group.  This place should be on your must-try list.

O4yiRTQYpX3ePXn6TUpKpg.text: It was a dark mysterious night when I decided to head to Carson Kitchen. All I can say is order the chicken skin. Chicken skin all day x's 2 to the twentieth power with the awesome honey dip. Expect a wait time, places has limited seating. There is a nice bar upstairs and outdoor fire pit to help time fly. The aroma of the succulent mist steaming of the juicy chicken breast makes you salivated as you bite into the most tender THOT of poultry.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skin &amp; Honey

ridCFS5YltpIMd804rhr5w.text: This was a extremely loud place. Also this is way to hipster for us. I asked for my burger to be well with no pink and at least 1/2 of the burger was pink although I did not know until i have eaten half of it. Also it was called a butter burger yet I tasted no butter on it. My fiancee got the red snapper entree and when it came out it looked like a appetizer as it was a very small portion. Not what we expected. We also did the chicken skin appetizer! The concept was ideal although they seemed to be over Cooked and or burnt.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken skins
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter less burger.

oOjF79bUSwEQNyT1-F2Bxw.text: Service was great, the owner explained the options on the meal.  Food came out of the kitchen quick.

jtNeptSqY_q2wqgPhI0-lA.text: We stopped in here for some tapas. This place had a very trendy atmosphere, very social gathering inspired. The wait staff was wonderful. Each food item was delivered and a description given, by different staff members. It was impressive how consistent their food delivery presentation was from server to server.      This place has something going for them, innovative tapas. The menu is a social or sharing menu, meaning you order several items and share them amongst your group.      We ordered a bunch of items, Bacon Jam, fried chicken skin, gyro tacos, charred octopus, and kicking shrimp. All of our food was very good and interesting in concept. The Kicking shrimp was exceptional, one of my faves.     We also order the donut dessert, which was out of this world. It is worth a visit just for this dessert.      All in all, this is a great spot with some creative takes on tapas, worth a visit.

I4x_4EMIP6mvpFfazv-m7w.text: I had the black rice risotto, very tasty, and filling enough for a lunch by itself, though if I had been hungrier I would have ordered more, and given how tasty the dish was, I actually wished I was hungrier.  I'm rounding up because the vibe is cool. The dishes show thought to them, it is an open kitchen, and the service was good. Definitely a place I will again visit.

johKctwn7ePERiQCJ_kmSg.text: Absolutely loved this place! The inside was very small but in a cozy feeling and not over crowded! I was seated at the bar which I loved because I got to see straight into the kitchen and watch the chefs prepare the food. Overall the atmosphere was like a young, hipster, upbeat vibe. It was spaced out very all and had a nice aesthetic to the place!   The waitress told me that these meals are supposed to be sharing dishes, which created a fun atmosphere! We ordered the meat pizza (forgot the exact name) with the risotto which both were to die for! The food was prepared quick and all prepare fresh made.   The service was great as well. The waitress was very friendly and helped answers all questions since this was my first time going! I am excited to go again to taste out more food and then that might just change this to a 5 star review!

GXFPGRLasSXJF-vlQJ_ipg.text: This was a great brunch spot close to downtown (within walking distance), and driving distance from the strip. Apparently they get very busy and don't take reservations, so plan ahead. We got there just as they opened at 11:30am on a Sat, and our party of 6 was able to be seated right away.  We got the following: Bacon jam ($13): highly recommend this. It comes with toasted baguette and this delicious bacon savory spread with Brie cheese. So good. Baked Mac and cheese ($13): another sharable side. The truffle flavor wasn't as strong as in other Mac and cheeses I have had, and the serving size was a bit on the small side. It was very good with the bacon jam on top though. Gyro tacos ($12): would probably skip this next time. They had a nice Greek flavor to them with lamb, tzatziki, and feta, but didn't wow me.  I also got the butter burger ($14), which was a pretty filling burger. I liked that they came with tator tots, which was a nice change from the usual fries.  Their desserts looked super tasty as well, but we were too full to try them. Next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter burger ($14)
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam ($13)
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

PsmGIqiNGAUJqE49V3TFWw.text: My boyfriend and I came to Carson Kitchen early on a Wednesday night. We had not made reservations, but we did not think it would be that busy mid-week. We had about a 1/2 hour wait, and later found out it was because the restaurant was also hosting a food tour group that night. We were seated at the bar, which was pretty neat as we got first glimpses of dishes as they were meticulously prepared before being carried out to the tables. We got to chat with the phenomenal Emmett, who was great at recommending dishes and also telling us neat tid bits, such as this is a restaurant that Gordon Ramsay frequents. My boyfriend and I both ordered the burgers, which were made to perfection and served with tasty tater tots (that have a surprising nice kick to them). For drinks, I had a glass of the Riesling, which was on the sweeter side, like I prefer and my boyfriend had a bottle of the Anchor Point beer. And even though we were full from our burgers, we had to try the bread pudding, one of Gordon Ramsay's favorites here. Emmett, our amazing chef, had prepared the pudding just for us, and carefully lathered it with the sauce to make it picture perfect. Every bite of the pudding just melted in our mouths. We can't wait to be back to this hidden gem of downtown Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of Gordon Ramsay&#39;s favorites here: bread pudding. Pure deliciousness!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My entree was the burger with the amazing tater tots.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best deviled eggs I have ever had.

asaDMd2ZLAKXRZLrOE7S1w.text: We walked here from our hotel.  It was a bit hard to find.  We couldn't tell what door to go in as it looked closed to us.   When we got in, it was cute and stylish.   Our server explained the menu.  Most of it was tapas style.  We enjoyed trying each of the items we each ordered.  The green beans and veal meatballs were good. The butter burger was big.  It was very juicy even tho I ordered it med and no pink.  We all shared. My daughter's Mac and cheese came out last.  It was yummy.  It reminded me of a warm garlic bread.   It was rich.  I'd come back to this restaurant.

bmLWzxByAkr0DpdwXRHjTA.text: What a great find! This little place is a block off Fremont. Instead of neon and glitter, its industrial space (brick, exposed joists, etc) is a cool oasis with a hot menu.   We feasted on delicious gyros tacos, deviled eggs w caviar and crispy pancetta, cocoa-espresso NY strip steak, a beautiful presentation of red and golden beets with goat cheese rolled in ground pistachio and drizzled with honey.   Another tasty savory dish was snap peas in smoked paprika butter with harissa cream. And the "pork wings" are delicious fried pork belly bites in buffalo blue cheese beurre blanc. Needless to say, we had no room for dessert... although I was sorely tempted by the brown butter bacon ice cream!  There are also flatbreads, interesting salads, sandwiches and more that make this a place we will return again and again.   A selection of craft cocktails plus a well-curated list of wines, ales and lagers includes gluten-free and cider options plus non-alcoholic sodas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Wings (4 pieces per small plate)

eZ40T0vJSohbV01HHkv5sA.text: I came here a few weeks ago with friends to celebrate me passing my NCLEX exam, we were all so excited to try this place out and weren't disappointed! It's a bit smaller on the inside, although there may have been additional seating upstairs that we didn't see? Reservations aren't taken and we were a large party coming at prime dinner time on a Saturday, and LUCKILY we didn't have to wait too long to be seated (only roughly 10 minutes). They have a modern concept in terms of decor, I just wish that the seating was a bit more comfortable since we were all sitting on hard barstools. The food was delicious though, we had communal fried chicken skins with smoked honey and bacon jam with crostini's; 3 of us ordered the Mac and cheese (had heard how popular this was and I do consider myself to be a bit of a Mac and cheese connoisseur haha) which was delicious albeit small, while the others ordered tacos, the flatbread, the Brussels sprout salad, and the risotto. The prices of the food ranged from $13-15 and they had a good selection of alcohol, overall we had a positive experience!

y_iXVEnUtqmZB7YKGOPmEg.text: Randomly decided to eat at this place after driving around downtown and we lucked out big time! They have 'sharing plates' so we ordered the Oxtail Risotto, Mushroom Pizza, Shrimp (I forget the name but it was crazy good!), and the Gyro Tacos. It was enough for two even in our hungover starving state. They have an open kitchen which I love and the restaurant is small so it's a cozy feel. Service was fantastic! Everyone was so friendly! we will totally be back again!

AJUD_i7cnQ41TQPRC8g5uQ.text: Wanted to check out local spots instead of the strip. Ordered the Gyro tacos, crispy chicken skin with honey dipping, bread pudding and specialty ginger ale. Overall the food was good. The lamb in the gyros was over seasoned for me. Lamb has a very distinct taste but I could not even taste the lamb. Can't go wrong with fried chicken skin, and was savory. The bread pudding was really delicious with cup of black coffee.

yp0s0ov2tPe0SI3urODvJg.text: It's been a minute since I was last here. I didn't realize they remodeled the place! It feels a lot roomier now. The only thing I wasn't a fan of were the metal stools we sat on. They're not the most comfortable seatings and I like chairs that have a back to them. Onto the food!   Bacon jam: I always get this when I come here. It's a must! Other than bacon and Brie, I'm not sure what else is in it but it taste like a bit of heaven to me. Comes with several slices of toasted baguette so you can slather on that heavenly goodness.  Gyro tacos: topped with feta cheese and diced tomatoes. Wasn't a huge fan of this one. It just tasted kind of blah.   Grilled cheese short rib: perfectly cooked. Short rib was tender and tasted excellent with the cheese. Bread had a nice crunch to it without being too hard. Comes with a side of spicy tator tots. These tots are seriously the most delicious tots I've ever had. They were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I'm in love with them.   NY Strip steak: cooked medium rare. Highly recommend getting this! It was juicy and the spices gave it amazing flavor.  Didn't get to try the desserts this time but I have my eye out on that glazed donut bread pudding! Will for sure be back!

N0Ah70J4xRemIiLdD3AmRw.text: I was worried about being downtown and parking but I was right out front, in and out in no time! From the ambiance and music,  to the decor, to the service and my God the FOOD! I had a cider,  the green beans and the chicken thighs with tots.  I mean,  I WAS on a cheat day after all,  and if I'm going to cheat I'm cheating all the way!!!  It was a tough choice because everything looked great but I went with some favorites I saw listed here on Yelp.  Literally my last stop on my way to the airport and now I wish it had been my first because  I would have gone back again. Thank you to the staff for getting me served and on the road in time for my flight too.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken thighs? Don&#39;t mind if I do!

RrY_8oEQFMQLyxIbiKPm9w.text: This place was AMAZING. We had the chicken sandwich and tater tots. Hands down this is the BEST chicken sandwich I've ever had. We are from the Bay Area, and I am not opposed to coming back to Vegas like next week! Just for this! Must try when your near Fremont st.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

icEe6VZ22HxeKFIoJ6QZ0Q.text: Another Las Vegas winner.  So unique and good.  Loved everything I tried including all 3 desserts.  The only item I had that I'd not re order would be the fried chicken skins.  Between everyone at the table, I think we ordered about everything on the menu and the chickens skin would be the only thing I wouldn't be craving to have again. Bacon ice cream is my new favorite ice cream.

VrMjCZAWf17U3XKX6SVfcg.text: This place is good. At first we couldn't make our mind up cause their wasn't any options for kids. The waitress even offered us other options to a spot down the street, but we ended up staying. We ordered the chicken sandwich, broccoli crunch, fried green tomatoes,  green eggs and ham flatbread, & the MAC & CHEESE with their secret cheese sauce. Everything was good kids enjoyed it.

yoSt15x0lbPrP8q0ODHP6A.text: Phenomenal small plates, and the freshest green beans I've tasted in years. The mushroom flatbread had the perfect balance of spice and sauce and cheese and we were able to eat a quick dinner in only 45 minutes to make our show. Great experience, can't wait to come back!

wQWojzc9-BgmU0tDsJ2_Tw.text: My sister and I have been trying to coordinate a double date with our dudes for some time. With one person working graveyard, another waking at the crack of dawn for work, and yet another working swing with varied days off, this took some calendar finagling. When we finally managed a date and time, Carson Kitchen was chosen for the January outing.   I preface all this because, in choosing Carson Kitchen, I will admit two things that actually came out of my mouth when reviewing the menu. These statements have been saved to the "Regina's Douchebag Quote of the Day" archives:  1. "Man, I hate paying for deviled eggs".  2. "Um. Chicken skins are not new, people."   Okay, on the chicken skins, I used to buy them by the pound when I lived in CA. They came with garlic vinegar. They were amazing. I used to peel fried chicken skins off of pieces of chicken and eat them for myself. My resistance to them on this menu comes from a place of "oh, NOW they're cool?". I know. I know. Still a douche...    Anyway, I still think that I was overdue for a visit here, having heard rave reviews from practically anyone that's been. Having now been in for dinner myself, I agree this is a solid choice for a meal at a rather decent price point. At the end of the night with two rounds of drinks each and a shared dessert, we each paid about $50 with tax a tip. Really not bad for the thoughtful food and drink menus.   I have some qualms though:  - Seating mostly sucks. I would pay an extra $10 per person for chairs with backs. I felt like I was Asian squatting throughout my meal. Where's my Filipinos at? You know how when you were little and your parents got those tiny plastic, bright colored chairs for you to use in the shower? Yeah, that's how it felt to me.  - Dining room is cramped. Along with squatting through the meal, I didn't really have anywhere to put my coat and my bag. I ended up covering my knees with my coat and having to finagle around it.   - The deviled eggs were good, but I'm still mad that I paid for them. My husband reminded me that the caviar was a nice touch.   - Dining room is loud. I don't think this is really a negative. It's just something to keep in mind. When I got home, my voice was hoarse from screaming through our conversations.   With the qualms, come the notables:  - The fried chicken skins were delicious. The smoked honey was the real MVP.   - The black rice oxtail risotto was exceptional. This was probably my favorite item of the night. The bite from the black rice, richness from the oxtail that was mixed into the dish, brightness from the gremolata, and the overall creaminess. DAMN. It was goooooood.   - Great drinks.   - The red snapper in panang curry was presented in a way we weren't expecting. We thought we'd see a whole or side of fish on a plate. The presentation in a bowl confused us; even partially disappointed if I remember correctly. This was all washed away by perfectly cooked fish and spicy, wonderfully delicious sauce.   - The donut bread pudding has us scraping the bowl despite previously all agreeing we were stuffed. I expected it to be overly sweet. Instead, it was caramelized and buttery, but surprisingly clean. Well done.   Downtown is a bit of a trek for me so I don't know how often I'll frequent this, but a great evening was had by all.

XzSSItqPV0WPJaIZaf-cHw.text: Great flat breads love the seating set up cool vibes and good cocktails ohh the fried string beans are a must

7Dul6BVPQPd-CpHvfliFBA.text: Food is delightful and challenges your taste buds with flavors for everyone.  Something for all Social dishes are plenty for those wanting variety.  Thank you Matt and Nicole for great experience.

b77OSc__mp8s8Q0_bAO8OA.text: Although Carson Kitchen has been around for a while this was an unexpected great find for us.  The atmosphere, as well as food is contemporary/chic.  On this evening we ordered the BBQ ends, veal meat balls with sherry fois gras, and bacon jam.  First you need to check out this establishment.  Second, get the bacon jam.  That jam was so damn addicting.  Personally, I would smear it on everything.

UvmdhtECBhhn5IVeakscKw.text: Love the unique menu, atmosphere and vibe.  Great restaurant to take out of town friends or for date night.

YZc6jLMkQ2f_hDKWaNHzTg.text: BEST FOOD EVER!! Worth the wait and the staff is exceptional! Try the Chicken Skins, Veal Meatballs and Turkey Burger

bf_O0IKTaX6XKTS3lGyDeg.text: It's so easy to miss the first time you go, because their restaurant name is at the bottom of one of the windows. You'll spot it if you notice the crowd inside and on the roof.   The food was fine, though nothing I would crave enough to go again. The Wellington Empanada was a cooked just right, but a little too salty for me. The drinks were strong and the bartenders were as slow as molasses, so I wasn't a huge fan.   The service was great and the staff was so helpful. A few hiccups of forgotten refills and plates to the wrong table, but it happens with new spots and they handled it with a bit a humor. Overall, it was nice to check it out, but I don't know if I would go anytime soon.

YyoJ_slzdbzyu9MxX0STgg.text: Another solid entry into the growing canon of downtown Vegas restaurants giving the celeb chefs of the strip a run for their money.  And you don't need a golden ticket 6 months in advance to eat here.  Just a good group of friends for whom small plates share well.  Great cocktails.  Intimate.  Good on ya.

bfn4ux1y_3zo1bDuFNO9Og.text: delish burger...a little slow, but I did request my meat well done.  Otherwise, on point.  :)  If I have the time in the future to go, I will.  It really fills up for lunchtime, so go a bit early.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy burger and spicy tater tots
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pear &amp; Persimmon salad

DZZYNj9xDzKhd-m7IbplXw.text: Absolutely love this place.   The decor, the food, the servers, and the vibe all match the growing trend of Downtown's vibrant food culture.   Carson Kitchen's menu is refreshing and worth every penny.   I was with a group of friends and everything we ordered far exceeded what we expected. We had ordered the deviled eggs and chicken skins to start off with.   The eggs were so soft and very airy and the chicken skins were the crunchiest I've ever had.   We each ordered different entrees, but we had ordered the butter burger, which was a perfect medium-rare, the chicken thighs, rabbit ragu, and the black rice risotto.   I ordered the risotto and it was a smooth, creamy texture and the black rice was al dente, just how I like it. The rabbit ragu was hearty and the rabbit wasn't very gamey. The butter burger was juicy and flavourful and the chicken thighs with chimichurri were herby and light.  All in all, this place should be on everyone's list of places to eat. Definitely worth it.

4lE2GFhRgjBkRgtdZ-eWpw.text: Creative delicious memorable food.  We ordered 5 dishes and they were all great.  Small restaurant that accomodates about 40.  We had to wait nearly 1 hr.  8 to 9.  Before us about 10 waiting.  After us, none.  So maybe u should plan ur arrival time.

popmeCxz35kntzUHH5olvQ.text: Ate here about 1:30 pm on Sun/21 Dec: - The gyro tacos for $10 were delicious. - Had the $14 trout(?), that was good. - Will be back to try some other items.

Pr2_yxI0ZxuAf8dqqqAXsw.text: I went to dinner with friends and we had a wonderful meal, great atmosphere, great food, the chef was wonderful.

gOn5ZP7IE34Lat0QlNcWYA.text: In town for the weekend and saw the good reviews so my family and I stopped by. Amazing food and great service. We had the BBQ burnt tips, baked mac and cheese, and the short rib grilled cheese. I highly recommend getting these three items. Also, the donut bread pudding was great!

ziWk3oC9TRhrUzjyLCgX4w.text: 5 on the food and 1 on the service. The food is great and very unique, but the server with the mohawk type hair was absolutely rude. We asked about drinks and he just said "no we don't have that" and walked away. GOOD customer service would have been to ask what we were looking for in a beverage and help us find the right one; instead we just got waters and bought no beverages from the bar. The server then was very short with us, barged in and roughly poured water in our cups, and never said thank you. I will NEVER come back to this place if that is how they feel customer service is.

Mp5F-z_LspHPB5P6J6X-eg.text: Great choice for dining when visiting Fremont street.  It's one street away and worth the walk.  We had a slight wait but enjoyed a community style table.  Server was helpful to recommend dishes.    Best choice in downtown Vegas

-2eeMxu1l3m_IjBL8UXnvw.text: Carson Kitchen is a take on new American food. While it offers classic American cuisine, it also dares to take on ideas that play off classical American foods. Such examples are crispy chicken skins (a play on crispy chicken tenders) or hot oysters (a play on boneless chicken wings). When I went there, I tried to order items that aren't typically found on everyday menus. I ordered the chicken skins, the hot oysters, an asparagus burrata salad, and some crusted lamb.   Most of the food was tasty and really interesting to try out. I never thought having chicken skins would work so well as an appetizer. The hot oysters were spicy, but I really liked the idea of trying an oyster that was coated with wing sauce and out of the shell. The burrata salad was quite unique; never have had a salad like that before, but the flavors inside the salad complemented each other. The lamb was cooked to a perfect medium-rare and had the perfect amount of seasoning. Overall, I would recommend trying it out if in the area.

SHAPCwaizjfx_jdb1YYG2Q.text: This place is really good! I like the vibe here. Had the espresso NY Strip, killer shrimp and chicken skin. Excellent meal, drinks were ok, It can be kinda of uncomfortable eating at the bar with people coming ordering stuff looking over your shoulder while you eat which i found annoying but overall a good experience! Can't wait to go back and try different dishes!

PV8hJoklJv8qhPEXDq5ofw.text: What a great little surprise in old downtown Las Vegas! You may feel more like you're in San Fran or SoHo but zero pretentiousness. Gyro Tacos amazing, Bacon Jam amazing, cocktails amazing... I'm in love!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brewer&#39;s Fix = excellent!

en3DyLYiM4tIWO8Fwk37oQ.text: Stellar and affordable!  Hand-crafted cocktails and impeccable delicacies are what you have in store. If you don't eat here while downtown LAS, you're missing out on a hidden gem. Everything was marvelous and the Donut Bread Pudding was beyond incredible and mouthwatering. They're doing everything right and this my friends is not commonplace in the restaurant industry these days. Order the Gyro Tacos and you won't be sorry!!!

JRXCCNhgKoGTVE3J3dwgVQ.text: We had the bacon jam, burnt ends, and veal meatballs. Absolutely delicious. The exterior of the building is misleading, looks run down, when you walk in the ambiance is really modern and fun. Love this place!

4s36uopD_qKFO1_LFuULlA.text: Amazing! I loved this place! The food is kinda tapas style, there are larger single courses as well. The Mac and cheese and bacon ice cream was to die for! I loved the downtown environment and the vibe. The service was great, they take your small plates quickly and replace them with clean ones for your next entree. I would go back in a heartbeat.

UG1Lgc_v5YbYqY1rVFJiWw.text: A perfect little hole in the wall that isn't! Not something you would stumble across but worth finding. Nice atmosphere and the wait staff is great. The menu is different and that makes it worth coming for, not your normal boring stuff here. Really enjoyed the meal and glad I found it.

WI6PKSsU7Xh-Oe7f0aujrA.text: Love, love love! Like most people we found this place on yelp. Honestly, I was worried when we first walked in that this was going to be one of those trendy types of places and we would be treated differently if we didn't "fit" in but it wasn't like that at all!! So dont feel intimidated like this is a place for locals or a certain type of trend because you will miss out. Everyone is super friendly and our server, wow, was super sweet, knew the menu, knows about beer (which is a super plus for us because we love beer), and was very attentive in a good way! I was very impressed with the staff and the food. We had the chicken skins and the butter burger. To me the chicken skins were okay I kind of wished we ordered something else not that they were bad they just werent what I was feeling I guess. The burger was so delicious, the burger patty was super thick and juicy. We've had a few burgers on the strip and they dont even come close to this. The burger here was so so good I highly recommend it and I can't wait to come back and try the mac n cheese and a few other things. The kitchen is open so you can watch them prep and make food while you eat. They  have a decent selection of beer that is not your usual everyday beer. Awesome place!

U6OJ6EC2f9PSooA6LZUQwA.text: Loooooooooooove their food! Michael is awesome, too! From the Asian girls from Tao and SLS hehe.  P.s. Their bacon jam is life changing.

ziwScEqXlxOHTmGCAVXRog.text: The steak was tough and chewy. The Mac & cheese was TO DIE FOR. Deviled eggs were v good; donut bread pudding was great, but ask for a little syrup on the side. (Better the way they did it - erring on side of caution). Great atmosphere, off beaten path.

d-xTaXZcF2hEE2KO8m6GbA.text: What a GEM of a place in Downtown Las Vegas...Went to a birthday celebration with friends this past saturday night and the atmosphere upstairs was amazing, the service incredibly attentive and fun and the food...OMG...just spectacular and fun too...loved every bite of everything we had....Our menu included their yummy bacon jam with brie cheese....to die for, crispy chicken skins with a honey -like dip ( seriously good), Rootbeer braised short rib sliders, an amazing roasted  beet salad, omg... then there were the Veal meatballs with the sherry foi gras cream ( could not get enough of these), then the swordfish, so delicate and full of flavor , the rabbit ragu served on spaghetti squash was D E L I C I O U S & THEN their baked mac and cheese that had the PERFECT amount of creaminess and then crunch on the top......oh my....I must go back for more of this soon...I mean the list goes on and on....My beverage was never empty unless I wanted it to be and then there was dessert....this Glazed Doughnut Bread pudding.....oh I think I will crave it constantly and I sure cannot forget to mention since I'm a dessert person...I had two desserts......so I had to have some of the Bourbon fudge Brownie with the Brown butter bacon Ice cream..that;s right...bacon in the ice cream...I mean who doesn't LOVE bacon?? The staff that waited on us was  Jenna &  Andrew- Bartenders Courtney & Ariel - Servers and then Chuck the Manager ...amazing, fun and delightful staff  I really can't wait to go back ...you absolutely MUST eat at Carson Kitchen...Did I mention how cool this place is...fun, eclectic and rustic atmosphere...not like any other place in town...probably because it's in an old hotel...check it out

SYQEVsnr9tGO66ZqXRjALg.text: Loved the vibrant atmosphere, decor and staff! The food was absolutely delicious.  Dined on fried chicken skins, bacon jam with Brie, cucumber watermelon salad, rainbow cauliflower, bison sliders, and thai pizza. Every item was fresh, lovely to the eyes and better on my palate

7830_wsEZ8KrGxHYL8OkBg.text: This place is amazing.  All the food we ordered was delicious, (Crispy Chicken Skins, Sliders,Beets Salad, and Gyro Tacos). The service was good. There was definitely teamwork involved.  The reason why i gave a 4 star is because i wanted to add chicken to my salad, like I've done in my previous experience, and our waiter told us that it wasn't possible. Also, we had reservations at 8:30pm which wasn't ready til 45-60 mins later.  Besides that, everything was perfect.

6DLAJhCQdoRrUPOruC7Mwg.text: BEST burger in town, downtown!  Big, homemade, delicious!  Great prices!  Will be back for dinner!  Great service!  Sign the book!

XCwVffCkAlOHZvb5nzSHjw.text: Good food!!!! But not kid friendly, and i am not talking abou the food since my little one eats everything that we eat. They do not offer high chairs so the whole time he had to sit on our laps, not very confy for any of us.

swS4SN5RzE5g_W6zryWByw.text: Thai chicken flat bread was amazing, customer service was awesome, cool interior. Loved it

TdqpnNYv395PA5EZxRtfvQ.text: We were driving around downtown wanted to try out a few places we had yet to eat at but everything was closed for lunch, that's when we stumbled upon this little gem. Had I not been looking out the window I would of missed it since there's no sign except for a little one on the window. Luckily they were open for lunch and everything we had was amazing!!!! I was so impressed that they didn't skip on the decor and little things like plates and silverware. Service was spot on.. I just loved the whole over all experience. BRAVO CARSON KITCHEN,  you're doing it right!

f_Gb6wLjvUgwcJ4gPKXePQ.text: Came here on a date night with the hubby for our anniversary dinner.  We wanted something low-key and casual, but with good food. This place totally delivered.  We actually didn't make it passed the starters because they all sounded so good we just couldn't decide, so we had most of them for our dinner! The cavier deviled eggs were amazing, the bacon jam with brie is delish!! I loved the tempura green beans, they were crispy & not soggy or greasy at all!  We also had the wellington empanadas and they were spot on!  We had the crispy chicken skins too and they were ok, not my favorite.  The dessert was amazing!  We had the brownie with bacon ice cream! YUP I could have eaten a pint of that ice cream. LOL The service was good.  Our server was friendly & attentive, but not overly on top of us.  She was awesome.  We'll definitely be back and we'll be checking out the rest of the menu :)

3PkfCRdL2dg7j9KdGJeGpA.text: This place was fantastic! The hostess was very friendly, the wait staff was great. I would highly recommend the bacon jam and the mac and cheese. Our table thoroughly enjoyed both. The atmosphere is very relaxed and laid back, a really good find.

Cb7gt3mQACugMl2dtH9W7A.text: Always on the lookout for a great meal the fiance and I just had to check out Carson kitchen. Everything was pretty much right on point. We started with the bacon jam and the deviled eggs. Both dishes were excellent. The bacon jam would be amazing every morning on a breakfast sandwich with a good runny egg. The deviled eggs were a great contrast to the in your face bacon and smokiness of the jam. Very suttle  on the flavoring but in a nice way.      We also had the rabbit ragu, delicious. The use of spaghetti squash instead of pasta was very appreciated. It just really makes the dish work and you don't go into a carb coma after polishing the bowl clean. At the same time we throughly enjoyed the veal meatballs with peas. An excellent interpretation of a classic veal and peas dish.  Finally to end our fabulous meal the amazing chicken skins arrived. They were everything I thought they would be and more. I mean who doesn't like delicious crunchy, salty, spicy animal skin. The honey balanced the great flavor of the skins and made me want to get a basket to go.  Forgot to mention the drinks. They were good not the best I've had but solid. We came for the food though so that's what matters. The beer selection was decent. A nice mix of craft brews. The specialty cocktails all sounded great but the 2 we had were just unbalanced. Not taking any stars off because they were still good and second fiddle to the food.  All in all a great meal and well worth the trip. The location, people and vibe reminded me of home and the neighborhood I live in. I will always have to make a pilgrimage to Carson kitchen whenever I'm in Vegas.

AOLeO3PUn1jdxgwnpgXy7g.text: This cheeky little restaurant has earned it's way into my top 10 hip places to go to in Vegas. Found in downtown. A two story location-downstairs indoor dining with a bar and outdoor balcony seating upstairs. The staff was super welcoming and Andrew the bartender was awesome! He made us feel right at home with good conversation and quick service. We went with appetizers: crispy chicken skins with honey and veal meatballs. As a main course we chose the black rice with oxtail risotto. The skins were like potato chips-crisp and slightly salty. The veal meatballs were juicy and bite size. Easy eating and the sauce they pair with was enough to make me just slurp it out of the bowl. But please...I really just want to talk about the Risotto. All I can say is FOODGASM! It was an amazing fusion of meaty, cheesy, juicy and creamy goodness. That's it. Just try it. I've dreamt about this for days now. The serving is generous and can be shared between 2-3 people along with additional protein to balance it out.   We snagged both of their dessert options. They have a decadent bread pudding-fluffy and rich and also...a brownie with brown butter bacon ice cream and a strip of caramelized bacon. Yes. I said it. Sugar and bacon and ice cream and chocolate. Talk about a trip to heart attack town. It's worth it.   You could literally order all of the items off the appetizer menu and have a complete meal to share between 2-3 people. I will be visiting again and again. Thanks for the great time Carson Kitchen. You did not disappoint.

b8IWvSQwIn2vfjiQvvRFVQ.text: Nice new restaurant downtown.  Spacing is limited in the downstairs dining room.  Looking forward to dining al fresco on the upstairs patio once it cools off.   I had the root beer sliders, meatballs, burger, devils eggs, and cucumber soda.  Loved everything.  Only gripe is the root beer sliders are too sweet and takes away from the integrity of the beef.  Portions are moderate and pricing is average to high.    Cool urban concept that looks to add to the growing downtown dining scene.  Service is casual but attentive.  The server recognized my friend from the last visit.

ixWNiiBxA2R9PaW7kBdOjw.text: Thank you Yelpers for helping find this little gem outside of Fremont  street. Small dining area but worth the wait. Definitely recommend a reservation. We tried the chicken skin appetizer, meatballs and Mac and cheese and New York strip. All done in their own unique way and awesome. All the dishes are made for sharing. Fun atmosphere with open kitchen. We had fun joking with the staff while waiting for our food. We were too full for desert but the manager some how managed to give us a bread pudding on the house. He said that we needed to try it. House favorite! Man did that not disappoint, unreal. Stay away from the hotel eateries and come here at least once during your stay.

8xPsq_JGrV7W7bwZZBraug.text: A definite must before heading to the gritty Fremont area. Restaurant is simple and cozy. Staff are friendly and hip. Food is fabulous-tempura green beans were the BEST.  Every dish we tried was inventive and flavorful. Cocktails were superb too. Hope to return!

faRirSYlX00paphpKWgLRw.text: So good! Crispy chicken skins are amazing.  Bacon jam is a must try. Jerk turkey burger is so good. Love this place.

IilqGwwAMaxxkbf7e502xQ.text: The food here is such an amazing experience, Charlene will be the one prepping your devils eggs and flatbreads from wed-fri, her craftsmanship is only outdone by her radiant beauty (I had to look away at times for fear of being blinded).  Michael the sous chef commands the respect of his staff like a roman general with perfection on the grill it was like witnessing the painting of the Mona Lisa. Back to the food was so spectacular that I believe it enhances my iQ several points, I found myself able to perform basic telepathy for a few hours afterwards.  I think I need to explore these powers further, I must return.

zt44rLLauwAlq7V6ExGFSA.text: Giving this place an okay and passing 3 stars. I do not write reviews but I came into this place with pretty high expectations and I'm pretty disappointed. I'm just motivated to write this review out of sheer disappointment.  Came in Saturday night around 9:30. Already missed the dinner rush but this place was still packed and the vibe and ambiance was still upbeat. We sat at the counter and got a good view of the kitchen. Our server Courtney was very nice and pleasant.  Ordered the Magarian for a drink. Aviation gin, thyme, lemon, honey, and cucumber soda water. It was pretty standard. Nothing special.  Now the food. Ordered the beet salad. The cauliflower. Veal meatballs. Steak. Sliders. Tacos. And the fudge brownie for dessert.  I think I like this dish just because I love beets in general. Came with orange slices, goat cheese, and pistachios. Eat everything together and it's good. If you're not a beet eater you might think this dish is awesome but if you're like me this dish is just your standard beet salad.  Veal meatballs. Nicely executed but I found the flavor lacking. Meatballs were light and not dense. Prepared and cooked nicely. It was actually enjoyable to eat except it needs more flavor. It was under seasoned. The sherry foie gras cream was nice. Though you can't really taste the foie. It was a rich sauce but not reminiscent of foie at all. So that under delivered. And the peas, I don't know what it's doing on that dish. It could've been a pea shoot salad with a nice zippy dressing to cut through that cream.  The steak. We asked for medium rare and it was cooked medium rare. Nice crust on the steak, pink inside, and a nice sauce to accompany it with. But for a restaurant with a reputation like this I already expect that you know how to cook steak. Although maybe they could've used some finishing salt here. Fleur de sel. Himalayan. Black. Any salt sprinkled on top by the kitchen to let me know there's some thought in this dish. Don't just send me a piece of meat. Send me a piece of meat with some "oomph!" Oh and please. Don't tell me about the salt shaker! For 18 bucks I think it should've came with a side of something. Potatoes or cream spinach or asparagus spears. Just something, anything to eat with the steak. Doesn't have to be big or a lot. Meat needs something. Even Michelin rated restaurants give you something. Mind is not blown here.   The lamb gyros. They were good but you can live with skipping it. Find real lamb gyros somewhere else. I just have to say that the meat tasted like spaghetti meat sauce without the sauce.  Short rib sliders. We ordered these under the recommendation of our server. She said these are to die for. I thought otherwise. I didn't read the description on this because I trusted our server so I took a bite knowing full well what short ribs should taste like. Meaty, rich, deep, earthy short ribs except they were not!!! I love short ribs so I was very, very, very disappointed. There was something sweet in it then I read the description it said rootbeer glaze. It might as well say sugar syrup because you can't taste the rootbeer. You just taste sweet.  There was no taste or note of caramelization to merit it to be even called a "glaze." That was a sad excuse to call it a "glaze." It wasn't deep or rich. I picked apart my slider so I could taste just the meat and it was just blah. It is shockingly dull and under seasoned. The slider buns came from a bag. They weren't warmed or anything. Eating it felt like a chore. Also served with tater tots. Which probably was the highlight of the dish... Maybe the night.   Now the dessert. Bourbon fudge brownie and brown butter bacon ice cream. The ice cream was good. Enjoyable actually. But that brownie. My god! that brownie! That brownie was served to us frozen hard as a brick. It was so hard that when we tried to slice it the brownie flipped out of the plate and onto the floor. Didn't need utensils at all cuz we were eating what's left of the brownie with our hands. Picking it up and biting off bits of it like solid chocolate. It was terrible.  We also ordered the cauliflower because our server recommended it but the kitchen might've forgotten to make it. Dessert came and our check came but our cauliflower never made it to our table. It was still included in our tab though so I just asked the server to take it off. She let the kitchen know what happened and Courtney came back and apologized and took it off out check.  Would I come back here? I might. There are other dishes here that still interests me to try. I wouldn't take my out of town friends here though. There are other great places to try out, experiment, and enjoy. It's a nice looking restaurant with a cool vibe and ambiance to it. It's a cool spot to be seen but the food while has great concept suffers from the lack of depth of flavor and under seasoning.   Final note. When working in the kitchen: TASTE TASTE TASTE TASTE! Taste your food before you send it out to us!!

wiapzEltdYAX1vXJelQ8OQ.text: Am I crazy or is every meal here a complete salt bomb? My wife and I have tried this place out twice now and each time we find the food overpoweringly salty. Like to the point that for hours after you can't seem to get enough water. It's a shame because we like the overall food quality and taste. And the price range is really great for downtown. Fried green tomato sandwich, the rabbit, the Wellington empanadas, the tacos, the chicken chimichurri could all stand to lose a couple of milligrams of salt to push the flavors through. My fingers are swelling as I write this ....

D6_7rvf3qd54epbERFO0Uw.text: Visited from NYC, I love travel alot and am a foodie. This place knocked our socks off! Stupid Good Shrimp, Caviar Devils Eggs(8 buck!), Lamb Gyro Tacos, veal meatballs. Need I say more?!!!

mjtsVdzZaGSWbORreU8C6w.text: UMMMMM THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. The fried chicken skins are so bomb. Every time I go I get something new and I am never disappointed!

7MwFG8UH3Dn2IsXUOpECKA.text: I enjoy sitting at the counter, watching the food being prepared.  Be sure to try their deep-fried chicken skins.  Amazing.  I enjoy their butter burgers-- excellent burgers smothered with melted butter while on the grill.  Place is very popular and busy, so expect some wait time.  HIghly recommended.

hKsrYAmMcU60fthcJ6Bknw.text: Trendy place located downtown Las Vegas.  Fun plates tapas style to share if you are having lunch.  I didn't have dinner there yet but it is on my list of places for dinner.  Being that I am a big fan of Kerry Simon, I can't say one thing negative.  It was good food, reasonably priced and fun atmosphere.  We sat at the bar that surrounded the prep area.  I would definitely recommend this to the tourist visiting the area as well as the locals.

iZwtERULHsk1SSlIlKxKTQ.text: We came here first time and it was really good, maybe best place in down town but today we check their hours in YELP and YELP said THEY are opening until 10 pm when we opened the door they told us that they were closing in an hour is just 8:30 that means 9:30. Yelp or you guys  have to go in the same page!!!

6dzFVYxwa0FtRj8jn5-kmA.text: This is not a downtown staple. It's really become a regular place to get solid food...sometimes service gets backed up...but the managers are pretty helpful...it's a great place period.

Rky-ixAqf9ueEi8P26g5aw.text: Absolutely amazing! Every single thing I've tried on the menu is to die for. I especially love the turkey burger with mango chutney. It's one of the items that will always be on the menu and I've had it multiple times. Ambiance is awesome, staff is great.

7BT9NHu5HmuGj1I2E5DVrg.text: If you are up for some afternoon Swank, you need to stop in and sit at the Chef's Bar, where you watch the magic happen!  What can I say, YUM Fried Chicken Skins with Smoked Honey Dip HOLY COW, my mouth went nuts!  The Flatbread is just as tasty and fun to watch prepare, we had the Buffalo Chicken and it was The Bomb!  Excellent service, great atmosphere, can't wait to go back!

auDde5cu7wKK3RT4slyU5Q.text: I recommend going some place else!! There are so many other places to eat that also have decent customer service. (Le Thai just around the corner has great food and amazing service!!) After waiting outside for the restaurant to open, which you could clearly see people (staff) inside by the door and which I had tried to open earlier, no one came to ask if I was waiting or to even acknowledge restaurant was open. I was first in restaurant (with no line at all). The hostess asked if I wanted to sit at the bar and with no other patrons in there I asked to sit at a table. The manager (man) said they do not seat party's of one. First, no one is at the restaurant and second,  I have seen in past reviews people said sometime multiple parties would have to be seated at a table. I guess I should have known the experience was not going well when there was no line unlike other places close to this one.  The manager did say as I was walking out the door if I was going to leave they could seat me at a table...no thank you I prefer my food with at least decent customer service!!! I will let my local Vegas friends as well as people visiting to go to another place! Update: I was contacted by Cory who was very gracious and apologetic. I want to thank him for his quick response. Next time when I am in Vegas I will give the restaurant another try, but sometimes you have only one chance to make a good first impression.

QGNMuiWxH4CYyl24_iRvVA.text: I never thought I would ever say this, but the cauliflower appetizer at Carson Kitchen might possibly be my favorite food that I have ever had out. Simple recipe, but loaded with delicious flavors. We liked it so much we ordered a second serving! We also had the beet salad, which was good (I like my beets a little crispier, but I think I'm in the minority), and the watermelon cucumber feta salad (which was really great; super salty feta really brought out the other flavors) for appetizers and enjoyed all of them. We split a steak for dinner and it was super, super delicious. The coffee / chocolate rub was kind of charred in a super nice way with the center still rare - fantastic. And we ate at the bar and got to BS with a hilarious Irish bartender that was also fantastic. Loved it. Plan to go back tonight.

_qDP8SnwqjC3elTbRlcyOg.text: One hour wait well worth it. For the 3 of us we shared veal meatballs, chicken skins, Brie bacon jam, & the fried green tomato sliders. We shared the communal table family style. People next to us share the espresso steak. All of it was delicious. Will be back.

yWSte0ovkrjgpxfjtJ9lSg.text: I cannot express what an amazing, wonderful time I had! Sat at the kitchen bar and heard the chefs discussing the new halibut dish- sounded like a winner to me! I'm melting w pleasure- so delish.   Along w fun, engaging conversation w the cooks- absolutely everyone was sweet and nice.  In fact, I had stopped in earlier cause I had wrong directions to an event, just happened to mention to the waiter, who steered me in the right direction, went to event and hustled right back to enjoy the food and the great atmosphere. Would recommend this experience to anyone and everyone.

hfo9D7L-c81yahI0NRyThA.text: Great place for tapas and drinks with friends.  Good selection of brews, really good selection and good tasting food.  Gotta try the crispy chicken skins!  Baked mac n cheese is good too. We had 6 different items from the menu and everything was delicious!

JDB65KTEchi4llb8QCrj8Q.text: Have been here as just a couple and also here as a group. Both times were amazing. Food is on point and service as well. Drinks are always perfect too !! They are an awesome group of people !! Love it !!

7LAtXGt5LFR6S-o0T8eoaA.text: DTLV gem! This place is amazing. The food was inventive and delicious. Have the chicken skins and the devils eggs ... SO good! Keep Calm and Kerry On

pix5UJmvG3hPxmh_WOfXcw.text: I don't even like bread pudding, but this place has THE BEST bread pudding EVER! I think they make it with donuts or something, but the vanilla/caramel cream sauce is just "the most."  Also, my animal lover friend loved the veal meatballs. She didn't realize what veal was at the time, but when I told her, she still liked them, but she hated herself just a little for it. What can she say, they were delicious!

UqT8lJGtHVyeB4f-oWVtzQ.text: What a great find on my trip to LV. Cool ambience (we sat at the food bar watching Molly prep salads). Very creative choices and delicious options. Bacon Jam, fried chicken skin with honey, beet and Orange salad with goat cheese and glazed donut bread pudding. All good. The best part was the interaction with the staff prepping the food. Daniel hooked us up with some chicken skins and some bacon butter ice cream because he couldn't stand us not trying it. I love these kinds of restaurant experiences. I will return for their soon to change seasonal menu.

PkCVxP6UOTuDybWZPZ9pKQ.text: Great taste with nice atmosphere. Quite simple dishes made with chief touch. We tried pacific perch, my strip and giro tacos. All are amazingly tasty. Perch comes with sauce redefining its taste.

tUnjxCD-WzTk5mvpm58POA.text: Wow!  Another fabulous restaurant by Kerry Simon and crew. Great vibe. Very low ceilings and intimate. Group tables make the experience very social. We had the fried chicken skin, Devils eggs, pork osso buco and black rice oxtail risotto. Great selection of beers. All reasonably priced. Great service. This is a real gem. A little hard to find, with a small title in the window.  We loved the dinner and the place.

k5MeY8YEzEIcYJMrr98tRQ.text: Great environment, great cocktails, and a solid menu all around. The chicken skins are a must. Solid burger, as always at Kerry Simon restaurants.

HLa_C-YRgPVhFZ-JG2tSKA.text: Okay so I'm a total foody! Literally work out everyday so I can indulge on vacay!! This place is top notch. They change your plates two times at least so your eating off of a fresh plate! The food is to die for. Literally ordered the whole menu and we loved everything! I mean everything! Soo so so good. A must stop and now any time I come here I will definitely stop here. Thanks Carson Kitchen for a fun, hip, intoxicating food experience!

C_uwfu41LamZTxDB2HG3sQ.text: I'm going to sound like a broken record, because there really isn't anything more I can say that hasn't already been raved about.  EVERYTHING we sampled (a group of 7) was delicious and perfect proportions (I give exception to the deviled eggs only because I could live with or without eggs at any given time), and the drinks were creative.  Unfortunately it was raining the night we went so we couldn't enjoy the adorable roof top bar that reminded me of the days when I was a kid and my parents would take us to the Route 66 kitchenette style motels.  Being a former motel, this place is unique in it's decor and really makes you feel comfortable as a guest, whether sitting at a table, the bar, or in the courtyard area.

C9MM6HFkJfmwXFsjfloX0g.text: Excellent! Off the beaten path! Worth the trip off the strip to go eat here. Good food and good service.

2f_SLbpFGrgKrmCXULfJJA.text: Wow! My second time here. I convinced my wife and my friend to go there for dinner tonight. They were very surprised at how great it was. Great atmostphere, great service and amazing food! We were immediately seated at the chef's bar, right next to the pizza chef, who was very friendly and we enjoyed watching him prepare several dishes besides the flatbread pizza. We saw what great care he put into each dish's presentation. Our server, Nicole, was very sweet, attentive and helpful in helping my guests make menu choices and did not disappoint. I had the Jerk Turkey Burger for the second time and it was perfect. Just like the first time. Consistency...very important in the success of a business. We will be back.

5ZsdcDPUFFE4tP7xd6nxGw.text: I'd been wanting to come here for quite some time and finally made it out last weekend with a group of girlfriends. I am sad it took me so long to get here. I absolutely loved it and will definitely be back.  The atmosphere is great. It's unique, and both downstairs and upstairs have their own vibe. Downstairs feels like you are in a crowded kitchen, but you feel like you get to see all of the action, which is awesome. Upstairs is more relaxed, with a view of the city. I also loved the fireplaces outside in the courtyard.  Our cocktails were great. The Towns End was reminiscent of an old fashioned. We had a bunch of dishes and shared them all. The standouts were: Crispy Chicken Skins, Veal Meatballs, the steak, Broccoli Crunch, and the shrimp. The only thing we didn't like as much were the gyro tacos.  I can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu.

V3BgUWlGCCnm6CO7T-ixsQ.text: Really like this place.  The plates are small and delicious and good for sharing.  We basically ordered half the menu and nothing disappointed!  The chicken sandwich was and especially good standout along with the fried green beans.  Friendly service.  Restaurant was kind of small without the upstairs open but still good and hipster like.  Great drink selection! Definitely gonna go back to see how the menu changes seasonally.

-OsFK6PNQdpgBaxwu06tdA.text: Simply fantastic! Great food, atmosphere, and service. We've only been here during the lunch hour and are never disappointed. I would certainly come here again and bring some friends.

xGmR8XrT_gkn3N3Zl43upw.text: Bianca was so nice and had the best personality. The Secret Chicken was amazing and the pickle aioli was so good! We ended our experience with the donut pudding and I could be single the rest of my life if I could have that. Loved it! Also shout out to Nicole one of the hosts who brought us here for the first time.

7Uy9BrWeDEpg-evABapUyg.text: We enjoyed our meal here - the bacon jam was really interesting...couldn't stop smearing it over the bread and eating it again and again.  The deviled egg with caviar - excellent.  But the fried chicken skins were not very good - over fried to  basically being burnt.  We sent it back and asked for an order of a shrimp pasta that was pretty good.  A solid option for the area!

adLnR3ozhz8sRv--QSFGNA.text: I ate here a few weeks ago with my partner and it was great. Before I get to the food I'd like to comment on the beautiful atmosphere. While I didn't get a picture the layout is very unique. They emphasize communal seating/eating which is great especially in Vegas! It's very easy to talk to people your sitting with without feeling like your yelling or sitting on top of each other. The bartender and drinks were all that and a bag of chips. Get the pear cider if your into those types of things. My favorite dishes were the chicken skins and the oxtail risotto. This was my favorite spot in Vegas and would go again. Plus it's nice to get away from all the celebrity chef restaurants.

tlVC2vFEvbqtgMGLw4GYjQ.text: Small portions, huge taste.  The killer shrimp was fantastic!  Best to go with a group and share appetizers.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x_UlHtNLiYT2EBcSOA3VMQ.text: We tried to go to Carson Kitchen on a Saturday night at about 5pm, there was a 90 minute wait. So we went back Sunday at about 11:15am, right after they opened. We were seated immediately in a pretty empty restaurant.   They don't have highchairs, and apparently we think its appropriate to take our 18 month old to a hipster bar/restaurant, so we got our toddler to sit in a regular chair and had a nice (and quick) lunch.   We enjoyed a beet salad, smashed potatoes, and jalepenos.  But my favorite was bacon jam.  It was pretty ridiculous. I couldn't look at bacon again for a few days after, but it was so worth it.

Agthzy4Xo0l9mvvVYweY7w.text: Hands down, one of the best spots in DTLV. Everything was delicious, creative, nicely presented. Service was on point & a great team of people running the place. Thank you Chef John for the plates. Will be returning for more!

6XJrXSkzVqgcSJdv5lCDSg.text: What a great find.  So not the Strip. Noisy, communal and it works. Waitress new the whole menu and had great and honest suggestions.  Nice sized small plates and extremely flavorful and unique food. I've owned 6 restaurants and would be proud to own this gem. Food comes out in minutes....you won't be here long but you're gonna leave happy

Aqbd2MYQGcB0Qqi7kvxcBQ.text: We saw the reviews and decided to have my boyfriend's birthday dinner here.  We were seated at a big wooden community table, which seemed less intimate & even odd at first...but turned out to be cool.  I ordered the mac & cheese (best I've ever had in my life), and the amazzzzing rainbow cauliflower.  He ordered the bacon jam, and the chicken skins (he loved both).  We wanted to try the deserts, but we're far too full from the good sized portions.  The staff was attentive without being annoying, the atmosphere was hipstery, 90s music at a good level in the background, the drinks were fantastic & the food was INCREDIBLE! We are locals, so definitely going to return again & again!!!!!!!

Udkca0Pj0j-Tv6f42ZNsoQ.text: The food is amazing. Every item order was perfectly flavored. Lots of feel good food options. The atmosphere is what got me though. It was a chilly night to be out dining rooftop. I thought if only I had a blanket this place would be perfect. Guess what...they have blankets!! Love it, cant wait to come back!

sZXnrZbJVmD9vTU_8XlJAg.text: Everything about this place is amazing. It's such a cozy and intimate environment that makes you feel nowhere close to Fremont street. (I love Fremont but it has its stereotypes) I love that everything is served as a shareable dish. They had the best Mac and cheese that I've ever tasted. It's rich but so savory. The gyro tacos were on point. I like that the gyros had a hard shell because it breaks up the regularly "mushy" texture that I don't like in regular gyros. They switch up the menu according to the seasons so that is something I look forward to!

0uaCTT4Dog9QWKph-1GyhA.text: Kerry and Cory just raised the bar. Food, ambience, and service are all excellent. The beef Wellington empanadas are delicious, as are the short rib sliders. Bread pudding is ridiculous and utilizes donuts from Oface next door.  The mission was to create a the welcome feeling of a home kitchen, and it works. This is one of the rare restaurants where diners plan their 2nd visit before they finish their first meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mrbE-1wDxFaGMyBVADshZA.text: Good value. Excellent service. Excellent: bacon jam, Mac n cheese! Ok: chicken skins and rainbow cauliflower.

NfoKlwLmoRmsOuoyfmyp1g.text: Came here for my birthday and sat at the counter which is basically the Chefs table. Service is amazing, we sat and talked to the Chef all night. We had...Devils eggs, Pear & Brie flatbread, Bacon jam, Shepherds pie, and Cocoa Filet, followed by Bourbon brownie with maple bacon ice-cream. We also sampled the Chicken skins. I can't even review, every single thing was amazing, I'm afraid I don't even have the vocabulary to credibly review. You just HAVE to go and review for yourself. There's nothing on this menu you won't love!!!!!! Go now!!!!!

5pSxEs_N_HqGRlTgkUh9uA.text: Even with the address in hand the location of Carson Kitchen was questionable since there was no sign with the name. The neighbor a doughnut shop jumped out at us with a large sign. We were seated immediately. Our arrival was mid way between lunch and dinner and there were several available tables. Our server promptly provided water and our cocktails. Initially the noise level was loud due to a table of six people. Once they received their food the talk level declined. Our server explained the menu and advised the food would come out as it is ready. We ordered the following  Killer Shrimp Secret Sunday Chicken  The Shrimp came out first. Very taste and crunchy the pepper creme and sliced jalapenos added some nice heat. A very enjoyable dish.   The chicken was ordered without the bun because we heard that it's a large breast. Right on it was large. The fried chicken was the best crunchy breast ever. Delicious!  Our table was in full view of the open kitchen and we could see them repeatedly check the chicken with a thermometer to insure it was cooked just right. The chicken comes with tater tots that are deep fried grated potato balls. They were crispy outside & soft inside. Goes well with the aioli or ketchup.  The wait time for the chicken was exceedingly long. At one point our sever brought over a complementary order of baked mac & cheese and apologized for the delay. Don't know what happened to cause the delay but when the check arrived there was no charge for the chicken. I questioned our server and she stated the chicken  was complementary due to the long wait. I was not expecting that response.  The baked mac & cheese is a large portion that easily feeds 2 people. I tried the mac & cheese but not being a fan I can only say it was tasty and filling..  One improvement I would like to see is padded seat cushions. Wood chairs become uncomfortable after a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret Sunday Chicken &amp; Tater Tots
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer Shrimp

vYZdRJx4Vi5NbPXoTSflRw.text: Oh my yum. This is slightly off Fremont street. The interior is adorable. We were seated right away and was waited on immediately. They explained the menu. They mentioned that everything should be shared and they also had sandwiches. We went with the broccoli which was tossed in green goddes dressing, dried cranberries and pumpkin seeds. This was so fresh and delicious. I had the jerk turkey sandwich and my husband had the Sunday Chicken sandwich. We cut our sandwiches in half. I have to say that jerk turkey burgers sandwich was amazing. These were also served w spicy tots.   I was stuffed when I was done. Like super full. This is a place worth eating at and good prices too.

9EQhJ4sdPBuY_ZXrd0LF8Q.text: This is meant to be a 3.5 rating. The atmosphere and service are solid 4, the food a 3.   Loved sitting upstairs on the roof with a nice view of the city. Cute artwork on the walls, romantically dim lighting. Pretty nice staff.   We ordered gyro tacos and they were good. The lamb was not that stinky aged kind, and the tzatziki sauce was nice. We also ordered the secret Sunday chicken and they should have kept that a secret from us customers. It was worse than Chik-fil-a (sorry if you like that crap)! Soggy, salty, meh. It came with tater tots and I wished I'd filled up on them first. Not bad!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MqkvlK3RhBVWFv6FDrui0A.text: Where do I begin?! Carson Kitchen is definitely a top 5 meal. I came here for Nikki B.'s wedding reception. We occupied the outdoor private patio for the evening. It was nice that it had a separate bar and our servers tried to make it as comfortable as possible for us with blankets and patio heaters for the unseasonably windy/chilly Spring evening.   But, let's get down to business - everything was so dang good. There was seriously not a mediocre dish on the menu. The wonderfully curated menu is also a product of Nikki B's fantastic tastebuds, so shout out to the bride as well!   *Crispy Chicken Skins (smoked honey): The chicken skins were beautifully crispy and delicious without being oily. The touch of sweetness from the smoked honey was perfect.   *Bacon Jam (baked brie, toasted baguette): Definitely burned my tongue on this dish because I was being hasty and I wanted to try it ASAP. Delicious combination with the sweet and savory bacon jam and creamy  baked brie.   *Tempura Green Beans (pepper jelly cream cheese): The pepper jelly cream cheese reminded the table of pimento! Yum. The green beans were perfectly battered and fried.   *Wild Mushroom Flatbread (basil pistou): I love me some mushroom and I love me some flatbread. I really enjoyed the pickled red onion on this. Helped to add some zing.   *Rainbow Cauliflower (garlic, lemon): Definitely leaned tangy from the lemon, but I enjoyed the palate cleanse.   *New York Strip (cocoa-espresso, red wine demi): PERFECTLY cooked. It was so tender that I didn't even need a steak knife to cut it. Also, cocoa-espresso is some next level Food Network stuff -- meaning I'm too lazy to make it myself at home, but I see it on the time on TV. & now that I have finally tried this combo, I feel like I can't go back to plain ol' salt & pepper!   *Chicken Thighs (mint chimichurri): Very tender! I also loved it with chimichurri. I don't think I've had the combo of chicken & chimichurri before.   *Black Rice Risotto: Yum! Great foundation for all the great protein we had.   There were 3 addt'l dessert items, but we were all so full that the delicious wedding cake was enough. WHEW, it was a food marathon and we were champs.   Viva Las Babies!   106/365

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip (cocoa-espresso, red wine demi)
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip (cocoa-espresso, red wine demi)

PrNWSAQwHnkvkPsw9zJXCQ.text: Very innovative food. You can tell a lot of care is taken not just by the chefs but by the management as well. All great people. All great food. For sure get the fried peas with a friend to share!f

u9_cCgB38Ojig1qwSATz7Q.text: The epitome of Vegas style cuisine.  Vegas cuisine?  It's New American with an "I did it my way" attitude.  Fresh and seasonal ingredients, some "bad for your health" results but all boasting big flavors that match requisite craft beers and cocktails and all playful enough for social dining.    Tip: All dishes are meant to be shared.  Ask your server about portion sizes.  They can be adjusted based on the size of your party.    Note:  Dishes will be served when they are ready.  They do complement each other well so coursing is not important.    Standards remain excellent.  The flour and spice dusted, deep fried chicken skin is crack in a basket.  Dip a crackling into the slightly bitter smoked honey and taste the bacon-esque essence of chicken skin.  Not to be outdone, the bacon jam.  Sweet, salty, bacon goodness.  A melted smear of brie adds earthiness and actually cuts the richness.  Smeared on a charred baguette, a sip of an Old Fashioned and all is right with the world.  Need veg?  The "Broccoli Crunch" stands out.  Vibrant and refreshing.  Raw, young broccoli florets, pumpkin seeds, and a sunflower seeds tossed with a light green goddess dressing.  A few cherry tomatoes thrown in for their acidic burst.  Incredibly refreshing and works well alongside the richer dishes.  The rainbow cauliflower and Spring asparagus both equally good.  The charred octopus is outstanding.  Slathered in oil, aggressively spiced, and charred to the point the tip of the tentacle is crisp.  Bitterness adds huge complexity when combined with first of the season fingerling potatoes.  The saffron aioli ties everything together while a squeeze of a charred lime adds acidity.  Finally, the crispy skin salmon, is simplicity at its best.  A perfectly cooked piece of salmon, its skin ethereally crisp, a trace line of spinach pistou (macerated spinach, garlic and olive oil), and a charred lemon ripe for the squeezing.  Rustic perfection.    Well chosen but short list of beer and wine.  Excellent craft cocktails.  Great bartenders.  Service is off Strip, very friendly and energetic.  Reservations recommended even for a week night.  In a word, outstanding.

nLKomURHRLEQmbEoA0h9DA.text: OMG. This was honestly the very best dinner I have had in awhile. My husband and I found this gem just a block off Fremont and my taste buds are so happy we did. The plates are made for sharing and so we started with the lamb meatballs. The delicate ness of the lamb was amazing with a mix of mint in the ball and then it was covered with a creamy delicious sauce. We then moved on to the oxtail risotto and steak with balsamic reduction. Under all circumstances you must put the risotto into your mouth. It was MIND BLOWING! Do yourself a favor and run past all those pricey terrible options on the strip and go enjoy truly well prepared and simply amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4KEb9orUEERBBXDx6WBsGQ.text: I enjoyed fried chicken skin and beets at the bar. Seat is comfortable and servers were friendly response for me. This store needs to walk or drive to visit from down town but here is a valuable to come.

pSBimFd5cZqF2crLghdsSA.text: Tried this place for the first time yesterday and let me tell you how customer service makes all the difference.  I was on a first date, and looking at the menu I was like ugh! I'm a pretty plain eater.  I tried to order some Mac and cheese to be polite but quickly found out it had truffles in it.  I decided not to order anything and to my surprise a worker came over with a huge smile and went convinced me to order.  I'm so very glad he did, I ordered the steak as well.    The steak was cooked to perfection with a fantastic rub that was so complimentary I about fell in love.  The Mac n cheese was also delicious.  Had it not been for a little extra effort on the staff part, I would sadly never have gone back. I will add it into my weekly rotation now though!  Thanks so much!!!

Da87r9vBAZiypUxUS5u3xg.text: The food is incredible! I only knocked a star because the restaurant is small. Shared Tables if you are a party of two and there are no reservations. The espresso rubbed New York Strip is so delicious! The Mac and cheese is awesome although I can't pinpoint all the different cheeses. The deviled eggs are topped with prosciutto and caviar. My only regret is being too full for dessert!! I'll be back!  Came again on a food tour which was pretty cool because it made me try somethings I wouldn't normally like veal meatballs and chicken skin

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QhG96QICTN0VeQIuU_acXQ.text: We came here for the first time this weekend and had such amazing food!! It was served in waves and we chose to do family style and all of us shared. The watermelon and feta salad was amazing! The pork tenderloin was beyond incredible and juicy and delicious! We had the Beez Neeze drink and that was the only thing we didn't love. It was different and I can see how some people may like it, but it wasn't for us. We will on be here for 2 more days, but I plan on going back one more time before we leave! If you have a chance go here!

dJu65IEZPxRgJ0WoVguTiA.text: Easily the best meal we had in a sea of disappointing food that is Vegas. Service was pleasant and informative. Cocktails were innovative and delicious. There was a mix up in the kitchen so we were given a plate of the Lamb Spiedies for free! They were so yummy. We also ordered the Chicken Skins, which, I would only recommend if there were more than two of you. I ate about four of them and had my fill. The chicken thighs were very flavorful and cooked to perfection. We never received our order of the killer shrimp and told our server to nix the order anyways because we were so full. Clearly there are some disconnects with staff but none of it got in the way of us enjoying our evening here. I highly recommend this neighbor gem while you are in town.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Skins $9

MkJYLNL0QBfkqDFmK9TVzw.text: Dazzling on every level. Memorable dining that remains casual and affordable. In fact, at its price point, one of the better restaurants to discover in Vegas.   It's an intimate space, so it's perfect for a date night or even a relaxed lunch. Service is knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive without being intrusive. Ask for suggestions based on your tastes and they will steer you in the right direction. It's difficult to go wrong.  Jerk turkey burger is outrageous. Expertly seasoned and dressed with a mango slaw that's perfectly sweet and spicy. Its hard to imagine I could rave about a turkey burger, but it deserves it. The tempura green beans are also not to miss.  Everything is best ordered for sharing, which is perfect, because you will want to try it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk turkey burger. Absolutely phenomenal.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mac &amp; cheese. So rich and so delicious.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura green beans with pepper jelly cream cheese. So great.

9ob1ExkZkoKHDI3GGc9WTw.text: Interesting menu but go hungry and look forward to lots of fried food.  Cool atmosphere.

7woqY9EMqAwlfZu-ziPvRQ.text: Carson Kitchen was the location we chose for a day date when Grandma decided to watch the little guy and allow for some adult time.   I guess I didn't realize that this was like a secret place. After driving down 6th St. looking for some signage we decided to just park it and walk. Thankfully the dude at the Doughnut Bar told us it was right next door. No signs, nada.   You walk into a modern design restaurant with a separate bar area from the main dining room. Not a big place at all, very intimate. You can see the kitchen, and all the action taking place which I love. We weren't greeted all that warmly and had a short wait then were shown our seats. We sat at a community table, which isn't my preferred dining style. Fortunately we had a corner which allowed a little more privacy. The couple that sat next to us disliked the seating options even less than we did. With limited space, it's necessary in a restaurant like this.   Our server was nice, but didn't offer up a ton of suggestions after we told her it was our first time here. So winging it we decided to order the veal meatballs and the bacon jam to kick things off.   Our apps were solid. The veal meatballs had a little gaminess to them and the cream sauce was really tasty with a hint of heat. The bacon jam was a solid app, definitely got more than we expected. It could have used some more brie though. You get plenty of bread to dip, the jam itself was really good, sweet & savory. It's served in a cast iron skillet which is a great touch.  For our entree we decided to share the Short Rib grilled cheese. It was good, but didn't blow my mind. Short rib was tender, Gouda was a good combo, but it just didn't knock my socks off which I was expecting. I'd probably try something else next time.  The dessert we ordered was outstanding. We went with the Bourbon Fudge Brownie which is a brownie (no nuts!!) that has a fudge layer on top, gooey brownie underneath and is served with the most amazing butter bacon ice cream to compliment this concoction. It just works. It works so well. Definitely the highlight of the meal for me.   We left Carson Kitchen stuffed and happy. Definitely will give it another go down the road when Grandma decides to offer up another opportunity for a day date.
