eGZ0iQ6crPLdbSU1hDSagg.text: We went here on the recommendation of our Uber driver. She told us that we could get better food and prices, away from the strip, which sounded about right. She definitely was! L C),

Dv0dgKlfEA0qt585sIhfbw.text: After hearing and tons of raving reviews about Carson Kitchen, I needed to see what all the buzz was about. From the street, it didn't appear as though the restaurant was open, so I called and confirmed that they were open.   Once inside, we were promptly greeted by the hostess and seated. Our table for two looked like it belonged in a tiny house. Instead of adult chairs, we had little stools. As a curvaceous woman, I was like what kind of nonsense is this?! But I digress. Just know that there's no back support for the seats.  Our server was very attentive and accommodating. I wish I knew her name.  Right now, I'm refraining from eating meat, so coming here may not have been the best idea. Most of their vegetarian dishes are merely side dishes. Here's what we tried: Baked Mac & Cheese, Rainbow Cauliflower, and a Wild Mushroom Flatbread. The mac was the best dish of the night, the cauliflower was WAY too lemony, and the flatbread was just okay. The portions were small just like the little chair I was seated on. Even the prices seemed a bit inflated and we were not in a high rent area. Plus, it didn't look like much money went into the decor either.  Ugh, I hate to be that one, but I wasn't blown away. My experience was underwhelming, which makes me feel sad inside.

eg7aOsX8lYpb6xUJr2ys1w.text: Honestly, I cannot find a single thing I don't like about this place.  Granted there is a dish or two that's not for me, but it's not because it isn't well made and tasty.    Sea Bass is my favorite.  Crispy, seasoned, delicious! Brussel Sprouts Ceasar.  No Romain.  Only shaved BS.  Delicious! Crispy chicken skin.  Yes just the skin! Delicious. I mean everything I have had, including cocktails by Geronimo is fantastic!  Must check it out!

thVjl2Ik_Q2_g25cEbeS4Q.text: Been wanting to come here for awhile now and after the anticipation... it did not disappoint!  The food was a-mazing and the ambience was casual and full of energy. We came with friends and tried several of the social plates and they were ALL phenomenal... chicken skins, bacon jam, gyro tacos, killer shrimp - I could go on and on!  The NY strip and mac & cheese were also fabulous and new favorites. The servers were attentive and the whole evening was one of the best dining experiences we've had in years. Counting the days until I'm back in Vegas to eat here again!

OoYaWuA7CBEYVN-vVwPP-g.text: Decent meal, a cool hipster vibe when downstairs.  But got quickly shuffled upstairs and outside without warning and into a boring lifeless atmosphere.  Be prepared for some edginess from a hardworking staff.   Dinner was good and interesting though the whole thing felt tired.

AdAwtOSp6qiGRPxELks8fg.text: Very unique food.  The menu changes seasonally, and is never disappointing.  It's best to make a reservation... They are always busy.  The food is awesome, flavorful, quickly served and the staff is on top of it.  Love, love.

pb4FGdpaYkqW7u8SLQwy-w.text: Dessert only review.  Stopped in for dessert with friends based on overall good reviews and tasty looking pics.   We ordered all three desserts in the menu -   The bread pudding was great!  The brownie was good and had a bit of cinnamon to give it a Mexican chocolate feel. The ice cream that came with it was okay.  The "pie" was my least favorite and was marred by the accompanying biscotti that was so hard it felt like a tooth breaker.   The service was really slow - it took about 30 minutes for our desserts to arrive.   Cool vibe inside with industrial design. Servers were nice but perhaps understaffed as we weren't given updates on why things took so long.   A decent time overall but not somewhere I'm likely to return to.

WkxQGPRFB5foXDL_Ha8vKA.text: Great food! The watermelon and kale salad was tangy and refreshing! Great starter choice! I had the butter burger and it was tall and juicy. The Boursin cheese was a perfect pairing to the patty. The NY steak was the star of the show. The steak was perfectly balanced and you taste the subtlety of flavors! Highly recommend this spot. We didn't have to wait for lunch. We will definitely be back when we're back in town!

qjzHv2P_S3H6n0ecuk3-EQ.text: We continue to love this place. Our second trip back and we met some friends for lunch.   Always crispy chicken skins and bacon jam   I Tried the poached pear salad and he has the special chicken sandwich, friends had burgers.   Food was excellent as always, well prepared.  My drinks (tricky Vic) was delish.   Our waitress was great, on the ball.  All around a solid experience again!

sI2AXON-NIKcffW_HuKfdg.text: Let me get this straight. I love their Dessert(donut bread pudding) first and foremost! Other personal favorite is the turkey and mango chutney burger! Love the ambience!

CtJ1G-StZ_9bRY8QTgc5ZA.text: While in Vegas, I raved about this place and brought 2 friends here because I was blown away during my 1st visit back in January. We got here 30 minutes before closing on a Saturday night and they welcomed us with open arms even though we were the last ones left. We started with the popular BBQ Burnt Ends and some cocktails, of course. The pork had a great crunch and not too fatty smothered with bold tasting highland ranch sauce. From the cocktail menu, I tried the Purple Haze made w/ Nevada H&C Silver Dollar Vodka, St. Elder Liqueur, fresh lemon, mint, creme de cassis and blueberry preserve. This was a fantastic strong drink so I ordered another :)  Then we just decided to get a variety of entrees to share including the Shrimp & Antebellum Grits, Black Rice Oxtail Risotto and another popular item, the Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip. No favorites here because each dish had its own unique flavor and presentation. All I can say that everything was well executed and prepped with passion. Plus the prices didn't break the bank. Appetizer, grits, and risotto were about $15 each and steak for $19. Pretty sweet!   With over 1500 reviews and still growing, Carson's is definitely a must stop in Downtown Vegas. It's a friendly and casual, no attitude local establishment that simply serves reasonably priced excellent food.

WfC1DWPYgMjJYvCa0Y9qww.text: An amazing evening of great food and friends.  We went to Carson Kitchen last night with some friends from out of town.  This place is amazing, small, intimate, casual but not too casual and located just around the corner from Fremont East, it is easy to walk to and park.  We started out with cocktails.  My martini came ice cold as ordered!  We then split a bunch of starters.  The Beet salad was awesome, Cauliflower app was surprisingly good, especially since I'm not a cauliflower person, the veal meatballs were also great, the Gyro Tacos were very tasty and how can you go wrong with grilled octopus.  Believe it or not, we then had dinner!  The salmon came out crispy the way we live it and was very fresh, the wild mushroom flat bread which was a last minute afterthought turned out to be the home run hit, the burger was amazing (it always is here) and the coffee rubbed strip steak was perfectly cooked and tasty.  Overall a GREAT evening.  Thank you Carson Kitchen

C7-BfaDc9w4uiYJPhQexqA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE. The food, the ambiance, and the drinks are all on point. I love how it's almost in it's own secluded corner. At first I had trouble finding the place, but it's actually really nice that the windows are tinted otherwise it would get extremely hot inside. I've been at Carson Kitchen twice now and it's always a great experience. The service is excellent and it's pretty fast. I usually get the tri-tip sandwich or the bacon jam (it sounds weird but it's to die for) it comes in a sizzling plate with little crackers. I highly recommend this place for dinner and drinks before you explore downtown/Fremont street!

The bill took about 20mins to get to us, and by the time our main course arrived, we had already lost our appetite because it arrived 20mins after our appetizers.

Tydd3iAsaPCyzqsrzg_T-w.text: Sorry, this place just isn't doing Kerry's dream about becoming a top downtown jaunt any justice! What so ever! This restaurant has just gone to shit! It's not just this visit but the last four times we have been here in the past year. Nothing has gone smoothly, really, since the remodel and the original opening staff left due to the long closure. You get seated and you can't even get water served to you for at least 10 minutes. The orders come out of the kitchen all wrong and most of the dishes are not what your brother would've wanted because the kitchen staff has turned over since he has passed and they don't know what they're doing half the time. We used to love this place but not so much anymore. Tonight we ordered a bunch of food, as always, and it came out in the wrong order again. The butter burger was literally braised in salt so that was a no go! I was the one that ordered that so I went away hungry as I sent it back. No time for a reorder when you have show plans and are already sitting in this place for well over an hour and a half. The beet salad is one of our favorite dishes but the guy that prepped that  out in the kitchen just set them on a pool of honey instead of a honey drizzle and why? That's not the way it has been done in the past, so are you not training your staff anymore? Every other thing we ordered was minimal as well. We always say that this is the last time that we will ever return to this restaurant, and I think we said that four times now but really this is the last time! Please get your act together, something that would make Kerry proud! I cannot recommend this restaurant at this time. The wait is too long, the service is too slow, and the wait staff as well as the bar and kitchen staff seemed to be overwhelmed! If this last visit didn't solidify never going back there again, certainly all of the harassing PM's, accusations and name calling from the owner all day did! Minus 1 more star for that.

no5Ap-2a3lOTOejIDODM0A.text: Expect a long wait for food and seating. Besides that, customer service was spot on!  I ordered the squid ink pasta because I haven't had it since I left Italy. I was expecting a creamy base but I received different. The pasta was black, there were tiny pieces of calamari and the base had a strong olive taste. This was an interesting dish and perfect for olive lovers. Was it worth the price I paid? For the portion and quality, eh, I'll pass. I also didn't enjoy the pasta strands clumped together. Makes me question the freshness.   Yelp convinced me to order the glazed donut bread pudding and I was not a happy camper. What's with the hype? I can get a better donut for half the price. It's basically a warm, glazed cake. The warm sauces swimming at the bottom of the plate added value to this dish.

7S9J55a1WttuWcZ9xyddDg.text: I've gotten takeout from Carson Kitchen while driving through Vegas from Utah to LA, and I was pleased with what I got. Following Yelp's recommendations (of course), I got:  - Bacon Jam: 3 stars. Don't get me wrong; the jam itself is amazing. A great combination of balsamic reduction and smokey bacon flavor. The texture is great and the combination with the baked brie is wonderful. Unfortunately, the "toasted baguette" made it difficult to enjoy the jam and cheese. The slices were so dry and hard that it made chewing a chore. If I were to eat here again (and assuming they offer fresh bread at the table), I would eat it with the fresh bread instead.  - Gyro Tacos: 5 stars. I am a gyros fan. Big-time. Lamb is my preferred meat, and if you roast it over a spit, you are my favorite. I loved the idea of sticking the lamb, tzatziki, and toppings on a corn tortilla. Delicious combination; I highly recommend it.  - Glazed Donut Bread Pudding: 4 stars. I love donuts and I love bread pudding, but I remember this being a bit dry for my taste in spite of the three rum caramel and vanilla creme anglaise they gave me on the side. I expect that I would have preferred it in-house, where they pour the caramel and creme anglaise over the warm bread pudding and impart more moisture. I, however, ate it dipping-style in the car.  Thank you, Carson Kitchen, for a solid meal!

oS2Khv_OdMiIQrBIyTnmjg.text: Definitely still a gem. Been here many many times and never had a bad experience or a bad dish. Food and drink prices are way more reasonable than anything on the strip. Eat drink and be merry here.

_w5eXA8R24jlbruLY1004A.text: I fell in love at this restaurant! Ambiance and service is amazing! Food is exquisite! The bread pudding is to die for! Omg I love it. The macaroni & cheese is soooo great!

itlpLEKSfhbPfLV1agED2w.text: What a meal! I am normally not searching for fancy restaurants when I am downtown but I will make a point to come back here. Its behind the strip so you aren't overloaded with all of the mess there but just close enough to safely walk. It is definitely not for large groups as the seating is small tables for about 4 or so.   The beer and wine list is a great selection. I had a glass of rose that was crisp and not too sweet. They have beer from the local brewery Big Dog as well which is a great touch. I will say the beer options are limited for non IPA lovers so be aware of that. We each had a couple of different appetizers to share and none of them were disappointing. Between all of we shared the chicken skin, bbq burnt ends, bacon jam, and pig & fig flatbread.  All of the food was flavorful and perfectly cooked. The chicken skin was addictive on its own but add the honey and its so many flavors in each bite. The burnt ends were flavorful and just sweet enough with the sauce being the stand out part. Now the best for me was the pig and fig flatbread. The pork belly was perfectly cooked and paired great with the goat cheese. It was salty sweet and just a bit tart. Get this when you go here.   Also on top of all of this the staff was amazing. We showed up with a large party not knowing the layout of the restaurant and had to wait a while. With all of the confusion and miscommunication the staff was A+ with service and made sure to make up for any of the confusion on our part.

2iwKENhHHN9IFPBez5RQ2Q.text: 4 Ruth time here and always a pleasure to dine here!  We came here for a team building for and had a great time.  Please know that this place has become popular over the years since it's opening and there may be a wait period of 10-15 minutes.  The good news is that since its recent remodel, if your solo or a couple, there are additional seating at the chef's bar or the adjacent bar to sit at.  My co-workers and I were seated promptly when a table opened up and our waitress was quick to come and get our drink order.  After drinks were ordered, we ordered our food and know that this menu is Ala Cart, so order your favorite sides to enjoy with your main meal.  Burgers and sandwiches come with crunchy and tender tator tots.  I ordered the short rib grilled toasted cheese sandwich with horseradish and sourdough- so delicious!  My favorite is the steak cooked to your preference (in this case rare) and it was phenomenal!  For starters, a staple would be the deviled eggs with smokey crispy pacing bit topped with a dollop of caviar.  The BLTA ( bacon, lettuce, tomato, & avocado) will be a great light filler.  From start to finish, the dining experience never disappoints.  If you're in downtown Las Vegas, consider coming here for lunch or dinner and enjoy a nice ambiance, experience, most importantly, some good food fare and leave with a smile on your face as well as a full belly!  :)

L7nfi3i3bOpm-2SOCegojQ.text: We really enjoyed this place. The food and service was great. We had the tempura green beans and deviled eggs and Gyro tacos and bacon jam to share. I had the jerk turkey burger and my friends had the Butter burger and Mac and Cheese. We ate most of it and requested to rest to be boxed to save room for the Bourbon fudge brownie! It was all very tasty and we will definitely be back!

ucJb5xmiCHzRULs1ebTnGg.text: So I had bookmarked this on Yelp prior to our trip due to the excellent reviews, then the owner of Black Bridge Brewery in Kingman said it was a must and when we were having breakfast the next morning at eat. a couple next to us raved about it so I figured it was a sign that there was no way we couldn't go here.   We arrive and are promptly greeted by the host, he was super nice. This place is small so there isn't a lot of seating but we were able to cozy up to the "chefs table" aka the bar type seating looking into the kitchen. This was fun!  Our server was very attentive and asked if it was our first time. When we told her no she quickly explained how it worked. Everything is basically ala cart so order several plates.   Baked Mac & Cheese- AMAZING! So creamy and delicious! I cant tell you what was in it other than amazingness.   Coco-Espresso NY Strip- AMAZING! WOW! The flavor was out of this world! The meat was tender and cooked perfectly.   BBQ Burnt Ends- Wow! Soooo good. Flavor was extraordinary.   Bourbon Fudge Brownie- This brownie was out of this world good, fudgy and perfect. And the ice cream... WOWZA! Topped with a piece of bacon... where can you go wrong?   It was also fun being able to watch the kitchen. Everything is made to order and with such perfection and enthusiasm. It genuinely felt like everyone in the kitchen was passionate about making sure every dish was absolutely perfect.   Overall amazing food and such a great experience.   If you don't believe me read the other 1151 reviews haha!  PS- Make sure you write a note in the book that your receipt comes in and look for my name =)

34NV4U9VvaBePl1T7sSRow.text: Went here on a sort of busy Friday night, waited around 20-30 minutes although they did have a nice courtyard with a fire pit. We got seated at the bar overlooking the kitchen which was ok. From there service was ok, our server seemed a little busy. For the food we had the deviled eggs (one of the better dishes) and the bacon jam (good but a little too greasy). The veal meatballs were pretty delicious, but the special of black rice risotto was a miss. Maybe I could have ordered a little better as I missed a couple dishes.  Overall though, the food was good. 3.75/5

8c9clKnrzHG9Nc6xvH0pUw.text: I love to do research before I go out of town to find the perfect places to eat. I don't always make it to all of them based on different circumstances (size of group, activities we're doing, etc) but Carson Kitchen was one of these places and I'm trilled that we actually made it!   My boyfriend and I got to Carson Kitchen a bit past lunch time after a night of drunken debauchery on the strip and this place really soothed our souls and put us back at peace with the world. Let me start off by saying that the service was incredible! Everyone we spoke to was very friendly, helpful and the kitchen staff got our dishes out at lightning speed!   Lets get to the nitty gritty of Carson Kitchen though: the food. AMAZEBALLS!! Per advice of our server, we ordered several different dishes to try. Everything was delicious! We ordered the tempura green beans with pepper jelly cream cheese, the veal meatballs with sherry foie gras cream, coco expresso NY strip with red wine demi sauce, black rice oxtail risotto, mac and cheese and of course the glazed donut bread pudding for dessert.  The portions were perfect for the both of us as we devoured about 95% of all the food. Our server even brought us some extra bread to make small bites with the steak and mac and cheese, genius! My boyfriend literally had his mind blown by all of the flavors these dishes had.  Carson Kitchen, I love you. Please come to LA. Specifically Highland Park so I can walk in several times a week and fall in love with you again. In the meantime, I'll see you again in March. I'm counting down the days.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail risotto, tempura green beans, mac and cheese, NY steak and veal meatballs, I miss you guys.

yDeqEB8KGbtCqVJplQIK3Q.text: This is a great place downtown. What used to a be part of a rundown no-tell-motel has been transformed into a fantastic dining space. The secret's out, though, so you may have a wait depending on when you stop by. Trust me, it's worth it.  If you can, and the weather's not oppressive, try to sit outside upstairs. It's a nice space, and the bar will keep you hydrated. I was especially impressed with the Angry Tony, with it's use of mezcal.  Food-wise, this is the kind of place where you could eat with your health in mind, but don't: you're gonna deny yourself some good eats. I loved the Devil's eggs, the gyro tacos, and the baked mac and cheese. Service was great, and our guy kept an eye on us throughout the night.

e2PUne3_nryUp6V6bUZwGw.text: Food was delicious as usual, but the service was very pleasant. The whole staff was also friendly and attentive. Atmosphere was just awesome.

LIdH64yHLS8nePcgDVBl8A.text: The service was amazing; Eugenia-is so sweet and patient. The food was even better.  However some of the GF options are cross contaminated from the deep fried , so be cautious.   If they could get a dedicated frier for non-gluten products it would be better. Would love to see some better bourbon choices too.

3QxVhcvT89SFOoERkEQ6dw.text: Tasty food, cozy atmosphere, enjoyed watching the chefs cook from the bar. I had the shrimp and grits, and my husband had the short rib grilled cheese.

r7seSEdARJZjuUfeVbjU9w.text: Great place, awesome food, solid service!  Lucky for us our bartender at nearby Atomic Liquors sent us here when we asked for a great spot to catch dinner. He forewarned us that's we'd wait, but that it'd be worth it.  We did indeed have a small wait of 30 minutes, but a cocktail on the back patio killed that time quickly. The cocktails are solid, "Damn, Daniel" is mighty tasty and I knocked back a few by the end of the evening.   We were seated at the bar, where Geronimo took care of us, mixed our drinks, provided a few laughs and was always quick with a recommendation.   Our party of two ordered a wide mix of different plates and shared. This was the perfect way to do it. There was a lot that we wanted to try and this was a great way to do it.  The Deviled Eggs are great, the Gyro Tacos are a must, smoky bechamel on  the Mushroom Flatbread is unreal.  By the end of the night we even gave dessert a try. The Glazed Donut Pudding was killer, but the Chocolate Tart was a little too much...   Overall, it was an awesome experience that made Carson Kitchen a place that I look forward to coming back to... and I did... the next day for lunch.  And, Round 2 was just as good.

o588UrSIu9c1OdR1ouDjMQ.text: Downtown Las Vegas has really upped its game with small eateries. Carsons kitchen is no exception. They deliver on their perfectly portioned plates and thoughtful flavor compositions. The restaurant is super cute and very reasonably priced! I recommend the bacon jam and the cauliflower dish!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple but nice menu

tZDL4SOSl64T5Mqg1yvjjw.text: Great service, unique food and good chill place.   It was an accident finding Carson, I wanted to grab sushi from next door but they were closed.  Walked in here and I'll definitely be back!!!  Sat at the bar, great service, friendly people.

-S6yQ625jFiNG7Y-58UMTg.text: I rarely ever leave the strip when I visit Vegas, however, it's now a MUST to hit up Carsons Kitchen. Everything is perfect about this restaurant! The staff is amazing, drinks are creative and delicious, and food is just perfect. Is hands down my favorite restaurant in all of Vegas now!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2tLhUKCtHsea05KuAazuaQ.text: First, try to find it. the address is Sixth Street by entrance isn't on Sixth Street. Do you think you could give us a clue on the side of the building? Secondly, Its small and service is oblivious. We sat with a view of the kitchen but the servers decided to grace us with their butts by bending right in front of us and leaning on the counter for the duration of our stay.  Thirdly, don't expect to get a decent meal. This is Tapas at its minimum. Finally the area isn't great. Parking is a joke and sadly homeless people are a plenty seen going thru garbage and trying to survive. Bottom line... with so many famous chefs overcharging and producing small plates all over the strip why bother with this one all the way downtown with so little to offer?

SABUYUUIKHmceNxnhFL05w.text: A hidden gem just off the beaten path of Freemont street. Tapas style restaurant that allows you to try as much as you want! Friendly staff who are truly passionate about serving up dishes that are a little different. The chicken skins are a must have, served with smoked honey. My mouth is watering just writing this review! The deviled eggs with caviar, even the beet salad with pistachio rolled goat cheese!!! Don't know what you want? This place has it! You just don't know it yet...

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t walk fast or you&#39;ll miss this place!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RkhbBR-gCzFPOQ5UB8T7cA.text: This place is a hidden gem. We had four dishes total. The bacon jam was great but if you don't like sweet then don't get it. The mac and cheese is tasty and goes well with the cocoa-espresso NY strip. For dessert we tried the bourbon fudge brownie. Everything we ate complimented each other and I will definitely bring my friends here!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy ice cream!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheeese!!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cocoa espresso NY steak! Yumm

DlvP7O0ZQWDm4j14NIBybw.text: Wow! What a wonderful experience. Great environment and amazing food. Maybe it was a Monday night and that's why it wasn't as busy but we got in and seated within 10 minutes. We were fortunate enough to sit at the table top bye the chefs/kitchen. If you like special drinks we highly recommend the Get Shorty. It was so tasty with tequila/fresh grapefruit and cayenne pepper. We ordered the bacon Brie Jam. Very rich dish; recommend ordering if you have a group to help finish off the large portion. The pork belly fig flatbread the super tasty. However the jerk turkey burger stole the show! With the spicy tater tots and the coleslaw, the jerk turkey burger was simply fantastic! Even my husband who is not fond of turkey burgers couldn't resist having half of the turkey burger. Will definitely be coming back for more turkey burgers and Get Shorty cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aMPfu5aw_B7XUgQHY8yEcg.text: As my husband and I were walking the streets of Vegas arguing about where to eat, a local couple saved us by suggesting this place. Fantastic! Great little spot with local craft beer and unique food such as the bacon jam. The service was very attentive, friendly, and welcoming. Will be coming back on our next visit to Vegas.

9rLxZ44ZcaE6HJrfTlVQhA.text: Always amazing. Killer shrimp were killer!!! Save room for the glazed doughnut bread pudding!

jbS8UYPIfhF-GOHmJnYTkQ.text: Hip and cool unexpected surprise in Fremont Street. We were going to a show in the area and looking for somewhere to get a bite before. Found this online and really enjoyed!  The chipotle sauce with the artichokes was delicious, I could have eaten just the sauce!  The mac n cheese was tasty and the snapper flavorful if not a bit small.  Being a brit I had to try the banoffee pie and it was a great twist on this dessert.  If I was in this part of Vegas again, I would definitely go back!  Super friendly staff and cool ambience too.

xgfGl0Gt3h7DO5n8FBgczQ.text: Gluten free friendly.. Such a hidden gem spot like your in England off the beaten path. It's a old motel remodeled into different stores and in the middle of the motel or I should say behind it is a fire pit with chairs. The food was delicious a must eat is the black rice risotto with oz tails so yummy!! For a different side try the chicken skins with smoked honey.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0-rh4IrDlzPh6MfjRbjn-A.text: Delicious food. Excellent service. Other customers are very friendly as well. The restaurant is a tad cold, bring a jacket if you're like us and get cold easily.

-lRnywHEi8_lYXnJJYL3Lw.text: Hello Old Vegas with a new, hipster line up! If you have a hankering for old school slots, True neon lights and street performers...you need to come down to Fremont. Once you've had your fill of Fremont's Experience cross the street into a swanky but down to Earth atmosphere.  What a great vibe this area has with open air bars, friendly staff and good eats crammed into every corner.  Carson Kitchen was fairly crowded for a Thursday, the wait was about 20 minutes, perfect timing for a HH cocktail:) We had the shrimp, bacon brie, turkey jerk burger, chicken sammie and topped it off with an amazing dessert! Their menu changes weekly so you could keep coming here and not repeat the experience...  Wish I could take this place back to DC with me! If you are in town I would highly recommend this as a must eat. Nice change from Vegas Strip feel!

ptFbUE_M3nf1yE-hG8Ztmw.text: Had late lunch here today so they weren't too busy, I heard it can get packed in here so plan ahead!   First of all the ambience is amazing. I like their unique seating area. We were seated at the bar.   Server was attentive and quick. Took our drink and appetizer orders. We got the tempura green beans, which were amazing. I find that most fried green beans I have are almost always too oily, not these. I ordered the Tomato Stack which wasn't overly filling but was flavorful. Lastly we got the bread pudding. As other have mentioned they use donuts from next door. It was so good, I wanted another one. Definitely a must try!   Would love to be able to comment on more of their dishes, so I'll definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato stack
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura green beans

uBDRoawrqEbQoS74BMv02w.text: Amazing food and great staff! This place is great. Highly recommend trying this place out. Located in the downtown district of Las Vegas. No breakfast but they have amazing lunch options. Check them out!

3qKEfRmn0Onm0CZ7OKiqjA.text: This little gem is within walking distance of downtown Las Vegas. The kitchen is busy, but they'll still find time to answer a question (or two). Grab a counter seat so you can see everything going on in the kitchen. We watched our deviled eggs with caviar being prepared literally right in front of us. Our starter was their famous chicken skins with smokey honey sauce ( a must). Our accompaniment was the veal meatballs (sooo good). Our drinks were great with DAAAAAAMN Daniel and 68+1 being our choices, and were so good, that we had a second drink with dinner.   Great service and a modern American-Tapas style will surely please the most demanding appetite, and particular palate.

uSUDeUUQZpelcJPQV7Nk_Q.text: I was amazed at the high quality of the dishes prepared for me. The food was expertly done. The flavors exploded in my mouth!  The staff was so attentive and explained the menu in detail. I definitely recommend this restaurant .  I will look forward to returning on my next visit to Las Vegas!!   I look forward to trying Standard & Pour in Henderson next!! !

LzI8J1qmCI_DS0hY0s-W8A.text: I work upstairs but have only eaten at Carson Kitchen 3 times. I felt compelled to write a review about my experience today. I had the Jerked Turkey burger with the hot tater tots. It was for real amazing. Words can't describe how it was perfectly cooked,seasoned and served. I will make it my personal mission to eat at least one a month from today on.  Also ask for Courtney. She's the cute server with a really upbeat attitude and excellent customer service.  Keep doing you, Carson Kitchen!  XOXOX  Chris from BUNNYFiSH

ph0noQCRtx2vwWFacpyDlw.text: This place can easily have five star if the chef can go easy on the seasoning. It's really quite salty. :(  I would still go back a couple of times to see if any improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very nice with chicken skin

Y90bm_Ed3ztWrdbpwrZrug.text: OMG everything we ordered here was amazing! Even their mixology on alcoholic drinks was well done.   Service was great, pricing was decent. I would suggest sharing everything as their plates are kind of tapas style except for their burgers. Burgers are huge BTW so don't expect to be able to finish that and have sides without leaving feeling overly full and uncomfortable.   This is what I had to eat starting with my fav (I shared of course): 1- Mac & Cheese- it's so gooey with cheese but not overwhelmingly stinky or heavy, very good mixture of cheese and whatever used to thicken the sauce. I couldn't get enough and I'm definitely not a cheese person.  2- Margherita pizza(I forget what it was called)-  Slightly heavier than expected so I would put it between a normal pizza and a margherita pizza.  3- Jerk Turkey Burger- This thing was huge! The sauce was like a mango salsa and went with it well! I didn't even think it was like a turkey patty, tasted like a normal beef patty. Yay for less fat without trying! 4- Their normal Burger- Tasted like any other gourmet burger would taste so it was up to par, no complaints except that it was huge! 5- Green Bean temppura- It was a little salty but the sauce went well with it. I probably could've done without this but I can imagine it being super tasty if I were drinking a beer.

jZJcnX7YH2H5A2Yt5j-SjA.text: OMG. Their veal meatballs are amazing. And their Mac and cheese. If you are stopping in Las Vegas please visit here and take some time to enjoy their amazing cooking. Their staff is very friendly and this place is truly amazing.

0lpWzfBYm6YHXZyRZ9JgxA.text: This place is a hidden gem! Though apparently not too hidden because the place was packed. Ariel was our super server, but at some point during the night nearly every server checked on us to make sure we had whatever we needed. Service is absolutely exceptional!   The food was also fantastic...had the tempura green beans with the most flavorful dipping sauce, the lamb tacos and turkey burger which were both super tasty, and the Bourbon Brownie with brown butter bacon ice cream that CHANGED MY LIFE. There are no words to describe how good this is. Just get it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bourbon brownie with brown butter bacon ice cream. YUM!

7-dZfY4R58TUYujcC6Y5hg.text: Had the chicken skins, rainbow cauliflower, gyro tacos, mac n cheese and bread pudding. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING. Ate every bite. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

ptuUue27ezYaUEiHcCZb1Q.text: What a little gem in old Vegas !!  Such a refreshing place .  An actual insight into people who live in this town .. Amazing food ..hospitality had the the pleasure of meeting chef owner Cory ?  Very kind and gracious host ..  Great experience . Go to strip for the lights and hyped food go here for a True Vegas experience ..  Highlights ...  Veal meatballs , Mac and cheese , Shepards Trout ..  I'll be back .

MTTxq9gn3dPVm-M8yFw0qw.text: First off our server Bianca was amazing. We were a party of 8 and none of us had ever been here so we decided to try a few menu items and drinks of course. We ordered the chicken skins, Baked Mac and cheese, bacon jam, tempura green beans, Butter burger, jerk turkey burger, short rib grilled cheese, Green eggs and ham, Bourbon Fudge Brownie and Glazed donut bread pudding. My favorite were the short rib grilled cheese, Mac and cheese and bourbon fudge brownie. The other favorites at the table were the green eggs and ham and bacon jam. This is not to say the other items were not good by any means. I would definitely recommend Carson Kitchen to anyone if you want to try food with so many different flavors. Oh and their drinks were amazing as well.

Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6pchbNVf4gr1grvNkxnqMA.text: Such a perfect place and addition to the beautiful downtown las vegas. Food is great and atmosphere is calm and relax. Cocktails and food! All we need!!!

iXzWIQgCOjR4a9eVgWKOIQ.text: I love love love Carsons Kitchen . I had the privilege to meet and get to know Kerry Simon . His food and concepts were always fresh innovative and Rock and Rock . The staff has kept up this tradition. Michael the Manager was very friendly and engaging. Our waitress was wonderful and since we sat at the open kitchen bar the kitchen staff also were very attentive. I love the Downtown Las Vegas Gem ps The Food, AMAZING!!!

qKC-PnqMJBnx7g5BawFDqw.text: Awesome restaurant and the service is really friendly and warm. We ordered bacon jam (highly recommended); crispy chicken Skin (delicious); bison sliders (very good); Turkey burger (must have); pork belly Cuban (good); Thai chicken flatbread (disappointing); glazed donut pudding (must have); bourbon fudge brownie (very good).  Had to deduct a star because the flat bread was disappointing but everything else was pretty awesome. The place was packed but the wait time from ordering food to getting it to eat was pretty quick turnaround.   Definitely worth going with a bunch of people so you can explore the menu together.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon ice cream with brownies
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai chicken flat bread
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bison sliders with Tatter Tots

miPzKhAJssLud6soHsphTQ.text: As though the food on strip wasn't decadent enough, this tiny restaurant packs an enormous amount of flavor in every savory dish. This was my second Vegas visit where our team incorporated Carson's- and it won't be our last.  We waited about 15 minutes before they were able to seat us. No big deal, we cozied up to the outdoor fire pit, and laughed, drinks in hand. Upon being seated, our server set us up with a fresh round of drinks. I had been elected to place our tables order. (This is trouble) There were seven of us, so we ordered a ton: Fried chicken skins: ok, hear me out on this one. I'm fully aware that chicken skins are the least healthy party of the chicken, but equally, they may be the most delicious. Especially when you deep fry them, and serve them with a smoky honey. (I love honey!) Three different burgers: butter, bison, not sure the last. that we cut like a pizza and shared. The sweet potato tater-tots were a table wide hit. Bacon Jam (this is an epic dish of bacon, some fruit, and Brie that you spread on crispy bread slices). Highly addictive. Completely unhealthy, totally worth it. Spicy shrimp: crispy and coated with a spicy mayonnaise, these were a popular, rich treat. Truffle Mac and cheese: mind blown- this was amazing. Unsurpassed deliciousness coated in cheese and baked to nice brown top.  Braised pork belly: this was a close second to the Mac and cheese. Very close. It was succulent, tender, flavorful and I had more than my fair share ;) Tri-color cauliflower: this was tangy and a wild adventure. Also, the healthiest thing we ordered. Gyro-tacos: sounded weird, but these were superb. Flavorful meat, and the prefect tzatziki sauce. Wild mushroom flatbread: perfectly crisp, great portions of toppings and yummy! I was a few Tito's and cranberry in, so I'm not sure if I missed anything else. I feel like I may have excluded something. Oh, then dessert. Bread pudding Bacon Icecream. (Never had anything close) The chocolate cake, also amazing.  As you can gather from reading the above, we enjoyed everything, and still kept eating. Tales of my dietary trespasses here will forever be told- and I'm not ashamed of any of them! Highly recommend this off strip gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The outdoor firepit- perfect place to wait to be seated
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam... More amazing than you can imagine

I6lSLsn0gTH28MH_6aZusQ.text: Exquisite food very well prepared. The sharing concept is great just like home.   This is a keeper.

TiuAQRBBItdzHuSHT4tLaQ.text: We were the first ones there right before they opened so they told us to wait in the back patio and they would come get us when they were ready. We waited 30 minutes on the cold patio and then decided to see what was taking so long. When we went back in the restaurant there were about 5 tables that were already seated. They totally forgot about us. When we reminded the host that we were waiting out in the back for someone to come get us, he could care less. The seating was hard and uncomfortable. The food was good and our server was nice. But nothing to write home about.

bZa6yPM5Gp5n3OAQnkjueg.text: Loved Carson Kitchen! worth the trip to old vegas!!!

-tarzvYKh9bIbiL36xGv8w.text: Had the NY Strip,Sunday Chicken and Bacon Jam. All were fantastic. The bacon jam was a little sweet but still very good.  Two of us split the three dishes and were very full. Signature cocktails also great. Highly recommend this place, I wanted to try so many more of the dishes.

ypssv7DkoP-VTB2w1yEEHg.text: If you want innovative/comfort food, you've come to the right place. Eating here is like having your cool, older brother cook you a bunch of his favorite dishes. Order lots of items with a group and share them ALL! I think my husband and I ordered half the menu - everything was delicious and surprising. Oh, and FRESH. Nothing frozen or fabricated here.  Service is attentive, friendly and personal. Come here and do it often.

1j8LXwUT7oqXsB8CMIt8rw.text: Open two days but you would think it had been open two years.  An open kichen concept where the chefs create master pieces on plates.  Cocktails are hand crafted and go down way too easy.  I am mad at the mac n cheese because it is simply AMAZING. I will never attempt to make homemade mac n cheese again as it will seem like an utter failure once I had this.  The rabbit ragu served over spaghetti squash is equally delicious.  I can't wait to come back again and again so I can work my way through this entire menu.  What a homerun for downtown.

nvJ7Oxeas0iPTt8aDReeYw.text: Very good food. Nice wine selection. Pretty expensive. Would go back for a special  occasion.

0gDoWmc17sXt1ZCRiyA3iQ.text: DEEEEElightful! They don't take reservations for parties under 6 people and it was a Sunday evening. They were pretty busy so we sat at the bar.  What a great decision!  The bartender hustles but we never felt rushed or neglected.  The whole main floor is pretty tight but it allowed us to visit with other diners and make friends!  We had the rabbit ragu, roasted tomato stack and baby beets. They were all fantastic! If I recall, the entrance isn't right on 6th Street but I'm directionally challenged.  Wait staff was friendly and efficient. Nice addition to downtown Vegas!  There was a party of three vulturing at the bar and tried to grab our neighbors seats at the bar when they left for a few minutes to check out the upstairs section.  If you're wound tight like that....don't go. It's bad energy, man.

J2H6CHXA1Y3dUtrWcrgTyw.text: Very original dishes worth driving downtown for.  Service is off the charts.  A twist on tacos, burgers, tapas and appetizers.  I like the jerk burger, shrimp, Mac & cheese and green beans.  Cool ambience w/hip young staff who are competent and caring.  Social tables available.  Gr8 bar menu and reasonable prices.  Call b4 you come to get on the waiting list.  No reservations.

q3oGSFzPt8z-0ca-0uv2Tw.text: I absolutely love this spot. Where else can you go and get fried chicken skins?? I ordered them but was a bit disappointed. I expected them to be crunchy chewy but it was super dry and crunchy and tasted just like pork rinds. However everything else made up for it. The lamb tacos...... OMG they were heaven... The mac and cheese melts in your mouth... But the shrimp.... it was THEE best shrimp I ever had in my life. I think it changed my life for the better lol. The bacon jam was such an original dish I have to rank it high. I never tasted anything like it before. My favorite was the tempura style green beans. There was a woman at the bar chocking and a guy ran from the kitchen and saved her life. It was the most excitement that occurred for me during my stay in Vegas lol. If you are in Vegas, I highly recommend you try it out. They place is small so you need to call ahead to get on the list.  Bon Appetit

tJPt01J-_lhQGHraVCC4OQ.text: bravo, a great new place downtown to get your grub on.  I loved the selection of beers, the food was stellar, I would go again just to try some other stuff.  You must have the deviled eggs, I would have taken another order of those, we also had some steak special that rocked out, fresh veggys and beer, just a perfect meal.  $$$ pricey, but well worth it.  Not horrible value, but not cheap per se.  5 star food and service.  mmmm mmm good...

ZPC4AmwxTKsgEMOZ4nvCzw.text: Amazing amazing amaziaballs seriously so happy I was able to try the bacon jam, caviar deviled eggs, the chef let us try Mac n cheese with the bacon jam ..to die for and I want to cry knowing orlando doesn't have a Carson's kitchen. This is a real gem. Signature drinks are unique and surprising.

rimsNWSE5KYEnhDNfeF4HA.text: TRY THE BACON JAM!!! I seriously love this place. The food is amazing.. Not one thing I haven't enjoyed. I would rate it more than 5 stars if I could!

tAzjn0kUobmGSaWncw3gzA.text: OMG delish!! I had the jerky turkey and it was perfect!!!  Would pass on the chicken skins (just thinking about all that fried grease is not appealing)-the devil eggs were devilish and I had a spoonful of the mac and cheese-yum!  Worth the lunch wait!

ZZl9JJhOl7sWk3IkzGcCiA.text: Holy moly. Fantastic! We had the Mac n cheese, rainbow cauliflower, the beets, broccoli, shrimp, OY! To die for. Then dessert - glazed donut bread pudding AND brown butter bacon ice cream with bourbon fudge brownie. Wow. You won't be disappointed!

AQFkJcfDfwwOMLCwT8iV4A.text: Tara rocks some socks. I fuckin love it. Rad bartender in a rad space. The food looks amazing although I was only there for an adult beverage. Can't wait to come back and dive into their Jerk Turkey Burger!

80o6eMSt5Fp2rfnEoETeZQ.text: This place is AMAZING. We just moved from Denver and have been looking for a great place to eat. Very small restaurant but trendy. The directions led us to the back of the building but other than that, there were no complaints on the night. Great friendly service, the kitchen (which you could see) is clean and runs well, all of the staff is super friendly and the food is very good. My husband and I ordered 4 appetizers/small plates. The bacon Brie jam was one of the best things I've tasted in my life. I honestly wouldn't order a burger or entree here (not that it would be bad) because the food is do good it's a great idea to get a few things and share to try all the different flavors. Food Not too expensive either, drinks a little up there. Definitely give this place a try. Small little hard to find restaurant but well worth the hunt!

S2RdcZ-gbsKTew6SAOxxgg.text: Two Words-So Good!!  A new gem to the downtown corridor. This restaurant by Chef Kerry Simon takes comfort food to the next level!  Started off with a few of the shareable plates. If you don't care about your waist line or your cholesterol levels, start with the crispy chicken skins. They have taken the best part of fried chicken and made it an appetizer!  The Wellington empanadas are amazing!  The beef inside is so flavorful and tender.  Next we had the tempura green beans. The beans were so fresh and the tempura was the perfect crispiness/saltiness. Don't forget to dip in the cream cheese sauce. Next was the veal meatballs with sherry foie gras cream sauce. Again heaven. Taking down home comfort food and jazzing it up a notch. Did I mention we sat at the chefs counter and were able to talk to the entire kitchen staff while they prepared our meal!  It was like being on a cooking show. For our main course, we had the short rib sliders and the baked Mac and cheese. Again amazing comfort food taken to the next level. The short ribs have a root beer glaze that is a perfect compliment to the braised beef. I've been dying to try the Mac and cheese since the day I saw a pic of them on FB a few months ago and it was so worth the wait!   As stuffed as we were, we still tried the Bourbon Fudge Brownie with brown butter bacon ice cream. And we were so happy we did. The ice cream had actual bacon bits in it!  Paired with the decadent chocolate brownie, the saltiness/creaminess of the ice cream was what God must have intended heaven to taste like :)  I will definitely be coming back with lots of my friends in tow!

pkZlFumL1mAY9W6i8LDLtg.text: Tucked away but worth the search!!! Great place to go with a group to share. Every single thing we ordered (party of five) was on point! Definitely take a moment to check this place out. Order a bunch. Take it all in with family and friends!

ZN1TfrYaECnfL-UmeJjwog.text: I came in on a Sunday around 6pm and this place was super busy but we got seated at the bar immediately. We ordered the chicken skins, the black bean and oxtail, and the gyro tacos. The gyro tacos were the BOMB! So delicious!!!!! The chicken skins got boring after three bites and the oxtail left something to be desired. Im giving this place 4 stars because the service was great and the  ambiance is better. I will def be back and try out some other dishes.

2xKIx2D37OspMbg_0DaNdQ.text: Comfort food with finesse. Nice change up for us locals tired of fighting strip traffic.

gIZgwoqsnolCvBKz4xZHdw.text: Crispy chicken skin. Nothing else needs to be said. Delicious food, great atmosphere, outside seating is beautiful!

2uTFWoNHRsMpJ72C4MoINQ.text: Nice food and service...The waitress was very nice - even funny...Will eat there again soon...

VQKqtHFkFKdUChYhLbBC1A.text: This was my favorite las vegas trip meal!  I came here for lunch and got to watch the chefs make our lunch at the bar.  The interior design is gorgeous with lots of would and industrial steel.  We got the watermelon & feta salad, tempura green beans, mushroom pizza, and doughnut bread pudding.  I absolutely could eat the watermelon & feta salad and tempura green beans all day. Skip the buffets and come here instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon &amp; feta salad.   Delicious!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom pizza
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura green beans

Ir8fXPUv_qbioG5n1SsO0g.text: Carson Kitchen embodies the spirit of the new downtown Las Vegas to the fullest.    The dining room; Just like DTLV is trying to create a sense of community, this restaurant is bringing a style of dining I have yet to see in Las Vegas, family style dining. This type of dining encourages conversation between complete strangers and usually ends up creating an atmosphere welcoming to all. An atmosphere some may say is similar to that of DTLV.    The food; DTLV is a place where trends come to be seen, the same can be said for Carson Kitchen for food trends. However, instead of being safe with food trends, they take trends and put their own twist on them. For example, they have fried chicken skins with their own spicy honey sauce, oxtail risotto, and bacon jam. All of which were delicious and simply addicting, especially the bacon jam (believe the hype).   There is not much more to say, this place is fantastic and should definitely be on everyone's radar.

Y58bbxtQBTNrHwYzziCiGA.text: Can you say chicken skins and smoked honey?! Oh my goodness, they might be one of the most incredible food bites ever created! Overall, this is one of the best places that we ate at while visiting Vegas. The menu is super creative, and adventurous. There is literally something to satisfy anyone from a picky child to an adult looking for a gourmet meal.

_ywkhzVzTotJhS6egcoqCQ.text: I joined a group of friends at Carson Kitchen not knowing what to expect and was more than pleasantly surprised. Such a creative menu in a funky setting. The food was creative and my favorites of the evening were the chicken skins, bacon jam, flatbread and sweet potato in a jar. The weather prohibited us from eating at the rooftop dining area but will try that next visit.  Two suggestions: 1) adding the name of the restaurant (maybe a reflective steel grey) on the second window on the top as the other signage is blocked by parked cars and the black text is hard to read and 2) hooks for purses.  If you enjoy creative food and a pleasant atmosphere this is a place to seek out. Thank you GM Matt Harwell for your hands on style.

ODOSymR4A2M9lXr0T_SHRA.text: My Husband and I ate at Carson Kitchen as our first meal in Vegas and the food was phenomenal! We had beets salad, sea bass, NY strip and olive oil potatoes. I would highly recommend every single dish, seriously really good! The service on the other hand was a little weird? The team felt a insincere and like they couldn't really be bothered. Not terrible service but did hinder the experience. Service aside , we were so impressed with the food that the it didn't matter however wouldn't return due to service. It is definitely worth going to on food alone.

DgTxtPyyFNnV_3ndNYabYA.text: Food wasn't bad, but felt a little overpriced for the quantity you get. This is a good place to come with a bunch of friends or for a small lunch, but don't come here hungry. It's got a nice ambiance. I see it more of a bar/lounge with food then a full out restaurant.

iQvnImetwAwRhYnBnJVLkg.text: Visiting Carson Kitchen was on my "must do" list for my next trip to Vegas.  A group of four of us arrived a little after 11am so there was no waiting.  We had the empanadas which were a disappointment.  The flavor was odd or off, unappetizing -- maybe it's the mushrooms.  One of the empanadas was half filled with gristle & fat which the eater spit out onto her plate.  We debated sending the dish back, hard to do when it comes with 4 bites and everyone took one.  We had the bacon jam which was good, make sure to get the extra toast. Then we had devil eggs which were average, not notable in any way except for a little caviar.  Beet salad which was fine.  The tomatoes in the stacked salad were not ripe -- something you might buy at cheap grocery store.  I know it's not quite tomato season, but the bland, hard meat of the tomato spoiled the dish.  The short rib sliders which were superb with with sweetly root beer sauce (and tater tots on the side).  I could probably eat these every day.  This would be my go-to item.  The mushroom flat bread was very good.  The gyros soft tacos were over salted.  The service was wonderful.  The scores for the food were 2, 4, 3, 3, 2, 5, 4, 3, for an average a little over 3.  Very uneven food.  The rating should be 3.5.  Somewhere between "A-Okay" and "I'm a fan".  If we had had only the sliders, bacon jam, and flat bread we might have been looking a 5 star rating.  The service makes we want to push the rating to 4, but the empandas and tomatoes make me want to keep it at three.  The food will win.  3 stars.

mf4a3sh8B16YQuFSY2i6Tg.text: Taste was good, a bit salty and very oily. Make sure you bring some nutriclean fiber powder and isotonix digestive enzyme. Excellent customer service, environment is good too.

Qvbb-ltWYw8T7wR6E_0jDQ.text: Carson Kitchen is a downtown gem!! I will def be back for more!! The service was great, kitchen a bit slow but all was forgotten when the food arrived!! We chose to start with the short rib sliders (sweet and savory) and rainbow broccoli (perfectly seasoned) and swordfish (cooked well)! Wishing we had room for dessert but that will have to wait for our next visit! Ambiance is amazing and you can wait with a cocktail in hand in their courtyard out back!

I enjoy sitting at the counter where I can see the chefs in action. food taste great!  ordered the  cucumber soda............yeah it taste like cucumber water and soda water.  not sweet.  fired chicken skin with honey dipping------I love this.  it's so crispy.    veal meat ball  beef empanada  beet salad  bourbon fudge brownie with ice cream.  ----I am not a fudge brownie person but I love this.  can really taste the bourbon!

2w0zk9NP12gFC5sgbmYDCQ.text: Excellent dinner!   Everything was delicious!   If you can handle the heat, ask for a seat at the kitchen, EVERYTHING is made to order!!!

BqnRbbkvfwf7vCsncVNHIA.text: Food is great! Staff is on point! Our waiter, Andrew,  was the bomb! Very knowledgable on everything! The girls cooking, Masa and Charlene are awesome!! Bacon jam was bomb! Nice little kick to it. The spread for the tempura green beans was sooooooo good! Hubby had the pork carbonara...um wow!!! Highly recommended and we will be back!!

iskDlwjuxA4momHJZUg4fQ.text: Refreshing!! Small plates with awesome flavor collaborations! Bacon Jam... Mac and cheese... Chicken skins... Oxtail... I'll be a regular for sure:)

i2eZ68-lQH8nyJz9B7KE5A.text: Restaurant looked nice. Was sat at the kitchen bar, no one (except the hostess when she sat me) acknowledged me, came over, all while the server was going to people sat after me. After about 15 minutes I gave up and just left.

CxVKzve9BiA9aONT8YWlDw.text: Just another day in Carson's Kitchen.  lol.  Service was great today.  My waiter was on point and michelle one of the cooks was super sweet while I sat at the bar by the kitchen.  She was very nice about making my watermelon cucumber salad small for me.  Very nice of her.  I came for the amazing and famous bacon jam which is almost better then you know what.  Ok it is better most of the time lol.  My my " some things with mrs. P's) drink was refreshing and made to order,  less sweet.   And then to finish...... Brownie bacon ice cream desert.  Wholly cow.  Some one roll me out of here. Yum!

3Xu0bka6Oi1yjU67BwdAVw.text: Small Loud Busy Mediocre service The Swordfish was quite good. Interesting and beautifully presented. The rainbow Cauliflower was over seasoned and had too much lemon. There is no beer on tap our bottles were served without a glass. Jerk turkey Burger pretty good, served with tater tots. Devils eggs were interesting. The bacon and caviar were a good combination.

WzU1a2h2MNNc4Vb45ZKOrw.text: This restaurant is just fantastic! It's one of my favorites. I recently went here with a group of 9 others for a birthday, and it could t have been better. The staff is kind, personable, and knowledgeable; and the ambiance is fun and lively. With menu pickings like bacon jam, seasoned crispy chicken skins with smoked honey, jerk turkey burger, and glazed donut bread pudding it's hard to pick just one item off the menu that stands out.   Definitely a must for anyone!

5LPSs6ht5BBj-dpdmPrRLw.text: Manny is a great server! loved his mannerisms and realism with us... Great server and amazing person!  #fakeittillyoumakeit ;)

IeimbfpxBDHar5FYjhy_9g.text: What a nice treat in downtown! Seemingly simple dishes are elevated by strong flavors. The Sea Bass is amazingly delicious with a crispy skin and great flavor. Brought a friend from our if town to experience a non Strip place and she loved it! Nice ambiance, just wish there were chairs and not stools. Recommended and would go back!

npZ0IRJIrt_QgqqD0q0Z5Q.text: It was my first time visit downtown LV!Awesome crispy chicken skin~And I like the devil egg!!!great dinner.

29Q1pMQNw63wppJ4-skKrg.text: The man and I WASTED too much money on the strip paying for fine dining. As a foodie, THIS IS THE ONLY PLACE YOU NEED TO GO. get the damn burger. I don't typically eat burgers but this burger is amazing.... get the deviled eggs. Ain't like my momma makes it in the south but damn good. The mac and cheese wasn't my style but it was ok. All in all, wish we would have eaten here for several meals so we could have tried more things on the menu!!

E345oLDMKoAQER20UAbw-Q.text: Totally underwhelmed and unimpressed.   We stopped in for lunch on a Friday afternoon, were immediately seated and given menus to look over. Deciding to share, we ordered a few different things; German potato salad, shrimp and grits, the steak with reduction and the crispy chicken skin with smoked honey.   The German potato salad had decent flavor but was overly salty. The chicken skins were indeed crispy with a slightly spicy dusting. The smokiness of the honey was lost when paired with it's intended vehicle, but on it's own, it's fantastic. And surprisingly strong. The shrimp and grits was by far the best dish. Spicy, flavorful, it's a shame there wasn't more of it. The steak was meh, but I appreciated that it was rare, as I requested. The coffee flavor was lost and the reduction was flavorless- making the entire piece of meat unmemorable. I swished the meat around in it a few times to try to find something and got nothing.  If I had a choice, I wouldn't be back. And for the hype this establishment has received, it definitely did not live up to it.

D8pI-YqmC-PPo-swz155Pg.text: Bustling little place located near Fremont. Three out of the 4 items we ordered were really good which included the deviled eggs, the brussel spout caesar salad and the skirt steak. The salmon was our 4th dish and tasted a bit bland and all the flavor was in the crispy skin. I wouldn't get that again. Even though we were not going to linger and had a show to go to, we still felt rushed. Things like your plate being removed the second you put down your fork, not being asked if we wanted another drink and the next set of diners standing in the doorway scanning the tables all added to it. It's a small place that needs the turnover so I get it. Not a big deal but something to keep it in mind when you go there. YMMV.

1CUSW8D6Wpc3ZFpnCeOdKw.text: We'd called ahead but they didn't have any reservations available. The host was super friendly and recommended we pop in anyway to see if they could squeeze us in. We did just that and were red carpeted right to the bar top overlooking the kitchen. Front. Row. Seats. Before looking at the beverage menu I immediately pulled out my phone to boomerang the $hit out of the cooks. It's like live theatre folks! Our server was super friendly and attentive. Made jokes with us, kept us engaged, and made all kinds of recommendations to me since it was my first time there. I ordered the Apricot Cider and we started with the Chicken Skins. They are served with a spicy honey that made me feel like a kid again, but with that grown up vibe. I seriously loved chicken nuggets with honey when I was growing up. My friend and I split the Buddy Burger, cooked medium rare, and the Roasted Rainbow Cauliflower. Yum.com!!! It was pretty enough to take a picture, which I did! The burger was juicy and fabulous, cooked perfectly, and those tater tots with spicy ketchup? Am I in Narnia? This is definitely a date night spot, or in my case, a special lady date spot with one of my besties. The menu plucks my belly strings and I can't wait to come back for more.

TABMAzi9JZvWq3RY3l8Bqg.text: There may be better food in Las Vegas, but you're going to spend 3 times the price. Carson Kitchen has amazing food and easily the best value of any restaurant in town. Believe the hype!  I would add the two "can't miss" items are the bacon jam and the killer shrimp.

LhalxAWeoPfH_-i7qxCiHQ.text: Of the hip and trendy restaurants hitting this end of Vegas right now this is one of the best by far. Awesome selections, great beers and wonderful service. If you get a chance and you're within 20 miles of this restaurant make it a point to come here. You won't be disappointed.

TzU4amvkhdp0VxL0vQEbmA.text: Amazing experience!  Traveling alone I sat at the bar and the bar tender was great, recommending 2 really delicious beers (they have a great variety of local and national craft beer) and a fantastic entree (oxtail risotto) that wasn't even on my radar.  Entree was $14 and was wayyyyyyy better than a much more expensive entree I'd had elsewhere the night before, so come here for good beer, energetic but good ambiance, and delicious, reasonably priced food.

hGSIVES7hlUasf8wOwg0tg.text: This was a fantastic experience. The Chicken Skins were amazing. The everything bagel flat bread with salmon was also well worth it. Great meal, great service. Well worth it. It was fun to get off the strip on vacation and eat at a great place.

2x_8cSOTsGkDodfAb1asbw.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas! Always great quality food and outstanding service!

RxkbHGIfS7UgfZz0Y3vQkA.text: Amazing. If this place was in Oakland they'd kill it!  Had 5 small dishes and each one was exceptional. Smoked honey with crispy chicken skin was a great touch. Their caviar topped deviled eggs were fluffy and decadent with awesome bacon flavor. The foie gras meatballs were a revelation, and the pork belly with buffalo/blue sauce was actually crispy -- take note Bay Area chefs you can actually crisp your belly not just claim that you can.... what a great restaurant!!!

4gImuNU_QZDv1m6mSSioKQ.text: A restaurant is judged not only by the food they put out but also by the service they provide. Tonight I was super excited to try out Carson Kitchen. I left unimpressed and actually a bit offended by the waiter's service.   Initially, the night started off alright. He introduced himself (I forgot his name) and was attentive enough. He gave us waters and recommended that we get about 2 plates/person as this restaurant mainly has small plates that are meant to be shared. We followed his advice and ordered 6 plates total. Halfway through the meal, the service started going downhill. We had 4 plates of food still on our table when he asked us if we were doing okay/if we wanted to order. 6 plates is a lot of food, so we said we were good and didn't order. He came back at least 2 more times while we were having our savory dishes to ask if we wanted to order more. That's a little overkill, especially considering that we already got his recommended amount of plates. When we wanted to order dessert, he was nowhere in sight, and we ended up having to wave at him from across the room. And then he tried pushing for us to try all three desserts. Dude, we're full. He also kept asking us if we wanted more than iced water. I think after the second time of telling him that we were okay with just water, he would get the hint. At the very end of the meal, he also gave us attitude when we asked if we could split the bill three ways. Honestly, he could have easily just told us no and been done with that. There are apps like Venmo; I can work around not being able to split a bill. Instead, he made the rest of the night super awkward as he hovered over us as we tipped him with the portable credit card machine.   We ordered: crispy chicken skins - one of the better dishes of the night. You can't go wrong with fried food, and the smoked honey is a nice accompaniment. bacon jam - They put a lottttttt of balsamic vinegar in this; it was a little too tangy for me. I would put more cheese to balance out the vinegar. It has also an odd texture and reminds me of diced up Asian beef jerky. black rice and oxtail risotto - They advised to mix the dish up thoroughly before eating. There was a familiar taste to it, but I couldn't place a finger on it. It was alright....  baked mac and cheese - They have a pretty sharp cheese in that blend of whatever cheeses they use. It's nice. They also browned the top with some breadcrumbs; the added crunch was a nice change in texture green, eggs, & ham - It smelled of smoky deliciousness. The eggs were overcooked so we couldn't "spread the egg" to the other pieces of flatbread, like we were advised. However, it also smelled exactly like the wild mushroom flatbread from the table next to us; so I'm going to assume that they taste also similar' glazed donut bread pudding - this was the star of the night. Get this.  Despite the chicken skins and the dessert, the service I experienced today makes it difficult to want to ever come back. 3 stars for food; -1 star for the awful awful service

ftodxwP60vq3Q1wY3WueNA.text: An amazing restaurant that lived up to its reviews. The turkey burger was amazing and I wasn't too full but wanting more. The chicken skins were good but just that...tempura chicken skins Highly recommend...hip and tasty

Z1NrKhxzTdVAHEJP7jtY1A.text: Why oh why did I go to Carson Kitchen? Was it the 4.5 star rating? Absolutely not.   My friend met a guy on one of those dating apps and didn't want to meet him alone (bc serial killers are a real thing). SO, she asked us to come (but obvi we sat at a different table). Jessica & Viv - The dynamic duo who will keep an eye on you from a distance to make sure you're safe!!   Here's what we ordered: grilled artichoke, short rib grilled cheese, and turkey burger.   Is it just me, or are whole artichokes really hard to eat? Like I'm eating leaves and I don't know if I'm doing it right. Well how where I did it, I ate it and it was good. A lot more flavorful than I expected.   The grilled cheese, turkey burger, and tater tots were good, but not so memorable. For $14 a burger, I'd probably just rather buy 3 double doubles at in n out.

-RH4Nyx19F6ao5RLM-A1cA.text: Sooo good. Tempura green beans were insane, Mac and cheese was by far the best Mac and cheese I've ever had, and the service was great. The ambiance was awesome as well, and there's a great bar area.

fsDTnPpCngDti5wmUDEkjg.text: It's a little hole in the wall looking place from the outside. The inside is cute and hip. The staff is just as cute and hip as the vibe. Waitress was super nice and not in a fake way. Like, she was ACTUALLY nice. They have an open kitchen, we sat at the bar watching the chefs in the kitchen do their work. It was fun. Food came fast. I loved the deviled eggs and octopus the most. But the beet salad and veal meatballs were also yummy. Great price! Same quality meal on the strip costs at least 3x as much. I'd return next time we're downtown.

dAUJVNRo4s4_9HdjgDv-lQ.text: Great place to eat off of the strip. A reasonably sized menu of delicious comfort foods. Prices seemed fair for the quality of food. Service was great although we were one of only a few tables occupied during lunch. Would certainly recommend this place is you need to get away from the chaos of the Vegas strip.

JDTFzUT-G7ALyEVRCxxabg.text: Great food. The bacon jam was a surprise star. The coffee/chocolate crusted strip was unique. The Mac and cheese was as good as it gets. I enjoyed the gyro tacos, but would pass next time because the other dishes were so great.   The place is small. The wait for parties greater than 2 can be really long. The back patio is great for waiting. Wonderful staff and overall experience.

Zjgf2_SBx0tHKPZYLl_r3w.text: Took a group of 17 here for my sons birthday. Service was over the top!! Food was amazing!!! Very fun, great atmosphere, very reasonably priced. The Chef's twists on some classics made it comfortable for everyone to try. We ordered a bunch of appetizers and entrees and shared.....highly suggest, so that you can try a bunch of different dishes. One of my new favorites in Las Vegas!!

PuQjyIRtvEdesL2Ndo-HEg.text: This is one of my favorite spots in Vegas. Small space and sometimes a wait, but it's well worth it. We usually order 3 or 4 small plates and share. Don't be intimidated by the unusual creative dishes on the menu, be bold and try it all. It's ALL GOOD!

dzklT9_OyJY76_khBox65Q.text: The food here is great. I've been here numerous times and the wait staff is also excellent.   Must haves: fried green beans with pepper jelly    Bacon jam   Ox tail risotto

Sd2O0UekR9LanCBbIoa0Ww.text: This restaurant is another spot that is located in the motel on Carson St. If your not looking for it you would probably miss it. It has two levels and a courtyard where you can wait for your table. There is a bar on both levels. You can dine outside when you are seated on the second level. This place gets busy. We waited 40 minutes for a table on a Tuesday night.  The food was excellent. We had the Coca Espresso NY Strip. It was cooked perfectly to medium rare and the Demi glaze was outstanding. We also tried the Gyro Tacos, which were good.  I will definitely be back to try more menu items. I recommend that you give this place a go.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coca Espresso NY Strip.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roof top seating.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roof top bar.

sD9auixVm48EyMw0pFhVFg.text: I expected Carson Kitchen to be a little busy based on the buzz, but not a 30 minute wait on a Sunday night.  At least my wife and I were able to get drinks and hang around their outdoor area in the back.  The whole thing was quite an eye opener for me.  Who would have thought even 5 years ago that something like this would be thriving on 6th St and Carson???  Amazing!  The dining area was a little cramped but still maintained a cool vibe.  The open kitchen, bustling servers and unique seating area kind of enhanced the experience.  I wouldn't come with more than a party of 4 until their outdoor and upstairs areas are done.  Our server informed us those areas would be complete in about a week.  I'd classify the fare as "New American".  Kerry and his staff do some really interesting twists.  Their "Wellington Empanada" was a delicious way to start the meal.  I enjoyed their take on the typical empanada crust.  It was light with some crunch and soaked up the excellent sauce on the plate nicely.    My wife gasped when she saw they offered "Crispy Chicken Skins" and ordered it almost before our server got out the word "hello".  Breaded and deep fried chicken skin isn't exactly clean eating but holy shit was it awesome.  Maybe chicken skin really is the new bacon!  It was a glorious way to swiftly kick my diet right in the balls.  Both of us weren't really big on the smoked honey dipping sauce it came with and opted to use the rich empanada sauce instead.  We shared the "Rabbit Ragu" and the "Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip Steak" done rare.  The rabbit was delightful and the sauce delivered a surprisingly spicy kick.  Thankfully, the spaghetti was made of squash.  I needed some vegetables after my mini guilt trip on the chicken skins :P The steak was a little more medium rare than rare but the sauce and light espresso flavor made up for it.  Can't wait to drink and dine outside next time!
