m8Zx2bvjGVADhKdavrM56g.text: The staff and environment are very welcoming. Lots of options on the menu to choose from. The turkey burger was amazing. Highly recommend you visit Carson Kitchen.

WGPNhOVj8zEolTMdnG1bkA.text: I love their cocktails! I came out for Halloween night and the drinks were on point. The venue is very nice. They run average cocktail price here in Las Vegas. The food was also delicious. I highly recommend if you just want to have a small bite with friends or your significant other.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the damn Daniel
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and antebellum grits with egg delicious!

ZsealTLmAFCFVraTMffdFA.text: Great tasty craft food! Very interesting variety. We had a reservation but still had to wait 45 mins to be seated. This was frustrating but the manager made good by comping is an array of appetizers. The staff was friendly and our waiter Roman was very attentive. Check it out!

nof8JM7_CZo7NrXigcE5Ig.text: The food is fantastic! It's a great place to eat and drink. The service was excellent and the location is convenient with a parking lot right across  the street .  If you're a Vegas local and haven't gone you are missing out. Go !

zAHH64xPMIvKUGFKkLT0gA.text: Carson Kitchen has always been one of my favorite lunch spots. They recently changed the menu and got rid of my favorite items "Burnt Ends". They now have a MMM Rib sandwich but without the best dill sauce ever it doesn't even compare. The other downside of Carson is that all the seating is either high tops or backless chairs so it's a hard place to take anybody with any physical limitations. I really hope they bring back the Burnt Ends or at least the dill/ranch dressing that came with it.

NKWzsXP20ruOGJU2-DePHQ.text: Yum! Yum! Yummy!  is the best way to describe CK.  Just like everyone else I have been drooling to try this place for weeks.  A friend and I went out for his Birthday celebration something neither of us are able to do with having a family.    We were greeted and seated immediately seeing that it was senior citizen dinner time.  We sat at the bar and browsed there beer selection which was fantastic in my opinion. I like the craft beer choices and the prices were not too out of line.  The decor and style of the place is top notch.  Very well done and has a certain rustic elegance and modern feel to it. Very nicely done.    We went with the chicken skins for an appetizer with honey to dip and I was not disappointed at all by the choice.  They tasted like a BBQ potato chip.  The skin were seasoned so well wanted to lick my fingers but I had to refrain and wipe them on my nice cloth napkin.     For my main course I went with the Buffalo Chicken Flatbread.  I really like the blue cheese and buffalo sauce flavor combo of hot and creamy with almost a chopped chicken with slice carrots and celery.  I am not a fan of celery but this tasted like a buffalo chicken wing and had tons of flavor.    My friend decided on the Turkey burger which he said was packed full of flavor also.  He said it had hints of apple and also seasoned well and was really juicy which is something you do not always find in a turkey burger. They tend to be dry and overcooked.  This he said was perfect with his side of tater tots.  The food came out quickly to the table.  The beer selection was very good.  Carson Kitchen has thought what would go best with there menu choices.  Almost like the have done the beverage and food pairing for you.  I enjoy the craft beer offering's of IPA's and Porters and such.  I am also surprised that PBR is making a comeback in certain hipster circles.    This place is awesome. The food is amazing and a must try for Downtown.  If you want to impress someone on a date take them here and you will definitely enjoy your time together.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VaY_SGS6ljMgg7rWemg2Xg.text: Carson Kitchen....  Here are the bullet points....  -New Downtown bar and restaurant -Open Kitchen  -Small, cramped, and loud.  NOTE:  there's an upstairs patio soon to be open -Great service with a big staff -Reservations if your party is 6 or more -Located next door to O Face Doughnuts -Apps:  Portions are small and pricey -The Food:  Portions are small and priced about right.   The gf and I came here on Friday night just about a week after they opened.  I thought that the service was great.  Our server gave us his recommendations, was very attentive, and he even gave us a quick tour.  As for the food, I enjoyed half of what I had.  I ordered their Wellington Empanada as an app and their Cocoa-Espresso NY Strip Steak as an entree.  The empanada was a little too greasy and pricey at $10 for two small pieces.  The steak cost $18 and I thought it was worth it. It was delicious, sliced, and full of flavor. My gf had their Bacon Jam as an app and their Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto.  I got a little taste and thought both were pretty good.  Again, wasn't a fan of the price of their Bacon Jam, but thought that the entree was just about right.    Overall, don't let my 3 star review fool you.  3 stars from me means that they are just "A-Ok".  In other words, I don't see myself rushing back any time soon.  I do recommend other Yelpers to give them a try. TIP:  Tip regarding their Check-In...double check your receipt. We were charged for our "Free" item.  They fixed the issue...just saying.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocoa-Expresso NY Strip Steak ($18 - small portion, juicy, and packed with flavor)
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mel C was here!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wellington Empanada (beef tenderloin, $10 for 2 pcs)

NrgUq6jJS2FU1N4Df-I8uA.text: Great place off the crazy beaten path in Vegas.  I took a prospective customer here to build our relationship - much better than the stuffy and overpriced food you get on the strip.  Very casual ambiance with family style seating.  The music is loud enough to be fun, but not so loud that you can't have a discussion.  The waiters understand their menue, and know about pairing with wine/beer to make the taste all the better.  I personally love the sharing menu/tapas style of dining this place offers, less stuffy and enables you to have a good connection with your party.    The food is awesome: the deviled eggs are a MUST have!!!  The Seabass is great, so is the steak.  They don't take reservations for under 6-people: we showed up at 6pm and did not have a wait.

1BK4kY5xTSnX6YZwi__oNw.text: Honestly, this place doesn't even deserve a 1  star rating. I Just had the worst first impression for a restaurant at Carson's Kitchen. At  arrival we weren't greeted with a warm welcome. We were seated at a high top that seats about 6-10 people and requested to sit in a lower table. The place was very empty and the host sat us at a vertical two top. When me and my boyfriend requested to sit next to each other at a four top, she mentioned to us she wouldn't be able to seat us there because if there was a large party they would need the table. Take in mind this place was empty. When we sat at the two top, my boyfriend moved along the side and the server rudely told my my boyfriend he couldn't sit next to me! At that point we were so shocked and upset that we just ended up leaving.  First impressions are everything in any business, and this place has the worst hospitality. If their service was that bad, I can only imagine how they handle their food they serve.

zNxiFTPnmKjgS2hbwVY5-Q.text: Good food in the hip area of downtown, I like the setting and open kitchen.For sure try the flatbread. Service was great. I am  going back.

zRM4C95euDyQ46-YQ7gVJA.text: Very pleasant surprise. Dishes meant to be shared -  all good for our party. Cocktails well made. Proximity to the Fremont Experience made for a nice evening

Y1cXjJyK9-Z1gPkhJxjj-Q.text: Yum dot com, people! I really appreciate places that put unique spins on things or do classics really, really well. We had mac and cheese, strip steak, cauliflower, Greek tacos -- all were tasty!   Our waitress was VERY attentive in the way that she always kept our waters and wine glasses full (not over the top, though). I will say, they have maximized the crap out of that space. I didn't go upstairs, but in the downstairs dining area, you may be sitting next to strangers. It's cozy, not weird, I promise!   I honestly don't know what more to say other than, the service was great, the place was clean and the most important part (food, duh) was delicious with items that you may not be able to find as easily in other places. Just look at the photos and see for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pictured here: Cauliflower, Potatoes, Mac and Cheese, Some sort of bacon/brie amazing spread-thing. All wonderful!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip Steak - you have to. The next to me ordered one because he thought mine looked delicious! So tender and a good slice of meat.

uakMP_rMtBxYOyjGtOOXXg.text: If you want to get away from the strip this is def the place to go. A group of us visited this place before we went out to Fremont street. Shared several different plates and ALL of them were delicious. It is kind of a quaint atmosphere in comparison to the strip. Was a welcomed change of pace!

mF2aiMGAOJcYQjxG8HTUMA.text: Sorry, I won't be recommending this restaurant anytime soon to anyone I know. We came here with dinner reservations in place for a birthday. Before we arrived we were told we would need to be on time because they had another party coming in. Meal ordering was rushed & pushy.  Not everyone enjoys the same kind of food, so while I understand the atmosphere is tapas with a sharing vibe we don't need 3 plates of one type of dish. Also, when we ask for no bacon and dishes arrive with bacon, please fix it in a timely manner. Rush, rush, rush. It was a birthday dinner & we weren't even asked about dessert before the check arrived. The food was okay, nothing stood out.

Twb0WffpumQA5J6n82llLg.text: The Mac and cheese is to die for!! Perfect place for a lunch meeting and in an amazing location for that downtown foodie vibe.

66zE7B9b6ONOY39X44HGjg.text: Came here for lunch while in town for work. Kind of located in a nondescript area but the interior of this place is really cool. Ordered the Sunday chicken sandwich and it was excellent. It took a while to come out but it was well worth the wait. It had a huge chicken breast that was seasoned really well and the sauce that accompanied it just made the sandwich work. The fries that came with it were on point as well. Service was friendly and apologetic about the food taking so long to come out. It's not a huge place, so I'm guessing there can be a wait sometimes but it's definitely worth it. Would absolutely return here.

9PUdKAqgpzlfzLb3LuoIsg.text: Geronimo very attentive and really taking good care of us. Music is great found easy parking right outside. Suuuuch a great selection of items we got the MANDATORY lamb tacos, Mac & cheese, I never order BEETS but theirs is the ISHT!!!!! The guy with sideburns is an amazing person also! So friendly.   I'm thankful for the YELPERS that came before who posted piks.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm ate this Mac &amp; cheese all to myself ha. Well half of it. It&#39;s very cheesy very filling.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beets up top w cheese- verrrry light.... Ladies love the green beans with the slight spicy sauce
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MANDATORY lamb tacos. Wowwwww

_RmQaY6SfEpk46lxPiPk0A.text: The place is very hip!  3.5 stars all around.   The check came in a book and the server encourages the customers to write comments in the book.  The staff was really nice and I would give five stars for their accommodations because they asked which items we wanted first when it came to our orders.  We shared our orders and sat at the bar.  We got a sweet view of all the cooks in the kitchen (we got to see the magic happen).  The servers are funny and interact very well with the customers.   The food and drink... The cucumber soda was really good and can be found at Wal-Mart.  The bacon jam is really really good but I would have appreciated more Brie.  The shrimp dunderi had well cooked shrimp with micro greens atop, it also had some other things I couldn't identify.  The butter burger was plain Jane but those tots, damn!  Those were good tater-tots, I smeared my bacon jam all over them and my burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Dunderi
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tater tots were great!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ox tail Risotto

_BGtkCHuuG9bFw5rrRb1Uw.text: This place came highly recommended by a friend of mine who was a Las Vegas hotel concierge. I was looking for a hip spot with an eclectic menu that included options for two friends with a dietary restriction (they are vegetarians). When I looked at the menu at Carson Kitchen, I thought this was the perfect spot with lots of meat centric options and a large variety of veggie options as well. They were able to accomodate our party of six and seated us inside (I called two weeks in advance). I never got to see their outdoors area but I would imagine the ambiance is more fun than inside.   The only reason why I am giving Carson Kitchen three stars is because some of the dishes didn't live up to our expectations. The wild mushroom flatbread was oversaturated with some kind of barbecue sauce which is not listed at all on the menu so it was a little shock to the palate. The black rice and oxtail risotto was not good at all. That was sadly a disappointing dish. The crispy chicken skins were just o.k. After hearing so much about them, it was displeasing to find them so bland.  Now that I got that out of the way, I have to mention that the service was amazing. Everyone from the host to the server were great. Our drinks were on par and we had some really delicious dishes; bbq burnt ends, "devil's" eggs, tempura green beans, pig in a duvet, baked mac and cheese, and rainbow cauliflower. The absolute star of the show was the rainbow cauliflower.  Carson Kitchen, you win at service, drinks, and cauliflower.

PniMn4LVseDPTgatKGClgQ.text: Downtown must. Staple. Fancied American standards. Helpful staff. Quality ingredients. Best dish...bacon jam. Worst dish...bacon jam. You'll see. Just skip it for the Gyro Tacos and Rainbow Cauliflower with a side salad of cucumber and olive oil.

-6ElVdB3DTIJ8pZZYKiMKA.text: Went there at 8:15 pm on a Sunday night. door was locked, an employee opened the door and said "we're closed". Then shut the door. No "I'm sorry", "I apologize". Just "we're closed" and instantly locks the door. Website said they closed at 10 PM. I guess their website was wrong.  Also beware the place is located on a dark street. While walking there from Fremont a woman stopped us and warned us of some mean vagrants that were near the kitchen.

QmfmMhCzIKnS4xDyk_VhCg.text: We were sat at the counter that surrounds the kitchen, which is very open. My wife ordered the hamburger and I ordered the burnt ends. Both were delicious!!! The tater tots that came with the hamburger were the best I've ever had. They sprinkled some kind of seasoning onto them that gave the tots just the right zing. Not spicy, but just a little kick if that makes sense. The address says it's on 6th but the entrance to the restaurant is on the intersecting street. Very convenient to anyone on Fremont Street. Would definitely return next time we're in Vegas. Dakota was our waiter and was very attentive to our needs.

jHSow4hFYomljNOAsrh8Nw.text: My rule when traveling....don't eat anywhere I can eat in my home city.  Found this gem on YELP while in Vegas and it was an awesome choice.  High quality food perfectly prepared. Bacon Jam, Mac & Cheese and the Jerk Turkey Burger.  Please come to Raleigh we  y'all!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Jam and mac &amp; cheese in the distance.
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Burger...!!!!

NNAY6cn1Nr-1CFneBGxV5A.text: This was hands down the best meal I had in Vegas. I would come back to Vegas just to eat here again.   We are the succotash, jerk turkey burger, and Mac and Cheese. Everything was incredible.

jFeq3qUG0ISfvaqRZ9HShA.text: The great things I've been hearing...THEY'RE TRUE!   I love that this place is tucked away. It's like a local secret. I went here for a late lunch and was seated immediately. Being only a party of two I'd feel bad taking a large table top so I went for a seat at the bat. Tentative bar service and quick amazing food. We got three appetizers because I really wanted to try a few things off the menu since other local friends were strongly encouraging me to try Carson Kitchen.   Let me start off by saying all the food looks just like the website photos. I love to eat with my eyes so I about fell out of my chair when I saw this delicious food coming toward me. First came the Bacon Jam. The guy that dropped it off suggested we get a piece of the Bree with every bite. It smelt a lot like BBQ sauce but as soon as touched my tongue, I was in love. Not to sweet at all, amazing flavor, and bacon. Nuff said.   Next came the Welington Empanadas. Flakey pastry, amazing flavor, sauce was a little bland but I saw it as more decorative because all the flavor was inside the empanada. Only two per order and only a couple bites. Not a heavy appetizer. I would recommend!   Finally, oh man, the Gyro Tacos. I seriously had to stop a staff that had nothing to do with our service and tell him how good they were. The tzatziki sauce didn't have too much dill in it like more authentic tzatziki WHICH IM TOTALLY OKAY WITH! Preferred in fact. Meat and cheese lay in little pitas that are easy to eat in a couple bites. I would recommend these for sure. Don't let the lamb scare you! Lamb is usually too tough for me unless shaved like in a typical gyro sandwich. The flavor is out of this word. I could seriously go on for days about those "tacos."   Everyone was super friendly, it's so clean, hip and new. Take the time to hit up this spot in Downtown LV!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is too cute. They&#39;ve put as much seating as possible in here. Good thinking!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro tacos. A must try!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Wellington Empanada. Where the term &#34;flakey&#34; is used with the upmost drooling respect.

BlosM93cLVk-P1V42DhEbg.text: Very good food, I was recommended by a friend and I am happy I gave this place a chance. Is a little hidden, but it's worth going not too expensive. I'm sure I'll be back.

qWpgIeEFmehrOTFbP2ujtQ.text: As a visitor to the great city of Las Vegas and staying in a hotel, its easy to stay in the casinos as they are mini cities.. but DON'T! Carson Kitchen was worth the trek. Cool vibes, mouth watering menu, great service. I was extremely impressed with my meal. I was there for lunch and there was plenty of seating and quick service. If I return to Vegas, you know where to find me.  Food: 5/5 Service: 4/5 Venue: 5/5

4qkv92Ijbcc95V4iPXB4aQ.text: Just an awesome atmosphere with healthy, delicious and creative menu options.  Off the beaten path for sure but well worth a few miles drive from the strip.

G9vmuyTyZV_a6Fs4OdTxNw.text: Ok so this place is amazing.  The pricing is comparable to the bar food in new Vegas but in contrast the food is exquisite.  We had the Bacon Jam everyone seemed k race in here and it for not disappoint.  The temperature was perfect and you could yell based on the serving dishes that this was well planned.  We also had the Rainbow Cauliflower which was delicious.  Many of the posters have said they didn't even like Cauliflower and found this to be awesome. We finished our meal with the NY strip steak which rivaled my top 5 steak experiences.  If you go with a bigger group you could probably try much more on the menu with their shareable menu.  The place is a block or two off the main run of Fremont street which made me wonder where the heck we were headed but we landed in food freaking heaven! Check it out l.

Ksq6M7I5SrF3WxqTJKIwPg.text: Solid food. Pretty good selection and friendly staff. I'd come by again sometime. Came here with a few friends. Everyone seemed to have a good time. Process are pretty good too

ULV0wFQgpkdoMA3Z6-vuAg.text: Located between Carson and 6th,google map had me confused. Love this place great addition to the downtown restaurants..service was great and the food was delicious as well..we had the crispy chicken skin .tempura green beans and the fried green tomatoes sliders.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

azJ1y4aCa0LQ7X9NU_zd3A.text: The burger was hands down the best burger I have ever had. The service was outstanding, the appetizers were delicious. We topped it off with the bread pudding which was also excellent. This place is a definite don't miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking into the restaurant from our table.

sJhrMUeT2zdBxrP-GB8Pig.text: 5 star service. Bianca is Awesome and that says a lot coming from me! Eclectic food well prepared and presented. Some highlights include Glazed Donut Bread Pudding, Bacon Jam and Tempura Beans. Their flat breads are nice too. You will not regret coming here! Why 4 stars overall? Because they could do better in adding some more variety to their libations. Parking can be a little tough on weekends or other "more people" occasions.

dH8q9gBAx6ZXq04hduQdYA.text: Baconjam was the bomb!!! I loved the atmosphere and service. Very simple menu and they put a lot of effort making sure the food will remind you to come back!!

cBOPZA-6xqTC9VdKAg_P5w.text: Maybe the most enjoyable meal I've ever had in Vegas. They hit exactly the right note on the atmosphere and the food and the drinks and the staff and the price for me. Authentic hipster vibe. As in, let's do something interesting and do it well, without coming off as snobs. LOVED IT!!

dE82xW7pM7MsgtglWcDPFw.text: Excellent sharable dishes with an up beat atmosphere near Freemont Street.  Great outdoor patio while you wait and plenty of parking near by.  Our server, Dakota, was exceptional and very welcoming!!  We took friends from out of town and had a great time despite the long wait on a Monday night. Would be nice if they would take reservations.  All very tasty: Risotto Shrimp Gyro Tacos Green beans

vLhuALITuN4WVnXYrguITQ.text: Fabulously unique food  along with a fabulous atmosphere and you have one great restaurant.  Outdoor patio out back.  Outdoor eating on the upstairs patio.  Any time somebody visits I take them to Carson's Kitchen and they all love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not the first time here and as always fantastic!!!

3fzyhGOzIyxRpy42q3cdAw.text: Great food, decent staff. If you're looking for a "metropolitan" restaurant off the Strip, this is literally the only one. Great for locals and tourists, alike!

PP0JhF_vA4-25C0NYB65Vw.text: Love this place! Only thing is it's so small but I know they are opening a second floor.  Service was great! Our waiter helped us decide on a yummy shot and was so nice and helpful. The bacon jam was really good as was the Wisconsin burger! Definitely a restaurant worth driving downtown to.  We went on a Friday night about 7, wasn't too long of a wait, we enjoyed a drink on their outside patio which I'm sure after fixed up and decorated more will be super cute!  I always have room for dessert but my first visit was too stuffed.  Going back to try the bread pudding!

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers to a new yummy place downtown!
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon jam
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam croquettes

SF9DFZniYuzh_rUbQtigVQ.text: The portions are small and they are meant to be shared, but they do tell you that to start off with! Also, their menu is a little limiting so be forwarned!

vUoCr73gMxH0JcT6XP_vaw.text: This experience almost made me want to find a condo nearby and move to downtown Las Vegas...almost. we started with the bacon jam...who ever thought of this medley of flavours and textures, allow me to bask in the honour of your presence. The burgers? While slightly overcooked for med rare, the brief hiccup was easily forgiven. Plump, full of flavor. And then the donut shoppe next door? Downtown Vegas, I'm a believer!

3g5kgOezN9eLr406BzcSrg.text: Took a group of 15 and the waitress just served us what she thought we might want. Awesome experience. Bacon Jam has changed my life.

88pgspUMorx03PJV1F1PwQ.text: I had heard from a few people that it can get super busy at peek hours so my husband and I went between the rush. The cocktails were great and the food was incredible! We had the Fried Chicken Skin, Bacon Jam and Bison Sliders. Each thing we ordered was more delicious than the last! I only wish we hadn't gotten full so fast.

Haq7FZjEjn3Ew1oG7EqOJA.text: Fun small place downtown. I had the veal meat balls which were great. Also had the spicy tater tots which were extraordinary. We went on a Sunday afternoon and still had to wait for a table for 6 so id expect to wait when going during peak hours. They had some gyro tacos which I need to try next time. The menu isn't huge but I'm sure you can find something that would satisfy. I expect the best time to really enjoy this place is during a night out.

WD__djc2LtSL3yqpVQR1ew.text: Decided to go "off roading" and get off The Strip on my recent visit to Vegas.  My adventure took me to Carson Kitchen...  Good atmosphere, open kitchen and a variety of options to satisfy my hunger.  I went for the Jerk Turkey Burger, as recommended by my server.  The burger was full of flavor, moist, and the toasted bun added just the right amount of crunch. I had the privelege of sitting at the bar to witness some of the goodness being prepared.  If I wasn't full from the burger, I would have ordered the beet salad.  Next Time.

-Xsp64rWI0OfPzSjjiOQuw.text: AMAZING. Given a suggestion from a bartender at a nearby hotel and I can tell you this place is pure gold. Not a bad item on the menu and Felicia was a fantastic server. This is a must eat at when visiting Las Vegas.

FSRhGz-T_WR_rbS1zDEDcg.text: What a fun place for dinner in Las Vegas! Priced well with great service and a staff that truly believes in the food and atmosphere.  With an ever changing menu, it's tough to make recommendations.  With that said, the beet salad was as good as I have had and the bacon relish/jelly is one of a kind. Oh and a great soundtrack full of energy!  Atmosphere is awesome.

kXwcCJ2LQI-WqHW9RjAkSg.text: Chill little spot with a nice, moder-hipster build out. Simple menu with an exotic twist to some top notch culinary favorites. Great service with beautiful ladies taking care of each and every guest on a more personable level then most places.

fd3J7HR62X7XY_WmIECRxw.text: I love it here. Food is so amazing. Service was on point...this place is so delicious It's ridiculous :)

xS8hmCOxaG6xfU-uC_JCgQ.text: Got here at 4:30 PM and half of the tables were open. We were refused service. Rude waitress. Terrible experience.

mTCXzlQ0eC-KQTnQGNO_rA.text: A group of 10 of us had an incredible meal at Carson Kitchen. We couldn't choose our favorite dish because everything was great. I'd also highly recommend the Get Shorty cocktail.  Service was helpful and fast. Best meal I've had in Vegas.

AboEY6VHzvTaDyCy-CFx8Q.text: Words cannot describe the pure joy your taste buds will experience during your time at Carson's. Their bacon jam makes you wish it was legal to marry food. It would make the divorce rate plummet. I promise.

XYneLbBjo1uL6CH0hSAkhQ.text: FREAKING AMAZING ! I am biased brother-in-law works here, however this is a fabulous place to grab not so commonly seen foods. Chef Matt and the rest of creative minds did a wonderful job, fabricating this tantalizing menu of compliment off of one another.

28kZFUVxNvZ-x2g65bRlAw.text: Carson kitchen is amazing with unique seasonal menus all the food was amazing my favorite was the pork belly carbonara, however the bison meatloaf slider, fried chicken skins and baked bacon jam with brie were also quite amazing and dont forget the bread pudding made from doughnuts quite decadent. I highly recommend and for vegas it was very reasonably priced as well.

CemShv8X08yBNHWhm-9goQ.text: Great new addition to the DTLV dining scene! Had dinner with a party of 8 at CK so we got to try a lot of the menu. Overall, the food was really good. Some highlights were the tempura green beans, the mac & cheese, the deviled eggs, the bacon jam, and the broccoli. The mushroom flatbread and the beet salad were fine and the spam croquettes were very salty (but cleverly presented). The gyro tacos were tasty and filling. Service was solid - at times inattentive but it was pretty busy. Only real drawback was how loud it was. Music turned up too high. in sum, definitely recommend it.

HkixkNMnLLlqR6zYlFt7_Q.text: So I went here the other with a group of friends. Between all of us, we got the Sunday fried chicken sandwich, black rice and oxtail risotto, Mac and cheese, beet salad, and beef sliders. The black rice and oxtail risotto is different from most other risotto I've had. I was not a big fan of the black rice because it reminded me of uncooked rice. And flavor was good though and the oxtail was tended. The chimichurri green stuff on the oxtail was a nice contrast to the creamy risotto sauce because it added a zesty kick. The beet salad was refreshing. The Mac and cheese had a strong truffle component which I liked. The beef slider were okay for me. A little too much on the sweet side. The Sunday fried chicken sandwich was good. The chicken was juice and the batter was the right amount of crispy. We also got the bourbon brownie for dessert. The brownie was not soft. It was too hard for me and too sweet. The ice cream had bacon bits so you either love or hate it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carson Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i4IUFabS3S7ZdxMW7lKbXQ.text: So much happening Downtown, and a great addition is Carson Kitchen. Cool vibe with great service and wonderful food! Chefs Kerry Simon and Cory Harwell have created an amazing menu... you'll want to try everything!! A neighborhood gem.

PqE8rwgqaet8FlXr1Daovg.text: Solid dining experience.  Food is very creative

LU6DSnH9zPrhFR0BXYXd9g.text: This place has such a wonderful atmosphere and delicious food! The drinks were so good that you can't help but order more than one. The upstairs dining was such a great idea!
